reviewText: I have had other Grand Theft Auto games though the years but this one is just as much fun as the other ones. I am 63 years old and some of the quest are a little hard for me but give it time and I can figure it out. Fun game but I think it is for older kids or adults.

GTA5 is definitely not for kids -- lots of language, violence, drugs, alcohol, etc. If you are OK with that, you will experience a whole new world as your customized character and encounter endless scenarios that are rather realistic. Even more fun is online gaming mode, where you can hang out with your buddies while enjoying some quality gaming. We first purchased this game on PC, but the PS4 version really takes the cake.
So recently bought this game because I thought it would be different than the rest or at least more exciting. Guess I was wrong. Its an ok game.

Good deal for the full game and money to start in the GTA online world but what stopped me from giving this 5 stars was the fact that you still have to buy an online membership to play online. (EX: you have to buy PS plus or Xbox live gold to play online)
This has been a popular game for years, but it really is adult oriented. Not really appropriate for preteens or younger. But its still a fun game.
Ive loved every generation of GTA. This one doesnt disappoint. Sprawling open world. Lots of interesting quests and side challenges. Definitely a great game.

my 22 year old son asked for this for Christmas. he has played it a few times and says that he likes it. He has all of them. Of course it rated M for Mature and I understand why - but age considered and maturity level, combined with an understanding that this is a game, does not make me concerned with him having it (yes even at 22 I take notice LOL)

GTA V is one of the best games out there, 6 years on and it still is nothing like it. The game is best played on the newer consoles or PC, but even playing on the PS3 or Xbox 360 is a fun-filled time, despite the lack of newer modes on the systems. The inclusion of heists, races and casino all add to sone fantastic fun and the Enterprise starter is a great way for those not familiar for the online component. A must own!!

I really love this game with all the fun missions. My sister has it and then I decided to finally buy me a ps4 and this game was my first purchase. I've always liked these games when I used to play with my cousins years ago.
I have completed this games twice its one of the best in my collection I also played against friends
My kids love this game and they have lots of fun. The only bad thing that it says bad words.

Playing this game, it is easy to get lost in the huge world. The side missions add to the story. Online? Astonishing. Rockstar has been providing steady updates including the new Casino. If you want to lose years of your life playing a game, this it.
Love GTA. It was on sale when I bought it. I already owned it but had to buy for my other ps4.

What can I say about this game that hasnt already been said. PERFECTION is the word comes to mind, while describing this game. Great story,missions,and the online feature is what really shines about this game. Yes its a very violent game, with strong language, and it wouldnt be a GTA game if it wasnt. Highly recommend this game, its perfection personified!

PS4's version of GTA V, especially in this all encompassing, online play emphasizing version, and to this day, in my opinion, no game has come close to the fun that never gets old, playing GTA V. If you only have time in your life to indulge in one game, then this version of GTA V, specifically on the masterful PS4 (versus X-Box) is an absolute winner, especially for the price.
Disappointed that if you to do other maps you have to go online. Only played it for like an hour on the regular PS4
Tons of fun and creative adventures to be had with this game.
This games is a lot of fun with how much there is to do, but there is a lot of repetition.
Fun and easy game to play! Lots of different storylines going on - not good for kids
A very fun game from start to finish and the online part is amazing.
I loved it on the PS3 and I love it on the PS4. I love the characters and story, and it is alot of fun. It is amazing how much better it looks on the PS4.
Great open world gameplay and is overall fun to play

The expansion is worth it to start your illegal businesses but youll want to purchase a better location once you accumulate enough money. The locations that come with this are far from the city which requires you to drive long distances. Its worth it to start up (and you get money).
Gta V is a fun game to play online and the story mode has good graphics.
Hours and hours of GTA fun. Best GTA game to date. Online has new stuff to do all the time.
The game still holds up. Its been out for a very long time and you can still jump online and still enjoy yourself.
If you are a fan of the GTA franchise, you will enjoy this title.

Even though this game is 4/5 years old, it is still going strong as a top selling game. Now I see why! It is a lot of fun, graphics are great, and the Black Friday price was amazing. Definitely not for young kids with all the language and violence.
This is a great game! The gameplay is awesome. The fun never ends!

Great game but honestly not even sure that the premium online edition access code (that you pay extra for) is even valid. When redeemed it did not change up a thing or give any type of add-on. In my opinion get the normal version and save yourself a few bucks.
Open city, lots to interact with & interesting story line. Definitely not for children, but overall worth the coin. Cant wait for the next gta title to come out.
This is one of the best games u can get. So much fun. Especially if u play online. So much different things to do.

I actually missed out on this game when it launched for ps3 and Xbox 360. Then it re-leased and I was thought maybe it was an old game, but my friends have been talking about it more and more. Turns out it is better than ever and still an amazing game.
Fun game. Keeps improving each year. I play this game everyday.
Not is a good game. It is violence and not constructive game.
My grandson loves these games. Each one is more exciting and so realistic!!

Too much glorifying crime and violence as if the bad guy is the hero. Game should be band but these days people dont care about family morals and values which come from the Bible and thats why we have so much crazy young people these days, not because of the game but brcause of no family moral teachings/parenting at home.

Better than previous gta game, except now you can switch characters on the fly. I prefer one character than control multiple people. Graphics even better than before. Voice acting and cut scenes top notch. Highly recommended! FYI if you have both ps4 and Xbox one, I suggest ps4, because Xbox one version vegetation, such as bush and flowers are dial back.
The quality was poor compared to what i was used to and expecting.

Bought this for my 12yo per her request. She plays online w/ her older brother and niece. I've played but don't get the appeal, the kids seem to get it tho. She thoroughly enjoys it. I don't like that it has some violence .

This game is fun on so many levels. The single player campaign is really good and don't forget about the multiplayer. The extra goodies it comes with for online is pretty cool as well, there is something for everyone when it comes to game modes. The support it gets from Rockstar as well just keeps on coming with new DLC missions and cosmetics. Thank You
Great graphics and really fun to play.I enjoy it a much as my kids enjoy it.
Luckily I bought this for my 19 year old granddaughter - I would have been in trouble if it had been for the young kids! I didnt realize it was kinda violent and not appropriate for younger kids.
THIS SHOULD BE ONE OF THE CLASSIC GAMES, FROM PS4, YOU WILL DEFINITELY HAVE TONS OF FUN PLAYING
I love all the GTA versions and I wanted to try gta 5 for a long time. I have completed 25 percent so far and graphics and the storyline is amazing. Love new cars this time
Son changed gaming systems, seems to like the way this plays on this system. If he's happy I'm happy....
Very fun game!!! Would recommend it to anyone that hasnt tried it
This game is awesome and it continues to give with new online content its a great game you will get hooked on time and time again

I have played this game back when it was first released for the PS3. When I saw this edition, packaged with the Criminal Enterprise Starter Pack, I had to try it again. I cant believe the difference between the two versions. The graphics/details are so much better and refined. The added features like the first person mode is a refreshing new look.
It is so much fun! it get's better and better with each update
This game is awesome I cant beleive the thing I can do if you have a chance to rob someone make it a great escape.
Great game has lots of different features through out the game love playing with family
I love this game. It is a favorite. Glad I got it.
Grand theft Auto does it again. True classic for the series and I am still unlocking online modes. I cant wait for GTA VI! I dont care who your are everyone knows and loves GTA
I did not like the game at all I traded it In Like three days after I bought it
Awesome, love this game and system, I recomend to my friends
This is a great game that is fun to play and quickly is becoming one of my favorites

This collection contains remastered versions of Yakuza 3, Yakuza 4, and Yakuza 5 that originally released on the PlayStation 3. Unlike the Kiwami games, these are not remakes. These are virtually the exact same games as what originally released except Yakuza 3 has restored content that had been cut for the original release and cleaned up scripts. This is also the first time Yakuza 5 has been available in a physical format in the west (it even includes a PS3 case of Yakuza 5 to help fill shelf gaps for folks that care about that sort of thing). While the games are a little dated compared to some of the modern releases, there is incredible value to this package as the writing holds up very well and there is a ton of content. Highly recommended!
I Just picked this game up today. Now my Yakuza collection is complete

Yakuza is one of the few series that age like wine. The story and combat do not feel archaic like many other remastered games. Although combat in 3 and 4 can feel stiff, they feel just right. The stories though are timeless, although I would write off Yakuza 4 as a first attempt at what they pulled off in Yakuza 5. Yakuza 3 is one of my favorites games of all time so getting to relive this in 1080p and smooth 60fps on my ps4 is awesome. I beat all 3 on my ps3, but the new coat of polish makes 3 and 4 feel like new games entirely although none look as good as Kiwami 2or Yakuza 6. Yakuza 5 feels like Yakuza 0 on the ps4.

This is the game series you want all of. You can visibly see where the ambition of the developers allow them to reach new heights and offer more diverse gameplay options to players. Yakuza 5 is the crown jewel with 5 interwoven narratives each with their own mechanics. This game is invented the multiple protagonist mechanic that GTA V touts but with greater effect.
Great collection of some awesome games that I played when they first came out on the PS3. I was impressed by the graphic upgrades.

Add Yakuza 3, 4, and 5 to your collection, which means now the series, 0-6 are on PS4. Awesome crime dramas that make you feel like you're in Japan and tons of things to do in these games. This specific collection though, is great. For those curious, 3 and 4 are on one disc with Yakuza 5 on a second. It even comes with a PS3 case for Yakuza 5 since that was the one never released on disc here in the US, which I thought was an amusing addition. I love being back to fill that gap in my collection with this release.

These games are remasters of the PS3 yakuza games and they're good games if you haven't played them before. This collection comes with Yakuza 3, 4, and 5. I like that this came with a PS3 case of yakuza 5 (becasue we never got the Physical copy). Overall I think this is a great buy. Yakuza 3 has the cut content restored and all the games in the collection are now 1080p/60.
It is absolutely perfect that they decided to release all remaining titles in one package!
Great story and characters. Battles are fun and great finishers. Awesome collection if you like action jrpg

First off the game is incredible and a welcome entry in the Doom franchise, I think it's the best one yet. The Mondo Steelbook is a work of art as well and absolutely worth buying at Best Buy over other retailers. This review would and should be 5 stars but unfortunately it didn't come with the promised pre-order bonus, Doom 64. I will update my review if this changes.

Didn't come here to review a perfect game but to trash bestbuy for not including the rip and tear pack nor doom 64 been a longtime customer and understand covid19 is probably creating a bit of a mess right now but as a person who has shopped here for a longtime they need to address this

Very excellent, though the arenas get repetitive and drag on a bit longer than they ought to sometimes; it does slow the pace a bit. More importanly, though, I preordered the Collector's Edition but I don't seem to have received a code for the Rip and Tear Pack. I've checked my email multiple times, even my spam folder, but there's just nothing.

Terrible. Simply terrible game. I do not know why ppl are raving about it. I was a HUGE fan of 2016. The story was simple but immersive and fun. The environments were cool and reminiscent of ALIENS the movie and the hell levels were simply stunning. The weapons were fun. Eternal takes everything good about 2016 and overdoes it, makes it way cornier, crappy story, its designed for mindless people who just want flash and mindless, thoughtless action. Truly a disgrace to all the others.

Doom Eternal must be one of the most graphic intensive game I've played. Several times I stopped to gaze at the back drop off what I was fighting at or in. The main issue is that at times, every new section or room you go into ends up being a big environmental puzzle to either get an item or open a door to proceed. Normally this really isn't an issue, but several times felt just as I finished an area and wanted to kill more demons, had to stop to figure out how to proceed further. Ugh!!! Kinda had the Tomb Raider feel where you have to solve a puzzle after killing enemies in a space. At one point I thought I was looking for tri-force. Oh and Doom guy is really good at gymnastics, who knew?! Maybe he should do the Olympics instead?
Great game. Preorder codes for Rip n tear dlc or Doom 64 bonus not included in box will change rating once codes are received.

I was a huge fan of DOOM 2016, It was my first Doom game. This improves on Doom 2016 with more enemy variety as well as new mechanics. If you're a fan of FPS games, then you should definitely give this game a try.

Having loved Doom (2016) and ALL Doom games since the original came out when I was in high school, this one is near the top. While I love the updates to the 2016 Doom, the one thing that all critics have said is true: the platforming is at times awful and beyond angering. Super fast and fun gameplay, and if you loved 2016, you will love this, but be prepared for some VERY annoying platforming sections that did not bring down the perfect 2016 Doom.

id Software practically invented the First Person Shooter. My, how the mighty have fallen. This game is for kids. I also NEVER RECEIVED my pre-order bonuses for ordering at BestBuy.com. As for the game, it's hard as nails. Even on the easiest level, there's limited ammo that requires constant weapon switches through a clumsy combination of button mashes. And in a major strategic error, DOOM Eternal has just as much swinging, jumping and climbing (and dying) as it does shooting. What a mistake! The AI is always OP, with you constantly being swamped by enemies that have unlimited ammo and are unreasonably hard to kill even on the easiest difficulty. Another major mistake. Average gamers will quickly tire of the nonsense of constantly dying over and over, and restarting checkpoints just because the difficulty if dialed up so high. That's for the highest difficulty levels, not the lowest. This game has been in our home for 2 weeks and nobody has even wanted to finish it...Despite being on Coronavirus lockdown for the entire time. Now it goes on eBay. The DOOM 64 pre-order bonus was one reason I purchased...But we never received it. I don't understand how a company can delay a game launch by 4 months and still screw up the pre-order bonuses?!? Buy and play DOOM 2016 if you haven't already. It's a much, much better game than this kids shooter!
If you're a fan of the first doom then you will love this game. Fast paced first person shooter that is extremely fun
This is a must buy if you enjoy FPS. Best combination of shooting and strategy gameplay
Perfect timing for the release of this game, helps with some distraction to spend some time during this most difficult times
Great addition to the series. Gameplay is challenging to even the experienced gamer.
Tons of fun and looks amazing, a great sequel to Doom 2016
Brings back the old days of the original Doom but way more fast paced and action packed!

As I get older it's tougher to makes time for video games, but this is one that always takes priority. This new one is no exception. These games always stays true to the original and improves, which makes it awesome.
Takes the already lightning fast combat of the first game and supercharges it, never a dull moment in this war against hell itself!

I have yet to finish the single player portion of this game. While I will at some point, I am just not enthused about it. I recently borrowed Doom (2016) from a friend. I blew through it, it was a great run and gun experience. So one would think any improvement to this formula would also be a great game. This game is a mess!!! I would love to see the conversation around the planning table for this game. And who thought adding all of these convoluted game mechanics in was a good idea. Gone is the infinite ammo pistol so when you run out of ammo you automatically switch to your trusty chainsaw, which now is not so trusty. The chainsaw will mow down three of one type of enemy, only one of another type, and anything bigger then that they leave with your pants down and laugh at you. Haha you don't have enough fuel for this enemy. Now whether there is an upgrade to fuel capacity or not I do not know. But at the point I am in the game I find myself running out of ammo while toe to toe with a Hell Knight so to have this worthless thing pop up to do nothing. You now have a Predator style shoulder mounted grenade launcher, which is almost redundant to a shotgun upgrade. You can light enemies on fire to make them drop armor. You can glory kill enemies to charge your infinity-like gauntlet to unleash a smashing side slap that disses out 'massive' damage. Hey you like Assassin's Creed and parkour? Watcgph as we try to incorporate this into this 3D environment. Wall climb, and swing off pipes. Why? Good question. Certain enemies have weak point that you can shoot out, but in the midst of trying to set on fire, glory kill, super punch, not chainsaw, running out of ammo it gets cumbersome to shoot an antenna sized cannon of the back of the head of son of motherbrain. Bottom line, I do not enjoy this game. I hate the new play mechanics, the story is not explained at all how this connects to the previous game.

So if you didnt get the pre order bonus dont worry I talked with a customer service rep youll still get your doom 64 and skin pack! Now, the game is like playing the original Arcade cabinet with an awesome story mode and a killer Cartoonish Feel to go with all the guts and glory. It makes a perfect follow up to the doom (2016) game. If you like mindless killing and slaughtering of Demons or looking for a cool story doom eternal is a must have!
I have not received my copy of Doom 64 or the Rip N Tear Revanant DLC pack, even though I pre-ordered.
Doom is a great game, but too challenging for me. It's a challenging fast paced shooter that I hope I can eventually conplete.

Overall, I have enjoyed the game very much. However, like other people here, I have not received any of the preorder bonuses that were supposed to be included with the purchase. That is why the score is as low as it is. Hopefully I will receive the bonuses soon.
Fast fun gameplay great graphics campaign is great
Great game but I still haven't received my code for doom 64 and the other pre order bonuses for ps4

If you played DOOM 2016, youre getting more like that, but better. Graphics, animations, weapons...all awesome. If you havent played that game, youre in for a treat. Its a rip roaring, ridiculous, insane game thats just tons of fun. Get it!
I pre ordered the game but didn't receive the features.

This is the definitive edition version of Mario Kart 8, and a must buy for those who never owned the Wii U version. For those who already own the Wii U version, the changes may or not be worth it depending on what you're looking for. Without further ado here are the list of changes compared to the Wii U version: 1. 1080p with higher frame rate* when docked (TV mode) instead of 720p (on Wii U). Tabletop mode it's still 720p. Frame rate TV mode is 60fps, off TV mode is 59fps. Yes, one frame makes a difference when comparing side-by-side and/or when you have been playing dozens of hours of the original 2. 5 new characters: King Boo, Bowser Jr, Dry Bones, & Inklings (Boy and Girl) 3. Characters can now carry up to two items at once, even if they don't drag the first item 4. Double Item Box. Get two items when you run through a double item box or two singles. Note that you cannot swap items back and forth 5. 'Smart Steering' A mode that prevents you from running off course or into a puddle of water. Good for toddlers or young children getting into the game (especially on the rainbow road courses). If the Smart Steering mode is on, the player's vehicle will have an antenna sticking out its rear end. The antenna blinks when Smart Steering is active. 6. 'Auto-accelerate' for beginners. Can be used in conjunction with Smart Steering, essentially you don't have to hold down the accelerate button. Again, good for young children who just want to drive through the track without any stop-gaps. Works well when using the wheel peripheral 7. All DLC (from Wii U) included. Everything is unlocked from beginning except kart parts and Gold Mario. Kart Parts are unlocked by playing through the game and collecting coins. Gold Mario unlocked by winning all of the 200cc grand prix cup 8. Time Trials in the 200cc engine class have been added. Also added are new ghosts of Nintendo employees to race against 9. Ultra Mini-Turbo, denoted by pink/purple sparks that appear after the orange sparks which makes you boost significantly faster. Cannot be used with smart steering on 10. Online Play. -Option to change character and vehicle combinations during an online lobby without having to leave/exit out; this is done by pressing the 'Y' button during the course selection screen of an online lobby. - You can see what lap everyone is in, in spectator mode if you finish early -When you win a match you get to wear a crown in the main online menu screen for everyone in the lobby to see. Hat also present when you're in the lead during a match - More icon packs for tournament mode 11. Faster loading times. Just a few seconds, but it adds up overtime. If you purchase Mario Kart Deluxe digital over the physical you get 1-2 secs off each track loading screen 12. New amiibo compatibility. You now get racing suits when scanning in specific amiibo 13. Boo and feather (battle mode only) item return to the game 14. You get the same 48 courses racing courses. But you get 5 additional new battle stages in battle mode + 3 retro stages 15. The Villager in now split between male and female selectable characters with different stats bringing the roster to the total of 42 characters (excluding character variants. Example: different color yoshis/shy guys, create your own mii, etc) 16. Graphical change: Motion Blur, High Quality Shadows, Confetti now drop to the ground showing animation at start of match 17. Battle mode: Biggest change in terms of gameplay. There are 4 battle mode game types: -Balloon Battle. Traditional Arena Style (no more battling in a circle) Mario Kart Battle mode where you use items to pop your opponent's balloons or steal them via feather item in order to score points. -Renegade Round Up. Cops and Robbers style setup. One team with the potted piranha plants try to capture all the other team before time runs out. Once captured your teammate can also free you from your jail cell -Bob-omb Blast. Same as balloon battle, but you only carry bombs -Coin Runner. Collect as many coins in the stage as you can before time runs out -Shine Thief. A keepway style game where you have to hold the Shrine Sprite the longest before time runs out. The driver holding the shrine sprite will have their speed lower the longer they hold it ==Additional notes: - There's 4 player split screen in docked (TV mode) and handheld/table top mode. Note that the screen for table top mode is really small and may be a problem for those who are far-sighted. When playing 2 player it's 60fps, 3 or more on the same screen it'll drops down 30fps -There's no Download Play, so you have to play split screen or have another copy of the game if you don't want to share the same screen or play more than 4 players -Stamps do not make a return since the Switch doesn't have miiverse -No more gamepad/duel screen when playing TV mode, so this time around you cannot see what items everyone is holding by glancing down -No voice chat (as of this review) unfortunately. Was present in the Wii U version with mic hardware (which no one bought). There's supposed to be a smart phone app that takes advantage of voice chat, but no word yet from Nintendo -Statistics of the vehicle parts and drivers have also been changed to make game more balanced -Other balance changes: Fire Hopping have been removed: An exploit in the Wii U version where you can repeatedly hop from left to right to get extra speed from turboboost. Blue shell dodge exploit still present. It's when you fall off the cliff the last second the blue shell is about to hit you, it'll save a lot of time recovering from the hit. Note this cannot be done when smart steering mode is on If a Blooper is about to ink the player as they cross the finish line, the player will still get inked. Red Shell Nerfed: If you're holding an item behind you while in the air, you can block a red shell Easier to break while drifting (advanced tactic) -Luigi still has his signature death stare If there's anything I missed please put it in the comments. Overall, i personally think the best additions are the enhanced battle mode and the portability aspect as I can now play during my break period and commute to work. I already sunk in over 300+ hours on the Wii U version and the upgrade is totally worth it for me as I got more than my money's worth in the original game on Wii U and plan to sync 300+ on the Switch version especially with the ease of use due to it's portability, and 100+ more hours of play in battle mode play with housemates. Well that is my personal perspective, so if you are in a similar situation it's a very good buy. If not, I hope the list of changes helped you in your purchasing decision

I've been playing Mario Kart since its inception on the SNES back in 1992. Perhaps that dates me a little bit, but don't be fooled: this old dog is a gamer and can still hang with the best of them. I've played almost every iteration of Kart pretty obsessively with the exception of just a few, so my experience with this franchise is quite extensive. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe was simply great, right out of the starting gate. Our family purchased a Wii U a little bit late in its production cycle, and as such we started playing Mario Kart 8 only very recently. We went through most challenges of the game and unlocked just about everything that is unlockable. Shortly after that, we purchased our Switch. The first game we bought was Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. With Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, many of the unlockable rewards from Mario Kart 8 are already unlocked. Some may find this to be a treat, especially if coming from Mario Kart 8 on the Wii U where they don't want to be bothered to go through those challenges again. For others, particularly those who are new to Mario Kart 8 in general, that might leave the game a little bit unfulfilling. I'm somewhere in the middle of these two camps, as I feel that while even though the game is 'largely similar' it does have enough differences that -- to me -- constitute the need for starting the game at the same baseline as the Mario Kart 8 edition from Wii U and then being required to unlock everything again. You do still need to unlock many of the vehicle customizations, though. All that said, the characters, available bikes and karts, and all of the attributes of the various vehicles really showcase the depth and thought process that went into the driving aspects of Mario Kart 8. It's really quite unlike any Mario Kart game before it. I find it intriguing to see how people use the different combinations of characters, bikes/karts, tires, and gliders to create their ultimate racer. Back in the days of the original Super Mario Kart and Mario Kart 64, you simply didn't have anything like that available. Interesting tidbit about the Mario Kart 8 Deluxe vehicles: changing your Mii in the Nintendo Switch console changes the available attributes of the vehicle that you can use when you choose your Mii character as a racer when you're in the vehicle selection screen. I'm a tall and thinner build in 'real life' but my Mii character on the Nintendo Switch console has a different body type because I want my Mario Kart vehicle to drive a certain way. Through a bit of trial and error, with which I am still experimenting, I have been able to create the ideal vehicle for me. Give it a shot! The online racing feature is greatly improved since the original Wii days. That is great to see. Nintendo has done a really nice job of making the online racing accessible, and I would venture a guess that more people are trying online racing (and online gaming in general) for the first time with this version of the game than in any Mario Kart titles prior to this one. The new tracks in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe are absolutely TONS of fun. There is a nice range of very simple to very challenging. I don't know how the developers continue to reinvent the wheel regarding the multitude of great new tracks over the years, but they somehow do every time. The retro tracks are pretty cool to see, too. The one thing with the retro tracks is that they aren't particularly 'true' to the originals. While there might be many similarities, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe takes those tracks and adds many new spins on them. For those of us who remember those original tracks, that can be seen as a little bit of a surprise, as the tracks simply do not drive the same with all the new features. Still, though, it's pretty awesome that they recognized some of the classics and brought them into the mix with this newest version of Mario Kart. The Excitebike homage track was pretty darn cool, too. Considering that there have been so many releases of this game, it's amazing to see that the developers have been able to keep it fresh and innovative after 20-plus years. This game delivers on all of that and then some. I highly recommend this game for anyone who loves fun racing games, and/or is a Mario Kart aficionado. You simply will not be disappointed.

Some of you may be familiar with MARIOKART 8 as it existed in the Wii U for almost 3 years now. If you are new to the game then I have to tell you that you are in for a treat. Welcome to Mario Kart 8 deluxe edition! What makes it deluxe? There were 2 packs of DLC (downloadable content) that added more tracks(48 total!), more racers(42 total!), more carts(40 total!), and added replayability to an already excellent game. Other than the aforementioned new carts and tracks, there are a few differences to note in this new version. There is a mode called auto steering that is default set on when you first start playing. This mode is akin to the bumpers that protect you from the gutter in bumper bowling, as it stops you from falling off the track and falling waay behind in the race. The sacrifice of having this mode on is that it will slow your cart down and/or redirect you to keep you on track. One of the biggest complaints is why this mode is auto set to be on? The answer however is simple, it's for kids and/or casual gamers so they jump in and not be overwhelmed right away by the complexity of some of the more difficult tracks. It's worth noting that this mode can be turned off before the race on the cart select screen. Hit or - and a small 3 option sub menu comes up below the carts stats. Hit L to deactivate auto steering, Y to activate physical driving (using the joy cons as a steering wheel), and R to activate auto accelerate, which I haven't used yet but I hear is pretty good. I feel this needs addressing most as this is the number 1 complaint I see online when it comes to the negatives of this game. It's relatively easy to shut off. Now back to the pros, which is basically the entire rest of the game, gain coins through racing or in the newly revamped battlemode to unlock new carts and custom parts for all of the carts. The battle mode has been redone as well, and makes the game that much more worth it. You can play multi player too, 4 players on one screen(which is tough in portable mode), or up to 8 if you and 7 friends all have a switch and mk8d... Online functionality is good but not great because Nintendo makes you jump through hoops to chat while you play. It doesn't bother me as I'm not one to chat with strangers online, bit I feel as though I'm in the minority on that line of thinking... It's yet to be said if there is to be any new DLC for this version but as it stands it's well worth your money and oh yeah... ITS PORTABLE!!! 3...2....1....GO! (get it)

Mario Kart 8 was such a good Mario Kart game I still considered it my favorite despite its lack of a proper battle mode and certain fan favorite characters. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe fixes some top complaints with Mario Kart 8 and adds new features on top of that. The new battle modes are a lot of fun. Balloon Battle and Coin Runners play like they did in Mario Kart Wii, and Shine Thief plays like it did in Double Dash. I did not find the new version of Bob-omb Blast to be *quite* as fun as the Double Dash version, but I was glad to see it return. The new Renegade Roundup mode plays like cops and robbers, and while it seems like the easiest to unbalance, it is still a lot of fun, and it feels fresh and different. While none of the race tracks are new, it is nice that Deluxe comes with all the tracks and CC levels unlocked (including the DLC tracks and 200cc). You do not get rewards for completing individual cups anymore, but as someone who already unlocked everything in MK8, it is nice to not have to unlock all the tracks and characters again. If you are someone who enjoys unlocking things, there ARE still locked vehicle partsincluding new Splatoon onesthat are unlocked by collecting coins. Even though the courses are the same, some of the new mechanics do make a difference. The most visible is the ability to carry two items at once. It allows some Double Dash strategies to return, but the inability to swap the item slots makes it feel more like dragging one item while having another in your item slot in other Mario Kart games. The item changes (and the introduction of the new Boo item) help give the first place player less of an advantage than in MK8 without feeling too unfair. Another new feature is the third level of mini turboit is difficult to drift that long on most courses, but the speed boost you get from it feels very satisfying. For advanced players, it sounds like a small change, but the ability to brake while drifting can actually really change how you play some tracksespecially in 200cc. For new players, auto steering and auto acceleration make learning the game much easier (though I wish the switches to turn them on and off were not hidden in the +/ menus). Overall, if you never played MK8, picking up Deluxe is a no-brainer. If you played MK8 and loved it, Deluxe is probably worth it for the new battle modes and the ability to play those courses on-the-go (spontaneous split-screen races in portable mode with Joy-Cons are still a lot of fun). If you hated the core gameplay of MK8, Deluxe does little to fundamentally change the formula, so you might want to try a friend's copy before deciding to buy. For me, this is probably my new favorite Mario Kart game.

TL;DR: This game is literally an enhanced port of the original Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U - with additional features and improved frame rate. Pros: Improved frame rate - especially in split-screen multiplayer, portable local multiplayer with multiple controller options, Battle Mode revamp, 8 player local co-op is possible, stat tiers have been fixed and stat points are no longer lost, Mario Kart is fun, very good purchase for those who never purchased the original. Cons: While 8 player co-op is possible, the game is a bit unclear at conveying that you require 4 Switch consoles to do so. Single joycon controls are the most economical choice to play with a lot of people, but they're fairly uncomfortable to play Mario Kart with. For veteran MK8 players, this is only an enhanced port - the only thing new is the battle mode and 1 new unlockable. Farming coins again can be a chore. Unlockables: most characters/stages/cc modes are unlocked at the start of the game to appeal to the market of players who originally purchased MK8 for the Wii U. There is 1 unlockable character (beat 200cc) and all karts/bikes/wheels/gliders must be unlocked by farming coins once again. Beating 150cc unlocks the gold cups/stars for 50cc and 100cc as well without having to play them. Additional features: DLC only characters and stages from the Wii U version are included. New and improved battle mode included, 8 player local co-op possible (requires 4 Switch consoles - can only do 2 player split-screen per console). Standard 4 player split-screen local co-op is possible on one console. New karts and stat overhaul. Personal review: As a veteran of MK8 Wii U, I purchased this strictly for the ability to play this portable with friends. As I had already unlocked everything and played the original MK8 to death, I found myself not being as immersed in playing single player since I had already 3 starred every track in all modes including 200cc in original MK8 and I got bored quickly and lost interest playing by myself. Online matchmaking is still fun and the new battle modes did warrant a good purchase in my book. The biggest draw was the ability to bring my Switch anywhere and able to set up Mario Kart at parties and game nights for casual and competitive play with friends, only to lose those friendships shortly after over a horribly timed blue shell. I would 110% recommend this to someone who has never played MK8 before, but I would only recommend this to a MK8 veteran only if the things I wrote in the above 'Pros' section appeal to them - otherwise, just stick with the Wii U version.

Let's see where do I begin! Well first of all, I'll tell you I do own the Wii U version and that I am a double dipper if you happen to be one of those on the fence wether to buy it or now still. This game freshens it up. All tracks plus DLC, Characters, parts, karts, and bikes. Butter smooth 60 FPS. Real battle modes and pretty good online play. (needs a touch work but nonetheless works great) Everything is unlocked form the start. All Modes 50cc-200cc with all characters. You can just dive right in! I've raced this game to death on the Wii U and somehow this feels refreshed as if it were a whole new game! So if your a new comer this game will easily give you hours and hours of enjoyment for your whole Switch life cycle! Racing, Time Trials, Battle modes, Online play, its all here. Trust me, this is a game that you'll love to play with friends even if they are not a gamer. Everyone knows Mario Kart. So grab some friends, have a party and get to having a blast!

I fell in love with Mario Kart on the N64. I put countless hours into mastering every track, on every difficulty level, and loved few things more than Mario Kart tournaments with my friends and siblings. Even to this day I break out that old game console and challenge my nephews to a race. When I finally decided to get myself a Nintendo Switch, my first new gaming console since my N64, I knew right away that this was going to be my first game purchase, just like it was back in 1997. I have not been disappointed. The first notable difference from my Mario Kart of old is the sheer scale of this game. It is simply so much bigger. More racers on the track at a time, more characters to choose from, more kart options (and upgrades!), and way, way, WAY more tracks to compete on. I've been playing this game for a few weeks now and still have really only raced on about 2/3rds of the tracks so far. And as a bonus for us old-time Mario Kart drivers, many of the tracks are throwbacks to those on earlier systems. Only now apparently now you can race on the walls and ceilings too, which is still a little mind-boggling to me, and an interesting twist visually. But where this game really shines is in when you get a few friends together and face off against them. The multi-player options are pretty expansive too, with several multi-player game modes to choose from. Battle mode is a heck of a lot more chaotic with 12 characters in the arena as compared to the 4 I was used to, but I haven't decided yet if that's a downside or not. But my personal favorite way to play, just as it was before, is a good old-fashioned race with a four-player split screen. Even my non-gaming mother-in-law is having a good time watching this one! Definitely pick up this title... and don't forget to grab a second set of joy-cons. You're going to be glad you had them for this title!

I've been wanting to get Mario Kart 8 since the Wii U, but never had the chance to get it. I'm glad I waited and got the Deluxe version of Mario Kart 8 for the Nintendo Switch. It's so much fun playing Mario Kart 8 on the go! :) The graphics look beautiful in 1080p HD. The new racing tracks are really creative. There are some returning retro tracks that have been completely revamped for Mario Kart 8, such as Moo Moo Meadows (Wii), Yoshi's Circuit (GameCube), and Music Park (3DS). **DLC & MORE PLAYABLE CHARACTERS!** It adds all the DLC packs that were released on the Wii U. Plus, more characters have been added to Mario Kart 8. They added Inkling Girl and Inkling Boy with different color schemes to choose from, Bowser Jr., King Boo, Dry Bones, and an alternate costume for Link (Breath of the Wild tunic) - which was a free update that was added recently. **IMPROVED BATTLE MODES!!** The Battle modes on the Wii U were just reusing the racing tracks which made it too big to chase after other players. It seemed like battle mode was an afterthought and Nintendo realized they needed to add battle modes for when Mario Kart 8 was first released on the Wii U. In the Deluxe Edition, the battle modes are much better and they created some new battle modes. The arenas are smaller, like in previous Mario Kart games. One of the new battle maps has a Splatoon themed arena. Returning modes are Popping Balloons and Bob-omb Blast **CONTROLS** The controls feel great. There's even a new Smart Steering feature which makes driving and staying on the track easy for those who normally don't play video games that much. Nintendo even added more controller options such as Nintendo Labo Motorcycle and Vehicle. Overall, I had a lot of fun playing this game and I recommend this to anyone who likes racing games. Fun to play on your own or play with your friends and family!

I have been playing Mario Kart since the SNES days. Mario Kart 64 was the first of the series I purchased with my hard earned money from my first job that I played for months on end. I admit that having previously purchased Mario Kart 8 on the Wii U there was some hesitation in buying the new 'remastered' game. But in all Mario Kart 8 Deluxe's seemingly small feature upgrades add a lot to the game. In my case the updates were well worth the double dip. If you've been away from the series and or missed it entirely on Wii U there should be no question on whether to buy (so long as you enjoy the racing, kart genre). But if you are on the fence consider the following: -Eight battle stages with four modes. This was the greatest omission from the Wii U version that is rightly fixed now. The modes are great, with Renegade Roundup being the new addition and my personal favorite. -Full 1080p 60fps on TV and 720p 60fps on the go. It ran at 720p 59fps on Wii U. So the game is sharper and very smooth running on the Switch. Multiplayer dips to 30fps with three or four players, but no different than Wii U. -Best handheld iteration of a Mario Kart ever made. -Double item blocks return, you can now get a defensive item and a coin or two defensive items. This really does make the game much better. -New characters and karts: Dry Bones, Bowser Jr. Inkling Boy, Inkling Girl. There is one additional character that is unlocked by getting a gold cup on every cup available, I won't spoil it here. A quick Google search will tell you who it is. -All DLC characters and levels included and unlocked from the start including 200cc mode. There is still a progression through racing and getting coins to earn kart parts. -Local wireless, LAN (with adapter), and online play are all available.
I really like the new improvements on battle mode overall it's what it should've been in the first place

There isn't much to dislike here. The gameplay is solid, the track designs are beautiful, and the replay ability is endless. With the Switch, you can play Mario Kart with someone anywhere you are because the joycons can be used as two controllers. I visited a girl in the hospital, and brought it with me, and we played this game together. For owners of the Switch, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a must have game.

Excellent game on the switch. Being able to play Mario Kart on the go is even more amazing. New Battles Modes have made this game even better. This is coming from someone who owns both the Wii U version and update Switch version.

It's the tried and true Mario Kart formula, but what they did to differentiate this version from the Wii U version is that players have the ability to hold two items now, there are battle arenas, and all DLC is included and unlocked. One feature I particularly like (don't know the official name) is that the game will either steer the kart or accelerate for you if it notices you're not doing one or the other (this is ticked on by default). This has helped my young niece actually stand a chance at competing, providing a more enjoyable time for her.

First, if you aren't a gamer member with Bestbuy you are throwing money away every time you buy a game. This game has everything! It's especially fun once you master the steering wheel(sold separately) and don't need to use the directional buttons. The switch joy con is made to fit hands that are roughly the size of Trumps hands. If you have anything larger than a toddlers hand when playing with the joy con you need the steering wheel. There are tons of characters and vehicles to choose from. So many upgrades. The game is set up for the most novice players to the extremely talented with all the classes and cups available. Better option for party's of adults or children than 1-2 switch. Adults only below this...... Trying playing Drunk Cup The rules are: You are not allowed to drink and drive. You must pull over to drink. You must finish your adult beverage before finishing the race. Good luck!!!!

First off let me say that I bought and played this game since day 1 it was released back on the Wii U so I have already put many hours into it before now. That being said even if you bought and played this on the Wii U it is well worth the price of picking up again on the switch. The battle mode is the biggest improvement over the Wii U version, but not the only one. Switch version runs at 1080p vs 720p on Wii U, it comes with all the paid DLC and of course the best feature... you can play it anywhere you want via handheld mode and it is absolutely gorgeous in handheld mode and on a TV. If you have never played.... buy it yesterday.... if you have it on Wii U... still buy it. As always I would recommend anyone buying video games to get the BestBuy Gamer club, it provides great year long discounts and since I have joined BestBuy is pretty much only place I get any physical games anymore. Great money saver.
This is MK8, but includes new battle modes, characters, double items, and more. Beautiful game on the Switch, and great couch multiplayer!
Mario Kart for the Switch is perfect for long trips. It provides hours of entertainment.
Uh yes- everything they learned in the past has been rolled into this content packed racing game. Fun with friends or online. lots of unlock-able content! A must for any Nintendo fan boy or gal!!
Lots of hours of fun in front of the television. Ok

This remake of the Wii U version does the original justice and then some. It's a fantastic game to play with friends with couch co-op or versus. It has a new battle mode that you can play objective style games like cops and robbers or trying to pop as many balloons tied to other karts as possible without getting losing any of your own. It's has a great single player mode as well, and you can earn special gold reskins from completing many of the single player races/times.
Fun...fun...fun! Great game on the Switch, would definitely recommend it as a must-have game.

Even though this initially seems like just a re-release of Mario Kart 8, or at best a game of the year edition since it includes all previously released DLC on Wii U, this is rather much more. Having played and completed every single Mario Kart released, this one has the best features of all games, and combines them in Mario Kart 8 as a base. Holding one item and keeping another in item slot is back, and so is Battle Mode. Multiple modes are feature in Battle (8 arena maps), and all addicting and fun to play online or with friends over splitcreen and even with multiple Nintendo Switches together. Racing is as solid as ever, featuring all tracks (48 tracks total for racing), including DLC ones from Mario Kart 8. Screen resolution is now 1080p in TV mode, with perfect fluid 60 frames per second when playing from 1 to 2 players, and a solid 30 frames when playing 4 in splitcreen. Game is excellent for hard core fans of the series since it features best item combinations and mechanics, and features optional steering and acceleration assists for those still learning the mechanics.
This game is just visually stunning. There are tons of contents and so many different modes to choose from. This is a must have party game and for anyone a fan of the series.
Whats there to not love. Its Mario Kart!!!!!! Solid 5 stars all around.
I love it is really fun, I remember when I was a kid
I can't say enough good things about Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. It is so much fun to play with laughs and intense competition & even has some new characters to deal with. Graphics good also.
MARIO KART 8 DELUXE GAME NINTENDO SWITCH IS THE BEST MARIO KART GAME SO FAR IN 2019
Best mario kart game. Best buy always has good sales, even when other places dont on games. Ehem Gamestop.

If you want to destroy your childs hopes and dreams while rubbing it in their face this game is a must have. Ive watched my sons life slowly fall apart race after race, win after win. This game is a must have 10/10 do recommend!!!!
My daughter loves this game. Its a nice family game and the entire family could play together and have great fun !
One of my favorite video games. Fun for the family.
Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is just another great edition of a classic game. Paired with the Nintendo Switch, it makes for hours of great playing and a lots of fun for everyone.
All of the best features of Mario Kart combined into one.
Mario Kart 8 Deluxe it is fun race game for families
Wont get bored with this game and you can play it with your family!
Game was better than expected. Have such a great time playing with my kids
Great game for the whole family. This might be the best Cart iteration in the Nintendo lineup.
I admire the fact they remastered all the classical maps I use to play during my childhood.
We absolutely love this game. I had to go out and purchase 2 more joy cons so we can all play. Hours and hours of fun! Lots of fun levels!

As like most, I had high expectations for this game for the Switch. However, I wasn't satisfied and felt the previous Olympic games were much better. It made me want to go back and play the Winter Olympic games on the Wii/DS instead because those games were more fun to me than this one. The retro part seemed pretty cool at first but I never felt a good connection with it and felt it wasn't exactly necessary. Only a small selection of games are retro too. There are many ways to play the games, but the instructions aren't always clear. The motion controls were pretty difficult. I'm just glad that every game includes the option to play the games using only buttons on the controller instead of motion control. The story mode is ok. There are a lot of objects and when speaking to NPCs they give you historical information about Tokyo itself and the real Olympic games. Seems pretty cool at first but there appears to be a lot so I tend to skip them over eventually or just not speak to them anymore. The cool parts were information about the playable characters. Most of the games I felt after playing it once was fun and that was just it for me. Overall, it is nice side game, especially if you love the Mario and Sonic series but I can't justify purchasing for full price for it.

I've played most of the Mario and Sonic games since they were introduced on the Wii and feel this is one of the, if not the strongest contender. From the onset you can choose how you want to play. You can start a story mode that takes you on an adventure through the 1964 Tokyo, or play any and all of the Olympic games available. There are quite a few including 10 retro games that are very fun. They can be played with motion (waiving the controller around) or classic controls (button presses) which is a fun option. If you're looking for a good multiplayer game this one is worth considering, and most games can be played with one joy-con to each player.

My kids love this game. They enjoy the wide variety of events the game lets them play. The events by themselves are not long enough to substitute for a single sports game (this games soccer event does not match the play of a FIFA soccer) but they are great for younger kids

This game is quite fun and in the footsteps of its previous versions. However if there was 1 improvement i would recommend that they update with a Olympics mode as all the events are single events and have to always select the next event, would be nice to have a mode that has events all lined up for continuous uninterrupted play.

If you've ever played a Mario and Sonic game before, you know what you are in for. However, there are some really cool additions to this game that brings it to the top of my list. To start out, I did purchase this game at $34,99 on a sale price. I think $60 is a lot BUT if you can get it cheaper, I recommend that. There is also a demo in stores that you can go try and see if you like it. This game has a fun single player campaign where you not only play through the story but also get to learn a lot of facts about Japan and the Olympics. There is also a new mode where you go back in time and play as the classic sprites of the SNES/NES/GENESIS era, which as a lifelong gamer who grew up in that era, was a real treat! The games themselves are hit and miss and you'll quickly find ones you enjoy playing and others you'll only play when the game makes you. We also played this with friends and that's where the real fun is at. Getting together and playing Mario and Sonic with a group is just as fun as Mario Party where you'll be either using the motion controls or button controls to best each other in various Olympic events. All in all, it's a fun game that would be best at a cheaper price. Again, if you are on the fence, go to your local store with a kiosk and give it a try! :)
Not worth the price. The story mode is very short and will take you about 2 to 3 hours to finish. If you can get it at a discount then I would recommend it for the casual mini games.
This game isnt as good as the 2012... it wasnt the same as I remember from my childhood!

Bought this game to play with friends and its a lot of fun for a group. Makes great use of the joy cons. Even the single player mode is pretty fun. I recommend only if you have 4 joy cons and can play with a group for the most playability.

This is a great party game for up to four players and includes a single player story that guides you through the individual games. I recommend reading the instructions for every mini-game and to also repeat the games as they give you more helpful tips each time you finish a round. It's been one of my go-to party games for the Switch!

The 3D and the Retro 2Ds are a sweet touch! Bigger, Larger and more colorful characters, the. In years past! There are MORE than enough gameS to keep one occupied and the burning desire to get get to the next level! It pull one into the game, unbelievable!!!!
We absolutely love this game. There are so may different choices from swimming to horseback riding to rock climbing. My two kids (7 and 5) never get bored!

I have four kids that are 11,10,8, and 2 and they love this game. Even I play with them sometimes. It is a great game for family night because of the different activities. It is easy to play, great for beginners, and family friendly.
Opened on Xmas and played for over 3 hours.Granddaughter loved it.
Its pretty fun for me and my son weve been playing all night
This is a great game to play on a family game night
It's great to play these iconic gaming characters to face-off one another in the Tokyo Olympic games setting with your friends. This makes a hilarious entertainment to watch as well.
Sport lovers would enjoy this game from beginning to end, no matter ages.

There are some quirks with the game, but overall it's been really fun at parties. The single player can get a little dull in longer sessions, but is fun in short bursts. The retro games can be fun, but I certainly wish there were more. Kids would probably enjoy this a lot and ignore the faults. As an adult, I've gotten my $40 worth for the nostalgia and party fun alone.

My son is really into the Mario Bros games. Specially the ones with lots of characters like Mario Kart, Super Smash Bros and Mario Party. When this title was announced I pre-ordered it to have it ASAP. This one is not as fun as those other titles, still an overall good game.
a great party game and a must buy for sonic and mario fans as well.
My little sister loves this game and its a great switch addition and great gift overall.
Good game if you put it on hard or very bad. Otherwise it is too easy. I have yet to try the online mode
Its awesome to have characters from both Mario and Sonic video games go against one another
Waist of money cant blame Nintendo just my self. Games not worth $10
The initial setting to start the game is too complicated.

I was really excited for this release! However, when I started to play, I felt empty as the gameplay was not as fun as I remember it. A lot of the mechanics are clunky and I feel does not get explained well. I still enjoy it for what it is, but I was let down.
