It was delivered on time. I havent played it yet but will play it Friday. I will update on how the game goes. Im so excited to play it.
If youre a fan of the series you will like this game. A great cast of Mario and Sonic characters light up your Nintendo switch in a fun way!
Second only to Mario Party this is the best family game on the Switch. We have played it for family night multiple times. Highly recommend Ed.
I have not received it yet. It was order in December and I still have no idea who I dont have it. It doesnt let me track it either.
My son loved this game and enjoy playing it in his new console.

Unfortunately I had terrible customer service when I went to purchase this game. Other than that the game is whats to be expected, if youve owned the other Mario and Sonic Olympic Games on other consoles. I couldve been fine waiting until this game was cheaper, but I was itching to get a new game so I went ahead a bought it when it came out. The solo story mode is fun and I still am working on completing it. The new sports they have on here is fun too in multiplayer mode. Mario games never seem to disappoint.
Gameplay looked disappointing, so I returned it before actually playing it.

Always will purchase online and pickup in store, It's quick and easy and very convenient that you can pickup whenever you are ready. I love it. Kids love the game and I love the quick in and out of the store.

My son played this game at Dave and Busters and added it to his xmas list. He was so happy to get it xmas morning. He's so protective of it that I believe he left the packaging on it and hasn't played it yet. I'm sure it's good though because Mario and Sonic are in the game.

This is a major upgrade from the previous TGCs. I still dont think it compares to the last version of EASports Tiger Woods on the PS3. That one was excellent with so many real courses. We only get a handful in this game. I was expecting more since is has the PGA sponsorship now. What it does have over previous versions is that the gameplay and controller motions are much better / more true. Ive enjoyed playing it. I like a good console golf game and this is the best out there right now. I still would love to see that last version of EASports TW come back on PS4 though. This one is good but that one was excellent.

Swinging the club is a little tricky at first but once you get the hang of it, its a great game to play. Tiger woods and Rory Mcilroy fans dont like it because they cant eagle every hole so their modded controllers dont work on this game.
If you buy this you will play it for hours on end like I am. Especially with the coronavirus, just sit here and play golf for hours, it goes by fast and is fun.
NEEDS A HELP / PRACTICE / TUTORIAL FEATURE FOR THOSE TRYING TO UNDERSTAND IT'S OPTIONS.

This is your typical golf game, but the quality of the graphics and the challenge to hit the perfect ball what makes this game different. You really feel you are at the course. They have license from PGA Tour, but unfortunately, not the license from the major tournament courses or the players. Though getting to play TPC Scottsdale for the WM Phoenix Open with its iconic 16th hole, that raises the bar for other golf games. If they could come to an agreement with the PGA Tour players association for next version, you could be actually playing the real players on the tour. I really like this game.

am only in my infancy on The Golf Club 2019 and have fortunately never owned a previous version of this series, so the initial selling price doesn't put me off as much as it will others. Overall I am very impressed with the game and expect I will find it very challenging for many months to come. If you enjoy watching or playing golf then you will enjoy what is in essence this golf simulation. What the previous owners of the PGA Tour license did with their games was a disgrace, making arcade golf game time after time, similar to how they treat other modern sports. Hopefully the new license can be expanded to further courses in the future but having paid the full value for the initial game I will not be spending on any future possible add ons. I will enjoy what I have. A solid golf game with endless playability.

Not for the faint of heart, this is a challenging golf game. It is more of a golf simulation than an arcade type game, this is not the Tiger Woods games of old. Personally I really like the game, and the collection of user made courses is fantastic and huge. The PGA aspects need to be expanded, no PGA golfers and the tour calendar has only a few licensed courses. It would be great if you could choose the courses for the tour schedule. The graphics could be improved, and the developers really should move to a better graphics engine, considering where console gaming is today. All of that being said, I really love playing this game. The challenge, and you can adjust the swing difficulty by the club set you choose, provides a sense of reward when you are successful, unlike the old EA games which you could master in a few weeks and then shoot 20 under par per round. If you like golf, this game is for you.

I bought this game for my husband, and although he doesn't play videogames very much, he loves this game as a 'putz' game. Aka, he can sit down, relax, and play for a few hours without any stress or commitment to the game.
I'm having fun with this but, it's still a bit clunky and needs some tweaking. But overall, it's not bad.

Overall a solid golf game. Difficult on certain levels but able to improve and be competitive. Graphics I think are lacking. Not much of an improvement from the old Tiger games. This has just not progressed at the rate of sports game.

I recommend this game for fans of golf. This is a good addition to the Golf Club series of games. The new PGA Tour mode will allow you to play in the Web.com tour, PGA tour and Fed Ex cup Playoffs. There appears to be an abundance of courses to play on and the ability to create your own course is a nice addition. Character customization is also available. Graphics are decent but the water graphics could use some work. Gameplay is fun but the putting takes some getting used to .
Good game, I enjoy playing it. Graphics are great, but the commentary(announcers) could use some improvement. They need to get some Golf Channel announcers on board.

Graphics are good, but when it comes actual game play, there is no consitany on swing. Most of the time, the ball will either go right, or be amazingly short (200yards on a driver that is suppose to go 265 yards). I had a drive go yesterday 154 yards.
Game looks really good. Nothing exciting about it though. Liked the TW golf games a lot more.
I do like it but it's no Tiger Woods PGA Tour. Wished those were on the games to play now.
The game is ok, not the best but not the worst. I miss the PGA Tiger Woods and Rory McElroy games
Played very first time and was not too impressed with game itself! Graphics kinda failed Does take time to figure out...I miss the EA Sports golf games that were out like 4-5 years ago...
I think I would have given this game 5 stars if there was the ability to have more ball control like other golf games. It is an enjoyable game aside from that.
Graphics arent great, no actual PGA Golfers. I hoped this game would be better than the EA golf games but I was mistaken.
Needs lots of work. I thought since 2k got in on this it would be amazing. Maybe the next one.

Driving and using irons are almost too easy. Putting very inconsistent. You can do the exact same shot with the exact same conditions 10 time and will get different results every time. Announcers are terrible too.
The game plays more difficult than most other computer games. Requires skill as well as patience

Loved last version of this, had to check new one...glad I did. Graphics, audio, swing meter, available courses all amped up. Very nice game, not carnival-like and mastered in 3 rounds. Real-life-golf buds and I once a week have craft and competion on this game and all enjoy it greatly. Honestly, I often hear This is a beautiful course!. Great visuals, smooth and as true to life as is available. One suggestion to John, the commentator. Im thinking I might have hurt your feelings in my last review of previous game when I said John delivers the smack...because your just too darn polite on this version. We miss when you used to rib the poor shots. Idea: offer 3 different commentator modes- Encouraging, Light Smack and Smack Down. Great work developers, keep it going Powerful! like Thors hammer!

purchased as a gift for golf enthusiast. person absolutely loves the game. Says only drawback is lack of pga tour players that were included in old ea games but claims it does not matter. game play is fun and great graphics
Its a fun game, lots of game modes to choose from. But I am not very good at hitting and find the game difficult at times.

Any video game library must have the 2020 The Show edition. Looks fantastic! Possibly the best starting rosters with many prospects listed by their actual name. New short season option is a feature that will appeal to a number of players. Game play is as smooth as ever. Legend players contain many fan favorites. 26 man rosters built in. Overall: Excellent

I am huge fan of the MLB the Show franchise. I preorder every year's edition and eagerly await release day ('opening day!'). The game is generally very good again and I have already devoted around 100 hours in just 10 days to playing it, so it must not be that bad. I pretty much only play Road to the Show and Franchise modes, so I'll cover each briefly... RTTS is not much different from previous editions, which does not make it bad. I was bothered by the fact that there were a lot of bugs with the logic for presenting stats and such. I would often see a player come to bat and it would show an entirely different (usually the last batter's) stats. Not a deal breaker, but hurts the presentation of the game. I was also bothered by the ridiculous decisions that 'teams* made during the off-season. For example, the Orioles organization currently has a top ten prospect in 2019 1st overall pick Adley Rutschman. They have complete control over Jim for at least 6 years, but despite being the worst team in the league, they allowed him to leave after 1 year and sign with another team. If your a simulation game, you should try to simulate. There is no way this would happen! You gotta get closer to reality. Franchise modes seems to actually have improved the decision making of teams. I used to be able to easily mill other teams in trades to quickly and vastly improve my team. I can still make trades, but they seem to require more reasonable offers now. That's a good thing as it increases the challenge. I also think that the draft process seems far more reasonable than in past years with less (more reasonable number of) high quality players. You can quibble all you want about player ratings, improvements and the like. We all have our opinions on that stuff. I don't fault how it came out. I also LOVE that San Diego Sports finally added the minor leaguers. I'm a fan of pro baseball and pay some attention to those things, so having the real minor leaguers instead of made up players is a huge advancement for me! YMMV. Overall, I still really enjoy the game. Some bug fixes and improvements to front office logic and I would have given it 5 stars and them some.

MLB The Show is back with another great yearly installment. For the first time ever, minor league rosters are included. This makes the game even more realistic. While not too much has been added, The Show keeps putting out another home run year after year. Highly recommended and literally the only way to baseball with the health crisis. This will hold over everyone until the MLB season starts.

The only thing I wish is that would allow all equipment in all modes, they shouldnt have removed the ability to select how many games you can play in franchise or season mode And it would be great if company added face scan in ALL MODES (using your cell phone or pad) THEN THE GAME WOULD REALLY MOVE THE FRANCHISE FORWARD
I brought a PS4 because of The Show. This, by far is the best game yet. It takes almost one and a half hour to play a complete game. And I dont mind it.
In times where we are stuck in the house, this game is right on time. Nearly flawless.
Last MLB The Show game I purchased was 2017. This years version feels better and plays a lot smoother. Graphics are very nice. I would recommend to any baseball fan to pick up.!

I had not bought MLB the Show in a very long time and then on a whim purchased the Show 20 and I am not disappointed. They have updated their rosters to include licensed MILB teams and players. This is a great game.
Best MLB game in my opinion. Quality of graphics. Game options are fun. Allows for all different types of games and seasons. Play Ball!
I love MLB the Show and this newest version is the best of all.
The new controls aren't for me, luckily you can pick classic controls, there's no comfortable batter camera but it's more of the same great show you come to expect.
Best Baseball game out there by far. So many different modes of playing. Addicting game , makes you want to be better
I gave it 4 stars because it feels like the same game, but I am still pleased with my purchase. I think they do a great job every year.
I love the show its always a good game if youre not too crazy about having a new roster is really good just play 19 its a lot similar
Great game for baseball fans ,very realistic. Some bugs need to worked out with roster updates.
Baseball video games are always a hard sell, but in the depth of the options here outweighs how frustrating trying to hit the ball can be.
This game never changes. Same game the last 4 years. Im done buying this game

I've been playing borderlands on and off for a couple weeks now. I haven't finished it yet, but I feel I've gone far enough to give a fair enough commentary of it. If you're a fan of the previous entries in the series, then you're going to like this one too. If borderlands was fun for a play through, but hard to come back to then you might find this game has worn out its welcome a bit. To explain, I feel that this is the apex borderlands game. All the writing, action, and loot is exactly what you'd want from borderlands and is done at a consistently high level. The problem lies in how you feel about borderlands in general. If you feel like the jokes get old and the combat is repetitive; if the thought of loot farming doesn't excite you, then this game probably won't either. The frame drops and random lag when navigating menus and maps certainly doesn't help things, but could possibly be sorted out through future patches. Right now it's not frequent enough to put me off entirely, but it does pull me out of the experience enough times to worth mentioning. Overall the game is lots of fun if you want a run and gun loot fest with some sillier throwback jokes thrown in. If that doesn't sound great, then it's probably not for you. But if it does, then you'll get more than your money's worth.
Not as ground-breaking as its predecessors, but at least better than the Pre-sequel. Really bad optimization with co-op and plenty of lag, but hopefully there's a patch for that...eventually.
I expected more than a flashy borderlands 2 when I spent 60 bucks years after it came out but all they did was slap a 3 on the cover and here we are.
Meh. It's pretty to look at, but it's boring to play. Story and characters aren't compelling and the gameplay is standard fare.

If you loved Borderlands, Borderlands 2, and the Pre-Sequel - you will love Borderlands 3. I installed the game on Friday night at 7pm, it's now 10am Sunday and I've put over 15 hours into the game. This is an excellent addition to the series. The gunplay feels better than ever, movement has been improved, driving is better and there are even new vehicles and customization options. On the bad side, there are some performance issues (playing on a PS4 pro). I've experienced frame rate drops, freezing and stuttering when opening and navigating the menus and inventory, and problems with the jump and climb mechanic newly introduced to the series. Speaking of the inventory system, it needs work. Comparing stats of items in your inventory is not intuitive at all. The quest tracking system is also dated and needs work (multiple quests tracked at once would be nice). I still give this game a 4.0/5 as it's extremely fun with an incredible replay value.
I am very happy I per-ordered this game to get the Skins. Such a good game, graphics are amazing. Its a great game for people trying to get back into gaming. So much to do but easy to follow along!

We have an average size tv (45') and you can't see any of the enemies or read any of the text with split-screen enabled. It's tiny due to the fact that only horizontal split-screen is available (they have no plans to add vertical split-screen). There are also awful lag issues that plague split-screen mode and the combination has made the game unplayable for us. It's crazy they could release a game without functional local co-op.
Love the borderland series and this on is just as good if not better!

Where to start borderlands 3 is so awesome to play even if you are new to the borderlands games or been playing borderlands every day. I also like have four new vault hunters to chose from and if you and your friend both play as the siren you can customized your character anyway you want so the choice is yours
I do not like this game.... not worth the money... oh well you live and learn I suppose..
Very nice tv and Im planning on buying another one soon
Not a fan of the first 2. This didn't make me a fan at all!
Do you like the gameplay of Borderlands 1 and 2? Then you'd probably like this. Writing is so bad to the point of insufferable. Easy to ignore if you town VA all the way down
Its just ehh.. the store is just ehh... ehh ehh ehh
This game has complete my collection. Love any minute of it.
I cant believe its Finally back out played in almost a decade for Seco well worth it fantastic show graphics new weapons multiplayer bringing back old characters messing with new
I was worried that it might take some time to show up in my email but it was delivered promptly and worked with no issues
Support on the phone refused to give me the codes for either one i purchased.
Not much to say. Digital code for what was advertised
I got the email 30mins after placing the order. depends on the day or time you order this. i ordered mine around 9pm
Digital code was sent almost immediately and I was able to continue gaming quickly
Its great. Awesome selection of games. I definitely recommend.
Xbox live is a requirement when playing online. Price needs to be lowered after all these years
After purchase, the code was emailed to me in 11 minutes. I consider that fast. 5 stars for Best Buy and Im happy with live so 5 stars there as well.
best buy should price compare ebay alot of this is bought online cheaper
Might be a good card I dont know yet but with all these reviews it seems good
Download code did not arrive in one hour. Status said pending for at least two hours. UNACCETABLE

I have the PS4 version and had played through it before but didnt really find it to be very entertaining. It felt like a chore to have to complete all those quests when I played it on the PS4. Playing it again on the Switch offered an entirely new perspective even though its the same game I played years ago. Im enjoying this game so much more on the Switch and this time through I find myself looking forward to completing all the quests, including those optional secondary quests! Theres something about the Switch that makes this game better. Im thinking maybe its the Switchs ability to put the system to sleep and lets you come back to right where you left off without having to wait for the system to reload. Maybe thats it. As for the Switch version, even though many previous reviewers compared it unfavorably to the other console versions, at least graphically, I still really cant notice the difference. I mean youd have to really put both versions in front of you in order to be able to tell. Even if you were to do so (you actually can by watching those comparison videos on youtube), the difference is not that significant to be worthy of the average persons concern. This is still a very pretty game on the Switch. There are occasional crashes but that doesnt happen too often. In fact, I remember this game crashed a few times on the PS4 too. Im a bigger Witcher fan now that I played this game on the Switch. Just in time for the Witcher series debut on Netflix in a few more weeks.

This game has blown my mind with its amazing story, beautiful graphics and some side quest that on pare with main story. In past I have played and almost completed the game. With this new version on Switch I will be able to play it anywhere I go. It is impressive how this game looks on a little portable device despite the fact how graphically intensive are visuals.

The witcher 3 itself is one of my favorite games of all time. I have over 300 hours logged on my PC version, but bought this version so I could play on the go as well as I wanted to support CD Projekt Red. The game on the switch seems very stable and locked around 30fps with minor dips, but nothing too noticeable. NPC counts seem to be around the same number as on other platforms. The game is slightly blurry because of the low resolution, but in handheld which I primarily play, it doesn't take you out of the game. It helps that the game is so immersive as well. Overall it was an incredible port for the Switch, and it's amazing they even got this thing to run at all, let alone how well it actually does.

This was already in my opinion the best game ever made. Yes, the game does graphically look worse than any other version, but it still doesn't look bad at all. Especially on a 5 inch screen there's not much to criticize. It's a feat in it's own that this runs on the switch but that it also runs very well. This was the 4th time I've bought this game and was well worth the full price yet again.
One of the greatest open world RPG's ever created, and now it's portable.

As a dad I don't get nearly as much PC gaming time. When I do it it is playing games with one of my two sons (daughter likes to play talking Beanie Boos not many games). I have played through 60% of the Witcher 3 when it came out in 2015 and bought but didn't have time to play the DLC. On my 1080Ti the game looks amazing at 4K... The issue is most of the time I have 'gaming' time..I don't play on the PC but my Switch in handheld so I can hangout with my wife watching hot trash on TV (90 Day F is fun to laugh at). So I usually grab my Switch and play Civ or BOTW until this came out. I have played in both Handheld (primarily) and on my 4K set. Yes the game is downgraded (esp from the my PC) but still LOOKS amazing esp considering it is running on a mobile CPU and GPU (Tegra) and the full game is here... The story doesn't suffer from this downgrades and the game plays amazing pretty much floating at 30hz 90% of the time. If you have a PS4 or PC and don't need portable access..get it there but if you have a Switch and play handheld..this game really feels like magic. The story is crazy good and the visuals are a knockout on the Switch compared to every other game. It runs better then I could have ever dreamed and after 30 mins you won't even notice the visual downgrade (minus some pop in during cut scenes). Well worth the buy and will keep me busy for 120 hours for the next 3 months. PS. Support CDProjekt Red for they truly believe in what makes gaming great: no loot boxes, great content, FREE post support content and DRM free future (they own gog.com and only sell DRM free on PC).

If you're anything like me. You've read review after review of the Witcher 3 port for Switch and they all said the same thing. 'It's amazing that Witcher 3 even plays on the Switch and it's good, but.....' That 'but' was always followed by, 'if you have the chance to play on Xbox or PS4 then play it there.' I'm here to tell you that the Switch version is incredible. Pick it up.

CD Project Red needs to be given a lot of credit for this release. Not only were they able to get the game on Switch but was able to get it physically on stores with tons of extras and the WHOLE game on a 32 Gig Switch cart with all content and all DLC released. Other companies (Capcom/Rock Star) take note this is how you release a game to Switch owners. The Witcher 3 has hundreds of hours of gameplay and is one of the most demanding ports attempted on Switch. To achieve this handheld mode runs at 540p with a stable 20-30 FPS. Docking the Switch ups the resolution to 720p and increases the FPS a little. The fact that this game is playable portable on Switch is a miracle and should finally end the debate if a game can be ported to Switch.

Everything accolade that The Witcher 3 has earned since its initial release is still true, but whats even more notable is that CD Projekt Red still does right by its customers and pulls off the amazing feat of fitting not only the entire game, but both expansions onto the game cartridge, with no need for additional downloads, codes for content, or day one patching. And it runs great on the Switch as well.
Very Simple Amazing, this games looks so good on my switch Lite. All I do is play portable and as a gamer could not be happier than the games that are on switch.

Wanted to be able to play Witcher 3 but didnt have a PC that could handle the graphics or a console. After a long time debating whether I should buy the Switch or not, I finally decided to go for it since it could run Witcher 3. I absolutely love the game. Hard core gamers need to know that obviously the graphics arent going to be as good as on a PC or on PS4/Xbox but thats not the point. Its absolutely great that the developers made this port for people who want to play but dont necessarily have a good enough Pc or not that interested in buying a console for the TV. Being able to go from playing Witcher 3 in bed, then the couch, then on the TV for a bit, and then back in bed in handheld mode is absolutely brilliant. The graphics are great! I really get immersed into the world and story!

This is my fourth time buying the game, across 3 platforms. Ive paid 60$ every time, Ive spent hundreds of hours playing this game, and I regret nothing. One of the greatest RPGs ever created. Blood, tears and laughter in equal measure.
Well it was time to tie the knot. No woman wants me. Time to marry my video game

The Witcher 3 is many peoples all time favorite, myself included. Ive played it on pc and ps4, but wanted to try on my Switch too. The game is all there, but the incredible graphics are so scaled down its sometimes difficult to see things, especially in darker areas. But if I hadnt ever played it on other systems, Itd probably be fine
Very good port. I've been playing it a Switch lite and I have no complaints. Amazing game!
Yup, it seems fine, just a bit clunky on the controls.

This is one of the greatest RPGs of today, and now it's available on the go. I've waited for this due to the length of the game (over 150 hours to see most of it) and I just didn't have that kind of time to sit on a couch and play, but play on my commute? So great for that. Please note, this is not a game for kids. Clearly it has an M rating but it really takes that to a high level, so really be to go with perhaps Skyrim if you'd looking for an RPG for a slightly younger gamer (even though that has M as well). The biggest concern from gamers who have played this on other systems often pertains to the graphics. I have played this on other systems, and while yes, the difference is vast, it's not something you'll likely think about, especially not while in handheld mode. I really thought it'd bother me but it doesn't at all because, at the end of the day, this is a great looking game and the performance doesn't suffer at all. Can't recommend picking this up enough and supporting CDPR (the people that made the game).
Great game but lacking for Nintendo switch. Gonna get it for pc instead to really get the most out of it
I cant believe this is on Switch. Sure it has some compromises but its remarkable how well it runs. Cant wait to spend another 150 hours in this world.
Playing in handheld is great. Graphically compromised but playing anywhere you want is pretty great.

Amazing port of one of my favorite games. As long as you play it on portable mode (which I do) it plays and looks like the PS4 version with some decline in resolution and texture detail. But Im thrilled to be playing the witches again when I travel for work.
the exact game that was on other systems but on the go but it does have graphics down grades but is still amazing to play on the go or on my TV
This is a great value. You get all three expansions and its great that the game is portable

The Witcher 3 is one of my favorite games of all time. I played through the whole thing on PS4 awhile back. I picked it up to see how it played on the Switch and I have been really pleasantly surprised. The game looks great, especially in handheld. While I can notice a few of the graphical blemishes right when I turn it on, I'm quickly absorbed into the world and don't even notice them anymore. Truly one of the best RPG's and really games in general available on the Switch

This is by far the most fun you can have on Nintendo's little console. Sure, the graphics are downgraded compared to the other versions, but you know what? It's still a blast people!!! I play strictly in handheld mode and I think it's the best looking game on the Switch, and by far the most fun.
Must buy! I dont know how they ported it in for switch!

The game looks & plays just fine so far on the switch. The ps4 & XB1 versions obviously look way better because of the hardware. But there's just something about being able to pick up and go when playing that makes all the little issues fade away.

lets face it i liked it but could never bring myself to play it on the ps4... it requires time... and when i log on to ps4 im pulled to play something multiplayer. The Switcher however is easy to play in handheld where i can just pause the screen and pick up again with no lag and faster load times than the ps4 version which was a slog to load.

If you have very high standards about graphics and cannot tolerate 25 frame rate. This version is not for you. But if you are like me, who do not have issues with graphic, it is a must have version for you. And it is even better on the hand console mode.
The Witcher 3 is one of the best games to play in your Nintendo Switch.
A great port of a massive game. It's incredible how they managed to get everything for on the go working great!

They did an excellent job on this port over to the Switch. The game looks and plays great, although expect a graphics quality dip from a PC/PS4. There's also some extra goodies in the box - a map, compendium and stickers. It's also really cool that all of the content, DLC included, is on the SD card. No download was required. Highly recommend, whether you are new to the Witcher series or a seasoned vet!
I never thought Witcher 3 would come to Switch but it's on it and plays great. No issues whatsoever.

First off this is a leap down graphically. It doesn't matter. This story is long and engaging and should be a must play. Also CDProjektred did the unthinkable and took the hit on cart size and put THE ENTIRE GAME ON THE CART. There's no extra download and they should be commended for that. take note other studios. Support this and play this game. This version is my 4th copy!
It will be fascinating to live this game on this console.
I owned it already. Worth having a second copy!!! This is a great game that I highly recommend.
You owe it to yourself to get this game for switch! 10/10

I'm new to The Witcher games. After completing BOTW I got this game. It's a good game while I wait for BOTW 2, but with a Mature rating. I like that it has an easy mode. I'm still getting used to the controls but the tutorial at the beginning of the game helps a lot! The game I got came with a little map of the world and booklet explaining a little about the story and its characters. There were also two little stickers of the school of the wolf logo (still getting the hang of the lingo). I got this on Black Friday for $15 off. The discount is what really got me to get it although I had already thought of getting it after BOTW. I like this game more than Skyrim. Look forward to playing The Witcher 3 during the holidays.
Full game with all DLC makes for ton of playable content. But graphics are blurry. Not unplayable just difficult to see some smalle enemies in the handheld screen.

Ive now played The Witcher III on XBOX One, PS4 and Switch. Is this the best version visually or as far as controls go? Of course not. But it is absolutely amazing that a game of this scope even plays on the Switch, let alone as well as it does. Gameplay is solid, and the story makes up for all graphical shortcomings. I knew CDPR wouldnt put their name on garbage, so I am not surprised at all. Very well done.

Don't get me wrong, I like this game a lot and it does bring back memories from when I played it on PC. But I don't think playability factors into this game as much as the poor graphical/audio performance on the Switch. It's a port of the game in the lowest graphical quality with some audio bugs during combat that turns it off for me and Nintendo needs to allow it to reach it's peak for quality. You go from playing it in max graphics to playing at minimal graphics.... it's a huge turn off and I feel like I wasted money. Nonetheless, still worth playing if you have never touched Witcher 3 and you have a Switch
These expansive games are spectacular and can be overwhelming. If you are an avid gamer, no big deal but there is a significant learning curve if you aren't (like me).
Might look better on PC and PS4 Pro. However, it's amazing to take one of the best games ever with you anywhere.
an amazing port and a must buy however play in portable mode and if you want to play docked get the ps4 version and play on a ps4 pro

The apple watch does not work properly. It keeps shutting off in spite of numerous efforts to re-sync, shut off and turn back on, repair, etc. Very disappointed as this was a Christmas gift for my grandson. My next step is to contact you all in the hopes of getting a refund.

The only redeeming factor is the great story, other than that - this is a waste of time. The mechanics are clunky, the controls are sloppy, it looks bad and has lots of frame rate issues, it crashes often, the voice acting is terrible, the horse pathng is pathetic, the mini map gps is useless, the combat is okay but suffers from the poor controls, and it is overall disorganized. I will stay away from CD Projekt Red games from now on. Just another lazy western dev. Not sure how this is considered AAA, when even all these years later it is clearly a beta, and I surprised it won so many awards. Over all it is a dissapointing experience. I got this as a gift, and want my money back.

First, I have no idea what people are playing, because it isn't Witcher 3 on Switch. This is a terrible port with extremely blurry/muddy graphics due to the very limited Switch hardware. Resolution is very poor and graphical detail is very low. This is one of the worst ports I've ever seen and definitely is not worth even close to $60. People are so settled on bad quality it makes me cringe. Stick to PS4 Pro/Xbox One X/PC for this one. Do not waste $60 for this bad port.

you have to spend an extra $60 on playstation plus membership if you dont have one already just to play a brand new $60 game! says online/membership needed for multiplayer.........also needed to play ANY of the game! should specify and dosnt. now I have a brand new $60 game that sits there collecting dust

Single player was gorgeous, but terrible. Multiplayer and its arcade auto aim, & terrible hit detection has become horrendously bad. When its not respawning you right in front of the guy who just killed you, it is totally possible to lay in a corner and just pull the trigger while people run by you & rack up kills. The auto aim & hit detection will do ALL the work. I played 2 rounds doing this & went 24-4 & 26-2 with 25 headshots even though I was aiming mostly at feet. Barely moved the stick other than running to a spot. The 3rd round I quit after watching my crosshairs literally follow another player around. Play something that will take a little more skill like Halo or Battlefield 3.

This game could have much better.For campaign play there is a lot of wasted time watching video. It would have been nice to have the option to skip it.Also nothing new and exciting. For multiplayer, still have the same lag problems as other COD games. This will be my last COD game.

I really wanted to like this game. Not because I am a Call of Duty fan, which I am not really, but because they promised this one would be 'different'. I purchased myself a copy and my GF's son one too. He played his and I played for a little while and I returned my unopened copy that same day. I got tired of the series when I was still playing MW2. I bought Black Ops hoping it would be different and it was just ok. I bought MW3 with high hopes of a game that i would not tire of in a few hours. I was wrong. Then Black Ops 2 was released and all the major internet review sites said. 'This is the Call of Duty game that will make you into the series again and if you have never played one, this is the one!'. Well I can personally say that this game did not do anything to get me back into the series or even open my game that I purchased. Let me just say this; if you were getting bored of Call of Duty before and had high hopes that this was the one that would revamp the series, look to another game for entertainment. Its that same game that is set in the future. I tried but I just couldn't like the series again.

I got this game the day it came out, i thought it would be the game of the year! Zombies and campain work fantastically but when it comes down to multiplayer, it is the worst. There is a knife you can use that doesnt even work. There are lots of host migrations that are extremely annoying when you are trying to play a game. Also do not buy the Nuketown 2025 map for treyarch doesn't have it in the game anymore! I made the mistake to buy one of treyarchs products, ill never make that mistake again

I was hoping this CoD would be an answer to MW3, but sadly it is far from it, maybe even a step back. The new concept of the 10 point system and the point streaks are great, but they didn't focus on the actual gameplay. The accuracy/consistency of the game is off. Blame it on lag or whatever but even in killcam's there are no hit markers while you are aimed at a target but rather a little bit to the right of the target. There are times when you could kill in three shots sometime NOT kill them with 6 shots and sometimes die without being shot. Something is very wrong there. Random/Problem/Closed lobbies. This has happened a lot for me. Having the party end randomly, or being in a lobby with your friends and then somehow being put in a game without your party. I don't know what you would blame that on except jenky development. The league play will not work. Tried for 30 minutes to get in and played one match. Again something is broken. Another issue has been the servers being down! it seems like it is always down and it is very, very frustrating to pay for a game that you cannot even play. Another weird issue is, if you have a later version you cannot join a lobby or vise versa. A small side note: if you are a Hardcore mode player, there are only FOUR(4) HC modes, TDM, S&D, FFA, and CTF. This is very disappointing to me, especially after David Vonderhaar said that they will place a bigger emphasis on HC modes than any other CoD. To give FOUR modes is a freakin joke. You still can tube in HC though it does seem like tubes have been nerfed dramatically from MW3 or maybe it's just inconsistent like bullets. Being that the game is so inconsistent, it is hard to like the game. It is very frustrating to play and would not recommend this game for it's multiplayer content. As for the campaign mode, I don't know, I played 20 minutes of it and it did not interest me much. I don't think it's enough to know if it's good or bad. I was one to hope and pray this CoD was better than the one before, but sadly it's just another CoD.

I guess they didn't learn their lesson from MW3. I agree with just about everyone on this review board. I find this game to be fairly easy in multiplayer, but the bad out weighs the good. The new perk system is nothing special. Personally I don't like the gun selection. Spawns are HORRIBLE!!; it seems like in every game it stops during the middle of a match ' Migrating Hosts'. There is a ton of lag and most of the time my signal is all the way up. Quickscoping is so screwed up, im sorry but if you buy this game just to run around with a sniper rifle you're a loser. I can keep going on and on. I haven't got into the campaign yet. Zombies are okay I guess; it's different from the other black ops zombies, but zombies is not as spectacular as they were making it out to be. I mean come on, all that hype for zombies and they give us this????? I hope this fix this game. If they don't then people are better off saving their money and buying the first Black Ops because there is not much difference, or you can buy Halo 4 which is what im probably going to do.

This is the best cod. It just hard cuz it takes more skill to be good at it. So stop complaining. They took out all the stuff that makes people mad in the other cods like finial stand and pain killer and death Streaks. Good job on the the game treyarch!

Great shooter all around. Campaign is a must play. If you have played previous Call of Duty games multiplayer is as fun as any other Call of Duty game. Zombies is also a plus. I play a lot of sports games but this is a must have in your game library.

I bought every single COD game since COD 4. This is by far the worst one out of all of them so far. This will be the last COD game i buy from Trearch for sure. I can get 10 hit markers on a person when all i see is their head, but they can shoot me once and I die, from a gut shot.

The game looks spectacular, sounds amazing and HAD the potential to be the best COD yet. But Treyarch dropped the ball. Their horrible lag compensation makes the multiplayer darn near impossible to play. Their 'new' (see:Terrible) spawn system makes it worse. People buy COD game because of the multiplayer, but stick with MW3 or go buy Halo 4. Treyarch has made no attempt to fix it, nor will they. I'd go on, but it doesn't matter. You're going to buy your kid this game anyway because it is a Call of Duty and Activision/Treyarch will continue to make billions on garbage like this.

I was really looking forward to this game, but there have been no improvements from the first Black Ops. Modern Warfare 3 has a lot better graphics. Also, the game keeps having server issues (in multiplayer) which is frustrating when you are in the middle of a match. They do not have a dedicated server-not that they did for the first one, but still... I see no improvements. Think I'll just play Halo 4...
its the same thing. Just a different skin. Multiplayer is just horrible.
The game is extremely weak, repetitive. The campaign is awful, the multiplayer is boring, every year a Call of Duty game is release and every year it's basically the same thing: tedious and awful.

We enjoyed Call of Duty: Black Ops so much we had to get Black Ops II. My grandsons are experts at these games, I merely a novice but with this Black Ops II I'm showing improvement. If you like the usual soldiers in Call of Duty, you have to have this version. The weapons, graphics, and missions are superior to all others before. The mission just keep getting more and more intense. Get over to best Buy for Black Ops II then be sure to check for Call of Duty Black Ops Ghost.

OK, first of all this review is OBVIOUSLY entirely my humble HONEST opinion, you can take it with a grain of salt for all I care but, I just wanted to put my two cents in. Also this is coming from an adult gamer and not some screaming 12 year old fanboy. I have every previous COD game going back to the PS2 including the original COD and all the Modern Warfare games etc...and this is one of the more stellar editions in the series. One of the things that stands out most in my mind is the map design. The campaign is one of the most riveting stories of any other COD game to date, albeit you need to follow it very carefully because of the many twists and turns through out the game. It was awesome having the choices you made through out the main story affect the ending to this game, I wont say any more so as to not spoil it for others. Now on to the multiplayer, in my opinion this game has some of the best multiplayer maps of the whole COD/MW series. I really like the variation in elevation in some of the outdoor maps. The new perk system is also refreshing as well, combat training made a return a feature I loved in Black Ops (I get to play MP with my kids without actually being online). . Overall I am very pleased and somewhat surprised at how well this game turned out.
This is a great game. Even for beginners. Great storyline.

I'm a fan of the Call of Duty Franchise, and usually find myself pre-ordering COD games. Campaign: Activision did a great job with with campaign mode-You can customize a class before each mission, choosing primary and secondary weapons, lethal and tactical equipment (semtex, flashbang, combat axe, etc.) and basic perks. The choices you make during the campaign; missions you complete successfully or fail; will change the storyline dramatically, which gives the game great replay value. The storyline switches between The Cold War (late '80s) and The Second Cold War, which takes place in the future (2025). This gives the game a great dynamic, allowing you to use guns and equipment available during the '80s and 2025 as well. Multiplayer: Multiplayer is well balanced in this installment of the COD franchise. Players are able to build a custom class with two weapons per class, perks, and equipment. Each class is limited to 10 items per class, i.e., you can equip 1 primary weapon with 2 attachments, 1 secondary weapon with 1 attachment, 3 perks, 1 lethal grenade, and 1 tactical grenade. Black Ops 2 brings a new twist to the multiplayer mode with 'Wildcards'. Three Wildcards can be equipped per class (each taking up 1 space out of the 10 slots given). Wildcards can allow you to equip a fourth perk, an additional lethal grenade, or a primary weapon as your second gun. Guns, equipment, and perks are unlocked with 'tokens' given per level up. Black Ops 2 also offers 'League Play' games, which give you access to all guns, equipment, and attachments from the get-go. League Play has limited game modes, but I find this much more enjoyable than Public Games. Some equipment is limited in League Play matches, such as under-barrel grenade launchers-so you don't have 'Noob Tubers' running around throughout the levels randomly blowing you up, which some might consider aggravating. One thing about the multiplayer experience in Black Ops 2 that I have the displeasure of experiencing twice is a major bug that Activision has yet to fix. If you play online, you should try to avoid playing local matches. Playing a local match can (and most probably will) corrupt your online multiplayer data, which will reset your classes, tokens, player card unlocks, and reset your prestige. Activision does fix this issue if you submit an online form with your information-they say it should take 24 hours, but both times I've faced this issue, I received support after a week. There is one way to avoid this issue-Stay away from playing local matches on your gamertag/xbox. Overall, Black Ops 2 is a great game. Campaign mode has a great replay value, and completing challenges during campaign mode does lead to equipment unlocks to use in the campaign. I find myself playing multiplayer on Xbox Live with friends, so the persistent glitch of classes and player data being reset is a pain in the butt. Zombies mode can be fun, but it is a game mode I don't spend much time playing. I would recommend this game to friends, just with the advice that they should steer clear of local games until Activision does something about the player data reset glitch.

I have been buying COD since Modern Warfare (#4). I do not like the futuristic feel to this game. This game is difficult to play. Kill times are very fast and the maps are too small. There is a lot of head-camping style gameplay from players online, people are either cheap like that or the maps encourage it. I preferred the original Black Ops, MW2, and MW3. The zombies game is just ok. Prefer der riese and kino der toten. The most positive aspect to the game is the campaign. It feels like you're in a movie and the fly suits are awesome.

Overall the game is solid. If your into the single player mode you'll love it. Multiplayer is also good. Server lags more than Modern Warfare though. The maps are awesome, but there's so much to them that there are a lot of 'campers' hiding in all the balconies and corners. Beware. The audio in this game is amazing. Graphics are sweet too.

All the hype, searching up gameplay and rumors everyday to be let down the way I did.. Im a hardcore CoD fan, cod was my first online game (besides Halo on PC) and was the game just a disappointment. If you plan on getting this for a kid 13 & Under go ahead they would love it, but if you want a great game and a fun online experience Do Not Buy THIS! If you own it Trade it in ASAP while it still has Value!

So disappointed. Could hardly wait to play it. Put it in and was out before I finished the first level. All of them were great and thought it would be the best yet and it was the opposite. If you like halo and that type then you might like it. Did play onlne for a half a match and it was ok but it was like they tried to copy battlefield 3 online play. If I could get all my money back then I wouldn't still have it.

This game is a terrible multiplayer, first off it is all based on the internet connection you have; a three round burst gun is like a shotgun from far away if you are host and have the best connection. SMG's are unstoppable especially around all the close cornered maps the creators had to make this year. Snipers are unbeatable they can be used from far away and don't even have to hit you to get the kill just come close around you and can quick scope up close for a one shot kill. For as much as this game wants to be like real warfare I'd like to see someone running around with a sniper and having the advantage in close combat. The shock tactical with the bouncing betty is an automatic kill. Let's see what else is unrealistic? Well personally I like to run around in video games and not stay behind cover looking down my scope waiting for someone to walk thru it but apparently with our 'perks' we have the ability to see devices thru walls yet don't have the ability to run for 15 seconds without taking a breather. All I have to say is good luck having fun playing this game especially once you finally have a good game and you get booted because the poor connection!
My son is enjoying the challenge of the game! Gland I was able to get it during the curbside pick-up, it was fast and easy!

(I re-bought this after trading my original copy in when my Xbox 360 failed many years ago). I loved the singleplayer campaign featuring memorable characters and an interesting take on what to expect five years from today (and, so far, was the only game in the series where you could make choices that impact the ending). I also loved the introduction of the 'Pick any 10' create-a-class system bringing a fresh take to multiplayer, scorestreaks (which award you for playing the objective instead of just getting kills online) and the return of zombies mode. So happy this is backwards-compatible on Xbox One, definitely worth picking up if you missed it up to now.

This was the first COD game I played since the `original. I gave into the hype since a buddy of mine raves about it. I'm sad that i did. 1. Multiplayer: I only played team death match. it was my first time seeing the in game graphics...WOW! Very underwhelming! I couldnt belie ve in the age we're in that a game would come out with graphics like this. I digress... i only played the one mode and i lost interest immediately. I just didnt get the point. 2. And while its cool to see famous actors faces rendered in addition to them lending their voices, it took me out of the game. I kept seeing Merle Dixon and Candyman! I'll preface this by saying I only play online so single game player is not applicable. The multiplayer is horrible. I am already on my 3rd prestige and if it wasnt for my friends i would have stopped playing this game. It takes 2-3 bullets on the head to get a headshot and about 4-5 on the body to expire them. However, there are some people that get a headshot with just one bullet and a body with 2 bullets. It happens to me from time to time as well but not everytime. And also i have gotten expired where he is shooting on my abs and he gets a headshot while im shooting on his head and dont get a headshot lmao. I watch every replay when i get expired and let me tell you 6/10 times i get expired is bologny. They need to fix that TODAY!. And also the respawning is ALL OVER THE PLACE!!!. I get 20 kill streak and all of a sudden somebody respawns right next to me and takes me out. On top of all that, these perks dont keep you safe from the radar at all. AND ARE YOU KIDDING ME 'INNAPROPRIATE LANGUAGE?' I HAD TO REVISE ALMOST ALL MY WORDS JUST BECAUSE IT WOULDNT LET ME SUBMIT WITH THE INAPPROPRIATE WORDS LMAO. WAY TO FUNNY

I was excited to get this game since I have enjoyed every other COD game. But Treyarch absolutely ruined this game. The multiplayer experience ruins everything. The server is constantly going down and booting you from games. Then it won't let you join back. I know their servers may be having issues with the amount of people playing, but come on, this is not their first time around the block. They should have done a better job predicting what the server load would be. When the servers are working, the connection is terrible. Whoever is the host has the best connection and is untouchable. You put 10 bullets into his body and he turns around and shoots once and kills you. The spawns also completely jacked up. You are constantly getting shot in the back no matter where you are in the map. Someone will kill you and you will respawn either right behind them or right in front of them, just to get killed all over again. The graphics are worse than MW3, and they have more of a cartoonish feel about them. Not nearly as realistic either. I already know about a dozen people who have returned the game for Halo 4. Unless Treyarch comes out with some radical patches to the system, it is a complete waste of time and money, and will only frustrate you to no end.

Been an avid FPS for over a decade. Started with Delta Force and Joint Ops on PC. Anyway, I own all the COD games as well as the Battlefield games. This will be my last COD purchase. After so many issues in the past, you'd think they would fix them in new games right? Like the spawn issues in multiplayer. How can you spawn someone in front of multiple bad guys and don't even give spawn protection for a few seconds? Why does it sometimes take 2 shots from a snipers rifle to kill, but a single shotgun blast from 2 blacks away always kills? Why, oh why did you get rid of Vote Kicking players? Now a single person can ruin game after game cause they are young, dumb, racists, immature, whatever and the only option is for me to leave. If the server is sick of they idiot, why not be able to boot them? Same goes for rage quitters. If someone quits during a match and they are the host (you never know who is hosting BTW), everything freezes while it sets up another host. Ok, np. But many times there is an issue so if kicks everyone out and you lose the points you'd worked on. They got lazy with this one, one crate you can climb, but the SAME crate in a different area, you can't. And it happens a lot. It can be fun, but very frustrating. It feels rushed and unfinished. My biggest issues is the small maps which only helps make bad spawn creations worse

Learn the maps quick and expect to play against people who still camp and use shotguns because of their lack of skills. One last good thing though is that you can add 3 attachments to weapons and their are some new kill streaks.

Some will say that it sucks because it is the same game being recycled every year, with the same run and gun gameplay, and there is truth to that. However, I actually enjoy the COD type of gameplay, however, this game just sucks for many other reasons. It is the only COD since COD4 that I absolutely hate. I love the COD franchise, and am a avid player. However, Black Ops 2 left me very disappointed. I was beyond hyped and excited to play this all winter long, but I hate to admit the game is really a step in the wrong direction. The guns sound like plastic toys, and the graphics look very cartoonist and are a step backwards...again. The servers are terrible right now, but that should change over time. About 40% of the games 'Lose connection to Host' because people keep rage quitting (not to mention the fairly common 'servers are currently down' message...but again this should change hopefully for those who decide to keep the game). Overall the graphics are bad, and lack the 'crisp' look of such titles as Modern Warfare 2. Even the first Black Ops looked better (in my humble opinion). Zombies, quite possibly what I was excited about the most is SUCH a BIG letdown! They tried to make it better....and I salute them for it but seriously they totally ruined it with what they did. I really hope that this is not the direction the game is headed, or the future will indeed be black for the franchise. Also if you do decide to get it, which I recommend you save your hard earned money, they want you to pay an extra $50-60 for bonus maps. P.S. Gameplay feels very slow, blehh.

Against ever instinct in my body I bought Black Ops II on its release date. I typically like the production company that creates the Modern Warfare games, but Black Ops has its little niche in the market with Combat Training. So let me first start by saying if you are a hardcore, online rank player, this review is not for you. Although Black Ops II has come leaps and bounds with its own online services, the true rank battles will and still remain in the MMW series. Having said that, BOII is great for the recreational gamer looking to get a taste for online, but still not looking to get lit up the second they spawn by someone who eats, drinks and breathes COD online matches. Which brings me to Combat training.... Combat training was introduced in BOI, allowing an invidual or a party to fight against, or alongside bots online. The greatness of being able to deploy a killstreak (now scorestreaks) in a match without the frustration of ranked players pummeling you, made Black Ops very appealing to the recreational gamer. However, if you found this gaming exciting, the lack of game modes, challenges, etc became very apparent in BOI. Increase the difficult and the AI was not 'smarter' just cheap (aka shooting at you before they even see you, or your bullets do little to no damage). The killstreaks were easy to get, but the AI would go Rambo once a care package hit the map. If dominating a map, sometimes the max care packages were only 3 per match (3 for each life, so if you're too good to die....) Little things that made BOI Combat Training pretty stale after awhile. Introduce BOII Combat training. It's like they went into every recreational gamers mind and improved the gameplay. Now all game modes are available on Combat Training, plus a non-party online option which is great for unranked matches. Killstreaks (scorestreaks) are infinitie as they have moved to the Modern Warfare point system. The care packages are now instantaneous, meaning your sentry gun is no longer going to be stolen by the fore-mentioned 'Rambo' bots. The maps are fun and nuketown returns. The AI is more intelligent, but not frustrating. Overall a great experience. There are only a few minor annoyances, (bots can't climb fhrough windows without awkward movements) etc. The gun fire rate and accuracy has been improved, but still not as smoothe as MW3. The player perks require limited space, so you have to compromise your online advantages here and there. The campaign is a lot better than the 'what the heck is going on' plot of BO!, and yes, zombies have returned. All in all, worth the $60 spot, but careful if you are a hardcore gamer.... but you all ready know that if you are.

Note that my review is only for the multiplayer section and online play. In terms of the continuing multiplayer franchise, Black Ops II is the most balanced online multiplayer to date, with good maps, a variety of gametypes and a balanced weapon sandbox. Key playlists are always populated. Perks are not as overpowering as in previous Call of Duty titles. The weapon balance is very good, with very few weapons that are considered overpowered. Proper balance changes have been implemented to correct weapon issues. The DLC released so far has been well executed, with maps that both play well and look stunning. The first DLC even introduced a new weapon.

I usually play this on PC so the ability to do cloud saves between Steam and Switch is a no brainer purchase for me.

I'm so happy that Limited Run could bring us this fantastic game in a physical version. I've sunk many hours into Divinity on the PS4 and am now very glad to be able to own this on the Switch, where I can take it on the go. I'm not a big fan of buying digital games if I can avoid it, so being able to get this game on an actual cartridge has been a delight.

Great story telling so far after ten hours. Every character is interesting. World is absolutely filled with lore. And every bit of humor is executed well. Love the game so far. And Limited Run do packaging well. ACTUAL BOOKLET with tons of information about the game to read. Great artwork.

This is a fantastic game and if you plan on playing it in handheld on the ORIGINAL Switch then this game is for you (5 stars). It is beautiful and plays amazing but only in handheld. It does not play well on the Switch Lite because you cannot see everything and you will miss enemies and the poison looks exactly like the grass and it's difficult to see the text. I bought it to play on the Switch Lite and it was a frustrating experience. I also have the original Switch so I tried it on the TV and the graphics are terrible and hard on the eyes and then I tried it in handheld mode and it was amazing and the graphics are so much better but like I said before, I bought it to play not the Switch Lite so I'm only giving it 3 stars. I recommend buying it on the Xbox or Playstation.

You can't go wrong with Digimon games. I got this game for a Christmas present for my son. He will love it!! I have pre-ordered all his games for Christmas, its so nice. I have my date when it will arrive, so easy, I love it!! Best Buy is great!!

So I've been playing cyber sleuth since release date and well this game starts off slow. You're basically just doing cases and some are needed to continue with the story. Things don't start getting interesting until chapter 10. Also there's a lot of dialogue! So you'll be pressing that A/B button a whole lot. If this is your first digimon game I would suggest doing some research when it comes to digivolving your fave digimon to a mega, how to train their needed stats, getting money and exp. Finally play CS first as HM can spoil the first game.

This is a remake of an older game that never came to the USA until now. SquareEnix has released a demo for PS4 and Nintendo Switch. Give the demo a try if you are not sure about buying this game. The game costs 50 dollars at Best Buy. I'm a little over half way through this game at about 15 hours and really enjoying it. The battle system is very good. The graphics are good and the audio is good as well. The only thing that is off is the voice acting... it is bad. But I,m getting used to it. There is an option for Japanese vocals with English subtitles. I recommend this to any RPG fan.

*spoilers ahead* This game has many positives. Nice visual upgrades. All the three dimensional settings are very accurate per memory of the original SFC game and emulations/repros played. There is actual jumping over terrain and jumping down from ledges. Now with 12 save slots instead of the original 3 slots. This version has actual Treasure Chest discovery/hunting. Back up inventory management is improved. Leveling seems to be easier in this remade version for faster playthroughs. The tiered seeds and seed growing system is improved making it useful and advantageous to use it frequently earlier on. Improved variety and accessibility of accessory equipment. The addition of Lilcactus has actual rewards, not just a poem happy sprite like in another old Mana remake. This version does have a handholding method via golden stars depicting the modern go here next which is welcome considering how obscure the original seiken densetsu 3 was on who how what and where for story progression, even with an English translation. It is nice to have optional dialogue with secondary characters while in town limits. And the elemental names are Sylphid and Salamando again... small yay. Also on the positive side, the vibration feature can be turned off. On the fence as to whether I like the new enemy loot drop system versus the old random treasure carousel method; the booby traps and chance at mimics based on Luck stat was part of the appeal. On the fence about post game chapter and new ascended job classes, but the unlockable new game plus is kind of neat. On the fence about the option to reset job classes; that was part of the replay value originally. And now the bad... Actual load times are a minor inconvenience. Changing back and forth from day to night is reminiscent of what a horrible night for a curse. The colored jars added for various recovery types may be a bit too much handholding. The ring menu doesnt seem as effective as it once was. Takes far longer to charge class attack meter. Much of the voice acting gets old/annoying quickly; remember reading dialogue in role playing games... or does anyone remember reading at all anymore? However, all added cinematic scenes and dialogue are skippable, both an advantage and a disadvantage. An advantage if repeating a scene or just trying to avoid listening to the nails on a chalkboard that a few characters have for voices *cough* Charlotte, Niccolo, vampire guy. A huge disadvantage if you bump a button by accident. Also, the game settings allow for voice sound level to be adjusted independently from music and sound effects to compensate. Not too thrilled about the repeatable error that closed my game each time I finished off the Black Rabite. I genuinely recommend this Trials of Mana remake to other players. Overall, this is a great remake, too bad this team didnt work on another remake released this year of a 1997 classic game.

I love the way this game combines old school writing and overall pacing and play with updated graphics. I really wish FF7 would have taken this general approach. Just a face lift to the graphics folks, not a completely new game. They struck a nice balance here making the game fun, looks great, good customization to keep things different and interesting. Awesome game, I hope Square Enix uses this blueprint for other remakes (doing FF7 in a true to the original form, ff8, ff9, or any of the first 9 final fantasy games!)

I have every Mana game ever made, I am so glad to play this 3D remake of a game I have been playing for 20years. I have the import for it on my SNES, and the English release on switch. No I have the English remake.

If you like Dragon Quest iX then you will like this version. It has the same control type function with some changes but plays like DQ. So if you like DQ then you will definitely like this one but if you get motion sickness because this game you can swing 360 when gaming so be ready for motion sickness if you haven't experience this before.
It was a day late. Other then that everything was ok

This game has the most wrestlers ever. The engine is the same as all the other 2k games. It's still hard to get out of submissions and pins. Counters are still hard. Button mashing would work better. If this game had the no mercy or smackdown ps1 engine, it would be the best game ever. Its still a good game.
This is a fun game. Definitely an improvement over the previous version and it was even better that I got it for $5.
haven't played wwe 2k in a few years. Tried 2k20 and it was awful, heard 2k19 was better and definitely a much better game. Ive been enjoying it and for $10 you really can't beat it.

Got this for my sons 7th birthday and he cant stop playing it!
Great game. Lineup is awesome with the classic guys. Nice graphics.
This game is super awesome. Best Buy is the best company

This game is so much fun. You can play this for hours without getting bored. I have a little Cousin who now knows all the names of all the old and new age wrestlers. I find it absolutely hillarious how a 5 year old kid is absolutely fascinated by Hollywood Hulk and ultimo dragon. Haha

Controls are complicated to learn, and timing is difficult. Trying to play with my 7 year old and we just get frustrated. I play Call of Duty, Rocket League, Destiny and several other games with no issues. Maybe we just need more practice? We do like downloading superheroes, villains, and playing. My son loves that part.
Last year's 2k game 2k18 wasn't short of it's problems, not to mention Nintendo's verison had some major cuts. But if your a fan good news. 2k19 brings back all the good stuff of online play.
I will never buy a 2k wrestling game again its not fun they try to make things too real and it takes the fun out of it I miss THQ smackdown games
The graphics are good and there is a wide variety of old school and new wrestlers. My only critique is that the moves are hard to do, or maybe its because I haven't played wrestling games often...
Happy to add this to my collection. Was so stoked to see the physical version. Highly recommend getting this

This is a very great package with 3 games and 2 movies. The movies are good, Assassin creed 2 is amazing worth buying this for that game alone. Assassin creed brotherhood is good as well although I dont believe it's as good as 2. I didnt like Revelations that much although it still has it's own charm.

I played all 3 games on PS3 and loved them ALL. If you have never played the series and even if you did, this is the series to get. This is what made me continue to purchase the AC games year after year hoping they could be as good as this series. They never lived up to the hype of Ezio Auditore. Must BUY!!!
I know the game is old, I also didnt need the cashier to tell me that the game sucks and that the store offered better games. I personally like the game, hence why I purchased it.

First, if you've played and loved these games, this is a great package. If you've never played them and have just played newer Assassin's Creed titles, they'll feel just a bit antiquated. Nothing is new to the games, but the throwaway multiplayer from Revelations have been removed. Now, regarding the visuals, these games are barely remasters. Rather, they're virtually the same as their last generation iterations with improved resolution (they run in 1080p), and improved textures. Draw distances might also be improved a bit, but not enough to cover up pop-in objects at the new resolution. The game also, for whatever reason, runs at a disappointing 30fps rather than an improved 60fps. Ultimately these games feel like a slightly sharper way to play the same titles from PS3 and 360 rather than a detailed remaster. But they were great fun 5-7 years ago, and they're just as fun today.
For any AC fans this game is an absolute no brainer purchase. The Ezio story was the best in the series, and for them to release it again after upgrading the graphics? Yes please!
This games are what made AC series great. Must buy
So addictive. The plot is great and the characters too.
This is amazing because it collects all of the Enzio Assassin's Creed versions of the game
So glad that they released these games again on PS4. Some of my favorite AC games and I am glad I get to play them again.
Love the game! Best one by far! So awesome you should buy
Not the very best games in the series, but for all three timelines & for the price... highly recommend. A lot of long nights in high school playing these games.
play this videogame is like playing last consoles but with better resolution. if you are an ac fan you must have this game in your collection.

I bought this for my wife. Yes you read that correctly, my wife. She loves it. She is a big Assassin's Creed fan and I thought this would be perfect for her. I was right, no sleeping on the couch for this guy!

I've had a lot of fun going back and revisiting the Ezio story. He is, by far, my favorite character from the franchise. The only things that I really noted that were a bit of an irritant are the new(er) character designs. It's not uncommon for the characters to glitch and all you see is the eyes and mouth. It is also a bit strange to see some of the characters with very weird looking faces. Also, and this may just me, it feels like the controls didn't transfer well to the PS4. I, at times, have troubles controlling Ezio. Again, that may just me. Overall I'm glad I spent on the money.
Assassin's Creed is one of the greatest series of games that has been released unto the world. I'm glad to own this game..

A fairly good graphical update of the PS3 versions, with a few noticeable glitches early on in AC2 that seemed to level out as the game progressed (in particular, if a speaking character was standing in front of a light source the light would shine through their face). Otherwise it's solid. The game still has all the fun control problems you're used to on these old AC games (No, I do not want to jump backwards. Jump right!), but that's to be expected. If you already own the old PS3 versions I'm not sure there's a compelling reason to upgrade, unless you just prefer a PS4 controller or want to condense your bookcase and unload three games to replace with one. But if you don't own them yet, this is the one to get.
I always played this game on my PS3 and now it's on the PS4. It's flawless it's awesome to play as the greatest Assassins Ezio on the PS4. Great game and awesome story and legendary assassin.

When I first played Assassin's Creed 1, I fell in love with the game. I knew there was something unique and special about it. If you take advantage of everything the games have to offer, such as side missions, you easily have over 60 hours of gameplay for one low price. I highly recommend this title.

Assassins Creed: The Ezio Collection does a wonderful job of reminding me how great the three-game arc of Ezio Auditore's life story was on Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3, while also reminding me just how much the series has evolved and improved over the past seven years. But while the frame rate and load times in the Xbox One and PS4 compilation are a big improvement over last-gens original games, there are some baffling lighting and texture degradations throughout the trilogy.
