Here's my point: you can buy crafting/experience/other boosters for your character; you can temporarily advance faster with those. You can buy cosmetic items (which I have never done) like clothes or pets, none of which affect gameplay.or, you can buy extra bag slots, extra character slots, and treasure chest keys. It's also possible to unlock the full version of the game, which gives you some one-time bonuses, special items, and access to a summon skill that will soon be overshadowed. Finally, you can buy gold by exchanging your real-world investment for in-game currency. This literally allows you to buy the best equipment in the game. Now, I appreciate te idea that a free-to-play game needs a means of making money from players who have already made the initial investment; I would ask youself what is really incentive enough;I'm glad the company resisted directly selling special equipment. Or am I? I mean, there's something that undermines gameplay when anything special about your character is purchased; the most disposable income wins. However, the alternative left me hungry for some incentive to having purchased the card. That hunger was partly satisfied. I unlocked the special edition, bought an extra character slot, an extra bag slot, and that was about it ( I got one of these for the holidays as well, in case you're noting that the price doesn't match). Was it worth it? I've never usd the extra character slot--yet. Sure, I made a bunch of characters just to say I did, but I really only play 3 characters. The bag slot is great. Bags are expensive, in-game. This slot was the perfect solution for me. The extras are ok for the game, but you have to care how your character looks, how fast you level, or level your crafting. I once bought a key to one of the 30 black lion chests I had, but really, you're playing the lottery with that. In conclusion, unless you can specifically identify what is of value to you in the game that you cannot achieve by other means, you will be disappointed that you did this. Keep in mind you are getting digital items in exchange for real money. Value, in that case, is in the eye of the beholder. Recommended with reservations.

Since there are so many rave reviews of what this game has to offer by itself, Ill be focusing more so on the external package. For its price, I have to say that this physical release of the beloved indie game is a little on the costly side for what it has to offer. Plain and simple, this version basically is just a game cartridge in a case complete with a small art book instead of the usual manual you might expect from these kind of releases. However, while some might see this as a charming offer, the game is admittedly available for only $10 on most digital storefronts so the added $20-$25 is probably the most questionable part of this whole deal. While the game is amazing, its honestly up to you if you see this release as worth it for the price its at.

Undertale stands out to me as the first indie game I ever went out of my way to buy. I initially bought it digitally via its original Steam release and fell in love with it to the point that I bought the Collector's Editions on PS4 and PS Vita. That would make this the 4th time I've purchased this game and have no regrets in doing so. The story isn't grand in scale, instead being a more personal tale with far reaching implications but if you're a frequent player of RPG's wherein the climax revolves around saving the universe as we know it then this is a breath of fresh air. Gameplay consists of turn-based combat like RPG's of yesteryear but the twist is that in battles you are given the option of decimating opponents like in most other games of this nature or of diffusing the situation without violence. If you choose the former, you must time your button presses to do the most damage but if you choose the latter you scroll through a small list of (often humorous) actions that will resolve the tension. When the enemy's turn comes, you're tasked with avoiding their attacks in a way that resembles old school arcade shoot-em-upsmeaning that you have to dodge every projectile that comes your way. This small twist on combat made gameplay all the more engaging. The cast of characters are easily some of the most colorful in recent yearseach having distinct personalities that you will gravitate to. This is aided by spectacular writing that never ceases to entertain. Much of the dialogue is not only witty or humorous but it also plays on your expectations in such a way that it's always one step ahead of you. As a broad example, if you decide to go through a second playthrough there are many moments in which you may decide to approach certain scenarios differently in such a way that you think you're outsmarting the game... only for you to find out that an alternate dialogue conversation plays out and (by extension) it lets you know that it expected you to think you were going to outsmart it. Brilliant. The game is admittedly a bit short, but the experience is so memorable that it never feels that way. Graphically, it doesn't look like anything that AAA developers would put out but it has a unique art style that evokes the feeling that this was a passion project that was painstakingly put together. Lastly, the music is undeniably incredible. As someone who plays a lot of RPG's I can say that this is easily the best soundtrack I've heard since Final Fantasy VII was released way back in 1997. It blends many styles together and uses many different sound fonts to great effect. The end result is music that is infectious even at its most daunting moments and emotionally resonant whenever it needs to be. Seriously, this game is worth it for the soundtrack alone. If you have the funds to buy the soundtrack CD it comes highly recommended. Overall: 10/10
Absolute masterpiece, everyone should experience this. Game feels extremely simple but like an onion, it has tons and tons of layers to dig through. Game music is probably the best I've ever heard!

This was a gift for my son. He has wanted this game for quite some time, and when it came out for Switch, I bought it for him. Gameplay is straightforward. The characters are interesting, the plot is a bit dark, but it does give you a chance to play the game as a pacifist to some extent. It is interesting to see how the choices made affect the gameplay. The quality is old fashioned (think 8 bit retro graphics), but it is still rather fun to play. The music is fantastic. Depending on the choices made throughout the game, the level of difficulty can be low or high. It is quite challenging for my children. Overall, it is a fun game and the price is right. It may be a bit scary for some children, even with a rating of everyone 10+, but my 7 year old loves it.

I really like the characters, music and different play-style of this game. The bullethell is fun to maneuver and the varying enemies make it interesting. And Undertale being on Switch now just makes it easier to play on the go. Once you beat the game once or twice there's admittedly not a lot different to do, but it's still a fun play all the same. Replay-ability is just minimal.

At a glance, Undertale appears to be a throwback to 16-bit RPG classics like Earthbound. It is, but it's so much more. It's has a basic RPG backbone, but it's also a hybrid rhythm and shmup game if that makes any sense. For those of you that require a physical copy of the game, this is the way to go. If not, it's cheaper on the eShop. In either case, you owe it to yourself to try out this game.

Very charming and funny game seriously the humor is great. Graphics are kind of ugly, but I think that is part of the game and is intentionally done. Its not a looker, but it is a fun enjoyable experience. Also very cool that you can go through the whole game without killing anything! Thats what I'm doing and I'm just about on the final boss, so while tough, its possible and it affects the outcome of the story! Or so I'm told.

Undertale is an enjoyable RPG essentially developed by one person. The game borrows a number of elements from the SNES game Earthbound. The story of Undertale is fun, and you're expected to play through the game multiple times to find all of the endings. The art and game's soundtrack is excellent, and the six hour story is well-worth your time to play.
love this game. graphics are 16 bit so make sure you like that style first.
If you're thinking about buying this, just do it. It's nice to have a physical copy of this.
Fun pixelated game. Has a retro feel but plays and has a modern feel. Lots of fun, loving it so far!
Great game for those who love rpg and characters involved
My daughter loves playing this game. I have not played it, but gives serious amount of entertainment.
Lots of reading materials but my grandson likes the game
But the kids do! And looking into the subject matter, I approve. Makes a great gift - recipient aged 12

My son was very excited to receive this game as a gift! The price made this a happy Mommy because it was only $30 compared to all the other games which usually cost roughly $60...Just opened the game today but have not had any issues
its ok but not the best game kinda hard to figure out

Undertale uses traditional dungeon crawler, and top down shooting gameplay methods coupled with a unique amount of control over how you tackle battles to create a most memorable gaming moment. With options such as pacifism being a valid way to best Toby Fox's creation, you never know where your choices will lead you!

Undertale is a good and unique game, although not without its flaws. The game play, writing and art are a weird yet mostly successful mix of comedic self-parody and earnestness. The core fighting mechanic involves controlling a little heart, dodging obstacles to avoid damage. To engage with the enemy, you can choose either to fight or to interact and talk. It's unique, fun, and the game constantly riffs on the concept. There are a handful of puzzles. They are okay but not inspired. The writing is full of jokes, meta-humor, and absurdism, and there are a cast of memorable characters. I enjoyed this side of the game a lot. I found the story mixed, though. The broad strokes of an underground realm of monsters is good, but it's overly complex and confusing, partially due to a reliance on exposition dumps, and there are about twenty endings, which rob the game of its narrative momentum about halfway through and start to grate. I wasn't very emotionally engaged. The art is very basic, largely in the spirit of self-parody, but about half of the character designs are actually really strong, and there are some pretty environments. However, the other half is pretty bad. Some of the in-world character designs are not even intelligible, and there's an absence of animation which, while joked at, seems lazy. The music is unreservedly excellent. Overall, if just due to its sheer oddity, I have to recommend playing this.
Already but a couple hours into this game. Multiple endings. Great game.

Just give it a few in-game hours before judging it by it is graphics, this game is amazing, the music is unique, the story will break you. I am pretty sure that this game is going to be a great addition to your collection, it is currently hard to find in other retailers.
The amount of choice in what you can do in this game is amazing. This game is one of a kind

Maybe the most original RPG to come along in a long time! Don't let the graphics fool you: the game is much deeper than what we used to have back in the 80s and 90s. Highly recommended for anyone who wants a unique game!
Undertake is a very interesting addition to the Nintendo Switch. It is a great hidden gem. I love the gameplay and theme.

If you're here, you know the deal: Undertale, that game we all played (or wanted to play) four years ago is finally on a Nintendo system. There's some neat goodies included with the physical version, but if you've already dedicated 2+ playthroughs on other platforms that's the only new thing waiting in this port. Still a must own for me, ymmv.
My kids received this game as a Christmas present and they love it.

The game kind of throws you in without much explanation of gameplay mechanics. There are 3 paths to victory: pacifist, neutral, and the path of violence (I forget the specific term used). For the pacifist ending, you must not kill a single enemy throughout the entire game. You have to either flee or talk to the enemies and listen to their feelings and get them to leave or give up. You earn no experience (called love) for this and just a little bit of money. So for the pacifist ending, you will finish on level 1. The game tries to urge you along this path without ever really letting you know that if you kill a single enemy that you change the ending. The pacifist ending seems to be the preferred path the first playthrough of the game. The neutral ending means you kill some monsters and let some live/go. The path of violence is the one where you kill every monster in every fight and let none flee and you never run, this is probably the most difficult path. The game itself is bizarre and fascinating and I've only dropped it a star for the lack of explaining the finer points explained above.
Great old school style RPG. I dig the music and the comedy. It is difficult at this times though.

I'm still mad no one told me that I could save the goat mom in the beginning by just hitting Spare 24 times I just figured 'well, i guess i gotta just hit her until she's at low health' and then yeet. I haven't beat it yet but I'm having fun so far.
Great game and so happy they ported it to the switch.
This is a great and funny RPG game. Perfect for Switch
Very fun game that mixes up the usual formula of a rpg.
Fun game, love that they made a physical copy for collectors.
This is one of the best games that has been released in recent memory. Please pick-up this game and learn how to empathize with others. Our society counts on it!

The replay value is found trying different ways of completing the game one way is to try and avoid killing anyone. You have to play through the game a few times to see a few of the very different way things change depending on what happens during the game.
Undertake is definitely a gem and a must play for the Switch! Perfect for the platform and a very fun story to go through! Depending on what you do, you wont end up having a bad time!
GREAT GAME TO ADD TO MY COLLECTION OF SEALED SWITCH GAMES

I purchased this game for my daughter and it just left me feeling like I was back in the 80's with the scrolling screens and the juvenile characters. I for one didn't like it however, she apparently thought it was all the rage and had her friends play also. To each his own, but no, I didn't like the forced screenplay then and I didn't like it now.
I played every day forget about homework, I need.!
I can see why this game gets the praise that it does. It was all made by one person! Having completed it with a passive play through, it was something that I didn't really enjoy.
With a captivating and funny narrative, addicting gameplay and some truly novel ideas, Undertake shows just how awesome and superior indi projects have the potential to be.
I don't know to much about this game but what I can see it's a mission game.
This was a really weird game. The gameplay wasnt entirely clear and was difficult to understand. This is a cult classic, but not something I enjoyed.

Okay, I get it: they're trying to bring old school games and make them fit on the, 'newer' consoles.... This one falls far short! It locks up a bit, and is just boring. The storyline put me to sleep, and I couldn't even find a way to play more than 25 minutes.

I read the reviews and jumped at this. Odd that is it $29,99 physical, but only $14,99 digital! I have the Gamers Club, so that took it down to $23,99 and figured I wouldn't be locked in if I wasn't crazy about it. Sure enough, I played a couple hours and didn't touch it again. Off to eBay. It's a cutesy little game, but unless you're a huge RPG fan and love these classic 8 bit looking story driven titles, your money is better spent elsewhere.

Animal Crossing is a great game for relaxed and casual playing. It has an adorable art style and lends itself well to providing many different styles of playing the game and creating unique towns to run around. Id Recommend it to any aged person if theyd enjoy a simple but fun experience.
Bad for the money you spend but I found myself playing other games
I really dont get what all the hype is about this game is not very fun at all and I wasted money and best buy certificates on this

Lego Harry Potter did not disappoint for Nintendo Wii, and it's even better for Nintendo Switch. Both games are available on the same cartridge, which makes the experience that much better. While there is little difference from the Nintendo Wii version (the one I had), the gameplay seems to be smoother. Despite the small nature of the Joy-Con, I can actually play this version far easier than with the Wiimote. Extremely fun, always magical, and endearing as the books and films, Lego Harry Potter for Nintendo Switch is just as much, if not more, enjoyable as I remember. Now they just need to release Lego Star Wars and Lego Indiana Jones. :D

Im a relatively serious gamer and typically enjoy challenging titles, but Im having a great time playing this co-op with my girlfriend, whose experience is mostly with Mario kart, party, etc. We love how much care went into recreating the HP universe with a LEGO twist, and were having a great time discovering secrets and solving puzzles. Soundtrack and sound effects are taken right from the movie scores and add lots of atmosphere. Highly recommend as long as you have someone to play with!
People sh1t on this game for being too easy or repetitive but it's right up your alley if you want some lego fun. You won't go wrong buying this game.

I have been patiently waiting for this to come to the Nintendo Switch and it was SO worth the wait. The colors are flawlessly vibrant, the controls are super easy to use, and the game itself is the best retelling of the Harry Potter saga I've ever seen. It is so fun even for myself who is almost 25 years old. Whether you are a Harry Potter fan, a LEGO fan, or both (like myself) this is a MUST-HAVE. If you don't have a Switch it is also available on PS4 and XBOX One.
The LEGO games always seem to be great for both kids and adults. Its fun to play for both, at the same time!
This is for my wife for Christmas . She loves lego's and Harry Potter and can't wait for her to be able to play

We owned this on PS4 and enjoyed it. Decided to buy it for the Switch simply for the portability. Game appears to be exactly the same as the PS4 version. We obviously couldn't import our PS4 progress but that was expected. Great game if you enjoy Lego and Harry Potter.

After traveling to Universal Studios in Orlando, we were on a Harry Potter binge. Got this game to play passively for fun. It did exactly that. Has fun puzzles and things to do. First time Lego game player, and it bugged me for the first 30 minutes of play, then I got past it and really enjoyed all the challenges and activities!

Found and bought this on sale and my daughter loves it. She played the first HP lego on her cousin's xbox and they'd play for hours. Getting it remastered on the Switch and with the full collection and on sale, made the total sense to buy it. And she loves it. Fun game for the family to join in!

I bought this game for my wife (which is now one of her favorite games ever), and we play together. LEGO games are always better when played with another person, and this is no different. It captures the essence of the films in LEGO form perfectly, and is a great game to play for fans of both LEGO games and Harry Potter.

If you're one or all of the following - you need to get this: 1) A fan of Lego 2) A fan of Lego games 3) A fan of Harry Potter 4) Needing another thing to play on your switch. I own these games on steam and haven't played them much, but now with the portability of the switch - this is an easy game to just pick up and play for a bit. It's exactly what you expect and doesn't disappoint.

I am so glad that they have both games on one cartridge. I've never actually been able to 100% either of these games before, but now they are on one cartridge and on the switch so I can take it on the go, I am already halfway there!
This game has a serious glitch prohibiting you for moving forward in gameplay. He hasn't played since.
No good. It's boring and repetitive and it doesn't follow any plot line. Graphics are bad.

This is a fun game but they cut corners and didnt give the characters voices. All they do is mumble and grumble and squeeke and then it gets to a point that you need to turn the sound off since its so annoying to listen too. I wish they would have given them voices with actual words.
This little camera is a perfect B roll camera and great for cinematic stabilizes shot! Audio not so great so make sure you have external or backup camera!

I am giving it five stars as I am taking this for what it is... an old school game, with an incredible looking new coat of paint. Some of things that frustrated me in the 90s are still here as the control scheme is still based on old school sensibilities. But it's just as fun as it ever was, and in 4K it's a joy to look at. Plus, I bought this to introduce a classic to my kids and they love it so far.

Amazing remakes of three classic games; this title features beautiful visuals, lively animation, and the same challenging gameplay from the original titles (albeit with some much-needed quality-of-life improvements). The current print includes the game's two DLC levels on the disc without requiring an internet connection or separate purchase (as denoted by the added banner on the game's box art) as well as many of the bugfixes previously implemented through software updates, which should please physical game collectors.

I have missed having Crash in my life and was ecstatic when I found this trilogy! The graphics are great, as well as the gameplay and it took me back to my younger years when I played the individual games. The producers did a great job with this remastering. I am very happy this product was released and am so glad they remade, or should I say refreshed, Crash Bandicoot. I could not be more happy to play it again!
I purchaes this for my daughter. She tells me its great and she loves it. Must be true because she plays it a lot!

Crash is remade from the ground up and it looks and plays wonderfully - just as you remember. Keep in mind, that also means it's hard as nails and frustrating at times, but a heck of a good time and a very rewarding challenge. If you liked it back in the day, you'll LOVE it now. Quality of life improvements makes the games MUCH more approachable (the games instant save! If you've played the first title back on the PS1, you'll know what a godsend that is). Picked it up for $20 on sale - money well spent.

Gameplay wise, these are basically one-to one recreations of the original trilogy. I'm sure there's probably some small tweaks here and there that I don't notice, but it feels the same as playing the original games. The only really noticeable gameplay change is that Crash 1 now saves after every level, which is a welcome change from the bizarre save system the PS1 version had. You can also use the analogue sticks now, and I found myself switching between the d-pad and the analogue sticks depending on the situation, which was useful. Being so faithful though, means that some of the less savory bits of the original level designs are still problem points here. This isn't so much a problem for Crash 2 (I haven't played either version of Crash 3, yet),

I haven't played the original Crash games in several years until recently and WOW this collection looks and plays fantastic! My 3 yo son really enjoys watching and playing it as well. If you were a fan of the series years ago, then this is totally worth buying. I'd also recommend it to anyone with kids since 'kids games' are few and far between when it comes to consoles (seems most of those moved to mobile/tablet), though there will be times you'll need to help them out, so use it as a good way to spend time together and enjoy gaming.

I picked this up because I had played the originals on the ps1. If you have played them you know what to expect. If you are new, Crash is an action 3d platformer but it can be tough. Stick with it though and you will find a great set of games. This collection includes Crash 1-3 and some new bonus levels.

This bundle has allowed me to relive my childhood. Packaged with all 3 games on one disk, this trilogy is easy to insert and play. The same cant be said about the gameplay. Although the graphics has been redefined and remastered, the gameplay difficulty has been taken up a notch. Still, like with the older versions of these games, it does get easier with practice.
I bought this game thinking it would be like the one we had in the 90s I was wrong I returned it the same day

Let me start off by saying that the graphical rework put into this game is nothing short of excellent. The major concern is the lackluster story, which at one point worked back in the 90's. In today's day and age, I would personally advice against this game if you're looking for a great immersive story. Nostalgia hungry players might enjoy it, but I would have rather kept this game as a memory of childhood. *** PARENTS BE ADVISED: THIS IS NOT A SIMPLE GAME YOUR CHILDREN WILL ENJOY. THIS GAME EASILY TOPS MY CHART FOR DIFFICULTY AND FRUSTRATION! ***
if you buy this and thinking is going to be a disc sorry to tell you it's just a code

I've loved Spyro as a kid and this collection brings back memories of when I was playing my PS1 after school. I held out until they released the Spyro collection on the Switch mainly due to the portability. The biggest issue I have with the physical edition is only Game 1 is on the card, you need to download 2 and 3. Just be away you need a lot of storage space if you want all 3 installed at the same time.

this trilogy was a perfect way for me to finally get into this series!! and i'm loving it, its way less stressful than crash was xD as someone who hasn't played any spyro and grew up with crash i never took a notice to this purple dragon til way later in life and i kinda regret not playing it alongside crash. BUT i recommend this to anyone either casual or hardcore, who wants another great classic on the go or just to add to your collection you will not be disappointed! controls are easy enough to remember and is very colorful, a good story and a great purple dragon with sparks
Game looks really nice on handheld mode. Enjoying the game so far. Only issue is that you have to download like 10gb.

Yooooo. Best buy. Your gamers club single handedly brought all my videogame purchases to your stores. Now that there is now gamers club I will not be buying my games through your stores. I hope you bring it back eventually.
Great game fun to play plus it's a trilogy so all three games are on this one card don't be afraid to pick this up

I love that I got Spyro on the go and there is three full games to play for hours of entertainment the only thing that makes me mad is that Activision is a bunch of cheap and greedy jerks that couldnt afford to upgrade the cartridge to a 16gb card and get the hole game on one cartridge instead they went cheap-O and went with a 8gb cartridge and let you download the rest but the game is still worth buying but I would wait for a sale and buy it then so Activision can learn a lesson not to be so cheap

I really was unsure if I would like it seeing as how I played this game when it first came out as a child. It stills holds up good whether you grew up with it or if you are a younger gamer who is barely getting to play it the first time. The face lift looks great. I would have gave 5 stars, but Activision cheaped out and didn't put the whole game on the cartridge.
I played the originals on the PSone and this game brings back those memories. Everything is just like the original which is great.
Best game ever!!! Played it on the original PlayStation and loved it and this remastered version is absolutely beautiful!
Wow! To have Spyro again and all three games with the ability to take it on the go with Switch - very very cool. Great memories and fun to play for all ages.

As a kid, I never really owned a Playstation, but I did play the demo of the first game and loved it and wanted to play more of it. I finally get to experience the trilogy for the first time in years! A lot of love and effort went into this remaking this trilogy. They even got voice actor Tom Kenny, (voice of SpongeBob), to reprise his role as Spyro since he voiced him in Spyro 2 & 3. The art style is beautifully recreated and very eye-catching. The music is a joy to listen to as well. Another cool feature that they added was that you can switch the music to the original soundtrack from the PS1 trilogy! That's very cool! During all 3 games, there are missions that you can complete. They are optional. When you've completed these missions, you unlock an art gallery from all 3 games. For me, I think it's cool to see some concept artwork for each game. I always enjoy seeing behind-the-scenes stuff from video games. :-) They have also added the cheat codes from the original games as well. There is one new cheat code that is only exclusive to the Nintendo Switch. It's the Rainbow Sunglasses. I don't know if the Rainbow Sunglasses will be added to the PS4 and Xbox One versions of the game or not. For now, it's only exclusive to Nintendo Switch. There were some slight speed frame issues when loading up a new area, but when you enter a level everything seems to appear to running smoothly. My only gripe is that not all 3 games are on the cartridge. Only the first game is on the cartridge and you have to download Spyro 2 & 3. The PS4 and Xbox One versions also had the same issues as well. There were some levels that were challenging to complete. Specifically the levels where you are on a time limit and you have to collect items or destroy enemies to earn extra time points to the clock. You have to do this all in one go and try not to bump into anything. Or don't lose too much time. Otherwise, you'll have to do it all over again. Overall, this trilogy was a blast to play through and it's great for anyone to play!!

The team has done a very good job of porting Spyro Reignited Trilogy on Switch (Includes Spyro the Dragon, Spyro 2: Ripto's Rage! and Spyro: Year of the Dragon.) The first game is physically on cart with the other 2 games needing a download. As far as the game goes it runs smoothly and has been remastered in HD. There are some slight speed frame issue when loading up a new area but when the level is running everything seems to appear smooth and solid frame rate. Though I wish all 3 games had been included physically it doesn't seem to be the case. PS4 and XBox owners had the same problem when it was released on those platforms. Spyro Reignited Trilogy is a nice addition to the Switch library of games.
My son and I use to play this when he was younger and were very excited when it came out for the switch. We could not even find this game at Game Stop, but Best Buy had it. YA!
I loved it back when it was on the PS1 and love it now on the switch! I hope they contjnue to bring back games like this one.

I was really looking foward to play spyro for the first time ever as most critics were really happy with this remake. However I found these three game (spyro 1, 2 and 3) to be really shallow. You just collect a bunch of dragons and pearls and keep moving to the next level. You dont actually find new skills or evolve you character like in Banjo Kazooie. Its a simple game from the nineties and good for nostalgia. If you have a nintendo switch, Mario Odissey is a much better game. Yooka Layle or Crash Bandicoot are better too. If you have a Ps4, go with Ratchet ans Clank or even the spiderman game.
Fun game, but nothing new if you played all of them when they came out.
haven't played the game yet, as this is a christmas gift, I know my son will love it, and got it for free with the purchase of the console
Its a Christmas present so hasnt been opened yet

While not the greatest game by today's standard, it does a great job at revamping what was a good game back in the day. Despite how simplistic it feels at times, if you are a perfectionist, it does provide a decent challenge. Also, getting all 3 of the original games in one package is quite nice.
Better versions of the old Spyro games on the go. Great!!!
the spyro trilogy was a great series on the PS1, so it's nice to see it remastered and portable on the switch

It's taking me a while to get used to cooking and baking with this stove. I do not like the burners are to delicate. Still don't understand how to clean them. The oven is hard to regulate. Baking items seems to take longer then recommended. I have not tried the steam cleaning yet.

The game overall is okay when it comes to game play, but understand going into this game that playing it is going to afford you little reward if you are looking to build up a character or improve your equipment. You have 3 club levels (or bags) to chose from, you sacrifice accuracy for power as you go up in club level. There are no skill points earned and the course difficulty is dependent on the skill level you chose when you start a season. The joystick is very touchy and the green reads are difficult and inconsistent based on slope speed. Essentially, the only thing you play for is to change your clothes and look of your clubs (has no effect on club skill), and the money you earn is absolutely useless. If you like to just kill time with no goal in mind then this game is okay, but if you want to work towards something like improving your skills or equipment, do not buy this game. I enjoy it for what it is, but could be so much more.

Rory McIlroy is way better than this game. You cant upgrade stats, you cant put spin on the ball and your luck to hit a perfect shot is one in a million. God forbid you have a slow back swing, good by ball.. and if you finally have that perfect swing you better have put it directly down the center fairway. Ive always been a fan of Tiger Woods and the last EA game Rory McIlroy but this game cannot compete. That being said the only thing I like about this game is the putting. If you would take the accuracy and power of Rory and the putting and graphics of this crappy game you would have a master piece.

The game is great as far as graphics and the flow of an actual round of golf. But the putting is just ridiculously stupid. Trying to make adjustments of a shorter backswing and shorter follow thru doesnt help either. Worst putting mechanics and accuracy of any golf game I ever played. No where close to a Tiger Woods caliber of a game. If they fix the putting I would give a better rating.

We got this game so we could play our characters building them and courses as we played. The graphics are awesome. But that's it.. Unless one of us plays as a guest you can't play together in a match. OH unless you have 2 blasted Xboxes.. Really, we are in our 60's...We loved the Tiger game and EA Sports Roy ------- PGA Tour but they only go so far and we were hoping with 2019 we would have that and graphics. Very disappointed.. We feel like we got ripped off. But it's the rich people so they don't care. Wish there was a fix for this, even if we had to 'pay' for it... Try and think / walk in the other person's shoes.. Thank you for listening who ever reads this.

The newest version of PGA golf is fairly similar to past attempts. In reality, there is only so much realism that you can get from a game controller, but this one seems to be a little bit more accurate than the EA versions. The graphics are good (but, perhaps not quite as good as the EA games) and the frame rates are very good. Game play is fast and accurate. If you are really missing a console golf game, than this one should satisfy you for awhile.

I bought an X-Box 1 for my grandkids to play when they visit. I am not a gamer, but I saw this game on sale and had a $10 reward, so, for $21 I self gifted at Christmas! It is very easy to use, the graphics, sound and features are great! Now if I can only get my short game in order....
This game is ok for relaxing but for some reason, they weren't able to make it as good as the old Tiger Woods golf.

Tough to play multiplayer with kids. I bought so we could play courses all over the world and figure out where we wanted to actually go play. Not sure that is going to work out as the game doesnt have all the places we want to play
I was a big fan of the EA sports Tiger Woods games. Like this game because it takes practice to get everything right. It's just challenging enough to make it fun and keep trying to get better.
The game has good graphics however it is not the same as Tiger Woods golf. It's a shame EA sports is no longer involved.

This is not a review of the game itself. The game is great, as you probably already know. Fangamer marketed this product as the definitive experience, but for a $20 premium over the digital title (and $5 more than the PS4 physical), youre getting a game thats doesnt include a substantial content update on cart, despite being released seven months ago. What makes it worse is that I wouldve returned it and waited for the PS4 version, which has the dlc baked in, but I cant because I already opened the shrink wrap. To be frank, I feel deceived.

Hollow Knight is really a long adventure; if you like exploring huge beautiful caverns and trying to defeat enemies, within a nice soundtrack, you will love this game too. :) The graphics are unique and excellent. Hollow Knight is so much fun! :D There are so many helpful items that can be found or bought with in-game currency. Your Hollow Knight will get more effective at defeating enemies as you progress, new skills, in-game maps, and equip-able items. And if you find certain creatures you can travel to and from those locations quickly. This switch bundle comes with the 4 dlc upgrades, an interesting instruction manual, a map, and a 15% off of all Hollow Knight products promo code. Note: when you get close to perishing press the + button and select the third lowest menu item, something about saving and quitting. If you do that: all progress will be saved, you won't lose all of your Geo coins collected and have to fight your shadow to get them back, and you will start sitting on the last bench you sat on. (This is also very easy to do bc the game is made extremely well; almost instantaneous loading time.)
Hard game but very rewarding. Deff the best indi nintendo switch game. So successful and popular they are making a second one!!!
One word of warning: While the game is advertised as having all the DLC, it does not. It excludes Godmaster. Godmaster is a free download, but it is still not on the cartridge.

This game is amazing, it's loaded with content and there's so much to do. I'd say Hollow Knight would be worth $30 or $40 for the interesting story, fresh gameplay mechanics and entrancing music. Should you let an opportunity to play this game pass you? Absolutely not! Go out, play this game you'll thank me later.
Theres a reason why theres almost a 5 star rating. It lives up to the hype, its cheap, and you can throw a lot of hours into it.

Hollow Knight is an absolutely stunning platformer!! Be warned you will die ALOT but it is so addictive that you just keep coming back for more!! Hollow Knight is one of my most played games next to Splatoon 2 and Luigis Mansion 3!! There is so much exploring that you can do and the graphics and sound effects are so beautifully stunning and immersive!! If I could give this 100 stars I would! If you are on the fence about purchasing this game just do it you wont regret it!!

My daughter loves the game. I got it for her for Christmas and she enjoys the puzzles that come with it. She enjoys the music so much, she found the sheet music for it online and started playing it on the piano one night.
My Son got it for Christmas and loves it . Very fun game and good graphicS
Bought this for my 14yr old. He enjoys that it is challenging. Cool to look at.
Really enjoy this game. The game is adorable and cool.

This is was a surprise gift for my 12-year-old son who got a Switch in 2018. He did not know to ask for this game, but I did a search and it came up on all the top-ten Switch game lists. He would agree that it deserves the praise. The art style is 'AMAZING,' the level designs are outstanding, and battles are challenging and fun. This will not get old too quickly. Only downside is that it is not multiplayer, but it still deserves five stars.
My son loves this game, it was a big hit! Glad I got it

Everything about this game is flawless. The level design, the controls, the bosses, the amount of content, the music, the atmosphere, the story and lore, the characters, etc . . . I could go on and on, but let me just say that this is the single greatest Metroidvania ever made. Hands down. Unless you can't handle difficult games, you owe it to yourself to go out and try this immediately.

so far having fun with this game. Im not too far into it yet, only because I play multiple games and work a full time job with 3 kids. the only thing I thought was kinda lame was you collect a form a currency by killing enemies and then use the currency to purchase items in the shop. well I was lost and was trying to find out where i was on the map, which i only was able to see a small portion of. come to find out i actually had to buy map identifiers from the shop. so to show my characters location on the map i had to purchase that, to show where save benches were, i had to purchase that. I enjoy the grind to collect and purchase items for your quest, but something like the map i think would be a default part of the game.

The game is different. I like it a lot. Graphics, sound, and story are there, but the game can be difficult, even on easy. It is also very appealing to the eye. I give it 4 stars and not 5 because of the difficulty in gameplay.
Fun game. Hard at times. Castlevania meets Metroid style.
Wow, what a great looking game! A very fun experience too. Can't recommend this enough!
When I opened it I could not believe it came with so much extra stuff!

My nephew loved it. He said it had all the extras. I got lots of hugs & kisses for this one.
Ok game and easy to play and the mechanics are a bit sluggish at time. Check Nintendo store first as the game is usually listed cheaper than actual physical copy of game.
I played about 50 hours of this game on pc, but it is perfect for the switch. Hollow Knight is a long game with a lot of content so it is great to be able to play it on the go.
I've heard great things about this game, I've downloaded it but I haven played it wy

Its basically a neverending metroid level. I didn't enjoy it at all.

This is a contender for best game of the year, and should be your next purchase after Breath of the Wild. Masterful storytelling revealed in the elliptical fashion characteristic of the Soulsborne games with amazing writing to boot. An excellent Metroidvania with a boatload to explore and 35+ hours of gameplay. Challenging but not punishing. One of the best soundtracks you can hear in a videogame, and that's not hyperbole (check it on YouTube if you're skeptical). I didn't expect this title to be this grest, frankly, and given its current limitation to PC and the Switch, Switch owners should be thankful they can even play this modern masterpiece. The art style may throw you off at first, but hidden beneath the cartoon graphics is a story rife with classic philosophical dilemmas about the meaning of sacrifice, life, and the price paid for knowledge. Seriously - buy this game.

Western Digital makes the most reliable hard drives as far as my experience has been. Ive only had this one a few months, but it hasnt had any issues and has performed perfectly. I keep my computer's backup on this drive.

I bought this for my 18 year old son after he was in a bad car accident. He broke both ankles and his right femur so he can't put weight on his legs at all. This game kept him busy while he was bed bound. He loved playing it. He is still playing being at home.

This installment is everything Sun/Moon should have been. An improved story, additional fun features like Mantine surfing, Move Tutors, and the chance to obtain most of the legendary pokemon from previous generations is awesome. I love it.

This game adds a lot of extra content onto the release of Sun & Moon released a year earlier. That being said, there is pretty much no point in even getting the original versions of the game with these available. Not really a comment about the product, but it is pretty annoying to release a game, then release same game with extra content that could not be added onto the original release a year after. This practice is basically just buying extra content and extra story chapters for the price of a whole new game. After buying it, the first game just a year before almost seems like it was a waste of time and money. Seems like it was even a waste of time making it in the first place. But this has been a long trend with this franchise, so you know in advanced just to wait for the second rendition of the game with extra content.
If you bought Sun or Moon version, don't expect that much from this game.
Kinda bland knowing it's just like moon but with minor differences. Still fun. No complaints agasint game play but I wish it was a bit more than I thought.
My 11 year old daughter loves loves this game! I would highly recommend this game for all ages!
This game has what Sun/Moon offered, but more. It's a little more difficult, which makes it a great challenge. Definitely recommended.
My son is happy with this game, result some different to Pokemon Moon more exciting
Another great RPG game in the series of Pokemon ;)

The game is great of you never played the original Sun and Moon. I played the original and waited to get this on sale and paid about $23-$25 for and it was worth it. I enjoyed my time and the gameplay had minor changes but overall the same game.
mastered the game in a day not worth the spending much if you are a good gamer
This games are the best only if you don't own Pokmon Sun or Pokmon Moon
What is this garbage? You walk around and do basically nothing. Boring and lame where are the guns and gore?
Game didnt even come out yet and Im still giving it 5 stars
My nephew loved the game he has been playing everyday since I bought it
I was just waiting for the release day and its here , a huge graphics upgrade from the previous one

I love this need for speed! It is the best one yet! The fact that Best Buy put it on sale with it being such a new game, made this purchase even more worth it. I believe Best Buy should continue to put new games on sale while theyre still new.
Came thru for the pick up curb side during the rona

Having been a NFS fan since the very first one back in the 90s, I have to say I KNOW my Need For Speed games. There's been a lot of hits, and a lot of misses, which mainly depends on the studio putting out the specific game. IMHO, the last GREAT NFS was NFS: Hot Pursuit. I LOVED that game and tacked on thousands of hours playing it on PS3 (and STILL do on occasion!) The next few after it, The Run, Rivals, Payback, were ok at best, but never grabbed me like Hot Pursuit did. Until now. NFS: Heat FINALLY brings back that thrill of racing through the city with a pack of cops hot on your tail. Heat opens up a nice, big world with endless, challenging roads to explore and tear through. There's lots of shortcuts, speed traps, jumps, and it even brings in rally tracks for a nice change from the pavement. My biggest complaint with the game is that it doesn't let you play as a cop, which in Hot Pursuit could be just as much fun as running from them. So if you like to drive fast, run and evade the cops, and basically just put your foot to the accelerator, give NFS: Heat a try. I think you'll like it.
Purchased this game for my two boys they love this game.
I like how you can chose between night and day but i hate the fact that its hard to outrun the cops in the beginning!

Wow earning rep is crazy hard in this game especially leveling up and having to win heat 3 races by the time your at that stage your risking of getting your car totalled and having to build up rep again wish you didn't have to do repairs the game would be alot more fun

It's a good overall game. If you like the past NFS games you should like this one. Here are the few things I don't like though. Musics selection needs work. Building a good off road vehicle seems confusing. I buy upgraded off road parts but the vehicles ranking drops. My biggest complaint is the drift scoring. I can take my car build for racing and drift perfect corners and get very low scores. Get in my car built with 'drift' parts that I can barely control, crash into walls and barriers and score so many points I've beat the event before the 1st of 3 laps is done. Overall though it's a fun game with great graphics and lots of cars to chose from and modify.

This is hands down the best racing game need for speed has launched since underground. You can spend hours customizing the vehicle. Taking it all the way down to changing the full performance and having the option for motor swaps to changing and tuning the exact note of the exhaust. They are finally heading the right direction.

This game is fun to play. Has a lot of races, I love how Im able to race in the day time or night time. Night time is more street races and cops are powerful as they would be in real life. Day time has sanctioned races that are legal. Reason for great alternative for PS4 is because XBOX has Forza with engine swaps and great resolution. Now PS4 users have this to do their own thing as well

Underground 2 was the greatest classic I've every played. No other need 4 speed comes close until heat. Heat has its problems but all in all heat is the next best need 4 speed. You won't be disappointed.
It got here fast happy about that just not of other purchases I've made where my things had gotten 'lost'.

Breath of the Wild is already an incredible game, the DLC pack adds more content and gives you an incentive to come back again and again. The first part of the DLC pack puts you back into Hyrule to go on a scavenger hunt of sorts, looking for some extra pieces of gear. DO NOT look up the locations of the gear on the internet, it's a lot more fun when you have to figure it out on your own. The first DLC pack also includes the master trials. Don't let similar trials from previous Zelda games fool you, these trials are HARD. You can easily get 5+ hours out of them even if you beat them first try . . . And if you're that good at the game, the DLC also adds the brutal Master Mode. Master Mode is more than just making the enemies harder, harder enemies appear earlier in the game and in more difficult locations. A task that was easy the first time through suddenly requires you to sneak your way around a brutally difficult Lynel. It's a total blast and I definitely recommend it if you're a fan of the base game!

Expansion Pack! More fun! Longer play. More time you should have spent doing something productive says dad. Yeah. Probably. Guilt. Shame. Turns game on... yeah. Later with that. 'I'm learning game theory.' College level.
Loved breath the wild and once I finished it, I bought the expansion pass and its almost like a whole other game. Worth itsprice.

There is plenty of challenge and fun added with this one. The extra shrines and dungeons are very interesting. Master mode is tough, as is trial of the sword. Definitely plenty of stuff here if you are looking to ramp up the difficulty.

This expansion is awesome. Even just treasure hunting the new items added a few extra hours of gameplay. I havent even done the included story expansions yet. Awesome job on this game and expansion pack. Very reasonable also.
A must addition for BTW players. Added several more hours of gaming and exploring after finishing the original quest.
This a must have DLC for Zeldies BotW. It extends the game with more side quests.
More quests, more stuff, more stuff to find, me and my 10 year old love it.
good value for some great content. Sad that you cannot get the moto earlier in the game
Amazing extra content. It adds a lot of extra shrines and quests.

Having this expansion pass adds so much to this already fantastic game. I cannot express how pleased I am to have put in that extra money into this amazing game. And buying this expansion pass in store sure feels a little safer than using your information for online purchase, or having to buy an eShop card just for this.

The additional story obviously makes this worth the money, but the bonus items alone had me sold. It doesn't just hand you the dlc items, it gives you quests to go out and find them. I prefer this, especially if its your first time playing since it give more reason to look around and read everything,

Comparing the content in these DLC packs to what was in the base game, the DLC is extremely overpriced. $20 DLC gets you a few items, 12 shrines and 1 dungeon. However the $60 game gets you 120 shrines and 4 dungeons. The DLC is still fun although it is overpriced in my opinion

Only half of the DLC purchased in expansion pass is available at the time of writing this. The other half will be available later. Even so, it added quite a bit of value to the base game with more goodies to find, extra side quests to do, and a master mode to start up for more of a challenge. After getting the DLC, I went right back into the game, sinking hours just wandering the world tracking down bonus chests and koroks. The focus on the first half of the DLC is adding gameplay time. The second half will be a more story-related addition which I am excited for.

Awesome addition to an already awesome game. Lots of loot from previous zelda games like Majora's mask, and Wind Waker lobster shirt. Also trial of the sword challenge to enhance your master sword. Mandatory for the full BOTW experience.
Not really sure what you get with this expansion I saw no difference and had to lookup what exactly had changed
Zelda doesnt let you down once again! Great game for any age
Sounds like this will be worth $20. Cost is low, and there seems to be a lot of content
I was so annoyed by how bad the game was that I stopped playing and never even made it to the expansion pack.
I think this was a free in store item but I can't remember what it was??
Unfortunately, I got caught up in the moment and pre-ordered unreleased content to a broken game. Lesson learned: don't buy season passes until you confirm that the game doesn't suck.

I picked this up on PS4 last year but held off playing it because of it coming to the switch. I have played a few of the games in the series but never finished any. This one will be the one that I play through to completion. If you are hesitant on whether or not you will like it, there is a demo that you can download for free. Your progress save transfers to the main game if you plan on purchasing after playing the demo. Highly recommended.

Between the demo and the game today on release I am over twenty hours into this already, and I've barely scratched the surface. A masterpiece of a game with traditional turn-based combat and an amazing orchestrated soundtrack. Highly recommend to any fans of JRPGs; if you are on the fence, try out the free demo!

I first off will say I have the PS4 version also and love the game as much if not more then DQVIII. Here you get full orchestra music versus the PS4 symphonic ost. I also love having a chance to play this in 16 bit retro 2D mode. If you have s Switch or Switch Lite and love the series or not you owe it to yourself to pick this title up.

Music is fantastic unlike someones review. If you love the dragon quest series in general this game is so good. Akira toriyama (dbz artist) Art is amazing as usual. You wont go wrong with this game if you love classic rpgs

The portability is always a welcome addition with ports of games but the entire experience of Dragon Quest 11 is here and available for the Nintendo Switch console. One of the best parts of this rendition of Dragon Quest 11 is that it uses the symphonic version of the soundtrack making it the experience worthwhile and on top of that the entire game can be experienced in a nostalgic 2D format if you choose to do so.

I originally purchased Dragon Quest XI on PC and had an absolute blast playing it! That same fun carries over to the Switch version, although the graphics are severely limited due to the Switch's already outdated, (at it's launch), hardware capabilities. That being said, the Switch version of DQXI has the Japanese 3DS' 2D mode as an option to play the entire game through. If you're a fan of traditional turned based RPGs, and you love old school 2D sprites, you'll love playing this game in 2D mode on the Switch!
I love this game. Awesome rpg with 3d and 2d modes.

Ever since Final Fantasy went from RPG to videos for gameplay, I have not played RPGs. This game finally goes back to the old way of playing them. Weapons, armor, accessories, NO RANDOM BATTLES (except while on ship or in 2D mode), can't give this game enough accolades.

I dont have much to say about DQ11 switch version. The only important thing i have to say is that its really the best Japanese RPG release on the last decade. If you dont like anime or akira toryama art work, even so, I would give this game a chance. Its charming and you play it like reading a novel. Really really really spectacular game.

Dragon Quest XI must be played by anyone who loves traditional turn-based JRPGs. And since it is traditional, it's also a good game for people who want to dive into the genre for the first time. Like Final Fantasy games, you don't need to know anything about the previous titles in the franchise because the stories are for the most part disconnected. If you're deciding between the Switch version and the PS4 version, the Switch is the way to go. The ability to speed up battles, call your horse anywhere on the field, and craft items anywhere besides just a save point saves you so much time playing the game. You also get the new 2D-mode if you prefer a retro-styled playthrough, orchestrated versions of in-game music, more story content, and more. This game will last you over 100 hours if you're also looking for a good beefy game to sink into. The visuals are well-preserved in this game as well. I definitely recommend this to anyone!

This game is great but is even better on switch minus graphics. here are the pros and cons Pros: full orchestral soundtrack quality of life improvements. 2d mode with vignettes from every past dragon quest game. take anywhere more side stories for your party members cons: Graphics are downgraded compared to ps4 version.

This IS the definitive edition in my opinion. The performance the music is amazing! I spent over 10hrs on the demo and the save data transferred over! Im just happy to be able to play this amazing rpg anywhere. I highly recommend to anyone and if ur not sure theres a demo available

I just finished the game and I'm mad at myself for sleeping on it for so long. The music is incredible, the gameplay is some of the most fun I've ever experienced, and the characters are great! There's so much to do and the world never feels empty. This has to be one of my favorite games of all time. If there's anything you should know, though, it's that you should put aside 60-100 hours if you want to finish the game. When you finish the game, there's actually a whole post game story that is around 40 extra hours or so. It is so worth it to play that much. I will admit that the first hour or so is a little boring and bland, but once you leave the village, that's when it gets exciting. That's what hooked me. If there's one thing I don't like, it's the main character. He never speaks and he always has this stoic look on his face. Emotionless... You could tell him that his dad died, everyone in the party would freak out, but he would just be standing there looking like nothing happened. That's my only complaint. By far, everything this game does right outweighs this one complaint. I had so much fun and I recommend this game wholeheartedly. Just don't forget to beat the post game true boss. Definitely worth it.

This game took me just under 100 hours to complete. In that time I rarely found myself farming or doing anything truly repetitive. The story beats kept me going at such a wonderful pace. After 50 hours I figured they were going to start stretching the story, but no, it was fresh and wonderful throughout. The combat did get old after a while, but if you enjoy classic turn based combat RPGs you know what to expect. Visually the game is one of the best on the system. The music is also very good, but DOES end up getting old after 60 hours. I would say a must have for RPG fans, but 100 hours is a HUGE commitment. I would say, if you have the time it is truly worth playing.

Dragon Quest 11 is the first mainline Dragon Quest game to hit a home console since Dragon Quest 8 in 2004. While Dragon Quest 9 on the DS was a lot of fun, it didn't have a set cast of characters and as a result it's story wasn't as complex or emotionally resonant. Dragon Quest 11 is a return to the style of the classic games with a fixed cast of characters, all of which get meaningful development over the course of the game. The combat system isn't revolutionary but all the attacks are wonderfully animated, especially the multi-character team attacks. The amount of game is also astounding, featuring several distinct acts, each with major plot and character progression. If anything there's almost too much game. The Switch version is also the definitive version of the game for the addition of new content and replacing the lack luster MIDI music of other versions of the game with mostly live orchestrations. If your a fan of RPGs and own a Switch you should definitely give Dragon Quest 11 a shot. If your unsure you can always try out the free and lengthy demo available on the Nintendo eShop.

There is so much to do in this game, and it is very high quality in terms of visuals, story, gameplay, and music. The story itself is very good. This should please both newcomers and veterans alike of JRPG games.

This game is incredible. Combining the PS4 version with a 2D mode from the 3DS version, there's tons of new content PS4 players wont' have seen, plus just new content exclusive to the Switch version. Easy recommend.

Great game, classic Dragon Quest experience. There really aren't many AAA turned based RPG's anymore so you have to appreciate that Dragon Quest still fills that void. This entry has a great story and is very long, I had over 100 hours in my first playthrough on the PS4, picked it up again on the Switch to have on vacations.

Dragon Quest XI S is a once in a generation landmark JRPG experience that is 2nd to none. The gameplay, the characters, setting, music and everything are top notch. I played over 100 hours and wasn't bored once. Few games pull me into their world's as much as Dragon Quest XI did and it has easily been the most fun I've had on my Switch to date. I highly recommend this masterpiece

Only 10 hours in but this is a gem. The characters, music and voice acting are great. The story keeps things moving along and the battle system is nice that you can set it to only control the main PC. Being able to see all enemies in the overworld eliminates the frustrating random encounters of previous entries to let you move around at your own pace.

I purchased this on release for the PS4 as well. I played that version and while its a bit crisper I felt like the camera rotation was hard to get dialed in on the PS4 and it made me a bit dizzy to play it. On top of that I can't take my PS4 with me. Enter the Switch version. I decided to give this another try on the Switch since I love DQ games and I felt like my experience on the PS4 was not so much the game as it was the hardware. Sure enough I tuned the camera rotation on the switch to make it faster and it felt just right. Add to this the portability of the Switch and I have not made it through the whole game satisfactorily. This game has some extra feature too since it is the definitive edition. The big plus over the PS4 is the upgraded audio. Instead of crappy midi on PS4 you get full symphony tracks. HUGE UPGRADE. I was unable to play and enjoy this game on the PS4, but the Switch version fixed all of my issues and its a better version of the game at the same time. If you have the option for both, but this one. You won't regret it.

The Nintendo Definitive Edition of Dragon Quest 11 is everything you could have asked for and more. The game has been expanded on from the original release with new content and side quests. You can play the game in it's 3D Engine or you can choose to go classic 16 bit style with beautiful pixel sprites. This is a very polished game from the music down to the art style for the game. There are 100's of hours of gameplay on offer in this game. This was one of the first games Square-Enix had announced for Project NX before it became the Switch. it is nice to finally see this game release and the wait was worth it.

I played the PS4 version some years back that made me love Dragon Quest again. Now when the Switch version was announced as definitive edition, honestly I was skeptical. Let me tell you they are correct, the orchestra music alone is incredible, but with all the extra character play through ( wont spoil it here) and the 2d mode , it was worth double dipping to play this remarkable game once again.

Dragon Quest XI is a very traditional Dragon Quest game. Making fewer changes between entries than the average Final Fantasy, the series has certainly grown into modern consoles while respecting its NES roots. If you're new to Dragon Quest, it's one of the original Japanese RPGs with art by Akira Toriyama (Dragon Ball Z). It plays exactly as you'd expect a classic JRPG to play. This is a port of the original PS4/3DS release, and it's kind of the best of both worlds. The graphics are downgraded (but hold up surprisingly well) on the Switchlight maps and textures are of a lower resolution, LoD settings have been tuned way down, and even world and character geometry has been simplified in comparison to the PS4 version. But this version has the additional 2D, '16-bit' mode, which is basically a whole new game with crossover points and the same story as the 3D mode. It's a solid port of an exceptional entry in one of the best and most important video game series ever. Probably worth getting.

I have this on PS4, too, but decided to play it on Switch because of all the additions and upgrades they put into this version. I don't take the Switch off the tv dock much but its nice to have that option when someone else in the family is hogging the tv. The game itself is fantastic, core Dragon Quest experiences... so glad we get most everything DQ related in the West nowadays. Highly recommended, this is the best version of the game!

I traded in the ps4 edition for this and I'm not disappointed. I'm getting a whole new 2d game and more store. On thing the ps4 version had that this one does not is targets. In the ps4 dq11, there were about 5 targets scattered across each region and you had to hunt them down. The switch version does not have them, which is actually a relief. The 2d game and 3d game are separate but with items carrying over and you can jump backwards into chapters to find things or replay story. You switch at the save points. One downside is that if you play 5 chapters of 3d and go backwards to ch 1 2d, you cannot jump forwards again to the newer chapter in 3d. You have to start at an equal place in the story to the older 2d chapter you're in. I'm very pleased with my purchase, and I highly recommend dqx1

This really is the Definitive Edition of this lovely game. The soundtrack and voice acting alone makes this worthy of your purchasing dollars. Lots of fun, really engaging. And if you're still not sure, check out the free, 10 hour long demo. But you won't make it too far in before heading out to pick this one up!

This is the best version of this game to play. Although graphically it is not the best - game play, features, music, etc. is all enhanced and even new from the PS4 and PC versions. Well worth a play on the Switch.

This game is a well developed and the game play both portable and Docked. The graphics is a notch above most games. I played the Demo and now the Physical game and can say being able to load the Demo save and continue is great. Gameplay is also intuitive once you learn them and doesn't require alot of memorization to get into the game. So for a 2019 game is a must have. Only issue is if you go portable with a graphics intensive game it will take a toll on the battery. But that is the trade-off that one takes but game play in return is one to experience.
Huge game, lots to explore and do. Combat is fun, most mechanics work well. Story is a slow burn, but good.

A lot of JRPG tropes are present in this game, both narratively and mechanically, but with some modernized twists on them to keep things fresh and less frustrating. Despite a few things that could still be modernized a bit more, the game's beautiful aesthetic and breezy gameplay make it a worthwhile venture.
Get it, Slaves. Go and get this, you filthy slaves. Filthy, FILTHY, FILTH slave.
Truly the definitive version of the game. I love the Akira Toriyama art.

Yeah I know the title may get some people riled up but THIS is the JRPG experience Ive been waiting for on the Switch. There are others that are very good, but this one really hits all the marks for me. From the story, to the characters, the music, the bright colors and great design...its all top notch. You can really tell all of the care the creative team put into this one.
Havent actually opened this yet but I really enjoyed the 10 hour demo. And everything transfers over to the full game!

Played before on PC and had to get the Switch version for all the enhancements it offers. 2D mode is awesome, though I wish the change was a bit more seamless than it actually is. It's understandable though, as it's basically switching to an entirely different game with a separate save file and everything. The orchestrated music is great as well. Pick it up if you are fan of Japanese console RPGs.
I am not a big fan of RPGs. This game was was fun to play.
It is a gift for someone...........................
Annoying music can not be turned off. The music is repetitive it becomes annoying very quickly. Do not recommend this game.
This takes me back to my childhood, a lot of beloved games are on this disc.
Doing this time of Covid-19 this game help with being in the house. I play this game with my husband every day. Also to play with your kids
My husband is back in the 80s and loving it. It is his childhood again. Really fun.
my 6 1/2 year old loves pac man... the big problem is getting him to stop :-)
Just like it was from back in the day, spending hours and quarters on the machine, but now right in your home
I wanted to play a game with my kids and this is an old-school game used to play thinking again
This game brought back memories from my childhood....
Can't beat the price and now they even have contactledd pick up at the door for your convenience!

Cool twist in pac man! I like it but I dont love it. Its enter for about 20 mins and then its too much of a trip on the one new pac man style game. Or the original version of the game is sloooow like there is a lag on it and it frustrating as all hek to me . So its an ok game but for me kinda irritating that original pac man to slow to wanna play at all.

I went into the store to find out more information about laptops with the intention to purchase a new one. The young man that helped me listened to me and my needs, and what my budget was. He immediately brought me to the computer that I ended up purchasing. He helped me with EVERYTHING from beginning to end and made sure that I had everything I needed to be able to complete my job on the computer. Thank you!

I'm a single mom in need of a good home computer for paying bills, kids doing homework, etc.. I asked the salesperson to help me pick something that was a good value and easy to set up with a large monitor. I was directed to the HP All in One computer, which i had already had my eye on. I love the modern look and white keyboard. he instructed me on what additional programs i would need to purchase and how to go about setting it up at home myself. It was so easy and user friendly. Setting up was a breeze with 'Cortana'. I have not used the touch screen much yet but I'm excited to explore and see what else I can do with my new PC!
Terribly disappointing that some of the most desired games are limited to online/ internet play only. The system is fine.
I absolutely love it great fit and easy to size to your needs.

So far I'm 30 hours in and the game is amazing! Must buy if you like collecting and training minions. Story starts slow but picks up the pace about an hour in. Has both English and Japanese voice acting so you can pick which ever you like. (The English voice acting was not for me.) Art style is a little childish but overall the world's have really nice details. Graphics could be better but still look great for a switch game.
If you have never played the first Ni No Kuni, this is HD remake is the best way to jump in. Smooth gameplay, and excellent graphics while docked and on the go!
This was one of my favorite games on PS3, and for this version to be so faithful to that is awesome. Saving is lightning fast and the story and graphics hold up beautifully.

While Ni No Kuni is a fantastic game nonetheless, please note that the Switch version IS NOT remastered. The Switch version is just a port from the original PS3 version of the game, but it includes all DLC. Definitely recommend if you like Studio Ghibli.
Great port of ni nu kuni and a must own for rpg fans.
Waiting for a patch, game gets buggy the further you play.
Unopened christmas gift so can't review...........
I collect switch games and buy any that are a good deal. This will stay Shrink wrapped for awhile.
A friend of mine recommended this game. So I got it for the family for Christmas. Hopefully its decent

I always wanted to get into the armored core games, but for various reasons was unable to. This game drew me in like few other games have, and I'm still playing it; grinding out online co-op missions. This is hands down my favorite game on the switch. If you're on the fence, try the demo, but I highly recommend it

this game has a learning curve...but try the demo out on the eshop because the more you learn and customize and upgrade ur mech the better the game gets!!! im happy to have this type of game on the switch and appreciate what they are trying to create so im not as critical as others have been with this game. i like it alot and this is without even touching the online multiplayer which i hope to play later but for now im happy and recommend it to others

This game is lots of fun. If you are looking for a good mech game, and don't want to import one from Japan, this is where you should go. The story isn't fantastic, but its not horrible. The game play is fun and the customization is really cool. There aren't many mech games available, so this is a good addition.

I tried the demo before picking up the game but personally it's a good pick up. If you wanted to pilot a robot, look here for a good time. The demo is on the E-shop and the cool feature is that your progress carries over from the demo to the full game and continue where you left off.

Once you mute the jrpg voices because they speak a lot. Now the battle sounds and music is pretty great and gameplay is fun it seems weird at first. Once you customize your character with the easy to understand stats it gets wonderful

As a fan of mech games this scratches an itch that has been lost in recent generations. The story isn't the greatest but the gameplay and customization level are what sell this game. Let's hope that Nintendo and Marvelous build on what's here and makes this an ongoing series.
If you're armored core fan, don't hesitate to get this game right now. The customization part and battle system are addicting though the storytelling and tons of characters are kind of confusing.

I've been eyeballing this game for a while. With it being on sale, I finally bought it. I haven't had much time to play it. So far, I've noticed this game requires 100% attention. I'm hoping to get more time on it soon. If anyone has played Damascus Gear on the vita, Daemon reminds me of it. For now, I'll give it a 3.5.

Bought this on sale for $50 and its very forgettable. It will entertain but there are better action games out there to play. This is a Switch exclusive and should continue to get polished down the road. If you could pick it up under $40 then I would recommend. Don't pay much more then that though.

This is a fun mech game but with so many other things coming out for the switch this is an average game that should be picked up on sale. It's definitely improved from the initial demo, the controls feel tighter and it's a more user friendly experience.

The gameplay in UFC 3 is really fun, despite them doing next to nothing with the ground work. The standup is really engaging, and the graphics look great. Career mode is unfortunately really shallow, and was misrepresented during marketing to be really in-depth. It's not. Ultimate Team is also, horrendously bad. It could easily be tweaked to become more enjoyable, but EA definitely relies heavily on microtransactions in all of their titles now, so I don't see it happening. It just takes a ridiculously long time to start earning any type of good move sets or fighters...unless you pay EA more money. Definitely a 'buy when on-sale' kind of game. Cannot recommend spending $60 in this.

This is the best UFC game to date! The striking system has been revamped, and is more realistic. Only negative so far is I think there should be more fighters. Especially in the Heavyweight Division. Hopefully they will release more fighters with updates, as in previous versions of the game.
Was a gift and they seemed to like it. The moves are a little tricky so it takes a little to get used to it.

Full disclosure this isnt first UFC game. Id never played one until recently with some friends and I enjoyed it enough to pick it up. The graphics and animations are amazing.
