I don't want to forget the fact that Persona 5 Royal includes all the DLC from the first edition of the game for free! One of the best games you can buy for the PS4.

Before I could play the regular release of Persona 5 on PS3 or PS4 they release this with all the bells & whistles... Plus on top of buying this new release I was also given a $10 gift card so its like I got the game for $49,99... So if you on the fence because you played it on PS3 or PS4 you will not be let down...
Simply the best JRPG ever made. So good even people who normally hate JRPGS could very well like this one. I suppose some would say it's not that great, but they're entitled to their wrong opinions.

Graphics: absolutely gorgeous. Sound/voice: every environment feels alive. Play with a high quality set of headphones to take advantage of the 360 recordings they made. The voices Senua hears throughout the game are very haunting and eerie. The actress who shares her likeness for the character Senua gave a brilliant performance. I loved those cutscenes where the camera is right up on her face and she gives it her all to convey this person going through some awful stuff. Gameplay: I think this is where people might start differing in opinion. The game has a linear path to follow with some slight openness to it (think of the first Uncharted game). Theres some environmental puzzles you need to solve that can be challenging at times and some can get a little tedious. Another thing Ive notice people complain about is the combat system. For me I quite enjoyed it. Its simple, yes but it gets the job done. Youve got to understand that this isnt a God of War game (apart from maybe the visuals) where youre chaining these combos up with some very punchy attacks. Hellblade is more of wait for an opportunity to strike, then strike. Theres an attack coming, dodge. With that said the way the camera is positioned, it all seems very cinematic and for me I enjoyed that. So in conclusion if you like that Viking setting and want a good but dark and depressing tale pick this one up. Its not a very long game but theres enough to bite on.

The developers of this game set out to make an independent game with the performance and visual fidelity of a AAA studio release. Considering how this title features done of the most realistic and impressive visuals this generation, I would say that they succeeded in that goal. While the game is somewhat short (8-10 hour playthrough), the story is still very much worth experiencing, as it tackles themes of mental illness in ways no other game has, and the performances are poinient and powerful, making the mystic and surreal story still feel real and believable. Though the combat and puzzles don't have the greatest amount of depth, I would still highly recommend this title for the story alone.
This was once a digital only game but glad its finally released physical
It's amazing to me that this game was originally an online only 'indie' title! It plays like a AAA title. The campaign is a little shorter for that same reason, but it is well worth the cost.

This game is an absolute masterpiece and will immerse you into the experience of those struggling with severe and persistent mental illness. This message is intricately weaved within the context of Norse Mythology, which provides an engaging gameplay. I strongly recommend watching the Accolades Trailer on YouTube that showcases fans messages to the developers on how the game impacted them and their understanding of mental health.

Excellent and unique action adventure game. It is short but has an exciting combat system similar to the one from Devil May cry. The game itself is short but challenging and the story is different from anything else I have played. Recommended!

I have no idea what having schizophrenia, multiple personalities or any other mental disease is like but if I had to imagine, it would come out something like this game. I'm getting to the second boss right now. Pretty amazing game, well done, fighting is easy and hard somehow, puzzles (so far) are a little too easy but rewarding, overall a great game. I would definitely suggest (and already have).

Going in, did not know what to expect outside of what the critics say about this game. Almost done with the game. It is short (invested around 6 hours so far with 2 areas to go), but bought for $15,99 with Playstation Play of Days sale price and gamers club still in effect. Sale ends June 17, 2019. Great story. Great art direction. Keeps you invested in the main character Senua. Combat system is pretty easy to get used to after a few fights. Without giving away a spoiler, I like the fact that the game added a mechanic that makes you think about your fights (too many deaths result in complete lost progress). No facerolling through this game. A lot of puzzles. Some stealth, exploration, and gathering involved in game. Each boss fight adds a new element on top of the normal enemies. Highly recommend this game for anyone that enjoys single player games. Made by Ninja Theory, same team that worked on ps3 game Heavenly Sword (also a short game) and Devil May Cry series. Have fun!

Excellent graphics. Excellent sound. Maybe not as good graphics as God of War 4, but it can certainly compete with it. Now, this being a game by Ninja Theory, you would expect stylish, stunning, intense fights. The fights feel shockingly primitive, so predictable, and you barely have to combine buttons, which makes the game feel too easy. I've been playing the game for 20 minutes and i've done nothing but run around solving pointless puzzles, fight boring fights. Simulation of Psychosis, and excellent sound are pretty much what makes this game feel special, and that's about it. I dont feel like playing it after 20 minutes. I would not recommend this game to anyone. Too bad i cant get my money back

This game is absolutely stunning. The graphics are unreal and beautifully life like. I would highly recommend this game if you still have a active gamers club account. If you do not you should still buy it but do it elsewhere because without gamers club at Bestbuy everywhere else is cheaper.
This game is overrated. I was slightly disappointed.

Played this back in 2017 when it was a digital only game and loved it. The story and graphics in it are amazing. It's not a really long game but I think it's easily worth this price for a 6 hour game. So thrilled they made a physical copy of it so I could add it to my collection.

This has basic game play and basic puzzle solving it is a liner game. The game itself can be played through a few times and it is a visual showcase with upgrades on pro. Has a decent narrative and concept to the story worth sitting down to experience. Worth having physical.
This is such an amazing game. Fantastic graphics, epic story, and tough puzzles. I had to have the physical edition as soon as it released.
Hellblade: Sensua's Sacrifice is a game that is worth all of the praise and accolades that it is getting. Definitely worth a play.
A great digital only games finally gets a physical copy. Picked this one up as it surprised me back when it was download only. Great storytelling.

The game looks amazing and is an interesting concept, however, if you have any minor or severe mental health issues you should avoid this game. There are support groups for those who were traumatized by this game. If you know you are 100% able to handle this game mentally then enjoy because it truly is a masterpiece considering it's an indie game.

Finished within a day, I was hooked on the story and learning about Senua's character and her struggles with reality. From soft and creepy to harsh and angry, the ASMR really immerses you in the confusion and grief she has of the past. Coupled with an occasional fight and plentiful puzzles, it takes a while to make sense of everything and eventually realize the true journey taken.

I am highly impressed with this companies ability to incorporate accurate historical information as well as accurate representation of psychosis. Not to mention the amazing graphics. Well worth a play

The game is incredible in every waygraphics, music, acting, designexcept that its completely impossible to play. The combat is too difficult even on Easy mode, and this comes from someone who is playing Horizon Zero Dawn on ultra hard with no cheats.

Hellblade was an unexpected gem of 2017, its the only game I pre-ordered this year, because I was immediately drawn to it after seeing its first trailer. Upon playing it, it confirmed why I was drawn to it in the first place. Its a beautiful game, great gameplay, an interesting story, and truly captures the unpredictable and personal demons of mental illness. Hands down and by a country mile, this is my pick for Game of the Year, and Ive played most major games released this year.
This game was recommended to me for over a year. Ive played it once or twice since picking it up. Yes, its worth all the hype.

I purchased this game as a gift to myself for Christmas because I have heard so many great things about this game, and I will tell you this game did not let me down! I have beaten the game since then and getting ready to go through it one more time! That said, once I played this game I went online looking for more information about the game and I must say for such a small dev team Ninja Theory did an outstanding job with this project! So good I want to buy this game for all of my friends so they can experience it! Well too bad because my local BB has sold out of them at this point! That said, I can not say enough great things about this game! 6 STARS!

This game is cool, you play as the hero and go around beating the baddies. However, I do have issue with them using bad words in the game title so I have to take a point off. Maybe if the game were called something nicer like Heckblade then I'd give it five star.

FFX is excellent, and it's nice that FFX-2 is included as well. This will be my 6th playthrough of FFX. My biggest gripe with the game is that FFX-2 is a DIGITAL DOWNLOAD! Not only that, but the cartridge is REQUIRED to play the digitally downloaded game! Not cool, especially since the international release has both games available on the cartridge. On the whole, not a bad purchase though.

I really enjoyed this edition of the series, I was very excited to get it for the Switch. Game play is just as I remember it and the graphics are smooth, just remember that you can save as many files as you want, but to load a save file you have to close the came and restart it. Please be aware that the cartridge only comes with FFX on it physically, and it has X2 on the menu but grayed out until you go to the Nintendo eShop and use the code that comes inside the box to download X2 and have it install on the Switch itself. This concerns me, as the impression it gives is that this cartridge contains both games, not one game and a download. I'm worried that when I loan it to my son to play on his switch, will he have to download the rest to play X2? Will he be able to? Will he be able to use the same code that came with the game? Is the code a 1 time use code? If the X2 is installed on the unit itself, can I play it without the cartridge? I haven't tested any of these questions yet since I've been playing FFX non-stop since i bought it, but it bothers me that this was not explained until I opened the packaging, opened the case, and found a slip of paper with a tiny sentence saying to go to the Nintendo eShop and enter the code to get the rest of the game.
This is such a great game! X2 is a download code and takes up quite a bit of memory.

I am about 8 hours into the game, and so far it's been fantastic. It brings back all these amazing memories I had when I played these games back in the PS2 days. Makes me feel so good to see beloved characters in HD
Surprised me how well this game held up. Loved it in college and still a great game. May not be as open world as some of the newer games but love it all the same

I wish you could review this game at a higher rating. 5/5 just doesn't do it justice. This is NOT the standard version of FFX that released in the US. This is the International Version which includes all of the Dark Aeons and Penance. If you love FFX, then you will love FFX HD Remastered even more. One of the best in the series of FF games.

I missed out on playing final fantasy X back in the PS2 days. I owned it but never got to it before giving up video games while in college. Almost 2 decades later i still don't have much time but the switch reawakened my video game availablity and i scooped this up. I am 20hrs in an loving it. Almost glad that this is my first playthrough. You won't be disappointed!

Game looks great on Switch, after seeing the PS4 version i wasnt expecting this game to look as good, but to my eye seeing them side by side, i couldnt tell them apart plus the switch version i can take on the go. Sound quality is excellent Game plays great. Plus includes final fantasy X-2 as a download code i was hoping it would be on the cartridge. Highly recommended

This is now my 4th copy of this game that I purchased. Being the first final fantasy game Ive ever played it holds a special place in my heart. Being able to play it while binging my favorite shows in the background has made it a million times better.

I have played this game on the ps2, ps vita, and ps4 and this game never gets old. So of course i had to pick it up on the Switch. This game plays and looks great and being able to play anywhere makes it well worth another play through. The only downside of this game is that X-2 is a download code sadly.

Great game! This was a favorite on the PS2. Loading times are reduced since it is no longer a disc. The only complaint I have is the X-2 is a download and not part of the physical copy. It was a little annoying to have to download a whole game even though I purchased a physical copy.

I have been playing Final Fantasy since it first came out on the NES. (I know, I am aging myself), and of all the games Final Fantasy X has been my favorite. I had wanted it for a handheld, portable device, but when it was released on the PS Vita, I was a broke college student who couldn't afford the game, much less the Vita to play it. Now that I am older, and have a steady income, I preordered this for the Switch the day I was able. And I don't regret it one bit! The graphics are amazing! So much so, if you pay attention you can see little mistakes that didn't matter in the original version, but in HD can be seen. Does that take away from the game at all? NO!! The story line is just as wonderful as I remember, and being able to play Final Fantasy X on the go is a dream come true. My main/only complaint is that FFX-2 was a download code, and not actually on the cartridge or on its own. I can understand why they did that, but I don't like it. TL;DR--Great game made even better by being portable. Highly recommended!
This game is a must own. Final fantasy x is one of the greatest games ever made, in my opinion. While x-2 isnt as strong, this game is still worth a purchase.
They did an incredible job on this remaster of Final Fantasy X, I'm having a blast reliving 2002.
Better remaster then Skyrim hands down this is a must buy

This is one of the gameS that got be into JRPGs back in the day. I have now bought and played it on three different systems and dont regret it for a moment. It is wonderful to be able to play it on the go as well. The story is great and the battle system is one of my favorites with the overdrive system and the quick party swap ability. The sphere grid leveling system makes the process more flexible and interesting. All in all, on of my favorite games of all time on one of my favorite systems of all time.

Probly a great game but it really hasnt grasped my attention. Graphics look great and handheld is a plus. I just have to many other games and it didnt make me have to play it it was so fun or had my intrest.

Revisit these classic games from the PS2 era with updated content and brighter visuals. These are 2 great games for one price if you have never played them before. My one and only nitpick is that both games are not on the cartridge and one of them must be downloaded with the use of a code provided in the physical US release. Would personally recommend the Asian English release for that very reason in order to preserve its physical form factor since Switch games are not region locked.

I absolutely love this game, and have from the first time it came out years ago on the PlayStation. The characters are extremely easy to get attached to, and the development of each lets you tailor them to your favorite play style. It just recently came out on Xbox, and now the Nintendo Switch. Its time to reacquaint myself with all of my friends from Spira!

Just like when it was released on the PS2, I'm obsessed all over again. Lots of memories, and thinking why did I ever get rid of my old game guides? Now I'm scrambling to find used ones at good prices. I have not played this on TV, just on the Switch screen, but it looks great. Only complaints are that load times between scenes are a bit sluggish and that FFX-2 is a download code, it's not on the cartridge. I don't get that, it seems that it should have been on the cartridge or if they do not make a cartridge with enough storage, then a second cartridge be packaged for FFX-2. If I wanted digital versions of my games, I would not have bought the physical version.

I've been trying to get into the Final Fantasy series for a while (enjoyed XV, hated Type-0 HD, enjoying FFXII: the Zodiac Age so far) and Final Fantasy X is a mixed bag. You can definitely tell it's from an older era in games. The dreaded 'Resident Evil' camera is in full effect, and even in a pretty linear game, it's not totally clear what you're supposed to do next. While the mechanics are definitely outdated, the graphics are still stunning, and the voice acting is really good. What kept me going through this kinda clunky game was the story and characters, which I enjoy a lot. Best Buy's rating system only does full stars, but I would say it's a 3 and a half.

I have so many fond memories of this game and continue to throw money at it. I have owned it for the PS2, PS3, PS4, and now the Switch. This is one of the top 3 games I have ever had the privilege to play and love the story and progression system. Last time I played it I logged 180 hours in to it. That should tell you how awesome I think this game it. The Switch port runs smooth and the only strike I will give it is the X-2 digital download for the US edition. I'm not even a big RPG fan but this game was amazing!!

FF X/X-2 runs & performs great on the Switch. It seems on par with the PS4 version of the game. The music & graphics are solid, and the story is very engaging with a good pace throughout. Only slight issue with the physical copy of it, is that X-2 Isnt on the cart, & has to be downloaded from the eshop, & can only be played while the game cart is in the system.

I was a fan of the original game on the first PlayStation and this version of the game is just as great as the original and even better! So much content is in this and many hours of fun are waiting to be had. Be sure to pick this up, definitely the best PS4 kart racer. Oh and the PS4 version has extra content that other versions do not!

This game has personally become my favorite kart racer even 1 UPing Mario Kart 8 Deluxe because of its skill ceiling and rewarding gameplay when you master the controls. Its way faster, more responsive, and puts you in control but, I do have a WARNING. This game is way harder than Mario Kart 8 in every way and if you are completely new to this game DO NOT PUT THE DIFFICULTY TO HARD YOU WILL REGRET IT. Hard should be categorized as INSANE because the A.I. does not hold back at all and will completely focus you and will catch up extremely quickly when you are in the lead. So start off with the difficulty on easy, you will thank me later. Once you finish adventure mode then start ramping up the difficulty. Other than that the amount of tracks, character customization, and adventure mode are Amazing.

Single Player: I believe there are 31 tracks to race in this game, all of them are a blast; although there is a learning curve that can be a bit strong for players new to kart racers. Solid A. Couch Co-op: My kids and I are having a great time racing and playing the battle modes. Most notably are the flag capture and crystal collecting battle modes. It will frustrate you in all the right ways. A+. Online multiplayer: I'm not waiting too long for matches, and the races run smoothly. The learning curve is the steepest here, you are required to fully understand thid game's mechanics to place high in these races. I haven't tried the battle modes online yet, i'll review those at a later time. Solid A. Performance: I haven't encountered any bugs or glitches in this game, and the FPS remains stable, even during all of the explosions and madness that can happen in 4 player couch co-op battle modes. The game looks beautiful. A+. Cons: Activision has you flip through a total of some 60+ pages of terms and conditions before playing the game for the first time. You can breeze through in seconds, but it was a little rediculous. I haven't seen any microtransactions yet, so hopefully they aren't ever added. Final notes: Unless you want to play this game on the go, the PS4 version is the definitive way to play. It includes extra skins, stickers (in-game), and if i'm not mistaken, the retro track is PS4 exclusive too. If you like Mario Kart, this is a bit more challenging of a game. If you like the original CTR games, you'll love this itteration. At $40, it's a great value.
If you're a fan of the original ps1 version you'll love this. Definitely harder than the original, but in a fun way.
Its for play with someone and having family good time.

I almost waited for a price drop on this but it is totally worth paying full price for. I initially thought CTR didn't deserve a remaster and they should move on to new games. Well, now I consider it one of the best remasters ever. I liked the Crash Trilogy remasters, but I felt like they weren't good enough to make me never play the originals again. I played the og CTR for about an hour before getting this and I can confidently say I never need to play that one again. This update is that good. They went above and beyond with this. The speed and handling of the carts is so much better. There are twice as many characters and twice as many tracks as the original. The level designs are exquisite, almost too impressive. I constantly find myself paying attention to the level designs and not the race. The best new control feature is the drift boosts. It is so incredibly satisfying to pull off a turbo drift. I have no complaints and the only common criticism I've heard is the loading screens are too long. However, they are still shorter than the original game and it's not that big of a deal to wait 20 seconds between races. Pet your animal, stretch, grab a handful of chips or just contemplate the meaning of existence during this time and you'll be fine.
The game is crazy fun and I can not believe how great it looks!

I had the original ctr as a kid and loved it so I bought this. I like the extras they updated with while retaining the original gameplay and tracks. I have yet to try the online part as my internet is sub par but the adventure mode and challenges are a blast.

This should really be a 4.5 star review, but a few things kept me from rounding up. Hopefully, updates will address these few flaws. CTR is a wonderful remake/ reboot that falls into both categories, grabbing maps & characters from the entire series. Even if you never played the originals, this is probably the best Kart racer in all of the PlayStation's history (I'd put ModNation from PS3 right alongside it) and certainly the closest you'll get to the King of Karting, in Mario Kart. If you're familiar at all with Kart racing- race with zany characters on courses just as crazy while picking up power-ups that either give you an advantage or rain on opponents' parades, you know what to expect. Some thinga that set it apart include a ton of different costumes for characters, often going beyond clothing to complete reskins (Skunk Bandicoot!) As well as cosmetics for the vehicles- paint jobs, new tires, even entirely new bodies. Which brings us to the first issue: while nothing costs real money, roughly 70% of all items get unlocked via in-game currency, and the payouts are BEYOND weak. Often, you're talking about a race earning double digits in rewards (no coin pickups on the tracks themselves,) at around 60 coins for a win (depending on several factors,) with unlocks often costing in the thousands. The second, and perhaps the biggest drawback are the controls, with only two schemes on offer (no personal remapping,) and neither utilize controls that have been the standard since the end of PS2 era for any racing games. The standby R2= accelerate/ L2= brake/ reverse is nowhere to be found, outside of one scheme that allows R2 usage. Brake & reverse? No, not only is it never mapped as L2, they're two entirely separate entities, with brake always assigned as square, and reverse always, for some unknown reason, set to the D-Pad. As an adult, it's hard enough rewiring my brain after 2 1/2 generations of consoles for this bizarre scheme, but what's more infuriating is that with CTR's family-friendly (and 4 person couch racing! Yay!) Is that it presents an even bigger hurdle of frustration for younger players (I have a 6y/o that LOVES racing games,) to the point of surrender in the early goings. This may be based on 'nostalgia,' as the original CTR debuted on PS1, and the early controller didn't feature thumbsticks, but there's a reason racing games have universally adopted 'trigger' gas & brakes... it's better and more intuitive. Lastly, you may have read about lengthy load times in professional review sites. Perhaps it was updated some prior to my purchase, because while they are a bit longer than you'd expect, they aren't atrociously long. All of these things are relatively low-maintenance issues that hopefully, Beenox will address in future updates. If not, it would be a shame, but nothing worth discarding a purchase over. The biggest issue, the controls, can be adapted to after playing some races, while the skins have two advantages in that you're not being forced to shell out actual cash, despite CTR coming in at a budget price; and nothing in the skin shop 'leaves'. It resets every 24 hours, but per Beenox, it's only a rotation of items. You'll never lose out on an item by not having enough coins, you'll either need to wait until your desired item returns, OR, If you own everything in that category, your final item will remain and not be rotated out while you gather up the necessary currency. Overall, a very fun game that's perfect for family nights or for when the younger ones have friends over, as long as you give it a bit of patience, both for the controls and for earning goodies.

The graphics and framerate on ps4 pro is the definitive version to enjoy best. The HDR looks amazing and the online lobby has more people on ps4 than xbox so if online is your thing this is the right version to get. The switch has this too but it looks and plays miserable there. I leave my switch for mario kart and the ps4 to crash a perfect balance. Only reason i give 4 stars is they made the AI too cheap and not realistic. The enemy can get blasted but will catch up again in seconds
Since i play on this on the first ps1 i never been disappointed
Good game for kids only to spend some time, Mario kart is better
Good gameplay, but not a very long single player mode.

Was really enjoying CTR as everything about it controls well and is an overall fun game! BUT activision ended up adding microtransactions after I purchased the game. This sullies the entire experience of being able to earn new items and characters in game. Would definitely give it a solid 4.5 but out of principle will give a 1-star due to this scummy practice.

Really well put together and a great remake. However, the game was designed from the ground up to be a grindfest unless you make a bunch of microtransactions to buy Wumpa coins, which really isn't appropriate for a full-price game marketed to children and nostalgia lovers. Very disappointing solely due to the microtransactions. Shouldn't have to put more money into something that was once a classic fun game

As someone who played the original CTR 20 years ago, this game is filled with nostalgia for me but it still remains a great cart racer suitable for all ages. It's downright stunning visually, it's more challenging than Mario Kart, and the tracks are all unique. Highly recommended!

I was torn between purchasing this on my Switch or PS4. I purchased it for the PS4 and I am not disappointed! The graphics have come a long way since its release with the first Playstation Console. It has more adventures and modes to choose from than I can remember. May just pick this one up for the Switch too!
Great to see them remake one of the best kart racers from 20 years ago. It's a bit different to control but there's so many tracks, plus online, it's s good value.

I have always loved the kart racing genre and give every new title a fair shot to see how it stacks up against the longtime king: Mario Kart. While Crash Team Racing is a beautiful game with fun characters/tracks, and loads of updates from Activision... I just didnt enjoy the gameplay unfortunately. Their isnt much variety with the power ups, drifting doesnt feel natural (yet is critical to use), and when I win a race it feels like its more out of luck than due to skill. Fair or not, its inevitable to compare it to Mario Kart which does a great job of keeping things competitive without rubber-banding or relying on constant drifting. Crash Team Racing just doesnt matchup unfortunately.
The game means well but its just a cheap rip off of Mario Kart and just isnt close
I got this game for the kiddos visiting for the summer, and we have been playing it non-stop! So glad that we are able to play together as a family.

I think the difficulty is broken. The graphics is not that great. It feels like I was still playing in a ps3 games with a 720 resolution. I am very disappointed. For $39,99, definitely not worth it. Wait for it to be on sale.
This is a good remake of the old Crash racing games, but not much was added. Could do better with some of the options available.
I thought it would be a fun game to get but its nothing amazing. Its a generic race game with the crash characters. Can play online and do adventure mode. I

The game is rather tough at higher difficulty. The graphics are average at best....more PS3 or lesser. The good part is we can play 4 players locally, so it's a good family game for parents and the kids. In all honesty, we like Mario Kart and even Beach Buggy Racing better than this.
Great job on the remaster for this game. I wish the settings were defaulted to the original ways and not the new ones.

The good: kids get to play with legos in a free-roam environment, and you won't be stepping on them or yelling at your kids to pick them up. The bad: kids still want regular legos that will result in us yelling at them to pick them up and stepping on them. Fun game for younger kids.

I thought the concept of the game sounded interesting but the negative reviews made me second guess purchasing. The game is a little clunky and draw distances are bad, but the amount of creative things you can do and build are loads of fun. You can ride in a number of different vehicles and aircraft, mine underground, explore underwater, or build your own lego town. Very diverse gameplay and building options keep it interesting in spite of the bugs of the game.
Really fun game with exploring in an open world/level design. I really like discovering things with the discovery tool.
If your son loves legos and video games this is perfect for them!
My 5 year old got this game for his birthday. He absolutely loves it and it is easy enough for him to play on his own but entertaining enough that it is fun for us to play together as a family!
This Nintendo switch game is awesome but my grandsons a little too young still at three years old to be able to play but then again in a couple more years its game on !!
fun to make stuff, unlock items, and build. my 7 year old plays it, thinks its the best lego game yet. he wasn't a big fan of minecraft. so this is probably a good alternative.
I play this with my 7 year old and he really likes it. Lots to do.

The game is a lot of fun and I have put about ten to fifteen hours in the game since my purchase. The game does crash every now and then and unfortunately it caused a glitch where I lost one of my unlockable with no way to reunlock it now that I have progressed past that point. The game is compatible to a Lego No Mans Sky.
Wow! Awesome game. One of the TOP legislature games made on any syatem

I really wanted to like this game. Ever since it was released on PC in early access I've been wanting to get it but at the same time my gaming rig died. When I saw it on the switch I was excited. The game would have been fun but the pop-in is so bad that it makes the experience miserable. Your character can be walking and a tree will appear right in front of them. I don't mind pop-in when it is objects in the background but immediate foreground pop-in!! Makes me think that the developers gave up. They had to have noticed it but released it to the masses anyway and hoped we wouldn't notice. I DID.
My son enjoys this game he had it on ps4 and wanted it for the switch and loves it.
Good game for Switch as you can play in bite sized pieces of extended periods. If you like previous Lego games you should like this

Lego games are always a great way to experience unique story telling. They are fun and challenging for both kids and adult kids!!! I know we are all still kids even if its just at heart!!! Have Fun And Play On!
I wasn't really sure what to expect when buying this game. In my opinion it's more of a children's game. Didn't really hold my attention.
Lego Games are a go to for my daughter as well as my wife. they both enjoy playing them together.

This game is similar to Minecraft, but in a Lego theme. There is a lot of good things within this game. It is currently available on other consoles but decided to buy it again for the Switch. Looking forward to having fun with my child when it comes out.

This game plays similarly to other Hitman games. There are only a handful of missions, but the challenges guide players to complete each mission multiple times in a variety of ways. If you don't care much for completing a mission over again, you will finish the game very quickly. However, if you explore every option to complete each mission, you can find yourself playing this game for a very long time. Not to mention, there are also an endless amount of other missions created by other players. The overall gameplay is fun, but I would probably classify this as an intermediate difficulty game and requires a good amount of patience. If you enjoy stealth games, I'm sure you'll enjoy this one!
This game takes an eternity. It has multiple ways to accomplish a mission. But its fun as hell.

After trying Hitman series for first time, it becomes clear how fun, addicting and awesome it feels to use strategy and wits in various situations. You get to make hits in challenging ways in different locations and countries. It's a good time.
I loved the original Hitman games and they just really outdid themselves on this one. The graphics and gameplay are great and theres a ton to do. Cant wait for the second one to come out

Hitman Absolution on the PS3 was one of my hidden gems when I owned that console. I loved that game, everything was great about it, I was still finding ways to complete contacts even when I had to sell it due to getting a PS4. Hitman for PS4 is just more of everything I loved plus even more.

I love this game becasue it has soo many options on how you play etc. plus you can basically start and stop when you want. I can't spend hours playing anymore so it's a perfect game to jump into ans play for a bit and move on. Looks great on the 4k TV even though it's not 4K

I love stealth games, and this delivers. Like most, I wasnt a fan of the episodic release format, but the game itself is fantastic, and obviously that doesnt apply to this particular product anyway. Its pretty immersive, each sandbox they give you has dozens (potentially hundreds) of methods. Takes patience but when you finally nail a mission exactly how you wanted, its super rewarding. It handles smoothly and it looks awesome. Its also very much a challenge.
I am still trying to get into the game. The begging of the game is hard to get the hang of.
I was not very happy with this game. the game feels like a puzzle. It doesn't really have a story either.

I don't care for this style of game play personally having to replay the same mission over and over to complete different challenges. If you are a die hard Hitman fan you will enjoy I'm sure. I wish I wouldn't have purchased it due to my preferences.

I loved Nioh 1 and thought the game did an outstanding job expanding upon the foundation of Soulborne. Having multiple stances is refreshing. But one underlying issue was the artificial difficulty that pitted you against unrelentless bosses. We play these games because of the challenge, but Team Ninja thinks challenge means unfair difficulty. I still solo'd the game. Nioh 2 though takes extreme difficulty to another level of absurdity. Not only are bosses resistant to fatigue, they spam every move they have within seconds of one another. And Nioh 2 introduces the Dark Realm where the entire area/arena slows stamina regeneration. The game handicaps you for half its run time in the Dark realm. And if anyone know what Yokai realms are, enemies seem to drop them more than I remember in the first game, and they occupy the dark realm as well. Outside of the difficulty issues, the level design is much better than the first, more enemies variety, flawless gameplay, and content for days. The story is still a convoluted mess told in cool '10 second' cutscenes a piece it feels. Team Ninja still did not fix the inventory and loot management system. Selling, dismantling, and sacrificing unused gear/weapons is a chore upon itself. Honestly if you are a newcomer, this game is very confusing especially with the new yokai abilities. I beat the first and still find this game to be information overload. Skills trees, excessive loot and accompanying stats, lore illustrations, stances, etc. It is a lot to take in, yokai burst/abilities. At this point I'm level 76 and feel comfortable with everything, but it is overwhelming in the beginning. This will not be enjoyed by casuals by the slightest. I like the challenge so bring it on, but for Nioh veterans complaining the dlc was an unfair mess...you will find Team Ninja just doesn't understand why people like these games. Unfair difficulty is not it bro!!! I. have a love/hate relationship with Nioh 2.
I absolutely loved playing the first game and this one looks just as good.
Great collection of games! Includes both us and jp versions
great collection of games! great gameplay, good story and tons of content for your money. awesome art gallery and music player as well.

Yeah you read the title right, all of the games are on the cart, that's impressive for Capcom considering the original and X series games required to download the other half of the collection. Which, is annoying since one reason you're probably buying physical is to not eat up all the space on the microSD card. This is a really solid collection, 4GBA games, 2 DS games and a ton of art, music and so on. This is honestly the definitive way to play this series, this extends to the other console releases, let me explain why. the GBA games are accurately depicted and are very fun titles- but the Zero games are very, very hard. The collection adds in 2 OPTIONAL modes, a checkpoint mode which allows you to start from a tagged check point like most other platfromers and casual mode. I can't comment on casual but checkpoint mode is VERY helpful. You spawn at the last checkpoint and have full HP and you don't lose a life. Say what you will about making the game easier, I don't find Zero 1's live system very fair otherwise. If you don't want to use these systems, you can entirely turn them off. I played the Megaman X games a lot and found them fun (well, 1,2,4, at least), these games do seem to ramp the difficulty up a bunch. ZX series is where the collection really shines in terms of being improved via this collection. The second screen is represented through a few different display options and is operate-able via the right analog stick. This lets you select moves on the fly or customize some skills. What makes the ZX games BEST here is, they used the original high res videos from back then as well as better voice samples. So the presentation is vastly improved vs the original DS which only sported a 192p screen. The ZX games also come with the checkpoint & casual mode. The controls are fully customizable in the options screen, but you have to do it in each, game. So hit start, then R then select what you want the controls to be. The GBA games are hard, but with the checkpoint system they're far less nasty and I think most can handle it now. They're great games that should be given a look, it was really apparent that the dev team enjoyed what they were making here and they made the game really stand out with nice visuals & utilizing the full effects of the GBA and later the DS. The only thing I can really complain about is, I wish they re-worked the games, like SEGA did with Sonic CD adding in wide screen. Because of the game's original hardware's low res, there's a bit of screen crunch that can make for some cheap deaths if you're not cautious.
A bunch of classic mega man zero games all in one package. Every game is a fun experience and the new modes help make the game easier if someone just wants a casual experience
OMG... now i finally have all megamans in my nintendo switch. Yeesss

If you like Harvest Moon-esk games this will be right up your alley. I got this game on a whim because I wanted something chill to play, and after only playing through a few in-game days I was pleasantly surprised at how fun this game is. It's a bit of a page turner as you just keep wanting to play 'one more day,' and suddenly you've played through a week. I've often found myself playing this game for much longer than I had originally intended as it really does pull you in.
Download was quick and easy. Really enjoying this game! Easy to kill a few minutes, or hours with. I really like the variety of things to do.

I bought this primarily because of the story of the developer, who built the whole thing himself and seemed like a nice chap. Well done! Also, people say the game is great. I mostly agree. It's fun. Improving your farm is enjoyable. Fishing and raising your animals is rewarding, too, though I had to look up how to do it, as the game doesn't explain itself very well. Cave spelunking is a little more action-oriented, for days when you're in the mood for that kind of thing. So it was time well spent, but I found myself putting it down after a few seasons. There was not enough direction for me; I felt as though I was passing the time rather than playing a game. Pleasant enough, but I'd rather just read a book. Still, an enjoyable time, and well worth $15.
Picked this up for my partner when she first got her Switch, she spent 80 hours within the first week.
I love getting lost in Stardew Valley. It's a charming farming simulator that draws you in if you let it and has real depth.
I was terrified that I would not be the type of player who would enjoy this game. Im not sure how many times I googled is Stardew Valley fun? before I made the dive. Honestly, Im so glad that I did!
This game is a great RPG at first I was unsure I would enjoy it much but boy was I wrong! One of my favorites games right bow

I got this for my daughter so she could play with me. Single player is fun, and multiplayer is the same with other people. It's a great time. Do recommend, especially if you have friends to play with.

...because it's very likely you'll lose the next few weeks to it. This game just oozes charm from the art style, music, villagers...everything. It's complex enough to really draw you in, but yet still very simple and cathartic. Stardew Valley is my go-to game when I want to just relax and unwind after a long day!

It sounds like a simple farming sim, but it is much more. You have relationships with the people in the town, explore, fight monsters, and craft useful items. The 8bit graphics only add to the charm of this game. Highly recommended!
Endless farming and grinding, but not in a bad way. A great way to kill time, especially when on the Nintendo Switch.

I love this game. It has a little bit of everything from the obvious farming sim to the dungeon crawling mines. I sank about 30 hours into this game the first week I had it. It is a time vampire in the best possible way. The digital code was delivered shortly after purchase.
Kept the boy busy for maybe a day or two but a decent game.

I really didnt expect to like this game so much. I purchased it before going to my parents for a long Christmas break, figured it'd be a good sit on the couch type game. I ended up loving the game and can barely put it down now. It's not something I think I can recommend to anyone because I don't know why I like it, but I do and it's so oddly addicting.
The graphics may be old but this game is very deep and I spend lots of hours just playing and having fun.

Yes, it's very similar to the original Left 4 Dead, and yes, the game-play is pretty much the same, but how much can you vary the sequel to a zombie game? Left 4 Dead 2 = Shoot the super-fast cross-country running zombies before they nom at your brain. With 4 hilariously stereotypical characters, a load of guns and melee weapons, and very creative maps. After you play through the game yourself, this is probably best if you have at least 1-3 other friends that own it. It's a great game to play with friends, because the replay value stays quite high with the amount of variety the AI director throws your way. Plus, it's a nice game to see which of your friends crack under the pressure of a zombie apocalypse. Go buy it. Make sure to grab your samurai sword and plenty of bullets, you'll need them.

Listen, guys. You, a few buddies, and a zombie apocalypse. What more needs to be said, eh? But seriously, with a fully-loaded arsenal of zombie slaying equipment and a few friends to help you smash skulls, you will be racing to catch your breath, running from safehouse to safehouse, and narrowly avoiding your own demise (hope you grabbed that med-pack...) until you somehow manage to escape the horde at the very last minute with but a few last headshots and a pipe bomb or two. Of course, if you'd rather just pummel your zombified opponents to the grave (again?), there is always the melee option (and one I'd strongly recommend - especially taking the ol' golf club to a few 'baddies' like you're Tiger Woods or sumpthin'). Just watch out for Tanks! And WITCHES! Please, PLEASE don't disturb the witches! Unless you've got a death wish - or a buddy that's quick to lay down some heavy fire on your behalf. Otherwise, they'll dedicate the episode to you - our fallen survivor...

Very fun game. If you have played the original, the basic concept is the same: You start in a safe room with 3 other survivors and basic weapons, and try to make it to the safe room at the end of the level, pciking up more powerful weapons along the way. There are the basic zombies, which will come at you en mass, and then there are the special zombies. Special zombies have niche roles, all of which are aimed at either doing massive damage, or dragging you away from the group to kill you. While one person can kill endless amounts of basic zombies, special zombies often require teamwork to kill, so the players that runs ahead or falls behind the group will often die first. This means that teamwork and sticking together become a neccessity to beat the levels. The game starts off with 4 environments, in which there are 4 or 5 levels for each. The game itself is not that long and can easily be beaten in less than a day, but it is the replayability that makes the game so much fun. Since the number of zombies that spawn and their spawning location are always random, each level is a different experience each time you play. In addition, you can also play multiplayer mode, where the special zombies are actually other players trying to prevent you from finishing the level. As stated previously, this game is especially fun for the multiplayer experience and the replayability, if you do not have xbox live, and no one to play with locally, you might want to grab another title such as Dead Rising 2.

Bought this game when it first came out years ago. We got a new puppy who ate it so I had to replace it. How many games do you own that if, two or three years after you purchased it, you would have to rush out and replace if it were lost or damaged? Off hand, I'm not sure I can think of one other than Left 4 Dead (1 and 2). I won't go on and on talking about the game itself (game review mags and websites can do a much better job than myself) but I will summarize by saying it is the ultimate online co-op experience. It is endlessly re-playable and years later the developer continues to provide new downloadable content to keep the experience fresh. Even buying this game twice, I have gotten my money's worth out of it many times over. This game is a classic.

Left 4 Dead 2 is a fantastic game. Especially if you are looking for some co-op play. Mainly it's a shoot em up (or...smash/chainsaw/chop) but it takes a bit of strategy sometimes to defeat the final levels. They give you a lot of options to adjust so that you can play the game many times over.
awesome from the very begining to the very end!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Just like the first LEFT 4 DEAD game, this sequel is just as awesome, but definitely more challenging. There are so many more weapon options. follow this link to see: linklink game is more of a challenge since it's a story-line from the first campaign level all the way through to the last one. there are also different challenges in each level; there's more to it than just playing through, then signaling for help and waiting to be rescued. Both LEFT 4 DEAD and LEFT 4 DEAD 2, are alot of fun.
I don't play many 'zombie' games, but this one caught my attention. It's fun and addicting.

Don't get me wrong, this is a good game but if you've played the first installment, this is very familiar. The developers were obviously looking for the $$$ sign when they developed this. They thought oh let's change the characters, setting, added some weapons and some new zombies it will be good. This feels very familiar with the first installment with minor changes and that's undeniable. You can probably get more value if you play more online. The overall stlye of the game and yes even engine seems to be the same as the 1st one. With Modern Warfare 2, Uncharted 2 etc. out - it will be difficult for this game to find a good niche in the market. Seriously, if you still have the 1st one and you play mostly online it's probably a good idea to wait for a few months for the price to drop.
If you love zombies, you have to get this game. Better than the first.
I purchased this game for my son who is stationed overseas. Another soldier also got the game and they have been able to play against/with each other and have really enjoyed it.

Ok, first off, if you don't like zombies, stop reading this. If you do like zombies, BUY THIS GAME IMMEDIATELY. It has 5 campaigns that all go in a story, 4 characters, and around 20 weapons. It also has 4 modes called Survival, Versus, Realsim (new), and Scavenge (new). In sirvival, you have a team of four people and you try to survive as long as you can. In versus, your team and another team switch off trying to kill the survivors as the infected while the survivors go through the campaigns. In scavenge, your team faces another team and you both try to collect as many gas cans while the other team tries to stop you. Overall, buy this game, it might teach you how to survive a zombie apocalypse.

This game isn't for everyone. The 'mature' rating is quite appropriate with the level of carnage and graphic detail that goes into killing zombies. Everything from chopping off heads with machetes, attracting hoards with pipe bombs, and yes, using a chain saw to cut the zombies in two. Needless to say, I loved it. It was challenging and intense as a video game should be. Sometimes it became less fun as it became extremely difficult, but don't let that shy you away from the game. There are several different modes of play. Offline you can only play with 2 players per console which is a bummer. Online campaign mode however allows you to play with 4 persons under the main characters Nick, Coach, Rochelle, and Ellis. Valve did a great job on many elements of the game. Notably is the way the infected take damage. There are over 40 different ways the zombies can take damage, and each weapon has some special damage abilities. Valve also managed to lace in some humor to the game which provides some comedic relief to the chaos. Ellis has inappropriate stories which no one wants to hear, and well the sound of hitting zombies with a frying pan or guitar never gets old. Besides the campaign mode, there are several more online modes where you can play as the infected or humans which provide for even more fun game play. The best seems to be scavenge. This round based game has you take turns between the infected and humans. Humans score points by filling a generator with gas from gas cans scattered around the map. The infected try to keep the point total low. Who ever wins the most rounds claim the bragging rights. Overall, I would highly recommend this game. Valve tends to make great games (Orange Box anyone?) and this one is no exeption.

No doubt this game makes a fantastic sequel to the original zombie thriller. It is a blast! Fight your way through 5 campaigns now that all link together. Fight new, dangerous zombies on your quest to freedom and rescue, all the while using new melee weapons and guns to meet your goal. While this game provides hours of entertainment, for those who were bored easily from the game play of L4D1, be prepared to be bored again. The repay quality is high, but as play will dictate, it is more of the same old Left 4 Dead with new weapons and fighters. I love the game, and it keeps my attention, but don't be prepared to spend hours upon hours playing. This game is good in small doses.

Here is 10 reasons why L4D2 is going to be AMAZING!!!! 1. It's the sequel to L4D1 which was awesome 2. There's new weapons 3. New Features like : Melle weapons 4. New dialouge 5. New characters 6. New setting 7. New infected 8. New explosives 9. L4D1 infected are going to be in L4D2 10. Better graphics I pre-ordered my copy of left4dead2 today at gamestop, so I can get the american baseball bat, and i can't wait. i still play l4d1. i play it everyday.if any of you people wanna play with me on xbox live ask me for my gamertag.
While in quarantine, found this game to be fun and easy entertainment for family who live gaming or never game at all.
We just bought this for our oldest for his new xbox because he absolutely loves it on the PC. If you have a zombie fan in your life this is a must have. So much fun
I've been playing this game since it can out. I saw it in the store and decided to get it and pass the torch down to my sister who just recently got into gaming. No complaints.
This game is awesome. Works for Xbox 1 too! Love the levels.

Ok campaign but very fun multi-player action. And it's now backwards compatible on the Xbox One. This is probably the best online game value for the money on the current system, even though this is last gen.
This game was fun. I let the kids play it which was not that bad or that scary.
This game is really fun. Like I said above, it is great for playing with friends since it is cooperative.

This game has only one flaw so i will get that out of the way immediatly in my opinion it doesnt have very good replay value one you beat the game in as many ways possible its not very tempting to pick it back up, often. And i was not impressed with the online play. Although i am extremely happy that they added the online play because it does offer up alot of enjoyment. I like the fact that the game is fast paced and slow at times but it is a great blend of both, and there are some diverse enemies in this game, its not just hoards of zombies. Each of the special enemies have their own unique ways of attacking and killing them affectively can be tricky. this game is very fun and very challenging
this is a great overall game. a must buy for horror/zombie gamers collection. the online versus is loads of fun especially with your friends. pick this one up, and ENJOY!

A great improvement over the first installment of this franchise. I got bored and sold off L4D1 in several months, but already I can tell that I'll be keeping this one in my library as my go to multiplayer game for a while. The inclusion of 5 campaigns, versus mode on all, survival and now scavenger make this a great purchase. They also upped the gore, and the added melee weapons are a blast to play with. The only drawback is that the overall graphics are not much improved from the first, maybe higher resolution. It seems too bad that with all of the awesome graphics in games these days that Valve seems to be resting on the house that Gordon Freeman built (graphics-wise). But with the frantic gameplay, you'll be more concerned about not getting your a** kicked than how many pixels there are on the screen.
This game is awesome. My three grandsons love it! It can be played in single player mode or multi-player mode. Good graphics, although can be a little scary for younger children.
Fun game if you like shooting and kiling Zombies my teenage sons love playing online where you can be a zombie or human on a killing spree
Overall a good game but campaign becomes boring very quickly. Must play online in order to fully enjoy the product.

CoOp game play is awesome. AI is frustrating during CoOp if you do not have enough friends to play all 4 CoOp slots. Game difficulty is one of the hardest I have encountered in all my years of gaming. Expert level is no joke! Graphics are on the level with other high level games. This is a must buy!

L4D 2 adds some much-needed excitement over the first installment, forcing you to advance or be overwhelmed by waves of zombies. New classes of 'special infected' add much-needed variety to encounters. Unfortunately, the AI-controlled 'bot' characters make certain scenes nearly impossible to complete when playing a 2-player game locally, as they tend to be less helpful than those found in the first L4D game. Simply put, they'll stand next to you and not help at all in many instances when the action gets intense. You're going to need help via Xbox Live to succeed if you wish to use split-screen co-op.
I got this game for christmas along with my new xbox elite. It is a great game!!! lots of fun, but it can get addicting so you might go through it quickly. I love playing online too! You will enjoy
This has been the greatest game I have bought my son and his family. They tend to argue as to who is going to play first. All in fun

This is a game that took everything that was right from the first game and made it better. More weapons, more gore and more action. The change in setting and versitle characters are good too. Check it out!
My daughter thinks this is an awesome game. I, however, would love to hear less profanity.
This is one of the best video game sequels I've ever played. It takes the foundation of the original and it makes everything better. The online play is also great.
Quoting my tweenage son who got this game for Christmas- 'Mom, this is the best zombie game ever' He loves it- his friends love it- it was a hit @ our house.

This is a good game that plays well and has lots of action. Its fun and challenging and you can play at home with friends or online. There is a new Scavenger mode and the new Zombie classes and melee weapons are a nice touch as well. But, if you are familiar with the first game, this one is not that much different. Its fun and dark and a nice overall game, but its not too different form the original, so I give it 4 stars out of 5.
My son asked for this game for Xmas, he has been playing it ever since
I' m really recommended this product. It has Polish language so much easier and better fun for me.

This game is a great game but this kind of game you would want to most likely to rent than to buy.....b/c this game is way too short.....but if your the kind of person that doesn't get bored on playing on the same 5 stages over and over again...then you should get the game

L4D is one of the few Xbox games I've spent more than 50 hours playing. I have a feeling that the sequel, L4D2, will be more of the same. I usually only play single-player, though the game was designed for co-op play and I hear that's where the game really shines. Still, they took the gore and frenetic violence of the original and upped it a notch. There are some great storyline locations that are very scary, an amusement park, a swamp, etc. The addition of melee weapons is fantastic.
All the melee weapons, and the 4 different shotguns and all the other additions truly make this game freakin sweet!

Well worth the price. I pre-ordered the game a few days before it came out. I dont know what there is to complain about, very good product. I dont know what people are talking about when they say you have limited ammo for your pistols? It's all unlimited, the double pistols, and the desert eagle. If you don't want to use those you can use a guitar, machete, sword, police stick, cricket bat, or even a chainsaw. You have the ability to switch between pistols and melee weapons so don't listen to people who say you run out of ammo with your pistols because they have the choice to switch back and forth between weapons. The graphics are fine, much more blood and gore than the first game. I play it as much as COD: MW2 lol and that's ALOT. Great game, great price, great everything. :)
Better graphics, more weapons, and MORE ZOMBIES! What's not to love!?!
This is how a sequel is supposed to be made. Melee weapons, new enemies, endless hordes, realism mode.... Sweet!

this is a surefire good choice for those zombie mangling fanatics out there with all the ways you can hack slice whack and decimate with ever increasing explosions or incinerations or pumping lead into them. Either way a good strategy game for the teamwork savvy individual and a refreshing update for loyal fans of the first game. although some might claim its easier to in as infected or maybe even survivors its really quite balanced in my opinion and with new modes other than simply campaign or verses it retains its entertainment time for quite a while. Not only will old fans love it but its easy to learn and jump into the game for first timers, all in all a good buy for those with trigger happy fingers.

I have had a blast with this game. It is a lot of fun to play. Make sure you have access to XBOX LIVE, then buy this game and have a blast. Try to play it with friends, that is where the most fun is at. Remember, communication is key. Now go kill some zombies!

This game is a very fun survival game. In most modes players must defend themselves as they travel in a group of four to the safe houses. When playing online, it is fun to switch off being survivors and play as infected. I found it that this game is best when playing online with friends. One of the best parts of the game is the new weapons and items. Also, melee weapons are fun to use. There is a new mode called scavenge where you have to collect gas cans and whoever gets the most wins-but you have to do it while the other team attacks. The variety in the game makes it worth coming back to. The achievements are also fun and challenging to obtain. The only bad thing is probably just some glitches, usually when online, but it really doesnt make much of a difference. All in all, this is a really fun game. If you liked the first one then you will like this too.
Its a fun action game. If you likes the first one then you'll like this one.

I was unsure if I was going to get this game or not. I still put the first one in from time to time, but I saw new game modes and what is more fun then blowing up zombies? I decided I would get it around christmas time. I saw that best buy had this game at $35 dollars (around thanksgiving) and I couldn't turn down this game for that price and I am happy that I didn't. The game is a huge upgrade from the first. The graphics are leagues ahead of the first game. There are several new modes, including a round based multiplayer over xbox lto go along with the versus mode. More guns and a longer much harder campain make this game worth the $60 you'll pay for it, if you find it for cheaper then that, buy it for sure.

Throw on your gear, grab your weapons, and stretch your muscles! The zombies are here and its up to you and your partners to stop 'em! As soon as this game starts your dropped in the middle of chaos. And, as you might have guessed, its an infinite amount of zombies constructing the chaos. Which leaves you only one option, blast your way through the town. But don't fret! You've got 3 partners to help you along the way, which you'll need against your fast-paced enemies. In single campaign, your partners can slow you down a bit, but in the online multiplayer, its a free-for-all shooting session. Please understand, online gaming is what games like this is made for. I've owned a XBox for a fairly short amount of time, but this game is at the top of my list as far as XBox games. I love the graphics, the sounds, the gameplay, and the setting. If ya dig apocalypse style games/movies like I do, definitely pick this game up. Highly highly recommended. *I've heard some people say that this game is just like the first Left 4 Dead. I can't vouch for that, but if you're a first time L4D'er (like me), don't hesitate in buying this game. Happy hunting!

I played Left 4 Dead 1, and I though it was sort of fun, but buying it never crossed my mind. It just didn't reach out and grab me, no pun intended, however, this game did. The reactions from the zombies when you attack them seem very realistic, the campaign levels are very unique, creative and fun, and there are more types of zombies than in the first one. The new weapons and game modes added are also awesome. When I saw that this was on sale for $35, I couldnt pass it up, and I'm glad that I picked it up. I RECOMMEND THIS GAME TO ANYONE WHO IS LOOKING FOR A SIMPLE, FUN, AND WELL CRAFTED GAME(with the thought that it involves a lot of violence and zombie killing, so if your sensitive to the kind of stuff, its not exactly the game for you)
Like my synopsis says, The gameplay is extremely fun, but online play is EXTREMELY laggy.

This game is better than the original with more campaign missions, new characters and weapons. You can now use melee weapons like baseball bats, night stick, frying pan and others. If you get bored with that pick up a chain saw. The game has a new multiplayer mode called scavenge which rocks. If you love zombies and gore buy this game. It will make you happy that you did.

I bought Left 4 Dead 2 after seeing 80% of my friends on Xbox live playing the game. It was fun, but probably the shortest game I have ever bought for my 360. Yes, it is basically the same as the first with new zombies, weapons, etc., but that is what I expected out of it. The graphics are very good and the campaign is great as well. I loved the first game and I'm glad they did not change the mechanics much in this one. The new melee weapons as well as better guns make this game more enjoyable and the new zombies such as the 'jockey' are great. Online modes, as in the first LFD, are great as well. The makers of this game came up with a great formula for the first game and so I don't blame them for not changing it much. As I said earlier...if you love the first one, you have to get this one. It is well worth it wether you pay full price or get it on sale.

the most i would pay for this game is 30$, but it has alot of blood so thats good. it has a super long campaign. it has ok guns, which you cant aim in so thats bad. ONLY GET THIS GAME IF ITS ON SALE FOR LESS THAN 35$.

Great game overall! More difficult and challenging that Left for dead 1. Love them Zombies. The new infected are awesome!

Its a pretty good game, especially for $40, but the Switch version seems pretty poorly optimized. It looks like its running below 1080p and dips below 30fps aren't super rare. The game has about a dozen different types of paint you can use on the cars but I can't tell the difference between most of them because the textures are so blurry. The game also uses a lot of motion blur with certain effects, which combined with FPS drops make me feel a little icky. It looks OK enough in handheld mode but is especially bad on the TV. If you mainly want this as a handheld game, I'd recommend it. But if you were planning on spending a greater amount of time on the TV I would recommend getting the game for a different system. 6.5 out of 10, would spend 2 hours racing with Coolmom85 again

Weve only had this a day so far, but here are some initial impressions. This is a bit more challenging out of the gate than Mario Kart, so if youre getting it for really little ones, you may want to wait. After day one, it doesnt seem quite as polished as Sonic Racing Transformed which is kind of a bummer because that was a blast. Dont get the wrong idea, this isnt a bad game by any means. The racing is fun, and the team racing aspect is a nice twist. The visuals are colorful and all of your favorite Sonic characters are represented well. A must have if you have a Sonic fan in your house!

An entire Sonic themed racing game done really well! I love this game and it is so much fun for people who have already played Mario Kart 8 on the Wii U and Switch and really need a new racing world to immerse themselves in! The race tracks looks amazing! Graphics are wonderfully done and a lot is going on in each track from jumping whales to huge waterfalls and flashy lights. The mechanics are overall really well done and for the price I highly recommend this game. Also and amazing addition is that the Sonic characters talk to each other while racing so youll hear comments throughout the race either bashing praising the characters racing each other! It makes you feel like theyre much more alive. Only critique I have is that for two of the cups, two race tracks are repeated twice. Wish theyd just come up with two new tracks instead of just recycle two of them twice.

I first played Celeste almost a year ago and it is such a good game. The story seems basic from the outside, but when you actually start to make progress you eventually learn more about the main protagonist, Madeline. The platforming in the game is top notch, but can be very difficult later in the game. The Limited Run physical release comes with a small ~30 page Instruction Guide/Artbook as well as the full game and Chapter 9: Farewell DLC on the cartridge. Whether you purchase the physical version or digital version you get the Chapter 9: Farewell DLC for free. I highly recommend anyone who has even a little bit of interest in this game play it, it will not disappoint.

This game a an unbelievable platformer. Its unique, has a great story, and can be extremely difficult. It really does feel like a great accomplishment completing the game, just like climbing a mountain.

This is one of few games that I am willing to buy more than once. I actually have bought Celeste 3 times, and I own 4 copies of it. - Digital Copy on Switch - Free PC Copy - PS4 Collectors Edition - and now Switch Physical Copy Why did I do this? Because Celeste is amazing. It is a 2D platformer that explores topics of mental health with a great cast of characters. I highly recommend it.

This game is perfectly crafted and is everything it was intended to be. With a compelling story of battle against will. You fight to reach the top of the mountain. With every perfect jump you land, lands you a step closer in accomplishing that feat! Latch onto walls, bounce off of spring boards and use the environment around to make it to the top! If youre a true explorer, while searching every corner of the game you will stumble upon the original Celeste which this game is based on! Limited Run games blessed us with a remastered classic and I cant say thank you enough. Pick up this game. Dont think about it, just buy it and enjoy this fun thrilled adventure. You may even shed a tear for Madeline. (Tear of Joy of course!!)
This is a simply humbling and soul crushing game. It will take your heart in many different direction with solid platforming being the means of narrative. Please, please don't sleep on this one!!
Another great title worth adding to your Switch library. Amazing platform game with challenging difficulty.
Great challenging indie game. Would recommend to a friend.
Good game for the Nintendo Switch, good story and fun to play.

'Celeste' is a lovely callback to the days of 'NES- Hard' games, with an easy-to-learn and hard-to-master challenge that hits home and links very well with it's story based on anxiety, depression and self-confidence. Highly comes recommended!
Good dialogue, story and creative situations. Amazing journey, is a 2d and has great graphics, well thought, development and final product.

This is a fantastic game and it is great to get a physical copy on the Switch. The game comes with a color manual too which is a nice touch. This game is much cheaper on the eshop but if you collect physical games this is a must buy.

This is a great game for any gamer. It will challenge you and thats what makes it fun wether you are an adult or a younger person you will enjoy this game. Its also a nice traveling gale with your switch will make the time go by fast.
