A lot of the bugs and glitches present at release have been addressed. The game is fun for all of the reasons other reviewers have mentioned. The potential for greatness is still there. The biggest current hurdles for the game and its developers are fixing the loot system and impressing with the Cataclysm event. Depending on how that pans out, it could be the game's saving grace or the final nail in the coffin. I'm still holding onto hope. While the game at release was lacking the polish and depth we were promised and expecting, Anthem has great bones. There's still the possibility that they could turn it around. I would certainly say, 'Give it a chance,' at its current $20 price point.

Fun game, pure and simple. I enjoy the game and play it almost daily. Being able to fly is really cool. The combat mechanics are fun and work well with the 3rd person view. I like that each Javalin is completely different and has it's own unique abilities. Speaking of which, the abilities are lots of fun. It's just a joy dropping a massive lightening strike or cluster of missiles on an enemy. Anthem got a bad reputation at launch which I don't think was fair. Sure it a had a few bugs but a lot of games do at launch so this was nothing new and the issues weren't really that bad. The developers have been constantly fixing things so it keeps getting better. All I can say, is don't believe all the negative press about this game, try it for yourself.

It baffles me how this game received such a high rating; this game is about as basic as it gets. Controls are way too simplistic and not a lot of options in any of the game. Golf game doesn't have a zoom or an option to change to a more suitable club, Beach Tennis is and all the other Mini Games are one button control. This is a game for the extremely novice who has never played any kind of video game. I paid $20 and regret it.
Purchased this game during a Christmas for the kiddos! They have been playing it every day. It gets them up and moving.
this was a gift to my kids. they really like it. similar to wii sports.

Just like the sports party games of the Wii, when my son asked for a Switch for Christmas, I had to include this game. He loves getting rewards of clothing and accessories for his character as he progresses through the games. Highly recommended.
This game is only fun with that condition. Everything is lackluster and extremely basic. It can be fun under the right conditions but not something that should be bought at 30 bucks.
Compared with Mario Tennis this game has basic graphics and not soo fun game play however will keep the kids engaged!!
This game is alright, but nothing to write home about. It's just average. Got it for $10 during a sale and would say that's a good price as I said, the game is just average.

The game is basically what you see from the cover. It can be fun if you dont have anything like Mario Kart or Smash Bros around. Or if you just want to feel that slight Wii Sports vibe, just not as fun. Bought it for being so cheap.
Great game we can play with the whole family lots of different games to choose from
It's a fun mini games for a group of 4 people. Golf is nice.
My daughter, age 11, loves this game as she likes competing in all the sporting events. She really likes the basketball and jet ski games the best.
Purchased the game for my son. He loves it. He managed to get the whole family involved playing the assortment of games. There is a small variety of games to play.
Purchased this game for my grandsons for Christmas. They and their father have been playing for the last few hours, totally enjoying the variety of games.
My son really likes the golf game. My son also likes having a variety of games to choose from
In the 80's I loved to play Summer Games or California games with my school friends. Now I can play again with them Sports Party!

i read a bunch of reviews before buying this. some dissed the simple graphics and game play but others praised it. if you're an adult and/or advanced game player it might be too simple for you, but my almost-10-year-old loves it, and i love giving them an option that's not weapons-based.
Very reminiscent of wii sports. All games are fun but golfing is probably my favorite.

It is the closest thing to Wii Sports on the Switch, but not nearly as fun. There is not enough variety on the levels. It looks pretty basic and the gameplay is basic too - not challenging enough to make it competitive.
This is a great game and keeps you busy for a good while
I was long hoping for a family game from Nintendo switch.
This game is fun to play. The different activities in the game make it so there is something fun for everyone.
Fun game for the small price that you'lll enjoy with friends and family.
Call game lots of variety easy for anyone to play.

I think this is an average 'Wii Sports' type of game. I was hoping for a little bit better of an experience. It is hard to say how responsive the game is when playing. It just feels a lot clunkier than other Wii games that are a similar genre. Definitely fun enough for the kids but not revolutionary but any standard. The sale price was definitely the kicker on this purchase that probably could boost it 3.5 stars. I would recommend it for the younger crowd for some entertainment but not as fun as the Wii sports of old.
It is a great game and it is too early to give a detailed review. But, it is a great game as per my son who like the game over all.

I bought for a birthday i ordered wii switch instead of wii reg. Well i put the game up for like under 1 month till birthday. You can only return for '15 days' so if you order wrong thing you stuck with it. So i wont EVER order from them again! And took 1 and 1/2 hours for the return call. So far as i am concerned good bye best buy it was niceknowing you...

This game is a lot of fun. Some of the 'sports' are more fun than others and some are only a play couple times and done. Basketball is the least played one. Frisbee and beach tennis are the most played, especially in multiplayer
I have been looking for something that has multiple games that my kids could play and Nintendo Switch finally came out with one. We have no tried it yet but I hope it works great.
I wanted a more active game for my son. we haven't played it yet since It will be a Christmas gift, but I'm excited to play this with him.

Good sale on video games and movies. They had most of the items I wanted in stock. The store was busy but the staff was available and helpful. The lines moved quickly. Overall a productive shopping trip.
GREAT GAME TO ADD TO MY COLLECTION OF SEALED GAMES

For the last couple of years I have been getting NBA Live and 2k. I enjoy them both but live gives me options that 2k doesnt for gameplay which I enjoy. As long as they continue to do their thing and stay in their own lane and try not to mimic 2k to the fullest I will continue to buy it year after year.

Better graphics,faster load times, no Microtransactions eating at my pockets, it needs a team mode for online like 2k but it beats them in every other way. They have a free demo in the playstation store for 2k users to try it out, I had live 18 and enjoyed it ,so i grabbed the demo, downloaded the companion app,took one photo, best luck ever from what I heard from other users, linked it, played for a while, everything transferred when I bought the physical copy, now I just grind and get my stats up! This is a must try for any 2k fan that's tired of them taking extra money just to make shots,unlocks players and buy clothes. With live 19, all you need to do is buy the game and have the time to grind and get your stats up, that's it that's all. Hope this helps anyone that's in the gray area on NBA games this year, oh and stay away from NBA playgrounds 2, it's a Microtransaction mess also made by 2k. Happy gaming guys and gals!

Bought this as a gift for my 11 year old grandsons birthday. He was anticipating the release and the timing was just perfect for his birthday. Pre-ordered online a week before release, picked up day of release. My grandson loves basketball and he loves this game. He plays it all the time.

NBA2K is still the reigning champ, but EA is getting closer. Still a big distance, but going in the right direction. I really like The One better than 2K's My Career. You don't need to shell out your hard earned money for VC to get incrementally better. It's a good change or pace from 2K.

The game is great the graphics and the controls are better than 18 but the only thing that sucks about it is you cant take your female character to the WMBA. I like the new feature that that you can make a female and play with her and has a diverse play that allows you to play with both males and females on your team.just wish I can take my female character to the WMBA
My son bought this game to compare with NBA 2K19. They are different in some aspects but he loves it.
Boughtbthis for my hubby and he loves it i tried playing but i think 2k is way better

I can't lie I was a big 2K fan & bought Live 18 last year but didn't play it much, but I've been going hard with Live 19 & so far I'm loving everything about this game, if you want a good Basketball game this is the one for you
Live 19 looks and plays a lot better than last years version. The arenas look, sound and overall atmosphere is way better than 2K19....
Great game but after 5-6 days I got error code ce-34878-0 when loading a franchise
awesome video game for the future for anyone get it now

I bought Live 18 & was impressed after a few years off the wagon they came back with a good response. Live 19 backs that up and grows from it. The one experience rivals 2K's my career & is highly enjoyable.
NBA live 19 is a good game for price 2k is better but worth the $20

NBA 2k has been made by people who dont play ball but have an idea of how ball is played. Live my not have quite the graphical quality as 2k, but the gameplay is there, and there LeBron James is the better looking versoin.
game sucked. sold it back for 2k. not what i expected

While the game is fun it needs to improve which is expected when the game has not had an entry since last year. There is another update to animations and more but its not enough in my opinion to keep it so im selling mine for in store credit for something else. If the update comes and makes it a complete game i will rebuy used but no thanks for this guy year. I think its fun when u play with certain builds and modes like court battles and the one mode but live events with randoms still suck and other modes leave me frustrated. Defense still needs to be rehauled and animations are limited. I wish i had a youtube channel so i could show what i mean.

This game keeps getting better and better every year. From killer crossovers to step backs on top of that the graphics are amazing feels like your actually watching a real life nba game. If it's in the game it's in this game.
Fun to play with an odd, quirky, and playful storyline. Love that it came with a physical manual

Super Meat Boy has been around for quite some time. It is not a newer sequel, to confirm it is the same old, die a thousand deaths, Super Meat Boy. You either love it or hate. So I'm not going to review the game itself, that has been done to death (pun intended? sure why not). I am instead reviewing the fact that this is a physical release. The company Limited Run Games put out this physical release like so many others they have and I am a particular fan that they have partnered with Best Buy for some of their more popular releases. The cover art is different from the one Limited Run sold on their website, but that makes little difference to me. It comes with a cool little comic/manual insert in the box as well (which many physical releases lack). Very happy with this purchase.

I missed the opportunity to buy this for the switch the first time Limited Run Games put this game out. Thankfully BestBuy now appears to have a relationship with Limited Run games, so I was given another opportunity. This game is great. I love playing it with friends. The levels can get pretty challenging, so you never get bored.

A classic challenging platformer game! One of the classic Indie games that every gamer should own a copy of! Made even better by the ability to take it on the go, partnered with it's mission based gameplay!
This game is very challenging but at the same time fun to play!
Fun game for the switch with interesting graphics/ visuals.

So much meat in this game. As far as I can tell very little of it is actually cooked. So you're looking at mostly raw ground beef here. I'd prefer it cooked to be honest but this is ok. What? No side dishes? Where's the potato salad? Also, (and this is BIG) you do a lot of jumping with this meat. Like... a LOT of jumping. Do you like jumping meat? You're going to love this.
This game is super difficult. It's an amazing platformer, but I think it's a skill grade above what most can handle.
Not really into this game its weird but yeah thats all I got
I mean most people have already played this as it is 6 years old. There is no reason to buy this version if you already had it. But it is nice to play portable. Also the game can be BRUTALLY hard.

The overall presentation in this package is excellent. Love the new modes and love the X games overall. The game comes on two discs which are stacked on top of one another in the physical version for the Xbox One. The only real complaint I have is with regard to the Xbox controller itself. Dash while jumping and shooting is a little awkward due to the increased distance between the face buttons. Not a big issue overall though. I would still wholeheartedly recommend!

Great graphics and soundtrack. A great game for any Sonic fan. Lots of side missions and content. The game allows co-op through the story mode which is a ton of fun. Playing solo is still fun, but it is definitely better to have some good teammates along for the ride. There aren't a lot of people online for races, but it's much more playing splitscreen anyway, so that's not a huge problem.
Just like previous Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing series before with only characters from Sonic games.
Love kart racers, Mario kart being the best but this one is a nice adding with Sonic characters. You will have a great time.

Has a split-screen mode; perfect for the whole family to play. Almost reminds me of Mario Kart. This game is feature-rich. Very moving in every way, can be addicting at times, but that was the whole point of buying this game. Now looking forward to watching the Sonic movie. Amazingly, this Sonic game pays homage to earlier Sonic games released back in the '90's.
It looks fun but not tried yet. I would try it this weekend.

Team Sonic Racing is a mixed bag, with pretty visuals, an incredible soundtrack (as to be expected from Sonic) and gameplay that is pretty fun for the most part. However the game is lacking in content, I don't see myself playing this game for more than 2 weeks and the game just feels like a budget title especially in comparison to Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.
Although its NOT as good as Mario Kart 8, us xbox fans don't have it anyway on our system SO, this is a nice substitute!! Fun for the whole family!

It's NOT a bad game at all, and I really enjoy the new team mechanics, but this is an obvious step down from the previous two Sega/Sonic racing games. Less characters and many recycled tracks leaves me feeling disappointed, but what's new is great.
Costs the same as buying crowns online, but you get the free monster as well. I'm personally more comfortable with giving my credit card info to Best Buy than the game publisher.

I am a Grandmother of eight. I started Wizard101 at the request of my seven year old grandson one weekend when he stayed over. He needed a little help because at the time you had to read the quest they weren't spoken. Well he went home and called me the next weekend and asked me to create an account to play with him. I did and by the end of the weekend I was hooked. We made household accounts for my other grandchildren and Wizard101 became family game time. My sister came in from out of state and when I was busy she played my Wizard with the grandchildren and soon she was hooked. When she went home we played together then my other two sisters and children began playing. We live in Florida, Maryland and Illinoise so we didn't get much time together now we play together at least weekly. We love to PvP. That is the Player verses Player feature. The Grove Girls are a fierce team to beat. It has brought us back together and we are loving it. Younger children will need some help and if you take the time to help you may be hooked too.

Wizards 101 is a kid friendly game for ages 5 and up. This card gives you 20,000 crowns which are in-game currency. In addition you get a magical familiar, which gives you a special power in the game.
my son wanted this for christmas and I didn't know if I would be getting it before christmas or not.
i only bought this card to get a pet and i made wrong choice to get crowns instead of the two months subscriptions.

You get free pet. In a way you could say you get what you pay for it. You can get 10,000 crowns or a membership. The 10,000 crowns can you out of the first world. You wont be able to get though the whole next world. You might be able to do 2 parts of next world. It took about 2 weeks to get to me that is standard on shipping. Sometimes they run out. Then it shipped later.
The pet is great, and the crowns are just what you pay for (or sub if that's what you prefer, but crowns get the areas permanently whereas the sub has to be constantly renewed). Good buy.
you can check on line before you buy to see what your free pet will be.

You should buy this prepaid game card. You can pick the 2 month membership or the 10,000 crowns. Which is better? 2 month membership. Why? You get unlimited access to every world in Wizard101. What's not so great about the crowns? You can buy crowns from the Wizard101 website. That is, if you have a credit/debit card.
I buy several of these a year for my son. He begs for these to use them to buy items on their site. He is always happy to get a new one.

A great gift for anyone who plays the MMO Wizard 101. This card provides a pet and either 2 months of membership or 10,000 crowns which can be used to purchase in game items, perks, etc. If you play the online game Wizard 101 it is for you.
I like getting these cards because it is easier than using my card on the site to get crowns.
I loved my pet and thecrowns I got helpedme get to the next level in the game
Awesome place to grab a Wizard 101 card that allowed me to play for two whole months....plus I could have gotten other things in the game had I wanted too. Nice deal...it included a free pet!!!!!!
Purchased this card for my husband and he loves it. So glad Best Buy carries them, plus he got a free gift with this card.

Purchased for my son when he was playing Wizards101. Like so many other games today, when you purchase one of the gift cards for in-game purchases, they don't go very far before needing more. Suckering people out of money over & over again like this used to be called a con or scam. Now it's called average gameplay.
I love this game and this pet has to be one of my favorites
You can't go wrong with a game card. It will not be returned and the teenager receivng it was happy.
Great online game definite one for your enjoyment.
Got exactly what I paid for. Nothing more to expect.
What a good gift for the wife who enjoys playing her wizards 101, for anyone really :) worked like a charm and you get a free pet too!
great buy ******** will buy again for my son *******
These cards are the best way to go for youngsters!!!
My son love to boost his game with these cards....
Love these games! Fun to play on computer !! Easy to use. Games last for hours of fun playing !
My kids have been playing this on-line game for years. They can play with friends but are not able to on-line chat so we feel it is safe to play. Creative and always improving.

I'm an old EQ junkie who kicked the habit. If you want to still be able to play an engaging online game without having to dedicate an unreasonable numbers of hours to stay current, this is perfect. If you need to quit a game in an instant, you won't have to worry about any real in-game loss. It's beautifully balanced not only in terms of game play, but also in terms of being fun for kids and adults-- and you will find a lot of both. This really is a 'fun for all ages' game. Part role-playing and part CCG, Wiz101 is a nice mix of light-hearted atmosphere and challenging gameplay. Don't let the early levels fool you. This game can get pretty challenging as you progress. PvE and PVP (with tournaments) are both available, with a lot of other extra 'in-game games' as well.
My son play the game wizard101 and this is something he needs.
My daughter loves playing Wizard 101! She adds other things to it from the card.
This is the standard coin card for Wiz101, which happens to be quite the money trap if your kids get into it.
Sorry, just not a good idea on my part....hoped for more.

My son had played this game for a few years & after he used this card for a 2 month membership they deactivated his account without a reason. They will not respond to any of my emails to tell me why. He got 2 weeks for the price of 2 months. Non of this is Best Buys fault, they just sold the card. Would not recommend anything for Wizard101 unless you are just throwing money away.

Expected Merchandise but 2-3 weeks late. Ended up going to best buy and buying one since it was 'back ordered'. Did keep the one ordered when I finally got it. Had forgotten about it by the time I did get it. It was a gamecard for my grandson for his birthday. Since all best buy stores had the gamecards there was no problem in getting it, except through the on line store. I recommend that if this is a normal problem, all gift cards that a person wants should not be purchased over BestBuy.com. Too bad grandson wanted one from best buy and not a card available at many other stores. I was just being lazy in going to a dot-com rather than in person. HAS ANYONE ELSE HAD THIS PROBLEM????
Great game, I play couch co-op with my daughter and she loves the game. A great co-op experience if that's what you are looking for. Solo is good as well, I really enjoy the added humor.

Who doesn't love Lego games? I do and I have almost all the games on different formats and I love this game. BB8 is so cute the way he rolls around trying to collect all the studs. The story follows the movie storyline very nicely.

They added some features to this Lego game to make it even better. Some of the Lego builds have multiple builds you can make. They also added a cover system for certain parts which was pretty cool and BB8 is a playable character, what could be better?
This is the best lego game I played at all time and I loved the force awakened movie
Son did not like it at all... Traded it in the next day
This game is pretty fun but I definitely enjoy the orginal lego star wars game. To me this game doesnt quite flow like the orginal one did

Lego games are fun for the most part, and this is no exception. Has great jokes, looks great, and plays better then most other lego games. Adds to the story of Star Wars Force Awakens, and has many playable characters. The thing is, kids will love this game, adults too, but mind you, kids, any kid, will love it, so it's a sure bet to pick this up even if your not into lego games, so long as you have a kid around, ;-)

I love playing Lego games and the new features in this one are cool, but the game isn't very fun. This lego game doesn't compare to Jurassic World or Batman 3. Those games are extremely fun this one is just average.

The Inpatient is a VR choose-your-own adventure set 60 years before the game Until Dawn. The game is very simple, with mostly conversations driving the gameplay. However, it has very good positional audio, which makes the scary sections very frightening. Additionally, they have a cool feature where you can actually speak the conversational choices in the game. It's very minor to be sure, but it helps draw you into the gameplay.

This game is good but short. Fortunately, like Until Dawn, there is a high replay value. With it being short, it does not have as many pathways, but you can easily play through in a sitting. It's an interesting first VR game to test the sensation if you have motion issues.

Great game - very scary with lots of suspense. The VR makes it terrifying (in a great way). I wish the game was a little longer, it only lasted about two hours, but at least I can play again. I recommend changing the rotation setting on the main screen, otherwise your movements are very choppy and can make you dizzy.

This game is not for people who like jump scares or dumb slasher flicks like Until Dawn was. This takes a more mature approach to horror so its not going to be or everyone. This game is a slow burn and about the decay of a human mind. This is probably the best looking title for playstation VR right now. Like i said it isn't for everyone if you love your kiddy jump scares this game isn't for you. If your looking for more Until Dawn look else where and if your a mature adult who enjoys a good story with a slow burn into crazy then sit back and enjo

From the first time I seen this game I was intrigued and almost missed out on the release of it. Im happy I didnt. Its one of the more unique takes on a VR game that has come out recently and really puts you into the shoes of the characters, story, and world of the game.

The beginning of the game is by far the best. I bought this game after being referred to it by a Best Buy member. I went home played it, and beat it the next day. The scariest part is when you are walking around when everything goes green. Other than that, very boring game, just walking around. The decisions arent very game changing either. Saves a character or whatever. This game is best watched being played. Ive watched a few different play through a for this game and I had more fun than playing it. Took it back and bought resident evil 7. Much better.

This is a very good and entertaining VR game. Not sure why people are complaining . This game it supposed to be played again and again to get the different out comes. You can use your own voice to interact with the in game NCP. its fun tense and scary at some points. Its a mystery story. I loved it. VR are is evolving into a great new game mechanic. I find it hard to go back to 2D. I would recommend this game to anyone.
Great graphics but awful story and hardly any real gameplay. Its mainly a walking simulator vr edition
Heard it was suppose to be a hood game. Haven't played it yet. Fingers crossed
I bought this game not realizing it was for the PS VR. You should have a special area for games that are only VR.

This game sounded great, but even though nothing anywhere says you cannot play it without using a VR headset it turns out to be so. As a result I have to spend another $240 for a Sony PS4 VR headset in addition to what I paid for the game and the large amount I paid for my PS4 Pro.
Love this. Having fun with my time. Really recommend this to anyone.
This game is really fun to play it's just like being in the show The Walking Dead
This is a bittersweet type of game.You established a motion then you mess it up base off one decision.
The game is really fun. There's a ton of things to do. The one thing I can't stand is the severe motion blur. I can't stand it. Other than that it's a solid game.
a good game with so much more potential nice 4 player co op
Great for a game good game but and I have the game on my iPhone game I love have a the box most of them have are on game that

I have played State of Decay: Year One Survival Edition for a lot of hours (perhaps too many... lol) and it is one of my favorite 'survival' style games of all time. However, the way Microsoft is treating this game... almost makes fans like myself feel that they hope it will FAIL and not OUTSELL their highly advertised 'Sea of Thieves'. Dropping the price point of a game BEFORE it's released raised a few flags and the overall lack of advertisements is disheartening. Unlike 'Sea of Thieves' which has had a plethora of ads including an awesome one with Sean Astin... yep that guy from Lord of the Rings, Stranger Things, Rudy, The Goonies... I am giving this game a SOLID 4 as I HOPE it not only lives up to, BUT SURPASSES Year One. Cannot give the last star until I play it. Single Campaign and Co-op.

3 in 1 for the same price as a regular new Nintendo 3ds game is not bad. Despite you get 3 great games under a good price. others will wait for a better deal, but I decided to jump on to this deal during the holidays, I been wanting to play Detroit, I never beaten beyond and heavy, so I hope to accomplish these games. Overall it a nice package to have all 3 games, each has their physical disc and instead not digital or else I don't think I would have bought it. Great game for older audiences though.

If you have been waiting for the physical disc release of Heavy Rain and Beyond in North America, here it is. Detroit: Become Human is the best game in this 3 game collection. It comes on disc in its own case. Heavy Rain and Beyond Two Souls are also on disc for the first time for PS4 in North America. The two games are in the 2nd game case on two separate discs as shown in the picture.
Detroit was amazing. The gameplay was very different than anything Ive ever played. I got emotionally connected to the characters. It was great!! More please!!

This collection includes a lot of decent to great games in one bundle. Heavy Rain and Beyond Two Souls are remastered for the current generation consoles which improves their quality and performance. Detroit is also included in the package which is the newest and maybe the greatest game in the bundle.
This is a good collection for anyone who wants to play mature games.
Just with Detroit Become Human packed in, this collection is absolutely worth it. Heavy Rain thrown into the collection just sweetens it that much more. If you see it, get it!
Awesome to get a hard copy of all three of these games. Great story telling and multiple paths/ways to play based on your decisions. Thanks Quantic Dream!
I wanted all the games as a physical copy. So I purchased this. For the price you pay it's an excellent deal!

Quantic Dreams games are incredible from game play and story development to replay Value. I have played through Detroit Become Human 3 times and I still haven't finished the game completely. With every play through I have been surprised. For the price Detroit alone is worth the money but you get two other great games.

Having already played two of these on PS3, this was a no-brainer. I waited on Detroit and got it at a steal (thanks GCU) with two classics. More cinema than game, go in for the experience more than the challenge. Interactive movies to be sure, but fun movies all the same.

I've played Heavy Rain and Beyond: Two Souls on the PS3 and enjoyed both immensely. I held out getting Detroit: Become Human since it felt like the triple-A releases would knock the price down, and low and behold this bundle was announced for a great deal. Detroit: Become Human is a modern masterpiece. The game takes the Quantic Dream formula and amps it up to 11. The choices are what makes these games great, and you get to see how your actions stacked up against your friends and the rest of the world. The story is a little... cliche, but still very cool. The development of characters is better than Hollywood movies. The game suffers from clunky controls, as their other games do, but it doesn't take away from the overall game itself. The graphics are stunning, gorgeous character models, backgrounds and effects help draw you into the story. Worth playing for anyone looking for more story than game. Lots of replay value too with multiple paths and branching story lines.
First and foremost, these are physical disc (3 included) for each game if your are wondering. To me that is a plus. All graphics and and sound has been remastered.
This is a great package if you are a fan of this style of narrative, choice driven games. Some may not consider them 'games' but more interactive movies.

I was so happy to finally see physical releases for heavy rain and beyond two souls on the PS4. All 3 of these games are just fantastic experiences. I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys these sort of games.

Honestly, if you don't have Detroit Become Human yet, and still want to pick it up, this is the same price as just that game, and you get 2 other games, one memorable for 'SHAUN!!!!' and the other features Ellen Page/ Willem Dafoe. Of course there is more to the games than just that, but, you should buy it and play them to find out.
great ps1 classixcs! Loved it, would buy again woot

Although $39,99 is a great value for 3 games, I also have to put out in perspective the fact that these 3 games are not for everyone one as these titles are mostly story based and not action focus that moves you through story events like a soap opera
Quantified dream collection is such great deal three amazing games for the price of one

I bought this game pack for my BF. One of my friends highly recommended 2 of the games, so I bought it. I don't know if they are actually good games, because I haven't played them, but.. there you go!

Wolfenstein II is just one example of how Panic Button makes the seemingly impossible happen on the Nintendo Switch. They did it with Rocket League, the did it with DOOM, and they did it with Wolfenstein. Wolfenstein II is good looking for what it is and runs relatively smoothly on the Switch with significant visual compromises and a 30 FPS target as opposed to 60 FPS on other platforms. The game itself took me about 10 hours to finish on Do or Die (equivalent to Hard I think) difficulty. It was a fun gameplay experience in handheld mode that doesn't hold up as well on TV mode. Since beating the game, I have not replayed it as I have no motivation to. It's a one and done game for me as I don't really care to find all of the collectibles and do a 100% run as that's not my desire with Wolfenstein II. In brief summary: Wolfenstein II on the Nintendo Switch is one of the best FPS games on the system, but it is not worth the $60 price tag in my opinion.

Panic Button and Bethesda outdid themselves; This game far exceeded my expectations. I have played it on both the PS4 and Nintendo Switch. While the resolution isn't as nice as the PS4 version, the portability of the Switch game makes it an easy purchase. I never felt like the responses were too slow and the framerate was nice and steady throughout. If you're unfamiliar with the series, playing the other games is not a necessity but definitely adds to the depth of the story. Think DOOM marries Last of Us and they have a baby. This game is a must have for the adult Switch gamer. This is rated M for multiple reasons, please don't let your kids play this game.

This game is amazing. I cant believe its on the switch. I have it for PS4 already but I had to pick it up for the switch day one. Killing NZs on the go has never been more fun! I am in the beginning of the game but it plays really well with no hiccups. The aiming in hand held is way better then I ever could of wished for. Its almost same as using a controller (handheld mode), just slight difference. A few parts are a little dark but for the most part the graphics are amazing considering this is a triple A game that was recently released running on the switch. So happy they made this for the switch. I would recommend this to anyone who loves a good shooter with a great story.
I have always loved wolfenstein games since the first one on pc. This game does not disappoint.

I held off on purchasing this game for awhile because I wasnt sure the high price point would match the quality of the game. After a lot of research, I decided to go for it. Awesome game!! Another great addition to my collection.

Panic Button has done another impossible port for the Switch. Like last years Doom, Wolfenstein II manages to bring the big console experience to Switch. With added motion controls, HD Rumble; A 720-P dynamic resolution and even an arcade version of the original Wolfenstein is included. The game itself is a first person shooter with a deep narrative that has you playing as BJ and his crew as they hunt down the enemy to save America.

I loved playing this game on my Xbox One X in 4k. The story is awesome. I was excited to play this game mobile. It is still a great experience if you know the switch gameplay is going to be a lesser quality. The game is dark and the frame rate suffers so seeing the enemy can prove to be a challenge. Docked mode isn't much better. It is a great game nonetheless.

Great game, great port... Bethesda was too cheap to put the full game on a larger cartridge. If you buy this you will be forced to download half the game onto the system or micro sd. They could have fit the 21 gigs on a larger cart but they decided to save themselves money instead. I returned the game. No game on the cart, no sale.

The game looks good and runs well, sure it's not as pretty to look at like say the PS4 version (which I have also) but to be able to play this in bed or anywhere I go is a good trade off for me. I mostly play in handheld mode and the gyro aiming is awesome, I'm about halfway through the game and besides some blurry textures here and there and the fact that it can be kind of difficult to see enemies from a distance sometimes I have no other complaints. Panic button does great work porting these big AAA games to switch so I am happy to support the games they work on no doubt.

Wolfenstein 2 is an amazing single player first person shooter. There were multiple cut scenes where was just thinking where could things possibly go from here in the best kind of way. The shooting feels great, especially with motion controls. The game looks truly impressive when playing docked, considering how tiny the switch console is. In handheld, the game can be a bit blurry and too small to see, so I've played primarily in docked. If you can't play it elsewhere, Wolfenstein is a must buy if you like shooters.
This game is a must buy for any fan of first person shooters that wants that experience on the go. There is a huge amount of variety throughout the game.

Wolfenstein was one of the first computer games I ever played. The storyline on II Colossus is very intense and time-consuming. With a busy schedule, I don't have time for the drawn out requirements of the game.
to much violence for me,is not what i expected, the history is not as the old one

I like the older versions of the game. I hadnt played in over 10 years. I found myself getting dizzy in the beginning with it moving angles so ugh. The game is fun once you get over the initial stage.

I say its adventure more then stealth cause it really is more like problem solving them being stealthy. The themes and challenge of the game is real though. Solving the puzzles of escaping knights, and rats and or using them against each other to move on to the next area. If you liked a game like Hellblade pick up this game. Its got a lot of sadness and bittersweet moments as a girl tries to save her brother.

An amazing AA game, it feels and plays like 'The last of us'. If you like 'The last of us' you will like this game. For a developer without AAA budget this game surely can compete with them(AAA games), that's why i give this game a 10/10.
Unless you are looking for a massive RPG or a frenetic shooter look no further, this action adventure game is amazing, great voice acting, nice atmosphere, cool story and nice soundtrack.
A medium linear game that has a good amount of exploration and interesting characters. Would recommend picking up a title like this and not a microtransaction filled game.
Played when it was first released and had a lot of bugs. Sure they patched them by now.
Great stealth game. It's linear but the story and animations are great. Lots of cool hidden things to find and tense atmosphere.

This game was fantastic!! It is fairly straightforward and linear with siple, but effective combat and stealth. It has one of the most interesting final boss fights I've ever seen that utlizes rats!! Play it!!

With games like Resident Evil 2, Devil May Cry 5, Mortal Kombat 11, and Rage 2 starting off the year, and games like Death Stranding and Cyberpunk 2077 (hoping!) wrapping up the holiday season, it would be all too easy to let a virtually unknown title like A Plague Tale slip under your nose unnoticed. That would be a huge tragedy. Not only is this one of the most graphically impressive and beautiful games (the lighting is unmatched) I've ever played, but the characters, story and gameplay pull you right into the world and really never let go. I actually CARED about the people in this game and found it difficult to put down the controller. This is 'survival horror' at its best and so many developers and publishers should be taking notes. Watching hordes of evil plague rats devour living victims in no time, or having Crusading henchmen chasing after you are actually nothing compared to the other frights awaiting you. And let's talk about that soundtrack... Easily one of the best in gaming. I really wish there was a Collector's Edition of this game!

This game was very compelling, mainly due to the story told of, and interaction between, Amicia and Hugo. The game works best when being more stealthy, but overall a very good game! PS - the music is outstanding

Like many of my favorite games, such as The Last of Us, The Witcher 3, to even Demons Souls on the PS3, some of the stealth, puzzle, and combat mechanics (which are minimal) are average to lacking at times, but made-up for ten-fold by the setting, graphics, atmosphere, acting, and storytelling. The game feels like a cross of several games but quite original in its story. Take aspects of The Last of Us mixed with Life is Strange or Tell Tale adventure with Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons to Dishonored. However, I would not call this an action game. It has a slower pace. The other aspect that impressed me on this is that it is very linear and not open world like many games, but the game designers make the world feel large. When you go down a path, you can run off a ways but always get to the same point and you can see many places in distance like an objective in one case. The characters had to get to a location in a city and I felt like I would have to go through many blocks and city warrens to get there and then I did just that and it felt like it should. This is also one of the few games in a while that user reviews on Metacritic are higher than critic reviews because critics seem to rate mostly after they rush a play through and rarely review games on any degree of artistic merit. In this generation of remasters and the same old same old with updated graphics, this game is refreshing.

Easily one of the best-looking games on console with an excellent tone-setting soundtrack. This game has drawn comparisons to Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice, The Last of Us, Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons, and more, but it truly is its own game based around exploration, puzzle-elements, stealth, and (very) light combat. Honestly, it is closest to Hellblade if you have to pick one, only I think the combat is handled far better here. While based in a historical time period, the story takes great liberties and introduces some dark twists into its story, which is actually quite enjoyable despite some occasional jank in the voice acting and animation quality. While I wish some narrative points had been done with better pacing, and perhaps just a bit more setup/emotional build-up, I am overall very happy with the experience and have high hopes for a potential sequel set in this genuinely interesting world. You'll be hard-pressed to find another aesthetic as interesting as this world's time period (Bloodborne's comes to mind). The gameplay does have some AI issues early on, but after a couple of flubs, you'll find out how to easily avoid triggering them. This game is best targeted to those interested in narrative-driven, beautifully presented games, that have room for collectibles and exploration (but remain a linear experience). Temper your AAA expectations, and you will find this to be a true indie gem that could honestly blow-up to something the scale of the Witcher sequels if the developers wisely reinvest some of their profits into expanding the story and gameplay.

The game is based in France during the 1300s during the time of the bubonic plague. The story follows a young girl named Amicia who is thrust into dealing with the Inquisition and the incredibly designed rat infestation plaguing everything in their path as she tries to keep her younger brother safe. It is an incredible linear game with a fantastic story in a beautifully rendered world in the Unreal 4 Engine. It is definitely worth playing, it is one of my favorite games this year (2019) so far and clocked in at about 10-12 hours for a full play through for me.

I'm not going to lie, after Hellblade Senua's Sacrifice, I went into this with high hopes believing it would be just as emotionally driven, visually complex, and thought provoking. BUT, after completing this game, I can honestly say it didn't click until closer to the end. The ending definitely featured an out of place boss fight and a woeful conclusion to a pretty bland game. Not sure if I went in with too high expectations, but this game did not land. The gameplay consists of running from rats, using a sling to 'rock' people, 'rocking' bells to distract people, using flames to do flame things, and just sneaking. It's not as boring as I'm making it out to be, but it isn't very entertaining either. There are some nice emotional beats throughout the story, voice acting is believable, the graphics are pretty, responsive controls, and a good length.
Haven't play game yet. Was looking for something different and this looks intriguing.
Okay game but way too short. Not interesting enough to play through again. It just felt incomplete.

Frustrating. To expand on that. Man, never have i seena game's gameplay resist me so hard to the point of me wanting to jump through a window, whilst at the same time having me honestly interested im wanting to experience this story. I wish i never tried it. iTryiCry

I'm a fan of the series and this port is pretty good. This is also a great starting point to get into the series as its a bit more accessible than say SamSho 2, 4 or 5. Obvious visual downgrade to get it running on the switch and some slight frame rate drops in handheld mode but overall excellent experience in both docked and handheld mode. Also, came with a copy of SamSho! 2 NeoGeo Pocket Edition and a skin for joy cons which was a nice treat.

I love this game. I own it on Steam and it makes total sense. Compared to a PC version there's a bit of a curb with the controller and compared to Civ Revolutions (last console version) it's very different as that was a lessened version. This, however is great once you get a feel using a controller.

This PS4 game comes on a disc. It is wireless, and the ink doesn't come off of the disc when you rub it in the sand. It is round and there is a hole in the middle! There is no way to play this PS4 game on the Nintendo switch unfortunately. It is waterproof also, so that's a big plus. I don't recommend using this game as a heart surgery guide. Overall it is a pretty good game, and I would buy it 5 more times to complete the set!
I bought this game for my dad who use to play this on the computer and he loves it
We've been waiting for this game to be released for some time now. Well worth the wait! Definitely lose track of time playing it!
Figured this one would be hard to mess up, my only complaint about the game is that the dlc cost more than the game itself.
Its a fun game to play. It has Great graphics. I like it.
Just as good as the PC version. Controls work great even with the PS4 controller.
I've yet to win a game. it's been more than a few years since I last played civilization games. I somewhat like it. Be prepared to put in hours in this game.
Fun game, a bit buggy. This version is more in line with the mobile and Switch version of Civ 6 in terms of graphical detail and unit count and not the PC version
Way more difficult to difficult to get started and playing. Not like the PS3 verso.

Originally I was excited to find out that Civs VI was going to be available on the PS4. I owned Civs 4 and loved it. I still play Civs 4 on PS Now till today. So instinctively I purchase the new Civ VI. Unfortunately I am left disappointed. The game play isnt the same. It felt like I was just pushing buttons with nothing happening turn after turn. I tried playing several times and now I'm stuck with a $59 game that I wont play. Such a disappointment.
The Civilization series has finally returned to consoles and it is an incredible addition to the game collection. It fills a void that is currently not met on PS4 and brings hours of entertainment.
This is a Christmas gift and it was easily obtained at Best Buy.
Bought is game for my 11 and 8 year old children. They like playing and exploring the different aspects of the game together.
Great game great graphics. Lots of levels and able to purchase cars people helicopters with coins you earn. Lots if fun!

This is a tough one. I love this game. It's a love letter to GTA that takes place in the Lego city world. It's so much fun and, in some ways, better than GTA. It's also kid friendly. Amazing. Unfortunately the game crashes very frequently when on free roam (not on missions) on my Xbox one s, and my kid and I both find it increasingly frustrating as a result. If you can snag it on sale and have a lot of patience, it's a great game.

An open world Lego game? Side missions a plenty? Unknown characters you really don't care about until you start to play and enjoy the story for what it is? Yep, this game has all this and more. If you're a fan of the Lego games, this is one to add to your collection.
Amazing Metroid type of game. Definitely worth trying
This game it was awesome, it was better than the first one in all leves if you like metroidvania, get this game support the teen who create this types of games
Off the subject. But...hey Best Buy crew....if you stop giving points after so many reviews......STOP offering them.

Obsidian Entertainment essentially made Fallout without the Fallout license. It has the same tone as Bethesda's Fallout games despite the setting being wildly different, the gameplay feels similar yet more refined, and there is an added layer of polish that has been absent from this style of game for awhile. Buy this game if: -You enjoy Role Playing Games. -You are a fan of Fallout 3, 4, New Vegas, or even Vampire the Masquerade Bloodlines. -You want to see a game developed by masters of the genre. -You like quests with meaningful choices, dialogue with impact, and an atmosphere that is unmatched by modern games in the genre. -You want to support a developer who clearly deserves it. -You dislike abuse of power specifically on a corporate level. Do NOT buy this game if: -RPG's just aren't your thing. -You have astrophobia. -You think Fallout 76 is a genuinely good game. -You love capitalism and corporate abuses of power.* -You dislike dialogue in video games. This is an informal review, thus I wouldn't give the game a score, but this is legitimately everything I, and many others, wanted Fallout 4 to be. I say this as someone who has enjoyed Fallout 4 for ~1000 hours. Seriously, The Outer Worlds is a master class in game design and Obsidian deserves all praise they get. It isn't perfect, there are a few things that the game could use (grenades, third person mode, more Parvati, etc.) but the pros greatly outweigh the cons and I highly recommend it. *Actually, if you like corporate abuses of power then this game might even be for you. It's an RPG to the core and supports you making choices, thus you can be a corporate shill.

This game is extremely fun so far. I also agree with the devs this will have replay-ability because you'll want to try new skill trees or do things differently. Reminds me of Fallout New Vegas with revamped graphics and better weapons/choices and looks. The followers seem to have more to them too as opposed to Fallout New Vegas.
Imagine if fallout new Vegas had a child with borderlands, and you get the idea.
Its not quite Fallout, very similar to New Vegas In game play , great graphics controls are good. Characters could use some polish But over a good game
Altho obsidian has the bad habbit of making incomplete games this is no exeption but they make sure ur not feeling like that anymore. Great game hope they make it even betterl.
It's a weird feeling to have bought a full game that didn't require a season pass , a yearly pass, or some other added expenses and it's a good one at that.

If you like Fallout, Bioshock, and other similar games, you will love this one! Same game mechanics, same open world gameplay, same immersive storyline with lots of choices and results. Graphics are amazing - no glitches so far! My only complaint is, just like with similar games, you kind of have to avoid the main storyline and find all the sidequests if you want to make the game last. Otherwise you will blow through the whole game in a couple days. Replayability is very high though, with different character builds and dialogue choices throught the game. I'm looking forward to DLCs that will extend gameplay!

This is by far the best game ever made, its a game where you can play as you will. It takes itself seriously and its a fun, SMART GAME! Like a smart phone, its a smart game. Unlike greedy companies like EA and ubi soft! I give this game a 10 out of 10!!!!!
Reminded me a lot of Fallout. Honestly, I'm not the biggest fan of western RPGs as they tend to feel really unpolished and bloated. This one never really hooked me.

You play as a somewhat nefarious space pirate, rounding up a crew of ne'er do wells on a mission for profit and--maybe--the greater good. You aim to misbehave. It's Firefly the game...or at least as close as we're likely to get. The art direction is stellar, the combat is frenetic, and the characters are as wild and wacky as you'd ever want in a space romp. It feels equal parts Fallout and The Expanse, with a much less dire long game. This is an outrageously fun and funny game. The characters are each deep and interesting, the quests are varied and unique, and the gameplay is constantly fun. I highly recommend.

This game started out well. If you liked the good Fallouts, this plays like that franchise. The game kind of falls off slowly around the middle of the game. I had fun playing this overall though think it is a the bottom of the 2019 games I've played. The skill tree (there are actually two) was weak. In other games, by the end of the game your character has filled out most or at least grown strong in a skillset that works for you. In this game, you don't fill up the entire sill tree which means you can end up spending your points on skills that don't really help. You do want to spend skill points on your style of preference, but a better strategy is to spend points on the way that unlocks specific things in the game. That's why I agree with a previous suggestion to wait until you need a skill before you use the points. The story is weak and discovered through a slow dialog / subtitle process. Talking to the other characters seems to take ten times longer than it should. It reminds me of reading through a Choose Your Own Adventure book from the past. People who buy shooter games probably do not want to spend huge chunks of time reading through conversations and logs. There are multiple endings depending on your decisions, but none of them, good, bad or otherwise seemed at all interesting. It appears that to have fun in combat, you need to play at a high difficult setting. If you play on normal, don't use the max of two companions or the teammates will take out most of the bad guys. I have other minor gripes on this game but I would recommend playing this game once if you don't have any other new games.

As a fan of the old Fallout and KOTOR games, I've been really enjoying what they did with this. It brings back fond memories of the Fallout New Vegas days, which is one of my favorites all together. Beautiful design, and quite entertaining throughout. I give this a 9/10 easily.

Aside from being the Fallout-killer gamers have needed, the game also blends in flavors of Mass Effect and Bioshock - the outcome being a product that is incredibly immersive, but also somewhat shallow in some areas. My first and major gripe is an easy swipe at low hanging fruit: the load times, sweet Zeus are they long. At first I was glad they had some great art to stare at during the load screens, but by the end I wanted to never see them again. Minor gripe aside, what really cuts into the greatness at hand is basically one that can be blamed on something like budget, and that is the game becomes rather redundant certain areas: guns, even though they can be upgraded on multiple way, they do start to become junk-fodder for the inventory menu. And speaking of inventory, I had a TON of it on a normal mode play through - I only used most of the consumable out of curiosity after not having touched them for almost the entire game. The same goes for ammo, armor and weapon upgrades - I hope Supernova mode remedies the general feeling of being overpowered. And lastly, as big as the game feels, and as much player decision is involved, at some point the veil starts to thin and show where the pathways converge. It is worth mentioning that the skill points can definitely change a persons game style and experience. Just dont expect to be pulling of any no-killing stealth runs, as no matter what youll either be shooting or slicing down enemies to progress. Now onto some of the positives. From the get-go, no matter what console, the game looks beautiful. Graphics in detail, such as characters, can be somewhat tamed down from the usual AAA push, but it doesnt detract attention in any way. Movement is fluid and feels much better than the jank that came with Fallout games - dont get it wrong, there is still some jank, but not the annoying sort. Dialogue options are fun to play with, and are well worth exploring with almost all characters, most definitely the companions. Some companion stories give a bit more strings to latch onto, but all are still great. Exploring the multiple planets offers a variety of settings, each of them with their own personality and atmosphere. Overall, everything carries a great symbiosis between all of its gameplay/story systems. Side missions can be fetch-questish at times, but ultimately most are immersive and fun to take on. As a whole, the game has very little flaws, and where they do exist its mostly a matter of the game being a new IP with limitations - fortunately the creators are legendary enough to know where/how to apply the proper amount of experience into the size of game they had in mind. With Obsidian being acquired by MS, I can definitely see this becoming a franchise with bigger and more fruitful ideas, and the small flaws practically erased. The story was in vein with these sort of games, and while this one couldve had a little more of everything, it succeeds in doing what it set out to do, if not better. I absolutely enjoyed this one, and think its fit for all sorts of players to take on, but its also clear that fans of Fallout (especially New Vegas) will dig what The Outer Worlds has to offer. I truly hope to see another entry thats able to expand upon the ideas that are presented in this original.

The Outer Worlds is exactly what I was hoping it would be. It's a FPS RPG with a large amount of loot and customization options. The quests play out much like those in the Fallout series. The gun play however, is quite a bit tighter. It's not as good as other dedicated FPS but that's only a small portion of the game. The only downfall for me is the smaller sectioned off maps. Instead of one enormous sprawling wasteland to explore there are multiple smaller planets. Most of which are sectioned off with cliffs which make the game feel a little claustrophobic at times. Coming to the edge of a map is almost always just walking into a rock wall.
This is a great game. If you enjoy the fallout games before this last mess they made, youll love The Outer Worlds. Enjoy the storyline. Very clever writing. Hilarious! A must have!
This is a fantastic game. Its basically Fallout in space with fewer fetch quests and less filler in general.

Yes this game borrows heavily from the Fallout series and it's set in space. Quite frankly, Obsidian should really be allowed to take over the Fallout series considering how well this game and FO: New Vegas is written. Bethesda is really ruining the FO franchise in my opinion with that travesty of FO76. But I digress. So far 10 hrs in, I am really digging The Outer Worlds which is this first person rpg/shooter/choose your own adventure game. For one, the character creator is the best I've seen in a while. The story lines and story paths are based on your choices in dialog and actions which I love; Obsidian really knows what they are doing when it comes to writing and branching story lines and not just giving everyone a safe ending regardless of choices made. The comedy in the writing is also great and not annoying or childish like BL3. I love this version of VATs supremely better vs. the FO series. I just wish you could map VATs here to L1 instead of R1. Lastly, the orchestral soundtrack is ridiculously good and I find myself humming the melodies for days after! If you love the FO series and good RPG's, show this industry that you want more games that are like this vs. Bethesda turning their franchises into random loot, action games without souls because they are greedy: yuck!

This review is not a knock on the game one bit, its actually a really great game so for that I'll give it 5 stars. My complaint about it is that Microsoft has their grimy little fingers all over this release. What I mean is that unless you play this on a xbox one x, you wont experience it in 4K resolution but a upscaled version of it. So whether you choose to play on a base PS4 or PS4 Pro its the same thing. Even on the back of the case there is no usual indicator that says 'PS4 Pro Enhanced'. Here is a direct quote from Private Division, 'It includes 4K textures and resolution on Xbox One X and PC, and upsamples to 4K from 1440p on PS4 Pro. ' So use your best judgement on which platform you choose to play this.

Everyone was saying over and over that this is what Fallout 76 should have been. Honestly I'm not seeing that or agree with it. It's a fun game for sure, but it's not pulling me in like Fallout ever has. There's a ton of quests, but I find the armor and weapons stats to be confusing as well as the modifications you can do to them. It's like there are too many options for all this. I feel like there is always a huge rush of information coming at you and it takes me out of the enjoyment of playing it. I also wish this was a true open world. You can explore, but only so far. Pretty much all the enemies you kill stay gone for good, so once you've pretty much conquered an area, there is little more to do there. The graphics are ok, but just that. Nothing has really impressed me that much with those. I'm actually kind of disappointed in places where it seems to glitch a little, or if you try to see better details in something (Like your ship) the graphics seem to blur out a little bit. I can do 4k, but I'm pretty sure this game doesn't play in it. I dunno, over all I just don't think it's as amazing as everyone was hyping it would be. I'm still playing but it's been a week since I have, and I don't have a huge desire to jump back in. I will. At some point... When I feel like it.

Everything you read is way to small at the bottom of the game, hard to know what to do and where to go. The whole game as you play it is very confusing, you can't sit on any chairs. $69 game should only be worth $19. If you get it as a gift trade it in for any other game.
All the DLC are not on the disc, and be ready to download 30 GB update when you first start your game. Besides that this is a pretty good deal if you are into Battlefield game.

Here is my experience with this wonderful game, I got a PS4 Pro and this game is stunning on the graphics and BF1 Revolution pack is a great plus I love the campaign in the online multiplayer... I would highly recommend check this game out
Awesome graphics, great story play, online play is tough for me, guys are good. But definitely worth money if you play FPS...
This was a gift for my husband. He loved all Battlefield game. He can play it all weekend
Mu Husband love the gift. Played every time. Fun every week.

I've was converted to the Battlefield series with Battlefield 3 on PS3. Battlefield 4 is one of my favorites but Battlefield 1 might have the best array of multiplayer modes I've seen. The new Operations Mode is phenomenal. The replay value is immense. The graphics and sound are as good as it gets on the PS4. And picking up the Revolution version for only $30 before applying my rewards certificates makes it even better!

To make such a beautiful game out of such a horrible period of time feels odd to me, but there it is. Great gameplay and solo campaign, which is what I'm mostly interested in. Endless entertainment for multiplayer.
My son and his friends love this game. They play a lot.
I love all the Battlefield game and especially Battlefield 1 because it has good graphics and many options to choose from....
These game products are too expensive for what you actually get. Gaming is all overpriced.
The funniest most action packed open world game ive ever played
Really fun open world game. Need more games like this on switch!
I have both Saints Row games on the Switch and this one is the better of the two. Better gameplay, music, humor, and fun. Highly recommended.

Looks great, runs great, storyline is funny and awesome, and it comes with all the DLC on one cartridge! Price point is fair at $40, better price would be $30, but not such a big deal. Definitely a must have for the Switch.
Great fun game at these times of pandemic good to just laugh and enjoy a goofy game
just the opening sequence alone deserves a play!(Aerosmith's dont want to miss a thing plays as the BGM) explosive fun!

I have found this game to not only be beautiful but also its the best game of the series since reboot. The puzzles are surprisingly challenging and the leveling system works very well. I would agree that in some portions of the game it almost seems like a horror game as they have captured some eerie environments very well. The sound design is exceptional and if you have surround this game takes excellent advantage of the surrounding ambient noises. Controls are pretty tight with some awkward camera goofiness on occasion, but nothing game breaking. The underwater environments are also some of the best of the series and again I cant get over how gorgeous they look! If you have 4K and HDR with a PS4 Pro or an Xbox One S/X you are in for a treat. Definitely 4.5/5 stars!

Shadow of the Tomb Raider steps forward in hopes of duplicating on the previous Rise of the Tomb Raiders quality and capabilities! It doesn't disappoint! While I feel their are less fire fights then the previous game, this game has added many new and intriguing Tomb Raiding challenging puzzles and quests! The graphics and frame rate run smoother on the PS4 version then the Xbox One X so I picked it up for the PS4. Don't hesitate and pick it up!

A couple cool moments here and there but otherwise this game was dissapointing. Bland story and characters, and very little combat that still feels weird. All the side activities honestly felt like a chore and not something I was I interested in so I forced myself to just play through the short campaign and finish it. If you want to know what this type of game should be like play Uncharted4 and Lost Legacy.

As both a rollicking, horror-kissed action-adventure and an introspective story about obsession and family, Shadow of the Tomb Raider works as a powerful finale to this particular chapter of Laras history.

The last game of the reboot was great! Definately preferred this and ROTTR over the 1st one story wise as they flesh out Lara and her past. Gameplay was pretty solid too, I loved the new stealth mechanics and kills. It seems like this may be the last game of Tomb Raider for a long time so I definately recommend it to close up Lara's story before her descent into the classic Tomb Raider.

Absolutely stunning and an incredible game to boot. While not as action-heavy as the last installment the focus on exploration in puzzles has been cranked up to 11 and I am very happy about that. While the game tends to feel like a sandbox Adventure... It tends to become quite linear. You'll find yourself for going many of the quests because you just have to go so far out of your way to accomplish them. Beautiful game and a fantastic ending. It's been one heck of a ride!

Lauras back in a new adventure in the jungles of central America plundering mayan pyramids and facing her toughest challenge! Great controls, combat is smooth traversing the environment with her various gadgets and abilities is non stop fun breath taking scenes and gorgeous landscapes lets you escape into the world of tomb raider! A must have for the fan or anyone that wants to be wisked away on an epic adventure!

I have been looking forward to this title for awhile. The Rise of the TOMB Raider was a great update to the franchise and Shadow continues the same. Tomb moment as she becomes the Tomb Raider. In Shadow of the Tomb Raider, Lara must master a deadly jungle, overcome terrifying tombs, and persevere through her darkest hour. As she races to save the world from a Maya apocalypse, Lara will ultimately be forged into the Tomb Raider she is destined to be. HIDE FULL DESCRIPTION

If you played Rise of the Tomb Raider, youve played this game. Not that its a bad game. Or that there arent some graphical improvements. Im sure there is. But overall, the gameplay and feel of the game is identical to Rise. If you enjoy that, and want a different story and setting, then get this game. Graphics are great. Nothing negative to say. Its just for me, it felt boring and repetitive and if you have options to play Odyssey I would go with Odyssey.

Everything about this game, from the graphics to the load times to the game mechanics themselves screams last gen. Top of it's generation PS3, but PS3 nonetheless. The graphics are more solid (without bad scaling artifacts that plagued the 720p gen for 1080 displays, as we've come to expect for 1080p encodes this gen. But texturing and detail is just not on the level of the latest Assassin's Creed games, Farcry 5, Horizon Zero Dawn, etc, etc. That's not to say it looks at all bad, but I expected better from a game released this late in this generation. Load times are also PS3 level SLOW, and game mechanics in general are firmly rooted in the capabilities and limitations of last gen. Had this game been released the first year the PS4 came out, I wouldn't be so hard on it, as most of the games for the first year or so still seemed to be biased by the previous gen. But I just can't give glowing praise for game based on last gen innovation that was so recently released in 2018. I'm a fanboy of the franchise too, and am grateful that Square Enix continues to develop games based on this version of the character, as I find the current reboot that began last gen to be highly compelling, story wise. But the gameplay itself is devoid of innovation and very plainly behind the times. Recommended for fans of Tomb Raider and Uncharted style games who appreciate following a story, more than for gamers looking for a genuinely ambitious next level gaming experience.

Don't expect an 'open-world' type game; this game is linear. Also, it's very short. I did it in less than 20 hours, and I'm a very casual gamer. Most others I've heard have beaten it in 10 hours. Other than the main story, there is very little else to do in this game. Sure, you can purchase weapons when you get the chance or buy a very limited selection of clothes for the character, but other than that (except trying to locate Playboy magazines or Wanted Posters) the only extra things to do is drive around and shoot innocent people. I would say this game is more of a game you should rent, not purchase just because it is so short.

I loved the story in this game. I thought it was very interesting, except for maybe the end of the game which was a little weird. The gameplay is also very well done, with almost no gliches at all and amazing weapons and you really get the feel of the 40's and 50's in a New York/Chicago place. The length of the story was a little bit shorter compared to other games, but it was long enough for me and I will keep playing to get all the achievements. The graphics were also better than the games I have played recently. One bad thing that stood out through the game however, is that it is not like GTA because there are almost no side missions. There is free roam, but there is not really a plethora of things to do besides go into clothing stores, gun shops, smash cars, etc. This game also is somewhat easy. I played on hard mode, and I had little trouble. Overall, I think this game was great.

Mafia 2's story is nearly the games focus point.Set in the 40's and 50's Vito has return home on leave from World War II.Vito joined as a way to avoid jail time.Vito finds out his father died and left the family in debt.Vito reunites with his old friend Joe,and quickly joins a life of crime.The game is told through chapters.The game features a open-ended map,there are no side missions before,during,and after the game is over,but you can collect magazines and look at the pictures inside.The games guns are the same as the era the game takes place in, Tommy guns,Colt 1911,MP 40 and so on.Interacting with objects in the environment involves 2 action buttons standard action and a violent action,for example,when stealing a car,you can choose to either pick the lock or break the glass.The controls are good even when hiding behind objects such as walls,and crates,to shoot enemies you must flank them.The music is also a good tie in within the world,it makes you feel like you traveled back in time.The graphics at times felt a little dated,but it's the right style for the time.So if your a Godfather,Goodfellas or any gangsta movie fan pick this game up it will not disappoint.

The game was fun for the first 5 or so chapters than it turned bad it seemed rushed and there's only 15 chapters.There are no side missions either.This game is a rent only you will beat it within the time.

Complex sociological themes run through this science-fiction classic about blue collar workers being marooned on a futuristic planet where puppies rule and humans are slaves. You will discover that these highly intellectual canines can both perform public services and talk. They have even established a class system and a political structure. You will suddenly find yourself part of a devalued species, trapped and spending most of your time collecting digital bones that have no value.

Took an Early Access game, full of bugs out of Early Access to justify paid DLC and an absurd price hike. I purchased ARK about a year ago, on sale for about 13 bucks. This was before Wildcard studios released Scorched Earth, a paid DLC while the game was still in Early Access. Lucky for them, because I wouldn't have given wildcard studios a dime after that. For the money I spent, I had a pretty good time playing on a dedicated private server with friends. The game had a lot of bugs (still does) but I felt the developer was doing a decent job pushing updates. I liked the game enough that I was willing to give the developers more money once the game come out to expand the experience. Then Scorched Earth happened. Instead of fixing bugs, improving stability, or pushing quality updates, etc; Wildcard was building maps to sell to people instead of finishing the game. I guess it could be worse, at least they aren't using loot boxes to push micro-transactions.... yet. Now the game is 'finished' and costs 60 bucks (it was $30-35 when in early access) and it's still a buggy mess. Even worse is they announced a season pass with the first DLC coming out in just a month after Ark's retail release which again shows they spent more time on DLC then finishing the actual game. Wildcard Studios got greedy and lost my business and the business of all my friends. If they would have gone about DLC in a way that wasn't so insulting, I would of happily shown my support through buying their DLCs. If you must experience this game for yourself, wait for a price cut. I wouldn't pay more than $20. Though I would suggest that you give your hard earned cash to a more deserving developer.

So you can even get in, now only weekends are full so dont plan on playing then. The big kicker now is they limit the number of tamed dinos a server can have.... the personal tame limit is like 600 when the server tame limit is like 4000. what does this mean? well it means that like 5-6 people on a 70 person server can cap it out and they did. I have around 10 dinos.... i went to tame more and it wont let me because other people have 400+ so now everyone on server (ragnarok 71) is stuck doing nothing. and tons of people tryin to transfer so the last few new servers are capping. so unless you can play on a private server with friends i wouldnt play this if they paid me.

ARK really advanced the survival video game genre. Stuff like being able to build and live on a raft fairly early on are one of the many fun features. However players have squatted all the starting areas on every server by claiming land by building pillars and literally walling off the rest of the virtual world from new players. It takes about 4-5 new charter creations on different servers to find a sever with a tiny slice of buildable land when just starting out. Lost is the feeling of waking up on a new world, more like waking up on the shores of an island overdeveloped by player condos. Conan Exiles, bugs and all, still retains that feel of being alone in the wild for the most part, by comparison to ARK.

The Outer Worlds was a game I didn't know that I wanted...no...that I NEEDED. Its a first person shooter with heavy RPG elements, you liked Fallout: New Vegas? Same people made this. This game pretty much shows that Obsidian deserves you take notice of them as a player in the video game industry. The writing is what sets this game apart, I missed the banter between my squad mates that Mass Effect gave me. I missed doing side quests to help my squad mates in things to better their lives. Don't worry Parvati, I'll get you that date with the woman you're crushing on. I've recommended this game to many people, friends, family, a random passerby on the street, and now I recommend it to you who is reading this. Get the Outer Worlds, if you enjoy smart writing, fun gameplay and meaningful choices, you won't regret it.
