Street Fighter 30th Anniversary Collection on the Switch is a very good compilation of many Street Fighter arcade games in a 10+year time frame (these are all classics so nothing after '99 essentially). The rest comes in the form of soundtracks from the games presented. My favorite part is the huge art gallery they've included in-game to go over little known history, early concepts and more over the 30 years Street Fighter has been around. I'm just a little disappointed that this wasn't labeled 'Arcade Collection' because they're missing out on a lot of other SF releases that would be more fitting under an 'Anniversary Collection' name. However, let me be honest here. The only reason I didn't rush out to get this on any other platform was because I wanted to play Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike on the go because it was my favorite SF game when I was about 15 after discovering it on Dreamcast. I bought it two more times on 360 and PS3 when the HD Online Edition came out but I still needed a TV. Yes, almost exactly 10 years later would I be able to officially play SFIII: 3rd Strike and the other SFIII versions on the go in one game. Street Fighter III: 2nd Impact is my favorite in presentation as it's the only one that holds up in official widescreen. The games are all based on the arcade versions so those used to any console versions (like me) will notice a difference. I still prefer SFIII: 3rd Strike on console but the arcade is good enough for me (even thought the soundtrack is lower quality than the console)! As for the competitive scene, I don't really mind the potential smaller player base on Switch as I'm not an online competitor. I've played fighters casually on arcade all my life and very rarely if ever online. Also one last thing to point out. You can exploit the save system and create a save state during your playthrough. So if you want to get through arcade mode more flawlessly if you lack the skill, you can save before a crucial moment and load it back up if you fail. Overall decent collection for classic fans and those interested in the history of Street Fighter in one compilation.

Can't go wrong with this collection on the Switch. Originally I wanted to grab it on PS4, but opted for it on this platform for the portability. I'm glad I did. All 12 games are arcade PERFECT plus being that they are portable, it makes it even better. if you are a Street Fighter fan, I recommend picking this up. You will NOT be disappointed.

All the games are is 2-D and seem to be perfect ports. I have spent hours playing this game on switch just like I spent hours playing this game on Super Nintendo and PlayStation 2.

I've always loved the SF franchise but this comes up short due to the fact that you can't use the joy sticks on the Switch to control movement. You're stuck with using the directional buttons and that makes it hard to perform some of the moves. Otherwise, this has a lot of great titles for those old school or nostalgic players.
A classic fighting game, have them all its amazing, to remember the old days.

This has everything from the fabled original Street Fighter to Street Fighter III, along with the various versions of those games. I would recommend it specifically to Street Fighter II fans (along with it's sister game Ultra Street Fighter II, the Final Challengers.). You'll probably want an external controller or fight stick of some kind with this (or even the detached Switch joycons in a controller shell) to play this. If you've never played Street Fighter II all you need to know is that it is the king of 2D fighting games and that doesn't mean it's my personal favorite, but I feel it is an objective assessment (though King of Fighters and others are worthy rivals). Of course, for someone like me, who remembers the long lines for the Street Fighter II cabinet in my college arcade, you might figure I have a particular bias, but the game series is a phenomenon for a reason.

What a collection. All of the games play and look amazing and that is almost enough to make you overlook the controls if not using the pad. The collection is not unplayable but it can be frustrating not to be able to pull off special moves and combos. That said, I still think it is worth owning for a handheld experience of these amazing games.

Remember the days when you went to your local arcade to play some Street Fighter. The battles you had with friends and strangers. All those memories return once you get a hold of this game and play it. There's nothing new added to the game itself, just the classic beat them up Street Fighter that we all know. You wont be let down with this purchase. Want to relive those fun memories? Then purchase this game!
You are getting a straight port of the classics in the arcade. So don't expect upgrade graphics. But if you're a fan of the series as I am.. you really can't go wrong with the value.

Playing SF 2 is the main reason to get this game, but the Alpha series and SF3 might be better games overall for the increased roster size and extra technical moves such as parrying. This collection does a good job of preserving the games for the old timers while also introducing a new generation with the classics. The museum in this has a lot of cool extras which is a plus, but sometimes online can get a little laggy

Its a great collection of classic SF games but it does suffer from some minor issues such as not being able to map certain buttons (3x kick/3x punch to ZR/ZL) online battles can be extremely laggy(Switch Wi-Fi players), sound issues with 3rd Strike and only being able to use training mode/play online in 4 games. All in all its a great package for those looking to revisit some classics.
Great game and a great value for what it's price is
Great game, but this will be one of my last purchases with Best Buy as they have made the wrong choice in cancelling the GCU. #SAVEGCU please dont make me shop with Amazon going forward.
We still havent figured out how to play this game
I had not happy at all with this game. I really thought it was going to be a remake of the old game with better graphics.
Cant go wrong with a classic and it comes with the original version

Street Fighter 30th Anniversary collection contains 12 Street Fighter Classics comprised from Street Fighter I, Street Fighter II, Street Fighter III and Street Fighter Alpha series. Only 4 out of the 12 games have online play Street Fighter 2' Hyper Fighting, Super Street Fighter II Turbo, Street Fighter Alpha 3 and Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike. The anniversary collection comes with a lot of extra features and modes that makes this a really good package overall.
I thought ultra street fighter 2 is way better than this anniversary addition.
Always love street fighter but for the nintendo switch it's weird being use to the directional pad that it don't have so gameplay was different
Cool game brings back memories when I was younger.
However playing any of the games on a Joycon is just horrible. Get a pro controller if you can or a fightstick and everything is fine.
Maybe I just never liked Street Fighter that much anyway... I dont know!

This game is well priced at a price I like to spend on games, $39,99, but it is also the best game youve played! With so many street fighter launches, from a few Street fighter 2 games, to street fighter alpha games and up to street fighter 3, you have a collection of street fighter games. If your a fighting game fan this is like a bundle of many street fighter games, including the first street fighter game. Best deal for $39,99. Very high replay value!

Its not anything like the old street fighter. Game play is terrible. Any switch controllers are basically incompatible with the game. The graphics look like the classic game, and thats the only good thing there is about the game (which isnt saying much.)

I'm one of the fan for Dragon Ball Z.Bought it to remember and try to play and choose my favorite fighter Sangoku but not happy for that disc because d don't reflect exactly what m looking for just playing that 3 or 4 times and stop playing...
I didnt like this video game, maybe you can like it. Has around 8 different versions of SF.

So I got this when it was on sale really cheap and with gamers club discount. It is nice to play with bringing back some childhood memories and show the kids what we used to play. I was not expecting the old graphics though. I know that's what we had back then but I think i'm too spoiled now. I read the previous release of street fighter on switch has an option to use current graphics so maybe i should try that one too. Not bad, cool to have, especially if you get it on sale.
All those games! The only complaints are the controls are not ideal, even on the the pro controller and the graphics are bad, though there might be an option for better graphics I haven't discovered.
Really bad game in my opinion. Should have read the front better. Wasn't expecting the blocky graphics and old school street fighter
Absolutely terrible. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!! Cant get the game to load. Just nonstop previews of the game. Wish I could return it.

I single player play is fabulous! Great throwback. This was purchased for kids to play against each other and the game is not easily set up to do so. Makes it frustrating and makes the game sit with dust on it.
Poor graphics expected more from the previewed images regarding the game.
I LEAVE ALL MY GAMES SEALED TO COMPLETE COLLECTION OF SWITCH GAMES.

Direct ports of old 8 bit and 16 bit games to a big high definition TV are dissapointing. I was hoping they could have taken the time to at least made the games high definition, but with retro graphics.

purchased for my children as the recently have gotten in to fighting games such as marvel vs capcom and injustice. I would not put this on the same level as those interms of graphics. Also unless you are somehwere around 40 you may not know who some of the characters are.

I had to be honest with myself in giving this game 3 stars and wanted to give it higher, but there some negatives that knocked off a few stars in my own opinion. First the good; U basically have the entire Street Fighter collection as your finger tips including SFIV if you pre-ordered the game which I think was an awesome incentive, but i already own it on Xbox 360, PS3 and PS4. Yes, these are straight arcade ports with minimal options available and this is were the negatives come in. First the button configuration options are bare bones at best, you cannot select the level difficulty of the AI in any of the games, as far as I know anyway, Not enought screen filter options when compaired to previous console ports for some of these games, training mode and online modes are limited to just 4 out of the 12 games, but I can understand why they might've made that decision since people can prepare themselves when they go online for those specific titles. Another small gripe is the bonus material which is all good and stuff, but I noticed they had a page or two where the art content was in there twice? And wish there were more notes about the stories of the games instead of just artwork show or maybe even included a small video documentry about some or all of the titles, now that would've been awesome. At the end of the day I would recommend this game to any fighting game fan or gamer in general, there is a lot do still and of course the games are a blast to play either solo or with friends.
Definitely not what I expected. I couldn't play the actual game. The game is very misleading. Definitely will be returning.
very hard to understand and play .
NOT AS GOOD AS I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE. IT HAS A LOT OF THE OLD GAMES BUT NOTHING NEW.
While it is a fanatstic overall package, I am not a fan of the d-pad on the switch. better played with a pro controller
Nothing like good old Street Fighter, playing this bring back memories.
Old school graphic quality. Would have like a new version with better visuals

if you preordered the xbox or ps4 version of this game, you got an additional 15th game via DLC. however, for switch, you are stuck with 14. that's silly especially when the Mega Man collections from Capcom force you to download 50% of those collections onto the SD card. Shame on you Capcom for shorting the Switch faithful with this 2nd installment of SF on Switch.

Come with quite a few games but I read that all of them are direct arcade ports. SF1 was almost unplayable due to inaccurate controls. The alpha and SF3 series were worth playing but couldn't get into the older sf2's.

Plenty of Street Fighter 2 versions to play, as well as SF1, Alpha1, Alpha2, Alpha3, and 3 versions of SF3. Special Features include music, artwork and a timeline chronicling the history of Street Fighter. One negative issue with the Switch version is the joycons. No dpad is make or break for some people. And some people have been reporting trouble with lag with the joycons.
The game is great offline, but since no one online has a hardwired connection, sets are laggy.
Great collection of games, history, and artwork, but unfortunately the versions of SF2 used in this are the early versions which were punishingly difficult.
Im a hardcore street fighter fan, because this is on the switch console. Cant play this game to the fullest due to the controller.

It is a fun game but the game is going to be discontinued by SquareEnix so you prob wont be able to play with others. Depends on how long they keep the servers up. I mainly got it just for my game collection.

But it fell below my expectation... Had bought it, thinking I could play versus mode offline, only to find out, Versus mode is only avilable via Online through PSN, which requires another consoles, game, and a PSN account... Be warn: Great games to enjoy your Final Fantasy worlds, but bad if you want to play local lan game.

This is a great game to those who love the Final Fantasy series. The graphics are absolutely incredible. It is fun to play as your favorite hero/villain. The gameplay can be a bit difficult. It is not as easily as a hack/slash type of game but it is still pretty fun. I wish all the characters were unlockable within the game. There is a free demo version of this game so you can give it a try to see if you like it. It will cycle about 4 playable characters each week that you can play offline or online. Also it does not include the story mode. If you do decide to purchase the game, all your save data from the demo is easily transferred into the purchased game and it does it automatically. Overall, nice looking and fun game and a great buy to those who love Final Fantasy!
This game is not as good as the psp counterparts. Try the free online version before buying this product. The story suffers greatly!

With RPG elements and fighting characters put together. You'll have this game. Visually it's pretty good but can be overwhelming for first time players. But, like most games. Once you understand the concept of the game. Things do get much easier. There are enough tools in the game to do so.

This game is great for FF fans. If you have been playing FF games for a long time you will like all the characters to fight with. The story mode is pretty short, but it's better than most other fighting games I've played. The graphics were really great on PS4 Pro. The boss battles are epic and difficult.

Call forth familiar summons like Ifrit, Shiva and Odin to dominate the opposing side. This is not your average fighter - this is your fantasy, your fight.Enter the arena in early 2018.A PlayStation Plus membership is needed for online play.

Note, you won't get nearly as much enjoyment out of this if you aren't a fan of the Final Fantasy series, but you may still enjoy it. This is an in-depth fighting style game spanning the Final Fantasy series. It is quite fun, but don't expect to button mash and win.

For those use to Mortal Combat and Street Fighter this is not the same. Due to being a 3d fighter the controls are a little more complicated and not really a game you can just pick up and button mash. But once you get past the learning curve the game gets fun and visually amazing.

I got this game thinking it was going to be like the psp versions but the whole premise was change they took a lot of things out like the character special moves. They now religh on the bosses you choose.
Always good to have a final fantasy fighting game. Controls could be improved.
gaming can be a non productive habit, but I like the fact that my son can use programming language to build stuff
Honestly i thought this game was for kids but it ended up being super good and addictive; i threw down royal games to play this and honestly i havent stopped playing this since i bought it.
Bought this game for my thirteen year old daughter and she absolutely loves the game and it keeps her occupied
Love it! Its works great. Works just as expected. I would highly recommend this to any one that likes to play Minecraft.
Minecraft digital code for xbox very convinient way to download.
My kids play this a lot, and use it as a great creative outlet to build, dream, and discover.

We've been playing this since it was ported over to the Xbox 360. We did a digital download this time because it made it so much easier not to have my two youngest boys have to handle a physical disk.
My children love playing this game I also enjoyed it and wouldnt give the children the remote back

My son really likes to play this game. We had this on one XBox, but my younger son couldn't get it on his (had to get him his own console). Ordered the digital version and was able to get it downloaded quickly without issue.
I play this game with my ex boyfriend a lot, its a really fun game and we build things for each other

You are a Man on a quest to seek the holy grail ...... wait that's not right, you are seeking to do something with someone while something else is trying to stop you, Orcs, Orcs are trying to stop you, you must stop the Orcs or doom / something.
Love playing this game! I dont play many games, so Im not very good, but this game has settings that make it easier and more fun for me. Great story line and graphics
Huge story mode. Tons of missions, objectives, and characters to encounter. Be ready to spend hours of game time.
Graphics on this game are excellent on the Xbox One X. Glad I held out until I got this version.
Great sequel. The gameplay is awesome and challenging. I would recommend this to a friend.
I just got this game I like the shadow of mordor game hopefully this game will be better than the 1st one got the deluxe edition for a steal aka deal right now

The game takes some adjusting if you've played the first one. However, once you get used to it the gameplay is flawless. The graphics and cinematics are breathtaking. The gameplay feels like the original yet revolutionized. I heard alot of complaining about the ending gameplay because it used to take hours to finish, but the game has been updated so that the 'shadow wars' are significantly shorter. This is one of my favorite games and it test your skills.
Love this game!! They took the good thofrom the original and made it better!!!

As the title says this game took everything about part 1 and made it 10 times better this is a beautiful looking game with an amazing story and hours of entertainment with great game play. Must own for lord of the ring fans and any action RPG style fans.
Got this at a discount, good game, got this during Black Friday

The one thing I always despise about PES is the lack of licensed teams. Until I discovered that I was able to import data to create actual licensed teams. The creative control, the customization, and the engine this game runs on are all amazing. I can control all aspects of my player and customize them the way I want. Unlike Fifa, you can edit the teams to whatever you like. The graphics are also super accurate to the players, even though Real Madrid IS FIFA's team, PES still has the better character models. And the game play is solid as always, and with the new abilities the game is much more realistic. Overall, I am glad to have purchased this game for full price because it is worth it if you're a die hard soccer/futbol fan. Now I have something to play until FIFA goes on sale, ha!

PES 2019 is really a great football game but it lacks a number of things. Now im not going to talk about licences because everybody knows that already, the thing that bothers me the most is how ridicilous the superstar difficulty is! It doesnt mather if you are a small team or FC Barcelona, alle teams play as if they are Real Madrid on steroids! Now you can say okay then play on top player difficulty but then the game becomes extremely easy! There is no balance in difficulty! It seems very scripted! I really believe that its one of the best football games when it comes to ball physics and graphics and all the things that matter on the pitch but playing master league becomes extremely annoying when you keep losing because of scripting!

The play is so fluid and it feels so real. I've been playing Fifa since Fifa 94. My first PES was 2018. I wasn't planning on purchasing this year again. Not a PES fanboy. I tried the demo and I was sold. PES is plain FUN. Konami desperately needs to hire a professional UI guy. Their menu is lacking, to say the least, but the gameplay is pure GOLD! If I had to choose I would buy PES 2019 over Fifa 2019 just because improvements are very minimal year over year. Konami this year is only supporting current gen system which allowed them to improve graphics over previous years. I suck defending in FIFA and in PES it feels I actually can control my defense vs holding all kind of buttons for second player, protecting, and so forth. In PES you are in control!!!! A++++

This is a 'real' football game. If you're a true football fan then gameplay is what should matter most to you, and PES definitely wins at that versus fifa. Sure, it lost several licenses. But, with option files that's easily sorted. Fifa gameplay is the same year after year. The details in pes are amazing. Recommended.

The gameplay in Super Lucky's Tale is ridiculously fun. Alot like mario odyssey but on a smaller scale. Looks great on a TV and in handheld mode. My only complaints are with the difficulty and esthetic. So far its definitely on the easy side. And esthetically is very kiddie. Overall it's still a very fun platformer. Probably a better fit for handheld mode.
If you like Super Mario 64/Odyssey, Banjo Kazooie, Yooka Laylee, or Crash, you'll love this game. It's easy to approach and difficult to master.
Really great game The controls are smooth and the storyline is fun.

I bought this game when it released, and can honestly say that it is one of the best platforming games on Switch. It has some challenge for older players, but not too much that a younger child could not play it. A perfect blend of difficulty levels in my opinion. I believe this is a must have game for any Switch owner. It truly is a hidden gem. This game is pure fun. And, who couldn't use some more fun in their lives?
Its a fun addicting game that makes it hard to put it down
This game is great for anyone at any age. The gameplay is smooth and simple like any other game would be.
This is a excellent game with so many different platforms and puzzles. Its different than the Xbox version. Very fun game and easy to complete 100%.

It's a great game. I've spent about 3 hours playing so far and it's easy to pick up and play. The controls are easy for anyone. It has interesting characters and an interesting story to keep you invested. The graphics are impressive and vibrant. It's reminiscent of Mario 64 and Donkey Kong Country. Each level has multiple objectives beyond the main objective to complete before facing the boss.
Great game and definitely worth owning for the Nintendo switch.

this game is a gem not only because its fun but it allows younger folks to play and not get too discouraged because of the sometimes ease of the game. Great game for younger kids as well as older kids adults.
this game I've been really enjoying and has very addictive game play and when I'm done I'll try the Xbox version next

I'm a LONG TIME classic Mega Man & X fan but I will NOT be supporting physical DAY ONE because how capcom handled Mega Man classic series physical release for Nintendo switch as a REMINDER collection ONE 1-6 is on the game card but collection TWO 7-10 you have to download that. Which is about 5 GB Capcom could have put all 10 games on a slightly bigger sized physical card but instead decided to release physical version CHEAPEST way possible NES games are TINY in memory size. the biggest file would be Mega Man 8 Not to mention many YEARS FROM NOW when collection is long OUT OF PRINT and nintendo eshop is shut down. Switch owners won't able to experience Mega Man legacy collection 2 because with USED games the download code will be redeemed already. Plus downloads have a CERTAIN TIME LIMIT and once that number of months or year has passed then the code voucher is WORTHLESS in my opinion this is what capcom should have done release both collections separately for $20 each Seeing this make me concerned for upcoming X collection 'switch version' this is my PREDICTION X-X4 on a card and X5-X8 downloadable. If that happens to be the case which is most likely then I will just buy X set digitally
40 dollars for a collection that had everything on one disk on the ps2 that cost 20. Now half of them are downloads.

I grew up with Megaman X as my go to series (having for some reason skipped the megaman series). I still remember a lot of the levels, and tricks needed to get through them in one piece. If you think this will be an easy breeze, think again. This was a time when games made you work for them. Now mind you this is easier then megaman, the X series added some help there, but its still hard. There is a new added mode to make it easier for people just starting out, but I haven't tried it to see HOW much easier it makes it. Runs smooth on switch in dock and handheld with no problems. Only complaint I could have, make sure you have internet and some memory space if you want the full game. The 'second half' of the game is a download code which is annoying.

As a kid, Mega Man 2 was my favorite game. This collection of the first 10 Mega Man games is really good to go back and play those wonderful Mega Man games I loved, and a bunch I never got a chance to play. Includes 10 Mega Man games, but note that half the games are digital download with a code included. (Yeah, it's a bummer). This game is great for people looking for a trip down memory lane, for a younger generation to get a chance to play some classics, and for parents to introduce their kids to some quality games with minimal controller inputs.
Incredible games but Legacy Collection 2 should have been on cartridge. Theres no excuse for it not to be, the files arent that big.

There are 2 serious issues with this package to be aware of. 1. This package only contains Volume 1, Volume 2 comes with a code as a digital copy so you will need to download it. 2. The game has lag when playing in Dock mode so keep that in mind. Portable mode or table top has no lag and plays great.
The game itself is good but only half of game is on cart. Would not have bought it if I knew that. Paid full price for half a game not cool capcom...!

Pretty lame trend of capcom and nintendo putting half the collection on the game card and the other half as dlc. Make me waste space on both my gamecard slot and the sd card. Grab it if its onsale. Otherwise not worth the aggravation. And the games are fun.

I'm 40 years old. If you remember these games when they first came out. You will not be disappointed. The only issue that i have with this release is not of the game itself. It's the way that it was released and executed by splitting up MM 1-6 and MM 7-10. Also, if you don't have at least 5GB on your system. You won't get the second half of the game since it's only available as a digital code. I like buying physical games still and this was a disappointment. Game play itself is good and the transitions plus difficulties are still there with some cool bonus stuff. The time challenges are worth it because it tests the true die hard fans with extra challenges that even the veteran player will find challenging. It's worth double or triple dipping to purchase.

Great collection but lacked several games like the fighting game, kart racer, wily game and mega man and bass. The a big negative is that the legacy collection is digital. If Im buying physical, its because I want it physical.

This collection is one of the best values for the switch, you get 10 games on one cart and one download (yes collection 2 is a download so make sure you have space). But the games, they are just as they were on the NES, SNES, and PS One. If you're a Mega Man fan than this is a must have and a lot of fun to play.

The first six Mega Man games included on the first collection are all pretty dang good, and the 'rewind' feature included on them (you can simply hit the L button to reverse time and redo a tricky jump or tough boss) as well as the ability to save anywhere lessen the crushing difficulty substantially and make them way more fun! The second collection is missing the rewind and save features and is much more of a mixed bag in terms of game quality. It's also a download code, which is frustrating. Still, the strength of the first collection makes it worth owning! You do also get a Mega Man cleaning cloth for your Switch screen, which is a nice bonus!

Just like everyone else, this game could have been great but it falls short because Capcom decided to put Legacy 1 (1-6) on the cartridge but Legacy 2 (7-10) is actually a download. Didn't realize this till after I opened it. Otherwise, it's cool to be playing these games again.

The controller seemed more responsive when I played on my TV vs as a portable game system. The rewind feature is really cool, but I'm glad I did not have it as a kid. It would have robbed me from the frustration of dying and the lessons learned from failure, but also it would have stolen the joy of a completing the game.

I purchased this game for my grandson while he was visiting for the summer. He rarely ask me to buy him anything. So when he asked for this, I couldn't resist. Buying it earned me 'the best grandma ever' award according to him. The game was easy to play. He enjoyed it better when we hooked it up to the television. We had to purchased him some games for it.

10 great Mega Man platforming goodness, the only reason i don't give it the full 5 star is due to the seperation of the game products. the first six games are on a cartridge while the remaining 4 are downloadable via a slip code. I highly recommend this especially with the upcoming mega man 11 coming out this fall!

I wish this was two game carts or an all-on-one cart...the mixed 'cartridge and code' method just feels clunky to me. Also, there's no getting around the fact that this is two separate games stapled together in one collection; the UIs between the two are distractingly different. Notably absent is the Super Famicom version of Mega Man & Bass That said..this is the best way to play Mega Mans 1-10. If you have nostalgia for these games, or maybe missed them entirely and want to pick them up for the first time, this is a great collection to do so with.

I'm very happy with this purchase. 10 Mega Man games for one good price. Also includes mini games. Capcom really did a wonderful job of packaging this. I only wish this included Mega Man Legends. New added feature with this set is that you can rewind within the game if you make a mistake. Down side is on the right joycon the thumb control knob can get in the way.

The games themselves are very solid ports but the lack of a physical copy for megaman collection 2 hurts this collection at a $40 price point. Still solid games tho if you want portable classic megaman
So I buy the physical edition and only get collection 1 on cartridge collection 2 is download only. They could of fit it on the card. Love mega man, dont love how they marketed this one

The cartridge in the box gives access to Mega Man 1 through 6. It also comes with a download code for a game that collects 7 through 10. It would be better if they were all on the cartridge, but since for other platforms these collections released at different times, it makes sense.

All 10 of mega man's adventures in one compilation perfectly emulated as far as I can tell. It does suck that 7, 8, 9 and 10 are not on the game cartridge but you will overlook that once you start playing and enjoying this pack. I also have both on ps4 but mega Man just feels right on the switch, portable is great. Pick it up before 11 comes out in October.

It is so great to have the classic Mega Man titles on the Swtich! The minor gripe I have with this is that Legacy Collection 2 (which is games 7-10) are an internet download and not included on the cart. I really wish Capcom wasn't so cheap. Making the cart with just a few more GB of storage would have made all ten games fit and then no internet download would be required at all. So in the end: great games, frustrating 'physical' product due to so many being just downloads.

If you are a megaman fan definitely pick this game up. 10 games for a low price, plus there are additional features like challenges and art galleries. Part of it is digital but you can just play it then delete it and redownload it again if you want to. Not sure why so many people are complaining about that. Plus you get reward points for getting digital

Nintendo Switch is the perfect platform for the Mega Man series. As a Mega Man lifer I've enjoyed the series in both home console and portable devices throughout the series' lifetime. It's absolutely fantastic to be able to play the original series on the Switch where I can play it on my 65' 4k TV or on the go in handheld mode.

This could have been on one cartridge. I could care less about the challenge modes and music players.I am sure many people would have been fine omitting those features to cram the game on a smaller cartridge. We also don't need the cloths. They could also make the artwork single sided. I am sure removing said things could have helped bring production costs down a bit to allow stuff to fit or allow for a bigger cart. If you buy digitally, you are giving them more of a reason to allow these 'physical' copies. They want you to buy digitally. I suggest getting the collection on the Gamecube, Xbox, PS2, or the original cartridges. Hold on to your Wii for 9 and 10. I didn't buy Resident Evil, LA, WWE, and NBA. I bought the Japanese Climax Edition of Bayonetta. As of now, Mega Man 11 and the Street Fighter Collection are safe. Those I will be buying. **** However, you can buy Mega Man X Collection 2 physically from Japan.

Half of these are digital download codes. Eventually every game on the shelf will have no physical copy and no manual at all. Just an empty case with a download code. Capcom only speaks in green. So vote with your wallet people.

10 rad main line Classic MegaMan games for you to have at home or on the go! You cant go wrong with this Classic MegaMan collection. Already own these 2 collections on the PS4 & the 1st one released on the 3DS yet, this Switch one is my go to by far! This also has MegaMan amiibo support like the 3DS for extra challenges. The extra content & features of these collections are phenomenal! Absolutely amazing for any Classic series MegaMan fan! Seriously can not wait for the MegaMan X Legacy Collections due out this July & MegaMan 11 this Winter! Capcom has been striking back lately & hitting it out of the park.
Not a bad collection. My main gripe is that 8 of these 10 games are old, crusty, samey NES games (or modeled after them). I would recommend the Mega Man X Legacy collection over this.

This was a beautiful piece that really rewards fans of the genre and the series. After getting a chance to play it, I have fallen in love with Megaman and the platforming genre all over again. I love the rewind feature where you can erase your mistakes in an instant using the L trigger on the joy con, essentially allowing you to play through the levels quickly. It was a nice surprise to find what was inside the case. Not only is there some physical swag, but a nice little boost to my Nintendo gold coins as well (cartridge + download = 115 gold coins). All in all, couldn't be happier and is one of the best purchases for my Switch I've made thus far. Also picking up the Megaman amiibo to find out what the title menu will reward me with. Can't wait to find that out. Pick this up if you at all like platformers.
Never played a Mega Man game in my life. I regret that choice now. Loved the game don't mind the digital download since it made the game cheaper.
I am super excited to have all of the mainline Classic Games on Switch, in portable form. However, the lack of games like Mega Man and Bass as well as the Saturn version of 8 is disappointing.

This one is frustrating with Joy-Cons but once I break out my Pro Controller, bosses started to fall. The eshop download takes way too long to download and it is a little inconvenient. I fail to understand why this whole collection is not on a single cart. Nevertheless, thank you Capcom for this nostalgic goodie.
Great for collectors and fans, another great game to add to the collection, got to get the X series also

If you love the Mega Man games, you need this collection. It has the 1-6 NES games, SNES 7, PS1 8 and the retro 9 and 10 they released on the Wii. The NES games still hold up well, and its fun to see the progression of Mega Man across the collection. Highly recommended.

Pointless to buy this - get them both digital. At retail,1-6 are on the game card, and 7-10 are digital only (you get a voucher in the package). These games are very small in file size, no reason for this, so don't support releases abusing this half 'n half policy for collections. Just get them both digital (ends up being 35 bucks).
FINALLY I can play RE-Make and RE0 on the go! These are definitely some of my favorite RE games and having them on the Switch is a dream come true!
Its a good port and having it on the go is really convenient but I was bothered that capcom didnt fit in both the games in one cartridge.

Ive been pleased with all the Resident Evil ports to the Switch so far. This one is on par with the rest. Disappointed that there was only a physical copies for Zero in the case. The other game is a download code.
a great collection but resident evil one is dlc and its $60 total

It's two classic Resident Evil Gamecube games in shiny HD, so what's not to love? Only resident evil zero is on the cartridge, download code for Resident Evil 1. I've only played resident evil zero so far, so this review is concerning that title. Good game for resident evil fans. New players, such as myself won't like the controls, old and outdated. No ability to aim. Worst part of the game is loading screens every time you enter or exit a door. So half the time spent playing is loading screens. Would have though they could have updated the game by now to remove all these loading screens. The game also contains lots of puzzles, internet is your friend. You will most likely need to lookup the solution as the game provides zero hints or explanation for some of them and they are illogical (Stopping the train brakes). If you are a resident evil fan you will probably like this. If not, but still want to try a resident evil game, try the resident evil 1+2 revelations collection, as they are much better games.

This is a short & sweat review Let me start by saying yes the game has been in development for 4 years which In return is the same time it took to develop top tier games like halo gears of war ect ect... with that being said if you go into this game expecting a game on par with halo god of war & GTA 5 you will be let down. If youve played the original crackdown & liked it you will love this one. Crackdown 3 does not deserve all bad reviews its getting from critics. The multiplayer mode wreaking zone is ok in short burst but could use some server & stability patches. Now the main story is a lot of fun especially in coop. Its a great game to just jump in wreck stuff up jump around & collect some orbs to power up your agent. My best advice is be your own review & dont listen to the bad critic reviews that are bashing it because of delays & gameplay not being much different from the original which I think its what makes crackdown crackdown. I bought the game day 1 & really am enjoying it I suggest at least give it a try on game pass to see if its worth a purchase.

If you are a fan of the previous Crackdown games then this will be right up your alley This game doesn't deliver anything new. The same Crackdown you have come to know and love is still here. IF you are a fan of the previous games or Agents of Mayhem you will enjoy this game. Might want to wait for it to go on sale before picking it up. $60 is a bit steep for this type of game.

This is a game that is absolutely a blast to play. Is it the most beautiful work of art? No, though it can still dazzle you with its colorful style. Is it the best platformer ever? No, but it's rewarding overcoming the challenges in getting to the top of structures and getting a particularly difficult orb or turning off a propaganda tower. The jumps and your handling feel crisp and smooth, and when you fall, it's your fault. Overall, the game does exactly what it sets out to do: deliver a tongue in cheek, fun experience. I put about 20 hours in so far, and I have enjoyed every minute. Haven't touched multiplayer, but the campaign is great.

Ignore the reviews. This game is a total blast to play. The graphics are amazing especially in 4K HDR. If you've played and Loved previous games from before this is a no brainer purchase. Playing as Crews makes it even more fun. The weapons are insane and the orbs are back as well as the announcer guy. BIG FUN.

I'm enjoying Crackdown 3 so far, i'm having fun. The disc install was fast the network update was the tedious part of the install. I almost fell asleep. The game play reminds me of Destiny when you engage the enemy. Overall it was worth the wait and i got a free crackdown 3 steelbook.
A lot of people say this game is just okay but I think it's a blast from the past I really enjoy playing it

After playing Crackdown 1 and 2 and hearing about all the hype that number three was going to be so great turned out to be kind of a disappointment even though the graphics were amazing the game roleplay didn't feel the same I expected it to be a lot more bang for your buck this game is blown out of proportion online like it was something great I was very disappointed enjoy and love playing the game but disappointed on the fact that is not what they said it was going to be

Crackdown 3 was a game that Ive waited for years to play. They kept pushing the release date but it is finally here and well worth the wait especially if you are a fan of the first two. Even if you never played you will enjoy this game. Solo campaign is fun as is the co op mode. Havent tried the third way to play but Im sure it is fun too. Get it and have fun. Terry Crews is one of the voices and a playable character. I keep waiting for him to do his chest pop.

Seriously, this game is a ton of fun. Unlike the disappointment that was Crackdown 2, this is the true sequel to Crackdown 1. While some have complained about the graphics, Crackdown 3 looks excellent on the Xbox One, particularly on the Xbox One X in native 4K resolution & HDR. When it comes to the city, the way the character moves, the way you interact with things, the way the vehicles transform -- though they transform differently than in Crackdown 1, etc., this is the true successor to Crackdown 1. The movement feels so good, too. Whether you're fighting enemies or climbing a tall building, everything just feels smooth. Crackdown was always a mix of open world Grand Theft Auto mayhem, mixed with a superhero movie, mixed with Mario-style platforming, and that's all on display here. You will level up your agility by collecting the oh so addictive orbs, you will level up strength by picking up objects & throwing them at your enemies, you will level up driving by completing races, by driving stylishly, by using your vehicles to down your foes, etc., and on and on. I disagree wholeheartedly with the negativity surrounding this game. Crackdown 3 is by no means a letdown. If you wanted a prettier version of Crackdown 1 with new abilities, more orbs, better graphics, a good framerate, etc., then look no further than Crackdown 3.
Always loved crackdown. Also came with a beautiful hard case.

If you played the 1st 2 Crackdown games, you will be happy to know this plays just like those games but with far better graphics. Controls are tight, your agent now has new moves and skills to unlock, as well as your vehicle. Collecting orbs is addicting, and the go at your own pace campaign is nice. Explosions, guns, etc all sound great. The Xbox One X upgrades are awesome as well. The co-op is great, and the multi-player is out of control fun. Another great exclusive, we'll worth the wait.

Purchased the 1st crackdown day of release and was blown away. Superhero GTA while searching for random orbs was awesome. Fast forward to 2019 and pre-ordered this thinking not only was there going to be explosions but building were going to crumble down....until I read the reviews which are pretty much correct. There was so much more potential this game could have had and I'm sad after just 3-4 days, 4-5 hours a day with 110 hidden orbs and 400 agility orbs found I've completed the game. The driving is just as bad and feels exactly the same from 2007? Come on Microsoft Studios couldn't the driving have been improved some? Its a better polished version of the 1st game with a few cool new weapons but not much else. The NPC's seem to be randomly located even on the top of some buildings that have no entryway to top which is odd. It seems to me the developers never attempted to play any of the new gen games to get a better grasp on how to improve the driving or NPC behavior. GTA 3 liberty City on PS2 had more lifelike characters running around the city. Overall if you can look past the small details in the game and have never played the crackdown series then pick this game up when it drops some in price.

Im a fan of the Crackdown series especially Crackdown 1. Crackdown 3 single player is exactly like the original Crackdown which I love. Definitely a must buy if you enjoyed Crackdown 1 on the Xbox 360.

Beyond that though it is a very fun game that will provide hours of play for every person who is bent on completing a game to 100%

We waited so long for crackdown 3 and its not even better then 2. Mind blown, youre supposed to make a game better then number 1 and 2. But still its crackdown and its a fun game definitely pick it up but once its on sale. You still gotta love crackdown.

Let's begin with the following: I bought into the Minecraft Beta when it first hit PC, and after various attempts, could never get into it like those who do enjoy it. Lego Worlds, while being compared to Minecraft, is different enough that it's kept my interest and keeps me looking forward to it. While I rounded up to a 5, I may have given it a 4... Technically, it's far from perfect, but there's just too much fun to be had to really let the technical (and some blatant lack of instruction,) knock it down. Now, one of the things I didn't know or wasn't presented in a couple pre-release stories that you SHOULD BE AWARE OF: you do NOT start with a complement of all the Lego pieces. So, if you believe you're gonna fire it up and begin building, I'm sorry to be the bearer of bad news. In fact, it's a very big time sink to start discovering all the various individual bricks and builds before hitting up the free build section of creating your own world. Keep this in mind. Really, this game can be broken down into several parts. To start, there's the exploration segment: you'll fly your ship to a World and explore the area. Each 'biome' is chock full of goodies. For the younger crowd, this plays like much of the other Lego games. Punch things and collect studs while searching for gold bricks- some, like various other discoveries, will be found in chests, others will be earned by running various errands. Another aspect of the game is the collecting. Your explorer has a little collection gun that will copy various discoveries (think flora & fauna) to your inventory for use when you begin your own worlds. Copying these only adds them to your inventory, you'll still need to unlock them by purchasing it (one time pay with your collected studs,) before you can actually use them. You'll also earn other tools- a 'copy' tool that you can use to copy large builds- that giant Sphinx that isn't a pre-existing piece can't be used with the collector, but can be copied, so you won't have to try & build one from scratch. You'll also have tools that remove terrain/ segments of the world for you to find hidden treasure chests, build tools that can reconstruct builds or individual brick by brick that you've collected. You'll also have little chase segments; to earn many of the individual bricks, as you wander the various worlds, a cutesie green 'troublemaker' will occasionally pop out of the ground, carrying either a new brick to earn or a gold brick. Chase him down and tackle him, and he'll cough up the piece. Once you've tired of a particular biome, enter your spaceship and find a new one to explore. There are issues. Inventory can quickly become messy, even with the divisions they have. There's just soooo much Lego here, that it quickly becomes a chore to locate particular items you may need in a timely fashion. I play on PS4, perhaps it's something the Pro or a PC more easily handles, but there are times, especially once you start using vehicles, where you'll get to the end of the rendered biome, but need to wait while it renders the rest (this isn't a huge issue, but needs to be recognized). At one point, the game didn't create the new biomes for me to fly to after unlocking the medium sized biomes, which worked itself out after a restart. (Note that you'll have to tell the game to locate a new biome from the spaceship map, biomes won't just spontaneously show up). There been a few times that while using a tool or weapon, the game suddenly switches it to the collection tool and won't allow me to put it away or switch. (Rectified by the ultra-handy 'parachute' option, which is there for if your character gets stuck in terrain- which is funny, because I've had to use it for the tool-failure more times than the one time I've gotten stuck on terrain). Also, the lantern will occasionally lose its glow, which is a huge negative if you're underground. (Rectified by zooming in, then out with the camera). While the game has quite a list of technical issues, these will hopefully be patched out over time: still, even if they aren't, the game really is one that will have you looking at the clock and wondering where the past 4-5 hours have gone. There is also multiplayer, both couch co-op and online, with perhaps the best feature being that you can share your created Worlds/biomes in the Lego Galaxy that others can visit (just make sure you set it that changes are NOT saved- ensuring you don't come back to multiple hours of planning and building, only to find it destroyed by visitors). While the lack of having the full Lego sets to play with out of the box may be frustrating to some; to others, the HUGE timesink involved in hunting down all the thousands of pieces may be too much, the fact remains that they have made the hunt FUN. The other bonus is just how different the game can be played. I've played with my 4 year old, who's just learning his 'inner gamer' and has some experience with other Lego games. The basic running around and stud collecting is in his wheelhouse, and with me playing alongside him, none of the few fights were difficult. This base experience is great for the younger crowd, and one that can be expanded as the young ones get older and more comfortable with the advanced portions. (I'm currently hunting down as much as possible to let him have a large selection to build his own little world with). And, while that hunt is fun, and can still get a bit repetitive, where else could you get every (non-licensed) Lego piece, unlimited in number, for $30? The price alone, at half the cost of a regular release, is absolutely worth it. Even with the list of current issues, I wouldn't have been disappointed had it been a full priced release. There's just so much to explore, so much to do and see, that the list of glitches is easily overlooked, as none are game-breaking.
Boring. Not at all what was advertised. Just another dumb Lego game with no licensed characters to add value. No building either. Let me say that again. NO BUILDING.
Like I said, it's aight. Haven't got far yet so yeah

I've been a big fan of Suda51's work since Killer 7 and the original No More Heroes games; I've given other games a shot, such as Lollipop Chainsaw, Liberation Maiden, Sine Mora, and Let it Die. To call this a No More Heroes game while not adopting the game play is just a minor blemish on an otherwise extremely playable title. There are tropes here and there (like charging the Beam Sword) that evoke classic NMH, but they're pretty superficial. The real gripes I have is that the graphical style isn't great, and looks very dated; the music is OK but repetitious, and the levels are needlessly long, and aren't really designed with any pizzazz. But despite all that, it's still quite fun, the cutscenes are goofy and bizarre, and the aesthetic is classic No More Heroes with a mixture of 70's cinema, anime, and retro video games. It works well and is intentionally jarring all at once. It also makes me nostalgic for Killer 7. Really, the name of the game should be Suda51 Strikes Again, because it really shares that disjointed, conflicting DNA that all of his games share.

Listen, if you've played No More Heroes and No More Heroes 2: Desperate Struggle .. you will definitely enjoy this. But just a word of warning.. keep an open mind. Cos omg, its got some hilarious jokes in there! I mean.. first off .. the Abbreviations for Travis Strikes Again? TSA? Also have you noticed how many number of times they've mentioned the word 'balls'. Wow. And that's just the beginning. Haven't finished yet. Check it out yourself. You'll enjoy it. The voice acting for the characters, side jobs (mini games) & taking care of Jeane (the cat) I hope this does well cos i would love tho enjoy another Nintendo switch game with classic NMH styles in a NMH3 ahem ahem SUDA51 pretty please!!

I knew going in that this game is NOT No More Heroes 3, nor does it mimic that gameplay style. Its an arcade style 2D game that borders on the repeative side but the writing and boss fights are still that NMH style. I managed to get this game for around $25 with rewards and Gamers Club. Overall wait for a price drop. Its an ok game but its not a $40 game.
Fun game just had to pick it up today this is an must have

This game is not a game I could recommend to just anyone, that doesn't mean it's bad, you just have to approach it with a specific mindset to get the most out of it. If that mindset is being an adoring fan of Suda51 and Grasshopper Manufacture's previous work, then you'll probably love the game and all of its wackiness. If you have no idea who/what Suda51 and Grasshopper Manufacture is, then consider a few things before purchasing. First off, I hope you have a big TV, because at many points during the action, the camera perspective will be so zoomed out from the characters that it can be hard to distinguish what's going on. Second, hopefully you have someone you can enjoy the game with in local cooperative multiplayer, as there's more fun to be had that way in choosing how to handle certain combat situations and deciding who gets to use what special abilities and so on. Lastly, you're probably not going to enjoy the story. It's a direct continuation from the first two 'No More Heroes' games, there's plenty of references to other games as well, and meta-references to video games as a whole. The narrative is mostly presented in lengthy sections of text, some of which are displayed in a deliberately 'old-school' computer graphics style with pixelated fonts and a green-text/black-background aesthetic that can be very harsh on the eyes. If you can stomach that, there's some pretty solid arcade style action underneath all that that's worth playing around with.

Travis Strikes Again: No More Heroes finally continues Travis' story from his last adventure in 2010. While this one is a bit of a smaller scope than the first two, they still manage to pack so much love and personality into this title as they did with the previous ones along with a fun story that really ties everything together. Gameplay is very simply, but with enough depth that becomes necessary to master on higher difficulties. There's also a strong emphasis on 2-player co-operative play that, while not required, adds a fair bit to your playthrough(s). Altogether, this is a fun game simply put and one that is well worth playing.

This game are same humor and fun of a no more heros game, but it is not a core game. All this does is make me want a new one. I didnt miss Travis touchdown, it only there werent so many sword wielders in smash. This isnt he game we want, its the game we need I renew interest in the franchise. Fun gameplay if not a bit repetive. Worth it at 40

So it's a mini No more Heroes game froman elevated camera standpoint. More reading than voice acting, graphics are a tad blurry. PRESENTATION IS STILL amazing! The game is cheap during certain boss battles with some boss battles which makes me question if that's the style of a game flaw. Whatever, it's no more heroes it's supposed to look shallow and come across as really deep at the same time. Also there is a ton of fan service throughout this game. Will make any Grasshopper fan smile with delight.

Travis Strikes Again is just okay. It's for the NMH fans. As Suda51 stated, this is his ode to Grasshopper Manufacturer for the past 20 years and how he plans to move forward for the next 20 years. The 'story' behind the game makes sense as a nice stepping stone into 3, but the game play is not really that deep or interesting like NMH 1/2. It's a fun time, but if you're not into NMH, pick up NMH 1 and 2 first, and then decide if you wanna go down this strange rabbit hole of a game.

I feel this game is fit at the right price especially with anyone with gamers club will cost them even less. Fyi, suda is making nm3 and killer 7 may be coming to the switch in the near future.
It is a fun spin off of the man two game's and I would hope people do not look at it as the 3rd game.

Not 1st person like the previous installments, but hopefully Nintendo will re-release 1 and 2 from the Wii (both awesome)and HOPEFULLY give us a 3rd! This is far from the type of game the older No More Heroes games were. You are diving in and out of a video game console fighting hordes of generic monsters. I do not recommend this game; wait until Suda51 makes a true No More Heroes game.

Really dug the first two games, enjoying this one as its own spin-off. I don't think the combat is super deep (it wasn't in the first two games either) but it's so stylish and I'm really enjoying the co-op a bunch.

This game is a strange continuation for the 'No More Heroes' series. Its basically a weird top-down brawler with co-op. Its fun, but not really what I want from this series. Co-op is super fun, though.

Travis Strikes Again No More Heroes is a spin-off of Suda51's notorious series No More Heroes found on the Wii. Travis Strikes Again takes the hack and slash style gameplay and throws it on its head in six different 'games'. Each have a different style to them overall, but have the same enemies aside from end bosses. Skills are interesting and fun to use and make fighting enemies much easier. The writing is quintessential Suda51 writing, which is nice to see. The game is $40, but that is because it also includes the $10 season pass that will be adding two new playable characters after beating the main game among other things. The value of the base game on the eShop is $30, but the season pass is a separate purchase. In conclusion, I would say it's worth it if you're a fan of Suda51 and/or want No More Heroes 3.

But it's not really no more heroes. If you can suspend the fact that it's not a real sequel then you'll have fun. Also you don't have to play the previous two games in order to get into the story. It's fun though, buy this game if you want a no more heroes 3!!

It's the same hack and slash missions that you do for the total runtime of the game. Definitely don'tt recommend. I would really wait for a deep discount or just skip entirely. Very disappointed.
The colors are very vibrant, the gameplay is solid, and the monsters are awesome. Comparable to monster hunter, but still very different. Bullet customization is still a great feature.

This is the premier option for Shovel Knight fans. It a physical collection of all of the previously released Shovel Knight games, plus the latest King of Cards and Showdown. All of the games are on the cart. Plus its portable Shovel Knight. If you're not a fan of the series or 8-bit (ish) platformers, then you probably won't like this game. But if you are a SK fan or a fan of older 8-bit games like Mega Man then you're sure to love this. Also its a pretty good value at roughly $8 per game.

Shovel Knight is an 2D side-scrolling platformer. If it was released in the NES era it would have been considered a masterpiece. No flickering and is widescreen. Game doesn't tell you how to play, have to experiment and do trail-and-error. Can be challenging towards the endgame unless you farm for upgrades or use cheat codes.

This is the third physical version of shovel night that I have bought. It is my favorite indie game of all time. I originally bought it on the Wii U then the 3DS because I wanted to take it with me. Both those versions are good but I traded and sold both of them so I could buy it again on the switch and have it all in one cartridge be portable and on my TV. If youve never played it or youre curious about it I highly highly highly recommend picking it up.

This is easily one of the best indie packages ever made. 4 campaigns, plus a full blown multi-player showdown mode. A must have for any retro platformer fans

Beautiful hand drawn graphics,great rpg gameplay,and a cast of some of the greatest indie characters,make this a good addition to anyone's collection.
The hand drawn animations are beautiful and gives the characters and world so much charm. With fun turn based action and an engaging world.
This is a great game I've been waiting for it about a year I like the combat style it's very pretty I like all the cartoon drawings I guarantee you going to love this game it's excellent

While not incredibly far in the game I see that everything is beautiful in this game, truly art. This game has a fun cast of characters but that all have unique abilities. The story so far seems simple enough but is entertaining. If you like metroidvania style games then check this game out.
This game is so good. The animation is gorgeous and the gameplay is so smooth.

I got this game based on reviews stating that it's the best AC yet. Unfortunately, it's Origins with a Greek background. The same few voice actors do the majority of the characters, the quest background stories are shallow and the responses seem generic, even from the player character. Not even 15% of the way through the game and I've heard repeat responses and seen graphic errors that should have been fine tuned. Overall, fun but nothing new.

If you like the WarioWare series you will love this. Many great added levels. For the fantastic 'Sneaky Gamer' alone, worth it. If you never played Warioware, this is addictive fun. But, the true beauty of this game comes with the collectibles. Where you open up a dozen arcade quality games that have little to do with WarioWare. And, the greatest bonus of all: get every unlock-able and open up a big, deep turn-based card game called 'Wario Kard' (get it?) This game will give you over 100 hours of great quality gaming. A must MUST buy. Heck, Im even carrying my 3DS with me again...and I own a switch too!

This is a wonderful collection of micro games of Wariowares history. Granted not everyones favorite made the cut but some do bring back that nostalgia. The cut scenes have full voice overs now which is a nice touch. Overall a worthy title to add to the library of 3DS games.

This game stays true to its formula. WarioWare Gold has you doing microgames; which are short tasks like chopping a vegetable, jumping over an obstacle, skiing down a hill, answering a question, doing a picture puzzle, etc. It sounds simple, with each microgame taking about 4 seconds to complete, but with each round things get faster and trickier. Mess up four times and it's game over. Being on the 3ds you will be using the stylus, blowing into the mic, tilting the 3ds, and of course using the d-pad and buttons. This game is rated E for everyone, but Wario has a persona like no other so expect his crude humor to be front and center. This is a full retail priced game. The story mode is short, however playing until you unlock every microgame (there are 300 of them!) plus unlocking all the bonus games and collectables will have you playing for hours.

I haven't played a WarioWare in a very, very long time, but there is a certain charm to these games. It's very weird, but very fun. The presentation is excellent as the characters come alive with full voice acting (I strongly believe that voices give greater life to something than just an image of them). Highly recommended and perhaps of the one last major original (non-port) first-party releases on the 3DS this year (or the years to come).
3ds game, a must own for anyone who loved microgames
very good collection of minigames from all the wario games

Wario Ware gold is a nice entry to cap off the series up to this point. It's crammed full with most of the best microgames of the series, which is nice since the DIY and Wii U entry left a bit to be desired for fans of the series. Honestly the only downside to this game is that it would have been great to get it on the Switch. But since a lot of the games use the two screens and mix of buttons and touch screens I understand why they didn't. It has all the characters you expect, and fully voiced too. Besides the great selection of microgames, there's a lot of other fun side content too, though unlocking them is kind of weird with a capsule minigame to get them. One of the more amusing side features is one where Wario will draw any amiibo you scan that isn't third party or Pokemon characters. They are pretty funny, and be sure to scan Wario amiibo if you have it. Otherwise you know what you're going to get, a best of WarioWare with all the good mini games from the Original, and DS entries. If you enjoyed any of the previous games, and still have your 3DS, I would definitely pick it up.

Fatality Lives! This game is a must for fans of the Mortal Kombat series. It has a wide variety of characters, excellent gameplay and great graphics. Several different game modes including story mode and a challenge ladder bring variety and hrs of gameplay. I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys a good fighting game.

Mortal Kombat has rejoined the ranks of great fighting games. I was koncerned about the future of this series, but those koncerns evaporated when I played this game. The action is fast-paced, brutal and exciting, the graphics are outstanding and look great in HD and the kontrols are easy enough to pick up, you'll be executing krazy kombos and brutal fatalities before you know it. Rather than trying to make this into a 3D fighter, Netherrealm has made it into a top notch 2D fighter in 3D environments. The gameplay harkens bact to the klassic Mortal Kombat II and Mortal Kombat 3, which were the best games in the series up until this one. There are lots of game modes, from one-on-one and tag team fighting to various mini-games. There is even a story mode which is a dramatic retelling of the events of the original Mortal Kombat trilogy. In the story, Raiden recieves a message from his future self that evil warlord Shao Khan must not succede or the Earthrealm is doomed. there are twists and turns that give this mode the feel of an interactive movie. The great kharacters from the original klassics are back. The kharacter designs are striking and distinctive. From terrifying kombatant like Baraka and Quan Chi, to heroes like Liu Kang and Johnny Cage and sexy female fighters like Jade and Sonya Blade. If you have a favorite kharacter from MK, chances are he or she (or it) is in this game. This is a great game, but not for family entertainment. Mortal Kombat is graphically violent. there is a lot of blood and gore and some particularly graphic finishing moves. For players 17 and older, it's a great game but it is not recommended for children. Mortal Kombat warrants its M rating. For brutal 2D fighting, Mortal Kombat kan't be beat. This game is a kut above the rest.
Excellent! Best Mortal Kombat to date. All the original characters plus.some awesome.new additions!
I enjoy playing this game. It brings back memories of when I use to play as a child.
By far the best mk game to date. Mkx is good too but I love mk9
Incredible fighting action. Characters are very well represented
Mortal Combat and Freddy Kruger??? Yes!!! Awesome!

Mortal Kombat has been a favorite of mine for 20 years and they did this game right! Tons of characters, great fatalities, and combos make this game highly addicting. I noticed that they toned down Lieu Kang and Kabal just a touch-focused on balancing the characters. Settings are beautiful, highly recommend.

I brought this thinking it was compatible with Xbox One but it wasnt. And Best Buy wouldnt accept a return because I opened the game which was disappointing and aggravating really. Im sure the game is good but, I never played it so Im not sure.

Help I have stolen my sons xbox. I cant stop playing the Sims. I life long Sims lover I have been once again sucked into the world of EA games. Even my mother comes over while my son is at school to play xbox. This is very serious.
Bought this as a birthday present for my daughter and she absolutely loves it.

I wish there was a way to toggle death being off or adjusting aging speed. The first time my wife and I played, our family literally became extinct while trying to build our digital dream house. They have cheats. Will probably try to turn off death with the cheat.. hope it works.

My daughter plays the Sims quite a bit on her computer and recently asked for the console version. From what I can tell, this version is a faithful reproduction of the computer-based game with the additional cats and dog bundle. My daughter enjoys it. Personally, I fail to see the appeal of watching simulated people live mundane simulated lives, but then I think I just described more than one reality TV show... If you like the Sims games, this is the most current iteration and should fit the bill for you.

True story bro...I played the Sims almost 20 years ago. I have since introduced it to my children and I'd be lying if I said I didn't 'help' them a little more than I should. It's fun, and has add-ons that keeps the game fresh. One of the best sandbox type game series in existence.

I purchased this game as a gift for my fiance. She wanted sims 4 so I got the bundle that included pets. She loves it. She did say this was different from sims 3 and had to get used to it but after a couple hours of play said she really enjoys it.
Chicago's common cello chimp chick all cool chill np
Using the controller takes some getting used to. The game is better of the computer.
Says for xbox one, but it says not for this system when you put the disk in.
Misleading cover art and title, same cartridge as the old version, require online update to receive DLC and patch.
Do not buy this if you own the regular version because the Cartridge of the game is the exact same, and all the DLC is free from the E-Shop.
Any fan of older side scroller/platform games must try this game. Very different and beautiful!
One of the best game for the Nintendo Switch, a must have in your collection
