If you like games like Strider, Castlevania, and Metroid. Get this. Def. not for everybody, more for retro/classic gamers.
Amazing game, great story and mechanics. This game will be loved by those who have played the inFamous series since it will somehow feel familiar, just without the open-world.

This is the most engaged Ive been with a game in months. I buy literally everything and often find myself bouncing across multiple titles. You know a game is good when it causes you to stop and focus all of your available time and attention on seeing it through. I found myself still up at 4AM after purchasing and for the first time since xenoblade 2 took the time to 100% before moving to the next title on my shelf. Ill be replaying this for sure and really cant say much without spoiling but if youre a fan of a well written story you owe it to yourself to play this one.
Great new IP from a solid developer. Passed it up last year b/c I have less time for games now with a child. Glad I was able to get this 2019 GOTY for 1/2 price.

This game is all about its creepy design and atmosphere. Scary, weird, confusing - Control is gripping because of its ability to make you feel so many different things. The gameplay is good; you gradually become this all-powerful Director as you further unlock your skill tree.
My adult son asked for this game for Christmas. He plays games like Destiney and witcher. He says this game play is excellent. He said he is really enjoying the game.

The story is thrown at you, which isn't a bad thing because like the game's protagonist, Jessie, you're trying to make sense of everything going on. I personally didn't care for the story and found Jessie to be a rather bland protagonist compared to Remedy's past works. Think of the core level design as Metriodvania, You can go back to past areas you've cleared and such. The level design towards the very end of the game is sloppy because there are enemies spamming projectiles, both in the air and on the ground, towards you and the game doesn't provide sufficient cover to deal with it. The game has a lot to offer. I didn't even delve into combat and weapons mods. If you're a big fan of Remedy and their other recent games, there's a good chance you'll like Control.

Its clear there are a lot of people not telling the truth because the game is a complete ripoff. Boring enemies, boring levels, boring story, just a boring game. I would download it on playstation if it were free. Why critics and people are even giving this respect is beyond me....horrible game.
Remedy has done it again with another solid sci fi action 3rd person shooter...must buy
Its a good game that takes a lot of time. It can be a little frustrating at times as it is most certainly not an easy game.

Not a bad game at all. I just couldn't get into it. Which is sad because I was a HUGE fan of Quantum Break. This game seemed to just have 0 depth to it. Though most people like it so I wont destroy the ratings. 4/5 is fair.
The preview looked awesome the game play and story line is really trash. I bought then traded in 2 days later so bad. 1/5

I haven't completed this game, so my review is based on first impressions (or about 5-10 hours of gameplay). Then again, I'm not sure this game even has an end... This is my first experience with Animal Crossing, and it's proven to be among the most relaxing games I've played. I must say that the formula works well on the 3DS. It's something you can choose to really dig into, but I've found it also works well if you just play for an hour or so each day. Time in-game reflects real time, so if you're a night owl, you may find it somewhat annoying that shops close over the course of the evening and don't re-open until the next morning. That said, collecting items, outfits, furniture, and even helping the townsfolk with their basic 'get me this item' tasks is surprisingly enjoyable. A nice, low-pressure game that should appeal to fans craving for a more laid-back slice-of-life experience. Also, Isabelle is super cute.

Ive been playing this game since its release day and I still love it. I even have 3 bugs left to catch and Ive had SIX YEARS to complete everything. I love the real time game play, the music, the sounds, the thunderstorms, the shooting stars, the footprints, the tournaments, the holidays. I will continue to play it nearly daily until New Horizons comes out next year. Im 39 and love it. I gave it to an 8 year old and she loves it. Its great for everyone.

Being an owner of AC City Folk on the Wii, I enjoy this franchise. But the odd controls and home-console functionality meant that I never played it that often. This game takes many of City Folk's problems away. AC works perfectly on a dual-screen handheld because I can check on it whatever time of day I want, and not just at home. Now I finally have the incentive to actually play every day. They call this game 'New Leaf' for a reason. It starts out similar to the old games; Rover welcomes you on a train, Tom Nook puts you into debt, etc. However, there's now a big turn in gameplay. Much rather than just being a mere villager, you now are the mayor of your own town. Now you can make public works projects, set ordinances, and have a cute dog named Isabelle as your secretary. There's all sorts of things to do. You can go fishing, talk with your fellow villagers, go shopping, pull weeds (WARNING: Weeds easily trigger people with OCD. Proceed with caution.), and more. If you need a break, you can veg out at the tropical Tortimer Island. This game is brimming with content. The 3DS also has amiibo functionality where you can get free items and villagers via amiibo cards and figures. All my useless cards were sitting around, gathering dust, so this is a great way to get one specific villager you want. Overall, this game is brimming with content. It has aged very well throughout it's lifetime. Those who are into vigorous gaming will probably get bored easily. However, I personally use it to relieve stress. If I get angry about a game, Animal Crossing will do the trick. While it doesn't really have a main 'end goal,' I still enjoy this time-killer. Many are upset that it's been several years since a real AC game has been released, but at least we can enjoy this gem until the time comes. This is yet another great game that doesn't even cost more than $20.

I recently got this game at Best Buy last year after hearing all the hype. I really started playing it a few months ago. However, I dont see how its incredible in any way. I'll admit, it is addicting, but it is so obvious the game creators made it that way on purpose. Almost everything is 'Wait until tomorrow'. And most of the shops close early, as a college student, the only time I get to play video games is at night and not even everyday! And the game penalizes you if you miss days. There are so many rules and so many things you can not do. For example, you cant start a new public work project the same day another one is completed, nor can you rotate your public work project (like a bench for example). And you can not buy multiples of things. For example if you want a red rose flower, you can only buy one until its available again! Ive heard people clocking in more than 500 hours into this game, I have done 40 and truly feel like this is my limit. I enjoyed it at first, but past the 40 hours, I feel like theres nothing left to do. I've decorated my town, and feel pretty satisfied with it (and that's saying alot because I love creating.) Decorating my home feels like a hassle compared to my experience with The Sims, where it's so easy to create and build. And yeah the animal villagers are cute and all, but I find this game hard to enjoy as a college age kid. HOWEVER, I must admit, when I was 10 or so, when I was obsessed with my DS Lite, I would have loved this game. But not at this age. I just personally dont enjoy this game, but it seems like it's great for little kids.

This is an amazing animal crossing videogame that you can take on the go on the Nintendo 3DS, it has many things to do, and a great feature is that you can play online with 3 friends, and do different minigames, if you enjoy collecting different things and rearranging them, this animal crossing adventure has you covered.

Even though New Horizons is more fleshed out and a newer experience, I wanted to play this one and it did not disappoint. If someone has not played any animal crossing before and wants to make leeway by just saving some money and finding a copy for $20 compared to the new $60 game go for it!
With the new animal crossing on the switch, and you dont have a switch yet? Come get this one, its still a lot of fun.
Animal crossing series is known for it's relaxing game play nothing serious and plenty of things to do. I would recommend this if you're looking for something laid back.

Is this even a real game? It's pretty cute and harmless but there's virtually nothing to do in it except bum around town picking up stuff to sell at the pawn shop. It was recommended to me after saying I love Stardew Valley but I don't see how this even remotely as much fun. It's a time waster like those Facebook games that your granny plays.

Stays fairly true to the core of Animal Crossing. The first 30 mins or so can be frustrating if youre not paying attention. But once you get through the first 30 mins, it feels like all the others, in a good way. Would recommend this game. I just picked it up because Im getting ready for the version on switch
Although the Switch version is right around the corner, this game does a great job to scratch my Animal Crossing itch.

While I really enjoy the game and would recommend purchasing it, I paid for a game that says it comes with an amiibo card. The game did not come with an amiibo card. Would have bought it elsewhere if I knew. Best buy should fix their listing.

I think this game is so much fun! It's a very casual and relaxed game, meaning that there isn't much pressure or a lot of action. On certain days, there is special events and different rewards. There are so many things for you to explore, experience, and enjoy! The packaging of the item was secure and nothing inside was damaged. This game does NOT come with any villager cards, as well. But even so, there is plenty of content for everyone to enjoy.

Animal Crossing New Leaf is the current latest in the Animal Crossing series, and I can't think of a better entry point, especially at the game's MSRP. If you've never played an Animal Crossing title, the best way to describe the games is a relaxed life simulator. You can catch bugs, go fishing (my favorite activity), do gardening, or just walk around in the in-game world talking to your animal neighbors every so often. There is no true main objective - so unless you set goals for yourself, it's a title you pop in whenever you feel like kicking back and just taking things easy. I would suggest getting the game digitally now that it's so cheap. I own a physical copy, but I don't play it as often as I'd like since I don't always have it in the system when carrying it.

Animal Crossing: New Leaf is a game that both demands a lot and yet nothing at all from you. The game is really what you make of it. It can easily draw you in and have you logging back in day after day to check on your community. Animal Crossing: New Leaf is a game that you could play every single day for a year and still be interested, or you could set it down for a month, pick it up, and continue right where you left off. It is one of the best games out there for a relaxing and charming experience that keeps you coming back for more. So far, I have been addicted to it since I started playing it 3 months ago and have hardly been able to go a week without checking on my town.

Animal Crossing makes complete sense as a handled game, and New Leaf exploits the 3DS' potential to its fullest, while keeping the casual tone of the series intact. Lots to do, relationships to develop (in a very basic way of course), but the biggest fun lies in your role as the mayor of your town. Getting to make leadership decisions on aspects of the town is a trip. This is NOT the next version of 'Civilization' series, but these newer features enhance the immersion while keeping things positive and warm.

Tons of features and things to do along with multiplayer makes this the best in the series since GC. No NES games still, but definitely worth your time if you like the rest of what prior games in the series offered.
My 15 year old son wanted to get back into Animal Crossing. He enjoyed going back to old towns and the characters remembered him.
i've been waiting on this game for so long and the price cut was the perfect point to pick it up
Isabelle peepeepoopoo big tiddy Milky milky mommy uwu
The new leaf version was better than this version.
I purchased this item for the welcome amiibo card that was supposed to come with it. It did not! So im returning. Do not buy if its for the card because it is not included.

The game itself is good. This purchase was to replace a cartridge that had stopped working. The game would no longer load. Nintendo wanted us to send in the console with the game because we were unable to troubleshoot further. The cost of the RMA was to be well more than the price of trying a replacement cartridge ($20 at this point). It was recommended to us to buy a downloaded version of the game because, if it becomes corrupt, you can just re-download it. The drawback being that if you do not like the game, you can't trade it in.

Design your clothes, your furniture, your home and more in this installment of the Animal Crossing series. As Mayor you will make friends with animal townpeople, earn MEOW coupons to buy items, pass ordinances and finish public works projects. Players can find different animals (even under water), grow flowers & fruit, and dig up fossils. Visit the campground, the museum, nearby Tortimer Island, and many other locations. Tons of opportunities to build and decorate your world, similar to but more in-depth than Animal Jam. The game can also be expanded with Amiibo cards and figures, each unique character providing new bonuses, accessories, locations, or game modes. My daughter spent hours...and HOURS playing this during Christmas break!
I got this game for my siblings and they loove it.
My son loves the game It's appropriate for his age
Got this for my daughter and she played it the first day for 20 minutes, never touched it again.
Its says 7 and up but theres so much reading involved my 7 year old had a really hard time with this game

my 5 year old got bord with it after inly a few hours

Still buggy like it was on other consoles, but not as bad as I remember. Game can be really fun with the right people. I got lucky and found some random group who was a blast to play with. This game natively supports voice, which is helps a lot. You can play without a mic, but i recommend to use one. I did run into a couple 12 year olds, but not too many. Just mute them if they get annoying. Remember to read the how to play and study the controls. You dont want to be panicking and trying to figure them out. At first I was going to trade it in, but once I found some cool peeps, I decided to keep it. I forgot how it was when people talk to each other in games like back in my csgo or wow days.

Such a fun concept. Survive as a counselor or hunt counselors as Jason. It works really well. The port for the switch is pretty good as well and comes with all the dlc. Check it out
Honestly its a updated version of heat 2. Slightly better graphics but gameplay is still horrible. They need to stop. Another company needs to take over
My son is an avid gamer and loves this game. Keeps him off FortNite so I can't complain!

I've been playing Nascar games for a good 20 years and this is the best Nascar game since dirt to Daytona which was my all time favorite. Highly recommend liked it so much I bought 2 so my son and I don't have to share

Great update from Heat 2, and the dirt is fun to play. Not exactly iRacing with the dirt stuff, but pretty good. I cant give it 5 stars because the graphics seem lightweight. Combine this game play with Nascar '14 styling and you've got a winner. Thank you for making this compatible with a wheel.
THE GAME LOOKS GOOD AND IT HAS AFUN CAREER MODE AND OTHER THINGS
It is an upgrade from last years game. Great graphics and better features. Buy it!
Nascar Heat 3 is super cool .im so glad they braught back burn outs . Fun , Fun Racing besides dont really like dirt tour series but it was still fun to race it . I can play Heat 3 for hours .
Dirt racing and updated roster, exciting times!!!!

This is a offbeat adventure game with a likeable main character, a fun art style, interesting puzzles and unique gameplay. It's a 6-7 hour jaunt that is a nice break from weightier RPGs or shooters. Definitely recommend it as a fun change if pace.

Help Penny on her adventure through the afterlife solving puzzles, posses the living, and give death the chance to go on vacation. Beautiful designed world and character art fits perfect with this puzzle adventure platformer.

I got this game thinking it wouldn't be that bad without the extra 'cash grab' of the VR gun. But let me tell you the controls were pretty terrible leaving you frustrated. The plot wasnt horrible but definitely rushed. Might have been a different review if I had the VR gun.
With still a limited library for the PlayStation VR I found the Farpoint was a fun and Immersive game that I has both a decent storyline and The ability to make you believe in the world you were in.
Perfect shooter but shame on Sony for making the aim controller so hard to get
This game is really good at showing the features of the VR. Everything is large and scary just because of how Alien the world is. I love showing this to friends just to show how awesome VR can be

Totally my fault for not checking the box but this game is NOT compatible with the motion controllers. It is dual shock / aim controller only. I don't have an aim controller yet so I haven't played the game yet because I didn't care to use a standard controller.

Farpoint attempts to bring the FPS genre to the world of virtual reality. It's interesting since there aren't too many first person shooters in virtual reality, however with implementation it doesn't bring anything new or revolutionary to the table. If you're looking for a good PSVR title that's different and innovative, check out Moss or the incredible Astro Bot Rescue Mission instead.

This is a new type of experience. It's only the first VR game of its kind, but it's really impressive. First person shooters feel way more natural when you're actually holding the gun in your hand. I hope to see more games like this in the future. This is the only VR game that I have tried so far that actually feels like a full and complete game, and not just a tech demo. This game actually has an interesting and deep story. Its not just a shooting gallery. It gets really interesting.

I bought this game when I got a deal on PSVR as an initial impulse purchase just so I had games to play on my new PSVR. The reviews were decent, and while I expected to enjoy it for the gameplay, I found myself appreciating the story and character connections a lot more than the gameplay, which is rather mediocre. I am definitely happy with the purchase, but wont be replaying it.

Farpoint has been out long enough that its extremely reasonably priced for what you get. As one of the headline VR titles for PSVR you cannot go wrong picking this up. The controls work with the aim OR moves (which I got with my Skyrim bundle). I recommend this alien blasting game for anyone that is a fan of FPS games at all!
Great game for VR. They really need to figure out 360 movement in VR. That's when it will truly be next gen. Fun game tho.
Haven't tried it yet was waiting on to get the gun for it but no one has a gun and start less you buy the game and gun and I we bought the game but I heard was good things about it

I like this game, it is full of excitement, and it also pressures me to get better at playing it. My suggestion is that you try it for yourself, and I don't think that you will be disappointed by purchasing this one for sure. It is better with the 'Aim Controller' so you'll want to have that while playing Farpoint.
Its like you are in the game. When spiders jumps on you, just a head rush. A must for VR gun accessory user.

If I were to play this game with just a game pad it would be decent. But because of how it incorporates the Aim Controller it makes this game really great. With the gun you are able to control direction, change weapons, launch alternate weapon ordinance. You really feel like you are there in this Halo/Aliens mesh of a first person shooter. The story is new, genuine, and interesting. There are definitely challenging moments and you feel very accomplished for overcoming boss fights or getting ambushed. The only complaint is how the gun can lose consistent placement. Meaning its not quite being held how I'm holding it and so I'll have to try and change weapons or lower the weapon and bring it back up with the hope to recalibrate it in a manner of speaking. It's not terribly bad but enough from earning it 5 stars. All in all its a great game and worth the purchase! But you really need the aim controller to appreciate it.
This game has stunning graphics and challenging gameplay.
Truly amazing VR tied game with Great gameplay and visual rendering!
Fun game but graphically it could have been better
Pretty good game. This is definitely a showpiece for the VR experience.

This was an awesome game. I wish I would've had the PlayStation rifle, to enhance the experience, but it was not necessary. I enjoyed the graphics and the storyline. More so, I love the feeling of being in a 'Starship Troopers'/'Terminator' environment. It was a nice cross blend.

Yes, I mean that literally- this VR game gives me motion sickness. Which is crazy because other VR games do not! Maybe its the graphics or lagging... who knows. But i get a headache and feel like Im gonna throw up each time I play this, If I didn't feel that way it would be pretty fun though. Not a great story line but fun to shoot nonetheless.
Bought this to play on the ps4 VR and was super disappointed. It was pretty much just like playing the game on IMAX. Not worth it if youre getting this game to play in VR.
I enjoyed this game. Having the Genies come to life as I drew them was great. Really enjoyed the combat at the end of the game. Wish there was more of that.
This game feels like it was made by old Playstation. I mean that as a compliment. Trophies are great too.

There's few games now days with ideas such as this. Rather than your typical shooter game, this encourages creativity and you can tell the devs put a lot of thought and effort into this release. Definitely recommend.
THe game had some interesting mechanics using the motion controls of the DS4, but the overall story/gameplay didn't really grab me after a couple of hours. Traded it in
Enjoyed game very much, I would recommend to anyone looking for a fun colorful experience with engaging gameplay.
This game is beautiful physically. Interacting/painting can be basic and kind of bland but I've just started playing the story mode.

You play as Ash a talented artist who has been tasked to return beauty and light to the desolate sea town of Denska. An imaginative and thought provoking game. Which touches on themes of bullying, pollution, art as a healing tool, and friendship. Once completed replay ability is low (unless you want all the achievements) but this game does stick with you and leaves you thinking well after your done playing. I would highly suggest it for young gamers 13 and under but its a game for everyone. Great graphics, control functions could be better, but overall a solid game.

My opinion, this feels like a throw back to some of the more fun adventure platforms of the PS2 era of games. Where they were willing to try new mechanics. Its a refreshing break from the now formulaic adventure platforming games out there. Its price is about right for the amount of hours you will get out of this game. And PSVR mode adds a nice extra way to experience the game. You have some adventure puzzle crafting based around painting and graffiti. A Jet set Radio vibe but without the amazing soundtrack. Some platforming to get around and fight monsters etc.

The game is artistic as well as socially conscious. The story line involves a boy battling a group of bullies. As you work through the story you get clues as to why the bullies behave the way they do and what their home and family circumstances are. Helps kids to think differently about how they see each other.

Was not expecting much, just hoped for something different. And it was certainly nice to play a game that is different from the usual genres I spend time playing. This game has a ton of heart and I really enjoyed painting and the world of this game. Recommend, especially if you have kids.

This is the best graffiti artist game I've played since Marc Ecchoes Get it Up back on the PS2. This is even better because VR makes it feel like you're really there. You'll be vandalizing private properties like Banksy in no time.
A cool plat-former release from LRG. Great for quick play sessions.
I am a collector so Limited Run games are a must for collectors.
Phenomenal game with countless hours of replayability. Simple controls paired with a fair challenge make the game one to remember. Also a physical copy is a must have for collectors!
Took long enough for it to get here but such an awesome game. Everyone should play it!
This game really gets you into the heart of the Yakuza games. I highly recommend playing 0 first and then this game to get the whole story!
I love the yakuza series and this one is no different. I'm glad it was remade for the current generation so those of us who didn't get to experience it the 1st time can do so now.

The fact that this title was put into the hands of the same veterans who pioneered the original Donkey Kong Country trilogy definitely shines through the quality of the design. Pros: Lot of collectibles for each level with lots of challenges because these are not just handed to you. Lots of puzzle-solving on the overworld map which is unique for the genre. Gameplay draws a lot of inspiration from DK: Tropical Freeze (which definitely isn't a bad thing). Cons: Difficulty curve could have been less or at least had lower difficulty options. More personality and enemy variety would have helped. Overall though, it's an amazing game and is well worth your cash. Well-played, Playtonic!

If you have any hesitations because of the original Yooka-Laylee, put them to rest. The follow up changes the play style from a 3D to a 2D platformer along with a 3D overworld to explore. With one less dimension in the core gameplay, you could compare this to games like Donkey Kong Tropical Freeze or New Super Mario Bros U. Those games are heavy hitters and this game keeps up easily. This game introduces its own flare that lets it stand on its own two legs. If youre a fan of platformers, either 2D or 3D, this will be right up your alley.

Lovely graphics, tight controls, fun collectables, and a charming overworld packed with humorous characters and secrets. You get 20 levels that each have one bee (think of a Moon from Super Mario Odyssey), and five special coins (just like the KONG letters in the Donkey Kong Country series). Each level has an alternate form that you must unlock via manipulation of the overworld environment. That leaves 40 levels combined along with the 'Impossible Lair'. The Impossible Lair is a mega-level with no check-points. The gimmick is that every bee you rescue will act as a shield. So if you have 20 bees then you can take 20 hits. This level is as unpleasant as you'd expect a villain's impossible lair to be, and leaves an overall great game feeling sour towards the end.
Yooka-Laylee is a fun and beautiful looking 2d platformer on the switch
Totally feels like a new version of DK: tropical freeze. Fun over world, great music, and much better than the original Yooka Laylee.

good game. the only problem i have is that it can be hard at times and the collectables can be hard to get as well. at least there is no life system so you can die a unlimited amount of times, at some points in the game i thought there could have been more checkpoints in the game. much better than the first game which i thought was just average even though i am a fan of banjo kazoee type games.

The second game is much more polished game than the first. A new game style in a 2.5D overworld and a 2D levels. Lots to explore and discover both ina nd out of game levels. With a amazing soundtrack and beatiful graphics really brings this gane to life. Worth the money
This is a fun game. Great game for any age! Highly recommend it.

Whether you enjoyed their first effort or not, Playtonic has successfully hearkened back to their DKC roots on SNES with this game. 20 levels (each level having two versions to play through) plus the Impossible Lair. Although the DKC Returns games exist, it's nice to have some of the original developers back at the helm of a new game.

If you love the Donkey Kong Country series, this game will be right up your alley. It was made by some of the same geniuses who made the original DKC games and has great music by Rare legends David Wise and Grant Kirkhope.
Nostalgia Donkey Kong Crash Banjo Zelda Adventure with real challenge and fresh approaches. Great sound track. Dont pass up.
This is probably one of my best game purchases, I been wanting it since I saw Playtonic's livestream, I was like 50 cents short, so I had to get to my car and get them, I'm not even mad.
Very enjoyable game. The movement feels so fluid. It is most definitely similar to a Donkey Kong Country game in its quality and polish. Would recommend to 2D platformer fans.
Great game. Great price. Highly recommended purchase.
Lots of fun, colorful levels. I like this one more than the first, its not as much of a collect-a-thon.
This is a great game and I would recommend it to everyone
I decided to buy this game after the first game came out. I really like this one more than the first!
I wasn't sure what to think after the first game, but this one is excellent.

This is a great game that apes something in the middle of the old Donkey Kong Country games and the returns series but has enough of its own ideas to be fresh. It doesn't feel big budget but it's still very fun!
If you liked the first game or donkey kong tropical freeze, you will enjoy this game. Lots of fun!
a must buy for donky kong fans its as if rare made this game and its a great fun game overall
I collect switch games and buy any that are a good deal. This will stay Shrink wrapped for awhile.
I should have bought this on another console. The Switch is missing features found on consoles over 15 years ago.

As a lifelong fan of the Castlevania games, I've played them on the NES, Super Nintendo, Playstation, Gameboy Advance, Playstation 2, Nintendo DS, and more. Some of the best titles of all time are in the Castlevania franchise- Symphony of the Night being one of the progenitors of its own genre, Metroidvania. Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night is like unto Castlevania Symphony of the Night meets Order of Ecclesia- and that carries all of the positive connotations it possibly could. The character, environmental, and sound design are all top notch and clearly make this a game that must be experienced if you're even remotely a fan of Metroidvanias. The level design is superb and you'll find yourself backtracking and finding all sorts of secrets, which is accompanied by phenomenal movement that makes traversing locations a joy. There are tons of little, interesting things to find, plus there's crafting and cooking on top of it. However, the Switch version ain't it, chief. At release, this game has tremendous issues- visual effects missing and insanely low quality textures are just the tip of the iceberg (even the rose tattoo of Miriam, the character on the box art, can sometimes show as a splotchy, pixelated mess not even visually representing a flower. That's how low quality the textures can present). This version of the game crashes a lot, which is wholly unacceptable for a game that doesn't have auto-saves. Sometimes you can crash while selecting the bookcase that *lets you save the game*! It's insanely frustrating to lose progress repeatedly due to game bugs. Notwithstanding, the frame rate is also quite low- it's 30fps in some locations, while dipping to as low as 15 in others, like the tower. This is probably one of the best games I've played in recent memory. Unfortunately, this just isn't a good port of that great game. Keep an eye out for updates that hopefully improve playability (fps, crashing needs to be at the top of the list of things to fix). If you only have a Switch, still consider this version after waiting a bit. This game is fantastic, even if I'm negative over the bugs this product shouldn't have, and those problems hopefully get patched. If you absolutely can't wait to play, the PC version of the game on Steam would likely give you the best experience.

Reviews are out that the Switch port is pretty bad compared to the other ports. They need some time to maybe fix it so I would hold off till then. PS the steelbox sucks also. It has a flimsy plastic insert that's supposed to hold a switch cartridge. Reddit has pictures of it.

Preordered this (at Gamestop because I got a deal, usually do everything BestBuy) and it looks really bad. Like sad bad. FPS issues dip AT LEAST into the 20s after a few hours in as well. Loading times are annoying, had the game crash a few times too. Get the Ps4 version. YES I know this would be more fun to play on the go...but it's just not worth it here.

The devs promised to patch it post launch but this is unacceptable. You can actually play and complete the game, its not 100% broken, but please read the following. This version of the game was clearly not complete. The game is a blurry mess when the switch is more the capable of rendering clearly, i look like a 3DS game in resolution. The ugly muddy mess is just the start of bad news. They messed up on the descaling of the Original textures for the switch so they look blocking chunky and blurry. The next issue is the INPUT LAG, a lot of the game you have 3x more input lag, this means sometimes your combos for some weapons dont go off, or that you jump and miss attacks. It feels like you are playing the game underwater. Sluggish and unresponsive. This needs to be fixed. Next is the constant crashing. On the other versions of the game they had some minor issues they patched the next day. You might crash 3 times in a whole 20 hour play through on the other version. On the switch version you can crash up to 20 times in one play through. That meaasn losing 30 or more min of progress each time if your unlucky. The FPS was locked at 30. Which would be fine if it was stable. The game has dips down to 10 FPS when lots of action is going on on screen. And the resolution in handheld is 720p but in docked its also only 720p but also dynamic so it can be WORSE then playing it in handheld mode. The rumble was also broken, in that the rumble might trigger and never stop until you reset the game. And it revs it up to max so it feels like it might break your joycons. Last there is some issues that the physical cart might run worse then the Digital download version. The Physical cart might run worse because the game was not properly optimized. This game and its 3d effects should be able to run 60fps and 900p on the switch. Many games that push the hardware more look better and run better then this version of the game. Smash brothers, mario Kart, MK11, Wolfenstien, Doom. SKyrim, and many more run way better. Its a software issue on the fault of 505 games and Igas Art play, they did not know how to optimize the game for switch. it may be months before its in a proper state if you buy this version.
This port is poorly done. I thought it would be fun to play on the go but the performance is bad. Go watch a video and youll know.

To begin, I've never played any Castlevania game, except for the very first one on the NES. I'm not familiar with Symphony of the Night or any other title similar to this one. This game caught my eye after I played Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon on PC. First, the good. The game feels nice. Movement is great. You have a lot of weapons to choose from to change your play style a little bit. The levels are fun to look at and have a lot of secrets, like hidden items and rooms in walls. Hitting enemies is satisfying, bosses are fun, and there's a lot of things to do. Crafting, making food, and enhancing equipment will keep you busy for a while. Then, we have some problems. Gameplay-wise, sometimes you get lost. It's not exactly super clear where you're supposed to go, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it can be time consuming. That's about the only complaint about the game itself. The biggest flaw about this game is the port itself. You get 30fps on average, and in some areas such as the Tower of the Twin Dragon, the game gets really choppy. The graphics are also pretty mediocre. But my biggest problem with this game is that sometimes it crashes. It doesn't happen often, but I've crashed a few times, and I have to re-do everything from my last save. If you're not careful and find yourself in a long stretch in the game without saving, you could crash and lose all of your progress. So basically, save whenever you can and wherever you can. Hopefully this particular problem can be solved with patches and updates, because this is a really good game, but not a great port. Overall, the core game itself is great. But it has its fair share of technical issues which makes me not able to rate it much higher than 3/5 at this time.

Switch version is good, but has many performance issues. 505 games has stated they are fixing it right away with patches. It's very hard at this point to Star rate this game as it seem unfinished until the patches roll out but overall good
The game itself is good - old school Castlevania, but the performance on the Switch version is not good.
Unfortunately the switch version of this game is incredibly laggy. The creator has stated that patches are on their way but it is a setback for people who have set time aside for this game.
Love the game but hope they do the updates fast. Lacking some smoothness compared to PS4 and Xbox.

When this game came out, I wanted to check it out but had heard the switch version ran pretty poorly. I finally picked this up on sale finally and the game has been patched quite a bit since launch. So far the game seems to be running fairly smooth. It isn't perfect but it is quite playable. As a huge fan of the Iga Metroidvanias, this was something I wanted to play for a while. And I had to get it on switch to play in portable mode the way I used to play the DS and GBA Castlevanias. If you have played any of the old metroidvanias, you know what you are getting here.
The switch version is currently far from optimized wait till the first patch rolls out in late November

I didn't play much of this game as it does not run properly. There is a lot of lag and frame rate issues. The developers said they are releasing a patch which was announced months ago but no date has been given. It might be good when they fix the game but until then, wait.
Backed this, deep game play, satisfying abilities, and classic game play ! (Cons) Graphics suffer between switch to console versions

Bloodstained is a decent game, but the Switch version is plagued by performance issues. Im generally not someone that is all that sensitive to frame rate drops, but Bloodstained has some of the more egregious frame rate drops that Ive seen. The game also has poor load times when dong simple things like traveling between rooms. There were a few times where I would jump off of a platform at the top of one room and it would be several seconds before the screen would show me coming up from the bottom of the next room. A few times it was so bad that I thought the game froze. These issues occurred whether I played in hand-held mode or connected to my tv using the dock, and I split my time pretty evenly between them. As for the game itself, overall I think enjoyed it. The visuals are good during gameplay, but the cut scenes look really low-res. The combat is generally fun and there are a lot of weapons and powers that you experiment with until you find what works best for you. I think the amount of shards is probably s little overkill though and I think a lot of people will stick to only using a few different ones. If you are big on story games, I dont think Bloodstained will hold your attention in that area, but this game is more about combat and exploration. Speaking of exploring, youll need to do a lot of that. There were a few times where I wasnt sure where to go and had thought I missed a clue from a character. A couple times I was so confused that I had to consult the Internet in what I was supposed to do next. I tend to try and avoid this on my first play through of a game because I like to have my own experience and dont want to risk spoilers, but o was just wandering around aimlessly. All in all, Id say that the game is good on combat and exploration and is a nice homage to games like Symphony of the Night. The weaker aspects s are the story and the performance issue make me not want to recommend it for the Switch (at least at the time of this review)

As of this review, there has yet to be a patch that fixes the input delay, massive load times, terrible frame rate, and poor resolution. If you want to play Bloodstained, I suggest you play it on the PS4 Pro or Xbox One X.
As much effort as Iga put into these games, don't waste your time on this version; you will get none of the true quality of this game. Stick with any other platform.

I helped back the game on kickstarter 4 years ago and I can tell you the game is amazing. I got the platinum... on the PS4. I wanted to support the game more and buy it on the Switch for the steelbook; however, I cannot recommend this version. The graphics are horrible, and the low FPS is intense on boss fights. IGA and 505 games are aware of this and still pushed a bad product to the market. Eventually it will get patched more but I would avoid this version no matter what unless the Switch is your only option to play this game.
Awful on the switch compared to other platforms. Wish they would at least improve this with some patches.

As you would know by now, Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night is a Castlevania Symphony of the night clone, and a very good one. The game mechanics, presentation, action is very good. The story is interesting, and presented in a good way. The draw back to the Switch version is it runs in a lower resolution, and has graphical glitches. Hopefully will be patched later on. But if you want to play on the go this is the only way to go.
Had to rebuy this on a PS4. This is the worst version of this game

This game could be better on switch if it was an off switch. The game plays fine on Xbox and PS4 but lacks on switch. Main reason I bought this was for the steelbook which was not intended for a switch cartridge so they added a little plastic insert that has to push out that accepts the cartridge which is total crap. The whole insert just falls out of the case Everytime you open it.

I'm not sure what happened here, I purchased this version initially as I was hoping being a cartridge it would be a solid complete port. Boy was I wrong. The gameplay is for the most part intact if you dont mind the muddy graphics and frame rate/crashing issues. Upon inserting the cart I was greeted with a pretty big online update. Still this game needs alot of fixing. The game crashed on me before I even reached my first save point the first time playing. I want to love this game so hard. Developers are aware and said to be working on patches to fix it. I purchased the PS4 version in the meantime and its exactly what i envisioned it to be. Its pure perfection (PS4) Id hold off buying this till its fully patched. if you are able to buy on PS4 or XBOX X its a no brainer. Im going to play it on PS4 and the original SOTN CastleVania on my Japanese Sega Saturn.
It's a great game...if you get it on a different system. PS4, PC, whatever. Just avoid the Switch version.
I really wanted to enjoy this game on Switch. Unfortunately, this game should have been worked on longer to, as it is a beta copy. Just wait for confirmed patches before buying.

i was a backer for this game on kickstarter and i chose the switch version. i been playing this game for a few hrs and i am disappointed. the game is fun, i am complaining mainly about the technical problems which i won't list. i downloaded all the updates which total up to almost 2GB!! 2GB!!! that's ridiculous. the switch version is imcomplete. this cart will have no value in the future b/c the majority of the game isn't even on the cart. if you buy this day 1 edition on switch, you'll have to download close to 2GB of updates!! this defeats the purpose of having this game on a cart!!! i'm not happy. i stopped playing, erase all the updates from my switch, and i've decided to wait for the special edition, w/all the bug fixes, in a yr or two then i'll but that version, then imma throw this day 1 crap edition into the trash can. i am sick of developers releasing imcomplete games these days. if you want to play this game buy the ps4 version OR do what i'm doing and wait for the special edition for switch in the future that i know they will release, because the switch version that is out now is imcomplete.
If you are looking to play this game, avoid the Switch version at all costs! It runs incredibly poorly and is almost unplayable.

As someone who nearly always buys multiplatform games on the Switch, it pains me to say that this game is great . . . on every console but this one. The input lag, frame rate drops, horrendous load times, and game crashes make it clear that this version was released unfinished. The developers did not take the time to optimize this game, which is sad because the Switch should have no trouble running a game like this. Please buy this game. But do so on the PS4 or Xbox One. Otherwise you are not experiencing this game properly.

There is supposed to be a graphic and stability update in mid July 2019 but if at all possible buy it on a different platform.
Wait until the game is patched because as of now, it is horrendous on switch.
I hope they patch this game because the switch version is terrible

This ver of the game should be on the ps vita look so horrible I think even for the vita is horrible ver. The game is good but the ver on the switch is the problem just buy the ps4 or Xbox ver if want to enjoy this game to the max.

The switch being very weak for 3rd party devs to work on makes multiplatform games look pretty miserable usually but this one took the cake. It is like a 3DS game not a home console version. Do not buy it and get this masterpiece on the ps4pro instead for the best framerate and 1080p

I got the Switch verson solely for the Steelbook case, but was a bit disappointed with it not being an actual custom case for a switch game, but just a regular steelcase for a CD/DVD with a plastic case holder inside for the switch game, but even that doesn't even fit snug in the case. Ritual of the Night could have been much better graphically, and the lag hinders the gameplay slightly. For collectors its probably worth it. For those who will be playing it - look at purchasing it for other platforms.
Fantastic game. Switch version is awesome, but due to system it is not as crisp as the Xbox or PS4. Worth every penny though!
An excellent retro style 2d platformer. This game is a must own if you love the castlevania series
Great game always want to play this game. Always thinking about it
