If you like the exploration based Castlevania games this is a game youll really enjoy, having said that the performance is questionable on Switch right now. The developer has already promised to get the game in better shape soon though.
Awesome game with tons to explore, plus should be more to come with downloads.
perfect representation of a metrovania game. Just lots of fun.
This is amazing! I freaking love this Game. Yeah it's not as pretty as the PS4 but still fantastical RPG Castlevania style game.
This game is a classic and will take a few hours to beat it 100 percent. I love the fact that you can play it on the game and the graphics are good.
I played Curse of the Moon so of course I was going to support them by buying this title
an amazing game spiritual successor to castle vania from iga. a must play for fans as well

I've been waiting since 1999. I am not disappointed. I picked up my Switch copy yesterday with the metal case. I was so happy and eager. On my way home I read all sorts of negative commentary. That scared me a bit but I was ready for it. I played the game last night just past the first boss-level character. This game is great! The graphics are clean and crisp. I love the artwork and illustrative style of the gameplay. Miriam, the main playable character, is very interactive compared to SOTN. I was impressed because I thought they would keep it all as basic as possible. Certain equipment changes show up on the character in-game and some down. Once you give me a little I want the whole lot, but I understand and accept the limits here. When you change the headdress or scarf you can see the character outfit change. She can even wear masks!! As for the dress, I have changed these body items a few times but the character's dress never changes. That's fine. Back in the day, no changes in outfit reflected in the character except for the cloak... and that was amazing! So having more control over the design is a pretty cool feature. I also love the postures the character Miriam takes with different weapon styles. I changed some buttons around in my game to better suit my style of gameplay. Playing on the switch, whether on my 50in television or handheld, is highly enjoyable. The first thing I was looking for was the opening score. I was satisfied. I am looking forward to playing this game until my fingers fall off! I plan on getting another copy as a gift to a relative for their PS4. It could possibly look better in some way but I can't imagine what that should look like. I;m looking forward to my next boss battle. CONS: I have no cons to list but I am aware of the frame-rate complaints. I was totally fine with this as it seems very normal to me, especially in this game. I seriously feel transported back in time with better tech. The game was meant to carry on that feeling, not meant to make a modern beefy version of the Igavania style. Also, only once so far had I noticed a slow down when a ton of things were happening on screen. Whenever stuff like that happens I tend to think I am like Neo in The Matrix. I get happy about it, not sad. Hope this helps.

So the port is bad to the switch 30fps compare to 60 for ps4/Xbox 720p compare to 1080 Oh the steelbook. Is a ps4/Xbox one. They just switched the plastic to hold a switch game. I know they came with the game could you be any cheaper . Its like putting lipstick on a pig. Its still an ugly pig.
If you like Castlevania Symphony of the Night, you will love this game. Great graphics, gameplay and music.
Alittle slow sometimes with loading but overall it's a beautiful game and I'm really enjoying it so far.
Awesome game, excellent graphics. The artwork is beautifully done. I'm so glad to own this piece. A must buy if you're a Castlevania fan.
If you love Castlevania this game will scratch that itch for you. With a huge map and many things to do it will keep you entertained for many many hours.

This game is a great metroidvania type throwback to classic Castlevania games, but Switch version is poorly optimized currently. If you have another console or PC, I'd recommend getting that version instead.

From the creative minds that brought you many of the most beloved titles in the Castlevania series, comes Bloodstained, a game that strongly harkins back to Castlevania sSymphony of the Night. if you already like that classic game, you can stop reading and go buy now you won't be disappointed, but for the rest of you please continue on. Bloodstained is 2.5 Metroidvania game form some of the best that have ever worked on the genre georgous graphically and tight controlling to boot, as you hack and slash your way through several towns and a large castle filled with the denizens of darkness and hidden secrets to bring an end to friend that is seemingly lost his mind, this game does have some adult themes so younger audiences may want to avoid, but I'm 50+ hours in and loving every minute of it. If you own a switch, this one is a can not miss

This game is one of my favorite Nintendo Switch games thus far. It is a true spiritual successor to Castlevania games. The gameplay is very engaging and the level/music are a delight. Many of the complaints about the game were addressed with the first patch. However, I would have wished for it to have better graphics.

A great game to play if you like the Castlevania franchise especially Symphony of the Night which this game is created by the same creator. There are some issues with the switch port as for it was developed pretty late in the games development the game doesn't have the superior Graphics like the PlayStation 4 or Xbox One version and also frames drop below 30 and sometimes there can be random crashes. The company has addressed the frame drops and the crashing and are working to fix them.

Game is decent but you are better off getting the PS4 or Xbox version. Framerate for this game on the Switch is 30fps and the other consoles run at 60fps. Big difference in smoothness of the game. This version also has crashed several times while playing. Especially after hard boss fights. Always save immediately after a boss battle. The loading times for this game on the Switch is atrocious for a cartridge based game. If I knew about all of this I would have gotten the other console version. Supposedly there is a patch coming for it but its coming with weapon and equipment nerfs also... no reason for that since you don't play online with anyone.

Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night is an exploration-focused, side-scroller action RPG by Koji Igarashi who had work on past Castlevania games. you play as Miriam, an orphan scarred by an alchemist's curse that slowly crystallizes her body. You explore the games world and fighting monsters and demons. If you ever played any of the side scrolling Castlevania or Metorid game you should have familiarity with its gameplay. Playing through you unlock powers and obtain equipment to help you advance the game.

This is a bit of a strange first metroidvania game to select for someone but it is still a very solid game with plenty to offer for its price. Beginners may shy away if things get a little too tricky but you can always grind up a few levels and tackle the challenges again. Grinding is encouraged since every enemy can give a new special ability to use. With the right set up you can feel downright unstoppable and thats great since you have to work for it.

I've been looking forward to this game for what seems like forever and it turned out great! It feels so much like playing Symphony of the Night again, but has its own twists and mechanics to keep it interesting. The Switch version has some bad slowdown occasionally and long load times. It can be annoying but doesn't take too much away from this otherwise awesome game.

I HAD BEEN WAITING FOR A LONG TIME FOR THIS GAME!! AND EVERY SINGLE 3RD PARTY GAME THAT COMES OUT I ALWAYS GET IT ON THE XBOX ONE X BECAUSE OF THE PERFORMANCE. WELL I DECIDED TO MAKE AN EXCEPTION FOR THIS TITLE ONLY SINCE IT SEEM LIKE THE PERFECT GAME TO BE PLAYED ON THE SWITCH PORTABLE MODE......AND WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT IT WAS!! DON'T GET ME WRONG THE GAME IS GREAT BUT THE TECHNICAL ISSUES ON THE SWITCH MAKE IT A HARD SELL FOR THE SYSTEM. THE ONE TIME I DECIDED TO GET A 3RD PARTY GAME FOR THE SWITCH AND IT DISAPPOINTS ME.

This is a great Metroidvania game and I'm having a blast playing it. RPG elements to level up including your character, skills and powers to collect. Not the longest game in the world but if you enjoy exploring, secrets and figuring out what to do next, this is the game for you. Switch version runs worse then PS4 and Xbox One but there is supposed to be a patch on the way to fix it. Check other reviews after 7/15/2019 to see if any issues have been addressed.

This game is like Castlevania: symphony of the night, mainly because it is made be the same creator. It is a side scrolling rpg. I bought this version because it is portable and can be played on my tv too. The Switch version is not as high def as the PS4 or Xbox one versions, but the trade off of having it on the go is worth it I think. Even though it has some flaws it is still a great game. The programmers said that they are working to improve the game in the near future with updates. Overall it is worth picking up!

From the creator of Castlevania come this title. Its very enjoyable though its alittlw rough on the performance end. The developer says a patch is in the works to make it more inline with the PS4 and XBOX One.
framerates and long loading times made this an easy return for me. if you want to play it now, get it on xbox one or ps4, otherwise you will need to wait for the patch to be released.

Clearly the other versions are better but Im still enjoying the game. I bought it for the Switch solely for the portability and have no regrets. Played it for 2 hours straight on a plain ride back from Vegas! Overall the game is everything I wanted. I just think the question is, do you want to play the superior version or the portable version?

My 5 year old son and I were SO excited to buy and play this game when it came out. That was about 3 weeks ago, we still play it just as much now. Something else I like about it is the fact that there are still so many different things you can do in the game. So, it's an endless amount of fun!! Kudos to everyone involved with creating it! Much love!
Yes, if you've played one Lego game you've played them all as far as gameplay expectations. At the same time, the games are fun especially with a friend. Lighthearted, funny, enjoyable.
The Lego games are always fun, and if you're a fan of the Incredibles, then definitely try this one out.
Black Friday gift all the Lego games are fun this one is as well
This is a fun game and I am having fun playing this game with my daughter.
Between the story line and a lot of missions after free play starts the game last a long time before you get bored. Great game
This is fun for the whole family, littles and big ones
Fun for all ages, I dont play video games, but was able to assist my grandson when he had trouble completing levels

My boys (11 & 9) loved it. They had seen the movie and it wasn't a spoiler, but it certainly follows the movie in a lot of ways. I think the old Lego games had more problem solving in them to accomplish tasks while the new ones seem to be just attack. Still a good game and it's great that Incredibles 1 is included with this game.
This game is extremely fun, and feels very much like your in the movie despite being a lego game.
Runs pretty well on the switch. Only time it lags a bit is when calling in the support characters. Only reason it's getting 4 stars is I preordered the game and never received my code for Endeavor

I am a huge fan of the My Hero Academia anime so this game was a must for me. From Bandai Namco, same as Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm series, I expected to see same quality or better with different backgrounds and obviously different characters, mechanics and attacks. What I got was a very bad graphic quality game that does put you down as soon as you see the cutscenes. I do like the comic-style narrating but I expected a lot more cutscenes. Also the game is missing a ton of characters from the anime that would be amazing but instead got a fraction of the main characters. If I had known sooner, I wouldn't have bought full price but at $20-25. Hope this helps.

My grandson wanted this game for making the honor roll at school but I could not find it at a reasonable price until I checked out Best Buy. Then, I was able to buy him two games for making good grades at his school!

Its an awesome anime series which I watch my 10yr old son... he's a bigger fan and so I got him the game. I thought it was ok, cool graphics, reminds me of the naruto games. My 10yr old loves it though but he beat it within a week. It does have other content though and multiplayer so you can make it last.
lower graphics than the ps4 version but still great game.
Really cool. Looks awesome in my collection and it brings me great joy.
My kid loves this toy & she cant stop playing with it !

This is a great game for all those in love with the Boku No Hero Academia/My Hero Academia series. Its easy to understand and very fun to play. The only downside is if you like the English dub. This game currently has the Japanese voice actors, but it does have English subtitles. Still, I highly recommend this game!
Much like the anime, it leaves a lot to be desired. Repeatedly suffers from performance issues and just gets monotonous after a while. The story mode isnt great, even by fighting game standards.

If you like MHA and 3D fighting games then you'll probably enjoy this one. The single player campaign follows the show's storyline directly following the UA Games and once it is completed a whole 2nd secret story mode unlocks. Your mileage with the online multiplayer will vary wildly depending on who you choose to play as and how much time you put into learning combo strings. Practice practice practice.
I am a huge Hero Academia Fan! And this game is perfect for it. I am gonna play this for a very long time until the next big anime game comes out!
Bought this game strictly because of the review s about it. People said it was super fun & hilarious. They were right we've laughed& laughed playing this game! It's a great time
Grab this game while you can. Its a great title with fun multi player setting. Another Limited Run Game that will eventually sell out
This is a strange, multiplayer-centric game where it is essentially violent duck trying to slay an equally violent duck.
Limited production, not going to open it. Going to be a collectable.
excellent service and am enjoying my lap top, scanner and printer

Fire Pro Wrestling World is nothing new if you have played another Fire Pro Wrestling game, but it is a bit jarring if you're used to the WWE 2K series. For one, the graphics and sound are something from the 16-bit or 32-bit era, but don't let that deter you. The game itself can be customized to your liking, from the wrestlers, arenas, rings, referees, match types. You name it, you can customize it. The wrestling itself is a game of timing and your purpose is to entertain the crowd rather than always winning the match. If you can get past the technological shortcomings, you are in for a deep and satisfying wrestling simulation experience.

While 2K, Yuke's and Visual Concepts struggle to make a decent wrestler title, SPIKE CHUNSOFT returns the best grappler on the market to consoles. Don't let the cartoony graphics fool you. You won't find a more deep or rewarding wrestling experience on current gen video game consoles. The roster isn't super big nor does it feature a ton of well known wrestlers, but the game features the largest Create-A-Wrestler toolset ever to give you the chance to create those very characters. OR if you prefer, you can look online for spot on recreations from the most passionate community in gaming. The controls aren't 'new user' friendly, BUT if you take the time to learn the game, you'll feel the most rewarded. The game rewards you for timing and trying to put on the best matches you can. The WWE series has a LONG WAY to go to make a wrestling game this good!
One of the deepest and most enjoyable wrestling games, ever! Even with outdated graphics; its still excellent

If you like retro wrestling games this one is good. The customization and downloadable content created by other players is great. The controls can be a little clunky and tough to pick up, but worth it given a little patience.
I love wrestling and this is a diffenet game and i love it.
Real wrestling for real fans! This game is awesome and really fun! Has a bit of a learning curve, but it's a lot of fun once you get the hang of it.
i wasn't expecting this game to be as fun but was extremely shocked at the game play and overall experience.

As WWE 2k20 is an absolute nightmare, this is the wrestling game every wrestling fan should play! The controls are a little finicky at first, but once you get used to them the game is an absolute blast to play. With online creativity, there is endless play time where all the wrestling worlds can finally collide!
If your a fan of fire pro series or wrestling in general , then you must give this game a try..its the most fun game period!

Have been playing Fire Pro for years and the gameplay is fantastic; however the presentation and game modes are lacking. Menus and modes are not explained well for a newcomer so be aware. There is not much to do from a single player perspective and what is there is boring. Presentation is also lacking compared to games today. Suggest waiting for a sale.
This is bar none the best wrestling game to come out to date... the graphics might be old school but trust me it's worth picking it up
On top of the big roster in the game you can go on linklink sign in and download from the items section at the top of screen!

Great Game. It's hard to pick up at first and if you just go into a match blind it'll feel like you're button mashing and not sure whether something is working or not. It's all about timing. They've got a timing tutorial and if you haven't played it before its a must. The customization of this game is absolutely amazing. And being able to utilize the NJPW roster really elevates it for me. Highly recommend.
The learning curve for the Fire Pro series is very steep, but if you're interested in learning the game mechanics then you'll have a far better time than the buggy mess that is the WWE 2K series.

As a fan of New Japan I love this game. You create a character who trains to fight for the IGWP title. This game is not perfect as graphics are not the best and sometimes attacking wit a chair can be difficult. the 5 star rating is a Dave Meltzer stretch as I just love the product from New Japan wrestling and I will always be a supporter of their product..
A great an amazing movie I thank Best Buy as always
WTH this is horrible..... I absolutely hate this thing theres like no instructions....Unless Im missing something

Hideo Kojima is rarity in the world of high-budget video game production. Hes an auteur. The Metal Gear Solid games are all branded A Hideo Kojima Game. He has a certain sensibility, but there has also always been a sense in his games that hes been held back. That was before he left Konami and formed his own independent studio, Kojima Productions, which just released its first game - Death Stranding. Describing this game is a challenge. The core gameplay loop is pretty simple. You play as a courier, and you have to walk from point A to point B without falling and damaging your cargo too much. There are hazards - rough terrain, bandits out to steal your cargo, and other enemies. Its more challenging than it sounds, but Id be lying if I said it wasnt at times tedious. The real draw here, as it has been for me with Kojimas other games, is the story. Death Stranding tells you both too much and not enough about the world the game takes place in. The first few hours of the game have only about half an hour of actual gameplay, with the rest of the time spent showing you the post-apocalyptic America that youll traverse throughout the game. When I bought my copy of Death Stranding, the cashier said that he had sold the game to two other people that day, and that neither one of them could tell him what the game was about. I told him, Ill be surprised if any of us can tell you what its about after weve finished it. I stand by that. When you buy Call of Duty 16, or Madden 2020, you know exactly what youre getting. What you get in Death Stranding is something you dont get in many high profile games - something different. Something new. Its weird. Its kinda boring. Its borderline nonsense. But its beautiful. It knows what it is and isnt afraid to be just that. And thats what keeps me playing.

I play games very casually and only finish about two or so a year. My favorites in recent years and the type that appeal to me are Horizon Zero Dawn, Metal Gear Solid 5, the newer Tomb Raider games, and The Last Guardian, Ico, and Shadow of the Colossus. All that said -- I love this game. I'm having such a good time. I love it love it. The environments are beautiful and traveling through them can be very mellow, but it's still challenging in a way that helps you engage with the main character. Story beats (I'll give no real details here) are intriguing and amusing in their shifting tones. I very much enjoy Hideo Kojima's voice and story style, and this one is not letting me down. Basically I enjoy a good game that gives an engaging story and gives a fulfilling world/environment to explore so I have something to do while I listen to a podcast or other audiothing. Hours and hours into this game, I often don't feel the need to listen to something else while I'm playing, and I'm happy to just be immersed in the world and sounds that are presented. Every element already feels deliberate and with artful authorial intent, so I don't necessarily feel like I'm 'wasting my time' by not supplementing with another piece of media while also playing around in this one. The game in itself just feels like a masterfully-crafted album. I'm not too big on games where most all you do is shoot at things and people. I don't enjoy feeling consistently tensed up and stressed or frustrated while playing a game. And striking that balance where there's not too much constant over-stimulation and aggression but it's also still very immersive and gripping -- it's honestly hard for me to define what exactly that balance consists of when a game properly hits it for me (like most of the titles I listed above). But this one does so maybe just about the most perfectly I've found in this PS4 era. That feels like an oversimplification of why this game is feeling so perfect for me. But that's about the crux of it.

If you are looking for a big budget game that is not like much else youve played and is not afraid to do totally wild things, then this is the game for you. Its heavy on simulation, but navigating the environment is very fun and the game looks gorgeous. I love it.

The gameplay is oddly compelling in that it is mainly focused on how you navigate the world to deliver packages throughout the world. Rather than simply going from point A to point B, you also need to manage a variety of systems: health and stamina, materials for crafting and using supplies and tools, player's balance, item and equipment degradation, etc. Traveling in New areas can be daunting and stressful at times, but it's usually a cathartic feeling to finally reach your destination. Furthermore after exploring a new area and connecting it with the network, you unlock a type of shared world social feature where you can find and make use of supplies and tools that were left by other players in their game. For myself, it's the first online feature since Journey that makes an otherwise single player game feel like a collaborative experience that you share with others. There are also elements of combat and stealth throughout. While they may seem simplistic in their respective ways at first, each have systems that are never directly taught to the player, but when discovered through experimentation add a new layer of depth and strategy (i.e. the ability to throw packages at human enemies during combat). That said, the game itself is not difficult, especially for those who play games regularly. Side note - at the time of writing this, I have played the game for about 10 hours. Though I have yet to see how the story plays out, I can say that so far it is intriguing and the early hours do a fair job of setting the tone and themes of the narrative, and make the otherwise complicated lore of the world relatively easy to follow and digest. Graphics are stellar in presentation, and the the sound design matches closely in its quality. This may not be a game for you if you're wanting or expecting an action packed adventure. But if you don't mind something more experimental, then I would say go in with an open mind and you will find enough to appreciate in this game.

Ive been playing for a few hours now and have been enjoying the game so far. I have high expectations for the game because Ive been a huge Metal Gear Solid fan and can see some similarities in game design however the game play is very different. There is a lot of cutscenes that are very enjoyable and lots of walking in mountainous terrains. Im still undecided on how I feel about the game so far but I think Ill like it. This is a very unique game.

Yes, you will walk hard, so hard. But never has walking felt so meaningful. Ive spent many hours walking across a lot of different video games, and for a variety of reasons. In a lot of those worlds, I just wanted to explore, and often with others. Maybe this particular game wasnt what I had in mind, but its ultimately a culmination of many aspects I love and wanted in a game. While I do agree that the whole package comes off very shallow at first - a visual feast of a story that drops the player into a delivery simulator - it unfolds into a curious and strange experience. The lonely walking is contextualized with a simple motivation, and an incredibly emotional story - then grown into an arc of meetings between other players through building and connecting across the world. Like ghosts in your isolated world, real people are an entity that can truly be felt. A constant symbiotic weave. Which is countered by the in-game threat of BTs (ghost-like entities that occupy that world), encounters that can be tense and sometimes terrifying, and always a threat to the mission at hand. Mobility throughout the world is aided by quite a few tools, including vehicles, robots and mechanical limbs. Eventually making certain traversing rather simple and relaxing, which means a lot in the face of trekking some harsh terrain on foot. The walking itself is akin to a survival simulator more than a delivery device. Knowing about certain packages can help the story, but in all reality its the challenge of the environment that provides the risk/reward satisfaction of playing the game, making deliveries - as well as the delicate balance of inventory too. The venture comes with a lot of characters that provide a deep story - one of the best Ive ever experienced. The entire experience truly comes full circle. Story and gameplay, the experience of playing through all the scenarios, traversing across such a vast environment - while many may not find this game suitable for everyone, I truly find it worthy of at least attempting the experience.
Absolutely terrible game . This game is the reason stores dont allow you to return open items.

So far, I've only devoted a few hours to it and I can already tell that Death Stranding is something unlike anything I've ever seen before in a video game, and it's certainly one that has to be experienced 1st hand. Now I've played many a Hideo Kojima title and would definitely consider myself a fan of his work, the Metal Gear Solid series is one of my most favorite game franchises, but Death Stranding certainly takes the cake as one of his weirder endeavors. Lengthy, beautiful, enigmatic cutscenes and story telling aside, the actual gameplay has the main protagonist, Sam, acting as a courier for Bridges, a company whose primary M.O. focuses on reconnecting the people of the United Cities of America to ensure humanity's survival. There's a small bit of combat sprinkled throughout game, but the main draw seems to be the micromanagement of Sam's delivery inventory, and traversing across some truly gorgeous vistas, trying your best to keep said delivery in tact. The better condition your order is in when delivered, the more likes Sam receives upon completion, which, in turn, helps him to level faster and become more efficient. It all sounds nuts trying to explain on paper, but there is something very alluring and satisfying about how it all works, and I really do enjoy it the more I play. I only took off a star because this game definitely won't appeal to everyone since it is so different, but the presentation, the quality, the soundtrack, and the mystique of the story, in my opinion, is worth the price of admission, especially if you're a fan of Kojima's work.

Death Stranding is a 'two trips is for wimps' simulator, essentially. The entirety of the game-play relies on you carrying things and not falling on your face. Your triggers are literally your hands, and you use your hands to balance yourself. As if that wasn't enticing enough, the cryptic story hasn't explained nearly anything in the first Star Wars-trilogy-worth of time, and from what I have read on other reviews, isn't going to in a Star Wars-nonology-worth of time. This game brought me nothing but confusion and frustration, and is a massive disappointment for me seeing as I was very excited for it and LOVED all the trailers. I truly thought we were going to get something unique and original, which we did... If only it was also good. In any way. Two stars for good music and pretty graphics.
Great Game. Realistic sci-fi story, Great realistic character casting for game.

I have been playing this completely over hyped game for about 6 hours now. I've spent about 2 hours watching cinematic scenes, 3 hours walking with packages on my back, 30 minutes trying to figure what this baby in a bladder is for and 30 min trying to figure out controls. I mean aside from the beautiful scenery (which gets old real fast), I can't believe they would hype this game up like this. It's walking. Just.... Walking. I mean you can run too, but really?? So disapppinted. Hopefully I can get some money back for this selling it used.

This isn't a game that requires fast reaction, rather, it requires patience. Most of the gameplay is walking around as you work to deliver goods to people. Yes, it is a delivery man simulator but it's much more than that. The story is key in games like these and I have to say the pacing is good and if you're into sci-fi, this will be right up at your alley. It's so different than any other game I've played. It's refreshing, it's innovative, and you can tell a lot of passion went into producing this game. Give it a try. It's a bit slow in the beginning but picks up after you finish the introductory missions that teaches you the mechanics. Lastly, I find the game to be relaxing and stress relieving. I like games like Apex Legends too but those games can be stressful too. Thanks for reading my review. Have fun gaming!

I really wanted to like this game. It has a great cast and the graphics are well done but the story is thin and the game play is extremely boring. You pretty much just run back and forth on the map and at every junction there is a giant cut scene, which would be great with this cast, if the story wasn't so bad. I am returning asap to see if I can recoup some of the 60$ I threw away on it. So disappointing.

I picked this game up the day it came out, after months of anticipation. My friends have all asked me what the game is about, or to summarize the game for them. And honestly, it's hard to put in to words. You play as Sam, who is for-all-intents-and-purposes, a deliveryman. The game is set in a post-Apocalyptic America. You must deliver packages, and are tasked with keeping America connected by linking posts you encounter along the way. You face challenges from the terrain (which gets harder to traverse with the more packages Sam is carrying), BTs (who are supernatural beings that can attack you unless you stay quiet), and other monsters found littered across the vast lands. You essentially have to make it from D.C. to the West Coast on foot, or motorcycle, or any other vehicle you can find, salvage, and repair. Of course, you aren't completely alone. You have a robotic arm called a Odradek, which scans the terrain's topography, and sense's BTs and other evil lurking around. You also have a BB Pod which is a baby in a clear pod, that you connect to, in order to keep it alive. While Sam can sense when BTs are present, BB allows you to see them. With Hideo Kojima at the helm, you are getting a beautiful masterpiece that is part game, part cinematic experience with a star-studded cast with Norman Reedus (The Walking Dead fame), Guillermo del Toro among others. The game is said to be a slow lull in the early hours of the game, with it picking up as you progress in both skills and chapters. If you're playing on PlayStation Pro and a 4K TV with HDR, you are in for a real treat.

A somewhat new style of gaming and online communication in a way. The graphics, voice acting, soundtrack are all top notch! This game is not enjoyable for everyone, I am enjoying it so far but I wanted to buy it to support Kojima in his first solo game outside of Konami. His passion and dedication really shows.
Boring. Youre a ups driver. That is all. Dont buy this.
the graphics were sid, as was the sound, but the game is simply boring...

I did not know what to expect when I first played Death Stranding and that was the best part about it. If you are looking for a very fast paced game this isn't one. Instead like some of the best dramas on television the game uses the slow burn tactic to tell a character centered story using realistic mechanics in a sci fi world. If you want something that makes you think, question, and analyze then this is the game for you. However if you don't want that than it is not recommended.
The game is very beautiful but the gameplay is very boring.
A very narrative heavy game with a confusing and out there storyline.
Just seemed a little to Amazon Prime delivery 'ish'. Graphics looked great but just not worth the price.

I've always been a fan of Kojima games, and this is an incredibly fresh take on social commentary that's shocking just ahead of it's time. In the wake of recent social distancing, this speaks volumes to the lengths people will go to form and create relationships with each other. The core game loop is incredibly fun for what starts out as a walking simulator and eventually progresses into an incredible exercise in world building, network management, and being a high risk amazon delivery agent. Strongly recommend for the beautiful visuals, strong storytelling, and endless yelling into the void.
Not a bad game, nice graphics, kills time for a while, but the worst ending as it plays credits while you move your character for over two hours.

Really had high hopes for this game with Kojima unleashed from Konami, but this game is a walking simulator with a store thats so overly convoluted and bizarre that I keep falling asleep. I decided to dump it and go back and play the Witcher 3 again.
You pay 60 bucks to be a UPS driver on foot. I wish I would have saved my money.

I had read so much about Hideo and the games he produced that I just knew this would be a hit. I started playing it after I finished The Outer Worlds. I was looking forward to what I had heard was a detailed and long running game that I could get deeply ingrained in. But I have to say I am greatly disappointed with this game. I will admit it is a huge departure from the normal games on the market. And THAT is cool. I like different. But basically it is a game about delivering packages..... Not sure there is more to day. I know a lot of people like the game. And my comment above is a huge generalization. But it is true and I found it extremely boring and mundane. Maybe I will go back and play more and may get interested at that point but it just is NOT something I would recommend to others.
The whole game is a mail man simulator very disappointing

This game is really tedious. All you do is deliver stuff from point a to b with minimal combat and some boss fights that are very easy. I'm sure some people will like it but it's just not for me. Maybe buy it on a sale.

Waste of 60 dollars and hours of your time. This game makes you frustrated. I played 35 hours into it till chapter 6 than just tired and bored I erased it and the saved games too. Never again will I buy a masterpiece from Hideo Kojima.
A game focused on frustration. You're given beautiful vistas to roam , but the body controls of a toddler learning to walk. It's fine, but I'd never recommend it to anyone.
Solid game overall at launch. Didnt experience any bad glitches or anything. Very story driven game so youll need to be good with a lot of cut scenes. Its very original and worth a look.

It is kind of boring in the beginning. Really feels like a walking simulator, but then when weapons start to become a thing and zip lines unlock, the game really evolves into something enjoyable. Its a shame the beginning 8-10 hours drag.

I am roughly 8 hours into this game and have enjoyed every second of it. There are many people out there saying this game is boring and I would say that I 100% disagree. Although these individuals are entitled to their opinion, the open world and mission possibilities are endless if you take a few minutes to truly understand the game, and I feel as if those reviewers did not give the game proper attention. There are subtle bits of humor scattered throughout the game that keep it very entertaining and the stunning visuals ensure that you are never in a dull or lifeless looking environment. For those craving action, much like the Metal Gear franchise, there are not only countless opportunities with the various enemies throughout the open world, but missions are completed based entirely on your own schedule and route. The online aspect is awesome where players have the opportunity to help others out by leaving ladders, bridges, and climbing hooks around, along with the occasional warning sign. In the spirit of avoiding any spoilers, I will simply say that in this game, it is very much worth getting past some of the slower moments because there is always something new and exciting waiting just around the corner. Death Stranding is something entirely new and is sure to revolutionize the genre. Much like Red Dead Redemption 2, investing a little more time than the average Call of Duty game will provide huge rewards and will present one of the most photo real and detail oriented experiences currently available on console.

Amazing game, granted do I feel like a FedEx driver most of the time, yeah, but in an awesome way! The game is so deep and has so many different elements to it, in addition to a very well made story, its an amazing game.
People say its boring but its not it is like MGS V but it has more cutscene. It is very fun and has the best online mode of the year.
Ive been playing for a couple of days now and I can honestly say this game is both super weird but I cant stop playing.

In usual fashion, this game is a bit troll-y. But make no mistake, its visually stunning. Im still trying to wrap my head around exactly what it is. But its clear no expense was spared to make it. So you play it if you enjoy what he makes. My buddy and I talked and it feels like a PS4 version of the Postman. But again, absolutely stunning visuals and some interesting mechanics. Id rather not spoil game specifics. If you know this creator, youll understand what he makes. Ill say that youll either like it or hate it.
This is a game that I purchased for my son, This game to me is sad and depressing.

Hideo Kojima games have been unique, intriguing, surprising, frustrating, challenging, ultimately, rewarding, and not for everyone. Death Stranding is no different. Intriguing back stories, mysterious happenings with far flung story lines. This is similar to a stream of consciousness story. The individual elements may be difficult to understand, or unbelievable, as they present themselves, but, if you push forward, they make some meaningful connections in the end. Like Nier: Automata, DS has some philosophical, and multiplayer networking threads throughout. Like Horizon Zero Dawn, it has a lot of reading materials giving further explanation as to what has been, and what is happening now. The oft mentioned travel/delivery times prove to be a sort of subtle puzzle - how to get from A to B, quickly, economically, and alive. It has a lot of resource collection, but not a grind, tools and weapons creation, and a fantastic soundtrack...tunes that accompany you on your walks across the land. There are many surprises along the way. All these things make Death Stranding an very global sort of game.
Visuals, voice acting, soundtrack, gameplay. I am in awe

Im so excited to play this game as I bought it for my boyfriend for Christmas and I cant wait to play it. However the disk itself was loose in its case when it arrived. I could hear it rattling and I had to open it to put it back in place. I dont think it was damaged but when I breathed on it I could see a slight scratch on the surface. I hope I wont have any problems with it, and I hope this hasnt happened to anybody else... especially with an expensive game like Death Stranding.
Beautiful game with a fantastic story. If you like Kojima games youll like this.
If you are a fan of weird games or are a fan of Hideo Kojima then this game is a must get for you.
I loved the metal gear series and cant wait to play though this series.

This is a hard thin plastic case that folds on its end to protects the DVD encased within it. The DVD disc contains organized information stored in a specific order that allows it to only be interpreted by a Sony Playstation series 4 gaming system. The information on the disc has been compiled by a physically and mentally stressed team of humans who compile information in the form of data read by computers. These human workers follow the direction of an artistic leader who orders them to write the data in a specific order. These humans are paid very little in comparison to the owners of the intellectual property. This is the way the world works.

First of all, I thought this was an open world game like, Red Dead Redemption 2, Horizon Zero Dawn, Days Gone, Monster Hunter World etc. except with aliens from outer space. Nope, nothing like that. You take on an unimportant role as a delivery boy walking/running around mountains, hills, and streams trying to deliver packages to people meanwhile trying to balance yourself so you won't fall over. Most of the time you are the only living thing roaming around this empty world, made me feel even more lonely playing this junk. That about summarizes the whole game. Totally boring and waste of time and money. I can't believe so many people are giving this 'home made' video game a 5 stars. I guess anything goes these days as long as it makes it to release. Yes, it is from Kojima. Yes, the 4K graphics and story cutscenes are great, but still this experimental genre of a game is absolutely no fun. Very bland and repetitive. Playing this game is like going to your job in real life and working, running errands all day for measly wages. I don't write many reviews, only games that are either really good or really bad. Unfortunately, this game is not worth paying $60 for. Rent it first, if you have the urge, but I don't think it's even worth that.

This is the third time I've bought this game... I'm going to talk about some improvements I've noticed when playing this version. Loading times feel a bit faster than the Wii U version. Graphics are more colorful, closer to the 3DS version than the Wii U version. It feels like the Switch is able to handle more enemies on screen than the Wii U version and with a higher frame rate to boot, heck even the menus have a higher frame rate. All the content from the 3DS version is now back and in HD. When playing the Adventure mode, missions feel more balanced in difficulty to start off. On top of that, previous DLC such as characters and costumes and more, are now added rewards for completing certain missions on these Adventure maps. But he biggest thing added to this mode is the ability to buy item cards with rupees. Rather than waste time replaying a mission to get one item, you can just buy it and be done as long as you've unlocked the item before (I'm pretty sure this wasn't in either version before). There's just two or three downsides to this version compared to my Wii U experience. Just like on 3DS, there are more materials to find meaning more materials to grind for to upgrade characters where on Wii U there were less materials and it was easier to upgrade more characters. Another thing is amiibo don't seem to give higher ranking items until you've unlocked the higher ranked version in game. I recall on Wii U being able to get higher level items with amiibo easier. Also the Link amiibo isn't used to unlock the Spinner weapon anymore, which is good as it's an in-game unlock now, but the Young Link amiibo doesn't get you items for Young Link in-game, it gets you stuff for regular Link. In fact it doesn't seem like the other Zelda related amiibo, like the Guardian or Bokoblin, got any special functions and they just act as regular amiibo; would of been nice if this gave rare materials more often or something. And finally... THERE'S STILL NO PLAYABLE GROOSE! TL;DR Looks better, plays better, includes all previous content and plenty of quality of life improvements all around with barely any negatives.

I originally played the earlier 3DS version of this game. I greatly enjoyed my time then, but I wished I had the co-op experience that the original Wii U release had (I did not have a Wii U when I played the 3DS version). When this game was released for the Switch as a Definitive Edition, I knew it would be fun to revisit this Zelda spin-off game. The gameplay is fun and it will take a long time to fully exhaust the depth of this game. I highly recommend it for those who like being able to plow through their enemies and then tackle the tougher bosses.

I never got a chance to buy the Wii-U and I understand that this is a port over with some minor adjustments to the Games graphics and color scheme but man is this game FUN!!!!! I am enjoying all these Port Overs and hope Nintendo keeps bringing them on to the switch. I feel like the Wii-U system was supposed to be what the Switch is today. If you don't own this on a Wii-U system or don't have a Wii-U system but own a switch, buy this game. It's worth it, it's fun and you can play with an additional person Locally like inside your home with out needing a second switch and additional game cartridge like you need with splatoon 2.

I put over 200 hours into this game for WiiU, and I was excited to play the additions in the 3DS version but it was so choppy it was hardly playable at times. Now, we get both packages combined at 1080p 60fps on the Switch? YES PLEASE! Dynasty Warrior games are fun but the characters always kinda blended together for me. (Same with Fire Emblem Warriors) However, Zelda plays nothing like Midna who plays nothing like Fi, and so on and so forth. And all of their movesets are related to their characters in their respective games. If anyone tells you this is a button mashing game, they really haven't played enough. It's part strategy part fighting game. Knowing when to move on, when to hold back, when to fight, and when to run is all an important part of many of the harder missions. The story mode is basic and just 'okay' and reasonably long but not too much. Where this game shines is the challenge maps called 'Adventure Mode.' This mode forces you to play the other characters sometimes and you may end up loving a character once you get a taste like me with Zant. I highly recommend this game for anyone who hasn't played the originals.

Hyrule warriors DE takes the beauty of the wii u version and all the extras on the 3ds version with all the dlc and mushes them all for a game that was already considered a great musuo game into one of the best. The cast overall shine as everyone is vastly different in playstyle Bosses offer methods to defeat them that is not go in head first. Wide arange landscapes that doesn't feel to repetatve or copy paste. And thats just the main story. We haven't even touch the side quest missions, maps, fairy system and all other extras. If you have never played a musuo game before, this is the perfect entry point since its tailored to begginer friendly and simplified, but still offers methods that veteran players will enjoy.

As someone who was a big Zelda fan but not really into Dynasty Warriors, I was kind of skeptical of Hyrule Warriors for a while. A bit later, I tried someone else's copy of Fire Emblem Warriors for the Switch, and while I could see the potential in the style of gameplay, it was not enough to convince me to buy it. When a Switch port of Hyrule Warriors was announced, I decided to give it another shot, and the way it appealed to the Zelda fan in me was enough to convince me to go for it. Gameplay-wise, it is still Dynasty Warriors, but Hyrule Warriors tries hard to weave Zelda gameplay, items, lore, and other references in wherever it can. It will certainly not feel exactly like a Zelda game, but if you already kind of enjoy the Dynasty Warriors but are into Zelda, the Zelda content could be enough to make you enjoy the game as much as I do. Performance-wise, the game runs great while you are playing it (though, in some cases, at the cost of graphical fidelity). Oddly, frame rate stutters occur mostly during cutscenesnothing new, if you played the Wii U version, but so far it looks like none of the stutters from the Wii U version have been fixed. Even so, those are fairly infrequent, and as I said, I have not experienced any lag issues during normal gameplay. In terms of the amount of content, I have no complaints. As the Definitive Edition title suggests, this game includes all the content from both the Wii U and 3DS versions of Hyrule Warriors and a bit more, including the main story, the original game's cast of great characters from across all the best Zelda games, extra characters from the 3DS version such as Linkle, an additional mode that lets you play levels inspired by the original Legend Of Zelda world map, and new skins for Link and Zelda based on The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild. All in all, even if the gameplay is still very Dynasty Warriors, they went all-out to make this feel like part of the Zelda universe.
It's Dynasty Warriors with Zelda characters. IF you like repetition but with much better visuals, go for it. Have fun hacking away hordes of enemies with the Hyrule folks.
Fun game, a little grind, but for fans of Zelda, there is lots of here to like. Really enjoy playing the Wind Waker characters. Not perfect, but for hack/slash goodness, it's enjoyable.

I have the Wii U and 3DS versions of Hyrule Warriors and Ive decided - yet again - to dip in. Its a fun take on the Zelda franchise, if not terribly great. Its still a musou game at heart, but enough content and fanservice to bring joy to Zelda fans.
I owned this on Wii U, 3DS, and now the switch. Best Version Ever!!!

This is the Legend of Zelda spinoff game my 10 year old self always dreamed of, with characters from almost every Zelda game. Never had a Wii U so keep these great ports coming!
This game is exactly what my library was missing. Very relaxing and a ton of content!
This is a great remake of the Wii u version that can be played now on the go and best of all it has all the dlcs included with it.

This must be the third time I've bought a variation of this exact game, but the reasons for that are pretty clear; the Switch version is the definitive edition, including all of the updates/characters/content that were trickled out for the Wii U and 3DS versions. If you're interested mainly for the portability, by comparison the 3DS version was plagued with slowdown and horrible control for any version besides the New 3DS, which you won't have to worry about here. Even gamers who don't care for the Warriors series will most likely enjoy playing this game, as there's more to do and the familiar Zelda series trappings to entertain them.
Good graphics and gameplay. Was hoping to be able to play split screen two player at the onset like it seems on the box, but you have to beat the first act to open that feature.

Another Wii U port for Switch that's 4 years old and full price. Incredible the audacity of Nintendo to do this to its customers. If it weren't for gamers club I wouldn't have bought the game. If you never owned it before it's a good game so atleast there's that.

The previous reviews on this product were in relation to the bundle with the PSVR and did not address the game itself. I thoroughly used to enjoy Doom in the 90s and was hoping for a great revival. The game looks amazing and, so far, I have enjoyed the storyline. However, the game does not utilize fluid movement but more like the click and move movement in old PC games like Myst. It jumps, what appears, five steps upon every standard movement and can be disorienting during the combat scenes. Other than that, the game looks amazing and I look forward to finishing it soon. I would recommend this to a friend if the movement was not an issue for them.
Just plays way better with a controller. Not for vr

Ive never experienced nausea like this in my life. The controls are very difficult to sync and the motion is constant and confusing. I own many other VR titles and this one is awful. Too bad because the game is actually cool.
Its not our good grafic for a fame on vr!!!!!!!!!!!

I'll admit, previews of this game don't do it justice. It seems like you're just teleporting everywhere without the actual thrills/gore of DOOM 2016. But that's not 100% true, there's a smooth movement option, and if you're playing with a Move Controller (or better yet, the PS VR Aim controller), this is a pretty unique experience. I wouldn't recommend playing this if all you have is a regular PS4 controller. DOOM 2016 is already 60fps and plays great: this won't really offer you anything better.
This game was a terrible game it does not support the move controllers and it requires you to use and DualShock which isn't fun at all. The movement is glitchy. Overall a bad game

I'm sitting there and I see this thing and it's called 'DOOM VFR' What does that VFR stand for anyway? 'Virtual Fun Room' I'm thinking so I tell my Mom... WE GOTTA GET THIS GAME. She's like OK. Just let me watch my stories. So I put on my special gaming goggles and jump into this 'fun room' and BOOM. DEMON. IN MY FACE. And I'm like... OH HECK NO. This is too close to real life. WAY TOO SCARY. Grandma loves it. WOULD PLAY AGAIN.
I have not played the full game yet only the demo but I look forward to playing it soon.
Still trying to figure it out controls a little wonky the graphics and the gameplay seems very nice and fresh get you into the game

I dont have time to play my game on PlayStation VR I have six kids at the house and I dont have time to play the game right now.

From what Ive played of it, its pretty good.im sure that as I would have plunged deeper into the game, I would have been completely taken by it.unfortunately I suffer from motion sickness lol.psvr is a very good and Emersive experience, but Im just not cut out for it.i cant sit on a game like Doom VFR, for more then 7 minutes tops.i get extremely nautious.i literally start to feel my stomach preparing to erupt as Im forcing myself to tough it out and play through it anyway.the teleportation system honestly eases the experience for me, but the restriction of regular movement can be frustrating.when changing the settings to regular movement though, I go from extremely happy, to maybe this isnt such a good idea after all, within a matter of about 4 minutes.i decided to give it all up and just hand my entire vr set over to my cousin.so far he enjoys it.havent heard any complaints from him regarding motion sickness.that haven been said, this is a good game, if you can stomach it lol

there are multiple versions of each game. Now you can save whenever you want and also rewind if you wish to. The Super Nintendo replica box and manual are nice, however there isn't a case for the game cart it's self. The cart is held in place by a piece of foam the size of a Super Nintendo cart.
I bought the solely for Aladdin thinking it was the one from the super Nintendo turns out It is the Sega Version. Which Im sure is a great game but killed my nostalgic vibe.

I grew up playing the SNES Disney games. These two were some of my favorite so I was thrilled to see it available on Nintendo's newest platform, the Switch. However, the Aladdin side of this game is not the original Nintendo version, but rather the SEGA which I never played having an SNES system and not a SEGA. Nowhere on the box is the version listed. I was fairly disappointed and attempted to return the game which isn't permitted in Best Buy stores once a game has been opened. No one informed me of this policy and it is not written anywhere in the store. I would not have purchased this product if I had known that the NINTENDO version was not included. The only reason I give this a Fair 2/5 star rating is because The Lion King side of the game did include the Nintendo version.
I love the Super Nintendo packaging and the 90's nostalgia kept in. It unfortunately doesn't have the Super Nintendo version of Aladdin - just the Genesis version. Buy it for the awesome packaging.

Just purchased this game on 12/22/19 from Best Buy. Got the version that had the SNES box. Specifically got it because we thought that it would have the SNES version of Aladdin. However it only has the Sega version. It would seem that there is NO SNES version available. This should have been called out as this is one of the reasons why we specifically bought this game. The Lion King does have the SNES version. For those who would like to know.
wasn't worth the $10. Game is way more difficult than it should be.
This is a pretty fun game. You get to drive NASCAR cars. That is fun enough to not need to say mich more.
