Of course with the Coron virus there was no place to find it, as a last resort (thinking they were closed) I went on line and found one at BestBuy! And, as luck would have it they were doing curb side deliveries, way to go BestBuy! He loves it and says the graphics are 100% better than past versions.

I am loving this game. I just wish I hadnt waited for so long to pick it up. I havent done any online racing yet, but plan to after getting some more practice. If youre looking for something to pass the time during the cover-19 crisis, do yourself a favor and buy this game.
Play very cheap good game if you love to race NASCAR nothing fancy just basic NASCAR racing

I've been really enjoying this game. I think it is much improved over Heat 3. Car handling is much better, collisions aren't super realistic but are improved. Career mode allows you to start in any series.
My five year old loves this game. It is too advanced doing the prep of the cars, however, playing it he does just fine.
Best bang for the buck purchase you can get for the price.
Its Nascar! Gotta love it! Driving with the champs, close as it gets!! Race day!!
None gift not opened. Had what we needed. If gift not able to review.
This game is the best in the series. Shame they didnt really update the career mode.

I remember playing the original Nascar game on PC back in the year 2000. The graphics and visual effects on this game is a step-up to the right direction. Although, I'd like to see more details from the graphics point of review. Would be great to also use personal names within the game rather than a select pro drivers. Weather effects would be awesome too.
I was waiting for a long time for this game and its just perfect!!! Great graphic quality, amazing new fearures for the characters, scenarios absolutely perfect!!! Good job Lego/Marvel!!!!!

My 6 year old loves it, but if you helped your kid through the first one, this is a slog - the city is the same and it now uses the globe map from Batman 3, I'm not a fan of these later, disjointed aspects of the games.

The main reason I bought Lego Avengers was because it was being advertised as an open world Lego game and my son loves Legos and the Avengers. However, the advertising is misleading and requires you to go through several levels to unlock a playable open world hub. Rinse and repeat until you finish the game and then it truly can be semi-open world. So I decided to run through the campaign as quickly as possible to unlock the free roam mode, however the game mechanics are so terrible that I really can't stand playing this. You go from literally mashing the same button or two over and over again, to trying to figure out these stupidly obscure puzzles. This wouldn't be so bad save for the fact that there are dozens of prompts and highlighted areas that draw the player in but require a different character to actually be able to break the brick, control the scanner, etc. And lastly, I have experienced glitches where a character is stuck in a corner and cannot jump or move out which required me to close the game and restart the entire mission. The only reason it gets 2 stars is because my kid does like to run around as a super hero. But I really wish I would have saved the money and passed on it.
This is an outstanding game, I really enjoyed playing it.

This Lego game did not win me over. Without going too much in depth on this review, I'll just make a few short points. First: The game is a slightly lengthened play by play of the the most recent Marvel movies. With a few extra missions tossed in here and there. Second: I honestly think that these Lego games have gotten increasingly more complex, especially for a child. The basics will always be the same but with more and more to do in each iteration and annoying 'help' icons, this game almost makes it a drag to play. Third: Lastly, I'm tired of all of the console exclusive content. Mainly towards PlayStation. I have all three current gen systems so, losing content isn't a problem. This is just an annoyance, timed exclusive or not, this needs to stop. Of course, if you want more content get it on PlayStation. I'd rather have it on Xbox if it weren't for that.
Fun, but hard to figure out. Maybe if you're an experienced lego player it's fine, but as never playing a lego game before, it's difficult.
Love all the lego games and this one is no exception.
Can't review as it is my husbands game he plays it every night...he enjoys it

I am pretty sure it's based on the MCU..so no X-Men, Fantastic Four, Spiderman (maybe). As a huge X-Men fan I'm going to be really bummed that I will have to wait even longer for Rogue/Nigtcrawler to be made into Lego characters. Really tiring of the Fox/MCU ownership rights..wish we could return to the 90s :( (No PS4 Marvel vs Capcom, X-Men arcade removed from PS Network). On the positive side will get to see new characters such as squirrel girl, MCU quicksilver! The preorder bonus will be nice also with the additional characters.

I have purchased this game three times now and can happily say that the Switch is a wonderful platform to play it on. I was shocked by how quick the loading times were and how well the controls worked out (there is a learning curve like most games however.) Thus far, my time spent playing has all been in handheld mode, and I havent had any issues regarding the games performance as of writing this review. Such an amazing experience to be able to take with you on the go. Also wonderful that the pawn system is not hindered by not having purchased Nintendos online services.

Dragon's Dogma when it was first released didn't receive the best of reviews. However as years have passed, the game is starting to get more appreciation. Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen is the 'complete' edition of the RPG released back on the PS3 and XBOX 360 from Capcom. The game plays surprisingly well on the Switch hardware (particularly in handheld mode.) If you're looking for a excellent third person action RPG to play, definitely check out this Capcom title.

I wont give 5 stars unless the game is perfect in every way and Dragons Dogma hits the mark. It is excellent. Amazing combat, voice acting, characters, gameplay, this game is a real masterpiece and it plays fantastic on the Switch. If you liked Skyrim, you will love Dragons Dogma.

Definitely was not expecting for this game to become one of my favorite games of all time. I bought it because I had heard good things about it when it came out waaay back when. That it was a sleeper hit basically. Boy were they right. This game feels like a video game, but in the best way possible. Lot of replayability and it's a blast! You can switch between different classes, and even hybrid classes. You also have a companion that follows you everywhere and helps you out. You can recruit two more 'pawns' but those are intechangeable - don't get attached. You'll need to get new ones as you level up. There are a lot of weapons and the world was fun to explore

Really, one of the best games I played. Missed this game during Xbox 360 era. But glad it came out on switch. Its kinda slow at the beginning. But after a few hours it will get a lot more fun. If you like SoulsBourne games you might like this one too.

No one told me that this game is not fun for the first 5-6 hours. I was about ready to return it but it really opens up once you pass a certain point: in terms of classes, abilities, everything becomes much more open. 4 stars for the wasted first hours.

I previously heard this game was good but did not know what to expect. The character creation process is pretty in-depth. When I first started the game I wasnt that impressed but as I continued to play I started to get quite into it. Im hours into it and enjoying it quite a bit. It plays great in handheld mode. Its basically the only way I play the game. If you are looking for a sprawling action rpg where you can change your vocation and skills then check this out. And for only $30 this game is a great bargain. I would definitely recommend.
Spent two hours on the character creator, which was fun, but game is pretty hard.

While you may think Dragon's Dogma is an old game, and it is, its one of few games I can think of that holds up all these years after it's initial release. I like to think of it of Skyrim meets Monster Hunter. If that gets you excited at all, I'd be hard pressed to think of a reason you wouldn't like this game.
Graphically I am impressed. It looks better than Skyrim did on switch, in my opinion at least.

Where was I in 2012 when this game originally came out? I finally dove in with this recently released Nintendo Switch version after years of hearing that it was a great game. Turns out everyone was right! Action RPG with different classes that you can switch between, large open areas to explore, deep combat, and customizable AI-controlled party members that you can share and download over the internet, all in a beautiful fantasy setting. Check it out!
Great game fun to play will keep you entertained for hours
Awesome game and very underrated . Get it you wont regret it .

I've never got to play this game when it was on the last generation systems so when I heard it was coming to the Nintendo switch I just had to pick up a copy because I watched a lot of trailers and YouTubers to make sure I would like it and I wasn't disappointed in my purchase

Dragons Dogma was a sleeper hit on the PS3 and 360. Its a high fantasy adventure game that has some great action gameplay and combat. Lots to explore in the kingdom you find yourself in as your work towards the showdown with a dragon and more. Now you can take this epic game on the go. Its a single player game so you can enjoy it on your own time.
I bought this on ps4 before. Graphics aint what I expect. But not on switch. Handheld is totally tolerable

This is the first time I play Dragons Dogma and must say I was craving for a game like this since I finished Zelda Breath of the Wild. Graphics look good, cut scenes look even better. Gameplay is very smooth and satisfying. Open world exploration is great too. For just $30 you are getting a lot of content here.
Pretty sweet rpg that holds up surprisingly well for its age, Im getting lost in this cool world all over again and I love it!
Very fun action RPG with great story and play mechanics.
A game I never got a chance to play. Loving it so far and I can take it on the go.
Very fun adventurer game. Graphics are great. A fantastic edition to anyone's Nintendo Switch Collection!
excellent port of this action RPG,very well done in my opinion.

Pretty good game, but too much to explore. Seems as though you can go thru woods, caves, climb rocks, and go many different ways. Have not figured out if there is a 'proper' way to transverse the terrain.
We received a great value on the tv we purchased , the picture and quality is excellent and Mike did a wonderful job helping us find everything we needed. Our whole experience was exceptional.
I buy the game and I rate the game 10/10 this great graphics and gameplay battlefield v game for the year ..
This is hands down going to replace BF4 and BF1! The game play feel and really good and realistic now i just gotta learn as much as i can to play better

I originally cancelled my Pre-order since I did not have fun, I picked this up again after my concerns were addressed by launch and i am loving this! I dont know why this game is getting negative reviews here, the game has a Campaign, the UI menu is A HUGE improvement over 4 and 1. Now i can actually customize my loadout in the menus instead of just in game. Graphics are what you come to expect from dice and comparing it to how COD launched, it is not a Blue Screen Buggy mess! pick this up!
Great game just do not like the revive system of the game. Makes everything alot worse
Amazing game! DICE really nailed it with this one, the realism and gun play make this one of the best Battlefield games EVER!
PERFECT NEXT STEP IN THE BATTLEFIELD ADDITION FOR PEOPLE

There has been a lot of negative conversation regarding the release of BFV but much of it is unfair. Yes, the game originally could use more maps, modes and fixing . But after an early update, the game runs beautifully and with the release of more content (all free), BFV will rank as the best of all time. Why will it be the best? Let me tell you quickly. 1. The gameplay has been refined with better controls/graphics. 2. Sound quality is realistic and guns/vehicles roar to life. 3. Plenty of customizing to soldiers/weapons/vehicles. 4. New, positive game additions such as building and lower ammo capacity will alter the way BF is played in the future
Its a big improvement from battle field one and the story mode is a bit long.
This video game was perfect for my brother since this is what he wanted
My grandchildren love this game. They don't want to quit & go to bed. They said they would recommend it to all.

Bf has been moving deeper and deeper towards cod territory. Vehicles have become increasingly non existent in large maps. Maps are large but are designed with narrow lanes to keep the combat close quarter sacrificing vehicles in large maps. It should of been a bf1 expansion into the next great war, again moving into cod territory where there is barely any change to justify a new game ex:(bo3 to bo4). If you enjoy close quarter with beautiful big wasted space maps, it is the game for you

Excellent punishing gameplay for souls-like players. Drop the NPCs if you dont want them helping. Everyone comments on the character customization being so unique and vast, but thats only a small part of what makes this game good. The typical souls-like game does not deliver on the story side of things, or make you feel for the characters in the game. This game has a great story, sound track, and environment that I really loved.
Gameplay is pretty simple. If you're used to souls games they added some differences to it to make it there own version of it. Overall pretty solid game not very difficult.
I probably should've waited for reviews on this one. Dark Souls meets anime but theres a bit too much going on for me (excessive cleavage).

I'm really disappointed in this game. They took out a lot of the great things about Fallout (interesting story , NPCS) . It is now multiplayer, which is good, but the glitches bugs and flaws make this review negative. It's more of a survival game than traditional fallout RPG game. Need to eat drink sleep, weapons break down etc. Spend a lot of time doing mundane things instead of just exploring. It is also only ONLINE play so cant pause, have multiple saves, etc. No moral decisions to make. Everyone is dead, so all 'missions' feel unimportant as the quest giver is already dead. I suggest watching online for awhile. If you get bored watching you will be bored playing.

Player beware. I am at level 30 now and the last 2 days have been back breakers. 1. I lost my home base! It was gone off the map. Turns out my Stash was intact as was my CAMP, but my fort with my building and all of my crafting stations, turrets, furniture, crops, etc.- All gone!! I read online that if a player builds their base in the same location of yours, you will lose it all. I did. Took hours to rebuild. 2. Now I am stuck in my power armor and cannot exit! This is a common problem- read about it online. I have not had it resolved yet and hope I don't lose my character. There are recommended fixes online but those too take hours of time to screw around with. Bottom line, you can live with minor glitches/inconveniences but not glitches that can completely change your play through. This game is not ready for public consumption.

Breaks my heart to write this as I'm a huge fan of the Fallout series with 4 being the best, this game is a disgrace. There are so many glitches it's literally unplayable for me. I've been playing 4 hours today and the game has frozen up and kicked me out 9 times today alone. If the game freezes up before I am able to reach my last death to retrieve my loot, I lose all of my Junk which is critical for repairs and upgrades, which you'll spend half the game constantly fixing your weapons and armor and trying to figure out how to carry and stash stuff. Massive battles, which in a game like Assassin's Creed Odyssey are amazing, are absolutely impossible. The game lags so bad when there are more than 5-6 enemies attacking to the point you can't play it, then it just freezes up and quits. My internet speed is a hard-line fiber connection with over 700 Mbps and none of my other games or devices have issues so it has nothing to do with the internet connection dropping out. I thought after playing the beta they would resolve the glitches but no they have managed to get even worse. Numerous missions have issues that you'll need to replay several times, it took me 24 hours and several hard reboots just to get a holotape to load on a computer on a Main Quest 'One of Us' before it finally worked, but I wasted a whole day and couldn't progress in the game until it finally worked. Also, in past Fallout games you could re-load a previously saved game if you wanted to make a different choice - not on 76! Your only option is to continue playing or start over from scratch Level 1. Save your money and get AC Odyssey or Red Dead 2! Trust me if you buy this game you will regret it! If I could give it a ZERO I would!

This isnt your typical fallout game so please do your research before deciding to buy. Watch gameplay on YouTube and read up on what the game is like. There are no npcs, this is a multiplayer open world survival game akin to ARK. There is a greater emphasis on crafting than story. The overworld is stunning and interesting to explore as you would expect from a BSG game. Its not for everyone though.

Buyer Beware! I am a longtime Fallout fan and purchased the game to play in single player mode. Once I got the game home and waited the 2 days for the update to download, I was very disappointed to find out I couldn't start the game without XBox Live. I refuse to get XBox live because the internet here in Alaska is terrible, so I guess my days of being a Fallout fan are over. It would be nice if they would have put on the box that XBox Live was required for single player mode. It would have saved me a lot of time and frustration. I hope BestBuy will give me my money back.

This game needs ALOT of work... I had unfortunately pre-ordered this game and paid the full $59,99 for [in my opinion] an unfinished game that dropped it's price only a week after release. I wish I wouldn't have spent the full amount on this, but for $35, it's a fair price. It's not a bad game, but I definitely was expecting better from another Fallout game. Some improvements/changes I would like to see: I'm not a fan of the No-Human NPC thing. PLEASE introduce them back with the next DLC. From what I understood at E3, Bethesda's reasoning behind having no human NPC's was that 'you are the first humans to emerge from the vault, there's no survivors because they didn't survive the bombs' but after you start playing, you see the map is littered with bodies of 'survivors' who have left notes and holotapes about their lives AFTER the bombs dropped... These would have been interesting NPC's' to meet and do missions for, instead of the hand written notes and holotapes we are left with.. It seems like the story writers were extremely rushed, short staffed, and working on a Ramen Noodle budget. The game feels unfinished, lazy, and pretty much emotionless. It feels like the campaign is just a suggestion if anything, I get more enjoyment out of just exploring the map than I do actually following the missions/campaign. Huge issue with high level players ganging up against lower level players...Hard to progress in the game when you're a low-level and being tracked down by players more than twice as powerful as you - forcing you to leave the server to find a new one after they've already taken all the aluminum scraps you just spent the last hour trying to collect... :P You can't really be mad at them though, it's understandable to have gotten bored in the game after you've reached a certain level... But still, either make an option to turn on/off player damage, or ALLOW PRIVATE SERVERS. Also, if SONY was the only one against allowing cross-platform; why can't XBOX and PC players play together? Me and my fiance are huge Fallout fans and even though I've got a perfectly capable PC that could run this game, the only way it looks like we are going to be able to play together is if we either buy a second Xbox (and a second copy of the game because we have the physical copy) or I spend another $1000+ on another gaming computer for her to play on - either way, it's not worth it.. :/ In conclusion, I feel like the artists and developers did a great job at making this a beautiful and interactive game. There are alot of bugs and glitches that I'm sure will be fixed within the next few months. Not taking stars off for that, every game as big as this is expected to have it's quirks. I'm rating 3 stars because the story line is so disappointing and the lack of NPC's makes the game feel dull/empty...

The concept of an always online, multiplayer/none single player campaign/story, NPC-less, Fallout game is already a sketchy proposition... after playing 76 for a couple dozen hours, I can see the appeal that this spin-off of the franchise might have for some who enjoy the basic aspects of open world survival RPGs; like leveling up, and searching for/fetching materials and resources to build, break down and consume- rinse & repeat... unfortunately, even that type of experience is hampered by an incredible amount of bugs & glitches (just search youtube for examples), that are surprising even for a Bethesda game.... if Bethesda can patch the bugs, balance out the gameplay, expand build limit, and listen to the various other critiques & requests on the forums, then Fallout 76 could be a 7/10 for a niche audience.... But right now, it's a broken mess, and there are no signs that Bethesda has any serious strategy to address the situation. For now, skip this one, keep an eye on the forums, and if the situation improves, maybe pick it up on sale.

Trying to play this game was so awful I had to write a review to warn people not to waste money buying this game. I loved Fallout 4 and was very excited to get Fallout 76 and get started. I was shocked to find out it is online only but liked Fallout 4 so much I figured I would give it a try. So I started playing the game and managed to build a C.A.M.P. but then the server disconnected. I figured it was because it is a new game so maybe they needed time to work out the kinks and release a patch or something technical....I asked my friends if it happened to them and they said yes. I waited a few weeks and tried to play again with no luck, every 5 minutes the server drops out and you forced to reload the game. I spent more time waiting for it to load than actually playing the game. I don't have problems playing any other online game, just Fallout 76. If you get dropped off a server even once then the game is trash compared to regular offline games because you never get kicked off your gaming system and have to wonder if you can even play the $60 video game cause the sever is down repeatedly or if the sever is getting an upgrade.... Fallout 76 came out in November and still there is no fix to the problem, I pay for fast internet so I don't have problems gaming but it's not the internet. This game sucks, don't waste your money.

As a fan of the Fallout series, I had really high hopes for this one. The map is huge, which is great, but... Unlike other Fallout games, there's no NPC's to interact with, which makes the missions and discovering new towns a little empty. Yes, you can play with other players (when it works), but I've found that can also be a little distracting since you have to listen to a lot of recordings. Also, everybody's not necessarily on the same page as far as where they are in the game, which can make things a little confusing to get done. The multiplayer also glitches out quite a bit, things lag and lock-up. I've also had a lot of trouble adding people to or joining teams. To fix it, we've had to all either reboot the game or reset the console, which can be frustrating. The one good thing about multiplayer is that you've got others to help scavenge and beat creatures you may come across. I'm interested to see what Bethesda will do to repair many of the well documented issues with the game as well as the added content. We'll see how this goes, but so far, unless you're a diehard fan and want to ride it out with Bethesda, I'd go in cautiously at this point. Maybe (hopefully), they'll fix the issues and this will become a great game. All that being said, be warned, if you're a fan of the Fallout series and gameplay, this is a lot different.

A lot of gripes with this game. I played it even with all the negativity and actually enjoyed it. There is so much wrong with this game and so little that went right. It only holds its ground because it is FALLOUT, and only because its fallout. Playing with friends is fun, but once you reach level 50 there is very little to do. Glitched loading screens, enemies, cards, stashes, quests, events, mods, everything is buggy. The end game content is a reskinned dragon from Skyrim. They LOWERED xp given by high level monsters with recent patch, thus increasing the boring grind that the game already had. Good weapons and armor are EXTREMELY rare, like 50 hours in and I cant get one rare. Same with X01 mods. I've server hopped 100+ times and still havent got the ones I want. Whats the point? There is no point to this game. Mindless, glitchy, boring, carnage. DONT EVEN GET ME STARTED WITH CANVAS BAGS, MICRO TRANSACTIONS... Just wait for Obsidians 'Outer Worlds'.

I don't know what Bethesda is thinking but why in the world would you have this be online only? It requires you to have Xbox live to play. That sucks. Not everyone can sit at home and play. I bought this to take on overseas deployments and there is not internet everywhere else in the world. So I really just wasted my money getting it. Plus you have to have Xbox Live to play it. Anyone who ever tried to cancel an Xbox live membership knows that it takes an act of God, Congress and a letter from the Pope to do so. So I will never get Xbox live just to play this. I am done with this series. Didn't Bethesda see what happen to Diablo when they had an online only game?

I LOVE me some fallout. Ive played most of them. This atrocity, however, is an insult to the not only the gamer that wastes their money on it, but all of the fallout games that came before it! Its extremely glitchy, there is no plot or story, they pretend that there is, but no, there isnt, and the gameplay is boring and awful. You cannot pause the game at all, its constantly online even if you want to play solo. You will also continue to be hit by enemies even when going into your pipboy to switch weapons or use aids. What kind of crap is that?! Everything about it is POOP! Just dont do it. If you really want to try the game, I would at least wait a few months to see if they fix or improve it. Its basically a broken beta that no one bothered to fix before full release. Garbage.

I am a huge fallout fan but this game is simply offensive. This is basically a Fallout themed Destiny knockoff. I thought Destiny had a terrible story until I played this game. It has virtually no story, you rarely run into other players, half of the missions I played were so buggy I couldn't even complete the objectives. Framerate would drop to single digits at certain points. I had the game less than 48 hours before I traded it in. Don't waste your time and money on an unfinished product.

Hello Everyone: I have played all of the Fallout games to date, and this one is the worse. You are required to have Xbox gold to play this game regardless if you try to play the story mode or not. This has you connected to online play all of the time. There is no real enemies except garbage can robots. This game is a poor attempt at something that is designed at party mode. Do yourself a favor and wait for it to hit the discout bin. I just sold mine off to recoup on this wasted purchase.
Great game that will keep you occupied during quarantine. Its a mixture of Minecraft and Fortnite.
Glitches are all over, no other 'human ' contact (as of yet). Near impossible situations. With that said, it's still a Fallout game so there's still fun in it.
The Fallout series of games is a favorite! Its a great immersive experience.
Major let down when compared to previous Fallout games.

I am a HUGE fan of the Fallout franchise but this game was a huge mistake with them trying to branch into a completely online play and I have had nothing but issues between glitches and horrible gameplay since I got this game!

This one died on the vine pretty quick. I bought a copy for my son and daughter last Christmas. They played for a couple of days and put it down. I understand Bethesda is trying to make amends and breath a little more life into the game, but it was definitely junk.

Here since Fallout 3 and this one doesn't disappoint. All the negativity it's gotten, while deserved, one needs to remember, this is their FIRST shot at an online/multiplayer game. Now that the dust has settled, I feel like it's a great time to jump into this world, if you haven't given it a chance yet. Also, the addition of human NPCs will be VERY welcome, since talking to terminals/robots is only engaging for so long. Adventuring: If you like exploration games which allow you to go (literally) where ever you want as soon as you leave the startup mission, then you'll love the freedom this game offers. It's truly a 'do what ever you want, whenever you want' kind of experience. You'll want to follow the main quest-line to follow the lore that is Appalachia, and to get specific key recipes or tips to help you out, especially early on. From delving into random caves/mines to assaulting a bandit camp or just picking a direction and walking to see what quest pops up, there is ALWAYS something to do to keep you busy. Crafting: Probably my favorite, next to adventuring, is the crafting aspect in a game. Again, this game delivers in a massive way. Finding recipes/plans through adventuring or via quest/event rewards, to create new useful items is a huge part of the experience. The storage limit is still an issue, but you just learn to adapt to what you really need, versus what you are holding onto 'just-in-case'. PvP: Multiplayer (specifically pvp) was never my cup of tea and this really worried me about FO76. There are 3 modes now and each is very different, regarding solo vs. pvp gameplay. Adventure is for ppl like me, solo focused, but can team up if you/they want. If someone does attack you (this has only happened twice since I started playing last year) the damage done is next to nothing, unless you attack back. It's much more common to see ppl helping each other out in this mode, as opposed to hunting each other. Survival is a pvp focused world where the rewards are better, and expeiemce gain is increased, but you constantly have to be on your toes and look over your shoulder. Nuclear Winter is a battle royale game mode... because I guess that's a thing now in most games. But, to each their own. Wrap-up: This is the tip of the iceberg, so to truly know for yourself, I'd give it a try, especially if you enjoyed FO4. It's a giant world to explore and you'll be glad you gave it a chance! Also, it's worth noting, you need to have Xbox Live Gold to play this game. No monthly subscription, however, besides that.
Please don't. This is a shame for any Fallout fan. Bug riddled still, without purpose or story.

The future of games can be seen here as your massively multiplayer online based but lacks etiquette towards the buyer or user, using most of the things we wanted out of the game of fallout to begin with, for example fixation on weapon durability, creating a bit more drama on my end, this game deserves a thumbs down, please stay with fallout 4.
Probably the worst game I've have ever spent $60 on. The game is glitchy and is definitely half finished. Would not not buy again.
The game is just ok it could have been much better
Pros: - None Cons: Terrible lag, servers crash all the time, Hit boxes are broken...... Honestly I could go on and on, just don't buy it.
Bugs everywhere game is hard to play mostly just another fallout 4. Nothing new

This game was the hackest piece of junk Ive ever bought...Its got it all , glitches, slow downs, no sense of completion or leading to any end . And worst of all I paid full price pre-ordered online and the one time I go to use it the disk will not work and try to get through to Bethesda customer support, hahaha I could go on and on all day about what a colossal waste of money this game was but my mother always said if you dont have anything nice to say dont say it at all .

Basically FO 76 is FO 4 online with no NPCs. The graphics are the same, and it runs on the same buggy engine. There are some clever elements, but overall the game just felt boring. I lost interest after maybe 8 hours of play. I would like to think the game could improve with updates, but sadly the fact that this runs on the same old engine Bethesda has used since Oblivion means I can't really get excited for this game to ever improve.

If you filter through all the bad press this game has received, it ultimately is a product suffering from a severe identity crisis. A franchise known for its single player, narrative-based gameplay, this one dumps most of it in an attempt to become a MMO. Unfortunately the MMO components are bland and half-baked, while the single player aspects have been cannibalized so badly that it simply isn't that much fun.

They took what Fallout 4 was and completely ruined it. They made it an online only waste of time. Glitches and lack of introduction make it completely unplayable. You'd do better just to buy a backward compatible version and save your money for when obsidian gets a say in their own ideas again.

Fallout 76 is to other Fallout games as Far Cry is to Far Harbor. In other words, it shares part of the name but it has no other similarity. I am a long-time fan of Fallout but this iteration is a complete failure. If you are looking for a fun game to play this isn't it. The lack of NPC's might have decreased costs for Bethesda but it also decreased my potential enjoyment. I had hoped Magnolia would make a repeat appearance and that cleverly written story lines would make me care about new characters the way I cared about Piper and Curie. None of that is to be found here. There is very little 'Fallout' in Fallout 76.

Fallout 76 is an online multiplayer game. With this being said, it's a quite different playing experience, especially in single player mode, from previous Fallout games. Here are a few of the differences I've noticed in the brief time I've been playing. First off, there are a lot of bugs and glitches, with a number of patches already released and more planned for the future. Also, there are no computer generated 'human' characters to interact with during quests. Building mode is different. I could go on but since I don't have that much time in the game yet, I'll end it here. I gave it 3 stars because the game is still fun in some aspects, but a lot different from the last one, Fallout 4. I'll give it some more time.

Actually preordered the game, not disappointed. Is the game perfect? No. It has its glitches but i really enjoy the gameplay. You can play by yourself or as a team, obviously it's easier as a team. Always thought 'I'm not the sole survivor, it would be cool to explore with friends'. Yes, there isn't a direct story staring you in the face but there is story and missions you can do. Unlike previous games the objective isn't to find a lost family member, but only to rebuild. Your story and objectives come from items, terminals, and robots.

Definitely a fan of the platform happy with the storyline and the graphics music from previous generations. Definitely appreciate the patch updating to the stash box and known glitches like unable to exit power armor. Still glitchy and often freezes and boots you from the game but there are different servers which allow you to interact socially with different online players which is new and can be enjoyable or irritating.

I'm going to keep this simple and say the game has got the most glitches I have ever seen in a $60 title. It's like playing an Alpha test. The game is bare, and boring with very mundane quests and lame online player interactions. The map isn't 4x bigger like they say, you just run out of stamina 4x quicker so you have to walk all the time to make it seem bigger. Pick this up for $10 at the most if you are interested. Watch some YouTube videos too before making the decision. Also wait for a few months after this review is posted because it's STILL BROKEN after this amount of time.

Fallout 76's post-apocalyptic world looks promising. But I wouldn't recommend this at full price. Unfortunately, this online game is littered with bugs and glitches. As a patient Fallout fan, I truly believe Bethesda will fix these in future updates and patches but it might take a long time. Until then, I will continue to build my camp and enjoy this game as long as the server will let me before booting me off. If you don't want to follow a storyline and just want to do random quests, stockpile random items, build a house to show off, trade with other online players. Then, you might get some entertainment value out of this game, just don't go in expecting a Fallout 3 or 4, otherwise, you will be greatly disappointed.

If you don't buy this game simply because people are giving it bad reviews, don't. Most people are buying this without realizing it's an online only game. It's their done 2 seconds of research they would have realized beforehand

This game isn't bad, it just isn't good either. The game play is not very difficult. I've yet to run into a difficult situation where I couldn't win. Not a deal breaker, but let's not pretend this is a survival game. Second, the game hasn't made any improvements since Fallout 4. The animations are the same... same weapons... same power armor animations... same sound effects. Aside from more vegetation I would swear this was Fallout 4. All this the game is worth it at sales price to add to your collection!!!

Finally learned my lesson on pre-ordering games. I could hardly get into the game itself because even on the One X the performance is terrible. I can handle the occasional dip in framerate but just walking with nothing or anybody around made the game stutter and freeze.

This has been a unique spin on the Fallout series. I personally would have preferred the game to be solo player instead of open world. It has it's weird glitches, enemy respawns as soon as you clear out a building and other odd things that don't make it as satisfying as it was being single player. It still has the look and feel of Fallout and is still time consuming and enjoyable to play.

I was extremely excited to play FO76 but almost immediately upon leaving the vault, my excitement turned to disappointment. The game feels incomplete and disorganized, not to mention how poorly it runs. I'm hopeful that Bethesda releases some updates to fix some of these issues.

It is a fun online version of fallout to play with friends. The party system works great and servers only have minor trouble. That being said it lacks the depth and narration of single player fallout games. The lack of NPC's make the world feel empty and the quest two dimensional. I really enjoy exploring the wasteland with other people I just wish it had the level of storytelling I expect for Bethesda games.

This is the most depressing expectation ever. I looked forward to the release of this game with giddiness. Only to get it and come to the realization that the game does not have a single player campaign. Not only that, but the game is really glitchy and needs a lot of patches.

I watched about 20 reviews after purchasing this game hoping to hear one person say something positive with no luck. So I turned to twitch and watched a streamer play as I went about my day. The game honestly looks like fun if you have friends, but I'm a troll and the PvP in this game was an afterthought. Part of me wants to keep it, but I think I'd rather have my $40.

I could write an essay about all the negatives that plague this game and it would be more effort than they put into their game. The game can be summarized with a simple example. I spent hours attempting this obstacle course on the map hoping to find something cool at the end for all my effort. In the end there's nothing but a couple crafting materials you could get in 2 minutes, and a pathetic note. They expect you to grind and reward you with the feeling of regret and depression. Dont support this, and tell corporate that this will not be acceptable.

I played this game during their Beta & not much has changed. While the graphics are impressive, there are still glitches & the biggest glaring flaw for the Fallout franchise: Tou can only play ONLINE. Although it is not essential to play with others, the game does urge you to do so with areas which seem overpowered. And while new patches are being introduced to fix problems, there is still a Wait & See option to see if the game will live up to the Fallout name.

I told the Best Buy person that i do not like to play in line. I live fall out She recommended fallout 76. I buy it get it home and upload. Well 3 hrs with Xbox customer service we realize that its in line and i have to buy x box live to play it. Totally bait and switch. Dont buy this

I have enjoyed several previous Bethesda games on the xbox (Fallout New Vegas, Fallout 4, Skyrim) when I heard about Fallout 76 and moving into an online game I was excited. However I quickly realized as I played the game that it was pretty boring as a Single Player and the lack of NPCs almost make it feel lonely. You want to like this game because its Fallout, but Im left feeling violated.

COULD NOT GIVE 0 STARS BUT THIS IS 0 STARS. PLAYED FOR AN HOUR AND HAVE NOT PUT THE DISC BACK IN MY XBOX X. I will admit, I was one of the ones who got uneasy by the idea of an online-only Fallout. Originally I had no plans to buy it, but by the time BETA came around, I saw enough to make me want to give it a chance. The Good: You can play it solo. No, there is no solo mode, but if you want to go it alone you can. I'm not much of a multiplayer person, so I spend the majority of my time completing my quests alone. If I come across someone needing help I may lend a hand, finish off a few enemies to lighten their load or help them defend their workshop. Once that's done, I wave goodbye and go back to my own tasks. Occasionally I team up with my son and we play together, but even then we can each go our own ways at any time. The Bad: It is still very early times, and as mentioned by Bethesda themselves there are bugs. They have put one patch out already since launch and more to come. It does feel a bit odd without human NPCs, but it's getting a bit easier to handle. There is also the issue with small stash limits which they have said will be raised. Sometimes weapon wear and food/water needs can get annoying. Would I recommend it for solo players? Yes. Would I recommend for multiplayer? Yes. Is it for everyone? No. Check out gameplay videos online if you are still on the fence. The lore and storyline are still present, so don't worry about that. It's not the typical Fallout, but it is still Fallout.
Worst game I've played this year. Was bored after 2 hours of gameplay. It's a buggy mess. Dont buy.

This is still a wonderful work by Bethesda, but you must enjoy with a different mindset. It doesn't feel like a typical Bethesda title because it is online. The interactions with other players is a change, but great. And it is awesome being able to join up and explore the wastelands with friends! But bear in mind that, with everyone else being actual players, I feel like the typical driving story isn't as effective in this version. The use of recorded logs to initiate quests doesn't make me feel as invested in any semblance of a storyline, which is greatly missed from this title. It is still a stellar game, you just need to approach with the mindset that it is not your typical Fallout title. Also, in-game bugs are pretty common, but with Bethesda's continued work on the title, there should really be only minimal interference when playing, if any.

This game has gotten so much flak in the last few weeks, and this is pretty much not a game that is similar to the Fallouts before it. This game has little story, little interaction with the world, and feels more or less like a deserted Fallout 4. But the game isnt all about the world. The game is about what you make of it with your friends and strangers. The story comes from the path and progression you and your friends make as you explore the Appalachia. Fighting through hives of enemies to launch a nuke, and fighting the endgame boss with the other ~20 people on the server was the best experience Ive had in any Bethesda game. The community in this game is so much better than others, it is almost the exact opposite experience of GTA V online. There are technical issues, and performance across all platforms is not just right yet. But Bethesda is being very transparent and working with the community to better the game and make the experience more stable and bug free. I definitely recommend this game to anyone that wants to give it a try but has been dissuaded by the many negative reviews. Just understand that this is not a regular Fallout game, this is different.

1st, this game is not Fallout 4. Too many get this game expecting a flawless multiplayer rehash of 4, but it's an MMO and a totally different experience. There are limits to base size and how much loot you can hold because servers can only handle so many players and all their loot. Still, once you learn to manage yourself it's not such a big deal. Also, the SPECIAL and Perks system is COMPLETELY DIFFERENT from any other Fallout to date. SPECIAL points affect how many perk cards you can equip not which ones will become available. It was made so you can respec your character on the fly while trying to maintain a balance at the same time. 2nd lots of bugs, but even MMOs like WOW and KOTR still have lag, latency and other issues periodically. It's an expected risk of any MMO and a Bethesda MMO at that. Haven't had any game breakers, just some minor annoyances like getting dropped from the server, lag, and having to revisit my base stash to refresh my materials for world use. It's only two weeks old and still not clean, but it's slowly getting there. Overall, not the greatest game, but far from a bad one too. Lots to explore and it really shines when you group with friends. I'd definitely recommend it, but check the youtube playthroughs and vids too make sure it's a game for you.

Collection of Mana is a physical cart containing the first three games in the Seiken Densetsu (Mana) series: Final Fantasy Adventure (Seiken Densetsu 1) - Originally released on the Gameboy and was an action RPG spinoff of the Final Fantasy series. So it has chocobos and even some sprite work from the old NES FF games. Was remade on the PlayStation Vita as Adventures of Mana. Secret of Mana (Seiken Densetsu 2) - Originally released on the Super Nintendo. Action RPG featuring a full three character party. Combat is a little clunky, but still holds up decently well. Was remade on the PlayStation 4 recently. Trials of Mana (Seiken Densetsu 3) - Originally released on the Super Famicom (Super Nintendo) in Japan and nowhere else. Still an action RPG featuring a three character party that you create from a pool of six characters and depending on who you pick will alter the story. Currently being remade on PS4 and Switch (though the remake loses the multiplayer functionality). This collection marks the first time Trials of Mana/Seiken Densetsu 3 has ever been officially released in the West, which if you're a longtime fan of the series, is a huge deal since it's one of the best ones. The price is a little high for what could be regarded as 3 very old games, but when you consider how much work had to go into localizing the third game into English, it's much easier to justify. I grew up playing this series and to be able re-experience it on the Switch is such a treat. A couple of the games even have multiplayer (Secret supports 3 players, while Trials supports 2). If you like old school action RPG's, you're in for a treat.

It has been fun to play these games again (or for the first time!). I have enjoyed what I have played but wish that the GB port had had more 'Super Gameboy' options. Better options for color changing and so on. Otherwise, plays great!
Im more of a fan of modern day RPGs. However, it is fun to play and own these retro games from time to time. Great thing is that games 2 and 3 are local co-op enabled. This was the big win for me.
Im happy with this purchase. Im a huge fan of the mana series. Whoever enjoy the mana series would love to own this collections

Even if you've never played the mana games, or even if you don't care for jrpgs, but are a video game collector or interested in gaming history, this is a great buy.
