The music, the characters, the story, the gameplay, it is all here. Being the fifth game in the series, not including DmC which was a reboot, this brings back Nero, Dante, and a new character named V who are all playable. Each one comes with their own unique style and motivates the player to get better while increasing their rank mid-battle. The story is rather short which took me about 12 hours, but you will not unlock everything on your first playthrough. There is microtransanctions to give you a boost, but you do not need to as I have almost unlocked everything after two playthroughs. Other than the story, bloody palace is another mode where you go through 100 floors of enemies and bosses and really tests your skills.

I dunno, maybe it's me going from God of War and Spiderman to this but the game just didn't seem fun, combat seemed sloppy, end bosses we're way harder than previous bosses. Music was amazing, and graphics are awesome.
Finally. Been waiting so long for this. Picks up after Devil May Cry 4.

Easily the best Devil May Cry since 2. I feel like after two, they went downhill and just coasted off of the success of the first two, which were Incredible. The DMC reboot was good, but not up to my standard for a DMC. Devil May Cry 5 is much closer to the originals than I expected, and I have been very pleasantly surprised at everything it has to offer. Dante plays fantastic, and the other playable characters are fun as well. I especially like V, and his very unique combat style. It's also just Gorgeous in 4K!!!! Absolutely pick this up if you are, or have been, a fan of Devil May Cry. It's feels like the real deal this time. I also recommend the Deluxe Edition content that you can purchase from the PSN Store, especially if you enjoy the music from the originals. It allows you to set songs from those as the battle music for each separate character, which is extremely satisfying!

I heard this game described in an online review as being like Lego Worlds, and I would have to agree. Rather than following a similar formula as used with other Lego games, this game has worlds you explore, collect bricks from breaking stuff, and build other stuff to progress. You collect artifacts while playing to help you complete some tasks. I guess that's about it. There are no mission levels like there are in other Lego games (or, if there are, I have not found them yet). Thus far I have played for several hours and have to say that I hate it. If I wanted to play Lego Worlds, I would have played Lego Worlds. Remembering which Lego thing to build in which area because I want to power something or jump higher is annoying and tedious. On more than one occasion, I would up building things accidentally because the selection menu is not very intuitive. In short, If you like to wander around aimlessly over quasi-vast worlds breaking everything you can find because you need special bricks to build obscure things that really do nothing to move the plot forward, then you may enjoy this game. If you like previous Lego games and think this will be more of the same, you would be mistaken.

LEGO Worlds with the Movie textures. My son and I really loved the game for the first movie so we were excited for this, but its not the usual LEGO formula. Its basically the LEGO Worlds game wich is alright but gets really repetitive. Its very polished and runs well compared to Worlds, but not as much fun as the usual LEGO game format.

Since the plot of this movie is the 'battle' between Lego and Duplo, then I have no problem calling this the Duplo of Lego games. If is pared down, stripped of all the enhancements that have made recent Lego games a challenge, and essentially one for the kids. The lower price point on launch day should tip you off to even the company's feelings on it's quality, and it shows. Seriously, if you are a fan of the Lego games, maybe don't skip it, but definitely wait for a price point of $15 or under.

So I love all of the Lego games. This one has a slightly more difficult play. It adds more to your required actions. Still great for kids. But makes you think more. Not a very large world to explore but fun interactions.

I did not know what to expect out of this game, but when I first played it, I was blown a way. If you like Minecraft or just Lego in general, I highly recommend this game. It is also an affordable game.

A great game. I played along side my son while we searched the game for new ways to build new Lego worlds. Here's the thing though, this game would be so much more fun if it had multiplayer. I understand the difficulties involved but, gaming is just better with your friends. My son was pretty bummed out because only 1 friend had the game to even play with him at all. Without that multiplayer element, he essentially was just playing by himself. In the end, it's a game he comes back to often but just doesn't play a lot. Hopefully this will change as it truly is a great game!

Some of the missions can be repetitive, but the kids like the game. There are multiple bugs with the game such as freezing and locking up. Those issues could be overlooked, but the biggest issue so far is with the saved data. After completing the game to the point where they could create their own worlds, two worlds were created and then the game froze and had to be restarted. When restarting, an error message was given stating that saved data could not be created. At this point the game restarted at the first world and the ship to visit other worlds could not be accessed. So far i cannot find any solution online other than restarting the game from the beginning (losing all progress). From what i read online, the company is working on a solution, but I would not recommend the game until the issues are fixed.
This a a game in which kids have to create their Lego Worlds and discover hidden treasures and such...Recommended!
This is a great lego game with endless possibilities for play. It also comes at a great price.
If you like Lego games, and creating things, you would love this game! I highly recommend this game to literally all ages!

This is Amazing and in my opinion the Best game I ever played.. Well it's more then just a game. You can create so much like movies, music, art and yes, you can create your own games. There is also tons of games and other stuff from other creators. The possibilities are limitless.

Dreams is less a 'game' and more a platform for creativity. It is Media Molecule taking the spirit of Little Big Planet to the next level, but not in a small leap but in bounds. If LBP gave people a galaxy of possibilities for design and creativity, Dreams gives them the universe. There's already a nearly bottomless selection of experiences to play through, some brilliant and many forgettable, but the pure joy comes from taking part in what others have created. There's a charm in that which not everyone will appreciate. Also, if you are not planning on ever delving into the creative tools yourself, you will not get to enjoy Dreams to its fullest potential and it may feel like half an experience for you. However, I do feel like a lot of people who go in not intending to be creative will be inspired by what they play from others and will decide to take the plunge themselves. This obviously would not appeal to all, and therefore that is why I feel this game is truly a masterpiece and a revolution of sorts in terms of the power put in gamers' hands. I also like the price being $40. Nevertheless, I highly recommend it for what potential it has. You never know when that spark of creativity might arrive, and Dreams will give you the tools to do something meaningful with it.

Dreams is really a hard game to review, because your enjoyment will largely depend on what you want to do with it. If youre looking just to play games, youll likely be initially impressed with the variety of genres that are available. However, like all user generated content games, the quality of these games will vary greatly, so youll probably have to play through some garbage to get to the good stuff. The included story made by the developers is great, but only lasts 2-3 hours. As a creation tool though, Dreams offers you the most comprehensive suite of creation tools ever created in a regular video game. You can sculpt, paint art, make music, animations, and of course games. However, it will take a good deal of time to both learn how to make things, and then actually make them. So overall, I would recommend Dreams to you right now in early 2020 if you enjoy creating digital art, or you enjoy playing/testing other peoples creations. If that doesnt sound interesting to you, I would wait a while to see where the community takes the game in the coming months and years. *PS PLUS is not currently required to share/play peoples creations online. However, online multiplayer is not a thing yet, so that may become a requirement if it gets added.

When it comes to success, Dreams should be the next Minecraft. Like that game, its biggest strength is endless creativity. But unlike that game, you don't need to be a creative thinker to get the most out of the game. Instead you can play thousands of experiences that are created by others, all from a wide variety of genres. The negative reviews complained about the complexity of creating something (which should be expected when it includes essentially an entire video game development software suite and you can literally create ANYTHING), but neglected to admit they may have been better suited to just enjoy the experiences created by other people. Like any artform, the skills necessary to create interactive experiences requires dedication, it is an endeavor that takes far more time to get good at than people might expect. If you find out you don't have the patience, no worries, you have an infinite amount of content to experience as a player. One of the best things about Dreams is what's called Dream Surfing. You pick tags of the kind of things you are interested in seeing, click a button, and are instantly transported to an experience. If you don't particularly care for what you are seeing from one experience, just pause and click the next button. Each experience loads in about 1-2 seconds, so you can quickly experience a wide variety of creations. Like many fans of the company who made LittleBigPlanet and Tearaway, I bought the game digitally through early access. I hate to see that the game is missing out on hundreds of five star reviews because of this, which may eventually impact its sales for the physical version. Media Molecule had worked on this game for 6 years and incredibly generous with the $40 original price. This game is worth so much more than that, you won't regret buying something that has infinite content.

This is a great game lots of fun you can also make your own game's in this but you will have to dedicate a lot of time and effort to make it worth your while and not have crap game's out there. They should think about adding this to the PS5 when it launches it could really enhance the experience on the new console just include it with the system and it would probably be even better on the next Gen console. But I think it's worth the purchase now anyways who knows if you buy a PS5 they may even give you the free update to the game for free when the new system comes out anyway we can only hope.

I thought at first that the creations that would be possible in this game would be very limited. I was proven very wrong when upon playing the game I was able to play all sorts of genres and they are full-fledged games. Of course some dreams in the game may feel kind of like free flash games off the internet. There is a large enough group of people creating some quality content.

This game is amazing and I haven't even really gotten into it yet. It's a library of games (user created) and an intuitive game creation toolbox all in one. My 13 year old was already creating game elements a few hours after she opened it. The tutorials break it down to where game design novices (like us) can still go in and make something really cool. The game library is also really fun. Content is uploaded daily by users who have created their own games. So many things to choose from.

From the creators of Little Big Planet comes Dreams. Its the same concept in execution like the former; a creation tool to build anything that comes to mind. From art, music, to games; the tools are provided to let your imagination come to life. Of course it spawns recreations of existing games done in this new engine but its the original creations that amaze.

The guys that made Little Big Planet made this game. This is basically a good teaching skill for how game design works. They give you a tool set that lets you create your own games and its surprisingly robust. You can also try out games other people have made in addition to the several games that come with this tool set that were made in engine to show you examples of what you can make. This is a great game on its own but its an even better tool for learning the basics of game design. In the style of the older classics like RPG maker, and Fighter Maker. Intro is a bit long and you have to play it before it lets you into the game proper like the LBP games. Tip, do use the tutorials to learn how to set up you games, they are very well done.

Dreams is a fantastic, innovative game where you can basically create whatever you want or play what everyone else is making. It's from the creators of LittleBigPlanet so you know it's a quality game. People are already making games in it based on real games and they look a lot like them. Things like Fallout 4, Dead Space, Sonic, Ghost of Tsushima, Crash Bandicoot and so on and that's not even mentioning all of the great original content they are making. Load times on non existent too. You just jump into one level and if you don't iike it you find something else to play and immediately start playing it .
Very cool and unique piece of software but just know what your getting before you buy, but imo is does deliver.

Okay I doubt I'll ever create anything amazing using dreams but that's okay because thousands of others have created a vast library of games that are incredible and you get to play them all just by getting yourself a copy of dreams!

MM (Media Molecules) the creators of Little Big Planet have done something I honestly didn't think they could do. Make a game as good or better then their Little Big Planet. Its a beautiful game with an amazing concept. Highly recommend

Excellent game! Create just about anything! Amazing what some people has created and shared. This is a huge leap compared to Little Big Planet! Easily one of the top games this generation going into the next generation.

My husband has been playing WWE 2K 19 since Oct 5. At first he loved the prelude to my career and enjoyed the whole story. His frustration is you can't continue your character in my career (my player). After you go through the whole story you then do what would be considered 'side quests'. He loves Universe Mode and says it's improved since WWE 2K18. Still wishes he could upload his own music. Thankfully for us Metal fans there's a good Metallica song included 'Spit Out The Bone' and of course Motorhead 'The Game'.
Bought both ps4 and xbox version of the game. Will see which one I like better
Good game and I recommend this game for everyone !

Being that Ive only played WWE 2k16 for the past two years, this game is a HUGE improvement. The MyCareer story mode is great, and there are plenty of options for a character. The deluxe edition is a must, as you get everything right off the bat without having to grind for it. Overall, this game has kept me entertained for days and it still hasnt lost its touch.
Love the graphics love everything love the big roster
graphics are realistic....ENJOYED PLAYING RHONDA R. CHAMPION .I LIKE NEW DAY.....EVEN IF THEY DONT WIN THEIR MATCHES OFTEN ENOUGH.
My son really enjoys the wwe games on line and the career mode
This is a Great game for everyone, WWE, should be happy with this game and how it came out for fans. Fans should go out and buy this game.
I always pick up this yearly installment! Best graphics to date and largest roster EVER!
We love the new features that was put in such as big head mode. Makes playing fun.
New finishers- upgraded graphics - ROWDY RONDA! great game!

What can I say its another Wwe game more payable characters but the only thing that bothers me is that universe mode hasnt been touch on that much so It seems the same they added new modes and brought back showcase mode which was cool cause you get to play as Daniel Bryan
It was an early birthday gift for him. He loves the graphics , he said it is better than last years. But every year they make it better. He loves all the wrestlers that are in it.

This game might be the best looking game currently on Xbox One. The lighting/art style/animation are just phenomenal. On top of that is an excellent RPG Platformer. Upon release it had some performance issues, but has been patched as of last week to alleviate some of that.

I was really surprised to hear that a sequel to Ori and the Blind Forest had been announced, but I also had no complaints. I've always been a huge fan of the metroidvania style of games as I love exploring large maps, uncovering secrets, and gradually powering up my character. The series has always been filled with emotion and heart and is beautiful to behold, and Ori and the Will of the Wisps is no exception. I was happy to pluck my money down for a physical copy even though MS was awesome enough to include it in Xbox game pass and I don't regret it. This game has a the charm, visuals, and difficulty of the original but it's all been expanded upon in remarkable ways. If you own an Xbox or a gaming pc, you owe it to yourself to give both games in the series a try.
game is missing some DLC skins. when you contact limited run and developers they don't assist you. you'll be taking a loss buying the physical copy for switch. just download from the shop instead.

As the developers have mentioned this game has nothing to do with the mobile version. This is a tag-team fighting game at its core and was developed with the help of known fighting game pros Clockwork and Justin Wong for example. Its similar to Marvel vs Capcom and Dragon Ball FighterZ in terms of gameplay. It does support Crossplay between Switch, PC, and Xbox (very few fighting games do this). This is BIG as I rarely have difficulty finding matches online due to the larger player pool versus the PS4 version. Gameplay controls are great for newcomers and pros. I like the approach taken with the control scheme. Non-fighting game players can get in on the fun and more experience players can make use of the more advanced combos/techniques. It does support player invite. So you can play against your friends online. Has a story mode and arcade mode as well as a basic tutorial. My only gripe for the physical is that it is true that the Kimberly Skin and Drakkon V2 Skin are not on the disc as stated (contacted Nway and they are supposedly going to send those codes out) All DLC is either for characters or skins. So there is no pay to win. This comes with Season One only. Wished it had Season Two on the cart. But I knew how many characters were available going in. Overall, I do enjoy this game as a power ranger and fighting game fan. It has become my top played fighting game at the moment. With crossplay and player invite being the two biggest wins.

I see a lot of negative reviews but the game is fun for what it is, a watered down marvel vs capcom clone. Its price at $20 online but here you get a physical copy with the season pass already on the cartridge

This game is a fun love-letter to Power Rangers that reminds me of Marvel vs Capcom with it's 3v3 fights. However, this version is missing the advertised character skins for Kimberly Hart (the Pink Ranger) and Evo 2 Lord Drakkon. This is of particular note, since these skins cannot be downloaded individually thus requiring you to purchase and download the entire Collector's Edition digital bundle of the game to unlock them. These skins ARE present on the physical PS4 version (though that version is also missing content in the form of an entire character, The Gold Zeo Ranger, who at least is present on Switch).
Honestly this game for this price is ridiculous, very low the graphics is not exceptional for $59 its ashamed
Excellent game. Glad to add this to my collection.
Please for the love of Zordon do not spend 60$ on this game.
The game had a good set up and quality. The game was a just a bit more difficult than we expected for our 4 year old, but that's on us.

I was very excited for this game since they were taking a fun p2w mobile game and making it a console game. I hoped they'd remove the p2w aspects but they didn't. It's still bloated with DLC and additional payments. This box is supposed to include a lot of that but it won't matter. Even with the best characters the game is EXTREMELY UNFUN to play. The controls are rigid, characters are very limited and boring, the pick 3 and a megazord thing doesn't work out to improve gameplay at all. It's a really bad boring game of rock paper scissors. It's not even that it's overly simplistic it's poorly designed and implemented. I'm a huge lifelong Power Rangers fan. Skip this game.
Was a great game on ps3 now I can play it on my ps4
I have been waiting for this a long time. Great details and enhanced graphics all around. Relive the birth of America and have fun doing it!
The remaster to the ps3 version of the game is great. This was one of the last good assassins creed games. Ubi soft should have stuck with this format.

You will notice when treading through the snowy hills layers of textures disappearing. Sometimes while mounted on a horse you can literally become stuck in between two objects trying to jump over them. Looks good in 4K for a previous generation title. Gameplay is a bit dated for an Assassins Creed game, but all in all a good game.
This remastered version of this game is really good looking.
Assassins creed has always been my all time favorite
Dope game, my favorite assassins creed, its old school but love the American revolution. Dope!!!
Its exactly how I remember the game six years ago. I love the storyline and graphics are extraordinary. The timeline is awesome and the characters are epic. Overall, a perfect game of this series.
Great upgrade on the classic AC3 game! A must for any AC fan!

A lot of people disliked ACIII when it released in 2012, but I always thought it was underrated. This the same game with prettier visuals and some gameplay tweaks, so if you liked it then, you'll like it now. If not, the remaster likely won't change your opinion.
We preordered this for our oldest son for his birthday. He loves it and it arrived on his birthday, earlier than expected. Thank you Best Buy!

This includes Assassin Creed III, Liberation and basically all of the DLC that originally came out for the games. I got these games as a bonus included with AC Origins Deluxe. Having only started playing AC with the Ezio collection, I missed a lot of the earlier AC games including these two, so I was happy to get these as a bonus included with Origins Deluxe. I have played most of the AC games in the last few years though and if there is one thing that is a bit of a negative with playing the older games, is how much smoother the newer AC games play as compared to these. These are remasters with better graphics but since I have never played the games when they originally came out, I cant compare the graphics before to the remaster. The graphics are decent but they dont quite match the latest AC games. There are also numerous graphic glitches and things of that nature that older games are known for. In a lot of ways, these two games remind me of the Ezio collection that got me hooked onto the AC games. With that being said, like the Ezio collection, the gameplay controls and environment interaction and movement feel awkward to me as compared to the much smoother Origins, Odyssey, etc. Fighting/stealth is definitely not as smooth, but I try to keep in mind that this game is much older than what I have been used to playing in recent months, so I am willing to be a little more forgiving in that respect. The tutorial seems to be a bit of an afterthought for these two games, but at least there is a basic explanation of the game. The menus are a bit cumbersome, but not enough to be too annoying to utilize. Maybe these games are not as big as the most recent AC games, there is still lots to see and do, especially since both games include all of its content. It is interesting to explore the varies areas around the cities. There is a variety of different quests to do throughout and has the familiarity of what I am used to doing in AC games. Of course, there is some of the boring collectable stuff and some meaningless side quests that can make it a bit of a choir to complete. I am not a bit multi-player fan, so that is not much of a factor for me. One small frustration is the occasional crash of the game on my PS4. I would expect a bit of a smoother port of these remasters without major hiccups. Although I am not quite familiar with the original, I am glad they have made some game improvements (based on what I have read) that would have probably been extremely frustrating. Being a remaster, those that have played the original and liked it will most likely enjoy this one, but the game is still with some frustrations that should have been fixed with the update. Overall, I like this and I am satisfied to get a chance to play these when I didnt originally. They do show their age in gameplay and other issues though. 3.5 stars

I remember picking this up for PS3 to me its till this day best assassins creed game! The story hits to home! Lone wolf on his own in a cruel world! Glad Best Buy had in shelves with the lowest price! Awesome!

The good news is there are two games on here. I got it for liberation, it was a vita game then a ps3 game, and is really under rated in the series. I really like liberation. I HATED AC3. Thats on the disk too. So Im going to recommend this for liberation, if you didnt like liberation, then I wouldnt recommend
Always enjoyed this series back on Genesis, for fans I definitely recommend playing this new one, its a solid comeback of something I didnt realize I wanted more of. Very recommended

I have played all the ToeJam And Earl games since the Sega Genesis Days it has updated graphics and similar game play you get from this game like it was back in the day but even better if you pick this one up it's like the 80s all over again but better you will not be disappointed.

I love the old Sega games, I was glad to get this, but I won't be getting stuff like this without the Gamers Club %20 off. It's too bad, I would totally buy more from Best Buy if they simply treated people like they used to...Sorry to see the business model change so dramatically.
This game probably isnt for everyone. But if youre feeling nostalgia then get this game. Its like the first game released.

This game is a high quality remake / update of the original so if the original was your favorite then by all means purchase this game and play to your hearts content! If youve never played it before its definitiely a game to check out, its gonna be fun for some couch co-op

ToeJam and Earl was a great, unique game for the Genesis, and it's captured quite perfectly in this (way overdue) sequel/follow-up. The physical release has some really neat extras, like a manual, which really makes it a worthwhile purchase as opposed to the digital download. Highly recommended.

Having played all of them, the first ToeJam & Earl on the Sega Genesis is my most lasting memory of the series. This looks and feels like a true sequel to the first. I'm having a great time jamming with the guys again.

I used to play Toejam and Earl on the Sega Genesis, and playing this on my Switch brings back lots of fun memories. This iteration is definitely more challenging. They've added some new creatures(humans?) and your characters can now gain stronger skills. If you liked the original, pop this one in!
Really fun game! Highly recommended to those who played the original games on Sega Genesis! Awesome soundtrack and a lot of fun! Very nostalgic and a great take on an awesome franchise!

Fans of this series will easily get their longing fill of the gameplay they know and love with this entry now in the form of a physical Switch copy which I absolutely see necessary to snag myself whenever I can. While it doesnt include any neat little bonuses for being physical, I can definitely say it has one of if not the largest game manual Ive ever seen!
We had the opportunity to play this game at PAX East in Boston this past spring. It is an updated game of the 90s version to play but a little easier. It's so much fun to play.
I bought this game out of nostalgia. I couldn't wait to try it. But my kids have been hogging it up since I got it. They seem to love it almost as much as I did when I played it years ago.
Well worth the wait and glad it finally came out. I was skeptical at first but enjoy it now that I started playing
Playing this and remembering the Genesis classic brings back good fun and nostalgia. Its a great game that can be enjoyed with a friend or alone.
If you liked the old toe jam and earl on the Sega genesis then this is right up your alley. Highly recommend

This is a limited physical copy print of ToeJam & Earl: Back in the Groove! for the Nintendo Switch. Published by LimitedRunGames, this is a BestBuy exclusive with variant cover art. Good game for anyone, but will be enjoyed more by people who have played the original ToeJam & Earl games, bringing back a sense of nostalgia.

Controls, graphics, gameplay - this game does not hold up. Nostalgia aside this is one of the worst games Ive played in a very long time. Huge waste of money. Not to mention limited run not being limited and selling at Best Buy to begin with.
Fun game that doesn't take itself to seriously, you shouldnt take it too seriously either and just enjoy the humor.
My Best Buy Has the best products EVER!!! Service is second to none!
Returned this game after an online purchase, this is not for kids

It's plays way differently than Valkyria Chronicles but it's still a solid game. It doesn't take after it either so newcomers can pick up on this one too. The First run copies come in a nice box, with OST and a pin included for free which is also nice

I respectfully disagree with the lower rated review because you can't say Valkyria Revolution isn't like Valkyria Chronicles gameplay without taking into account that Chronicles is a lot older and games evolve in some cases. Nonetheless, I would say Valkyria Chronicles is the Final Fantasy 6 or 7 of the series where Revolution is the Final Fantasy 15 of the bunch. It's really good but it's not Final Fantasy 6 or 7 and no one should go into it expecting it to be since JRPGs were much difference during the time. It's worth buying at this price because it's already pretty cheap. Sega needs people to show love to their quality games like this and Yakuza if we ever want more games to come to the states like this one. Not buying this game and future releases that are similar means Sega is less likely to take a risk in bringing stuff like this over to the U.S. Sonic Mania and Forces can probably survive a price drop if they're not good because they will most likely still sell okay and get new entries of some sort. Pick this game up, it's fun. No it's not Persona 5 or Final Fantasy but if you're done with those this should be next in line. P.S. first prints come with some cute little extras so if you wait that might not be available in later prints (soundtrack and pins).
The game might have gotten flak but it is a spinoff. I bought this game on clearance and it's a good pick up. I dont regret my purchase. I would get it since it's on sale.
I wanted to like this game but the cutscenes are beyond overboard. Also the gameplay is very different from past games. It is almost like Dynasty Warriors.
Not worth it even if you see it for only $10! Disappointing from the very beginning! Just get VC1 or VC4 instead!
I loved the original valkyria chronicles, so I bought this one in hopes it would be as good or possibly better. This was a major step down from valkyria chronicles.

Pretty good battle system once you get to it. Be prepared to maybe battle 2 or 3 times though in the first hour as cut scenes and excessive text occupies 95% of the first hour. A shame they used the GREAT Valkyria name though. It seems Sega lets sales numbers dictate whether they make sequals.

You spend a majority of the time watching cutscenes only to be rewarded with a few minutes of gameplay that is not anything special. Graphics are pretty good for jrpg standards but the game itself is unplayeable.
The worst sequel they could possibly make, the only redeeming quality is the games '''''assests'''''

I was really excited for this collector's set. It looked great. The pin is cool. But that's about it. The game itself is nearly impossible to play. There are so many loading screens. In the first hour of the game, there is 5 minutes of actual game play. The rest is loading screens and so much talking. There are a lot of cut scenes and I'm not against that but it has to load every time one start. The worst part is the loading screens aren't quick. Running it on my PS4 Pro, the loading screens are just as long as the scenes themselves. The graphics are another disappointment. The moving painting style ruins a lot for me because it's in every scene. It's like a bad filter over an anime. Besides all of the technical mediocrities, the story itself is slow and lackluster. The combat is fast and is often over before you know it. I'm not sure if a diehard fan could get passed all of these hangups.

While I really enjoy this game's characters, the story, the soundtrack, and the boss battles, there's a lot of annoyances here. If any of the following turn you off, you may not enjoy this game: 1. There are TONS of cutscenes, more than actual gameplay, and the cutscenes are split up by a TON of loading screens. I haven't seen this many loading screens in a game since Sonic the Hedgehog 2006. Luckily, this game's a lot better than that one. 2. Gameplay takes a backseat to the story. Personally, I'm a fan of many of the characters, so the story is interesting to me. I'm normally not one for anime, however I am enjoying this. That said, it's too bad that they're so frequent since I'd like to be able to enjoy more of the gameplay if there was more of it. 3. Graphically, I think the game looks pretty nice, however it's still pretty dated with stilted & robotic animations that would be more at home in a PS2 game. This doesn't bother me much since many Japanese games are behind western games in this regard. There's a lot to like here, however there's a lot to dislike too, so just be aware of that before buying.
It's okay. There are some small mechanics that might annoy people but the overall gameplay is solid.

This game has the Valkyria name but really shouldn't be called that. Battle system is completely changed and made very simple. Graphics are ok but I can see why they only charged 39.99 for this instead of the normal price of a game. It's fun but I'd wait until it's on sale.

Valkyria Chronicles was so good, and the sequels were mistreated. Now instead of updated releases of 2 & 3 we get this spin off that shares none of the original games. Just the art style and half the name. Save your money.

This collector's edition was fairly sparse, even for the modest premium over the base edition. The game isn't anything like the original Valkyria games, but the soundtrack (included in this edition) is outstanding.

Get this Game-Of-The-Year Edition on the Xbox 360 for the best version of this game. Everthing is included, all 5 expansions as well as the original quest. Super long game that is very hard to put down once you start. Take a two week vacation before starting to play... LOL!!! A+++ Get it!!!!

Be prepared to spend a lot of time on this one. Very well designed game, awesome graphics, awesome concept. It'll have you going for a very long time with all the different missions, each one of which is very creative and extremely well done. It does have a bit of profanity, and some of the graphics in the death scenes may be much for younger ones, but overall it is by far the best game I've ever played

First of all, Bethesda made from Morrowind(2003) and Oblivion(2006) the games of the year. As well as in Fallout 3(2008) let me tell you why, the graphics, are but great, the length of the world is a bit smaller than in Oblivion, but the graphics explain it, the creatures and weapons are too creative, and the game never ends(sadly you must purchase broken still to continue after the ending.) Get your copy today and turn on your VATS Visor, its ghoul-headhots time!
Fallout 3 has endless game time and a different path to play every time and with every add on in the game of the year edition you get hours of new game play

I love the way it challenges me, and the controls are easy! The graphics are amazing and it never ends (which can be very time-consuming)! I love that it has all of the add-ons for such a low price! Hope all who play this love it.
Fallout 3 by itself was an excellent game, but the expansions add hours of additional play, provide new challenges, and fantastic rewards. Definitely worth the price of admission.
everyone should own this game. easily one of the best 360 games. the pc version is wonky - so i went for this version.
A little slow at the start, but it picks up really well within a few hours that you'll end up wondering where 30 hours of your life just went.
Easy to play without using cheats or hints. I liked the add ons to the game.
Good story gets you engaged early. Anytime you get bored with a plot line you can quickly find another.
Great game played it twice, great storyline with interesting characters.
Best game ever, the wife loves it...great for everyone

A fantastic game with a rich combat system and an in-depth storyline. The GotY edition comes with all of the DLC. Be prepared for an incredibly long game, though, especially if you are like me and like to explore all of the nooks and crannies.
If you want to get lost in a war torn world then this is the game to get. This goty comes loaded with ALL the dlc. Heads up though, this is a digital code dlc and not on the base game.
Got this at black-friday price of 30 bucks. I feel it is worth it for the base game and all dlc but not at full price. Would've been nice if the dlc was on disc like previous GOTY games.
This does not include the DLC on the disk, it only provides a code to download it. Which means you won't be able to sell it in the future (only the game itself).

At the time of this review, the Fallout 76 debacle is still unfolding. Bethesda has released a hugely bugged game that is apparently about to lead to a class action suit. That's how bad it is. Contrast that to Fallout 4, arguably the finest release in the franchise to date. The game is wholly bug-free and a joy to play. Plus, it has literally thousands of mods available, something that won't be true of Fallout 76 until November of 2019, apparently. Why would you pay more for less? Pick Fallout 4 instead!

I recently upgraded to the Xbox One X and wanted to see how 'X enhanced' Fallout 4 was on the new system. I was not disappointed. Much better draw distance and textures than I remember when I originally played this game on the PS4. Great game with a nice upgrade in graphics at a great price. What else you need?

Most gamers are familiar with the Fallout series and Fallout 4 is a great game with plenty to do and see, especially with the GOTY edition which includes all of the available DLC. The standard edition also provides a lot of things to do, places to go, people to see, mutants to eliminate. The GOTY version will be on sale for the 2017 Black Friday sale so that would be a good time to pick up the complete version which should keep you busy for a really long time. Enjoy!
Hours of fun and I love that it includes all the extra content. If youve been curious about the Fallout game series, Id highly recommend it.

Fallout 4 is not a bad looking game, most of the time. It's got a decent story, most of the time. It's even got some interesting gameplay mechanics, again, most of the time. Nothing ever comes full circle in Bethesda's new blockbuster. After a tumultuous production, the belated 4th entry in the 'Fallout' is what happens when you take the turkey out of the oven too soon.

Friend highly recommended it because he knows my play style. I had gone through the first two hours of the game (might have had way too much fun with the character customization) but could see how much I'll enjoy it. Got it at Blackl Friday pricing so it's an extra bonus - stretched my dollar much further!

Fallout 4 is a great continuation of the Fallout series. It includes a lot more of what made Fallout 3 & New Vegas great: a massive world to explore, with enough choices to keep you coming back for more. Note that this version of the game does NOT include the official DLC on the disc, but rather as a download code. 5 stars for the game, minus 1 for the use of a one-time use download code.

Crazy enough, this game was the introduction to the fallout series. Im not finished with it yet but it totally lives up to the hype! Its a great mix of rpg and first person shooter. I love how you can be in 3rd person perspective or 1st person depending on your preference. Definitely a game worth checking out.
I would give this 5 stars but the all the dlc needs to be downloaded. Wish it was on disk
i bough for the ps4 on release date and it was fantastic, recently got a xboxone heard the mods were better on this console so i figured to give it a second go with goty edition.
This is a great Xbox game. You can get hours of gameplay.
Awesome game would recommend to anybody who loves open world games
Fallout 4 has the same great feel of the past two games with even more content! Love the moding and ability to create huge settlements.
An incredible game that is best played on the xbox 1 x. This also includes all the dlc which is great, unfortunately as a dlc code which is a let down. Great game.
This game is so big! Theres so much to do, and such a cool story. This is gonna take me a while!
Great game. Cool graphics, awesome story. Lots of things to do in game, can play for hours. So much fun.
Fallout 4 has an amazing open world and great story. Add in a the DLC released its a great deal!
All Fallout games are a must buy! Stop reading and click Add to Cart!
Love the game, and this is a great deal if you want all the extras!

I mean, it aint no skyrim... but lets be real... whut is?? This game has got that appeal though.... most gamers look at this game like wilford Brimley looks at a jar of mustache wax and a jelly donut.... he gone wake up no toes though!! Im tellin ya right now they are takin a foot one day. Hes gonna have to hop around with a nickname like willy no toes... I think we can blame fall out 4 ... 5 Star - would buy again!
Overall great game although disappointing compared to Fallout 3. Also, the DLC is provided via a download code and isnt on disc

The DLC is just a code and not on disc (which is unfortunate) but this is still a much better bargain than buying Fallout 4 and the Season Pass for it separately. You will traverse the wasteland and spend hours completing everything and exploring every nook and cranny.
I always have enjoyed the fallout series and this entry is no exception 100s hours of gameplay plus all dlc
So much fun, huge open world to explore and so much to do
It was amazing on the PlayStation 4, but seeing it in 4k with HDR on the Xbox One X is a game changer.
Been waiting for this since it launched. Now even with Xbox one X enhanced so definitely a no brainer for those who love this kind of game or a rpg and open wold game lover.
The GOTY edition includes all of the expansions which is nice. Also all versions are upgraded to 4K on Xbox One X.

Long time fan of the series absoultly love this game! Played on PS4 at launch and I can say my xbox experience is far superior in terms of lag and load times. I'm having such a blast exploring through the commonwealth my second play through!
Thank you for this game. It is a great game that gives you all the downloads and expands from the original. It allows you to play all the download content that challenges you. It adds on to the game.

Dont go outside. Theres monsters and stuff. Theres monsters in this game too. Package includes a shiny disc. The game is actually on there too. Its enhanced with MacroTransaction technology where you buy one thing and play it.
The opening scene was fun. Surviving the end of the world. Only to see some morons steal your baby! It's on like Donkey Kong!
Makes this an endless enjoyable game with so much to do
Great game at a great value u can never get tired of the fallout series
My daughter loves this game. Good plot, not overly complicated controls.
Overall a good game. Graphics could be a bit better.

Herd some good things but there nuts apparently. Graphics suck.! Rather play a ps2 game. I couldn't believe how bad the graphics were nd just the game in general. I sold it at gamestop 2 days later nd took a loss, that's how bad it was.

It takes practice to make this game enjoyable, but once you get the hang of it it's fun. Although it sometimes feels like a slug fest and confusing to someone who doesn't know all the moves and technique names in MMA. Very enertaining game
This game is great. I would recommend to all my friends.

UFC 2 can be a pretty fun game at times. Overall I feel like it is missing something, but i can't quite put my finger on it. The graphics and game play itself are great. Some of the movement and animation looks a little silly at times though.

This is by far the best UFC game yet. The gameplay is fast and tight. The graphics are fantastic. The character customization is deep. The only issue for me is that the career mode is pretty light in content and depth.

This game is not perfect when it comes to physics or career mode, but it is an adrenaline rush for sure. The controls are comprehensive and the ground game is not impossible to learn. Visuals and soundtrack are awesome. Live events keep the game fresh and interesting. If you like mixed martial arts or fighting in general, this game is for you.
UFC 2 is a lot of fun even for someone like me that doesn't know too much about UFC or really even follow it. I still enjoy this game though and it has great graphics.

Overall graphics are incredible, and the story mode is solid!
Great graphics and the controls are easy to learn. The ground game is much improved without losing too much of the moves and control.
i feel like all they did was update the roster and made the game look better. Save your money, wait for a pre owned or rent.

I have played UFC 2009, UFC 2010, EA MMA, EA UFC, and now EA UFC 2. I stand by the fact that I think they went so far away from what made UFC 2009 so great. I feel like there isn't a real way to enjoy the story mode. For crying out loud, I'm just over here trying to have a decent run to start out in the UFC and I go from facing a homeless man they brought in from outside the arena, to facing Rumble Johnson. Things escalated very quickly. I don't like that even on a low difficulty the game is still ridiculously hard to play leisurely. Graphics are pretty solid, announcers are as annoying as they always are, and I haven't touched this since a couple days after I purchased it. Maybe I'm just not hardcore enough.
Overall not that good of game no terrible but not great not even good just a average fighting game. Nothing special definitely not worth the buy
A kick butt game to kick butts and take names. Ground and pound baby.
I have put a lot of time in this game already and I love it. Don't judge it by other's reviews. I almost didn't buy it but decided to give it a chance and I don't regret it at all
This game is nothing but glorified violence. He hits her. She hits him. It's like a trashy talk show vs a video game.

I really wanted to enjoy this game, but there is far too many things wrong with it, preventing me from not returning it. Which I did today. Grappling Is a huge part of the sport and granted it is very intricate and very hard to replicate but both of EA sports attempts at creating it have failed tremendously. Undisputed 3 is still the best UFC game made to date in my mind. The best thing about this game is the graphics and presentation of fighters. That's great and all but I'm pretty sure nobody pays for the real pay per view events to watch fighters walk to the ring get rubbed down, and then introduced. I'm sure they'll try again in another few years, and I'll be there patiently waiting to see what has improved. But if they lay another egg I'll just shake my head and return it like I did with this one.
Not that impressed...Tried to play the game multiple times, cannot get the hang of it. EA game face needs some work too.
I really love UFC 2, I really love the large roster. Love the create a fighter. You can stockpileing your own fighters. It will take hours to fight every fighter on the roster.

Overall this franchise is very enjoyable and i think everyone should try it out.Its great for parties and after you watch the big fights on pay per view belive me ive played EA sports games and they are awesome.Fight night,NFL Madden,Nhl,Nba live,Fifa, and more .I've played them, all of the games have nice graphics,Physics and features, EA has done a great job with UFC 2 if you dont believe me check out EA s new trailers and go on their web page.
I enjoy it because i get beat by everyone and learn to box
This great for exercising. I played the game with my Grands and it gets a little exciting and fun.

My friend and myself enjoyed this game a lot. At the beginning either one of us get knockout shots. But after learning it makes really fun to get through each rounds. Well, sorry I can not give my opinion but based on what I have heard my son say about this game, he seems to like it very much. He did mention staying up late one evening playing even though he had to be at work early the next day. So I guess that means it is a great game! ha

I played the original 'next gen' Tomb Raider on PS3 back in 2013ish? Then re-lived it on PS4 release as well as Rise of the Tomb Raider. Quarantine and social distancing finally gave me the opportunity to game (in lieu of other interests/hobbies), and this game delivers on all the joy of the previous titles. Exploration of the world, finding tombs and solving puzzles, and sniping dudes with bow and arrows continue to provide tons of hours or satisfying entertainment at a much needed time in life.
Love tomb raider and this game is amazing and a must own with all dlc

People like to hate on this trilogy, but I have no bias since I didn't grow up with the originals (although I do own one of the Tomb Raider games that came out a while ago prior to the reboot). I honestly love all of the games in this trilogy, this one being no exception, and every time I see trailers for it, I get more and more excited!
I got this and sadly it was not sealed and the game was open so i guess i got an used game...
A must own for all tomb raider fans. Fantastic story line and plot.

After playing for a few hours I have to say I am enjoying it. Its more than just a walking simulator, some cutscenes are kinda long but I am liking this game overall.
death stranding is one of the best games on PS4. personally, i consider this game the best game of 2019. Hideo Kojima, creator the Metal Gear series, at his best.

Another great PS4 exclusive. Death Stranding is everything I've come to expect from a Hideo Kojima game. Great characters, great narrative and great gameplay. Kojima just continues to create games you just immerse yourself into!
Fun game with a really cool looking steelbook, love it!

Its definitely a different experience to go through the entire journey of this game. Its enjoyable, with a good soundtrack. But is it FUN? Not really sure about that. Beautiful looking game, but replayability is not high in my opinion. Not for everyone.

everyone knows Kojima and his crazy weirdo antics so Im sure you know what to expect. Im a big fan of his work, and I love this game but its simply isnt for everyone. its a slow burn that demands commitment. the game makes traversal its main priority. theres combat (combat is okay, I enjoy it but recognize it isnt the greatest), but its not the focus. main enemy is the environment and how you traverse and overcome it to get your packages to point a to b while keeping said packages in top quality. while it can be upsetting when you fail to deliver, its never the games fault. you can make it to point b if youre smart about it, and the game always worked well. if I messed up, it was my own doing. the game is also super pretty and the soundtrack, dude the soundtrack is amazing. this game is so gorgeous and has so many gorgeous moments. the story told is really cheesy and pretty pretentious at times but I personally found it super enjoyable and loved it. my biggest issue really is just the combat. like I said earlier, it works but its not the greatest. while its not the focus, it wouldve benefited if the combat had been worked on a lot more. its only noticeably wonky at the mandatory fights. the bosses generally fall down to relocating every now and then and just shooting. theres option for stealth but the stealth is wonky as well. the monster fights are a lot better but still fall under the wonkiness and generally are the same relocate/shoot stuff. its enjoyable, but dont expect mgs6. if you dont like slow burns, stay away and please stop spreading misinformation about it also crazy how relevant this game is to this corona virus situation we have going on kojima u psycho

I've seen so many reviews of this game going from one end to the other, and I would admit this game is not for everyone, are you into fast action, racing or don't have a lot of time, this is not the game for you. Are you more into story, immersion, and you enjoy weird, convoluted stories that would take forever to uncover, even months or years? (Remember Metal Gear 5 and the nukes discovery after more than a year after launch?). I might have a bias, but I've really enjoyed all the Kojima entries since MGS1 for the original Play Station and is not just the gameplay (which is actually pretty fun), the story and emotional involvement is as good as it can get. I'm 44+ hours in, and I'm sure this will be my next Witcher-like adventure. If you have a chance to try it first with a friend, that might work if you're deciding to get it or not. I liked it so much that I ordered the collectors edition after purchasing the special edition. I wouldn't recommend this game to a friend, just as I wouldn't recommend any of the dark souls' titles.
Game is different experince than most. Its hard to explain without giving away the plot.
The steelbook looks very nice, its not perfect though. The disc has to be bent out of the case in order to be removed, you cant pop it out unfortunately. Im sure this will cause wear in the future.

Do not believe the down play of this game. Yes, death stranding is definitely not for everyone and is a walking heavy game, but far from a walking simulator. This game is much deeper then ppl have given it credit for and it's a shame. Its visual stunning, the soundtrack is amazing,the controls are smooth and responsive and the story is indulging. I personally love it and I'm not a kojima fanboy. My advice would be to at least give it a try. Its take a little to build up, but it's worth it when it gets going for sure.

This game is very unique and interesting game that makes you dig deeper into this apocalyptic setting. You play as Sam who is a package handler trying to connect individuals to a chiral network. At first organizing the menu can be tedious but then you get the hang of it after chapter 2. The creature (BT's) encounters are nerve racking and intense. All in all very good game for it's storytelling and mechanics. Try not to compare this to metal gear solid, it's wayyyyy different and the game is worth the experience.

This game is definitely not for everyone but for those of you who love an amazing story with visually stunning graphics and great performances by the actors involved will love this art piece by Hideo Kojima.

This game is pure quality. Gorgeous graphics and amazing presentation. There is nothing like this game. The slow pace means its not for everyone but people who appreciate this type of game, a game that dares do something different, are going to love it!

This game is a total different experience. And is this new fresh take on Open world gaming that makes it so unique and interesting. You have to play it in order to get it. The production value of this game is off the charts. Very happy with this new take on gaming, especially when you see other players providing items and using items you provided. Very engaging. Special edition steelbook is really cool. Highly recommend this game.

Waited a long for this title to come out and I must say i'm not impresed im a fan of the MGS series so I know what Kojima is capable of doing but i must say this game does not hit the mark falls short I really had high hopes for this game is just boring and tedious Graphics are Amazing but what good is that if the game does not meets the expertations we all had lost interest after 2 days of playing it.
I love the game, but when I received it I didnt know thats the steelbook case was dented until I got home. Please handle merchandise more carefully next time.

Beautiful, imaginative, challenging masterpiece..........until a hint, or menu pop up on screen......then you'll need BINOCULARS handy, even on a SEVENTY inch screen, from 8 feet away!!! Hold onto your money until yhey fix this game breaking OVERSIGHT. AMATEUR.

I didn't think I would like this game as much as I have, but it's been a delight to play. The world feels so alive because of the inhabitants which each have a unique personality. The monsters aren't all evil. It feels so nice to build things instead of worrying about minmaxing a character or something. If you like RPGs and don't hate building games, I think this is a great buy.

First off, before I begin the review, I just want to let everyone know that if you own a Nintendo Switch and are curious about this game, there is a free demo on the Nintendo eShop you can download AND on the main menu of the main game there is an option to 'Continue from Demo' to bring your progress over. I absolutely loved the original Dragon Quest Builders. I finished it 100% and loved every chapter. However, starting Dragon Quest Builders 2, you immediately see just how many quality-of-life changes they made to the gameplay that makes it a much better experience! To quickly sum the new things up: - There is now a stamina meter for your character to run. - You can play online with friends (must have Nintendo Switch online membership and reach a certain point in the single player campaign for this feature to unlock). - Your weapons/tools are no longer breakable. - You have a companion that travels with you helping you defeat enemies and pick up items. - Your tools/weapons are assigned to different buttons now. - There is a robust photo editor where you can take pictures and post them on the DQB2 message boards (think Super Mario Odyssey photo editor). - You can upload your creations as well as visit other people's islands to see their creations through the DQB2 message board. - Your hunger meter is now a percentage (0-100% as opposed to five slices of bread) - Defeating enemies still give you items but it also gives you experience you use to level up you and your companion. - There is DLC on the way that adds even more items and quests for you to enjoy. - Physical version has stackable slime DLC code inside AND a reversible cover that matches the artstyle of the first one! (see photo) Essentially, if you enjoyed Dragon Quest Builders, you will LOVE Dragon Quest Builders 2! It plays more like an RPG than the first one and you'll find yourself constantly building new structures! The story keeps you playing and the quests are fun as they reward you with new items to craft. The writing is also FANTASTIC...the characters are hilarious and the dialogue is cheeky! I hope this review helped you out. I am still currently playing through this (have been for about 10 hours now) and have been addicted every second. If you are on the fence, again try the eShop demo...you may be surprised at how much you enjoy it! :)

I was so excited for this game since the original DQB is one of my favorite games of all time. So far this game expands on the original and I am loving it. HOWEVER, the reason I'm only giving 2 Stars (otherwise I would give it 5) is the performance. The Switch is just not powerful enough to run this game. It lags and stutters SO BAD just from moving the camera around to the point where it's very jarring. Maybe Square Enix has factored in that some people may not notice things like framerate drops, but for me this is inexcusable. Admittedly, the lag is not so bad in handheld mode because the resolution drops down to 720p. So if you plan to only play in handheld mode this may be OK for you, but in my opinion it is unplayable in docked mode. I was VERY upset to buy this on Switch only to turn around and have to spend another $60 to purchase it AGAIN for the PS4! It is very disappointing because I wanted to be able to take this on the go, but I predominantly play on a TV and the performance issues are not worth it. I would highly recommend skipping this version and getting the PS4 version which runs smoothly and flawlessly at 60fps!

If you don't want any story or structure just play Minecraft, otherwise try this. Really fun and a great sequel to the first game. I guess if you didn't like the first one you wouldn't really like this but if you had any fondness for it you should adore this. It's a refined but similar gameplay experience. Yes, some of the scriptings are obviously intended for a Linear A->B style playthrough but there's as much freedom as you want outside the specific, story-driven tasks.
The lamp I bought is broken so now I have to take the time to return it, etc.
Haven't used it yet. It's not even for me. It's a gift.
Loved the first game, this game brings alot to the table as in content, you can easily spends over 300hours into this and still love it
Oh wow, so many upgrades from the first one. Multi Players, Season Pass, and so much more!

If you played the first Dragon Quest Builders game and enjoyed it at all, then you definitely need to buy the sequel - its has everything that made the first game fun, plus tons more content, plus fixes a lot of flaws that the first game had (such as having to leave the areas you built up once they were 'done'. Its now possible to revisit previous lands, and in fact somewhat necessary for gathering materials.) If you haven't played the first Dragon Quest Builders game, then its probably best described as 'Minecraft but with a story.' The game is set in a world that's largely been destroyed by evil. You play a 'builder' - a person with the rare ability to create new things, while the rest of humanity scrounges in the ruins trying to avoid being killed by monsters. You travel to various lands, each of which has a ruined town that you must rebuild, inspiring the people to move into your town and eventually take back the world from the monsters. You're responsible for building them homes and defenses, and completing quests (which tend to unlock new things you can build or cause new people to move into your town.) The first Dragon Quest Builders game was good, but DQB2 improves on it in basically every way. I would consider it one of the best games on the Switch at this time, and would say everyone should at least give it a try.

The first Builders was fun with its blend of RPG and Minecraft style building, but didnt feel quite the best in either of those aspects, it was great for being the combination. The sequel upgrades ever, its much easier to enjoy things purely for the building aspect, and its a far more enjoyable RPG, and still that magic combination of the two elevating it higher.

DQB2 improves over the original with Bigger open world areas to build and Awesome story. Its very addicting to build a whole town and watch the villagers interact with it. You can level your character and your villages. The more you level up the more new things you and your friends can do. This game also has online co-op and offline. Its really worth the price and if you get it on sale its a steal.
Absolutely amazing game wether you are playing the story or just wasting time. 10/10 in my books, it has surpassed and improved everything the first one had done great. Recommended for newcomers too!

This game is packed! The first game was fantastic, except everyone hated losing their city. No worries in number 2, they heard what was good and bad and totally made this sequel. There's soooo much to do, build, story, and even multiplayer. Traveling, storing and building is better and AI of characters helps with mundane tasks making it less burdensome which allows me to explore, build or fight more. Great game, must have in a Nintendo switch collection, this is coming from a person that didn't think he'd like Minecraft mechanics and here I am, playing the sequel!

Do you like Dragon Quest? Then buy this game. Do you like Minecraft? Then buy this game. Do you dislike either or both of those games? Then buy this game. DQB1 was a great game and they just made it 10x better.
This is better than the first game in all possible ways. The main improvement is the food and health restoration. Food is abundant and heals you as well.

100% better than the first one in so many ways. The only issue is the switch only stays powered on the battery for 3 hours or so before needing recharged (though I suppose that's a good way to limit play time).
I like how its basically like Minecraft with rpg elements and a story, only complaint is that the controls feel a bit weird but nothing bad once youre used to it
Tried the demo and really liked it so purchased this based on that. Really fun, runs at half the framerate of the PS4 and XB1 versions, but thats to be expected on the switch.

This game is very addicting! So addicting that it was capable of finally getting me to stop playing Super Mario Maker 2 (at least for now). LOL. The game is a substantial improvement over it's predecessor and I prefer the opportunity to go back to my original fort that this game finally allows. Minecraft and RPG fusion is really fun.

This game exceeded my expectations in every aspect. The graphics are superb and the multiplayer experience is like none other with vast load outs, destructible environments, etc. With Battlenet, you can even track and make changes to your character with a mobile smart phone. This I use frequently since the menus in game can be a little overwhelming and confusing.

This is my first go at a Battlefield game and having been a Call of Duty player for the last 6 years I've been getting bored with the same old game so to say the least I was blown away with Battlefield 4. The campaign was fun and intense for me I enjoyed it however the end could've used more of an ending. There is a huge learning curve in multiplayer especially going into a Conquest game play but if one stays with it beyond the first few frustrating games adaption happens rather quickly. Unlike Call of Duty there is no party so friends have to join your game session and getting paired up can take some time which can be a little fustrating. Also unlike CoD this game is ridiculously more true to life with recoil and bullet drop so sniping takes work to lead shots and adjust for distance. I love the option to adjust your gun/equipment class while your in the game and the option to choose spawn points. The vehicles are amazing while standing in the middle of it all you will see dog fights in the air and helicopters buzzing all around while the ground and building explode due to a tank battle. CoD is great for just shooting at each other, BF4 is great for teamwork and experiencing a battlefield in a war zone.

Being a FPS and global warfare fan, this game did not fall short of my expectations. Initially I purchased this, but returned it for the special edition of the game that included the China Rising expansion. They were the same price for a little more content in the special edition (highly recommended you double check what you are purchasing before you buy so you don't make the same mistake as I did). The single-player campaign was awesome, seemed like I was in charge of a movie. While I'm not a fan of how the cinematics are getting in video games, it was still pretty freaking awesome! The progression and length it took just on normal felt pretty on par with what to expect. The multiplayer so far has been amazing! The global warfare is awesome. I've always been a fan of the Battlefield series, even Bad Company, because the ability to switch classes and go from soldier to pilot to commander, or equipment operator in an AC-130 just blows me away. The graphics are said to be better than the Xbox One (running 720p vs. 900p in the PS4), but all in all the gameplay is what makes this great. The progression through multiplayer gets you hooked with trying to constantly achieve new rewards and unlocks. The fully destructible environment made me sit in awe the first time I watched a huge mutli-story building fall and crumble before me... Then the next time I was inside as it happened and had no idea why I was 'Killed in Action' until I realized it wasn't a timer making the building fall..... It was the constant barrage of shells and rockets that made the building deteriorate and crumble with me in it. The game is a great addition to the series, and cudos to the developers for this one. I look forward to the additions in the future, and think the 'season pass' (Battlefield Premium) is totally worth it.

Me and my buddies are Call of Duty fans, so it was difficult to make a transition to Battlefield. Overall this game is far superior to COD games, HOWEVER you don't have the ability to do private matches and it is extremely difficult to get into the same game with friends. If you are playing solo, this is the game to go with, if you have a group you want to play online with, stick with COD.
Great game, very reallistic and better than the current COD.

This game is fantastic, period. Most people buy the Battlefield and Call of Duty franchises for one reason, online multi-player, and this game has it on lockdown. The size of the maps and the player interaction changes depending on what game mode you choose. If you want to have an intense, bloody, all out infantry confrontation your maps will be just the right size. More interested in sitting back and sniping people off from a mile away? Play one of the larger map game modes. Want to play for objectives in an intense, all out war on a massive scale? Yeah, we've got that for you. Some of these maps on the bigger games modes are so massive it is hard to believe you are: A - playing on a console / B - playing a video game at all! I was in an Obliteration game and was sitting on top of a sky scraper, picking people off that were running by on the street below with a 40 time magnitude zoom. All of a sudden I hear a massive explosion and the building starts to cave-in/collapse. I end up jumping off and parachuting the the ground several blocks away, all the while watching the carnage as I float down. The single player campaign, while 'thrilling' at times is not the reason to buy this game. It's all about the multi-player. The only thing that bugs me is that you cannot play split screen, either local or online so to play with your friends you will need to play from multiple televisions with multiple systems on multiple ip addresses.

This is by far my most favorite game. Cod has fallen behind. The graphics of BF4 are amazing. Every thing in the game interacts, shoot a building and it crumbles, hit a tree and it falls.... Endless fun!
Another great game in the Battlefield series. Love it!
This game is a step up from the last battlefield. Great game
Battlefield is my favorite shooter/war franchise of game, the story and arrangement of the scenarios and combat stories is great!
Best shooter game ever, needs to be remastered to bring up to 4k and 8k standards still worth the purchase today
Have several other battlefield games. All of them are great
Great game!!! Maps are huge and so many different weapons and Vehicles you can use. Definitely recommend this game.
I had played this one on PC and decided to buy it for my kids. I had forgotten there is too much cursing. Still giving a 5 star, its not the games fault that I have bad memory.
not a shooter kinda guy, but this surpassed all expectations. just the campaign mode is enough for a purchase
The game is really great and easy to play. I didn't play a shootout game for a long time. however, I got used to it real fast.
This Shooter Is Much Better Than Call Of Duty. Larger Maps And Better Campaign Mode!
Great graphics, action packed and entertaining good audio
Can't speak for the campaign because I had bad experiences with the bug that compromised the save data, but the multiplayer is quite addicting. Fun game for fans of first-person shooters.
The campaign is a nice play through and the multiplayer is intense that keeps you coming back.

awesome action/war FPS game. love the campain mode and the multiplayer maps. Love the weapons and vehicles included. If you want to get even more , become premium and get map packs and exclusive stuff first and free!
Great game with lots of cool effects and hours of entertainment. Great graphics too.
Always played the cod series got a ps4 and wanted to switch it up. Wow you will not be disapointed if you are a cod fan much more realistic battlefield 4 is.

It's a great game. It does have it's differences than COD if you are use to that game. One thing that does suck about this game is the multiplayer function. You can't have a party set up to this moment. So that means if you want your friends to join your game you do have to send someone in and hope there is enough room so you can get your friends all to play together. Still a fun game ads is great. A lot of fun game styles.
Even months after release I have problems with lag in multiplayer conquest. No other games cause this problem for me. Makes it frustrating to play online.
Awesome game great on multiplayer. Wish it had a way to play 2 players on the same system split screen while loss into the multiplayer but I know almost all the games have moved away from that.

As a long time Battlefield fan, this game is pretty disappointing to me, and not because the core gameplay is bad, because in fact I think it has better maps than Battlefield 3 did and the reintroduction of commander mode is much needed. But the game itself was obviously rushed out by EA, like usual, which shows in the outrageous amount of bugs and performance issues across the board in terms of the multiplayer (the single player campaign, while not doing anything outstanding or fresh, was fun and functioned properly). Quite frankly, it should not have been released in the state it was and continues to be even 5-6 months after launch.
Everything you expect from a high quality next Gen shooter

The game always force closes and the multiplayer and campaign never save. the multiplayer always resets stats and level and campaign will reset every time you shut the console off. Would wait a bit longer before buying

Battlefield 4 has outstanding multiplayer game features along with a great story mode. The multiplayer game is very engaging despite your play level. I did not think I would like the story mode however it turned out to be as decent as the multiplayer. Great game!
I bought BF4 after Christmas and I love it. The online multiplayer is insane. There is 64 players at once in some of the game modes and it gets crazy.

This game features a lot of huge environments not seen in that of call of duty. Battlefield 4 offers huge environments to explore and a solid gameplay experience. Multiplayer is excellent and fluid and provides gamers with a unique structure of gameplay and scenarios to choose from.
I purchased this for my son-in-law and he has enjoyed!

This is a must have game if you like FPS titles. It has great maps & OK story line. Wish they provided more stable support to online game play which has many issues but are currently being addressed for the most part.

People are split into two groups: those that like battlefield and those that like call of duty. Simply said, if you are a battlefield fan, you'll like this game. The pacing, speed, and learning curve are different from call of duty, so any hardcore cod fan will not be sold to the battlefield franchise from this game. Until the servers are more reliable, it's hard to recommend this game because it is so frustrating to play online when you have issues with losing progress and freezing. Hopefully they will fix this soon because overall it's a great game.
No issues on PS4 platform as there have been on Xbox One. My son primarily plays this and has been happy with the product.
This game is great for someone who likes to game online.

This is the 1st Battlefield game that I've played always heard that they were pretty good & what I heard was right! I've played my share of Call of Duty & have to say that I think a lot of people are missing out by not giving Battlefield a chance! I'm still playing the Story mode mainly because I've been into the online play & the only issue I have is the Online Multiplayer, for example when you shot someone with a Rocket Launcher that tends to take them out but for reason most of my dead on hits tends to not even phase the enemy! An update is needed!
Really love the online play even though it glitches every now and then but they are working on that and the very short campaign was pretty fun to play also.
BF4 is shows off the power of the ps4 with its stunning gameplay and graphics!

I have always liked Battlefield 4 with the attention to detail. The game play is great but I wish EA would have taken the time to workout the bugs. It freezes and has problems saving your progress in the single player campaign.

Great overall game with a lot of options to do in game. More difficult than call of duty in terms of bullet drop, having to worry about tanks,jets, and other vehicles but it's a game for someone wanting more out of a shooter.
