So, a coworker and I swapped games for a week. I got his copy of BF4 and he got my copy of COD:Ghosts. I had heard some rumblings from friends about the game crashing. Fortunately for me (or so I thought), I wasn't running into any of the bugs...until I got a significant way through the game. That's when I decided to try my hand at some of the online play with 1 of those friends. We had trouble getting on the same side and when we did, we had trouble hearing each other. It was fun, but I was thinking the whole time how much better it would be if I could hear my friend. On top of that, the game crashed at 1 point. No problem, just restarted and kept playing. Next day, I go to play campaign and, to my dismay, my save file was corrupted and my progress lost. After learning my lesson, I made sure after every mission that my progress was saved to psn...until it crashed again most of the way through a mission and lost that. This happened to at least 2 of my friends. If they could fix the bugs I'd probably give it a 5. I wouldn't even recommend playing it until the bugs are fixed. Too much of a hassle and it takes the fun of playing away.

Online play connections and locker room errors galore! After 20+ years of making NHL games, you would think EA would get things right. NO..... Again, they release a game incomplete and full of glitches and errors when trying to play online against other teams and players. On top of that, you MUST join a CLUB to challenge other clubs - as drop in team play is just TWO CHL teams and you are playing OUTSIDE in street clothes. So, if you don't have a regular group of people to play with, you are pretty much stuck with nothing. Seems EA just cares about HUT - cause that is where the money is.

cant use 200 legends they advertise, maybe 100 and you cant move them to say bruins, oilers, rangers etc! Huge disappointment. To get remaining legends you need to spend more money on a pack of cards and hopefully a legend is in there!!! How is there no Orr,bourque, Neely , Bure, Gordie Howe, lindtos in their legend list??? If your getting this thinking there are 200 legends be warned they lie to you!!!!

EA has lacked any significant improvements since NHL 15. This year introduced all new skating and hitting mechanics. It is the most realistic feeling NHL game I have ever played. With other game modes introduced like World of CHEL. NHL 19 still has the same commentary and looks much like NHL 18. With that being said the graphics still look great and is a very fun game to play!

The on-ice gameplay is much improved this year, but it doesn't matter when you can't get into games. There are so many error codes, bugs and glitches that it often takes 40 minutes to get into one 25 minute game. It's nonsense and it's been this way since the game launched on September 14th, which is 2 months ago. So for 2 months this dev team has known about the game-breaking issues and done nothing. It's insulting to their entire customer base. And they changed so much about lobbies/matchmaking from 18 that it has ruined the 'playing with friends' experience. You are endlessly taken out of the dressing room/lobby you are in with your friends or people you just played with online. So you have to essentially re-group after nearly every game and it's a giant headache. In 18 you were always left in the same dressing room with whomever you just played with and it was super easy. Now it's ruined and the fluidity of playing with others has been destroyed in a mode that is about playing with others. Gigantic EA failure.

NHL 19 finally improves the feel of skating and checking, which haven't felt quite right since NHL 14. Gameplay feels much improved compared to the last few years. However, the game still has many issues. Poke checking and stick lifting continue to be abused when playing online; they're too effective and it ruins the pacing of a game. Speaking of online, input lag and poor peer to peer connections continue to ruin the majority of matches, even if you have a high quality connection yourself. I find this isn't the case as often with Madden, but it continues to plague NHL year after year. Roster updates continue to be too slow/inaccurate (as opposed to Madden's weekly updates). Commentary is fine, but not dynamic like in Madden and NBA 2K so it feels antiquated. The player models are terrible except for the occasional star player they scanned correctly. The graphics, sound, and presentation are in a serious need of updating. There continues to be no story mode like other sports franchises have been adding the past few years and all you're left with is a shallow-feeling Be a Pro mode from last generation. The new World of Chel modes like Ones (1 v 1 v 1 hockey on a pond) or returning Threes (fast paced arcade hockey) are nice additions and can be fun to change things up. However, I can't help but feel too many resources go into these minor things that most players aren't even looking for instead of focusing on the core experience. Passing is one area that feels in need of an upgrade; rarely does the mechanic execute the way I want it to when in the offensive zone or rushing on a breakout. There never seems to be enough time/space to incorporate the D players in the offensive zone either, as the cpu instantly cuts off any shot or pass you try to organize from the point. Gameplay definitely improved, but it still doesn't feel as fun as it used to. I've played every NHL since 2004, and it just isn't hitting those same highs like some of those older games. If you're into hockey, this year's game brings back some of the fun with the improvements to skating and checking, but just know that many more improvements need to be made for this series to return to its former glory.

The upgraded skating and collision system in this version is awesome. There is even more stuff to do in EASHL and HUT is still fun. (Think of FIFA, I am not a soccer guy but enjoy playing FIFA) Great effort by EA.

Imagine if Resident Evil 1 starred a nobody and took place in first person. That's the simplest way of describing RE7. And that's a good thing! RE7's main plot is far removed from the usual Umbrella shenanigans and deals with issues much closer to home. In fact you are on a plantation in Louisiana cut off from the world trying to rescue your wife from a crazy family. It's more than that of course but that would be spoiling a lot of surprises. The game really plays like RE1 with bizarre puzzles, ammo sponge bosses, creepy enemies, item conservation and limits on what you can carry but there's modern touches too, like no limits on how often you can save (but saving is limited by location and special auto save checkpoints) and having a bit more mobility. In 2D this game is scary and graphic. Probably the most extreme visually speaking. Decay in all forms throughout the game. In VR the game really shines. And it's the entire experience too. You can aim and shoot with your head and lean around corners without exposing yourself. And everything literally is in your face now. If you are squeamish VR might push you. Game takes about 10 hours to beat. Usual first time length for an RE. But since this is the gold edition there is all the DLC to explore. Not A Hero I hear is the best but I haven't gotten a chance to play them all yet. In time... Really I have no complaints about this package or game. RE7 was a much needed shot of creativity to the series while returning back to what we loved about RE games in the first place: survival horror.

I've played this game in VR mode, so that is what I'm basing this short review off of. The game does a good job of being scary in the same way the first one did 2 decades ago. The VR actually adds to the experience and I don't think I will ever forget the dread I felt the first time I had to walk into the darkness. The controls work really good and the game does a good job of restricting your view as you move faster, keeping the camera from making me feel queasy. If you have PSVR and want to be scared, play this game. Made the purchase of the headset feel totally worth it.
Worth the price because all the dlc is included. Great.

This game is terrifying and excellent. But a note to collectors with a focus on preservation: The 'Gold Edition' features (aka, all of the DLC that is included on the disc) cannot be found on the main menu until the Day One patch is installed. In other words, even though this release DOES technically include all of the content on the disc (except for the 'Not a Hero' campaign, which is a free download) none of it can be accessed until the Day One patch adds them to the main menu. So in a post PS4-online-server world, this content will be locked out of reach. Since many people wait to buy these releases of games in an effort to have a complete archived version of the game, this is less-than ideal :(

I love that RE started off as a puzzle thriller/horror/OTS game but hated what it had turned into, basically a shooter with a little puzzle thrown in. RE7 takes it back to the horror roots in this game and the VR mode is freaky worth it. The base game and some DLC are well worth the purchase of this edition but I hate that there is a return to the almost run and gun that RE has become. The Not A Hero DLC just urks me. Get it and do not play the game in VR when you have cats in the room, or do, and have a heart attack.

After waiting forever for this game to go on a sale I finally picked it up and wish I had purchased it right away at full price. This is a terrifying experience in VR and one of the strongest examples of why VR will continue to grow as a platform. Both flat and VR modes feature superb graphics, especially on the PS4 Pro. The story itself is somewhat predictable but enjoyable overall. If you have PSVR you must own this game.

This game will scare you. Played in a First person perspective gives it that even extra feeling of dread as you creep through frightening old houses and outdoors in the dark. Scares around every corner. Play it at night it will haunt you.

This is a fun entry to the Resident Evil franchise as it incorporates FPS in the game. Resident Evil 7 immerses the players and puts them in the belly of the Baker estate as they search for Mia Khali- errr uhh Winters. Mia Winters was what I meant. Gameplay: 9.5/10 Plot/Lore: 9.5/10 Visuals/Level Design: 10/10 Replay Value: 10/10 The only thing this game lacks is enemy variation. Other than that, this is a solid game!
This new first-person take on the formula wisely remembers that its survival-horror adventure, composed of tense exploration and careful item-hunting

I highly recommend this game to fans of resident evil and survival horror genre. Although, I personally like third person perspective like all previous resident evil games but I still enjoyed this game with first person perspective. Environment is intense and always keep you on the edge of your seat. With VR support, the overall experience is superb.

I did not make it very far into the game before I had to turn it off. The movement controls for VR made me incredibly nauseous. However, I have watched the GameGrumps play through as well as some others online and I look forward to playing more normally (without VR). So far the beginning is a little spooky, and does look good considering while wearing the VR headset. I hadn't reached any serious jump scares yet, but I'm interested in seeing how it plays out.

Resident Evil VII was one of the surprise hits of 2017, starting off the year right. Personally, it did not get much better for me. The atmosphere, the puzzles, the combat.....it all made for a fantastic title and now you can get it with all DLC included! Well worth the cost of admission!

The last few entries into the Resident Evil franchise have anything from mediocre to downright dismal. Thankfully, Resident Evil 7 Biohazard has broken free of this trend. Let start with VR. This is one of the best games for virtual reality to date and this mode is included at no cost. This isn't a lazy port to VR either. RE7 feels like it was designed around this concept instead of shoehorning it in at the end. There are more than a few truly terrifying moments in this game - even better, Resi 7 doesn't rely on jump scares for its horror. The claustrophobic and eerie atmosphere make every moment tense. One thing I'd like to mention is that this game made me feel physically sick, (dizzy and nauseous) especially while watching someone else play, VR mode fixed this entirely for me. There are other people who have also experienced this so keep that in mind when purchasing.

After the mediocre 5 and horrendous 6 this new resident evil brings back the exploration and dread of the earlier entries of the series. Definitely a must own for horror fans and resident evil fans. Just an awesome game all around

I bought this game when I bought my PS VR. It was so amazing in VR you feel like you are in the RE universe. Capcom made the game so good that you dont need to have VR to enjoy it. This is a must play game with or without VR. Resident Evil is a franchise that redefined the horror game genre and 25 years later they did it again.

Although it retains a little bit of the Capcom cheesiness of previous Resident Evils, RE7 is much more immersive and terrifying than previous entries. I've played most of the previous entries in the series and found this one to be close to the top of them all. Since this contains almost all of the DLC released for it, it's an extremely good deal. The DLC is all on-disc, so there's no codes to redeem.

Despite the changes they made in this game compared to previous games it does not disappoint. The Gold edition is so worth getting since all the DLC is included. Everything is on disc except the Not A Hero DLC. You have to go on the PSN store to download it.

Reverting back to survival horror in 1st person. Initially I have to admit I was a little put off by the 1st person view (hate COD) but took a chance anyways. I'm glad I did, game delivers! Ration that ammo, you'll regret it later on.....

I really enjoyed this game, and it was refreshing to get back to survival horror after several mediocre action games in the series. Some of that trademark hammy dialogue makes its way into the game, but that's kind of par for the course with RE. The dlc is all here in the gold edition, although it's more hit or miss. Some of the minigames are fun but nothing special. And the story dlc is a nice diversion after finishing the main game but also not really anything special.

This is a great pick up if you enjoyed Resident Evil when it was scary and made you think about what to bring with you while exploring the house. No more over the top senseless action. It's back to how it used to be and I'm happy with the game.

Resident Evil 7 is a big comeback to the Resident Evil Franchise. This one is more about the survival just as it is about the horror elements but in first person view. Its a nice and refreshing change that made my playthrough very worthwhile. Easily one of the best survival horror games out there.

Love the resident evil series games. This one is a complete newly experience that doesnt go deep into raccoon police department story but behind a sadistic family who undergoes a demonic presence of a little girl. The monsters are not zombies which i didnt like. I mean resident evil suppose to have zombies right?. The creature are scary looking but only few creatures were in this game. Overall this gold edition was what i looking for with the dlc. Was worth the wait i guess and price match it to gamestop. If you are a horror fan of Resident Evil games start with this one. RE 1 then past 5 and 6 RE 4 is good too.

I use the full review scale so that is a very good score. There are a ton of experiences that I wouldn't waste my time on this generation, but RE7 is not one of them. And with the Gold Edition it's even better. The design of the game is great. You will frequently come across locked doors or things impeding your progress that you need something for. As you go along the other route, you find what you need and eureka moment, you now know what you need to bypass the barrier in true Metroidvania fashion. This extends into the DLC as well (at least with End of Zoe and Not a Hero). The game has excellent pacing and a cool, well thought out story. The pieces of the plot start to fall into place, shedding light on earlier details. Resource management is fun because you can save all your good stuff for the ending. Shame about the generic enemies, though. They also could've made the puzzles (if you can call them that) a little harder. Overall, it's nowhere near Resident Evil 4's level of quality, but like I said, it's a great game nonetheless made even better by the DLC. The DLC has the same great design as the main game, though with new mechanics. I highly recommend you play Not a Hero and End of Zoe. Even though their stories aren't all that, and they don't really add much to the main game as far as revelations are concerned (the files you can find are still entertaining, though), the gameplay in these DLCs is still great. All the DLC is on disc, except for Not a Hero which you need to download from the PS Store.

This game really messed with my head the first time I played through it. It is scary, strategic and above all, it is survival horror because I felt like I was surviving playing this game. I am a huge fan of the series and genre so for me this was not even a question to buy. BONUS: The Gold Edition has all the DLC which are extremely fun and they come at a savings by buying it as an all in one package.

A great turning point for the Resident Evil series. Whereas Resi 4 took the series too far into the third person action territory, Resi 7 brings it back to the weird, B-Movie horror/adventure game roots. This is the real step forward for the franchise. The first person perspective put you squarely in the character shoses and let you experience the world first hand. It does stumble with some of the design choices, characters, and enemies but it keeps it from derailing by having great graphics, controls, interaction and immersion. Resident Evil 1 light if you will. Not a perfect game but a step in the right direction.

First, it's amazing that this game is running on Switch. It's an excellent port done by Panic Button. Second, there are a few caveats attached to the Switch version, including its 30 FPS target, which occasionally sees framerates dip well below that creating a jarring effect, as well as pretty low resolution textures which give the game a much softer edge and bit of blur on Nintendo's console. Yet, the ability to play anywhere is still why this is a very worthwhile port, and despite the hiccups mentioned, it sticks very closely to the 30 FPS for almost all the action and even features motion assisted aiming. Meanwhile, the ability to revive your partner online or off makes some of the brutally challenging moments much more forgivable and less frustrating.

All I can say is that Wolfenstein Youngblood is a gigantic disappointment. The Switch is not a console to buy AAA games and expect the same performance in the graphics department as you would in other consoles. That's fine, at least for me it is, rather I'm more concerned with making sure the game doesn't lag and it provides the same exact in game content that you would fine on other consoles. YB runs OK for the most part, but the things that are wrong with it are: -It's unnecessarily muddy looking. -You're forced to download the game because there's no cartridge. -The storyline is not great or original. -The gunplay is sadly boring. -The co-op option is pointless. -The game lags when a lot of enemies are on screen and things start happening. -Enemies are bullet sponges. It gets extremely frustrating when the difficulty spikes become unfair. The game becomes less rewarding because it's not challenging in that fun way but more so cause it's doesn't have the same proper difficulty mix that other Wolfenstein games have. I seriously would avoid this at all costs. If you do decide to get it, even though I am a big fan of the Switch, I really would not recommend getting it for this console. Just avoid!

Yeah its full of good old fashion cheese cake and silly humor from the days when games used to just be about fun. Its actually got a competent fighting game under the hood as a 2 button fighter but its mixed with some of the best elements of Party fighter games like smash bros with how you have to finish off your opponent with a super move instead of just getting rid of all their life. There was an all female SNK Fighter for that system. I feel this is the reincarnation of that same game. The battle mechanics are different from traditional fighting games; a finisher of sorts ends the match. A fun game worth checking out in regards to SNK as a franchise.

Snk Heroines is a simple fighter, with easy combos, special moves, and super to pull off. There's a decent selection of fighters to choose from and has customizable options for headwear. There's very few stages to choose from however. The story isn't anything serious or interesting, but rather a comedic story which is good for this type of game. I would say to pass on this game if you like more complex fighting games, but if you want a more casual experience then this game will be for you.

They did some cool things with it: four-player support, an interesting customization system, a playable panda, etc. But for the most part, it's a big let down with its generic paint by the numbers missions. I'm not mad I bought it because it's a budget game and I love Contra, but man what a missed opportunity.

Doom lets you Rip and Tear through well crafted levels with a compelling story and lots of weaponry to blow through the demons and save Earth from Hells Wrath.

While it's similar to Doom (2016) in terms of non-stop action and fast pace, it also feels like a completely different beast. Everything, from enemy behaviors and weaknesses to resource management, has so much more depth to it. There's so many mechanics to the game that it might feel overwhelming to some people and I understand why. But every single thing the game teaches you is significant and useful in the gameplay loop, it isn't there just for sh!ts and giggles. GET THIS GAME.

I have been a big fan of this series since the first game came out. each game has played different the other and that is the same for this game. This game is much more difficult then the other two game and in the beginning seem very limited with combat. After about an hour of game-play you get your first power up that helps with the combat as up until this point you have only really had one attack button and not many combos for attacking. also unlike the previous two games, you will not be able to just power smash your way through enemies and you will have to dodge and plan your attacks. There are some issues here and there with graphics and camera angle (fire being blocky at the beginning of the game, camera panning between charterers in cut scenes not smooth, camera angle in small areas) Other then these issues (could most likely get patched) and getting use to the new play style, i am enjoying this game very much. after the first hour the combat is fun and challenging, the story is good so far (minus some bad voice over for a few characters). the few issue i have mentioned are why i am putting 4 star, if they patch these few issues i would give a 5 star for this game P.s. the darksiders series has had a interesting development history, with the 2nd and 3rd game almost never being made due to company buyout and bankruptcy. the only reason that the 3rd game was able to be made is the original team of the first two games created this new studio after THQ was shut down.

At a full $60 Eve is one of the most expensive VR titles available. The lack of a single player campaign mean it's a primarily online flight sim that has fantastic immersion and visuals. It's one of the best looking of the launch VR games and controls more like a simulation then an arcade game. It's held back by constant microtransaction currency pack encouragement of a free to play model. It has a high learning curve and you are put right into skill based online matches. I found I didn't have the time to grind or money to invest in microtransactions to level my character and ship up enough to find the game playable. I always felt underpowered and outgunned. If you have the disposable income the gameplay is fun, but it's held back by its price point, lack of single player, and pay to win business model. I indicated I'd recommend it to a friend, but only if they knew what they were getting into and were willing to pay a premium price for it.

Eve Valkyrie gives us an awesome glimpse at what is coming with VR. The dog-fighting is challenging and, it has ruined all non-VR flight games for me. Flat screen flight just doesn't touch being 'in' the cockpit. My only complaint is Eve could use a bit more content. Here's hoping to some updates/DLC.

Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night is a reminder to why a lot of us enjoy gaming. Bloodstained is a beautiful side-scrolling adventure that was created from the mind of Castlevania Symphony of the Night godfather, Koji Igarashi (hence the Igavania term). I couldn't get enough of exploring this wonderful castle world. Every inch of it. Every secret. Every hidden boss or level. The story is pretty solid and the voice work is delivered in a campy American translation that will make you smile. Like Symphony of the Night, there are some RPG elements to this game where you will experiment with creating weapons, trying different styles of weapons (whips, swords, boots or pistols), along with armor that has different effects to your style of play. Bloodstained is about sitting back and enjoying a game the way it was meant to be played right out of the box. There are no paywalls, no microtransactions to boost stats, etc. The visuals, the game mechanics, the soundtrack and fun all come together. You would be hard pressed not to have this in your gaming collection.
A brilliant return to form for metroidvania enthusiasts. Hits all the right gameplay notes and alltogether gorgeous to look at as well.

Well Koji Igarashi is back to bless the gaming world with his brilliance. The master of Castlevania has brought finally delivered Bloodstained after a few delays. I must say the game is absolutely gorgeous, controls well and appears to have a great story.

I loved Castlevania - Symphony of the Night, this game has many reminiscent aspect of that game which made it incredible. I recommend this to any Castlevania fans and new alike. Its beautiful and addicting to play.

IGA really honed in the best aspects of his last few games he did and meshed the best parts of them into this game. the 2.5 3d takes some getting used to since most metroidvanias are 2d. But the game has amazingly tight controls. And you really can mix and match and play the game how you want to play it. And unlike SOTN this has 3 difficulty modes. There is lots of content here and there is 13 DLC patches coming out that will be for free. They could have charged the full 60 for this and I would have been happy with that price after playing this. Its a sign a game is good that you think about it when not playing it. And even after beating it you want to come back to it and play it again from scratch. This really is IGAs best work to date.

I want to start off by saying it's a shame that the steel case doesn't come with the PS4/Xbox version, but I'm buyng a Switch copy so that I can get one, and I'll just let my friend borrow/keep the game Switch copy. The game itself is fantastic. Miriam's control is solid, plenty of weapons and items to find and craft, a diverse selection of enemies, sidequests, hidden rooms and lore, cosmetic items to accessorize your character, this game has it all! Bundle that with the expansive Shard system (basically the Soul System from Aria/Dawn of Sorrow) and you have a game to rival even the best that Castlevania has to offer. Konami made a huge mistake denying Igarashi-san to make another game. There is a story here, and while I can't say there was zero effort put into it, it's clearly to have an excuse for Miriam exploring an enormous castle filled with demons. Some of the cutscenes are a little janky, and the voice acting isn't the best ever, but they don't detract from the overall experience. The cutscenes are in real-time, so you can really enjoy all of Miriam's costume pieces (there are LOTS), which is a nice touch. I haven't gotten far in the game yet, but I have a lot more to do and I can't wait to jump back in. This is truly the game to rival Symphony of the Night, and will be fun over multiple playthroughs with different characters, weapons and abilities. Looking forward to the Switch release so I can store my game in the steel case.
Finally get to play this game! Enjoying it so far.

But with the recent update, havent had a problem since. Now for the game, the story is pretty short but a ton of fun if playing with friends or randoms online. There is Friendly Fire so be-careful not to shoot a teammate especially at a higher difficulty as you'll be taking a chunk of your teammate's health. After watching the trailer and a few gameplay streams on Twitch, I decided to give World War Z a go. I bought the game for PS4, fired it up, next thing I know I'm with a few friends online having lots of fun exterminating zombies... lots of zombies... swarms of zombies. Such an awesome, fun game. The online multiplayer campaign is extremely fun but it is limited to just 4 levels, which can be completed in less than 24 hours. I hope the developers of the game eventually release new content, especially for the online multiplayer campaign, with various playable cities throughout the world, in order to keep the story moving forward. The game is currently extremely short, and that's my only complaint about it.

World War Z is one of those rare licensed games that doesn't just happen to match the material, it blows by it, leaving the film in the dust. In fact, it's much, MUCH closer to the 'source-source' material, (the book,) in that it follows along with the titular WWZ by visiting different spots around the globe, each with its own cast of characters. Truly, however, WWZ the game, doesn't lean too heavily on story, although each of its 4 protagonists in its 4 locations get a background story told via a comic book style cutscene once you've finished a level with them. Each of the 4 locations has a small background told via radio transmission at the selection screen, and a set of transmitted objectives during each mission. Each location has 3 missions, except Tokyo, which inexplicably launched with two. (My guess is meeting launch deadline, as within 2 weeks of launch, the official Twitter account announced a 3rd mission and new special zombie type arriving in an upcoming update). That is one difference that doesn't come from either source, but rather video game tropes: special zombies. An unknown 5th is on the way, but currently, there's a Bull- a large SWAT officer that charges, grabs a party member and pummels them (or you,) until taken down. The Lurker, who hides in the shadows and will pin the victim to the ground, clawing away at them. The Screamer, a construction worker with a bullhorn whose screams continue to call in more zombies until he's quieted. Lastly, there's the Gas Bag, a former HAZMAT employee, complete in suit, who releases noxious fumes upon death. Pretty standard fare, in that regard. What isn't standard fare, (among the zombie side of things,) is the unparalleled size & scope of the zombie swarms re-enacting, in real-time, and in almost every case, interactively, the best scenes of mass zombie movement and attacks from the film. From flowing like a river through streets, to flinging themselves from great heights in pursuit of prey, to making 'pyramids' to scale walls, it's all impressive with no signs of slowdown, even on a base PS4. And while the comparisons to Left 4 Dead are certainly warranted, I'm not *entirely* certain it's completely fair- in all honesty, I've forgotten much of my playtime in L4D, so I'll leave that for you to decide. Yes, it's an up-to 4 person co-op shooter, although (and IMHO, at least on consoles,) better for being in 3rd person. It also features 8 person versus modes, complete with zombie hordes. Despite it being 4 person co-op, there are 6 different classes. Each class has its own permanent leveling tree. A gunmaster, explosives expert, medic, ammo support, melee, and an 'exterminator' who gains bonuses versus hordes and specials. Next up is a WIDE variety of weapons. While each class starts with a particular loadout which can't be changed initially, as you level that class, unlocked perks may give you a few different options, but most weapons will have to be found scattered around the maps. Like classes, each main and sidearm weapon will level up with use, unlocking more powerful versions of each of the many available. (Usually between 4 and 8 variants). After finishing a level, you'll earn some XP that you choose where to spend. Bank it? Unlock a perk for your class? Or, unlock a more powerful variant of your starting or favorite weapon? Because each class' skill tree only allows for 1 ACTIVE perk per branch, (3 different perks per branch,) playing with one team's gunslinger online may be different than landing on a team with a different player playing as that same class, as each player will personalize a class to their playstyle. Lastly, gameplay-wise, playing solo in WWZ isn't nearly as awful as similar online co-op games. The bots are generally capable, although far from perfect. They generally hold their own, help appropriately (ie, don't forget to try and save their own skin while attempting to help you,) and can be counted on for revives. Still, they're not above stepping in front of you and taking damage while you're shooting, and occasionally are known to crowd into you, clipping into your body/ view as you use a gun emplacement/ stationary weapon. (Hopping off the weapon and getting back on seems to fix this). Outside the game, the developers are extremely active with the community, genuinely overwhelmed by the love of the game by fans. They've been asking for feedback, error reporting, and wishlists of what to add, as they plan to continue to support the game for some time. This is a great game, even just to solo, scratching an itch for a co-op shooter that has been attempted many times since L4D, but not nearly as successfully as WWZ. At a retail price of $40, the few issues are easily forgotten. Had I paid the full $60 AAA price, I'd still be as happy. If the devs keep adding as they've stated, that $40 is going to look like even more of a steal. Run, don't walk, to add this to your collection.

Every year I fight with the question of which soccer title to purchase and every year I end up purchasing both PES and FIFA. Truth be told, I usually end up playing FIFA more than PES. That deciding factor has always come down to licensing and presentation, because both titles play well. Well, that being said, FIFA again has cornered the market on the licensing, by snatching up the Champions League and also upping the ante in the presentation department. However this year, the gameplay for me feels broken. I have had several instances where goals were scored by way of animations playing out that I had no control over. Madden Football has become notorious for this and now it appears to have spilled over to FIFA. This is not a good thing at all. I can give you several examples of this, but the we don't have enough time. Here is one example. The opposing team took a shot on goal and it deflected off my defender and looked good while doing so, ball physics and all. And then IT happened.....The other offensive player literally slid about 5 yards over, like on ice skates, to put himself in the perfect spot to net the goal, without the players head even tracking the ball or legs moving to run over to that spot. The play happened so fast I had to watch the replay to figure out how it was possible that the player reacted so insanely fast. And that is when I noticed that it wasn't anyone reacting or controlling the player at all, it was in fact a pre-determined animation playing out. WOW!! What a buzz kill...Up to this point, I had never witnessed this occurring in a FIFA title. It is supremely disappointing and frustrating. That was only the first occurrence of many. I have also noticed a crazy amount of players clipping through other players, the ground and their own limbs as well. It just really feels as though the FIFA development team is banking on the licensing and presentation to carry this game and have left the gameplay unfinished and broken. It's an easy decision this year for me. It's PES all the way. FIFA will be in real trouble if PES can improve on the presentation and licenses, because when it comes to realism on the Pitch....it's hands down PES. I hope this helps anyone trying to decide what title to pick up this year.

The fellow defenders legit stand there and don't do anything. When you switch players all your other players slow down and don't sprint. They're no where to be found. If i forgot anything else that's bad in this game, please let me know. Can't really say there's one good thing about this game.

I bought the Orange Box as one of my first X-Box games and got hooked on Valve. Portal was right down my alley. Portal 2 for me rocks beyond belief. I am at chapter 4 which is where the dificulty level kicks in. Portal 2 has many upgrades to Portal. The controls are better and more responsive and situated better. I love the diverse methods of beams, light floors, new cubes etc. to assist you in your getting from one place to the next. I could go on forever about the creative imagery and totally fantastic visual effects. Just go buy the game and enjoy it for what it is. Puzzle game playing at its best.

My review is based on the Splitscreen Co-Op mode. My son (10) and I had a BLAST. High 5s, screaming, cheers. It's all there. Fun. Replay may be low, but I'm sure we'll do it again. My Sons review...... best game I've played since halo reach. just to say you really need to brainstorm and work as a team

I'll be brief. This was a hoot! I'm not a huge fan of puzzle games but the humor, graphics and first person perspective made this game a total blast and its longer than I thought it would be. It has some expected but still surprising twists and turns along the way as well. I spent hours on several levels trying to reason out the solutions and once I figured it out it was very satisfying! If you enjoyed the first Portal and you like first person style games I think you will enjoy this a great deal. Valve did a great job!!!

OK... i played this game all the way through and it just BLEW ME AWAY!!!! it is the perfect ending!!!!! I love the twist too!!!!! i don't want to give away too much of the story, but when i finished the game i had to go back to the beginning and play through it again... IT WAS THAT EPIC i LOVE YOU GLaDOS PORTAL 3 {THAT'S WHAT I'M COUNTING ON}--- PORTAL 2 REFERENCE

Portal 2 is a mind-bending puzzle game from Valve. You open your mind to a knew way of gaming. You get a portal manipulator device, which you use to create 2 separate rifts in space and time to teleport throughout the map. You essentially just go in one portal, and go out the other. This device along with useful environmental advantages will help you conquer dozens of maps and will have you thinking with portals. Portal 2 is a blend of puzzle game and first person action that will keep you, and now a friend, busy for a while. Maybe there will be Cake this time?

This is by far one of the best games I have ever played. The levels are challengeing but not so much that you get discouraged and stop playing. Have yet to explore the co-op section but I am sure it is just as good. The graphics are great and the story line is good as well. No gun or fighting violence and no mindless cursing and foul lanuage. Your adveserary is a compute AI that is trying to kill you but the violence is mild if not almost non existent. Great game for casual gamers.

Wow. The amazing storyline will keep you playing for hours. After playing this you will be looking for places to put portals in real life! What really is the fantastic humor and voice acting. Crazy, babbling Wheatley, is by far the best video game character ever with the best voice acting ever. GLaDOS isn't far behind. A fun game where you think, not just blow peoples brains out with machine guns. The co-op doesn't disappoint either.

Portal 2 honestly has to be one of the best games i have ever played in my life. I played almost ever kind of xbox game imaginable but this game definately has a different vibe. Running around shooting at ever thing that moves in COD or HALO gets pretty boring. But Portal 2 is a great way to sit back, have fun and work your brain at the same time. The ending is epic and its a great game
Excellent game. Graphics are great, fun to play, and love the characters good and bad!

I was a big fan of the original Portal, so I had to give this a try. I had much debate over whether or not to spend $60 on the game because I knew how much use I would get out of it. Anyway, long story short, I bought it, beat it within two days, and haven't picked it up since. I'm told I should play the multi-player mode, I just don't wanna! Can't imagine having to play this game with some tard who keeps messing around and getting killed. The game was fun and had some great challenges. I really enjoyed it........ for 2 days..... You want my opinion? Rent it....

Portal 2 was a real treat to play. The puzzles are thought-provoking and deceptively tricky. The addition of 'goo' adds a nice dimension to the puzzles - and the addition of a co-op mode really pushed this title over the top. Only a couple of the puzzles were stumpers which makes the game approachable to even the most logically challenged. Even those few that offered a challenge garnered 'Aha' moments once the solution was realized. So, while none of the puzzles induced headaches, the entire game was well worth the cost - its more than just a puzzle game, afterall, any time spent with GLaDOS is worth falling down a few pits, getting crushed by large spikey articulated platforms, covered by orange, blue and white goo and suffering verbal abuse, isn't it?

Here's a game you can play with the whole family as you try to solve the more challenging puzzles presented. The Humor of the compute opponent is frankly a great surprise. I play this with my 11 year old daughter - we have fun in co-op mode and assisting each other while we play individually.

Portal 2 is awesome and different that your run of the mill First Person Shooters. It's 10,000 years in the future, mankind has perished...all that's left is machines. You are a robot trapped inside a complex run by a maniacal super-computer with a bad attitude. You have a portal gun that allows you to create entrance/exit portals, and you are given puzzles to solve in order to proceed from one level to the next in the game. Some of the puzzles are simple to solve, others are quite elaborate. This is a great game, no violence, just problem solving. Highly recommended.

In case you haven't been told recently or often enough, this really is one of the greatest ever invented. If you're a fan of the first-person shooter but miss the old days of puzzle games, this is the most satisfying game I've played in a long time. And it's hilarious. The commentary you get from GLAdOS, Wheatley, and Cave Johnson have you frequently laughing out loud as you stretch your brain to figure out the puzzles. It's just challenging enough to make you feel smart as you complete most levels. Hours of playtime, absolute replay value, and engaging co-op missions earn this game my highest recommendation.

I am not very familiar with this game, but my boys wanted it so they could play it on their Xbox One. I was able to purchase it and pick it up in the store with no issues. The game works great and the kids like it.

Already a classic, this XBox 360 game now works on the Xbox One. I had previously purchased the PS3 version but I wanted to play it on the One, so I picked up this now heavily discounted version. Hoping for Portal 3!
Not some mindless shooter game but one that makes you think how to solve each section. This game can really stump you at times, but still a lot of fun.
Great game better than portal 1 would recommend to any one who played the first game

This a great game for everyone. The graphics are phenomenal, and the plot is compelling. I took off a star, because I became stuck,and there was no help available. The puzzle I was stuck on had no name or level number to seek help on.

i enjoyed this game. IF you like strategy type games, play this game. If not, it;s not for you. There many levels that challenge you i unique ways. It's fun but frustrating when you have no idea what to do. But they're little clues to tell you what you have to do.
Portal 2 is a fun strategy based game. If you were a fan of the first Portal, then you would enjoy playing Portal 2. Its full of twist and turns that keeps you engaged.
I personally liked this game. Love the Co-OP it's pretty good. Love that that story line follows up from the precious portal.
Fun challenging game. Kids love it. Adults are addicted to it.

We play this game as a family at times. My teenager who is very into video games enjoys it a lot, but everyone else can still play and have a good time without boring or frustrating the gamers in the family. The game starts off pretty easy and gets more challenging as you move along.
If you love video games you musr play this. One of the top 5 best games ever made. Some fantastic co-op too.

I loved the chalanges this game presented an great gaming expirience. the use of physics was awesome and the only complaint i had was that it left me wanting more. the 2 player mode was fun with friends and presented new chalanges and harder problems. I recomend this game to those who like mental chalanges more than bloody shooters
Fun, and keeps you hooked. My brother finished the entire thing in 2 days.

If you have ever played the original Portal, this is a must have. The gameplay and puzzles are challenging and fun. The characters you interact with (Wheatley and GLaDOS) are quirky, funny, and a riot to listen to. I appreciate the fact that the game is not scary or gory, so my children can be in the room while I play.

The first Portal was just a short side game, but it was amazing. This looks like it's going to be even more so. My only qualm with it so far is the pricing. I would get this on the PC since it's $10 cheaper there.
is awesome and will be the best game for 2011, been stoked since E3 2010

Bought this as a more sophisticated alternative for my 10 year old son who fancies himself a 'gamer' and wants to play more 'adult' games. Since we don't allow him to play Mature rated games we were looking for something that didn't feel too 'baby-ish' for him. He likes this one. It's got a more adult feel to it and really requires the player to figure out how to advance in the game. My son really likes this one.
This game is action packed. It has great graphics and movement.
My cousins got this game for Christmas, in three days we got through four rounds (great Christmas right ;). Ever since I've been saving up for an Xbox, just got the game and didn't disapoint.

My son only played it several times before moving back to HALO. Guess it means that HALO still rules. It just never held his attention. At nine, he may be too young for the need for thoughtful and strategic thinking.
portal the original was one of the funniest games i played i have been waiting for 4 YEARS!!!! for this game. all i can say this game is going to be EPIC
I wanted to like this game because it seemed interesting, but after 30 frustrating minutes gave up and decided to move on.

A very good successor to Castlevania symphony of the night. The game is challenging but rewarding. Some grinding is required to defeat difficult bosses. Nevertheless the game looks fantastic and the game will keep you engrossed. I definitely recommend a buy if a Castlevania fan. But do recommend either on Xbox or PS4 until Switch port has been patched.

Bloodstained is the best side-scrolling Igavania game yet-- a huge castle to explore, with lots of secrets to uncover. This game was 4 years in the making, and you can tell with the level of detail in the story, equipment, shards (powers), and graphic. There are little nuggets that nod to horror genres of all kind, and of course to past Castlevania games. The visual fidelity on the XBox One X in 4K is the best I've seen yet. I also have it on the PS4 Pro 4K, and on the same UHD screen, I am able to get better clarity on the Xbox One X version. Either way, whatever platform you are on, Bloodstained is a fantastic game with hours and hours to continue to explore! Wonderful symphonic soundtrack too!

It is a 10/10 for *anyone* who really enjoyed playing Symphony of the Night. If you really liked that game, you will absolutely without question enjoy this game and it will be a 10 for you. Frankly, I'm annoyed it took so long for the game industry to make something amazing like this.
Great game! It reminds me of sotn. The graphics are beautiful and the game play is on time. I would recommend this to any castlevania fan.
If you like classic CASTLEVANIA games, YOU WILL LOVE THIS! Just like the title says, it's a super beefed up castlevania from it's original creator. Five years in the making, totally worth it!
The game itself is super fun but cant beat the game due to heavy crash issues.

Fun 2D platform game a lot like Castlevania. Worth the $40 price tag. Deducted a star as the 2 updates were over 14GB in less than a week. The install from the disc was only 7.7GB. Another company shipping a game before it's finished. Very annoying!
Great game to throw in when you need to give your brain a rest.
This game has kept me interested for some time now. It definitely didnt disappoint!! Worth checking out if youre into shooting zombies.

I used to buy these often. yes, they we often a hassle to redeem because the codes are wonky but they worked for the most part. I put up with it because it used to provide 6,250 gold for $25,00 or 250 Gold per Dollar. One of the best deals out there. Equivalent to buying the largest $99,00 12,000 gold packages on the World of Tanks Website. Some time in the last week Wargaming changed the amount of gold the card gives you for $25,00, reducing it to 5,350 gold or 214 gold per dollar. Not such a great deal, one of the worst in fact. Wargaming made the change without any warning or notification what so ever. It's a surprise that you get after you pay your money and redeemed your card.
This card was a good deal once but wargaming knocked off 900 gold from what you got now its very not worth buying
Wargaming has knocked down the Gold value of these cards. Previously, you would receive 6000 or so gold. Now, you only recieve 5500, a significant drop off. Not worth it any more
I use these all the time. easy to use and actually you get 6250 gold for $25 instead of 6000 gold for $24,99 on the website!
Easy way to spend cash in World of Tanks. Were on sale for $23 when I bought mine so actually a really great deal. Will buy again!

Pros: Good bit of gold, gold was processed quickly and put into my account right away cons: had trouble entering the code since I wasnt sure if it had zeros or 'o's and the site didnt let me use the return/enter key to enter the information -making me think i was typing it wrong. IN FACT the site wants you to press the submit key instead! If you press enter it would just delete the code you entered up to that point (Not sure if they fixed it since I tried it, but man that was annoying!
It's a no-brainer gift for World of Tanks players!
My husband is often lost in world of tanks. This was something that fit him and did not have to be exchanged for a different color!

This gives you the highest amount of gold per dollar spent, the only downside is that you can't use to purchase vehicles directly. You must first buy the gold and then use the gold to buy premium vehicles.

Whenever I have some extra cash, I pick up one of this to increase my gold supply in World of Tanks. You you may not know is that you can use the gold in your account to buy items in World of Warplanes and World of Warships because your account is tied in to those games as well. You can purchase premium vehicles and premium time. Both help making the grind to your next tier 10 a little easier.

fun game that is free to play, but not pay to win. The pay stuff helps you advance faster, but in no way makes a paying player have an advantage over a non-paying player. Not being forced to spend my money to win is the reason I like to spend my money on this game.
very addicting and fun to play. love this game a lot
You get less gold than you used to. I should have researched that more

Gold enables advanced options and premium tanks. This online game is relatively easy to learn. Decent graphics that can be turned up or down, depending on your computer and internet speed. Don't add spaces when entering card #.
Love the game... Best way in my book to purchase items in game without the concerns of data breaches. : )
Excellent product and a Fun game! Time to sign in and play World of Tanks!!
Easy way to control what is spent inside the game.

Got these during a 'deal of the day' sale. They were 20% off so cost only $20 each, yet you get the full $25 worth of in-game gold. I spread the word when I saw them on sale and many of my fellow clan members bought them as well. Super bang for the buck and gets you the highest gold per dollar, but only if they are on sale. Otherwise, it's the same cost and easier to just buy gold from the game website, unless you wanted to give the card as a gift.
It's a better deal than buying $100 worth of gold direct from WG. If they offer this again, buy them. I bought $100 worth and got something like 6k more gold than if I had paid that direct to WG.

Pretty good deal to get in game gold. Be aware, you can only use it for in game gold. I purchased several of these, hoping to use towards purchases of gold/credits, maybe a premium tank or two, but no such luck. It only gives you gold......

When i tried to activate the card for my game it said invalid code, and when I went back to the store to try and get them to activate it again or maybe a refund they told me that there was nothing they could do. The staff I talked to were very rude about it also.

I like purchasing the cards as its the same amount of gold pretty dollar add the most expensive potion online. So. ... if you are into World of Tanks this is a very efficient way too purchase your gold.

What can I say, I am a tanking addict! I love this game. First person shooter for adults. It's not who clicks the fastest, it's all about who uses their mind that wins. Go ahead, get yourself some gold, there are lots of tanks to buy!!
I hello it just got this is just stupid why on a card , i had to go through the whole thing reset password and log in just to review a card . Gareth
Seriously? How does one really review a gift card? Ever notice that gift cards purchased at best buy do NOT include sales tax? Save 5-8% off the top!

Not the best way to buy gold in game! This game is so rasist, because they don t want to put Macedonian flag in a store. Reson is they keep their money outside of USA. And that is Cypress. So becouse of Greeks they are not putting Macedonian flag even do I be contacted their costumer service 3 times.
Fun but addictive. Free to play but have to spend money to be competitive. There are better ways to spend your time. Takes self discipline to limit your time.

Credits from this card only give you in game gold, you can't buy anything from the premium shop with it like a tank however, you can use the in-game gold to purchase a tank, in-game. Great for gifting though, I get these for my friends that play and they eat 'em up :)
I would recommend that you be causes because when you buy it and for some reason when they don't do it right and activate it and you call them they don't accuse you of being a thief.
I still have it and have not used it yet. Waiting tomsee what happens on xbox

The game is pretty much puzzles, platforming, and even a dash of visual novel-style storytelling. It's pretty well balanced in this style game. It's easy and fun to pick up on but like most games it does get challenging as it goes along. The game controls really well and that's very important in a game especially one like this. It's title worth owning for your Nintendo Switch collection if you're a collector or gamer. I'm very thankful we got it in physical form and not just digital. Being a Limited Run game it'll always be sought after by collectors down the road. So really no risk in giving it a try. But always check a video online of the game play if you have any doubts on it being for you.

I bought this strictly because the demo was fun to play and even thought I have not opened this up yet I would tell anyone who is looking to get this to try out the demo and then buy it. The game is a mixture of making food and hunting monsters for cuts of meat so if that is something you wouldnt mind doing to pass the time then this is your cup of tea.
Its a puzzle and a rpg game all in one. A must buy if youre into LR games.
Shop online...Limited run exclusive on best buy...i already get the others exclusive ones.

When I picked up this game, I was unsure if I would like it. Im actually glad I picked it up. Its a puzzle game that has a little bit of action. It makes you think about the things you need and how to combine them in order to make what you need work. It has a pretty good story line as well.

Battle chef brigade is a fresh mixture of genres, think 2D monster hunter but instead of crafting gear with your monster part you cook them. The gameplay is really simple but engaging, you'll be given a theme ingredient and elemental flavour then you proceed to hunt monsters in a small arena to get ingredients and then rush back to the kitchen to cook em, all in limited time in an iron chef battle. The graphic is handmade drawn with a positive cute vibe, the story is simple but engaging offering an easygoing experience for when you want to relax a little bit.

I didnt think it would happen. A physical release for this game. Initially a digital only title I was on the fence of buying this game. Even at a sale price I didnt pull the trigger. Leave it to Limited Run games. Lately Best Buy has been the sole store that has Limitex Run published game.
This game not only looks good but it plays well. Making a new dish is always satisfying and exciting. I originally bought a digital version and had to get the physical as well

Collecting Limited Run Games offers a more enjoyable experience than hunting down any other publisher for Nintendo. The inclusion of extra content in the case reminds me of retro games with registration cards and booklets.
Battle Chef Brigade Deluxe - Nintendo Switch, son loves this game for system.
Just want free points Never played game nor do I intend to

If you want to feel like an action hero like John wick, get this game. You go from tense shootout to shootout and everything is high quality. It's kind of like a full game version of the london heist missions from the worlds disc (made by the same studio). Continues to get fun updates too with AIM support now.

One of the best interactive VR games I have played. They have cleverly found a way to use all your climbing, shooting and ducking actions in the game in a way that doesn't feel forced or clunky. There should be more VR games like this one...

Had to get this on Christmas eve or i couldnt come home for Christmas as per wife and kid. Amazon would take to long and the only store and ahow in town that had it in the clutch was best buy. Customer service was excellent and best buy made the christmas awesome.

This is a great game, if youre on the fence about purchasing just go ahead and purchase. The cinematic mode makes it easy for people who typically cant finish the arcade sections of these type of games, meaning old people like me. There is violence and cursing, but nothing to offend an adult.

Great action sequences but seems to be followed by too much talking. I can only play vr so long before I get sick. Sometimes the talking part takes so long that by the time I get to the action I have to stop playing due to nausea. I get sick easily, if you don't you'll be fine, there is even a comfort setting to reduce nausea but I'm too sensitive. Top notch action sequences, kind of like superhot but more fast paced
The beautiful game it looks great in VR and handles with everything involved with vr...turns out it might be Playstation vr best game

I was looking for a fun shooter for vr and this game did not disappoint. The story is fun to play. Once you complete the story there is more to do. You can play a new game+ or there are challenges such as skeet shooting and timed targets. You can easily get your money's worth.
I love the product and can not even wait to play it.
Wasn't expecting this much fun, the gold edition makes this version a blast.
This game has been awesome Ive spent so many hours playing it already and havent even played it online yet

Always been a fan of Trials on the consoles. But always wanted to bring the game on the go. And that's what this game does for me. Looks great. Runs great. There's some grinding once you reach medium, but it's enjoyable trying to get better on prior races.

This game is absolutely bonkers. You get to play 4 players at the same time locally and try to run away from each other's blasts until all hilarity ensues. One of the best games ever made just for the bloopers and hijinx. The graphics are cartoony, colorful and fill the intense color pallete of the PS4. And if that weren't enough, the game also has its own storyline mode where you get to play with movie like cutscenes. The best game developer in the world right now, Konami is on a roll with hit after hit.
got this game to have more multiplayer gsmes when friends come over. guess i went into this expecting to much, didnt deliver. classic bomberman games are a lot better.

I had friends visiting from out of town and spent a long time looking for good couch co-op games for the PS4. They really dont exist for the PS4. We decided to pick up bomberman and we had a blast! Lot of fun and new bomberman characters to unlock. Docked one star since the graphics are a bit dated and the switch version can do 8-player local multiplayer. Still, with the lack of choices for local co-op on PS4, this is one of your best options.

Its a fun party game to play with friends. There is 25 mini games with about 10 wordy games and 15 speedy games. Wordy games have you type a word in to use while speedy uses motion controls. However, be warned, you can only play the Switch version in single joy con mode. Pro contoller will not work

The mini-games are tons of fun - there's a lot to choose from and it's great fun playing with your family (up to 4 can play with just 2 joycons). The sandbox levels are very imaginative and let you create whatever objects you wand and have them come to life! Lots of good replayability with Showdown mode and Sandbox levels.
My nieces love playing this game! Fun and entertaining for the whole family!
Kids love this game. No complaints. easy enough for the littles but challenging enough to play with parents.

My wife, kids and I love this game. My kids are 8 and 5, and although the 5yr old still struggles to read (reading/spelling is required) its nothing that a little coaching from mom and dad cant resolve. Like I said... Great Party Game!

This game is a Scribblenauts title and is available on all major consoles today (including PS4 and XBOX One.) I bought this title simply because I'm working to grow my Nintendo Switch collection. In regards to the game itself, it's very generic. It simply fails to capture the magic that made the original Scribblenauts title so enjoyable to play.
Not the best Scribblenauts game out there, but it is worth the price it has dropped to.
My family love playing this together. def recommend
Game got stake very fast. No online hurts it. These Mini games are boring.
It is good game from Nintendo switch for girls age around 9 years
This game is not that good. I don't think that you should buy it

Yes, it shares the name and the look of those previous games, but it lacks the all-important creative heart of its predecessors, and ends up being a by-the-numbers affair that goes through the motions in a shallow attempt to turn Scribblenauts' unique premise into a multiplayer party game.
The stripped-down sandbox may be a disappoint longtime fans, but its an extra feature that adds to a game that would still feel complete without it.
nothing new to see here. its ok. nothing too exciting. i would pass
Expected a party game or at least a classic scribblenauts game but it was neither. Lacks variety
It is a great twist to the original game. Great for kids who have creative minds and bonus of they can read and spell
Its not really fun game unless you have someone to play with, by yourself, not so much.

Being an owner of a PSVR for over two years, I must admit that the library of good games that are available are very limited. Playing Paranormal Activity has been refreshing. The graphics are great, the sound is awesome and the scares are really fun. The game has some issues. One in general is trying to grab objects on the floor and having your hands vanish and you find yourself trying over and over again to grab a key, etc. The other issue is how long it takes to complete the game. It took me roughly 2 hours. At a $20 price point, 2 hrs of gameplay is still a little steep, but between the good story, great atmosphere, and good graphics, Paranormal Activity is worth a check.
I enjoyed this and had a lot of fun on it. Great reason to own a ps4

Wish this game came out during Halloween. Nonetheless it's a great puzzle horror adventurous mystery game. And in VR it matches the platform perfect by reaching your other senses and keeps you involved in the game. Recommended for those who want a nice little gem for the PSVR.
Super creepy environment that brings the movies to life in a horrifying way.

This game captures the jump scares and creepiness of any horror themed game Ive played, maybe even more. The rub is that it uses an incredibly tedious walking system. It uses what used to be called poor-mans scrolling (move a few steps, load, move a few steps, load), and the most awful environment interaction I think Ive ever used. My CDi has more control. If youre thinking about picking this up because you think it would be the perfect game to bring a casual gamer into the VR world (like I did, hoping my wife would enjoy it), you might as well put the 5 bucks towards a tent youll be sleeping in in the back yard. My PS4 was angry at me for loading this stinker. Lousy. *I would recommend this to a friend? *I wouldnt recommend this to an enemy
Good game my wife likes it alot i got this for her bday and she enjoys it

Paranormal Activity for PSVR is a fairly short game, but the price makes up for it. I'm a fan of horror games, and was hopeful that this would at the very least, offer a creepy atmosphere to explore in VR. This has actually ended up being one of my favorite experiences on the PSVR. The game is creepy, the controls work really well, and aside from some initial tracking issues, the game has been a joy to play. Initially I had trouble picking items up off of the ground. Once I moved my camera higher and stepped back a couple of steps, that took care of the tracking issues I faced at first, and tracking has been spot on since. I also realized that in order to pick up some items, you have to use the crouch button to reach low enough. Overall, this is a great creepy game, with lots of atmosphere. There aren't really any difficult puzzles in the game, but you do have to do a good job of exploring to find what you need to progress. If you like eerie atmospheres and exploration, I'd recommend buying Paranormal Activity.
This is what VR us all about. Just like Rush of Blood these games are perfect for VR. Very immersive. No 2 play throughs are the same.
If you like to jump this game is for you, wouldn't suggest someone with a weak heart play this game, lots of jump scares overall a lot of fun to play but not much replay value in it.
I enjoyed the game. It made me jump at times, but I found myself beating it very quickly. It wouldve been better if it was a lot longer.
This got to me because of the VR experience. Having seen the movies, it was like actually playing out an actual movie for me. Experience will vary of course but this got to me.
This game is frightening and the vr only makes it all come to life.
Loved this game, wanted to see how immerse you could get. Would recommend full over the ear headphones when playing for better experience to mono set that comes with ps4.
This game starts out a little slow as many VR games do but as you progress it becomes more intense and the VR experience really comes alive.

Paranormal Activity is you exploring a haunted house with only a flash light. This game requires a PSVR headset and is definitely a fun and haunting experience. Still, if you are looking for a true horror experience, Resident Evil 7 in VR is the way to go.
One of the best horror games for virtual reality. Lots of jump scare. Must buy!

Put on the headphones and enclose yourself in this VR gem. Definitely shows potential in the platform but from problem solving to environment to jump scares, this was a really fun game! Will get your heart racing. Not much replay value, but the initial experience is exactly that....an EXPERIENCE. And one you should not forget. Don't be scared....pick this one up, crank up the volume, and 'live' the story. This is not as good as Resident Evil, but a worthy opponent.
Turn off the lights, close all the blinds, and have a few friends close by. You will have a good time playing this game!
This game has all the fun for VR that you want. Great graphics and jump scares.
Good Vr game for your collection on playstation Vr.
Might wife played the game at night and actually got scared. Great game
I never would have thought VR would be so realistic. A true scare!!
Truly a classic .. one of a kind for us psvr owners
Omg one of the BEST games for VR!!!! *warning* dont play alone!!! Lol

Very buggy game with enemy markers not always working, enemies walking off cliffs or building edges, distracting enemies with rock does not work some of the time. Just full of things you would expect a game developer to be better at. Every time you go to the main menu and then go back to continue the mission, you have to listen to about the entire intro before you can start. Earned enough money to upgrade weapon, but then upgrades aren't on weapon, even though it says equipped; and going back to the main menu to double-check that it was equipped forced me to listen to the mission intro all over again. How about this for stupidity from the developers, for targeting when throwing a rock, grenade, etc. they use the color white as the target radius and aim point and several missions are in snow. so you can't see where you're throwing it. How stupid is that why not make it a bright yellow or orange? I guess this will finally teach me a lesson about pre-ordering a game. Need to let it be out for several weeks and read the reviews. Maybe that's why many game makers are now not letting reviews get published until the release date. It's not due to spoilers as they claim, it's probably because the game has lots of issues and they know it'll get bad reviews.

Hellblade is a tale of a woman who suffers from a mental illness. While it would've been easy for Ninja Theory to create a game that stigmatizes this illness, they handled it with care, taking the player on an emotional journey through the mind of Senua. Along with the superb storytelling, you'll explore beautiful, sometimes dark & mysterious, landscapes that truly push the Xbox One. If you have an Xbox One X, this looks glorious in 4K/HDR.

I dont know why people keep bashing this game , it plays just like COD 4 . the weapons are WW2 weapons but what did you expect with a WW2 game. there are plenty of weapons to choose from you just have to unlock them making it that more challenging. some people say that you start out with junk weapons but that is definately not true and you unlock the MP40 after being promoted after the first few promotions which is one of the best weapons , the next to unlock is the type 100 which is another fast shooting great weapon. people are also grumbling about the tanks because they say they are nearly indestructible which is of course not true. All you have to do is shoot it twice with a rocket launcher amd then a grenade and it is destroyed. this is true 99% of the time. I mean what did you expect ,it is a tank and its not supposed to be killed with a few shots from your gun or a grenade or two , it doesnt happen in real life why should it happen in the game. people also gripe about some of the boards being to dark and bad graphics. look all you have to do is go into the options in the game and go to brightness and turn it up all the way and it will be plenty bright enough ( I guarantee the people that say it is to dark never tried this). and talking about the graphics , the graphics on the game are great people that dont like the game are just trying to find more reasons to bash the game. the artillary strikes you get after 5 streight kills is just awsome much beltter than the air strikes on COD 4 , they are just devastating to an enemy if plced right. all you have to do is wait for one of your teamates to get a recon plane so you can see where the enemy is and then pumel them with your artillary strikes. after 7 streight kills you get to call the dogs to action and this is another great additive . call your dogs and follow them and they will lead you and your teamates to the enemy plus giving you extra kills like the helecopter on COD4. people also say the dogs are nearly indestructibe and this is also not true , you can either shoot them or if you don't want to give your position away kill them with your knife, its that simple , but learn to time your knife attack right or they will kill you , but it only takes a few times to get the hang of it. the boards are also just awsome, they are alot bigger than COD4 giving you more places to hide and move around in stealth to find the enemy. also in march treyarch the creator of the game is coming out with new map packs to download so you will have more boards to play on. ( I CAN'T HARDLY WAIT !!!!!!!!!!! ) . all I can say is that this is a great game and one that I can't wait to get home to play after I get home from work. I will not bash COD 4 because I own this one also and have enjoyed this game for many hours and still play it with my friends, we tend to alternate between the two but COD5 is my favorite. so if you buy this game and I think you should dont give up on it after the first few minutes because the more you play the better it gets , and believe me it is great. for the people that keep posting negative junk they either are not any good at the game or dont have the patience to unlock the better weapons on the game and think it should be handed to them like on COD4 . so dont listen to the negative junk and try it yourself buy it or rent it it doesnt matter you wont be disappointed. what I have just said in this review is based mostly on the online multiplayer part of this game but dont get me wrong the campaign is also one of the best.

A good sequel for COD and first shooter fans. World at War mimics the rewards and rank-up benefits methodology of COD4. The one down note, Activision contracted Treyarch instead of the more highly skilled Infinity Ward to produce this game, and as a result some detail and authenticity suffers. Regardless of which side you fight on, the uniforms all look like wrinkly green G.I. Joe. Contrasting with the brilliant authenticity of Infinity Ward's CODs 2 and 4 this is quite a disappointment. When you're playing the only way to tell friend from foe is the name tag popping up above the character, green letters for friend, red letters for foe. Sometimes this doesn't appear in time to make a crucial decision. Contrasting the uniforms Russian v. German or Japanese v. American would be a great improvement for this game and bring it up closer on par with CODs 2 and 4.

Look, for everyone bagging on the game before it's even come out, get a grip. Have you ever played any of the old school CoD games? Call of Duty 1 and it's expansion pack United Offensive laid the groundwork for what a CoD game should be. UO had vehicles, huge maps, and new weapons. Between UO and CoD2, UO had the better game engine as far as physics and hit detection. CoD2 was a good game, but it got rid of two things UO had gotten right: sprint and vehicles. CoD3 was alright, it was poorly implemented. CoD4 is probably the best game in the series to date. Best campaign I've played, most diverse multiplayer I've played. CoD5 is just going back to the roots of Call of Duty. How can you complain about being able to n00b it up with a flamethrower, or vehicle camp/spam like none other? It adds a new, challenging dimension to the game and I honestly can't believe why people are knocking on it. Since it's using the CoD4 engine, it's basically a full conversion mod for Modern Warfare. It also covers a theater of WWII CoD hasn't touched yet. Bottom line: New perks + new weapons + 4 player co-op + new gameplay + new storyline + vehicles + game engine that's seen successful action = Game of the year shoo-in and NO reason to be complaining about it.

COD:Waw is the better pick of the two. People that say COD:4 is better are probably sniping someone right now because they are scared of a little action. I'll admit that the spawning system in Waw is flawed and a sometimes you are spawn killed. DRINK WATER! The only reason that is happening is because someone on the opposing team is pressing the action and kicking your teams butt! It is good to make some friends that regularly play this game and that you can rely on to have your back. That way you are never playing with a bunch of nublets and 10 year olds that are more worried about sniping and shooting nub tubes. You have to learn what perks and weapons work best with what maps. That is why the prestige system is so much better. The more classes you can create, the more options you have to switch to mid-match. But if you are playing by yourself, they have mercenary match options where there are no parties allowed. COD:Waw keeps the pace going in each match. Rewards for kills are also alot better in this game becasue there are few places you can hide from a pack of dogs. Nub snipers never win in this game, if you're team has more than 1 or 2 snipers, get out of there because you are about to get beat!
