Burnout Paradise remains as fun as when it came out on Xbox360/PS3 more than 11 years ago. The graphics look mostly like original version except run native on Xbox1. Best is the install size isn't like all Xbox1 games that require often require 50-100+GB hard drive space. Remastered Burnout Paradise 7.6GB Install+159.73MB Update. It's good that EA didn't turn Burnout Paradise install into 20-50GB like many remastered games. Some games made for both Xbox1 and Xbox360 require 50GB install on Xbox1 version while Xbox360 version 8-16GB optional install while Xbox1 version graphics don't look that much better.

I had the original, but this version is fully enhanced for the latest hardware, comes with all the DLC, and is simply a lot of fun to drive, without the mandatory milestones that other games of this genre often have.

I will admit I am a car freak. Every chance I get to jump behind the wheel I take it. But sometimes the weather gets in the way, or maybe you're not allowed to cross the state line. You can fulfill your desire and this game does a great job.

Burnout is an amazing game. Its super fast paced and visually stunning to look at. I have spent hours racing and destroying cars and it still draws me back to it about once a month. Its a definite purchase for the price. Id recommend to fans of the original and people that just enjoy fast paced action games. Will for sure keep your attention for a long while.

My Children Live and Breathe XBOX, You can never have enough Games, And when There On Sale, They are Johnny On the Spot. Great Race Car Game, And Amazing Graphics. Plus On Sale. No Negatives, All Positives. Thank You Best Buy, You always Deliver. And have the Best Selection And the Best Prices.

While this may not have been the BEST burnout in the series, it offered someone new. Tons of cars, a beautiful island to explore, and better wrecks. This game was a big part of my childhood, or just the burnout series as a whole, so youre dad-gum right I bought this beautiful game! And I recommend you do the same

For years I've played the Burnout series, Burnout 3 and Burnout Paradise were two of my favorite games out of them. After getting the Platinum for Burnout Paradise on PS3, I felt a sense of accomplishment, but also empty due to the fact I couldn't afford any of the DLC. Fast forward to early this year, and upon hearing the news of Burnout Paradise getting a remaster, I cried tears of joy. I immediately pre ordered and patiently waited for it's release. Being a huge fan of the game, I was excited to play it in true 4K, and man, does it look good. The game still holds up today, and I finally was able to play the DLC! This game brought back so many memories, and I can't wait for play it for years to come.
I bought this as a gift and have not tried it yet. It looks similar to the older game 'Driver' that I used to play and love. I am hoping it is as enjoyable of a game.

I remember playing Burnout Paradise on the Xbox 360, and it did some things right and wrong. The open world was a plus and the environment was great, but the gameplay felt like it was a step back from Burnout 3 Takedown and Burnout Revenge. Now we have the remaster, which kind of makes the lacking gameplay stick out a little more with a more polished environment. Its not a bad game, it just feels outdated gameplay wise compared to other racing games.
This game is meant for meat-heads whove never heard of any other real racing games
This game was not the burnout that i thought it was, the one where you rack up money when you crash.

The remastered version is fine. My complaint with this game is the same as the original, the crashing is my favorite part of this series and it just really isn't a major part of this game. Other than that, it is fine.
Reminds me of Need for Speed. Enjoy the crashes and boost. Need to play more to get a full review.

I was excited when Nintendo announced the HD remake of this game. And even more excited when they made it a Wii U select and dropped the price. I now own this game in 3 diff releases, and not upset at all. This game is a pleasure to play.

The cartoon whimsy is charming but ultimately this game world feels empty. The sailing is improved over the original by going twice as fast but you still spend too much time sailing thru empty seas getting from island to island only to be sent back the other way.
GREAT REMAKE OF WINDWAKER , THE ADDITION OF THE WIIU PAD OF INVERTORY AND MAP IS SO COOL

I'm one of the people who always preferred Wind Waker to every other Zelda, especially 3D Zelda's. IMO, it just had a lot more charm than the more 'realistic' looking Zelda's. If you've played this before and enjoyed it or never played it at all, I'd recommend grabbing this version regardless. This is hands down one of the prettiest looking games I've ever played, it's a bargain at its new low price, and they've fixed some of the issues in the original Wind Waker.

It is not a new edgy game, but it uses a great system from other combat games such as 'Assassin's creed, Batman, Ryse (son of Rom) as well as other games. It's an open world, go anywhere anytime with no loading screens, except starting missions. If you want to be surrounded by 30 plus Uruki at once this is the game you need to get. It isn't bogged down by the LOTR story line, it is a good story with a lot of killing. A good game to just have fun.
Very much like Assassin's Creed as far as game play. Graphics are outstanding, and story line is very engaging. Highly recommended.
Such a good game which definitely helps break up the every day shooter. Would recommend to anyone.

I have returned to my younger, unmarried, child-free days by becoming completely immersed in this game. It is fun and challenging and definitely not for children! I can unleash my inner dark side by unleashing stealth attacks upon unsuspecting foes... and feel great about it. At times the XBox controls (left analog) are a little finicky, hence a 4/5 instead of a full 5. Very worthwhile and if you are a LoTR fan, you will enjoy some of the historical back story.

Maybe I should have done more research before purchasing this game. Shadow of Mordor is the reason I bought an Xbox One. However, I was disappointed to discover it follows the Arkham Asylum-esque battle systems we see so much anymore. That may make me biased in my review since i absolutely hate that system as it's always so slow and clunky but I failed to get very far into the game because of it. For fans of the fighting mechanics of the Batman games I would definitely recommend this. Anyone else I would say to give it a pass.

The DLC campaigns that are now on the disc for this edition and add very interesting twists to the gameplay of Shadow of Mordor. Frankly, it would have been nice to have some of these elements in the main campaign, but this would have changed the game significantly, so its understandable that the developers didn't do this. The stories in these campaigns aren't deep, so lore fans may be disappointed. In addition there are challenging 'Test of' modes that make you complete certain tasks within a time limit. I found these tests very compelling despite how long they took and how difficult they could be. I enjoyed mastering the techniques needed to do well. Others might find it frustrating. All together, I'm glad I picked up this version of Mordor with all the additional content, especially at the great price I got it from Best Buy.

Shadow of Mordor follows Talion as he seeks revenge on those who killed his family. The gameplay is a mix between the recent Batman series (free flow combat) and Assassin's Creed. The game does a great job of immersing you into the world of LOTR, and does a great job of telling a solid story. You won't quite find the combat up to Batman standards, but it is a lot of fun. The open world experience is really where the action stands out. There's plenty of quests to enjoy and with the game of the year edition, there's probably 40+ hours of content if you want to experience everything.
Thisproductisgoodandiwouldreccomendittowhoeveridc.
It's like Assassin's Creed in many ways, however it does add its own unique style. I love the combat system and the visuals are fantastic highly recommended.
great game play, action and strategy. my 7 yr old even enjoyed it.
Game was amazing but the extended edition was not worth it for the extra money. The game was so long that by the end I had no interest in the extras.
Not a good game just by looking at the cover. It has a horrible cover set up and not enough game details. I would not recommend this game to anyone.

As stated above this will be a review of the contents of the box only NOT the game as I have not had enough time playing it to provide a fair and well informed Software review. The Rune Factory Archival edition, in addition to the game includes a music CD, artbook, and DLC voucher. i would also like to add that the included 41 page instruction booklet is a pleasant bonus for anybody not purchasing the game digitally. The Musical CD although not the full 94 track OST (track number estimated from the original game release) does offer a fairly generous 36 track music selection. For those unaware these type of collections usually only include 3-10 track musical demos on CD More extensive musical selections are usually reserved for for download only if offered at all. In addition the majority of the tracks included have been a joy to listen to. Next we have the artbook. This, I believe, is where this collection gets its name from. The book contains art, design, and notes(in english) spanning the entire rune factory series up to this point. At approximately 160 pages this book is the size and volume of a novella and is packed full of beaut drawings on good quality (to my inexperienced eyes) pages. Last we have the DLC which I have yet to experience due to my limited time with the game. However, my understanding is that this content is almost exclusively a series of short visual novel experiences revolving around each of the romance-able NPC characters. If so its value will likely depend on your enjoyment from that type of game. I find myself enjoying finding out more about a series that up until now I had barely any interest. The artbook and the fun Ive had so far with the game has piqued my interest. My only nitpick is in the content of the CD. I think it might have been more fitting for the selection to, like the artbook, feature music from all previous games in the series. I enjoy what was provided in quality, variety, and quantity but I cannot help but feel this was a missed opportunity to transform this package into an indispensable look back at the history of the series for fans both new and old. In conclusion I have enjoyed the extra content beyond the $20 higher price tag from the standard and digital edition of the game. Ultimately though I believe those who will value these extras the most will be existing fans, but that doesnt mean potential new fans wont be able to find enjoyment from them. I know I did.

I just purchased and received this today so I will admit that I have NOT played it today because I am dealing with exams right now. :( But the reason I am giving this 5 stars is because I received this in perfect condition as promised without any damages at all and everything completely intact. Thank you so much for making sure this was undamaged. Everyone, please DO NOT mark this review as unhelpful. If you have questions regarding how hard the game is or how fun it is, I will give you a definitive answer as soon as I play it but I will answer your question. But don't flag/mark as unhelpful my review just because I'm dealing with exams and haven't had a chance to play. Really not fair to do that.
The game is amazing! If youre a fan of Harvest Moon and Stardew Valley then you will love this! Overall an amazing experience
Played the 3DS version and excited to already sink 20 hours into this game!

A fantastic game to play while you wait for animal crossing ;p. I just got it today and cannot put it down. Super fun gameplay involving farming, rpg elements, combat, talking to villagers and running your own town. super fun game and i cannot wait for rune factory 5. super worth your $!
Boring and easy game, Mark cerny should stick to hardware

My wife and I are always looking for co-op games to play that don't result in a competitive shouting match. Knack 2 does a great job of being user friendly to those great at platforming and not so great at it. In co-op mode, you can automatically teleport to where your teammate is if you're having trouble with a series of jumps or obstacles. Outside of that, beautiful world, responsive controls, fun story. Great game.

I really enjoyed the first Knack. I'm not a hardcore gamer, more into sports games and simple ones I can place with a group of friends so Knack is a great game to pickup and play at anytime that isn't too difficult but still quite fun. Knack 2 just adds onto it and had a more wide spread storyline, a little harder difficulty, and just as fun play with new moves.
This game and it's predecessor are a fun ride for all ages. Don't be fooled by its cutesy appearance the gameplay is fun and it's good for a couch co-op.

Like the few, not afraid to admit it but I enjoyed the first back when it first released and received tons of criticism by journalist who sucked at it or games in general (typical). I beat the first in all difficulties well anything above Easy. Now this, it isnt as challenging as the first but it remains as an enjoyable platformer/brawler. I definitely recommend it. GOTY right lol. Nah but seriously, its fun and if you got a family member or friend then let them grab the second controller for double the fun.
Continuation of what done before on Knack I. If you're in the market for a nice platformer then you can't gone wrong with Knack II.
If you played the original Knack you know how this one is. More of the same platform type game. The graphics are excellent and the gameplay is fun.

I was a big fan of the original but this is better in many ways. The graphics are crisper and a really cool feature is c-op play so you can play with a friend who is over to battle the enemies that lie ahead. Good Game!
The graphic is pretty good. The gameplay is smooth.

Somehow this was at 31st my doorstep days before release. I am an avid couch co up player and this is shaping up to be one of the best in ps4. The controls are responsive and all make sense. A great action game 3 hours in. I am very happy to say it's more than I hoped for.
You are not living life until you play knack 2!!!!
Knack is hmmm you either love it or loathe it...i loathe it.
My 9 years old prefer the knack 1 better. He said he didnt enjoy this one very much.

As a fan of the Yakuza series I was a little hesitant to give this one a try but after spending almost 30 hours Im glad I did. This game does a great job making you feel like a detective that skirts the boundaries of the law to get necessary information. The story is pretty good and for the most part the game looks and runs good too. Im playing on a Pro and while the frame rate does drop at times its not enough to take away from the experience. Another minor issue I have is the game is not Pro enhanced at all meaning you will see jaggies everywhere if you are playing on a 4K tv. The English voice acting is not good despite the voice actors best efforts. Its hard to listen to Yakuza bosses speak with a western cowboy twang and where there should be inflections in the dialogue at times its nowhere to be found. It all feels off. Id recommend playing with the Japanese voices and your native language subtitles. The fighting mechanics feel a little bland but otherwise provide suitable entertainment. It never gets old smashing enemies faces in with bikes, road cones or flashing signs. If you are a newcomer to the series then this is a wonderful entry to the game style Yakuza is well known for. You dont have to play any of the Yakuza games to understand whats going on and for the fans then youll be pleased to know the city of Kamurocho is alive and thriving. The dramatic story is full of twists and surprises. The graphics are amazing and youll often forget youre playing a game during cut scenes. If you own a PS4 and have a remote interest in these types of games then youll have a good time with Judgment.
Im not that far in the game yet. But, Im really enjoying this game a lot.
My kids loved it. Graphics are awesome. They won't stop playing it.
This game plays similar to the Yakuza series but instead of being a gangster , you play the role of an ex lawyer turned Private investigator. Great gameplay and graphics that bring to life Japan.
I enjoy all fighting it reminds me of yakuza kiwami but game is in English thats a plus. I like you pick choice to question they ask you and bonus.

If you've never tried out a Yakuza game because your overwhelmed by how many there are or don't like reading subtitles, this is a great place to see how the formula works in English!! It has it's differences, being a standalone spin-off, but it captures what makes those games great and has a great English dub. The original Japanese voice tracks are still available for fans of that more authentic vibe too. Loads of content. Great action. Definite must-play.
Im only at chapter 2 but its an awesome game so far. If your a fan of the yakuza series or just looking for a good single player game to play with a good story I highly recommend picking this up

Judgment is technically not a sequel to anything, but it's basically a Yakuza game (and even takes place in Kamurocho like those games do). That said, you don't have to have any previous knowledge in order to enjoy this game. You play as a lawyer-gone-detective and are tasked with solving cases that the plot puts before you. In doing so, you may find yourself getting involved in fisticuffs with random gang members. The combat is great and makes interesting use of the environment (such as using the swing set at a playground to kick a dude in the face). The investigation portion of it doesn't add much to the experience, but it's a nice change of pace from the usual Yakuza antics. If you get bored of the main plot, there are plenty of side activities (though sadly karaoke isn't one of them). Highly recommended!

I love how they are combining Detective Conan & Phoenix Wright into one game! The main character is pretty awesome the whole story is amazing and the side missions never bore I can't stop talking about how good this game is!!! I usually don't like a lot of fighting in single player games because of the way they fight *as in the controls suck for fighting or fighting just isn't that good* Batman Arkham games & Marvels Spiderman along with God of War has had the best fighting for me currently! But Judgement is up there too now no powers so he's like Batman a bit for me which is why I love it even more! All the other characters in the story are pretty amazing the girl that works in that law place reminds me of Hibiki *Anime* *Movie* worth watching! The whole story feels real with the characters real reactions like they are surprised when they should be at death and not giving a lame reaction to it. I love how you can fly drones around too and take pictures in the game lol along with the chasing down and tailing people as well the boss fights are fun too!!! LOVE when a game like this has good boss fights not everyone does them correctly or make them fun enough and challenging. Lastly, I recommend this game to anyone who wants Law, Detective Work, & Fighting involved in all one game SEGA really hit it out of the park with this Main story, side missions, characters. So freaking good!! I am in Chapter 2 now of the game so fun I don't want it to end trust me you won't regret buying this if you are looking for Detective & Fighting related stuff the Law involved was just a bonus and makes it even better!

You will love it! The story so far is great, gameplay is almost the same as Yakuza with a little twist here and there such as tailing and chasing people. Graphics might seem a little bit outdated, but most of the yakuza fans are in for the story and beat em up gameplay. The features seem to be better than other Yakuza. Theres voice over for every main story quest unlike Yakuza. Theres also English voice-over but I prefer Japanese voice with English subtitle.
Excellent game to play in this summer, 100% recommended Btw give me my Best Buy points :,(

It doesn't have robust or branching skill tree of fighting like Yakuza 0 or the food exp system like the Kiwami. The art style is definitely lighter in tone but the game world and locations are noticeably shallower in both depth and detail. The voice acting, that is the english dub, is fine when it pops up. The problem is that only does 25% of the time. Outside of Main Story cutscenes, there is no dub or it is found piecemeal and jarred between different lines of opposite characters. There is literally a scene where you solve a case for TWINS SITTING NEXT TO EACHOTHER and one of them speaks perfect english and the speaks completely in japanese in front of the player character who also speaking english. There is another scene where there is a Musician who greets her audience IN ENGLISH and then proceeds to sing entirely in the japanese dub, returning to english after. There are too many examples of this. SEGA wants people to believe they didn't cheap out on the dub by hiring union va's but the reality is that they cut corners literally EVERYWHERE ELSE. To add, I'm talking about both branches of SEGA who worked in tandem to decide these choices especially seeing that they chose in the past to digitally edit out several of their 3D models to erase the likeness of an individual associated with criminal activity, in a game series about YAKUZA and DETECTIVES. That takes more time and money out of their profits after the fact than finishing the dub properly. They were even deceptive enough to toss a survey in the direction of all current owners of the game asking if the dub was passable in a thinly veiled series of questions to excuse not paying for a dub in the future most likely.
the game was not what i expected. the game is not that fun
I really enjoy all Yakuza games so when I heard about this title I had to buy it
Sick port to the Nintendo Switch, dont be a dummy, buy the ticket, take the ride.

Doom was one of the best games released in 2016. Now it is available for the Nintendo Switch, and the experience is just as good as it was on other consoles last year. The Switch port has graphical compromises as it is essentially a tablet, but once you start slaying demons on the go you'll quickly realize that they are well worth it. Doom is worth being played on any console, but only on Switch will you be able to play it portably. Overall this is a fantastic port and while playing it on my Switch I couldn't help but keep looking at the system itself and wondering how it could play this game. Definitely recommend as it is a fantastic game, and also a showpiece for what the diminutive Switch is capable of.

I haven't played DOOM on other platform but switch ver definitely looks and plays great. The shooting is relentless but there are maps you can explore and secrets to find I think many people will find it fun and addictive. Must have game!

I'm having a blast with this game. They nailed the multiplayer, and the game is so much fun to take on the game. I owned the Xbox version of this, and yes, the graphics aren't as good on the switch, yes it runs at 30fps vs 60 (although I honestly don't notice the difference too much to be honest), but it still runs great! You'd be a fool to expect the exact same performance as ps4/xbox. Definite must buy for switch owners, especially if you never owned last year's version.

I have only played Doom in handheld mode, so I have yet to see how it runs on a TV. I am beyond impressed with how it runs on handheld mode. It is evident many compromises have been made to accommodate such a taxing game on what is essentially an NVIDIA Shield tablet, but the experience is excellent. Motion blur is utilized to smooth out any choppy frame drops that occur from time to time. I have played about five hours in the campaign on a fully charged Switch, and after two the battery was at 55%, so if you take this on the go, have a back up battery or your charger handy. The controls are smooth but it takes a minute to get used to pressing down on the right stick for action. Overall, I strongly recommend this game to any Switch owner that has any desire to see more FPS and third-party titles on the system. It's not every day you see a fully-realized triple A game on Nintendo hardware. I will update this review once I dock the system and play it on my TV.
All I can say is they did it they put a AAA port of Doom on a portable console and it looks and plays great!

This is the only game I have ever played that had a good reason to reboot. The original is awesome, but the advances in technology allow for much better 3d immersion. The original soundtrack was kept but improved on. All this makes for a more horrific experience made all the more satisfying when you see those demons blown apart.

Doom on Switch is marvelous as it provides the awesome Doom experience with flexibility to be at home or on the go. Also, the inclusion of gyro-controls makes it the best version if you don't have as a priority graphics and resolution.
I have been banned online because of my kids but the game runs solid from what Ive seen
Great game to play for 1 player. Looks just as great as the doom game of ps4

I love Doom and already owned the Game for the Xbox One. When i found out that Doom was going to be released for the Nintendo Switch I couldn't believe it. I had to double dip and buy the Switch version so I can take Doom anywhere. I was not disappointed. Now I can shoot demons while on my work breaks. The game looks and plays just like the Doom we all know and love. Sure it's only 720p in handheld mode and only runs at 60 fps but who cares...why? Because I'm holding portable DOOM in my hands and can play DOOM anywhere I want. Not only is the campaign good but the Switch version also includes Arcade Mode and Online Multiplayer. Is it worth full price for a game that's been out for over a year on other systems? Well, that's the nice thing about being a Gamers Reward member. I got $10,00 back for reserving Mario Odessey and used it towards Doom along with my 20% discount. Not bad. Making a game like Doom look and play the way it does gives me hope that we'll get to see other cool shooting games in the future for the Switch.
To see this running on a handheld system is amazing. Cant wait to see what the future of the switch have.
Ok, Doom might not run as smooth as the other versions but is still a really good game which everyone could enjoy, and is portable!
Very clunky and not interesting at all. Would not recommend.
Just get the PS4 or Xbox version. The switch port is not great.

I recommend this game for people who have or haven't played this game. It's fun, awesome and even better it's portable now! Story is awesome and the multiplayer online is pretty good. Of coarse the graphics and resolution were to bed down But even then I really enjoy it. I really don't think it's worth $60 it's pretty much cheaper on every other platform, but if you have gamers program 20% off!
Awsome tv and couldnt be happier. Image and color is more than i expected. I actually got it for a steal because it was a open box item.
My daughter loves this game very happy with price and perches!
What a game. Doom is incredible and having it portable is great.

I can't believe I waited so long to play DOOM 2016. This is a great port. Multiplayer environments and some menu images and models can look a little muddy, but seeing a game run like this on the Switch is astounding.
A quality port! Great graphics and online multiplayer!
I still can't believe they fit this game on the Nintendo Switch . Awesome!!!!

With the latest update Bethesda forces you to download an 8 gig update to play the single player campaign. The update includes the multiplayer. it took me roughly 2 hours before I could play the game, that is unacceptable. During the marketing of the game Bethesda said the single player would be on the cartridge and the multiplayer was an optional download. Apparently that is not the case, Bethesda is forcing you to download the multiplayer to play the single player. This is draconian, they don't let you choose
This game looks amazing on the switch, I already have doom pre order and cant wait to play it on the go.
Great purchase experience and Im totally happy with my purchase.

I double dipped on this, But it is DOOM on a portable system. It's glorious even though the game is not without it's technical issues. Frame rate is at 30 most times, graphics aren't as sharp as on other consoles. But when you're playing you really don't notice most of this stuff cause the game is intense and engaging.

It's cool to see a great, AAA, 3rd Party FPS get a portable version on Switch; but this port feels rushed, and suffers from some annoying bugs. I suppose my first complaint is subjective, as it has to do with graphic fidelity, but here it goes.. there is a fine line to walk when trading off graphics/frame-rate for portability, in my opinion, they failed here.... the reality is, Doom is a fast paced shooter, even in single player campaign, and while the 30 fps cap (and quite a few dips below) doesn't ruin the game on it's own, the reduced/scaling field of view, apparent motion blur (turning this off in settings doesn't seem to help) combined with the dark/low-lit nature of the game, makes it difficult to enjoy. My second complaint is more objective, with no room for argument... there are MAJOR audio glitches in this port. I've experienced frequent, random LOUD buzzing sounds throughout the few hours I've played; and at about a 3rd through the level 'Argent Energy Tower' had the audio completely go out. I hope that they can at least fix these audio problems with a patch soon; and perhaps I will update my review at that time, but as of writing this, this port is not worth the buy... especially since better versions exist on other platforms, often on sale for a 3rd of the price or less (INB4 'but it's portable!' - yes, and so are many AAA games of the past on iOS/android, but I can't be bothered with most of those either because the overall/consistent experience isn't there).

I owned this same title on my xbox one and traded it in after a few days because I was disinterested. Now the same game on a handheld has me picking it up and trying to advance levels all the time. Great game on the switch
Port looks great considering its playing on essentially a tablet. Never played on any other system, however, so I have nothing to compare it to.

This game is fun, fast, and great! It looks impressive on the Switch! Sure, it doesnt have the exact same graphics as the PS4, but the small dip in graphics is worth having DOOM in my hands wherever I want! Great game!
Good game and now I can take with me anywhere I go.
It is a Very cool game. I think it is Worth buying it.

The Switch version of Doom is the worst version, worst framerate, worst visuals, worst controls, and it's the highest priced at $60. PC, PS4, and Xbone all have it for ~$15, maybe less if you look hard enough.
Very clunky game and not interesting at all. Not recommend
PlayStation Four graphics way better but not bad for a hand held !

Real intense fighting combined with the requirement to figure things out. Definitely for mature gamers, thus the M rating. I love the sounds that really scare me sometimes, and the music helps me know when I finally got all those enemies. The mapping is kinda confusing but that is part of what makes it good. Good graphics, with lots of stuff to shoot at, and to find. Good guns, and good names for the guns, shatter does just that!

Great action game that could be classified as Horror as the setting and some of its themes relate to the supernatural but without going into ridiculous territory. Teleportation, mind manipulation, astral planes and a weird infectious entity known as the Hiss from another dimension inside a transforming building. Some of the mechanics have been present in other games but the unique look and feel of the game makes it all very special and different. It has some elements of the 'Metroidvania' genre, but overall its a satisfying game for anyone curious enough to try something different.

Great localized version of Peach Ball. Seriously fun pinball game with Senran Kagura characters. Very Mature and not for kids. This is the kind of game that makes you wish the Switch had folders. Highly recommend this to anyone who loves pinball and doesn't mind adult themes.

i love pinball machines and i love gifted women ;) put those two together and you got my money! i been a fan of senran kagura for years. i bought many senran kagura games on the 3ds and the vita. many of their games now go for $80 or more on amazon and ebay. i also love the manga. boy do i love the senran kagura manga!! nothing much to say about this game. it's a decent pinball game WITH a Senran Kagura theme! whats not to like?!
Not much needs to be said if your looking at this. It's Senran Kagura mixed with pinball. First time playing pinball in years, and it's worth it if you want a fun time killer and pretty girls!
This game is a naughty game and I love it because its very different. If you like pinball and girls this is the game for you

The best thing about this game is it's very light and silly tone. It does not take itself seriously at all... in the best possible way of course! The characters that you interact with are, in my opinion, real easy to like. My personal favorite is Asuka. The way you can customize you characters is quite fun too. The opening animation was really well done(In both sound, energy and looks). The game itself looks bright, colorful, weird and most of all charming. The games controls are excellent. The gameplay was quite solid too. If you couldn't already tell, I really, really like this game! This game is, kinda obvioulsy, not everyone's cup of tea... but it most certainly is mine.
an adult themed pinball that encourages tilt in its gameplay.
I mean you would only want this if you are weeb trash. Otherwise if you want a pinball game then this is one. Perfect for your grandparents.

This is the original Snipperclips with an extra DLC and my nieces and I had an absolute blast with this game. You can play with just the simple little joy cons. There is the little mini competitive games you could play and if I had one complaint I wish they lasted longer. There is a 1/2 player co op puzzles to solve and a free mode to paint. Excellent for younger gamers.

I bought this game so my wife (who does not play video games) would have something simple to play with me on the Switch. To that end, this game is pretty good. There are a lot of cooperative puzzles that we can work together to solve, the animations are cute, and it's fun to cut each other to pieces every once in awhile. The drawback to this game for me (not to most others, I'm sure) is that all of the other game modes are competitive, and my wife will never be as good as I am at them so they are just sort of wasted (the way I'm playing this game). It would be nice if there were even MORE cooperative puzzles. Definitely worth the price, though!
This skill game has my two boys working together to solve problems and they think theyre just playing, its awesome!

We have a fairly large family and last night we had my 10 yr old, my 13 yr old, my 22 yr old and myself at 51 years old playing together and we all loved it. The 4 player levels we played were a lot of fun and while the puzzles arent too hard to figure out WHAT to do, they are just enough of a challenge (to get everyone clipped into the right shape and in the right places) to keep you engaged. I love the cooperation aspect of the game where we all have to work together and its not a problem if someone makes a mistake and trims too much off the other person. All that person does is hold a button to reset their character and then get clipped again. Im looking forward to playing again with my kids tonight! No guns, no killing but if you need a little more action and want to run around the screen chasing each other and snipping your teammates to shreds, go for it! They respawn and the chase it on again! Lots of fun for us, we love it!

My kids and I have had tons of fun playing this game together. It's easy to get into, but keeps throwing new twists and interesting puzzles at you that encourage collaboration. There are multi-player options for 2 players and 3-4 players with the puzzles being adjusted for the higher player count. Each round typically takes just a few minutes, so it's easy to play when you have a few minutes spare. It's not for the hard core crowd, but overall this is a really cute game that provides lots of fun family time and great value for the modest price.

Snipperclips is exactly the kind of game you want to own for your Switch. It's perfect in shorter play sessions for on the go or simply at home with friends/family on the couch. It's primarily a puzzle game where you control a character in the form of a piece of paper and 'snip' or cut out pieces of yourself or your partner to create various shapes that will help you solve puzzles of different types. They do a good job mixing up the different ways you'll need to use the mechanic to solve these bite sized puzzles and it never felt boring or overdone. The game doesn't overstay its welcome, but also offers plenty of levels to make your way through. I completed it entirely with a friend and we really enjoyed the game; it left us wanting more too! There are some other mini-game type modes included which offer up some more competitive fun if you're interested in that. Highly recommend you pick this up!

This is one of the best puzzle games on the switch. It is so creative and such fun to play either alone or with friends. There is the normal puzzle mode for 1-2 people, but there is also a section of group puzzles for 2-4 people. These have several solutions to solve because you can cut into a variety of shapes. How you solve the puzzle is up to you which is the fun. There is also some fun mini games like basketball, and a versus mode where you try to cut the other player until they don't have enough paper left to survive. This includes the dlc with more content in it. I have had this game since the release of the switch. We ordered this copy for my Nephew and he absolutely loves it too.
game is a good thinking game for kids and they liked it very much
This is a great game to play with friends and family. I originally bought this game on the eshop, but I prefer physical cartridges. Also this game has the dlc included so more fun levels!
Such a fun game to play with a friend. Glad they released the plus version
an amazing fun co op game the only reason it dont get five stars lack of online play
This is a great social game to play with friends or family, it's been a blast with my wife. However, don't spend over 20 bucks for this game, not worth more than that.

If you're a survival horror fan, you owe it to yourself to check this game out. It's like a combination of The Last of Us, Silent Hill, and Resident Evil all combined. If you haven't played the first game, don't worry as it's not required. However, you'd be doing yourself a great disservice if you skip it as it is quite excellent as well. This game has it all: brutal combat, terrifying & grotesque enemies, atmospheric soundtrack, and a great story. Also, if you have played the first game, played on normal or a higher difficulty, be sure to play this one on Nightmare as the difficulty has been reduced some.
Finished the first one and this one is just as fun and scary!
Love the game, love the creator. Always support Shinji.
One thing: this game has flaws, but overall if you played the first one you knew what you were getting into!!!! A great gift for a little spook before Halloween! Well received in my opinion!
This is a must have, way better than the first, buy it
My bro said he didnt like the first one but i haven't played so i cant judge. Based on gameplay reviews the game is twisted enough to buy in opinion if you like stuff like this

I had mixed feelings about the first one, but while this one starts off slow, it definitely picks up and gets interesting, with plenty of scares and gore. I would recommend it after it drops in price.

I HAD FORGOTTEN THIS GAME WAS COMING OUT; PICKED IT UP THE DAY IT CAME OUT IN THE END. MUCH BETTER THAN THE FIRST ONE IN MY OPINION PLUS WITH THE GAMER CLUB DISCOUNT IT WAS A GREAT DISCOUNT TO GET IT.
Pretty bland main character and ok story get if you liked the first one

I loved the first game but I know it has its flaws. The second is miles better than the first and a lot less linear. Think of if Resident Evil and Silent Hill had a baby, thats this game. About 10 hours in and only about halfway thru. If you want a good horror game for the Halloween season then pick this up! I highly recommend playing the first before though.
This game is like dying light but without the parkour. Another clone of the survival/stealth games that are a dime a dozen. It did make me jump pretty bad from a shock scare enemy.

I was able to beat this game in 5 hours. It's nothing like the first one. It's overly easy, way to shot and not at all creepy or scarey if your looking for horror. Don't bother paying full price for it just red box it and beat it within a day. Story is lacking as well extremely disappointed in this game.

If you loved part one, part two will it disappoint you. It is full of scary and difficult bosses. Play on hard for the best challenge. This is one game you want to play at night.

I may be a little biased as I play a lot of games and tend to gravitate to the biggest franchises. But the mechanics of movement and even the storytelling really suck. I like the idea of the story so far and will definitely keep playing but so far it is just tedious and boring. This reminds me of some of the low budget games of the past. I already regret spending the money on this game. I wonder if Best Buy would take it back for a full refund if I returned it in the first day or so????
Game is crazy and action packed. Better than the first game.
Better than first game. Many improvements. Good horror game.
A heart attack waiting to happen. as spooky as they come!
I like the evil within when it came out and now evil within 2 is here i going to buy it and enjoy this horror experience..
One of the scariest games I played so far. The first one was just as good.
Ive been waiting for this game to be released for a very long time!! Im so happy. I love this
As great as the first evil within game . Great story and creepy environments

If you're a fan of Part 1, The Evil Within, I suggest you stick with that. This was flat out boring.
Great story If your into thrill and horror you'll enjoy
The game has creativity in spades, but gameplay is only passable.
Love this game. Better then the first game. Would recommend this game.
To the original. While part one was frustrating it was unique. Three chapters in i lost interest in the main story line.

I actually like this game a lot so far. I have played a few quests and have ventured into the new main game territory. I will probably update this later if I have any different opinion but wanted to get this out to offset the 1 star review so far. I can say the start is a slow burn but I think the main story and side quests are actually very well thought out and can conclude in a number of ways which I like. There is also loot, character customization, and 'Fashion Souls' if you like that kinda thing. The clothing and jewelry you wear can provide benefits to your character which is good. Unfortunately, it does lose 1 star for a few reasons. The game does not have a jump action which I think is a bad choice for an open world game in 2019. Vertical navigation is usually done by falling or moving up stairs or ramps (usually rock debris in a ramp form) but geez Louise jumping would be nice. Furthermore and like the other reviewer here, the combat controls are wonky and a little hard to get used to. At this time in video game evolution, if you are not incorporating Souls-like button mapping with your similar Souls-like combat design, you are stuck in the PS2 era. To add insult to injury, you cannot customize the controls on the PS4 either. Blurgh! Anyway, it's Eurojanky but I do think the graphics are very good, quests are good, loot is good, but controls could be better. Spiders-You Did Good!

It's true that GreedFall has some serious problems with variety and bizarrely re-used assets, the story is ok and the combat and game systems are mediocre at best. Anyone willing to look past its problems and dig into the story will likely have an alright time with it. Best bet is to wait for it to drop to the 19.99 mark.

At time of review, I am about 30 hours into the game. Graphics: Pros: Some of the areas are really pretty looking and comparable to a AAA game. Cons: On the PS4 it does not look great 50% of the time. Lots of pop ins and texture rendering. Facial animations and cutscenes are sometimes painfully bad(think Mass Effect Andromeda). Story: Pros: Pretty interesting premise. Not similar to another storyline I can recall ever playing before in an RPG. Lots of the side mission story's play into the main mission story. Several ways to approach missions. Dialogue will change depending on who you bring in your party and can effect your relationship status with party members. Cons: The poor graphics unfortunately sometimes affect my enjoyment of the story. The camera is super janky when in dialogue scenes(going through people, odd angle on characters faces, no mouth movement, etc). Also, super repetitive dialogue (the natives repeat the same lines over and over at each tribe you visit, and so does your character). There are some fetch quests before you get info out of people-typical RPG stuff. Gameplay/Combat: Pros: Several ways to approach missions and how you approach will sometimes be dependent on what skills you are building your character with. Warrior, mage, and a mix of gunslinger/rogue/scientist?, are the general classes, but they all really bleed into one another, and can mix it up. I enjoy the so called boss battles. That is when combat feels the best. Lots of armor and weapons to choose from. Can customize them to an extent. Cons: Combat is not that fun to me and got old quick, even with the multiple traps, bombs, swords, magic, etc that can be used. Not a variety of enemies; has more to do with armor rating that enemy type. It just does not feel right when connecting with an enemy and sometimes delays. Sneaking around is not enjoyable. Companion AI is not good, and they will die quick. World/Exploration: The map and how you explore between areas is similar to Dragon Age: Origins-which may be a pro or con for some people. Pros: I like that you can move pretty quickly through an area by running-vs. in Dragon Age: Inquistion where it felt like you got nowhere fast. A couple of the cities do look nice(from a distance). Interesting set up that where you can go is dependent upon what attributes you have, but this also falls into a con... Cons: The exploration is not interesting enough for me to want to go back to areas I was previously unable to due to my attributes (nor do I remember where). Exploring the world can be frustrating; running into invisible walls, not being able to make short hops off areas, but instead having follow the path, then randomly being able hop off another area that is higher up. The only pay off for exploring is finding shrines with a skill point or a random chest (that you may not be able to get into). Most places you find you will probably end up at in another mission, so not a lot of incentive to explore. Minor side missions to find camps and notes on beasts does not feel worth it. The cities are copy and paste, then slap a new skin on it. How you traverse the city changes, but once you step inside a building they are duplicates with new skins from one to next. Things to Note-Bugs Aplenty: Serious frame drops during gameplay on occasion and sometimes dialogue scenes freeze. Lots of graphic issues-seriously. I have not had hard crashes or data erased though. I would recommend as long as you understand this is a AA game and comes with all the issues you could expect from one, and is not going to have the polish. It feels a bit like a PS3 game.

I followed the reviews on this game and it looked good so I decided to give it a try. I played it to the end it was a fun game for me. A little different style of play but a welcome difference. I made the mistake of finishing the main quest and ultimately ending the game early but i might replay it and see where it takes me later on.

Greedfall is the story of a French-looking colonial kingdom in search for a cure to a plague currently ransacking its populace. In this game you will play as a character who is in search of any answers for this sickness, leading your original created character to a new continent never before seen by colonial eyes, hoping beyond hope for help. If you've played Dragon Age, Mass Effect, or any other old BioWare role playing game, you've essentially played Greedfall before then. All the old beats are there, with such fun as character romancing, class choosing, story and world building with deep, rich writing, it's all there. Battle system is a little linear but still a lot of fun, with a fast-paced action tilt reminiscent of PS2 era RPGs, like Star Ocean or the Tales Of games. You and your two partners will be slicing, exploding, and bashing your way all through a beautiful island countryside. The story is a little predictable, but it's still full and rich, a decided contrast to most RPGs nowadays that just throw you into the action without giving you any reason to fight to in the first place. Writing will never be an issue with Greedfall, always throwing some delightfully devilish story detail your way. Plot driven and full of action, Greedfall might not be the biggest game you'll play, but for a double-A caliber title in 2019 it sure doesn't disappoint. Worth a purchase!
Its not the witcher but it makes a great effort at being that good. Gets a little monotonous at times and needs a little polish but for a AA title, great job!
Its a fun solid game. Great exploration and world

This is spiders latest title. You may know some of their other games like Technomancer. Greedfall harkens back to a time of rpgs like the first dragon age or mass effect. There is a minor amount of bugs to the game but they're overshadowed by the deep character customization that actually has an effect on the paths you can take. Talking your way out of a situation is just as effective as drawing a sword and allows you to take on quests in different ways instead of just go to x and kill y. Builds have complete freedom where you could make a warrior, thief, and mage if you wanted to go the vanilla choices or you could dabble into a little of every tree to make a hybrid that's able to tackle the toughest challenges in a unique way. Overall I suggest this to anyone that was a fan of rpgs that put more of a focus on quests being about a freedom of choice instead of being railroaded into one option.
This is what they call a budget title its not a AAA game. So the game does have some flaws... and doesnt have the best graphics... but its without a doubt a solid rpg
Good game. Awesome rpg style game if you like that type.
lot of fun just to title screen 5 hours in level 5 out level 100. their a lot to do . no bugs .

I've been following the developer Spiders for years. From Mars War Logs to The Technomancer. With the exception of Bound By Flame each game has been a solid step forward. Greedfall is by far their largest and most ambitious title. Combat will take a little getting used to for some, but for me it wasn't difficult as it is quite similar to The Technomancer. It's certainly not a AAA title, but it is a very well done game. Spiders is a small studio and doesn't have the benefit of blockbuster budgets. Hopefully this title will finally get them some recognition.

The game takes a while to play through which is really its only strong point. It simply does not do anything that well however. There are several spots that could have used more polish. From the graphics which are good but nothing along the lines of a game by Ubisoft or other large studios to the problems with some quests. At one point I had to go back and get a regular healing potion for a quest because it would not allow me to use a greater healing potion to heal the individual. These types of little issues really added up and made the game seem unfinished. It also did not really feel like a roleplaying game to me.

I can only give 4 stars because I have only just started the game. From what I have played though I think I'll really like it. The world looks great and interesting to explore. Lots of customization options. Combat may take a little practice but seems fun.

Now, I understand why many stores don't have this in stock. This is simply awful, in everything. The graphics are average when you compare it to everything else on the market, so if you were at least trying to see something pretty, that's not it. The controls are probably some of the worst controls I've seen in recent games. Go back 10 years in the past, controls and camera work were better. Gameplay is atrocious, combined with the awful controls and you get some of the lamest combat sequence ever. If you played Assassin Creed 1, 10 years ago, they had better combat. I feel like I just thrown $40 down the trash. Don't be like me, spend your $40 on better games, almost everything else is better than this.

These games are both great, and it's so convenient to have a hard copy to carry around (and share with friends). It's also great to have them on the same cartridge. Child of Light is beautifully illustrated and the game play is superb. I haven't tried Valiant Hearts yet but I'm excited to.

This package includes two great indie style games from a major publisher (Ubisoft). They're a bit old at this point, but still absolutely worth a purchase in physical format. Child of Light is a beautifully illustrated RPG with a female protagonist in a typically male dominated fantasy setting. Valiant Hearts is more of a point/click type of adventure game with a great story about the folly of war. Excellent choices in the package as a whole!

In this package, you'll receive two critically acclaimed Ubisoft 'indie' games. These aren't full blown AAA games like Assassin's Creed or Far Cry, but they are both worth your attention. Child of Light is a colorful Japanese RPG, while Valiant Hearts is a wonderful game about stories from World War I. And since this package is on the Nintendo Switch, both games are perfect to be played 'on the go.' Grab this title and enjoy both excellent games.

I loved Catherine! The original on the PS3 was great and this remake Full Body on the PS4 is even better. I will say its not for everyone though. Not everyone will enjoy its puzzle, tower building, missions. The story is great though, I love the different choices that were offered and that they mattered to the story. Make the wrong ones and our 'hero' Vincent will not be getting the ''happy ever after ending.'' If you want a thinking game however, with a different story than your typical one in video games that is mixed with a little horror and romance then this game will be for you. I personally give it 5 out of 5!

I loved the game on the ps3 and I bought the collector's edition of that back in the day. I thought, although not up to the same level as the original CE, this one was great also. I love the sheep plushy and think its worth the price. The game is almost the same although there is new story added. One new girl and extra scenes. I am not sure if there are more levels because it's been a while since I played the original, but I'd have to assume there are.

The game is just as good as the original release. The packaging however, is not up to snuff for a premium collectors edition. This version of the game includes a steelbook, however the games title is not printed on the spine of the steelbook, and there is no slipcover that goes over it to resolve this issue. Every other version of the game did include the slipcover for the steelbook, and it was even included in other region's version of this product. Not sure why the premium paying fans in the US got shafted.

I like to display my collectors editions on my mantle for a bit after purchase, not realizing my wholesome dog walker had to look at it. She didnt say anything, but I still felt weird.

The concept for this game is great, but even months after release, this title is still filled with bugs. I've encountered more game breaking bugs in this game than in any other title I can think of in recent memory. Buy on sale only, dont pay $60. Combat is also...okay. There's really not much impact or weight behind attacks. Everything feels pretty weak and slow so far (I'm about 10-15 hours in). There's also really unrealistic damage to further break the immersion. In one instance, I shot someone with two arrows, one in the chest, one in the arm, but they still were coming after me like nothing happened (with the arrows sticking out of them). I don't know if that was another bug, or if enemies simply don't react much to limb damage. Overall, it's just an average game. Good idea with a really flawed implementation. So. Many. Bugs.

The graphics for this game are beautiful especially the environment. The combat needs some getting use to and can be very wonky at times. I've heard that the game is very difficult at the beginning and very easy late game. At the moment I'm about 70% through the game and things are still pretty difficult unless you just point blank shoot someone with a bow and arrow. The lock picking and pick pocketing is horrendously hard but they seem to have a patch in the works for it so we will see. The story is very good and the voices for the characters are good as well. The game seems to push you into doing the main quest right away due to time limits at certain points so you'll probably just want to focus on the main quest line at first. If you like rpgs its definitely worth a play but until they fix some bugs and some other stuff I'd wait for a sale maybe when its like $40-$45.

This game is like if you modded Skyrim with a hardcore mode, only without the fantasy stuff like dragons. You have to manage your hunger, sleep, and dress in dark colors to help sneak better at night. People will even comment on the cleanliness of your clothing (or lack of). Some quests are extremely in depth and have hidden options that you can discover. But because it's so focused on realism there are moments where the game can be a bit dull. You only ever fight other humans and the world has a lot of empty space, as it did in the 1400s. You have to really know what you're getting into with this game to know if you'll like it or not.

My character failed the pickpocket tutorial. This caused the whole questline involved in theivery to be blocked. That was the first bug. The second was getting stuck in a room and not being able to get out. No matter how many times I logged in and out, I was stuck. I just gave up on the game at that point. I had an older save, but I got tired of repeating content everytime I encountered a bug.

I knew this game had some issues before I bought it, but I thought most of it had been taken care of by the massive patches Warhorse had released for it. I can't even imagine the original state of the game then, because the bugs that are in it now are pretty terrible. You can certainly still play it, and I've not encountered a game breaking bug yet, but it does really break immersion. NPCs act odd, textures fail to load and pop in is ridiculous. The story is fine, and I like the characters, but it's hard to recommend this game. It's my first regretted purchase of the year. I'm glad I got it on sale at least.

This game has the makings of a modern classic. Everything is deep and immersive, the characters and story are well-written, and the world looks beautiful. Havent been this immersed in an RPG since Morrowind. Easily a GOTY contender.

This is the future. A kickstarter indie game outcompeting triple A titles. If you love sandbox RPGs where you can play your game any way you want, give this a shot. Does it have bugs? Yeah, but so did Skyrim and Witcher 3. Warhorse is a studio to watch, thus game has the support it needs. Kill npcs, stealth or play the sword and shield hero. Your way, your game.

PROS: Great Simulator, great graphics and lighting, can sink HOURS into this game without a thought, RPG at its finest CONS: Steep learning curve, takes a lot of practice to do anything well in this game (kind of like real life), not great voice acting, and an antiquated save system Kingdom Come: Deliverance is a great game that takes a lot of effort to get the most out of it. Most of the game centers on training, as you came up a Blacksmith's son you have no real skills to speak of and are laughably bad at nearly everything. As you play, you end up increasing the skills you use the most to create a somewhat unique character to you. Do you stab everything that moves? You will have a high Strength, Agility, and Sword skills. Do you knock out you opponents while they have their back turned and then pilfer all of their hard earned goods? Have fun with that really high stealth skill. In KCD everything matters and makes an impression. Your charisma goes up and down based on how expensive your clothing is or how dirty it is. Your actions will increase or decrease your standing with everyone from the citizenry to the guards to the different millers to make them love or hate you. With low standing you will even be stopped randomly by guards purely because they know your reputation as a thief. A few things to look out for that take a star away from this game include a very antiquated save system. While I understand the save system (it is designed to make fast travel dangerous and make you think about your actions) I still don't LIKE it. Also the lockpicking starts out being nearly impossible, but after lots of practice I can crack Very Hard locks in mere seconds.

I'm very harsh on games for things like graphics and gameplay, so I invited my cousin who is less picky to play. He absolutely hated this game as much as I do. The combat is shoddy, the graphics subpar, and the bugs cringeworthy. At one point we get stuck in a kitchen at the castle and cant get out because the door simply will not open. I will say the story seems well thought out and the voice acting was very good but the game was sadly horrific.

The game starts slow and you have to make a lot of choices about the missions. The fighting could be better and also a lot of bugs in the woods. The game crashed once after the big updates. I like it. They could have better action something like assasin creed.

Presentation/Availability: Product was well packaged with no broken/opened box. There were many available at the store. Performance/Gameplay: My review is for the PS4. Game is for just 1 local player at a time. Online playing is for 2+ players. Image resolution (gameplay and theatrical) is very good and the sound is very good as well (and if you have a home theater sound system, the best). I really recommend you use a good headset with this game if you want to hear every tiny sound on the game. MY KIDS LOVE IT!!!!! Customer service: Very good customer service. I was greeted by an employee as soon as I walked through the door. There were some technical (computer) problems with the cash register, but the employee was extra courteous and managed the issue in a very professional way. HAPPY CUSTOMER!!

The Monster Jam game prior to this one is much better. This new game the races are all very short and you don't get time to drive around. The tracks are all in stadiums which makes it full of hairpin turns and zero room to roam around.

As an avid reader of HP Lovectaft, I was very curious about this game. Its a survival horror game. There are few instances of fighting or action. The game consists of conversations with various choices based on character attributes. I felt that the attributes had little effect on the outcome however. There are many opportunities to investigate the environment which is basically a point and click experience. The puzzles were frustrating as they did not seem to work in any discernible pattern; just trial and error. I lent this short game to my friend who loved it. I would not recommend. Do you like cute dialog? Do you like cute enemies? Do you like a story with a plot? Do you like Minecraft? How about Dragon Quest? Do you like nostalgic call-backs in the form of music, sound effects and characters? If you said Yes to any of these, you'll love this game! Dragon Quest Builders 2 is the sequel to the beloved Dragon Quest Builders game. It improves on the original in almost every way. Much like Minecraft, you are thrown into a world that can be build and destroyed. Enemies abound as you search for valuable resources needed to build bigger and better things. What makes this game stand above Minecraft is the plot. You have to complete tasks in order to advance in the game, and learn more crafting recipes to overcome the challenges the game throws at you. There is a multiplayer part to the game that allows you to build with a friend online, if they also own the game. Your multiplayer level is a sandbox world that has no bearing on the main game story or plot line, so it is neither cooperative or competitive in the main game.
I am a Minecraft fan and this fulfills that building desire while giving you an amazing story to go with it. 100% would recommend.

Minecraft meets Mario, the perfect pairing of form and function, enough to sink your teeth into and get lost for hours. This game has it all, building, farming, friendships, cats, and dogs! Expect to spend a lot of time exploring everything, not to mention playing with friends!

This game is awesome. I spent more than 100+ hrs on it. Cute characters and story is not boring. The most enjoy moment on this game for me is after you finish the game and come back to your island to build whatever you want on it. NPC is smart enough to participate and interact with the room that you make. Try it and you will love it.

The game is like a love letter to both American and Japanese fans of the two Titans of their respective cultures; Minecraft and Dragon Quest. The game is a great game for parent and child or good friends just wanting to relax and have a good time. I would recommend this game for anyone interested in the series. The dialogue is phenomenal and there have been multiple times where I laughed out loud. I recommend this game for all ages and crowd.

Fun and engaging story line. It allows players to share pictures and ideas to create buildings. Easier than the first DQB game with the help of a fighting companion. There is a little glitch while walking or running in an area in the beginning.
My wife loved the first game and she likes this one even more. Its an improvement over the first game and adds some great RPG elements. Dont hesitate.
Follows part 1 nicely. Includes alot of references from dragon warrior 2. Would recommend.

Way better then the first. Much more to do. Story in the game is good. You have to deal with changing weather which is good. classic monsters to fight. The sidekick you have in here is really helpful through out the game. A must own for any DQ fan.

I love these games! This time around they added features like 4 player coop and fast travel which I don't believe was in the first one. They've also added a lot more items and blueprints which some a very large.

The game is incredibly addictive. I can't stop playing it. It expands on everything that made the original Dragon Quest Builders game so good. Retains the gorgeous and charming Akira Toriyama's aesthetic the grindy JRPG nature of traditional Dragon Quest games.
Love the first one so you already know I'm gonna love this game
This game improves on a ton of different things on the first game. Highly recommend.
A great JRPG with a good story and so many more items then in the first version.
only reason i give it four stars is because the game is mostly via dlc code

I'll start by saying I bought this game on sale for $20, not $60. It's definitely worth it at $20, but probably not at $60. The games are all fun and don't have any game breaking flaws, and I enjoy playing them. They are each available individually from the eshop as well, so if you're only interested in one there's no need to get the full bundle. Since this game truly is three games (including 3 different games on the switch home menu) I'll review each individually. Risk: Overall fun, but a bit slow moving at times. I wish you could skip through the AI's move entirely, since I've been playing long enough I can look at the board after someone moves and instantly tell what happened. Currently, the best you can do is set the AI speed to fast and hit 'a' whenever they attack a territory to skip the dice rolls. On that note, it would be able to skip the dice rolls when it's my turn as well. I don't need a roll-by-roll play through of the battle; I would be more than happy to click attack and have the game spit out who won and how many armies were lost. The only other thing I wished the game had was an option to return to the classic game board and game pieces, but that is a very minor gripe. All that being said, the game is very fun, the controls are intuitive, and the AI is hard enough to present a bit of a challenge. The game also has an autosave feature which is really nice; if you decide you want to play a different game and finish the current risk game later you can pop this game card back in later and pick up right where you left off. 3/5 Monopoly: This is probably the best executed of the three games on this card, in my opinion. One of two gripes I have is with the 3D fields; the view is so zoomed in I sometimes had trouble visualizing where I, an opponent, or a property is on the board, but as I play more I think I could get used to it, and the game does have the option to play on the standard board, which is better in my experience. I also found the manage properties and trade screen a little awkward to navigate, but with so many small properties Ubisoft did about as well as could be expected with the switch controllers. The only thing that might help it out is if the cursor moved a little faster. There is a lot to love about this version of monopoly, however. One of my personal favorite features is the option to play to different goals, which each have realistic time estimates. No one I know would play monopoly with me before this since it took so long, but I think I might have a chance of convincing them now. The different game modes vary from 'first to own a hotel' to 'first to have $2000' or 'first to have a certain number of properties/sets.' The time estimates vary from 25 min to 55 min, and I found them to be fairly accurate playing against an AI. Some of these game modes do a good job mixing up strategy and the play of the game as well; for instance 'first to own a hotel' makes cheap sets much more valuable than expensive ones. I would highly recommend this game. 5/5 Trivial Pursuit Live: I've played this game the least, so I don't have as much to say about it. I've never been a massive trivia pursuit fan, and this one has several mini-game type trivia games that seem a little unnecessary to me. The game is solid, however: the trivia is current, not crazy difficult, and the game does a good job of feeling rewarding even if you're not doing well. 4/5

This game is beautiful and the story is outstanding. But this is a new form of cash grab. The game is a sort of RPG and Ubisoft sells you armors and weapons at various levels. The pre order armors and what not are worthless after minutes into the game. Youll find stronger and better armor in the game within minutes. The boosters are $15 together and $20 separate for both. The game is designed to tempt you reallllllly bad into buying them. They intentionally make it hard to level up after a while and youre stuck grinding to even have a chance against AI who is stronger than you. Micro Transactions in this game is bringing it down. Its basically what happened to destiny 2. It was so difficult to defeat certain enemies that it was no fun. Dont get me wrong, you can level up decently enough, but it will require a large amount of grind where the game becomes a chore rather than fun. This game couldve been great but micro transactions made it fail. Overlook all those problems and this game is in contention for game of the year.

Sonic Forces is just average from what I played. It's a step down compared to Sonic Generations. There's no drifts, no customizations for boosts & other skills (if you ever played Generations). For Modern Sonic, even when you boost, it doesn't feel quite as fast as he did in Generations & about half the time, the game goes auto-pilot on certain curves & turns slightly for you, even when you hold the boost button, which kinda annoyed me because it feels like they don't think you'll be able to beat the stages on your own. Classic Sonic has some of the worst physics & momentum when you play as him although his stages aren't bad. You just have to get used to landing platforms on his weird air momentum. That's pretty much it. As for the Avatar... I thought it was gonna be the worst part of the game only to end up being my favorite (which isn't saying much). The Avatar char. has a weapon called Wispon which lets you use different types of Wisps: Burst is a flamethrower, Lightning is an electric whip kinda weapon, just to give an example. Getting a Wisp item of your choice will grant you a Super, depending on which Wisp you choose, such as the Burst gives you an exploding jump to get to higher platforms & lightning gives you a ring/enemy dash. From a person who likes Modern Sonic stages in Sonic Generations, my favorite out of the three is the Avatar stages with Modern Sonic being my least favorite because of certain parts of each stages where Sonic goes auto-pilot & he has a few QTEs for some reason. The bosses weren't all that great either. Boost, homing attack 3 times, rinse & repeat for most of them. I'd give it a 6/10. It's not a bad Sonic game but it's not a great Sonic game. It's a meh Sonic game. If I we're you, I'd wait for a price drop (around $20 or so).

I am a huge fan of Sonic from the Sega Genesis era even up to the ps3 and 360 Sonic Unleashed days. First of all this game is not like Sonic Mania the masterpiece released two months before it. With this said Sonic Forces should not be discounted. I like the avatar and all the cosmetic, gear and weapon options which I unlocked all in the daily missions. Additionally, the price of the game is about right being around $30 or less. If you like 3D Sonic games this game is very playable. Just don't go in thinking it is as deep as Sonic Unleashed, Generations or Colors. Visually the characters and levels look nice and some of the music was done well to the level of say Sonic Colors or Unleashed which in my opinion have some of the best modern Sonic music. The many in-game unlockables really works well for the game. Sonic Forces creatively uses daily and weekly challenges related to wearing and using certain gear, which brought a lot of variety as well. Additionally there are challenges for completing stages within a certain time. However, I do feel the levels are short and you can blast through them and just mash 'X' most of the time. Finally, this game seemed a bit like Sonic Heroes, Colors and Unleashed combined with your avatar able to use a variety of weapons as well as run, which in my opinion is very interesting. The Shadow the Hedgehog DLC was a nice bonus as well.

Every part of my order went without a hitch. I ordered on line for pickup at the last minute. The game was reasonably priced and no wait when I picked it up. I highly recommend and will again order this way. My grandson was so excited when he saw it Christmas morning.
