FULL REVIEW: linklink calls Vampyr a AA production. While true that the game has rough spots, its overall polish is greater than several AAA titles seen this year. I expect nothing less than stellar of Dontnod when it comes to writing. They have a knack for creating an entire world for their games worthy of the silver screen. Vampyr mixes real world history with traditional vampire lore and creates something fresh. Even issues of race are touched upon. I was really happy to see things like that were not shied away from. London's mysteries wait to be unraveled and you will enjoy the experience. Gameplay While doing nothing new, Vampyr employs a gameplay design befitting the action RPG genre. You cannot run into combat Rambo-style and expect to survive. strategizing before and during combat will yield the best results. I would have like a bit more stealth as you are a creature of the shadows. The gameplay does employ a fair amount of talking; do not mistake this as a pure action title. The talking goes a long way for player immersion as you will truly feel the lives you may be taking. Graphics & Sound The graphics are one of the few cavities in the teeth of Vampyr. Fight animation is smooth, level and character design are great, but some areas just look dated. The in-game visuals also do not live up to those of cutscenes, giving a very PS3/360 feel. PC will obviously look better, but you will still be able to see flaws like wobbly characters during conversation. The music and voice acting are both top notch, but loading can interfere with music. There is also the sticking point that NPCs may repeat dialogue and make no sense. For example, Nurse Crane repeats the same dialogue outside your office as when she first welcomes you to Pembroke. Thankfully, that is about as much as I can report in terms of bugs or glitches. Bottom Line: If you game on PC, PS4 or Xbox One, Vampyr should be in your collection.

Things I like: The combat is fun, and special powers were impressive. Enemy variety is kinda standard, but has enough variety to not be completely boring. The whole investigation side of things where you figure out stuff about people and the city is a neat idea, and pretty well implemented. Characters are very well developed, and generally interesting to get to know. Taken all together, the game play is good and the setting feels alive. The idea of wanting to save everyone, but needing to kill people in order to be strong enough to save them in the first place, is well implemented. Things I don't like: Animations during conversations are stiff, and all the dialogue and voice acting feels like it's pulled straight out of a soap opera. It's... not great. It's especially jarring when conversations are such a major part of the game, and you have to suffer through them because everything around them is honestly really cool. Oh, and the romance arc feels force and rushed, but that's par for the course when it comes to video games anyways. This game satisfied my RPG fix til Dragon Quest XI came out. If they had more time to develop the graphics or more of a budget, DONTNOD would've rivaled or topped the later entries of the Castlevania PS3 series in my opinion. The story and setting was certainly on point.

The closest we'll get to a Vampire the Masquerade in this day and age. It's a an action RPG with an intricate dialogue system and a city health system tied down to the health of its citizens. You can only kill characters by having a higher LV, hypnotizing them and sucking their blood. The more info you know about each citizen the more XP you are rewarded if you kill them. On the other hand you can fight and do quest and get XP that way. This is an excelent example of a AA game that is only held back by some weirs choices. Like the fact that you character can't jump or traverse the xity through the rooftops, instead you have to press a button and the right time on the right spot in order to jump up a balcony or any other platform. All in all the game is great and should be supported. They tried something new and succeeded for the most part. Get it. Cheers.

I had such high hopes for this game because there hasn't been a good fantasy/non shooter game out for PS4 since Witcher 3, and I was so let down by Vampyr. The story line is so bland and the whole game is so choppy and short and it made no sense. There was a serious lack of development for this game. I'll be returning it asap.
Way better graphics than the Nintendo Switch. I own it for both systems.

Starlink is a pretty decent late entry in the 'toys to life' video game genre, because 1) the toys are actually really cool, 2) there isn't an overwhelming number of them to collect, and 3) you actually have the choice to collect all of the ships, weapons, and pilots digitally, if toys aren't your thing. The game itself feels a bit tedious and grindy at first, since you spend a lot of time repeating similar missions and tasks on every planet you visit. But as you begin to reap the rewards of completing these quests and maximizing your alliances, things start to get more satisfying. Difficult battles become easier and your ships, weapons, and pilots become more powerful. I completed the game in about 50 hours and ended up really enjoying it, even if the characters aren't very well developed, the story feels kind of rushed, and there's still a fair amount of world-building to be done. The Nintendo Switch version is probably the definitive one to get because of its pretty excellent Star Fox content, but I also bought the Xbox version while it was on sale because I really wanted the physical Zenith ship and Shredder weapon to round out my toy collection. For the achievements, I suspect this is a game I won't mind replaying!

Starlink: Battle for Atlas is a fun, family game for tweens, teens, and adults. Flying your ship through space and battling aliens is always a fun adventure. The Starter Pack has everything you need to have fun. Using the enclosed controller mount, the ship mounts to your Xbox One controller and you are off on your adventure. The pilot, ships, weapons, and the ship's wings can be switched out with additional items available for purchase. The physical product is fun for kids to watch their ship fly and the engine even lights up too. It is easy to see why my boys love this game.

We are loving Starlink: Battle for Atlas on our XBox One. It's a great sci-fi space battle action adventure game is an open-world space saga thatfeatures modular toy technology, allowing the user to customize different real-world physical starships spaceships, pilots, weapons, wings to theirgame controller. We initially played building outposts, destroyed extractors, destroyed primes, destruction was our game. It was fun, but we learned not as fun as when you play as the game is intended. What I mean is when the three dreadnoughts appear in space, the fun begins. We played until we could leave each of the planets overrun with the Legion. We encountered more enemies, mastered some weapons, ships, and pilots and learned how the combos work. Plus, fighting the Infernal Primes is an epic battle of fun. We also learned about cloning and fusing mods, leading us to have all Legendary mods. It has been a lesson in playing through, paying attention and enjoying the storyline. This game is fun and unique. It offers several difficulty choices so whether you're a new gamer or seasoned gamer, it offers something for everyone. My son seems to love scanning new lifeforms and taking down the enemy and their bases. The entire game takes place completely from the ship you choose. My son does say that it's a pain to use the digital weapons because to do so you have to move the joycons from the toy ship's cradle. So you either play all digital or all toys. He'd like the game to integrate to be able to mix and match between the two. There are some surprises, like the back of the Arwing ship lights up while the game is running. It makes for a great addition to the game. It's a huge world in the game, so there is plenty to explore and do. Overall, we are enjoying this game and find the universe to have plenty to explore, with epic battles and great details that make this game an ongoing adventure.

This is a truly unique gaming experience and unlike anything Ive ever played before. You start by picking an actual toy ship, a pilot, and weapon combo. You then place this attachment onto your video game controller and watch your creation come to life. The ship is very light and does not interfere with actual game play. The video game itself is really fun to play and has a huge expanded universe so theres a lot to explore and discover. During battle, the game will actually recommend which weapons (kinetic, fire, or ice-based) to use against certain enemies and you can just pull one weapon from the wing of the ship and replace it with another. As you do this the game automatically pauses and takes you to a home screen where you can see your customization come to life. The starter pack comes with one ship, one pilot, and three weapons (cannons that attach to end of the ships wings). I would definitely recommend this game to anyone over the age of 10. The graphics are incredible, the game play is really smooth, the story line is entertaining, and this new concept of connecting an actual toy ship to the controller just blew me away. But aside from a unique new concept, this is one of my favorite video games I played this year.
Didn't really play it yet hopefully I get to soon .

What fun! I had thought TTl games were dead (except for Amiibo, because Nintendo is too clever), but this one's really fun. Fly, fight, explore! Use new weapons, ships, and pilots. No joke, I ordered all of it!

Buyer beware the Xbox game was not in the box as advertised. I had to return it. Checked another box for an exchange, no CD in that box either. BB looked it up and it has been a known issue, They Kindly refunded my money, therefore two stars for fairness.
If you liked Destruction Derby on the PC in the 90s, then you will love this game.

Nothing like racing around or smashing into some other junkers to blow off some steam. The game play engine is steady and offers reliable and realistic play, but the load times are abysmal. Even scrolling between cars in your garage initiates a short but very annoying delay. Also, the interface can be a bit confusing until you figure it out, such as when events are locked and you don't know why (wrong class of car, wrong drive-train, wrong country, etc). All in all, happy with the purchase despite the negatives.

Wreckfest is the spiritual successor to the original Flatout games created by Bugbear (Flatout 1, Flatout 2, Flatout: Ultimate Carnage). Flatout 3, not created by Bugbear, was panned across the board since it was a bad game. Flatout 4 while not created by Bugbear, is still a pretty good game, and a big step up from Flatout 3. That said, it still wasn't close to the original Flatout games created by Bugbear. Enter Wreckfest, the true sequel to Bugbear's classic Flatout games in everything but name. If you enjoy destruction, top notch physics, and just an overall enjoyable arcade racing game, look no further than Wreckfest. It's not perfect & has a few issues such as the A.I. sometimes being cheap & the loading times being long, however they did recently release a patch to improve both. Wreckfest is an excellent racing game.

So I've had Wreckfest purchased on Steam for years now, but haven't been able to upgrade my PC enough to play it, so I bought it again on console and am having a blast. There's no mod support yet, but hopefully console will get it. There's a couple dozen cars as of right now, plus like 6 or so silly cars, damage models are pretty realistic with the minor bangs and crashes, but once you start slamming the cars for awhile, they turned into foil balls basically. AI are pretty aggressive, which makes it fun, and challenging at the same time. What little I've played online seems to be good as well, everyone I was with had a max of 80 ping and nothing really lagged or ruined the experience for everyone else. It's not as silly or crazy as Flatout, but it's made by the same guys and published by THQNordic, so... Praise both of those companies. If you like racing and being a little aggressive/beating doors in, this is the game for you.

Downloaded this game the other day and can not be more satisfied with my purchase. The graphics are absolutely stunning when playing on my 4K HDR TV. There are loads of tracks to choose from, and the career mode is great also. The load times are a still slow but still a great game. So if you like this type of racing game...just get it, you wont be disappointed.

This game gives you a good feel of the movie itself. Lots of race tracks, different routes and hidden paths that makes every race feel different. Younger kids will love it once they get the hang of it and older kids will enjoy the Mario Kart type weapons to wreck other cars.

This game is little different from the others that preceeded it. Adequate graphics, sometimes annoying controls, limited gameplay, just sub-par in every respect when reviewed as a $59 game. Fortunately I am a game club member, so got a good chunk of the price taken off, and used reward zone points to lessen the cost even more. If my son wasn't such a huge Pixar Cars fan, I never would spend this much money for such a mediocre kids game. This game may earn 4 stars had it cost $25 or under, but not at sixty bucks. Graphics are alright but hardly worth bragging about, but it seems that the controls are even worse than they were in the first Cars game. The races have a little variety, and the free play area is a nice change of pace. I do miss the challenge of finding all the postcards and such from the first game though, things you could do as a single player in more of a campaign mode style setting. There are no such things here other than tricks, which is where it really just loses the replay value. If you get it on sale, it may be worth it, but don't pay full price for this, it's a total ripoff at that price point.

The original most wanted was my favorite NFS game. The cop chases, pursuit degrees and pursuit blockers made the game. I have to say that single player for this version is just as fun and let's not forget the updated graphics. I can't say much for the online play because I don't play online.

The other challenges in the game are more for people who just like to mess around & have fun, or people that like to complete 100% of a game. Certain races in the game are offered and when selected, the player is prompted to have to purchase the content as DLC (downloadable content). This practice should be offered as an option at the start screen, instead of fooling the player into thinking that the races that are offered IN the game, are playable in the game for which you have ALREADY PAID. If it weren't for this disappointing 'feature', the review would be perfect as this game is potentially the result of combing the best of Need For Speed combined with the best of Burnout. Beautiful graphics, wonderful car control and sense of speed. It just feels incomplete when I'm being enticed to buy something while playing the game. But who knows? Maybe by the time I write this a patch will be released unlocking all of the content that they place in the game and then chose to lock until you shelled out more money; if that's the case, then consider this review upgraded to a perfect score.

But I hope the next Need for Speed goes back to the roots of the game. I've been playing since the first Hot Pursuit on the playstation. Those are the racing games I enjoy. And on a PS3\360 those are the games we deserve with todays graphics to boot.

This is by far the worst Need for Speed game produced to date. The past few NFS games have been met with mixed reviews but I still found them to be enjoyable. This one on the other hand is just dreadful. There is no storyline, which I admit isn't a huge deal to most racing games but NFS usually has some interesting story. The control of the cars is very difficult to learn...half the time it seems like it wants to be a racing sim, the other half it think its an arcade game. The streering is bad, the braking is bad. And if you just tap another vehicle or wall you crash and your race gets interupted by this annoying 'crash' sequence. if you want a fun arcade NFS racing game this holiday season go pick up the original Most Wanted game that was released when Xbox 360 was first released. Even though it's many years old, it's way better than this game. The makers of Need for Speed should be ashamed of putting their name on this. An even better suggestion would be to go buy Forza Horizon. It's a lot more fun and enjoyable arcade racer.

I purchased the xbox 360 video game need for speed 'Most Wanted' limited edition for 59.99 plus tax. Last weekend the product was in Target and Kmart Circular for 39.99. I called customer service...( a 27 minute adventure) to take advantage of the price protection. The customer service rep told me ultimatly that this lower price was for the non-limited edition model. I begged her to just look online at either Target or Kmart to see that it was indeed the limited edition version. I told her that if she would not even look at this I would be forced to send the Best Buy copy back... she replied ok... go ahead. I jumped in my car after hanging up the phone and drove to Target and PURCHASED the Need for Speed 'Most Wanted' Limited edition for 39.99 plus tax. I have it in my car right now and would be more than happy to send a picture of it with a copy of the receipt! Needless to say, this will be the LAST product I purchase from Best Buy!! I will be sure to tell anyone who listens about my experience with your customer service.

Zombie Army Trilogy was a great concpet but, it was lacking something the latest entry in this Spin-off is a outstanding release Zombie Army 4 is one of the best 3rd Person titles this curent Gen. I put a good 10hrs into the game (Just playing it solo) That way i can actually take my time and take everything in and explore the landscape Story: Is pure love letter to Grindhouse Films/Lucio Fulci (It feels like you are thrown into Fulci's Zombie aka Zombie Flesh Eaters (1979) While the entire Zombie subgenre in pop cultured has decayed and become a parody of itself (Don't avoid this because of the oversaturation of all things zombie) Achievements are Quotes from various 70's & 80's Horrors films, massive Easter eggs throughout the landscape It would be awesome if Rebellion could acquirer the rights to Fulci's Zombie and make some type of tie-in adaption to Zombie Controls: are solid (If you are new to Rebellion Studios) It may take a good 20min to get used to but, once you do everything will become second nature I honestly feel the controls to ZA4 is close to perfect Audio: Best if you can take advantage of the DTS 5.1 option (The score is flawless it sounds like a homage to everything Italian Horror/Goblin There's also a sample used That i could bank is from The Warriors (I would love to get a Original Soundtrack for this game) It adds a lot to the game all the sound effects, weapons, splatter sounds, V/O actors are super high quality Graphics: Are really good Rebellion Studios is a legit HQ Studio (They really get overlooked as a Studio) that puts out Triple A content Fun factor: Super fun and enjoyable (There is grinding but, it's actually fair and adds a lot of layers to the overall enjoyment Once you rank up past 10 it opens up the new adds-on elemets to change things up Best way to Rank-up play through the Horde mode for at least 90min. then move on to the Story Campaign

BEFORE YOU BUY, it's worth noting that the information on this page at the time of this review is incorrect: This is a port of the game Deemo, not Deemo: Last Recital. The former is the original version of the game while the latter is a significantly remastered version that adds additional play modes, extends the story, and adds a new after-story. A port of the original has been available for digital purchase on the Switch since 2017, while Last Recital is apparently still exclusive to the PS Vita. This is just a physical release of the Switch port of the original game. I was pretty disappointed when I booted this up only to find myself face to face with the same game I had already purchased digitally over a year ago, when I was expecting the remastered version. All this aside though, the original Deemo is still great with a surprisingly good story for a rhythm game, and fun gameplay that's easy to pick up on even for non-gamers. If you know how a piano works, you'll be able to figure this out pretty easily (although that doesn't necessarily mean the songs themselves will be a walk in the park). The Switch port comes with all the extra DLC songs that were offered in the original mobile version of the game built-in for free, and there are a ton of them. This is definitely not a game you'll be able to complete in just a few sittings if you're planning to play through everything. Overall this game is definitely worth its price even if you're not used to the rhythm genre. Just make sure you know that you're buying a port of the original version and not Last Recital.
This is a fun beautiful creative game! The art and music are fantastic! Great puzzles and amazing content! From the moment I started playing I did not want to stop!!!
First hour and Im hooked, lots of interesting characters and to be honest Im loving the 2D spin!

Overall a nice activity watch. Loving the round face and its not so bulky, definitely wearable for both women and men. Great features plenty of apps, excellent gps activity tracking, gorilla glass crystal, easy to add additional apps at the Garmin store.

Game is mediocre all around. Poorly designed and borrowed gameplay mechanics from Dark Souls but implements them in a lazy and uninteresting way. Character design and backgrounds are very generic and bland. I'd much rather play a good game in this genre, like Symphony of the Night.

This is a great Lego game full of humor and Lego fun. However if you're on this on the Wii U it may not be worth double dipping. My 9 year old son enjoys playing this game on my PS4

Evolution is a must have game for those who do and even those who do not typically gravitate towards park builder games. The overall appeal (graphically) for evolution is astonishing, especially if you have a solid 4k TV and are playing on the One X (I have a Pro as well so I am sure for PlayStation only users the game would be almost equally as good). The details from top to bottom in this game have far exceeded my expectations, and with only about 6 hours into the game there is so much more to explore with only about 7 of the 40 something dinosaurs unlocked and a slew of buildings to still discover, along with the other islands. Gameplay wise the interface, controls, camera, and building components are easily accessible making the functionality for a sim building game in my opinion moderately easy. With a couple hours of getting use to everything any individual 10 + years of age could find great fun and success with this game. Some users have reported problems (bugs/glitches) with this game and I so far have only ran into one instance where the game kicked me out and restarted. However, after almost every action completed, the game will autosave so when this occurred I did not lose any progress. Frontier seems to be very driven in continuously updating and patching this game, as well as working with the community to ensure that a solid gaming experience for years to come can and will be achieved. Before going I do not want to mislead anyone with my rating and just say that althoguh I gave Evolution five stars, my true score for this game is 4.6/5 making it a game well worth exploring.

This game is akin to a roller coaster 'tycoon' or Sim City, but with dinosaurs and your own dinosaur research facility. I purchased the game for my 11 year old daughter, who loves dinosaurs and everything Jurassic Park/World. The game proved to be a little too sophisticated for her. If you like 'tycoon'-like games and dinosaurs/Jurassic Park, then I suspect this game would be for you! If you are looking for something with a little more action, or more simplistic gameplay, this is probably not the best game for you.

I bought this game for my 9 year old son as a birthday gift since he's really into Jurassic World right now. He liked it but said it was a little challenging for him. One of my older boys had to help him with certain levels so maybe it's more appropriate for older teenagers. Overall though they enjoyed playing it.

This is a fun game once you get. beyond the learning curve of the building tools and accept the progression tree. The graphics are fun, as you can zoom in and out and circle about these dinosaurs as they do there thing. These graphics are not Forza or Assasins Creed, but very nice. There are 3 track you can focus on as you play. Choose scientist, business manager or grow the park through public relations and tourist growth. Regardless of which of the 3 youselect, you are still going to use the skills of the other 2 to grow your park. Yeah, its that sort of sandbox game like Sim City, where you balance factors and deal with disasters to expand your park. But tons of people like the Sim City sort of games. If you are one of them, this game is probably something youd like . . . I do.

Here is a list of pros and cons of the game through my first 20 hours of play: Pros Dinos look great. Visually this game is outstanding. Music is also wonderful and effectively recreates the Jurassic park atmosphere. Lots of things tinker with. Cons: Bad AI. People and dinos looks good at first, but dont stare too long. Not enough customization like other park games (benches, statues, etc) Overall a fun game, may not be for everyone at full price.
One of the worst games I played all year. I would rather read a book about dinosaurs.
Kind of blah! No real direction. Ive already sold it after only playing it for two hours.
My 14 year old loves this game. Very close to Minecraft

Good game over all for what it is, a zoo tycoon style with Dinos. Love the voice over work and attention to detail. After 4 hours of game play I think it just needs a few bug fives and will be a great pick up for gamers.

Works great and looks amazing. Timely delivery. Plenty of space inside the refrigerator and freezer. No matter what you put in the temperature stays the same. Would.definately recommend this product to anyone. We are enjoying our new.refrigerator.

GBVS is a fun fighting game, but sadly it feels like a cashgrab behind the polish. Only 11 characters at launch is pretty disappointing, even moreso when they had two season passes planned before launch. The gameplay itself is good, but the value is honestly pretty bad unless you're a huge fan of Granblue or if you're a fiend and will play a ton of versus matches to get your money's worth. I'd like to call this game overpriced, with all the DLC and small starting roster, but if you think you'll get your money's worth from playing other people all the time it's worth it.

There's been a lot of decent fighters out in the last few years but Granblue Fantasy Versus instantly grabbed me with the great 2.5D visuals and more traditional 1 on 1 gameplay. I enjoy Dragonball Fighterz, Blaze Blue Cross Tag, & MvC but there's something to a nice 1v1 fighter that I've always enjoyed more. There's a great cast of characters, lots of varied fighting styles, & a fantastic soundtrack. Highly recommended if you enjoy fighting games. The only downside is even if you shell out for the Premium version, you've still got to hand over cash for DLC characters. But I guess that's just the way things are going these days unfortunately. Anyone remember buying a game and that was it? You owned ALL the content? Good times.
The reason I gave it a 1 star is due to the fact that the game was defective! It was supposed to have the 400 days included, but it did not! I think the actual DVD was defective, so I returned it!
Love the TV series, love this game. Wish they made more games like this one

The flow and feel of this game definitely reflect the nature of not being a fully funded AAA title. Overall though, the gameplay, graphics and writing really are able to shine through to make this a highly recommended experience for sure.

This game is considered a AA game because of its relatively lower budget. But, the complexity of the quests and dialogue options is SO impressive. Can NOT wait to play it again to get other results regarding the story. I just hope it sells well, so that Spiders will have more money to, hopefully, build an even bigger, more complex sequel (or other great RPG). BioWare had better step their game up if they want to compete with Spiders, going forward.
Very very surprised that this game is a quality RPG and is better then anything BioWare has made in the last 10 years and its a great price

I've really enjoyed my time with Greedfall. If you are a fan of Bioware games like Dragon Age: Origins, Jade Empire, or the Mass Effect series, then I would recommend this game for you. I like the beautiful outdoor areas, the storytelling, and the character/team building. There are a few technical issues and some missing features that you might expect in a game like this that keeps it from getting 5 stars from me.

This will definitely appeal to the hardcore rpg fan... and maybe some not so hardcore rpg fans. If you love decision making... weapon crafting... upgrading etc etc this game might be for you This is not a AAA game. Which means it was made on a budget and developed by a small studio. Do not go into this game expecting Mass Effect (a classic series) but expect a studio with a lot of potential to maybe one day reach the greatness of the old BioWare I own the psychical and digital copies of this game... ive had over 20 hours with it. This is worth a buy. That says a lot because ive played a little of the new fire emblem... Im also working on astral chain... and i jsut bought borderlands 3 recently . This is the opinion of an all around gamer . Not coming in here with no type of standard for games.... just know what to expect and enjoy ! .

I can't tell you how many quarters I plunked into SFII and its cousins in my younger years. When the PS3 version went on the cheap I had to pick it up. I've played it quite a bit with my kids and we alll enjoy it. The controls are done about as well as you can expect with a gamepad. It would probably play a lot better with an old school joystick. My only gripe is that there is some mild profanity than cannot be filtered out. Your only option is to turn the voice-over volume all the way down but this is a bit overkill in my case.

I was always more of a MK fan when it came out compared to SF but I have got to admit this game is pretty fun also especially with others and the online feature is great as well. Like all fighting games though it can get a bit boring after so many times. I pretty much bought the game when I have others come over for game night. But if you like fighting games such as MK or SF and never get bored from them, then this is the game for you. The CPU also gives you some competition cause I feel for playing on normal it seems a bit difficult.

This is a game that i had really high hopes for. As a kid i always loved playing this game at the arcade, even if it was just Street Fighter one. When I first played this game, I didnt see alot of new characters and was really disappointed at the fact that they did not hook up the grapiX a bit more. I remember fighting in the USA and throwing someone into the boxes.. What happened to that!! Also, there is no bonus round. What happened to smashing up the Mercedes Benz.. I loved That!!! I would only recommend this if you enjoy the classic game with out all the fun extras in a more colorful scene..

Street Fighter has returned from the land of the dead and thank god, and if you don't believe in god then thank your savior, and if you don't have a savior... well thank capcom. For those who know Street Fighter is the best fighting game ever, and thankfully the fourth installment is no different. You can play as 20 some characters each with distinctly different styles of playing. The graphics in the game are top notch. Tthe painted art style really grasps you and pulls you into the action. The animation is smooth and running at a great 60 frames it is amazing. Every animation of every move is beautiful and graceful. The genre-defining 2-D gameplay returns brilliantly. The detail in each of the stages is great too, there is constantly something happening in the backround of the stage. The audio is typicall of most games at this point. It runs in Dolby Digital 5.1 and maybe DTS, I am not sure. The sound of flesh hitting flesh is very satisfying when pulling off an ultra combo against a tough foe. The Singleplayer is a solid experience. You fight round after round against characters selected at random. The final Boss, Seth, is a complete maniac with a cheap set of moves that you can counter after learning his timing. You will learn his timing though because the campign is so repetetive you will be able to blaze through Seth time after time. The campaign has several difficulties that you can set depending on whether you are a rookie or a seasoned veteran. The multiplayer mode is great, with both local and online multiplayer modes it will keep you coming back for more. Each of the characters have unique playing style with different combos. The unlockables will keep you playing the campaign to achieve them all. The game will keep you playing for roughly 100 hours before you get tired of it. I am going to tell you right now that it is most fun to play local multiplayer with family and friends. The game is easily worth 60 bucks. Out of 10 I would give Street Fighter IV an 8.9 out of 10. The game is amazing but not exceptionaly amazing. Please leave feedback. Thanks for reading, BEYOND!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The person below me doesnt know what hes talking about. SF 4 is not hard, and you can unlock characters even on EASIEST MODE. All you have to do is meet certain requirements like.. certain amount of perfects, some ultra finishes, etc, BUT ITS NOT HARD. Like i said SF does it again, this is what fighting games are all about. Ive been a SF fan since i was 6 and ive always loved it. This SF 4 is beautiful, the graphics are awesome, the controllers are perfect, the new characters are cool and the new specials are the bomb, theyre crazy!! If youre a SF fan, you wont have a problem learning the moves. The only thing i dont like about the game is when people keep using Ken all the time and all they do is corner others and do shoryukens like crazy, other than that this game is a must have for all the SF fans out there, this game was the only reason why i got a ps3.

PS3 Version runs perfect and loads even faster when the option to load to hard drive is selected. My kids love this game as well as myself. Last time I played a fighting game like this was in the 1990's. This is one Top Notch of a game. Looks stunningly awasome on my 42' Panasonic 1080P Plasma. Now I need someone to sell those old programmable controllers like the good old days. Although the PS3 Controller works nice its not like those aftermarket fancy ones I wish I could afford.

This is classic SF, even the storylines suck. All the old school characters are there as well as some new ones. It's a great game and a lot of fun. I particularly like the online option where you can battle in ranked and unranked matches. Buy it, you won't regret it.

I love street fighter, I love this game too, but. The last character is the cheesiest character I have ever seen. His name is Seth. I honestly don't think they put much though behind him. They basically said, OK well have a diesel manikin guy with a circle on his stomach. lame! All his moves are cheesier than cheese. the insane Teleporting, the fact that he can keep grabbing you no matter what. using other peoples attacks. I despise Seth even his name is not exactly a bad guys name. They messed it up with this guy. However buy this game Is the best. I been playing it non-stop but I hate the blue mans group manikin at the end.

One thing I like is having a good boss that uses skills to make a game challenging, not some some teleporting guy with cheap moves........since when was difficulty replaced with cheating. Besides that its a great game, oh yeah get ready for some hardcore gaming blisters on your thumb.

The king o' fighters returns for the next gen consoles. Sf4 has it all, sharp new graphics, new blistering combos even more impressive, flashy super finishing moves. Expect the old favorites like Blanka, Ryu, and Vega as some new blood like Seth and Abel. Is the AI to easy and your friends are no longer a challenge? It is okay because this game also has an online feature hows that?

If you hate fighting games, you will hate it, oh. I love fighting games but this game is so much fun and I grew up playing every street fighter on all the systems that came out before the once we have now and when I saw this game on tv I checked it out bought it and you can't say anything about the graphics, if you have a cheap TV, you need an HD TV period. I have mine hooked up to my 40 inch and the graphics and sound are truly amazing and I love it there's not a bad thing about it and some people are just bad at video games period and say its hard. That's so not the case if your into good fighting games you will love the graphics truly the best fighting games and the Combos some are hard but if you practice you will be pretty darn good and if you don't practice of course your going to suck. By far one of the best games I have had and I have had it since it game out and I just can't believe the bad reviews about this amazing game! Dont buy this game if you have a cheap tv because you cant see the game how it was meant to be but if you have an 'HD TV' and its hooked up to the HDMI it will look truly amazing and the sound just every thing is crisp about it, don't hate on this game, it's one of the best.

This could be the worst fighting game made.It is so hard to do any special moves.I was a champ at this back in the day and now I can't beat my 4 year old son.I would not recommend to any one.Mortal Combat /DC is the game to get.

I am a long time Street Fighter fan and I had been waiting for this since Comic-Con 2008 Street Fighter panel. This game is well worth the wait! The graphics are amazing, both character and background with fluid animations and perfectly rendered character designs. While some games may try for a realistic look, SF IV retians the classic Street Fighter look and feel. The characters look and play like the fighters fans have known for years. The gameplay is fast and intense! There is no shortage of action in this game and the controls work great. I am using the Dualshock 3 controller and have found control to be flawless. The gameplay itself harkens back to SF II, but with some new twists to bring Street Fighter to the new generation. The combo system works intuitively and there are different types of moves to keep you playing for a long time to come. The gameplay is easy enough to pick-up for beginning gamers and has enough depth to interest more experienced gamers. The difficulty is adjustable from Easiest to Hardest, which is great for any level of gamer. I've unlocked most of the hidden characters, including Akuma, and have had no problems doing so. The anime scenes for each character are fun to watch, and makes me wish the people who created these scenes would make a Street Fighter IV anime. The Japanese voice track features some top ranked voice talent, so I recommend the Original Japanese dialogue over the English dub. Lots of action, great graphics and high replay value. Street Fighter IV rocks!

Overall I like this game. It's a solid SF game. The online battle is great and fun you can mix it up with people all over the world instead of having to wait for a friend to come over. The graphics are great, but the story lines are pretty stupid. I don't think they invested a great deal of time in the story line. My biggest complaint with this game is the last boss as most people have said. He is way to hard even on the very easy setting. It makes it difficult to unlock the hidden characters. You can spend an hour easily trying to beat him. I'm also not a fan of the controls for this game with the PS3 controller. The D-Pad is not in a great spot, it makes it kind of awkard and the analog stick doesn't provide enough friction to get the special moves right everytime. Overall it's a fun game but I have a feeling I'm going to get bored with it quick.
Worst fighting game ever, and i mean it's really a horrible game, thats why they are re-making it with the title Super street fighter IV
this gami shows all the hisstori offi stret figther

this game is awful. its too hard. i can beat it on easy but it doesn't unlock anything. the only way to unlock more characters is to beat it on medium and its too hard. its too hard too hard too hard too hard. its ridiculous. its not even any fun just frustrating. just don't buy this game its not worth 60 bucks cuz you won't even be able to do anything. online is even worse you don't stand a chance to an opponent online. i understand there needs to be a challenge but its not fun...i don't know how to express how much i despise this game i don't even like to play it because all that's gonna happened is some cussing and some controller tossing...don't even bother with street fighter.

I have been waiting ST4 for such a long time, i've started playing this game since its 1st version on Nintendo 24, yah, for sure it kept its origin, but everythings the same, and even worse, WHY did it even bother releasing it? Its hard to control for starter, comparing to Naruto, the graphic was way off, When you die from the game, you cant continue, but have to start again from the menu.... anyway, I'm a japanese, SF4 is invented by japanese, and i have to say that this game really sucked, the price was too high, and its noth worth the price and time....

Graphics are good but game play SUCKS. I mean its just horrible. Ive been playing street fighter for years and even when this game is on Very Easy I have a very hard time beating the boss. I have never seen anything like this. Buy this game only if you want to raise your stress level through the roof. Save your money for Tekken 6 or to pay rent, or to flush down the toliet because any of those things is better than paying for SF4.

Loved playing SF back in the day at the aracades. I always thought it would be cool to bring the game home. Finally got SFII at home and it was good and I played it on & on. Now, that I purchased SFIV it was great on the graphic side but my game genre has definitely played since then. Either you're going to love this game or hate it. Its pretty much that simple. I took the game back in a few days. Why did it take so long, I was looking for the receipt...lol

As a casual gamer, some of the battles are quite challenging to tackle, but extremely fun to play. There are linear elements to the story, but overall it's treated as an open world game with platforming, puzzles, and plenty of opportunities to use the force on enemies.

EA sucks for thinking nobody wants any single player games anymore. Or they just see things with greedy eyes, this game is great and respawn did an amazing job at giving us fans a star wars games we wanted for so long. Let this be a lesson to EA that not everybody wants plays fortnite all day long and wants to pay for stupid micro transactions and loot boxes. This is one of the best games of the year, no multi player no loot boxes no micro transaction. Just an amazing single player Star Wars adventure. Great job respawn!
Awesome star wars game. The physical copy only contains a download code, no benefit to buying the physical copy instead of a digital copy.

I am so happy I got this game. The gameplay is excellent. The graphics are beautiful. The game plays very smoothly even on my 3 year old laptop with graphics on epic. But the best part of this game is the story. It really pulls you in and you really care about the characters. I haven't finished the game yet but the game is so good I don't want it to end. Highly recommended.

If you like exploration, don't mind the brutal souls nature of combat, this is the Jedi game you have been looking for. I've enjoyed the time I've spent, there is a lot more exploration then I expected and I'm having fun with it. The combat is more on the souls side, with a risk/reward save/death mechanic. Also this game does not hold your hand. There is no waypoint marker, and the HUD is limited. Though Respawn did a good job giving clues, like having the droid on your back turn red when you need to heal, so that is a nice change in pace, unlike a lot of newer games that will guide you from point A-B on the screen. Only design choice they made that might be immersion breaking is the fact you don't slice the Stromtroopers in half. I get they most likely wanted to keep the rating at T so they couldn't, but I can see how that could bother someone, so giving the warning here. Overall I'm having fun with it and if you are looking for a game to get your Jedi on, this is the Droid (game) you are looking for.

Finally, a fun Star Wars adventure. It has the look and feel of the movies, and using the light saber just feels perfect. The story is entertaining, and if your PC has the horsepower to play it at epic, it looks incredible. Another nice aspect is the ability to select difficulty, because it can very hard on Jedi Master. Worthy of the Star Wars name!

I was able to purchase this game for $15 less than most stores, and they offered free 2 day shipping. It even arrived a day earlier than expected during the busiest shipping time of the year. Very satisfied with the entire experience and my husband is loving the game!
Returned the game after seeing that another shop offers a lower price and delux edition.

This is my starting point in the call of duty series and it is an excellent one at that, I do plan on going back to play the predecesor call of duty 4 but for now let me talk Modern Warfare 2. This game has a stellar campaign with plenty of omg moments packed into the relatively short story missions clocking in around 6 or so hours and incredible visuals to compliment those moments. Theres also the inclusion of spec ops mode which are pretty much campaign missions without the story to accompany them, these can be done with a friend and will take some impressive players to unlock all the stars for the missions. The sound effects from bullets whizzing overhead to large explosions in the distance are all spot on and make the experience all that more enjoyable. The multiplayer is what wil keep me coming back to this game however as it has a vast amount of unlockable weapons, emblems, and prestiges. The ability to customize my player online to have either a sniper, smg, or assault rifle is an amazing feat ( if a little unbalanced) and keeps me playing deep into a saturday night to try and earn new attachments to my guns as well as new perks. although the experience can be frustrating at times depending on what type of people your playing with its really great at its good times. As a new player to this series Im enjoying every bit of it.

This is one of the most addicting fps games ever! I was so addicted to this game that it got so many straches and broke! This a really awesome call of duty, and if you like thrilling action, awesome multiplayer, and something really fun, this is the perfect game! Great Game for FPS fan, and great for playing when bored. I recommand this to anyone that enjoys shooter games and anything that relats to awesomeness!! Please thumbs up if you thought this reivew was helpful (i would thumbs up myself)
great garaphics, entertaining, and it keeps me busy.

Modern warfare2 for xbox 360 is by far the best multiplayer game for xbox 360 the campaign is great spec-ops is fun the only down side about modernwarfare 2 is that it is easy for modders to get in and cheat but when u end up beating them that makes you feel even better also i believe this game is better then black ops because the guns are better and the graphics i dont like having to buy everything in black ops plus the weapons are insufficent they had some great ideas but when it comes to multiplayer in call of duty infinity ward knows how to make a good game the only good things about treyarch is there campaign and zombies which i like alot.

this game is oh so f-ing awesome! good story line good maps,guns and graphics. way much better than black ops! looking forward for mw3 to come out in november 2011.oh the graphics are so much better on a led tv yall should get it will blow your mind! oh and one last thing for all of yall that complain about how others game playing like campers, noob tubers who cares and shut up and play your own game cause after yall IT'S JUST A GAME!

Let me say first have always had a love for FPS and this genre of game. This one blows them all out of the water. I've owned all of the Call of Duty games but never found myself still playing almost a year later. The only games that have kept my attention span this long were GRAW 1, GRAW 2, and Halo 3. Multiplayer modes that it. Graphics in this game are amazing. Environments are great, not standard textures such as with most Halo games. Campaign was fun and challenging at times. The reason to buy this game is for XBox Live Multiplayer. This is extremely addicting. You will find yourself on it for hours try to unlock the next weapon, attachment, callsign, emblem, or dominate your friends. Never has a multiplayer for console brought so many people together of all ages. The only downside to the online play is the Modders, Hackers, etc. All of these people are spineless losers who have no integrity. What is funny is that they're playing an Military games. One of the core values that was pushed on me during my service to the country was integrity.
If you played Modern Warfare, then you're in for a great treat. No locations, weapons, etc and still one of the best games in its class

like everybody else, i beleived the treyarch lies. they told me black ops would be good through their trailers and ads and so on. i was so disappointed to see how boring and terrible it is. i gave BO a month then i couldnt take anymore. so me and my friends went back to mw2 and it seems better than ever. great game and if ur thinking about buying black ops dont, stick with mw2. better spawns, graphics, guns, killstreaks count toward more killstreaks

I've played every single Cod across every platform since the days of the 1st Cod on PC and Call of duty modern warfare 2 is as near to perfect as an Xbox game can get. The graphics in this game are stellar, the 1st modern warfare is the only other game for 360 that even comes anywhere near the graphic quality of this game which would only make sense because MW1 was made by the same company but modern warfare 2 received a bit of an updated look including a touch more color. The default control layout is the most functional set up i have ever utilized in any game. The story mode is of adequate length mission-wise and varies in time length depending on the difficulty settings and has a wonderfully baffling ending. The absolute most attractive feature of this game is by far the multiplayer mode. The multiplayer mode is the fastest, most intense multiplayer experience on Xbox live. Every portion of the multiplayer mode is customizable from weapons, to perks, to equipment and every combination there of. If you own a 360 you absolutely must get this game and if you don't have a 360, GO GET ONE!

OK, OK, OK, everyone that came from under their rock early 2009 couldn't wait to get MW2, and instantly rushed to pick it up at their local Best Buy, go back under their rock, and play it. Yes, I get it. You were VERY excited, and wanted something that was more amazing than the prequel. But did you get that? Well......if ya ask me...NO, you didnt'!!!! 'ZOMG! He said it's a bad game! FLAME HIM!!' Yea, slow down for a bit. Use some intellect when you read this, k? Well......I'll be nice. The good thing about this game, minus the nice weapon sounds and the actually enjoyable SpecOps, is the 'OMG!!' moments in the campaign. MW had the sniper level, and walking around before dying thanks to a nuke going off. But what's in MW2? Well, how about a snowmobile level, ice climbing (don't look down), killing innocent Russian people in the THIRD LEVEL (yep...No Russian..YouTube it), sneaking around bases with surpressed weapons, and throwing a knife at the end of the game. Yes....OMG moments, and LOTS of them. What's the bad, though? Well....the campaign is short....VERY short.....UNBELIEVABLY short. Four hours??? ON NORMAL?!!!! WHAAAT?!!! MW1 took at least 8 on Normal! And the sequel is shorter?!!! Yea, no...not likin' that. Also, could they make it any harder to follow the story? Bouncing from Ramirez to Roach to Ramirez to MacTavish (yes, he's in the game).......I lost track of what was actually going on after 'No Russian'....third level...that's the last time I remember the story being clarified EVER in this game.....and with a four-hour campaign....should I be surprised? I also said the online wasn't so great.....well...if you played the game BEFORE the many, many patches, you already know why. Maybe it's because I REALLY liked MW1 due to it actually took SKILL to dominate in that game, but...wow...why, Infinity Ward? Why????? Why would you let people run around with a grenade launcher, Thumper (which launches explosive rounds....just like another weapon...hmmm), and Scavenger so I can keep picking up launcher rounds? This game wasn't meant for veteran players of MW1 like myself. It was meant for novice players to hop in and get easy kills without using much brain power. Also, some of the killstreaks are waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaay overpowered. Think about it......Chopper Gunner comes in....flies above you...you die. You spawn, you die again. Yea, let's change 'Hit X to respawn' to 'Hit X to die and get your butt spawn camped by a Chopper Gunner', which fires a flare before it can be shot down. So, if you're lucky enough to have a horrible gunner that just can't see you, or you have Cold-Blooded (prevents you from showing up as a red square), you can shoot two Stingers at it and take it down. Ehh......it can happen. But let's talk about that AC130. Get 11 kills in a row, and you get to call in this baby (if you pick it as a killstreak). So, what happens with this thing? Oh...nothing......except it rains (they won't let me type it) on Earth with explosive shells firing at you, and shooting four flares before FINALLY being shot down....unless you have a team that's willing to co-ordinate attacks (one person fires a Stinger, flare...another fires, AC130 can't shoot flares in time...BOOM!)....just run....and hide.....for a good minute. Don't even get me started on the glitchers before the patches. I played a few hours on Saturday.....nine games. Of those nine, half had people doing the care package glitch, and the rest were modded rooms where you basically run at twice the speed....yea, that's a fun way to play a game! Let's glitch and cheat like we're playing Halo 2 back in its prime days!! :D Good idea (.....insert explicit word here). Before that, it was rooms that had infinite ammo....yea, imagine an automatic grenade launcher...with infinite ammo...FOR EVERYONE.....fun? Yes. Annoying after a while? Yes. Yet ANOTHER problem with online....LAAAAAAAAG. No, it's not my connection. 6MB wouldn't lag so much. But I can't count how many times I fired four rounds into someone that tried to knife me, only having the last two register, letting that guy knife me. OR, shooting an automatic gun...one, two, three, four, five, six....guess which ones registered? Yep, four, five and six....the last rounds register....what happened to the first three?!! Don't you people know you can't destroy matter?!!! If you're like me, you'll get beyond annoyed with people running around stabbing you, or sniping you with a shotgun....actually, lemme talk about that as well. How far do you think you should be able to hit someone with a shotgun? Not that far, right? Don't you think that.....hmm, a few feet....is effective, but after that, it's not worth anything? Yea, tell that to the SPAS-12, or the Model 1887 before it got patched. I'm on the catwalk on Sub Base...that's two full levels up...I kill a guy in two shots that's below me.......yep...the range with shotties is unbelievable. And another pet-peeve. How is a .50cal sniper rifle going to actually HIT a guy, and he doesn't die?! Come on!!! It's a 50....50!!!!!! That's death waiting to happen! But chest? Walks. Neck? Ehh, if he's lucky, walks....but the Intervention, magically, they're not so lucky....uh-huh. Great job, guys. Maybe I'm being WAAAAY too picky, but coming from a game that actually was close to being a well-balanced game (MW1) to one that's completely broken (the FUBAR mistake they called MW2), it's obvious to see that MW2 was nothing but a cash cow, only to abuse the name instead of actually improving from MW1. It was made to be for those novice players/little kids that want the best early and go 'OMG! Grenade Launcher! And I can still have perks! Cool!' and go use that instead of learning how to aim a gun, fire rounds (assuming all of them register!), and getting a kill. *sigh*.....veterans......don't buy this game, 'less you're more patient than I am......and I'm not a patient person to begin with........ P.S. I re-read this five times to delete the profanity from the review....that's how frustrating this game is.....six, now.

I got this game for the multiplayer basically. Its awesome, hour less nights on this game for sure. It has soo many game types and weapon unlocks... And best of all the 'Killstreaks'. Killstereaks are basically a killing spree. So you if you got 3 kills in a row with out dying you get UAV... to spot enemies on your HUD. You can customize your killstreaks also. Now the campaign.. its fun, but it get boring at some times. But I don't really care about the campaign. Get it.. it has the best multiplayer ever. Thanks for reading! :)

I would say the online experience is the best for this game, but if you are not hooked up to Xbox Live and still want a good game Call of Duty has it. Special Ops is never ending it seems and adds a lot of difficulty to the game. The campaign was fun and the different difficulties actually make it really hard. I would buy this game if you own a console.

I was very excited about getting this game as I heard MW3 was practically a repeat of this game (however I may purchase MW3 in the near future). The gameplay is nearly flawless, you move smoothly, and it's a great overall experience when you're playing. My favorite part of the game is definetly the 'Special Ops' mode. If you can't afford Xbox Live for the online multiplayer #which is pefect, the way you level up, the killstreaks, the customs you can create is very innovative and very fun# then this mode is what you'll find mostly exciting. There are a variety of missions to play and each one is challenging and extremely fun to play. You can either go solo or play with a friend. I recommend a second player because by doing that, you'll get the most out of the 'Special Ops.' The biggest flaw of this game is the single player Campaign. First off, there is no co-op like in World at War, so you're stuck playing by yourself even if you want to play with a friend. The story however, is extremely confusing and hard to keep up with. It is almost as if it doesn't make sense. The layout of the storyline is very random and you shift from one person to another trying to figure out what relation the last mission has to the current one. It's very short compared to other Call of Duty games as I was able to tackle it in mere hours. The Campaign was obviously not the focus on this project. Overall it is a great game but the story needs big adjustments.

this game is so amazing, it is rediculously better than black ops. the graphics are the best ever. the online is sooooooo fun when u arnt playing against a bunch of hackers, noobs, and campers. the campaign is really fun but short, but it seems that the campaign is to short for every game.

When i bought this game in November of 2009, I thought hey, Call of Duty, all right woohooo.. I purchased the game as soon as I could like any other anxious customer. As soon as I put the game in my Xbox, I fell addicted to it.. It was very fun... Until i prestiged.. Everything got boring... People were cheating.. The killsreaks were insanly overpowered.. You respawned in a location were the enemy is! Really 'Team Deathmatch' Is not team deathmatch, its run around the map shooting everyone else, by camping in buildings, setting up claymores, and so forth.. Now for a new game, that people haven't really thought of at all. That is Battlefield Bad Company 2... A game most people say, 'what is that??' Let me tell you this game, is 10 times more real, than MW2. This game requires straegy... You can't run out in the middle of a map, shooting a grenade launcher, and thinking you'll kill someone.. You can't snipe or camp in buildings.. For exmple.. You know how you can shoot a rocket launcher at a house in MW2 and nothing will happen to the building? Well in bad company, you can blow the **** out of walls, tell your buddies were the enemy is if you spot them, you can drive vehicles in Bad company.. (Tanks, ATV, humvees, choppers) You can heal your soldiers, no more getting shot and immediatly dying.. (MW2) And most of all it requires strategy.. You have to work together to win the game and get more points.. It is more fun overall, and i encourage everyone to get it, if you like MM2, but is sick of online play.. I thought the same thing.. 'I'm not bying because of a review'.. but trust me it is worth the money..

I AGREE THIS GAME IS GREAT BUT SOME TIMES I GET TIRED OF THESE NO LIFE HAVEING HACKERS THEY JUST DONT GET IT THEY JUST MAKE THE GAME BADER AND BADER.IM GET BORED OF IT SOME TIMES TOO.IM ABOUT TO BUY BATTLE FIELD BAD COMPANY 2..

When I first started playing this game I had lots of fun but now with all the cheating and boosting going on it really makes no sense to even play anymore. People are constantly exploiting the game and Infinity ward is doing nothing to stop it. For example every other free for all match you will find someone boosting ' setting tactical insertion and killing each other over and over to gain killstreak rewards and eventually the nuke BOOM!! game over for everyone. Team death match is not really a team at all everyone is out for number one. This game has lost alot of it's original flare because of the cheating and lack of teamwork. Things that could make this game better is maybe a lobby for people who just want to cheat but I suppose they wouldn't find any fun in that. I know halo multiplayer trys to match people of the same skill but in MW2 you will be matched against someone who is either and absolute expert or someone who has never played a shooter game before,so maybe if they could match people according to their skill level. All in all this is a really fun game if you like just running and guning.Also parents beware!! you kids will be exposed to some very filthy language and sad to say it is mostly just little kids talking like this. Would I recommend this to a freind?well that is a yes and no question.

Another thing is the boosters in the game, they got rid of Cage match because people were using that to boost so they are trying to get rid of it but lets face it, they won't ever be able to totally rid the game of cheaters and again lets face it.. everyones boosted at least once lol whether youre trying to get FMJ for your gun or trying to get Fall. Im fairly new to playing these types of firstperson shooter games, but I found this one very accessable. Ive played other types of games for quite some type, but Im no xbox live champion. I bought this game simply for the on-line play. It never gets dull! There's so many challenges to complete, guns to master, and then you have the Prestige modes. I play this game every day online. It's a lot of fun and the game play always changes as you play against different people. I bought the wireless headset for chatting, but I found I hardly use it as I'm tired of hearing 10 year old's cursing up a storm or people trash talking others. MUTE is a great feature! My only complaint about the online portion is the amount of points it takes to update your maps - but the updated maps are great. Learn your maps, and master your guns. The best gun to use is the AUG HBAR and the .50 Cal Sniper rifle. Anyway, master your guns, learn your maps and take out the 'campers'... oh, it's so much fun to ruin their killstreaks!

Nice game overall but a little short in playing time in single player. The look and feel of the game is good and overall it's entertaining. The only drawback I have found so far is not with the game its self but with all the gutter mouth trash talk on multi-player. Sounds like it's full of 10 year olds who like to call everyone by the 'N' word. At least you can mute them. Do you know what is your 10 year old is doing on xbox live ? That aside, I would recommend the game.

I really hate the online play. It is so stupid how people tenth prestige hack, and nuke boost. But when you play with people who play fairly its fun. Don't think i'm not good either because I'm actually really good. $15 IS EXPENSIVE FOR 3 NEW MAPS.

It need new maps... maps more like CODMW 1. QuICKLY!!!!

If you're one of the few who still do not own this game I would strongly advise that you not buy this game. Unless, that is, you were not planning to play multiplayer. The campaign and spec ops are fun but only a limited amount. The multiplayer is terrible. The concept is great; however, the game becomes so inconsistent depending on the connection. If you get even slightly angry when playing any game you will find yourself very irrate amidst the glitch-plagued, cheat-filled multiplayer. The arrogant creators at infinity ward believed the game would be glitch-free, unable to be hacked. They made a terrible shortcut in the game design--lack of any administrative tools to counter glitching and cheating. Now the game has seen 4 fun-killing glitches and the latest has been abused for the past 3-4 weeks with no end in sight. Quiet simply the game is no longer any fun.

I really, really wanted to love this game. I bought it, and played it for several hours. Mostly online. Its... old. I played so much COD when it first came out. I did the levels / achievements / the collectables / the guns / prestiege points / etc. Well if you haven't had enough of it... It's back. But to be honest, this really feels like a mulitplayer map upgrade for the old COD. It's not worth a full $60. Exactly the same old style of play, other than it takes less bullets now to kill someone in the game. Average life span in multiplayer is less than a few seconds. When you get your barings and run around a corner into gunfire, and then respawn, come back, get killed, respawn on a grenade, respawn... (yawn) It's boring, becuase it's been done to death. Nothing new here... Single player is very quick and easy, but it's level designs are nicely put together. No one talks over multiplayer unless it's vile cursing and racial epitets... (more yawn) I'll play Left 4 Dead 2 or Assassins Creed 2 thank you very much. Save your $$$ if you want plot and depth to your game. If YOU ABSOLUTELLY HAVE TO play a shooter game with no plot other than kill streaks and respawn timers, then have at it... this is one of the good ones for that... I just felt that I want more meat on my video game bone. This is a COD Fan boy's wet dream. For all others, avoid and go find something with a little more depth...

I have been off and on with this MW2 since its' release and I have to say that it is a very enjoyable game. The fact that I keep coming back to it speaks for itself enough considering how easily I tend to bore of a game. + First, I have to touch on what everyone is saying about the campaign. Personally I enjoyed it. The storyline was decent and most definitely an interesting concept. It wasn't the hardest campaign to finish, but it was fun none-the-less, I have a decent amount hours logged on the campaign itself. + The key highlight for me has been the multiplayer and xbox live play. I have spent a significant amount of time on live, as well as just doing some free-for-all matches with some friends of mine. I have found the weapon leveling system to be very fun! I like how you have to posses either a certain amount of skill or large amount of freetime to unlock upgrades for your weapons. I always hated the person who would run around with the best weapon and equipment on a game and obtain a decent score just because of their inventory. + Now, on the other hand, one bad thing about the live play and weapons... The akimbo shotguns... Just in case you are not familiar with this, it is a dual wielded shotgun that does very high damage and has a rediculous spread that will hit its target if you are even remotely close. It takes little to no skill with this weapon and every online game, there seems to be some no talent idiot running around blasting people with these. Last I checked, video games are quite a bit more fun when there is some sort of tactics or planning employed. + Overall, I have found this game to be great! Great graphics, awesome leveling system, fun campaign, and intense multiplayer action. I would recomment this game to any FPS lover.

This game is really not that bad I'm just tired of people calling it 'the best game'. This is not the best game at all. Arma II is the best game. Most people just don't have a fast enough computer to play Arma II. Arma II is ahead of its time. Call of Duty is old and played out.

The single player is ok. Too much hollywood flash. Trying to make it into an action movie kinda stuff. The ending is the exact same as the previous two games. Cod4 = pistol shot to bad guy, win game. W@W = exact same. MW2 = knife throw to bad guy, win game. Cant believe how lame they ended the last THREE games the same way. Slowmo kill saving your buddy and its over. Overall still fun. The multiplayer can burn. Its the worst of all 4 latest games following the CoD4 pattern. The killstreaks are sooo stupid. Player controlled missles that show where your at? Player controlled death ships that shot missles at displayed targets. You can get like 10-15 kills with these things!!!! On CoD4 and W@W you had 3 kill streaks and you might get a few kills for them but this game went waaaaaay over the top. They changed the perks too much. The pro perks were cool but the effects they gave were rediculous. They turned this CoD game into a Halo copy. Think about it for a second. ZERO fall damage with commando pro. Long distance lunge attacks with a knife? Unlimited sprinting ability?!?! I thought this was modern warfare? Not super human combat. The one thing that makes me sooo mad is the marathon/lightweight/commando tactical knife combo that most players use onilne. Makes it completely annoying to play getting knifed because the character runs sooo fast you cant shoot him in time before he turns to mist 20ft away and reappears with a knife inside of you. Stupid. Hate it.

This is one of the most fun games to play. First of all, the campaign is pretty cool. Then special-ops co-op mode is pretty fun. It is basically doing a mission with a buddy. The great thing for both modes are the achievements; they make you want to do the hard levels. Then of course, there is the online multiplayer. This by far is the best part. There are so many guns and attachments to unlock. Also, the class perks makes online play much more fair and fun than CoD4. There are also many killstreak rewards to choose from: care packages to nukes! Overall, this is a gam worth buying because it will keep you coming back.

Please don't listen to reviews of people comparing this to another PC game. For the Xbox this game is great and a must have in the collection.

Being new to this game and the XBox 360, I was fairly unsure about what this game had to offer. But, now that I own it, I love it. My three favorite things about this game are as follows: online, online, and online. Of all the internet gaming i've done, this is by far my most enjoyable experience. As soon as you buy this game, please make sure you've got your XBox Gold Membership up and running, or else you'll miss out. As for the gameplay, its laid out perfectly and you have a ton of different weapons at your fingertips. The scenery is awesome, and it changes constantly. So, don't worry about getting bored. As I stated above, the campaign is kinda short, but thats a small price to pay for the entire package. As for controls, the controller set-up is pretty easy to figure out, and eventually will become instinctive for you. I own a Wii and was VERY used to the motion and point controller, but I still got used to the 360's controller set-up for this game pretty quick. So, seasoned 360 owners should have no issues. Some requirements that I recommend: XBox Gold, a good headset, and a wireless controller. Energy drinks are optional because you'll be playing into the wee early hours of the morning, lol. Other than that, don't sweat getting 'waxed' when you first start playing. There's a learning curve that everyone has to endure. **Note** Please do not buy this game for a kid. There's already enough kiddos who are online playing this that use profanity constantly. 15/16 year olds and above should play this game.
Pretty good game. Wish the campaign was longer but it still was great. Feels like your in a movie almost. Also, the multiplayer on xbox live is awesome!

A good game overall, but not necessarily the ground-breaking experience you might be expecting.

Modern Warfare 2 is an excellent first person shooter. The controls are excellent and fluid. There are three components to the game. One is Special Ops, in which you alone or with a friend via Xbox Live or split-screen clear levels with different objectives. Warning: Veteran Difficulty is insane. The second component is the campaign mode. When compared to the first game, this game's campaign let me down. For one, there are times when it gets confusing. And secondly, you don't really get attached to the new characters that are introduced. The third component is multiplayer mode. This is the highlight of the game. There are 70 levels to level up, ten times if you choose to prestige. There are many challenges and weapon specific challenges that reward you with a title, which you can show off to your friends.

Single player game is okay and the storyline is mediocre at best. I finished it in a day or so. It pretty much gets you ready for multiplayer, which is where I have most of my fun. Getting into a match is quick and easy. Wait times are around 1-2 minutes max. Maps are all laid out nicely. Buildings almost always have multiple entrances to keep you on your toes and have plenty of spots to snipe from. Plenty of weapons to choose from with the option to have 5 customizable gear setups. The gameplay is always fun and keeps me coming back for more. Cons: Could have a few more maps. (I'm sure there will be map packs soon) No option to select a map unless you host a private game. No organized system for guilds.

The campaign is very good, however i personally prefer the COD 4 campaign. There is a lot of problems with the online multiplayer. For example, there are a lot of glitches and hackers online. It can get a little repetitive, which is where map packs come in. Overall this game is 100% worth the money, despite all of its problems.

I'm writing this review to give you the full Modern Warfare 2 experience.This game is absolutely amazing.5 years after Modern Warfare, Makarov the man loyal to Zakhaev the guy you shot down in COD 4 wants revenge on everybody.An entire nation is duped into military action,and America is invaded by a foreign power.The campaign hops back and forth between the US and overseas.The enemies in cover are well better hidden than in Modern Warfare.Your allies are ready and willing to move up,help check the corners and even prompt you to move forward.The visuals are simply amazing with every scene looking like a major blockbuster movie.Over the course of the story you will infiltrate arctic bases,race to safety on snowmobiles,sprint over slum rooftops in Rio,hold fast food restaurants against invading armies and liberate the White House from enemy hands.The level designs are fantastic from start to finish.Some people might get very offended,but their is a play through were You shoot innocent civilians in a crowded airport.You don't have to play this part of the game if you don't want to.Modern Warfare 2's multiplayer is better than ever before.The big edition is Spec Ops mode.It's a collection of 23 missions designed for two players to battle their way thru.It also shows events that happened elsewhere within the game,as well as in Call Of Duty 4.Competitive multiplayer is what you're familiar with with as in COD 4.Leveling,perks,kill streaks rewards it's all here,and It's been tweaked and rebalanced for a better experience.You're constantly unlocking rewards earning XP for just about everything you do.Completing challenges for new gun attachments,leveling up perks,even opening up custom titles to display along side your name and matches.Kill streaks are now awarded for new vehicles,auto turrets,care packages for random bonuses,even to rain AC-130 from above.For those that play badly you're still rewarded you get a bonus for snapping a scoreless streaks of death.3rd person mode not all that great,you might play it once or twice,but that's it.Modern Warfare 2 is sure to be a game of the year,and it's a first person shooter that every first person shooter junkie should own.Infinity Ward you done it again.

You will be impressed with the online play with all the new maps. There are so many new weapons and theres even a perk that allows you to have 2 primary weapon attachments. Perks can be upgraded.
