Most of the criticisms you may have heard about this game do indeed apply. It is simplistic, there is not a strategy element like in the main series games, and it is pretty repetitive. However, you do get to guide hang out with all of your favorite pikmin again (except I have yet to encounter the white ones), and if you play toward the goal of completing all goals for an area, then it can be quite fun and challenging. Most areas have at least two challenges that are optional and do not affect your ability to beat the game. The first challenge is to first discover all 20 pikmin and then to not let any of them die during the level. The second challenge is to discover the hidden artifacts in the levels and retrieve them. Attempting to complete these challenges has caused me to place most levels at least 2 times so far, some even more. Some levels also have secret exits which open an extra level for you. Gameplay is repetitive, but still fun. You tap where you want Olimar to throw the pikmin in a side scrolling universe, and you move Olimar with the circle pad to try to find the exit(s), all the while collecting a little sparklium to help your ship take off and go home. There are 9 sectors. I have not completed them all yet, but according to online guides, there are 5 levels and a boss battle in the first 8 sectors and one boss battle in the 9th. There is no strategy element to speak of in this gameplay, but there is a puzzle solving, and a new element introduced of Olimar having a jetpack. So at times he can jump and fly to place the pikmin cannot go and you must solve a puzzle without them or in a new way other than just throwing them. Amiibos are used in a fun way, but not in a very necessary way. If you have a bunch cluttering up your bathtub, then you can break them out for this. Each Sector has a couple of special one-screen puzzle levels that will unlock when an amiibo is scanned. The scanned amiibo (only Animal Crossing, Pikmin, Splatoon, and Mario Party ones are supported I believe) will appear in game as an artifact and you must figure out how to get the Pikmin or Olimar to collect it. If you do not have any amiibos, then the one made special for this game will act as a randomly chosen amiibo for you when it is scanned. I have not used this feature much, but it would seem all you really need is luck and the Pikmin amiibo for this game to unlock them all. As with all artifacts, there is a funny description unlocked when the amiibo is collected and catalogued. You could easily beat this game without the need for any amiibos, and the only thing you would miss are a couple of one-screen puzzles and a bunch of funny text which you could easily find and read on the internet. You can also use the special pikmin amiibo for this game to cheat in a level, by calling more pikmin to you once per level. So if you had 10 pikmin and accidentally killed 5 but you could not progress any further with only 5, then you could scan the amiibo and more would come to help (amount depends on the level of the amiibo), however, it is clear the game sees this as cheating, because it will not allow you to unlock the special challenge of rescuing all pikmin if you use the amiibo in a level. Lastly, there is a minigame that is not very game like, in which you send the pikmin you have lead to the exit of each level into a top down environment and you leave them to harvest fire, water, crystals, grass, etc in an area and unlock more sparklium for you. It is a very slight attempt at a management sim, but it does provide yet another reason to replay certain levels if you are stockpiling a particular type of pikmin for harvesting purposes. There is a demo for this, if you try it and you feel that you would want to repeat those actions over and over for roughly 40 levels, then this is definitely the game for you.

Pikmin is my all-time favorite game; I've played it to death. It just has so much mysticism and wonder to it all, combined with stressful but rewarding gameplay that feels very unique compared to what's out there. Hey! Pikmin, on the other hand, feels very bland. It's just a semi-platformer puzzle solver that involves you tapping the screen a lot. There's little to no challenge from what I've played so far (I'm on World 3 now). A lot of the wonder from the original Pikmin series is gone; this feels very soulless.

I've played through Pikmin 1, 2, and 3 and loved them all. When I heard that a side-scrolling-spin-off game was in the works I had mixed feelings. After playing the game for a while, I still have mixed feeling about it. Let's start with the good: Despite the low resolution of the 3ds, this game is beautiful - much like the previous titles. It is a joy to look around and see the world. The Pikmin are adorable. Nintendo is so good at making mute characters come to life. The descriptions of the things we use are entertaining. The puzzles are different from most games because it's about launching Pikmin everywhere instead of getting your actual character places. There is still a small amount of managing Pikmin. The game makes you want to explore every part of the levels. On to the bad (and keep in mind, this is in comparison to previous Pikmin games) The game isn't tough at all. You don't get to micro-manage the Pikmin to do different tasks. You don't get the joy of an RTS-like game. I liked being a Pikmin Overlord, sending pikmin all over the map to kill enemies, destroy walls, and haul loot. This just isn't in the game. The Pikmin park has a very small sense of this, but it is nothing in comparison to previous titles. This game is split into a lot of different level (ala mario bros.) which makes the world feel less natural and broken up. It kills the exploration vibe of the series. Thinking about it now, this game could have been made at least thrice as good if it was a metroidvania set-up where Olimar gathers lots of Pikmin from all over and backtrack to previous places to solve puzzles that required more Pikmin or certain types of Pikmin. Exploration would go up, micro-managing would be a thing again, and the world would feel more real. This all being said, this is a good game. It has enough enjoyment in it to warrant $32 (hooray Gamer's Club), but I'm a bit wary of $40 for it. It can be a good introduction to the characters of the series, but in no means is it the same as the others with regards to gameplay.

This is probably the bare minimum of what a Pikmin Platformer game could be. I wish there was more of the main series represented in this game. Fine for fans of the series who are up for an easy platformer.

First off, this game's production value is through the roof. The 1930's art, animation and music style is so on point that it can be a bit eerie at times. It's reminiscent of old Steamboat Mickey, Betty Boop and Popeye cartoons of yore. It looks like you are watching an actual cartoon. However you should know that this is NOT an easy to play game at all. Perhaps one of the hardest games I've played in recent memory. You will probably die at least 10 times before you can clear just one level. My kids wanted to love this game so bad but it literally brought them to tears within the first 20 mins. They were begging for the pain to stop. Now when I mention the name Cuphead they give me a look of pure disgust. That being said, the game's not a lost cause. If you are persistent enough and research gameplay tips via google and youtube you just might be able to clear a level or two. I'd suggest changing your controller scheme if you find the controls funky. Polygon had a pretty good scheme they've shared in an article. My other suggestion is to use your in-game coins wisely. Purchase the 'gas bomb dash' move first, as it's integral to getting through this game. It will allow you to avoid damage as you dash past enemies. Then either get an extra HP or the 'Roundabout' weapon. It takes some getting used to but it's the largest projectile and has a boomerang effect that if held down as you play, will probably randomly save you from cheap kills as you run n' gun your way to the finish line. Last tip is the most important... PINK projectiles and enemies can be parried. In this game you NEED to Parry ALL the time in order to build up your power shots and even quickly revive a pal whos been 'ghosted'. My very last tip is to remember the enemy patterns as you go through levels. The bosses have patterns too but some are randomized. These are just a few minor tips, but honestly the only way to succeed in this game. So just understand this will NOT be an easy game. At all. But! If you give it some practice you will be able to stay long enough to enjoy it's charm. The developers actually hand drew everything and recorded actual live jazz bands to make this as authentic as possible to the 1930's cartoon style, and for that I give this game a fifth star. I love the idea and am planning to do my best at finishing it. But it'll take a lot of convincing to get my kids to even look at the game again. Good luck!

This game is meant to take you back to the computer RPG classics like Baldur's Gate 1 and 2, Planescape Torment, Neverwinter Nights.. The music, presentation and story telling are very well done. Can't recommend this enough to Dungeons and Dragons fans and classic RPG lovers.

I tried, I really did. Been playing this game for days now. I adore Obsidian and have rarely been disappointed by them. And I'm a gamer who grew up on PC RPGs. Been video gaming for decades. But we've moved past this era, haven't we? Do people still watch silent films in this day and age? Do gamers want Dragon Quest 1 when they can have Witcher 3? Pillars of Eternity seems to TAKE an eternity to play. This is a game with no artistic direction, zero cinematography, a game with laughably bad graphics, a game with virtually zero visual pyrotechnics-- and yet I can handle all that. The story is pedestrian, slow, and requires you to read tiny, unfulfilling text at every corner, at least when the D-minus voice acting isn't piercing your brain. Yet I can handle all that, too. Where I draw the line is laboriously slow, unfulfilling, tedious combat which requires you to cycle through every one of your party members and all of their commands just to go ONE round of a battle. Multiply this by dozens for longer battles and, well, I was screaming into my controller by day two of this game. This is not a game made for consoles, and it shows glaringly and unflinchingly. Simply changing someone's armor is a rigamarole that puts several different windows in your face at once, occasionally blocking the armor itself. I could list more reasons why I'm disappointed, but my keyboard might not last that long. You a JRPGer? You a fan of Witcher or KOTOR? Skip this. You've moved on from slow, plodding, ancient games. Move on from this one, too.

Capcom has actually gone, and done it. They created good modern Mega Man after all these years. You can feel the inspiration from the original series in the level design, character design, and activities. The boss fights all feel retro and modern at the same time. Just a wonderful game. While it borrows a lot from it's legacy, there are tons of quality of life additions to make the game accessible to everyone. It can be an easy romp, or challenging buster only run if you choose. There should be a sweet spot of challenge and fun you can make your own.

I'm a huuuuge fan of Mega Man so I was stoked when I heard about this new entry. Gameplay is classic Mega Man and the new additions (double gear) come across well and don't feel gimmicky. The game is HARD too... although there are 'easy' modes available for newcomers to the series as well. The only thing I was a little disappointed with is the music.... it's not bad, but overall the songs just aren't as catchy and melodic as a lot of the previous Mega Man games were. I do really like the alternate soundtrack that was available via preorder though.

Finally we get a modern Mega Man game with a decent graphical treatment. However, Mega Man 11 plays it a bit too safe. Most of the tropes of old make it back here, but not much else. After the initial 8 bosses, the Doctor Wily stage isn't particularly long (just 2 stages with a boss rush and then Wily himself with 2 forms). The new Double Gear system is a winner and does add some newness to the formulaas you can essentially speed up or add a power boost at willbut there's no real secrets to speak of, and Rush seems to take a backseat this time around with nothing new added to his abilities (all you get here is the stock Rush Spring and Rush Jet). After the main game is over, there are a series of challenges you can complete to add some replay value, though only the most hardcore of Mega Man fans will likely have the patience to tackle these with gusto. Despite this, if Mega Man 11 is any indication of things to come, the future is looking bright for the blue bomber!

Pros: - Mega Man is back in action with new graphics and a modern twist - Not full game price - I love the new art direction of the series - I really enjoyed the English voice acting (which I understand some might not agree) - The game is very fun and the new mechanics is awesome (It does not alienate long time fans at all) Cons: - Would have wanted that the Ps4 version came with a special edition - At least a manual/booklet - Soundtrack is good but not the best in the series - Would have wanted Capcom to explore more with the story (It's not a big issue though since Classic MM games always had simple plots)

If your a fan of the old school mega man games...then you will LOVE this game. Same side scrolling action packed adventure game you remember as a kid just with up dated HD graphics. Game play can be difficult (as are most mega man games) but DEFINITELY hours of fun!

My Samsung Tab S 10.5 finally died. I was looking for a replacement. I did not want to spend $400,00 dollars or more for the newer Tab S5 or higher. I found the Tab A 10,1 on sale and it fit my needs. Works great. The resolution is not that of the Tab S line, but for what I need I really like it.

I have no problem with the game itself but the actual product as a whole has a major problem. One of the items in the package is not as it is described in the description. At the time I ordered, at the time the product shipped, and still right now, the pictures show and the write up says it comes with a 'canvas carrying case' but the case is a really poor quality nylon that just looks like it'll tear if I try to carry anything in it. If I bought the game alone I'd give it a 4. It's really fun but really buggy and desperately needs the improvements they say they're working on, but when a product's description straight out LIES about what it contains I have to give it a 1. In case the product page changes, here's what it currently says, 'West Tek Canvas Carrying Bag'.

This is not a game. It's not even an alpha build of a game. Fallout 76 is just boring. Empty world, tons of bugs, and repeated server crashes are just some of the issues I had. Playing with friends can at times be fun, but it's not a reason to justify how broken the game is. I can't recommend this game at all, even if you're a huge fan of the previous fallout games. The helmet is cool. But not worth $200. I'm extremely disappointed with the quality of this title and Bethesda will need to gain back my trust before I invest any time or money into another product they release.

Helmet looks pretty cool... but disappointed that the voice modulator DIDNT WORK.... it also had some scratches that didnt look like they were from production... Maybe cool for just placing on your shelf... but thats it.

I bought the Armor edition with high hopes that F76 would be a great game. To my surprise, it was a bomb. $200 for a collector edition is a lot of money but if the game is good its worth it. There are just too many bad reviews, that I had to return. I will pick up this game when it drops to $20 or less and the way it's going, I should have this game by May 2019.

A great deal for $80, a terrible deal at $219. The helmet is molded plastic, the voice changer does not deliver on its intended feature. That said, it looks really cool. It is wearable, but uncomfortable. This is really for show, not for wear. If that is what you want, then you will be happy. I recommend it if you are a fan and this is how you want to spend your money.

I am a fallout fan but this game is extremely Buggy:(. I bought this edition because I collect gaming memorabilia but I wasnt impressed once I opened it. Too much $ for what it is. The games on special now. If I wouldve picked it up at the $39,99 price, I wouldve rated it better. For now I will wait till all the bugs get worked out.
The only reason I gave it a 3 stars, because mine was missing the West-Tek Carrying Bag. Returned this one and ordered another one, hope is complete
As the title states, items included. I have yet to play the game. I'll wait till the kinks are worked out. The helmet is a nice prop that goes well with all my other fallout memorabilia.

The helmet is awesome. Made me wish I had the pip boy to go along with it. But as for the game itself.. for the first time ever I don't really feel excitement to want to play? It's empty. No one wants to team up, and no one wants to pvp. So what your left is just vast emptiness with no npcs to compensate. I don't think I'll play it for a couple of months until the majority of bugs are fixed. The 'collectible figures' inside felt like some really cheap 99 cent toys you would buy kids from the groceries. I think one unique pop? or fallout boy figure would of done it justice.

The game itself is fun when it works but frustrating when it decides to glitch out or crash. Been playing it since release date and overall i been mostly playing with without too many interruptions. I have gotten disconnected from the the servers about 4 times and that was mainly during crafting, they should get rid of that workstation animation. Doing co-op with my friend has been mostly simple and straight forward, we did run into an issue where i could not do a quest because i did not receive quest clothes. Overall i think this game is rough around the edges and definitely needs more work, probably in a year it will be working way better but right now, only the most hardcore of fallout fans might want to bear through it.

I currently have 106 hours playing Fallout 76. The game has bugs and Bethesda is working on fixing them. Aside from the bugs I am really enjoying this game and have played it completely solo. This game is not the typical Fallout game and plays differently its more of a online survival mmo hybrid except has a storyline and quests littered all over the place. Those who say it has no story clearly have not played this game. The overall map is huge with endless things to explore. If youre looking for a complete single player typical Fallout experience You May or may not like this game. I personally am a huge Fallout fan but also a creature of habit and really enjoy grindy RPGs and crafting type games so that does affect my positive opinion towards Fallout 76. 80% of the community probably does not agree with my opinion and most diehard Fallout fans are pretty upset about this game not being Fallout 5. On to the actual physical product the Power Armor helmet is nice though the voice modulator is a bit weak and you can hear yourself over it. The bag is not canvas as described it is nylon so not as durable and feels cheap. The toy soldiers are pretty neat if your into small plastic figurines and the map is well just a map that does glow in the dark. Overall I think this should have been priced more in the $150 range than $200.

First off I will start by saying that yes the game has some bugs. What online game hasnt launched with bugs. I personally find this game to be enjoyable playing either solo or with a group. I did find that it is much more enjoyable in a group. There is a lot of exploration in this game. It did take some time getting use to not having npc's telling me where to go but I quickly got over that. Also the stash limit is a non factor. I kicked my hoarding tendencies to the side and only stash what I'll need. Weapons and armor that are lower level I just scrap and move on. I would say if you have a group of friends that love fallout pick up this game and it a chance. I'm sure with future updates new content will come out and there will be plenty of things to do.
Regardless of the reviews this game is still one to at least try. It's Fallout at heart and something new to play.

Boasting one of the most impressive collector's editions in the history of gaming, this game is a no brainer for anyone that is a fan of the series. I cannot understand the negativity this game is receiving. I've had nothing but fun with it, solo and with groups.
I been seeing all the previews, game playing and what perks the power armor edition has to offer. Looks awesome with a T-51 helmet is like a cherry on top of it all.

The leap backwards from 5 to 1 implies a significant downgrade and should temper your expectations to an extent; be under no illusions, this is very much the original PS2 game in widescreen with high-def art and extra content from earlier ports (it previously appeared on Sony PSP and Nintendo DS, plus a PC version released in 2016). In many ways, a fresh lick of paint is all thats needed the base game remains a winner and its idiosyncratic spirit still feels fresh.
This is not much of an overhaul of the original, which can be found on a lot of different platforms and for cheaper.

I was introduced to this game on the Vita with 3. I really liked it so I picked this up because I've never played the original. Its a lot like 3 and I really like it. It puts me in the mind of Final Fantasy Tactics a little bit. I think its more chaotic though. There are so many layers to this game. It can be somewhat overwhelming. If you don't mind a story driven by the wants of demons, then this will provide hours of entertainment.

My first exposure to Disgea was Disgea 5 complete on Switch which is also great(I rate it higher). I'm no Disgea expert and I've barely leveled my characters in 5, but I liked it so much that when I heard they were releasing Disgea 1 I knew it was a day one purchase for me. Now playing 1 a bit I have to say that it is great fun but I do miss some of the game play improvements made in 5. I was hoping for a remake using the 5 engine with the newer updated graphics and quality of life improvements. It is not that. From what I can tell and read about it is mostly just a graphics update. Don't get me wrong I still recommend it but I suggest if you are new to Disgea, play it first before 5 as it feels clunkier in its systems. For those new to the game it is a Tactical RPG where you control a group of units that fight turn based on a grid system. It allows crazy unit levels and progression with very deep systems that you don't actually really have to figure out if you don 't want to. It even has a character that flat out tells you you don't have to know the systems to beat the game. The almost infinite leveling and fun storyline and characters make for a good time.
If you are looking for a fun co-op game to play with a friend get this one.

This is one of the most unique gameplay experiences I have ever had. Everybody should give this game a chance. You play COOP, and you must play COOP, the game is fully designed around the idea of playing as two people who meet in prison and work together to break out to get revenge on somebody they both know. The game allows one person to buy it and someone else to download the free trial version and then you can coop without buying a second copy. A fun story full of cool twists and turns and an ending that had my friend and I talking as the credits rolled. Seriously, give this game a try!! Support the unique stuff!

I haven't finished this game yet, but so far it's awesome! It's kinda like Telltale games but for 2. Don't listen to the pre-order moron that rated this amazing game a 1 star because Best Buy messed up. The game is fantastic.

This game may turn off many for the fact that is Co-op only. But for me and my friends we have been looking for a great couch Co-Op game, this is a welcomed feature. It should also be noted because of this, the game is designed to work over the internet with only one of the players owning the game. A way out has a great story that helps pull you into your characters and how the interact with the world. The many scenarios you play allow for different problem solving which adds to multiple playthroughs. Would recommend for those looking for a great co-op experience.

This game is really co op only. You only need 1 copy between you and your friend to play it. Your friend will download a trial version and can get your invite to the game. It's a fun time if you really have a craving for a co op game.

Having only played half of 'A Way Out', I cannot give an opinion on the entirety of the game, but I feel like it is definitely lacking. The story-line has been pretty good so far, but the writing and acting are awful. I am hoping for some big plot twists that sway my opinion the opposite direction, but so far I have mildly enjoyed what I thought was going to be a fantastic game. The co-op aspect is the only redeeming quality because the game mechanics aren't great and there isn't much to do outside of the story-line.

This will set a new standard for co-op experiences, however it got 4 stars instead of 5 because there is no matchmaking for a co-op partner. However they do make up for this by allowing a friend to download the trial and play the whole game with you if you invite them. It just limits you playing when you friend is available and not necessarily when you want to play.

It is just like Sniper Elite and Zombie Army Trilogy. Lots to do and fun puzzles to complete while fighting all sorts of enemies. Time flies when playing this because there is so much to explore.
It's a great silly game for one player but an utter blast in co-op.
My kids had a fun time playing this game. I recommend it.
It's sort of Indiana Jones and the mummy combined. The graphics are beautiful. The puzzles are tricky. A lot of fun.
Gorgeous graphics, and easy game play, a must play
This game is just pure FUN. Love the narration, locations, beautiful graphics, and lore. Just buy it!
If your a big fan of The Mummy (1999) and old school adventure movies this game is for you

I was surprised that the 3DS also got a port of the original Wii U release. However, interestingly enough, this version is more faithful to the original than the Switch version due to the second screen. Graphically, while an obvious lower-res downgrade, it's a very beautiful game for the 3DS, making the most of its limitations. I wish the 3DS game was priced $10 cheaper than the Switch release.

Personally this is my favorite classic NES Super Mario game. To have it available to play on the 2DSxl is just icing on the cake. This game has 90 levels with various levels of difficulty. There are secret powers and secret warping. Mario and Luigi in a raccoon and frog suit; who doesn't want to see that? This is a must have for any Mario fan!

I happen to still have this game and a Nintendo Advance that still works to play it on. I can tell you that the graphics in this digital copy of the game, played on my 2ds are really poor. The game is great, clarity very poor.
Good game, but low quality. Im playing on the Nintendo 2ds xl, and I think they should have updated the graphic a little. Excatly the same as when the game originally released back in the day.
A little bit old even if its what you are buying !!
This game is difficult to view and difficult to play.
This is unlike the last 2 Wolfenstein games to be released by bethesda. They are trying different mechanics which do not work very well.
A bit more story than the rest and some rpg elements don't really live up to the hype. Fun shooter though.

Basically a game of people telling you to go do something, you reporting back to them, and them sending you back to the same spot to do something else. Storywise it pushes the franchise forward, but gameplay wise its a step back from the main series games.
Solid game but not as good as the mainline Wolfenstein games. Still good entrybin this series though.
The games is great! Continues on with BJ Blazkowicz daughters in either co-op or single-player.

This game isn't anything like the previous two entries in the series. As a die hard fan of those 2 titles I'm very disappointed with it. Everything you live about the other games is taken away unfortunately. I'm going to play it through and finish it but I'll never revisit it. Hopefully they go back to the great formula they had for the game previously.
This game is amazing, if you are a fan of story driven, fast pace, smooth and action packed FPS, this is the game for you
I am still waiting for my game. I have no review to gave.
This is another unusual SpikeChunsoft game that grows on you. I'm glad it was finally released here in the U.S. Has great replay value.

This game isnt as much as we thought it would be, there was A LOT of reading to do. We did not think it was going to require so much reading. The game is mostly pictures and reading. Would have wished there was more actual movement involved.
I have not played Samurai Showdown since its arcade days so this is fantastic

I love fighting games, but I've never been into Samurai Shodown. But truly this reboot, with high stakes, high reward playstyle, and the idea that every action has a counter gives every moment in the fight gripping and exciting. I do hope that this can help SNK to continue reinvigorating their great catalog of games.

This is a classic game reborn! One mistake can cost you greatly, so make sure you have a plan before you attack. Samurai Shodown is essentially a chess match in fighting game form. Highly recommend it to the FGC aficionado!

Wow!! This game is so good that make me happy!! I'm fan of Samurai Shodown from the beginning and this one makes me remember the first one but with the new great graphics, textures sound and visual effects. SNK made my year!! Hope they will continue making more Samurai Shodown games and revive The Last Blade series too.

Just started playing it, but so far it delivers. Story mode is basic (unlike more modern fighters), but it's the fighting and VS mode that matters. And the fighting is classic Samurai Shodown. If you're a fan of the series, this is a must-buy.
Snk is back and better than ever love this game and awesome fun for the hack and slash fan

I remember I used to play this game at Lampost Pizza back in the days, except it was the older version and in a big arcade machine. Now we have a new Samurai game for home and it's a good one... like bringing back the days of going to the Pizza place. I do not have a Lampost Pizza anymore, but the local Round Table has a Sunset Riders machine.
Easy to play and enjoyable in depth game play for fans of the series.
Its not the best of quality and not worth spending that much when u can just get the switch version which is waaaaaay better.
If you only 3ds its okay but the switch version is better.
I have bought a 65 inch 4k tv which I use 24/7 and no problems or complaints it works great also I did received great customer service from the floor rep he was very knowledgeable

Gave 2 stars just due to my disappointment in it not being a Real Fire Emblem game, as in the traditional strategy style game Fire Emblem is known as. I got thus game and was really excites because I thought it was an actual Fire Emblem strategy RPG like everything else with a Fire Emblem name. Just figured they finally put some small 3D open areas in dungeons (which they did in F.E. Echoes, but it wasnt released at the time). Nope, I got Dynasty Warriors with FE characters, and some extra abilities added in. Was very disappointed as FE is my favorite game line of all time. But besides my disappointment in it not being a real FE game it did have great battle mechanics, amazing graphics for the DS, and would be an excellent hack&slash game if that was what I was looking for.

SONYs new game dev policies are going to have alot of western games censored. This game is such the case. The Japanese version was left untouched but its had some areas removed. Still a great game but I wont be purchasing a next Gen SONY system. I prefer to choose the content of my games like the adult I am.

Game is a remake/remaster of the first Senran Kagura that released on 3DS years back. The changes include shifting from a 2D side scrolling perspective to fully 3D realized world as well as some extras to more or less justify the re-release. Though be warned, if you are into for the fan-service, the main feature was stripped at the request of Sony and you'd be better off with the Steam Edition. That said, my real overall score is 3.5 stars because of this. Its what made Senran Senran in the first place and considering all the other things allowed on the platform, it just feels like censorship than actual quality control but I digress. I still decided to buy it and support the devs as this was not their fault and I much prefer to keep the collection together on console and I'll wait for a sale on PC.
Due to Sony new policy the localization team had to remove intimacy mode had been removed while I never cared for this mode it still SHOULDN'T have been removed. Game is still fun and enjoyable.

Yes, the PS4 version removed the intimacy mode. But, looking at the game for what it is, it's a good way for people who never played the first Senran game to experience the origins of the story. Gameplay is fast paced and the graphics, though running on the same engine as Estival Versus, look like a slight step up the previous games. The visual novel cutscenes can go on for a bit too long, however, and the story focuses on a few characters too much, leaving the others a little neglected. Other than that, a very fun hack and slash game.
Great remake of the original minus some things that had to be removed due to PS4 censorship.

I was especially excited about getting this in my hands, seeing as I was a fan of the Battle Chasers comic in the mid-90's. The game starts well enough, which a fantastic art style (expected!), and compelling characters. Over time however, the story becomes a bore - predictable and unexciting. The gameplay is engaging, with a unique combat system, but with no compelling story to drive your quest from point A to point B (it feels very very linear at times), there just isn't a reason to see what the next dungeon holds. Good enough fun for a while, but buy it on sale.

Battle Chasers hit a lot of nostalgic points for me, reminding me of my times playing the older Final Fantasy games, or other similar JRPGs from back in the day (Robotrek anyone?). The game consists of a lot of tactical choices, and a fairly streamlined skill tree system to power up your combat skills. The skill tree system doesn't lock in, allowing you to mix and match your skills and figure out the play-style you like while you play. The only complaints, and these weren't enough to knock of a star, is that the game can feel a bit grindy at times, characters who aren't in your party don't level, and if you go searching for treasure you may out-level the game making it almost too easy. Still, it was a great ride and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys old-school JRPGs.
I dont own this game on any other console so I cannot tell if its a good port but I picked it up on release date and I havent been able to put it down its an awesome game! Graphics are beautiful!

Didn't really know what to expect going into this game other than the turn based RPG gameplay, but the game has been pretty fun. The story is interesting and the gameplay is fun. Not really much else to say about it.
I enjoyed the game lots of fun and action . I played the game for hours and hours and hours:)
Such a great game and new features! Great story line as well!
Lots of fun to play. Challenging but not to difficult.
Every Lego Game has been great and they will continue to get better.
This game was bought for my 7 yr old son's Birthday and has been a hit with the whole family. Great graphics and fun for all ages.
It is a really fun game and my son and I have a great time playing it. I'm always Plastic Man.
I like this game for the boys it was easy to understand
My nephew loves it! Fun game and everyone in the family can play!
I purchased this for my girlfriend's son Christmas gift and he loves it.
This game is very exciting and keeps my 9 year old entertained.
My kids love all the lego games they have been playing since they got it
We have played every one of the Lego games and this one proves to be one of the best. The characters are very exciting and fun to learn to work with. This will also make a very good holiday gift.
look forward to the release of new LEGO games and they never disappoint. big improvement on he last Batman game as otehr DC characters are playable ealier in the game.
My daughter love this game and it keeps getting better by adding new superheroes, including the super pets and new locations. Hours of fun.

First off, this game is nothing like Monster Hunter World. Going back to the traditional art style that Capcom always had for the Monster Hunter series, this game is just as tough as the original games. Has a much wider-range of monsters and armor sets to collect along with all 14 weapon types. If you're coming from Monster Hunter World, this version is not as easy, but has a lot more content to offer. With an included G-Rank that increases the AI and strength of monsters, the game will really test your monster hunting skills. Definitely not a game your 'average gamer' can just pick up and play, but definitely worth the investment. Has tons of replay value. I have over 600 hours in Monster Hunter World and that game barely has any content (although all updates are free). This game is nearly 2 or 3 times the size of MHWorld. For all you previous MH fans/vets. I definitely recommend!

If you've played any of what would now be called 'Classic' Monster Hunter, you know roughly what you're getting into with Generations Ultimate's main gameplay loop. A solid action game with a highly satisfying combat system that circles into a Diablo-esque loot 'grind'. If you've never played a Monster Hunter, I am a tad hesitant to recommend this as your first. I would say to try World if you have a PS4/XBox/PC, or 4 Ultimate if you have a 3DS. Generations and Generations Ultimate don't do too well to explain everything, and a new player could easily be overwhelmed. Generations Ultimate is the final game (as of now) in the classic Monster Hunter formula, and it knows it as it brings more Monsters into one game than ever before. Monsters, Locations, Weapons, Armor, and more from across the entire series have returned for one of the most content-packed releases Capcom have ever put out. Though it may seem funny to others, one of the largest additions for me personally is the ability to 'transmog' armor. That is to say, wear a piece of armor for skills, but have it look like another piece you like the looks of more. No clown suits just to have your favorite skills! The game plays wonderfully on TV and in Handheld. All-in-all, Generations Ultimate is well worth the price.

- A great and rewarding challenge - Metric ton of weapons, armors, skill, etc. - Unique styles that expand each weapon's moveset - Crazy amounts of complex bosses/content - Online is simple and works very well - Very customizable AI teamate for offline play
A great game for old monster hunters fans & giving a fresh look for new fans!

As a veteran hunter (played Monster Hunter since the Playstation 2 days), I have played every Monster Hunter game that has come to the US (Monster Hunter, Monster Hunter Freedom, Freedom 2, Freedom Unite, Tri, 3 Ultimate, 4 Ultimate, Generations) and have also played Monster Hunter Portable 3rd (Japan's Monster Hunter Freedom 3) and have loved the entire premise behind Capcom's slaughterhouse grind fest of defeating various creatures, endless crafting options, and various strengths and weaknesses of monsters, whether it be a Wyvern, Elder Dragon, Fanged Beast, Piscine Wyvern, etc. This game is a continued Generations experience (which is awesome as you can transfer your Generations data from your 3DS to Generations Ultimate and get some cool bonuses; the Deviants that were added here makes it sweeter (Diablos, Mizutsune, Gammoth, Astalos to name a few) and also being able to fight my oldest nemesis (of sorts) Lao-Shan Lung is a treat for me -the addition of the Brave and Alchemy styles add more possibilities and great combinations to hunting teams; for me, I stick to Adept Sword and Shield due to the evasion + mounting combination; while I may not do a lot of damage compared to Great Sword at times, it's ability to mount makes it easier to set up mounts and extra damage after toppling the monster. I admit I was a little disappointed that we didn't get a new weapon; was hoping to see a new one to be honest but at the same time, the styles do make some weapons that were 'underpowered/useless' become able to shine very well and even make overpowering weapons even more 'broken' Overall, I'd give this game a 9/10 for my scale, but for this scale of 1-5 I'll have to give it a 5/5; great game, fast-paced, strategic fighting especially when solo, great monsters new and old; the only thing that I wish they would have done (which for me would have secured 10/10 for me) would be to add EVERY single monster from EVERY generation and bring them ALL to Generations Ultimate as I feel that would definitely make the game live up to its name; my opinion Despite that, this game is a must-own for the switch in my opinion as someone who has played all the regular games (and played a couple spin-offs like Monster Hunter Stories); if you love fighting different varieties of monsters, having cats as friends who help you, and just flat-out battling monsters alongside friends, this game is for you
If you like taking out tough and merciless monsters, this is def the game for ya. Plenty of gear to you keeping grinding for hours and hours.
Its a great game. My son loves it. Have fun and enjoy.
I would like the game more if I understood it more.all I figured out on it is to talk to the villagers
Unless you're a diehard monster hunter fan, skip this. It's a port from 3DS and isn't really meant for the Switch.

Let me say right of the bat: Monster Hunter World, is a step in the right direction. This game is really fun, and a great way to 'catch up' with all things monster hunter. However you'll find as I have that you never realize how good a few quality of life upgrades can be for a game until you actually experience them first hand. I've played every single monster hunter game and I love everything about the series as a whole. That being said I really wish this didn't come out so close to world because other than monsters this game really doesn't have anything that I can say it does better than world. It cant be fairly compared to world because this is a celebration of past monster hunters not the latest chapter in the story that is monster hunter. Still it's worth the purchase and you will not be disappointed with this game. Just remember that this game came out BEFORE world.

My experience with Monster Hunter is still very fresh as prior to MHGU the only game I had played was Monster Hunter World which also came out recently. I do however have about 500 hours in MHW currently and I still play it. It should be noted however that MHGU is very different then World in many ways. World was designed to be a AAA experience for the mainstream consumer. GU is an english port of Monster Hunter XX (Double Cross) which came out in Japan before World. MHGU represents the 'Ultimate' experience of the old handheld MH titles, with a staggering number of monsters, weapons styles, weapon arts, and other features. However this game can be much less inviting to new players as it was mostly designed to be the pinnacle MH game for MH vets. That doesn't mean however that new players can't enjoy it, it just means you will have to do some extra work to break through the games many obtuse systems. That may not be everyone cup of tea but the people who stick with the game and watch guide videos online will discover an amazingly fun game loop with hundreds and hundreds of hours of things to do.

This game is the Monster Hunter for anyone! Whether you've been playing them since the PSP days, or you just want dabble in to a new game, you absolutely cannot go wrong here. There's hundreds upon hundreds of hours of hunting, gathering, making friends, and experiencing the enormous cast of OVER 100 monsters! Truly, this is an essential for the switch, and an absolute must for anyone who's ever played a Monster Hunter.
Ive been playing this game non stop since i picked it up!! Great game.
It's great to play on the go! I can hunt in MHW and MHGU now
i thought my 11 year old would really like this game but definitely not his favorite.
This game was way over hubbys head. It is meant for a gamer geek not for grandpa.
Great fantastic movie! Would highly recommend to any fan.

This is a great game if you want more Monsters to hunter after playing Monster Hunter world. They're 80+ Monsters, G-rank (Hardcore Mode), Portability is the best feature especially if you do not have time to sit in front of a T.v for hours.

This is a pretty fun game, but it's very obviously a port from the DS. I was hoping more for an open world Breath of the Wild type game, but with huge monsters to fight . (Kinda of like Monster Hunter Tri, which was released for the Wii U.) However, this is more 'I want to go fight this monster. Here is a closed area with somewhere between 3 and 10 rooms. The monster will be in there.' Plus, there are loading screens between each room. It's fun enough, but it's kind of clunky for a current generation console. That being said, if you're into a lot of different types of combat, this is the game for you. There's at least 10 hours of training, easy. (You don't have to do them, but they are there.) Plus a LOT more monsters than there are on Monster Hunter World (which was released on Xbox and Playstation). All in all, this is a pretty decent game, with LOTS of hours of play on it, but it feels a little dated for a modern console.
The Switch console is too under powered to give a a true console MH experience.
So if you think it sounds fun to grab a big weapon, fight a big monster, make bigger weapons from its parts so you can fight bigger monsters, then this is the game for you.
Game was just ok. 12 yr old son didnt remain interested for very long.
was just a port over from the 3ds version graphics arent all that
Not much of an evolution compared to the new world that was released.
This game never really got as exciting as the others. It's a good game to rent, but not really to buy.

Originally on the Nintendo 3DS, the Ultimate version arrives on Switch. Since Monster Hunter World released on other platforms, some fans cannot go back to the older versions. Supposedly clunkier in combat and not as smooth as World, I am a fan of the older games' combat. So preference matters if you want to pay $60 for this. If you own the 3DS version, then may not be a purchase for you specifically.

This game is pretty much the last 'old world' monster hunter game, and while there isn't a whole lot of story, there is an insane amount of depth to the game, and as long as you don't care about graphics, I would say it's worth the $60. If you are expecting Monster Hunter World for the Switch though, do not get this game. They have similar core gameplay, but they are very different from each other.
so so , it is not very good game to me, not recommended to friends
It's a little hard to go back to this game after playing Monster Hunter World for so long. It's not bad, necessarily, it's problem is just that it isn't its big brother. Story of my life.

World is just better. The biggest problem with this game is that nobody is online to play it. Finding people to play is a chore, and making a party is a chore. Doing voice chat is a chore. Otherwise it is a very fun game, and a lot deeper than MHW when it comes to your character builds.

The game is good but it is a bit to slow for me personally. I thought it was more about killing and capturing the monster but had no idea you have to level up everything from players to the sword that you use. Game is annoying when you go from one sector map to another. Loading screen would be shown which could get in the way for a smooth gaming experience. On top of that, characters voice could be annoying to some. Average game for me but might be good for others who enjoys RPG type of game play,

my wife is a huge monster hunter fan whereas i always had issues getting into it, mostly through the 3DS releases thanks to my larger hands and the not so ergonomic design of those handhelds. decided to give this new one a try with the pro controller and it's helped the learning curve of the mechanics and UI a lot. there are some design and map layout issues i have issues with, and there are some definite frustrations in the gameplay, but playing almost exclusively with my wife, it's a fun experience.

I'm a newcomer to MH. I've never played any of the games in the franchise. I always wanted to dip a toe in, but have been wary due to the countless comments about it being way hardcore. Turns out, it ticks every one of my addiction boxes. The gameplay loop of village > prep > hunt > craft/upgrade > village is very tight, but the story is barebones (I guess other games in the series have a more fleshed out story, but all I know from the 40 hours I've put in so far is that monsters have body parts I need to make cool looking armor, so I better do quests where I hunt those monsters if I want the cool armor). Unlike traditional MMO's, your character doesn't level up and get more stats. You can upgrade your gear, and get buffs from items and meals, but your ability to take down the giant monsters relies mostly on your personal skill. With the many potential combinations of weapons, styles, and equipable arts, there's guaranteed to be a playstyle for everyone (right now I'm playing Dual Swords, Aerial style, but have dabbled with a LBG Striker). Love the fact that the single player is perfectly adequate, and that the multiplayer experience has both local and network play. I just wish more of my friends would get on board so I could have someone to take down these giant monsters with.

This game is the best in it's series. CO-OP is a great addition to the game but is not required to get the full experience. Weapon customization is awesome, plenty of suits to use, lots of bonus items for veterans and pre-orders, additional modes unlock as you beat the game on different difficulties adding plenty of replay-ability. Overall, I felt that this game is very well worth the $59,99 and the value increases as you get more DLC (Download Content).

If you enjoyed the previous Dead Space games, you'll be sure to enjoy Dead Space 3. The most polished, well-paced entry in the excellent sci-fi horror series yet. Bringing a friend along for two-player co-op is a blast. Snow crumbles beneath Isaacs boots, necromorphs are disgustingly detailed, and the backdrops are stunning. Solid voice acting sells the drama, and the cries of enemies are appropriately unsettling. The new weapon-crafting system and roll dodge make it easy to play the way you want to play. The environments are moody and the gameplay is without a hitch. This is one of the best horror games Ive ever played. A fantastic game.

I'm a fan of Dead Space through and through, and this one definitely is a must-buy in my opinion if you enjoy horror/action games. Firstly, there's plenty of new features that the predecessors didnt have before. Single-player co-op is a definite plus. You will experience completely different when you play alone rather than when you play co-op. Dimentia and psychological factors play a huge factor here since for one person they could be walking into a seemingly eerie quiet room, and then your co-op partner could be screaming bloody murder because his character is hallucinating a nightmare. All of this trickles down from an immensely well written original storyline. This time around there are optional side-missions which add to the experience, and there's plenty of small features which make it all worth the buy. 8.5/10 for me.
Great., fun game. It still maintains its horror elements while cranking up the action. Fans will definitely enjoy it.

If you love challenges and the series of 'Dead Space', this is for you. I recommend you play the first two games before playing this one. If you don't you'll get lost as to what's going on in the story-line. The graphics are amazing with a few imperfections (every game has them). The story line is amazing, with a great plot twist in it. Co-op mode makes the game more enjoyable but less challenging. There's an achievement where you need a co-op partner. As to what's bad about it, it doesn't have split-screen so you can't play with a buddy. Other than that it's a great game all around. If you play non-stop I'd say it'll take you a week to beat it. Very great at passing time. Great game.

The game is fun, but it is no were near as scary as its two predecessors. It feels more like an action shooter and a survival horror. If I would have known that I would have just watched the cut scenes on youtube.

A great example of how not to infuse co-op in your game. I picked this up for about $20 after I played the previous two games, but soon discovered that unless you are playing co-op it is impossible to complete the game with all side missions, collectibles and weapon upgrades. The story and gameplay are just so-so, unless you got a buddy with you ready to tackle the co-op sections then don't bother.

Dead Space 1 and 2 are great games. They are tense, have some great scare moments, and provide a great atmosphere. Dead Space 3 on the other hand, doesn't do any of these things. The game is more action oriented and the addition of co-op takes away from the tense feeling of the other two. If you are all about action and shooting games you make like the game more than idea. I just expected more from what was a great franchise.

Excellent follow up. Building weapons is phenemonal. Dual play as two different characters was an added bonus. The game lasts a good long while - you actually feel like you got your money's worth. Over all - STELLAR!

Overall the game is great, coop is really a great option, Everything about this game is great except the occasional freeze. Well worth it. Wish it had versus like the second one but who knows they might still come out with a DLC for it.

If you liked the first 2 then don't skip this one. The storyline had an interesting twist and the game keeps all the good and adds some new . I like the new but i also am glad they kept the crafting optional by adding blueprints for those who don't want to twink weapons for hours.

This is by far one of the best horror/survival games and maybe the best in this series. Requires better aim for limbs than before, you have quicker mobility, enemies are harder to predict and seem a lot more intelligent, and the 'when will they stop comming' & 'oh I'm gonna die' momments keeping getting more intense as you move through. Only down side is I am not too hip on the new mod system for weapons, but it could be I really haven't tried to get too creative as I am trying to just survive right now. All in all though, great game!
Great product, I'd tell all my friends about this item
GREAT GAME TO ADD TO MY COLLECTION OF SEALED GAMES

A true Gem a must! Your Delivering Items across an expansive beautiful world with Stranger Things like creatures waiting to hear a peep! I pre ordered this Collectors Edition way ahead of time before I usually do. Big Norman Reedus fan the content in this edition is awesome and not like any other collectors edition. Great to show off put it in my Game Room.
What a beautiful game! Stunning visuals, intriguing story, lovable characters. I love my BB pod too! Overall very proud of the work that Kojima has created.

So far the game is awesome, yes its not going to be for everyone but i'm loving it i think i'm about 20 hrs into it though only at the start of episode 5. the collectables are cool, baby lights up if u put batteries in it and the little figure is similar to a keychain but more Japanese style where they hang from their phones or backpacks (i got mine in my car hanging from the mirror), tape is still in crate which the crate would be a helluva a lot cooler if handle moves; shouldn't have to worry about them braking as the crate seems heavyduty for the plastic and comes with a foam liner.

Pretty unsatisfied with my purchase. Huge shipping sticker on the front over the collectors item writing. The box and artwork is a huge part of this game and item and was very disappointed to see that it had been damaged. The manager at the Fullerton location told me every item comes that way when shipped so maybe they need to talk with their shipping company. The sticker could have been place on the bottom or another spot with artwork. Wont be buying any more collectors items from Best Buy if this is how it will arrive. Also was told a new box would be waiting for me since mine was damaged but this never happened and thats when the manager informed me that each box has that sticker. Image shows the box after I tried to peel/remove sticker without further damage.

At least, in my oh so humble gamer opinion, Death Stranding should be named - (Console) Video Game of the Year, 2019! Hideo Kojimas vision has been fully realized within every aspect of this game - from the detailed realistic graphics, spot-on voice acting, mood-inducing atmospheric and ambient sounds, the soundtrack, but most importantly ... the story. Gameplay was flawless, with not a glitch to be found (as of my first play-through). With the release of this game, I finally have a reason to begin gaming again. And Im taking my time, to see and experience everything, the world of Death Stranding has to offer. Thank you Mr. Kojima!

This Collector's Edition is pretty dang cool. Especially if you're a fan of Hideo Kojima, or the Metal Gear series. I'm not so sure about the price tag, as it's $200 price is a tad steep unless you're a true 'ride or die' fan. The game itself is an amazing experience so far. The items included were all made with care, and it's definitely an interesting set if you're a FAN. The box is hefty, so finding a spot to store everything could prove difficult, but once again if you're a fan of new, fresh, original narratives, and an engrossing experience. This is for you! I say just go with the game, it's well worth it. If you happen to come across this set and love Death Stranding, and have $200 to spare. I say buy it up!

I was a little skeptical at first with this game. Everything I've read makes it sound like a walking simulator. I'm a huge fan of Kojima, and have played every Metal Gear game dating all the way back to the 80's when I was a kid. Kojima is a master story teller, and I was excited to see what he would do with this game. Simply put, I love it. This isn't a game that is high on action set pieces. It's not trying to be. What this game is, however, is a breathtaking take on life and death. The writing is superb, the acting is insane, and I'm not quite sure what genre the game is meant to be. At times I was genuinely afraid of my surroundings in the game due to not being able to see with certainly where the 'BT's' were at. (I guess the closest thing I could compare them to would be a ghost?) At others I remember standing on the top of a mountain and wondering how Kojima's studio was able to make the game so dang beautiful. The grass, the rock, the mountains, and the water all had me fooled at times thinking it was real. The story starts off slow, but I'd say it picks up at chapter 3 and then doesn't slow down. Do yourself a favor and play this game. It's more something you 'experience' than you 'play,' and will keep you thinking long after you put the controller down.

Collector's edition with the BB replica is awesome. I wish they would have made it a glass replica instead of plastic, but still really well made. However the game itself is ok. No doubt the mechanics used in this game, and the way they keep throwing stuff at you to improve on it, with the main them being sort of a walking-simulation-based-gameplay is amazing. However, its not fun if you are expecting to get an adrenaline-surge out of it. It you pick this game up thinking its a action-game, by now you know it is not. The only thing that kept me going is the story. It is simply worth playing for. Or simply just go to youtube and watch its cinematics. I think Kojima created an amazing sci-fi world which begged to be made into something more than just fetch-based quests. There was so much potential in the world created, and could have easily been made into one of the best action-packed adventure. Opportunity missed and it really disappointed me.

This game is a slow burn. It sounds a bit reductive but if you are the type that like call of duty-esque balls to the wall action, then you wont find much here for you. But if you dont mind the slow burn story heavy games, I think there is a lot for you here. It takes some time to get going but once it does you wont want to stop. The Special edition is pretty darn good too. I am getting tired of just an action statue of the MC, so this was refreshing. The BB pod is neat and lights up, and the case is decently heavy duty. I only really have two complaints. The case is very plain, there are no stickers or molded insignia so it seems like a generic case rather than something from the game, as well, the handle is fixed and does not fold down, so storage is a bit odd. Second, the screw on the pds battery case was nearly stripped. If i didnt have the right tool for it, I may not have been able to put batteries in. Overall, a neat and somewhat unique special edition, and a great game that wont be for everyone.

This game will admittedly not be for everyone, but IT WAS FOR ME! I love this game which is mostly driven HEAVILY by it's unique creative and amazing sci-fi horror storyline. I am playing it on Normal mode and it is a bit hard to tread through the gameplay for the first 3 chapters. After that there are no limits as to how you can traverse the open world. If you find yourself having trouble with the gameplay I IMPLORE YOU to switch the game to 'Very Easy Mode' to get through and view this amazing story.

Great game if you're the type who enjoys art and game design. This game will upset gamers who typically are into fortnite or COD and more action pact games. If you didnt have the patience to sneak around in previous metal gear solid games. This isn't the game for you. This game has a lot of funny moments and can get chaotic. The people who claim it to be a walking simulator are actually right. This game challenges the player to trail different terrain levels while balancing load on their back. While doing this there are different mechanics that get in the way like rainfall that will damage your packages, environmental hurdles and stamina, fatigue, superficial ghosts. This game will throw every inconvenient thing after you to make going from point A to point B a challenge. On top of that you do get various tools to help you for yourself like guns, grenades, vechicles. This game will easily take up more than 30 hrs your first playthrough so definitely worth the buy I'd you weigh gameplay time into your purchase. A lot of detail is put into this game design wise You don't get a lot of that in most action/shooter games which are pretty redundant these days.
the game and story is good couldnt put the controller down
Death Stranding after a few hours reveals its core gameplay and premise to the overall plot. After playing many generic open world games in the past few years this game is a breath of fresh air.

I've been hitting my head ever since I pre-ordered this. I knew it would all be made in China and essentially nothing is directly made from Kojima Productions (except the game). I knew it wouldn't really be worth it in the end and it's essentially for the rich people who can afford to spend money left and right. I do not have such luxuries and was just contemplating to return it and just buy air pods since it's that time of year to save a few dollars. But this is Kojima's biggest release after dealing with a bad break up and I think over time the worth of this video game and the collector's edition will definitely be worth it. I think the big briefcase, the steelbook, and the mascot keychain were the best items. The BB pod was indeed a big let down but I think that's why we got the big roll of tape so that we could decorate the BB pod how we really wanted; and knowing Kojima, he probably intended on this as well. I will stand behind you Hideo Kojima-sama until my tomorrow doesn't come.
The BB is cool but the briefcase is horribly cheap unimpressive pvc plastic. This should not have been more than $110 at most.
A Mega Man game has to have perfect controls and this doesn't have that.

OK, let me start off by telling you the bad, me and a couple friends got a sneak peak at the game and there are no airplanes ): ! anyways heres how i works... you no longer frive to missions, you dial up your cellphone with contacts you recive along the way. That is also how you access multiplayer! As you know liberty city is designed after New York City, although ground zero is NOT included nor any asppect of 9/11. What interested me a lot is that to hijack a car you must first break the window with your elbow and then hotwire it. Now to the WANTED, it will no longer be stars. It will be a radius (a circle) that appears on your mini map. The bigger it gets the more 'stars' you have. Next, the game will be loaded with a BUNCH BUNCH BUNCH of mini-games. What I loved so much about the sneak peak was the taxi ride. It was real time and you have a view from the backseat. If your wondering how you decide where to go?... a map fills the screen then you point anywhere. Now I saved this one for last because I didn't know how you would react... THE RPG HAS BEEN TAKEN OUT! that means you can no longer get fat or any other attributes/abilities. I dont see why they did this but it did get annoying. I don't know whether there will be cheats or not because I had none to enter. Please report this as helpful so I can post further reviews.

After 89 missions and about 20-25 hours of non-continuous gameplay, I finally beat the game. It was absolutely fantastic. The drama that carries on throughout the game(I'm not giving anything away) make you feel as if you are personally Niko Belic. It's so life-like it's not even funny, and at the end I actually felt kinda bad for what Niko had to go through. I WILL say you get so close to Roman as if you're actually his cousin in real life then it's all taken away.. About the rest.. You have friends and you have a girlfriend and you can do things with them as you can in real life(bowling, darts, strip clubs, eat, drinking, etc.). One more thing I love about the game are how the missions are actually based on events that can/do actually happen in real life. All in all, I give this game a solid 10/10 and I cannot wait until GTA V!

My review? Oh, that'll take a while to get through the good stuff and just a few seconds to get through the bad! This game offers a huge city that is a almost perfect replica for NYC. I love the people and especially the italians!!! But it has great graphics, great challanges to overcome without some cheats here and there...but the one thing i would change about the game is the length...I is really long, but if i wouldnt have any breaks in my gametime, it would ammount up to 3-5 hours of gameplay. I would love it to be more but, hey they have 'expantion' packs so to speak, so...im fine for now.

The interaction with the citizens of Liberty City is great. Fun to play. However, you can't save the game if you want to quit and play at a later time, even if you follow the story line. The game will allow you to save at different scenes, but it takes a while.

GTA 4 is probably most known for its stunning graphics and amazing story. You play as Niko Belic a Russian imigrant. You will go through some crazy stuff as you try to save yuor cousin roman, and yourself. The setting takes place in Liberty City which is clearly a remake of New York City. Its got everything that NY has. For example The Stastue of Liberty is The Stastue of Happieness. Anyway, you explore 3 different islands. I am not really sure what their names are though. This game does take take realistic to a whole new level by having a 5 out of 5 graphic team. Also by the killing affects. For example you can run over people and they fly all over the place. Also if there is a car on fire and you get near the fire your clothes are set a flame and you roll on the ground. Overall GTA4 is a great game. There is only 1 problem, you can't save games at any time, you have to go to the safe house. =(

Ever since I was about 8 I discovered Grand Theft Auto. It Actually started with The Second Grand Theft Auto. One of my brothers friends, played it. I never asked to play, until one day my brother brought home Grand Theft Auto 3. I asked him if I could try. I did, Went absolutely insane with the gun. It is horrible actually. I just shot every random person. Than he bought Vice City. I loved it too. Years later, I met a friend in 7th grade, I went to his house, was playing a video game, He was playing Vice City. I screamed and begged him for me to try it. I haven't played since I was 9. than He also had San Andrea's. Than the same friend reserved Grand Theft Auto 4. I was freaking out, especially when he got it. I played it with him. Once I think I played it for 3 days straight. Today, I bought my own, and I'm playing it as I type this. I can seriously either pass missions, or if I'm bored I'll go into a park, and beat people up. Its a good, good game just, Its a little addictive. Especially when It's summer.

The only problem i found in this game, is that first, the city is not even half the size of San Andreas(GTA), and that you unlock all the are before reaching %50 of finishing the game! But the graphics, music, cars(you CAN steal cars and bikes directly from the agency!), Missions, Weapons! and length is great!!! Worth 40 bucks, believe me. Though there's a small chance that you get bored before finishing the game.
Great games with so many things to do, missions are fun and online is okay. But its to violent for kids.

Grand theft auto 4 is one of those games that makes me marvel at how much detail got put into it. It's such a big game but so much close attention was paid to make it play well and look good as well. The graphics are great. Liberty City is fully realized city with tons of people and traffic. Its one of the most impressive cities in a game that I have seen. It truly feels alive. The story is great overall. The main character is Niko Belic, a russian immigrant that arrives to the US on a ship. From there you pretty much work with all kinds of shady folk in order to make money. Niko has his motives that he works toward throughout the game. He's an interesting character and his story is an interesting one to play through. Its a lengthy one as well. If I had to say the one thing I think rockstar nailed down almost perfectly in this game I would have to say the physics. From the people to the vehicles in the game everything reacts in such realistic way. It's very apparent to how much attention went in to making everything act realistically. Each car has its own kind of physics. Trucks are heavy so they will plow through other vehicles a lot easier than cars. Different cars have better handling than others making it so you have to adjust to the weight of each one to get turning down. When a pedestrian is hit. They will react realistically. If you clip their leg or arm they will jolt and whip around in a violent way. If you hit them straight on they will fold on top of your hood in a very gruesome spectacle. To put it simply its the best ragdoll effect that I have seen in a game. Even today. If you shoot an enemy they will react accordingly. And each weapon has its own power to it. If you shoot someone in the leg while they are running they will topple to the ground. My favorite is shooting their leg while they are climbing steps. What follows is an amusingly realistic topple down the stairs. If you take advantage of the physics in the game you will have a lot of fun watching what happens in each segment of the game. The missions in this game are very well done overall. Some of them aren't that great and sometimes leave you wondering what the point of it was but for the most part they take advantage of the strong points in the game. My favorite mission of all time is in the game. It involves a bank heist and has you running from the cops trying to escape. It's just awesome. There is a great addition the the gta series that helps immensely in missions: the cover system. This mechanic works well. Niko is able to snap into cover easily almost anywhere. Behind cars, dumpsters, walls, etc. While in cover he can aim, pop up, shoot and repeat. This makes firefights a lot more enjoyable than the ones from past gta games. Once you have completed the single-player campaign you can hop into some of the most entertaining multiplayer available. There are a bunch of different game modes to play including team deathmatch and you can play them throughout the whole city or you can choose a section of it to play in. You can have up to 16 players in a match. I did give this game 5 stars but I don't think this game is perfect. There is pop in every now and then that can get annoying sometimes. Combat in tight spaces doesn't work all that well and can result in some frustrating deaths. And Nikos movements are a little too stiff for my tastes. These complaints are minor, however. This game is just an awesome package. I recommend it.

This game is great. It is suitable for the whole family. It is not as inapropriate as evryone says. You do not have to do the bad things, that is optional. The only thing you have to do is when you do the campain you may have to take care of some drug dealers. But who cares about drug dealers. They are bad people. In this game you are actually cleaning the streats of mean people. You have to do this with use of force, of couse. But, sometimes you dont achieve your goals without some force. Like, if you tried to talk to a person who was about to shoot you, you would be dead. But if you kicked the gun out of the person's hand and tackled him/her to the ground you would have a better chance. I'm just saying that all the bad things that they say are in this game are optional. It is also a very fun game. You can really do anything you want. You can fly a helicopter then jump out over water and emerge unharmed. Great game, do not imediatly think it is to inapropriate.
Tons of fun to play! I also have the game add-ons, and those are killer also! A must buy!
