Grand Theft Auto IV is really one of the best games in a very long time. It has extremely good graphics that make things very real. Of course on a game this big there are going to be a few clipping problems, but nothing that really detracts from the feel of the game. The game play and storyline are great. You can obviously beat the main game in under 30 hours (Its one of the achievements), but there are so many more side missions to do that it really can keep you playing for well, days, hours at a time years hopefully, but probably not. The sound track to this game is immense; as you are driving there is about 9 different radio stations with 24 min of music/talking on each one. There is a lot, and I mean a lot of swearing in this game so I advise not playing this in front of the younger people, or buying it for them. The driving in the game is although a little loose and easy to go out of control, once you get the hang of it and start driving nicer cars then you really dont have to worry much about it. Airplanes are gone (thank goodness) but you can still fly helicopters. You can play Darts, pool, bowling, go to a cabaret club, and even a comedy club. At the beach you can take a look through one of those magnify things that you see on piers all the time. For vigilante mode you actually access the police computer from the car and find the whereabouts of the crook. There are car races and getting the specific types of cars for people. Also, as always the hidden packages (which I think are pigeons in this game) and stunt jump spots. A nice new addition to this game is that it is a little more modern. You get a cell phone that you can setup having a drink with your friends or inviting your girlfriend to play a game of bowling. Also, you can go online at the Internet caf and browse the internet (its all built into the game, but there is a huge amount of different websites to visit) or check your e-mail. As you can see there is a lot of fun to be had with this game even if you dont follow through the storyline, or want to deviate at all. There is also a great online multiplayer mode that you can do a lot of the same with the free roam, also, death match style things. Unfortunately I cant say much about the online yet because I have not played it too much, but what I have seen is a lot of fun. I say if you enjoy any of the GTA games, or any of the other sandbox style game series then you will love this one. Try it out!
Like the ability to roam free through out the game

I'm a big fan of the GTA series. This game only made me more of a fan after being a bit let down by San Andreas. First off, you can interact with nearly EVERYTHING in this city. You can pick up a brick and hurl it at an enemy, find numerous small alleyways with a fire escape you can run up, and find side missions with average people on the street. The missions are very fun, and start you off small. And when I say small, I mean it! One mission involves throwing a brick through a window, haha. But eventually you get up to the big ones like bank heists, large drug deals and assassinations. The theme of this game is centered around revenge, unlike trying to amass wealth, as is the central theme in most other GTA's. It also plays a part in some missions, where you have to decide whether or not your victim will die. You can choose to let them live and possibly interact with them later on in the game. This feature allows for even more replay-ability. I might start up a new game and change my paths this time. The only drawbacks are: 1. If you're just goofing around and trying to die in amusing ways, the death camera lasts way too short thanks to it being in VERY slow motion (we all know you want to see Niko fly headfirst into a building and then land on a car on the street). 2. The story is pretty good, but it could've lasted longer. I felt like this was a quick story to get through. More filler characters than ones that help develop the story. 3. Whenever you hop up to a small ledge, you actually jump past it and fall to your death. I'd like to think Niko has a little better judgement than that. So overall, despite a few minor drawbacks, this is a very good game. The M rating is well deserved, but who doesn't like that?!

GTA IV is an amazing breakthrough in modern gaming! The environment of Liberty City has come to life! From the skyscrapers, to the vehicles, to the weapons, even the water flowing down the rivers have been graphically designed to perfection. The writers from the GTA franchise come through again! A whole new storyline brings a hard-edge and humorous adventure to the game! However, if you have an appreciation for extreme detail and customization in these games, it kind of takes a step backward from GTA SanAndres as far as customizing your cars and your personal style. Also there's no working out or learning new fight moves. But you can hide from the cops in the game which can be fun! I miss going to airports and flying planes like you could in SanAndreas. I think if they made a Grand Theft Auto: SanAndreas II for the modern consoles, and had all the features in the orginal plus the graphics of GTA 4, it would be the greatest game of all time!

I wont beat around the bush: Grand Theft Auto IV is the greatest game to come out for the Xbox 360 so far. I say that without reservation. It is a true evolution for the critically and commercially successful GTA series, not just a next-gen polish job of the same old game. But maybe even more importantly, its a new high water mark for video-game storytelling in general. This may sound like hyperbole, but it is deserved: GTA IV signals a moment in video-game history where it can no longer be denied that the medium can be as significant of an entertainment vehicle as the best that movies or television have to offer. GTA IV is sublime.

This is the first Xbox 360 game I have played. And I can't stop playing! It has got a great story line. And with my HDTV, the graphics are just amazing. However, sometimes the characters move kinda like robots. As far as the AI goes, I am not so satisfied, because sometimes even if you do something bad (minor ones) before the police, they won't come after you anyways. And yea, you don't have to stop for red lights even if there are cops around, lol. This game actually makes me want to buy a luxury car in the future, since you can clearly tell the enormous difference among various cars when you are 'driving' in the game.

I just picked up the game and so far it is more or less living up to all of the hype it has been receiving. It has good graphics. Well they probably are not the best graphics I have seen, they are good. All of the little details that are included in the game are what make the visuals outstanding. An example is instead of just popping open the door of a parked car, Niko might bust in the window and have to hotwire the car. Ah, it's the little things in life that we cherish. Anyways, there have been many tweaks to the game since the last installment. The new cover and targeting mechanics work great and make the game a lot easier. There are no more ammunition shops; instead to make the game seem more realistic you buy guns out of car trunks. The cell phone is a nice addition and really adds a lot to the game. You can use it to call up NPCs you have met and access multiplayer. These are just a few of the great new additions to the game. (There are too many to name here.) The thing that I like about the multiplayer is the fact that you have free roam of the entire Liberty City. You can go anywhere; do anything, just like in the real game, except now you can have up to 15 other people in there with you. The chaos is endless. Bottom line is this is a GTA game and the best one yet.

Though this may not be the most in depth game that I have ever played, it is probably the best GTA that I have ever played. There are more than a couple reasons that I say this, but let's start with the bad... + 1.) The Vehicle Handling - The worst thing about this game in my opinion is how the vehicles are controlled. There are only a very select few cars that I am willing to cruise around in throughout the game because of the poor handling! That is probably just personal preference however. + 2.) Still working on finding this one! + Now, onto the good stuff... + 1.) Niko - The main character is so much better than that of the previous GTA 'heroes'. He doesn't have that, 'I'm CJ *****' attitude, he isn't completely silent, and he isn't convinced that he is the king of the world. Really laid back and only seldom does he spout off some pointless quip. + 2.) The Map - Though I was a big fan of Vice City's map, I have to say that thus far I am enjoying the new Liberty City more. This could just be because of the massive dissapointment they offered up in San Andreas (what a stinker!!!) + 3.) The Minimal, but sufficient customization - I want to start by saying that I am a character customization 'NUTZOID', but I found all the different systems that were offered in San Andreas to be neat, but for the most part dead-end wastes of time. GTA isn't really about being this custom character, it's about playing out the story that is in front of you, and besides, you can change up your clothing however you wish and you can still obtain certain properties! That is really good enough, in my opinion, for this game. + 4.) The missions - So far, what I have played, this game is pretty fun. It offers up some fun missions that aren't impossible, but that aren't just a walk in the park. It seems like the faster that you complete the mission the easier it is (once you have played a while you'll know what I'm talking about). + 5.) The Combat - There is a new and vastly improved hand-to-hand fighting system. This new system allows you to punch, kick, block and even disarm your opponent! Also, when wielding a weapon, you can blindfire around corners, and even use cover. + All of that just begins to cover the things that I have found better about this game than the previously released versions! Overall, this is a great game, I would suggest it to any gamer, especially fans of the GTA series!

I purchased this game a couple of months ago, played through it twice, and have only good things to say about it! The storyline is unlike any other storyline that I've seen in a game before. It's original, fun, and there are even some twists and turns that you'll come across throughout the game. There are MANY different characters that you'll meet throughout the story, and you'll even have a chance to kill some of them. Hehe. The gameplay is fantastic. The driving is realistic, though this can prove to be a pain in the rear sometimes. The voice acting is astounding; you'll find yourself so immersed in the game, that you'll start thinking that you're IN Liberty City, which also looks extroadinary. There are tons of mini-games, such as going bowling and playing darts. (Niko's also able to obtain girlfriends within the game; some of them have special perks which can benefit you as you play!) The variety of weapons, guns and melee weapons, isn't as broad as the previous 'Grand Theft Auto' titles, but this only makes the game more realistic. Of course, you still have the trusty ol' RPG that you can take down choppers with! Overall, I give this game a 5/5, not because I'm following a trend of 5/5's, but because the game DESERVES that rating. It was well worth the wait to purchase this game, and I must say, it was probably the best $60 I've ever spent. Trust me when I say this: If you go out and buy this game today, you will NOT be dissapointed.

ok, so I bought this game a little while back and I can't stop playing it! Even after I have beat it there is SOOO much you can still do. And trust me, the carnage never gets old! Definently buy it if you haven't!
excellent game...no real flaws.excellent gameplay.interaction.graphics...one of the best games ever

This game is outstanding. The graphics are sharp, the game-play is smooth and the story is very good. I enjoy playing this game. Even after the game is complete, there is still hours of extra side-missions that can be played. Very good game overall.

Great videogame. Compared to the other GTA's in the popular series of games; GTA 4 is the best so far, out of all of them.I've played each one, and this one has better cars, better weapons, and now you can use a cellphone to call other characters that you encounter throughout the game (i.e.girlfriends, mobsters, enemies, friends, ect.) Good storyline, fun adventures, and the further you go in the game; the more cool stuff you unlock (like better missions, better weapons, new girlfriends, new areas of the city and map open up.) There's too much great stuff to list, not to mention that with the XBOX 360 version, you can also play LIVE with your friends or other online players. The only con (which isn't much of a con) is that the in between movies that play after you complete a mission or go further in the story; tend to run a little long. But overall, it's a great game for mature teens 14+ or adults, due to the mature nature of the game, and M rating.

I rarely get a game and constantly play it for hours. I try to time myself on my play time so I'm not stuck in the house al day. But this game gets me so involved with it I just don't want to put it down. I enjoy playing this character because even though he is STILL a cold blooded killer, he is the most liked out of all the GTA main characters that I have played. The vast open scenery is key cause I don't like playing a game when the backgroud fades away or just pops up like a block before it configures into a building or a mountian. Using the controller is also quite easy to used compared to the previous games. The driving though is too loose and you tend to swerve around alot (Especially when you are riding a motorcycle). All around this game is huge and deffinitaly entertaining.

This is a great game, but it is not suitable for young kids, because of the intense violence and language. I recommend this to anyone who liked the previous GTA games, i personally rank this the best out of all of them. You are a man from Russia (i think), who comes to Liberty City to meet his cousin, Roman. Here in liberty city there are many missions that you can do for a variety of different people. There are many guns and cars in the game, and you can fly a helicopter around, but not a plane. The online is fun if you want to kill some people with some friends, and do drive bys. In general, GREAT GAME, FUN ONLINE. 5/5

I was really excited when I first bought this game, but now, I pretty much just feel like I am driving around and really not doing anything. The missions are great, however, if you are chasing someone down, the car doesn't handle that great at all. I've spent a little over 20 hours and have only completed 11% of the game... So it definently is long and has great game play. Plus- there are lots of cheats out on the internet already to help with different cars, more guns, and the ability to change your wanted level. If you have a lot of time to sit down just to play GTA4 then by all means go ahead and do it, but after awhile, it gets really boring. I've also tried to get online to play, but have had a really hard time actually getting into a match.. There are still a few glitches that I can see that needs to be worked on.

This game is great. One pro I want to tell you about is that if a vehicles door is locked, you bust the window out. There are only a few minor cons about this game. Okay lets start. If you plan on buying this game to immediatly drive in NYC, which I did, you may be disappointed. You have to complete a little over 23% of the game before you can drive in NYC. However, you CAN drive over there if you want, you just have to evade the 6 star wanted level, which you cant. The last con about this game is the toggle control. When you steer around corners in a vehicle, the corner is blind only for a moment, due to the toggle controls. Overall, this game deserves 5 stars. If you haven't bought it yet, GO NOW AND BUY IT!!! You will enjoy it. WAIT, one last minor con, the cops on the game will point their weapon at you when your close to them and try to place you under arrest until you bust out of in front of them, if you don't bust out from in front of them, your going to jail.

I am not a fan of this series. That said, I can't stop playing. It is like being in a movie and you are the main charactor. I have never played a video game that had me so totally involved. I can't get enough. It is like I am really there. I have the xbox 360 version and I can hardly stop playing the game. The controls are simple. The graphics are a little too real. I especially like the way the game teaches you as you go along. This is all before I even tried the online version. Ok back to online. I paused this review to try the online and my first impression is also amazing there is no lag and the interaction with real player make the game even more real. I would recommend this game to anyone over 17 as it's content is truly adult. This is a must buy for any gamer other than kids. I only wish it was also out on PC as I prefer PC controls. Bottomline buy it if you can find it.

So far, I've only played a couple of missions, but this game has great potential! I've played tons of games, and solved some, but this has so many side games and missions, it's staggering! The only bad thing I'd have to say is I have an 8 year old, and the casual cussing in the game is so often, I don't think I can even let my daughter HEAR the game! Not that I'd ever let her play it, but it's tough on dad's. Just a heads up!!

This is a very fun game but it doesn't offer anything new. If you have previous GTA games, than you pretty much know what you're gonna get from this game.... but still very fun. Lots and lots of 'swearing'.... very violent.

I picked up GTA4 last night at the midnight release and had (between last night and this morning) about 3.5 hours to give it a try. Let me say, as a long time gamer, this is one of the best games I have played in a long long time. The story (so far) is rich and full of amusing characters. The control scheme is familiar (for those who have played the previous installments) and easy to pick up. The one issue I've had is the face that you have to watch the entire opening cinematic before you can jump in and play. I assume this is to give your console a chance to load the extremely expansive landscape that is Liberty City. The mission system is great, and all the missions seem to be unique in one way or another. They're not too hard, but they're not very easy either. Perfect for the casual sit down before work, or the long grind of a late night full of pizza and redbull. This game is DEFINATELY not for the young or easy offended. The language is real, and very graphic, the violence is brutal (including cop killing and other conterversial subjects), and there are continious references and instances of adult themed activities. If you are a parent, I would not reccomend this for your young children. BUT, if you are a gamer, or a fan of the serious, then you will be highly satisfied with the way the fourth installment of the series has turned out. If I could rate this between 1 and 10, I would give it a perfect 10.

If you are a fan of GTA, then I assume you already have this game. If you aren't familiar with the series (hard to believe but I'm sure there is a minority out there), you cannot go wrong with this title. In my opinion, if you only have one game you could by all year, this is the one. It is so entertaining to say the least, whether you go on a rampage, explore the city, or stay true to the story mode, there is not a second that passes without an interest in what you are doing with the game. I really hope more games use the Euphoria physics engine as it makes the movements of the characters so realistic. Do not have any doubts, just go pick it up if you haven't already.
All you can really say is WOW. Its an awesome game with great graphics. Woould recommend it to anyone thats age appropriate.

The small glitches and pop-ins referenced above in now way hampter the gaming experience brought forth by the guys and gals at Rockstar. They have produced one of gamings cornerstones for the future of open-world gameplay as well as written and artistically captured a great mix of dialogue, architecture and graphical beauty. GTA IV is one for the ages and it is worth it's weight in gold.

I bought my copy on opening night and it is unbelivable. The game is going to be the highest seller and highest reviewed game in the history of gaming. The amount of detail is incredible and the story is amazing. What are you waiting for?

Very excited for this game. Just pre ordered mine from online. Also chose the nice in store pick up so i can walk in Monday night at 12:00 AM and walk out in a few short minutes! Game so far looks amazing, The graphics look very nice for the GTA series and the multiplayer looks very promising! Over all the story line looks amazing also with some in depth things I guess only con i would say is that its not out for PC at launch, oh well! Game looks great!
Russian Gang takes over! After completing GTA Liberty City, I purchased this game right after. Great game for what it's worth.

The game is really fun to play. My brother had a copy with a scratch on it and my xbox wouldnt read it. Finally after several attempts i went to best buy and bought my own. After using it for a day i got the red rings of death meaning my xbox has officially died. Its your choice to take the risk, will it work or destroy your 300 dollar console, assuming you have the cheap one

I do not like gta games at all they are wicked dumb with the cops and you have to enter cheats or run away to get rid of the stars unless you like to kill them but i am looking forward to playing this game it looks like they made it better than all of the ones before that
It is the most boring GTA by far. If you want fun Saints Row 2 is the way to go. Check out Yahtzees Saints Row Review it say it all.

Everybody should agree that Grand Theft Auto IV is going to be a waste of time, no, a waste of life. This game is going to be just like the PS2 version. The Xbox 360 offers the most advantages to buyers because of Xbox live, but it won't be that great. If you have a PS2, buy that version. If you disagree with me, fine. I'm not mean, I'm just trying to save you some money and time.

Why would GTA decide to take away planes??? That was one of the best parts of GTA, as well as taking a jet pack and riding through the city. If you are going to continue making GTA games, add content, dont detract. That is my biggest complaint with this game. Yes, they added online play, which would have been exciting with xbox live ers being able to take flight with jets against each other. I feel with this installment that GTA is going downhill. Stick to San Andreas

Graphics and gore are amazing and fun, thats where it stops, the fighting style is not fun, driving is not fun ( I just take a taxi every where) Although I do love the fact you can fly through the wind shield. The worst part about this game a the missions...They are so unoriginal and remind me of every other GTA game I have played it takes a way from the game. Seriously...get up on a building and snipe while people come to attack? Sounds like Vice city all over...San Andreas was way better a game and I would rather play that then GTA 4 to be honest.
PS2-like graphics even on the 360!!! SAME GAME PLAY AS OTHER GTAs of course.......

If you are looking for the next installment of GTA, you got it. If you were expecting something beyond what has already been done your probably going to be a little pist you dropped 60 bones on it. How this game got such high ratings is beyond me. If your like me, beat it and trade it in before GameStop gets fludded with them. I will admit the overal level design is cool and the features provide great playabilty but the game is the same as the old ones with a fresh coat of paint.
well what can i say? this is the best game ever it has everything from online to search and destroy to driving mishons

i bought every GTA game there is for ps ..xbox.. and now xbox360.. i got everyone of tha been out and i watch there graphics and abilitys grow on this game and everytime it gets better ... i seen it get cycles to boats to racing helicopters now online..!! it crazy there online game play will not be i see u shoot shoot .. it gonna be duck and hide plane races and ur supposed to get all free roaming abilitys to every location online to and tha takes alot of work.. tha why it took them so long to develope this game .. it gonna be the best out there u get tons of side missions .. very nice rides in this one .. more open areas with better graphics.. u get races and everything .. if u like games with a storyline plus fun side missions plus loads of free roaming.. this is def the game u just HAVE TO BUY!! BUY!! BUY!! BUY!1 if u dont get it now ur missing out big time .. get it before it to late!!

I like games that have an involved storyline, decent voice actors and a variety of play within the game. It lasts long enough to make it worthwhile. While I wish there were more non-killing options for the main character, it IS a GTA game and I knew what I was getting. Also, I like games that I can play solo, so the GTA games work for me.
The game itself is awesome but the disk just stopped working. Out XBOX is working fine because it plays other games, just not Grand Theft Auto IV.

I'm loving everything that I'm hearing about this game, I think I'm going to love this game because you can play it for years and not get bored because there is so much to do. Grand Theft Auto 4, Game of the Year?
The PS3 version is better than the xbox version. THe Ps3 version has better graphics. GET THE PS3 VERSION
waist of money. the driving sucks. you cant turn without runing in to a wall. every thing is the same exsept the story line. the game sucks.

This game is just another story folowing the old need money and 'action' game. the missions are old drive and shoot. the driving is bad. and online the first person to shoot will win. . . ops sorry i ruined all ur fights

My Dad was one of the people who test the game for glitchs and other things and i got to play it it is AWSOME!!!!!!!! the only bad thing is there is no planes.I think it is the best game ever or in the WORLD! I told all my friends about it it is so cool.
These games have always been great, and i cant wait to get it. With xbox live, this game will blow all others off the shelves. The regualr campaign is awsome itself.
#1 best ganes ofn the year this game is gonna rock. I Love this game and cant wait until I finally get it.
this game was very disappointing. the multi player is hard to figure out. this game is so not worth the price!!!

I am on my 3rd disc and it still freezes. I even thought it was my 360 so I bought a new one. The problem is still there. I can't even get to the start of the game. It looks pretty sweet, but all I have is the trailers.
great game over all good graphics good game gameplay over all.
graphics are great, thats why i guess the game is soo small. driving is so unrealistic. shooting and fighting sucks and is no fun at all.

How came they dont make this game on PS2. Same people dont have the money to buy PS3 just to play GTA4. The game is osome. But it would be nice if they could make it for PS2 too. At least it could bee like the last game they would make for PS2... 'I just whant to play it'. And whats up with no flying in airplanes in GTA4?

this is yet another GTA game comparable to past GTA games. the graphics are by far the best of the series and they did take a more realistic approach on driving, shooting than previous games. the game in my opinion was not worth the origional $60 price tag due to lack of diversions out side of the main mission unlike saints row. the game does support trophies which does add some replay value but there seems to be a few things lacking compared to the previous san andreas such as vehicle customization, working out to get bigger and stronger, the need to eat but not over eat. some of the features that made the last game stand out are missing which kind of takes away from the fun of it (working out was not fun, but getting bigger and dual wielding sawed off shot guns and making your car look different were neat aspects) they have dating in the game which is more of a pain than anything, dealing with all the personal relationships in the game to keep everyone happy. i personally found it annoying to have to stop game progress to take everyone out on a 'date' so they continue to like you and give you their help/bonuses in the game. all in all they went forward in the series while taking a few steps back, maybe the next GTA game will hit the nail on the head (or score a bullseye for those who play darts in the game). they added dart, pool, and bowling as a diversion, the games are not great but it is something to do outside of the missions and they have trophies associated with them as well. all in all a good game for the $40 right now
..... not as good as san andreas ... which had it all customizing things free falling all sorts of the good ol gta mini games

I respect the people that give this game very good scores just that for me is just not that great i played like 5 hours and i simply dont like it , the controls feel bad, graphics are not that good , music is good and story was building quite interesting but that is about it , i may be one of those few that dont like this type of games . This game gets a 7.5 in my book

I truely do not see why people rave about this game so much I think it is very boring. Trust me I like GTA I am not a peson against it, but this game is not to fun. First of all the story is very boring and has no appeal, I found myself skipping the cutscenes after I got tired of it. Also, the begining is a way to lose gamers, because all you do is drive people around you don't even get a gun! Plus, to run tapping A is very annoying. Next, controling the cars is bad enough its a pain. Another thing I don't understand is why people talk about the graphics the character models look horrible, the only good looking stuff would be the city. Finally the health system and missions are poorly done. The missions are boring and the finding stands to gain health are a pain to find. Sad to say GTA4 is just flat out bad, if you want an fun open world game check out the Saints Row series you will find more fun in those games.

To put it simple this game should be called SIMS 'Gangster', it is not much different from a SIMS game. If you put a gun in a Sims hand and made him cuss up a storm you have GTAIV. The game is fun but it requires little or no gaming skills. The driving experience is a total joke and far from real, cars bounce off walls like smash up kids game. Shooting is just plain stupid. If you are a fan of first person shooter games like COD4 & RBSV then you will be disappointed in this game. If you like the previous GTA games then you will love this one. It is definalty not worthy of the 10 score it has been given on game sites. 7.5-8 at best.
i love this game and it is so much fun !1i will never get tired of playing it

i just can't believe the issues with both the 360 and PS3 version. i own a $60 paper weight. if you can play the game without freezing issues then great for you; you'll have a tried and true recepie for a great game with next gen graphics and content. but if you're also one of the unlucky ones with lock-up issues pray they come out with a patch. . . . . a patch, wait. . . . am i playing a PC game. the advantage of having a console is to not have these types of issues and need patches. i want a 'game' console, not a mini computer. i love what the 360 can do but at the end of day i bought it to play games. . . . games that work. severely frustrated and disappointed. . . . getting my money back and saving it for the sequel to Saints Row

Everything is good about the game the only things I dont like is the car handling, you cant drive airplanes, and you dont have any parachute to get when you want to trhow yourself off from tall buildings

its a great game i was the 3rd person to buy it on tuesday and i love it the onley thing is it is still in liberty city it is better and more in porved than before and verry realistic from driveing to gass prices lol i wish the continued from sanandres but all in all great game

This is a great game. The new multiplayer alone makes this game a great buy but then you add in all of the things that made all of the grand heft autos great and this is a must buy. The story line isnt the gratest in my opinion but it is decent and with all the other aspects in this game they can be easily over looked.
THis is a very great game. The best game of 08. Its a must have for all gamerswho love crime action games. Its such a fun and great game.
I would not recommend to anyone under 21. this game is way to graphic. it takes away from the game play and gives me a gross feeling after i've played.

Haven't played online yet, but hoping its good. Basically it's the same Grand Theft Auto, just retooled. So if you want an updated version of GTA III Pick it up its fun, especially since it has xbox live access. That is why I bought the game. But if you are looking for something new and innovative, don't bother. It's no Halo 3 or COD 4.

Grand Theft Auto IV is simply an amazing game. The euphoria engine creatures very realistic and amazing physics. The Rage engine which is used for the cars in GTA IV is also very realistic and amazing. The story plays like a movie and you're in control every step of the way. I could go on and on about how amazing this game is but it would take a month to cover the experience it has brought me and some of my friends. This is a must buy or at least a must rent several times since you won't see the same thing more than once. The city is alive and you're just one more person visiting it.

The mature themes remain in this next iteration of the GTA series. Any concerns that I had with repetition have been dispelled. There is so much to do with tons of interactive environments that put the old PS2 versions to shame. This game is a must have for any true gamer. The XBOX 360 version is definitely the way to go with all of the upcoming downloadable content on XBOX LIVE.

all the work they have put into this game...it is close to a guarantee. dont forget to preorder this...i know everybody will be playin halo 3 but when this game comes out it will be a good changeup to take a break from all those killtaculars.
great game! I loved all previous titles, this one is also very good. Of to play more and later I'll write more :)
After playing a lot of other elite games on my xbox 360, I just felt bad playing this game. Hopefully, the newer versions will have better control/gameplay.
i wish they could of brought tommy back, but this is still a fun game
There is really not much to say about this game because it is the same old GTA just with a new character.
you will defenitly want to have this game it is prolly one of the most realistic games you can buy ,i would defenitly recommend this .

Glad the folks over at Rockstar Games left the scenarios explosive with details to familiar sites and sounds of New York and New Jersey. You sometimes forget what youre supposed to be doing, just from the backgrounds enticing you to explore even more. Thats just from the demos Ive encountered so far. I love this game its older but if you dont no how to play gta its a great first gta to learn
Definitely NOT for kids or anyone under 18 years of age! That's why I do not recommend this game.
I particularly do not like, I bought for my son and he really likes the more when I play with friends
Excellent blend of story line driven narrative and free-roam exploration
Great game. Very addictive. Has exciting gameplay requiring creative thinking and mastery of the controls.
The first Xbox GTA. Multiplayer is cool and gameplay is solid as always with the GTA franchise.

I am not usually into this style of game, I usually only play shooters and sports games but I gave this game a shot and it was a very fun and innovative game. I love that you can play it through once as one character and then go play a totally different style of character the second time through. Well worth the money I spent on it.
This game is great. The story line continues from the first game. Been looking forward to this game and it hasn't let me down.

This Game is Amazing !!! The Graphics are epic and I have enjoyed the story line. They captured the spirt of the first game while making it feel fresh. I like that you can play the story as a different person. It makes me want to play the game twice to see the differences. I have enjoyed the game and I look forward to playing it again.
This game is even better than the first one. The exploring and battle system is really fun.

If you need a blast from the past, definitely consider getting Dishonored 2 and if you want to really challenge yourself, try playing the game without being spotted by enemies and killing enemies(including bosses) for the entire playthrough. You'll earn 2 rare achievements and have alittle bit of bragging rights. You can always play through it again and do some damage to get the bad ending as well.
Fun game with plenty of action, a must have for any gamer
I played the first game, so I already know this will be a great game as well

I've been looking forward to the release of this game for a while. It looked great from gameplay videos; however, after playing it on the Xbox One S, I was utterly disappointed by the performance issues this game suffers from--it doesn't run smoothly. It suffers from frame rate drops. The graphics for the Xbox One are blurry compared the the PC and PS4 (I was very upset when I learned this). The game looks ugly at times. All of these maladies take away from the enjoyment and playability from the game. I really hope patches will be released soon to remedy this, but until then, it's so irksome that it's unplayable, at least for me.
Been watching a lot of footage of this, and can't wait to get it in my hands.

I did not expect much from this game, but I was surprised by the fun gameplay. Unlike the beat em up games of the 90s, the main character, Shaq, has an array of moves to defeat various enemies. I enjoyed the hilarious story mode, which features Shaq as voiced by Shaquille ONeal himself. The story features tons of jokes, celebrity parody bosses, and quirky product placements that Shaq had advertised in the past. The only negatives I noticed were inconsistent hit detection and one dimensional defense. You can only roll up and down. Overall, I recommend this game to anyone interested in simple beat em up games. Shaq delivered non-stop humor throughout the game.
Castle Crashers with offbeat Anime-humour. It's an old school button masher like TMNT Arcade but a tad less refined. Still fun as heck and worth the playthrough.
Same issues as the other poster.. good news is, you CAN download the game on Steam and use the digital code they give you thru Best Buy.. easiest fix.

I purchased the digital version of this software prior to reading the other reviews. I have only had one problem after another, and still don't have the software. I've called the Digital Library support line, been placed on hold, and transferred multiple times. A number of times I've waited over 30 minutes for a call back, only to be placed on hold again, then transferred to a disconnected line, and have to start the whole process over again. Geek Squad confirmed that there is NO issue on my side, that there is something wrong with their download link, but I can't find anyone that can help me. I will NEVER buy another digital download from Best Buy. You are better off downloading directly from Steam or another online service. At least it will be instant, and you don't have to wait for some stupid upload of the software to your Library, that you can't download. At this point I'm looking for a refund and will buy the software elsewhere.

I purchased this digital version and having previous digital game experience, I thought this would be a simple download process and I would be playing in no time. Once the game showed up in my digital library, I clicked on the download button and absolutely nothing happened. I called Best Buy's support number and was transferred around several times. Finally Geek Squad tells me it would cost me $49-$99 in order for them to help me. The game its self was $65. Why should I have to potentially double the game for them to fix their own issues with downloading. I have a brand new top of the line Dell laptop so I doubt the issue is with my computers requirements. I spent a total of 55 minutes on the phone with several different people just to try to get a refund. Finally, some one says they will mail me a refund gift card and it will arrive in a little over a week. Awesome... so much good that does me. Terrible game support.

Should have gone through steam! BestBuy didn't send download key until midnight, while steam allowed players to download in advance of release date. BestBuy uses the Akamai netsession interface to download and my problems begin there. That problems fails to install on all three computers I own, so the download of the game cannot proceed. Called BestBuy support and was told everyone was at lunch and they would email me in a couple of hours. Totally unresponsive in my opinion.
Downloading the file form the digital manager is very difficult. I've installed the digital download manger, which does not appear to work either.
I was impatient and wanted my game. DO NOT BUY THIS! I tried Firefox, Chrome, and IE. Nothing works. WTF, Best Buy! There is NO WAY to download this.

The graphics are unbelievable. Gameplay is a little different but now you really need to think about how you want to build your empire. As the developers have said, no two games are the same. The game just came out so no mods as of yet but the game is awesome already. The downside is the cartoony portrait of the leaders and I thought we'd have more of a selection of leaders. Overall this is a great game that I believe has a ton of replay value. This is not one of those 1-done games.

I will have to reiterate what the other reviews have said. The download doesn't work for most people (myself included), and despite all these reviews, nothing has been done to fix the issue. After 2-3 days of dropped transfers, speaking to people who didn't even know what the problem was, but had no trouble giving me a resolution anyway, and other dead ends (I could go on....) their solution was to redeem on the Steam platform, which works, but a huge headache and TERRIBLE customer service.

Civilization 6 is a decent game. It brings some new mechanics that try to make the game more interesting. The success of that is questionable like the cities now having districts that also limit each city to focusing on only a few traits, mainly because of the lack of space for each city, or the culture tree that now runs as a clone of the science tree. The graphics have been dialed back as well, which is unacceptable. The game looks cartoony now and some of the designs for units are very unrealistic. I've played Civ 5 for over 300 hours and can say I prefer the 5th with a doubt. What Firaxis has shown from the 4 last games they have put out is that they do not fully understand what they're doing anymore. They randomly inject ideas into rushed games and it has shown. They sell well at first because they have a strong legacy but their games have not been up to par with their history. It would seem they spend too much playing their own games and not enough developing them.

This iteration of civilization is the best yet. It feels so complete. Normally my first game involves me thinking things like 'man, once they fix the tourism system' or 'once they balance religion' or 'once they add *insert anything* in the next expansion'. However, with this one, I don't feel like I'm waiting on an expansion to make the game complete. It has all my favorite features from previous versions and some new improvements that take it from awesome to perfect.

Civilization VI has much of the same great game play as previous entries. However, I've put around 15 hours in it so far, and it's just not as captivating as it used to be. Maybe I've outgrown this genre of games, but I can't help but feel slightly underwhelmed by this effort.
a worthy addition to the Civilization line worthy of play

Great game but have been away from series for too long - too many changes since I played it last. Guess I am too nostalgic about it, but not the games fault. New to the series or stayed kept up with it, great game, coming back from an older version, may not be for you.
I've had a couple older versions of this game and this compares favorably. It's a bit more involved than older models though and required a Steam account which I wasn't too excited about.
Same review as the others.I used key code on Steam and it downloaded with no issues.
Fun game! The last Civilization I played was #3 I think. The only downside with this game is that you have to download and run Steam to play it.
Just another hit with this game with new features for many hours of game play.
Steep learning curve even for an experienced civ player

This seem like a much better Civ V. It may not seem like there's a lot of improvement, but they make a difference. The districts make planning your city much more important, as it takes up tiles and positioning can affect multiple cities. Gone is the global happiness, replaced by amenities and makes expansion easier as long as you can find new resources. The new civic tree is a nice addition and can provide a strategical boost when needed. I do wish they had more leaders to choose from, but I guess they're saving that for expansions. There are some UI bugs here and there but more of an annoyance than anything too troubling. Still I'm having a good time with it.

If you like the Civ games, then you'll definitely like Civ 6. It has several improvements over the older games, the most significant of which are the new districts. It revamps other areas as well making for a good Civ experience. The AI isn't very good, but the fun of building your own civ is still the main draw for the Civ games.

I especially liked Civilization IV due to the better graffics and game play. Civilization VI is still strategic but looks like a lame cartoon in comparison. The problem is if you have Windows 10 it's the only version compatible so you're stuck with it if you wanna play.
I watched this as a kid not knowing what anime was, and I have to say the re-dub has made it age wonderfully. The team that did it is very aware of their audience. Highly recommended.
One of the best game series of all time, you can't get out of your seat once you start a game!

Honestly I thought that this game was a bit of a disappointment. I was expecting more from Civilization than what this iteration delivered. I would recommend just because I am an avid fan, but yeah. It's not the best.

if you love guns you will love this game. They are everywhere!

This review is based on previous releases of this series title and what has changed. I am an Avid fan of the Forza series but this time around I am completely disappointed!!! The game is absolutely beautiful but I complaint is about the Ultimate edition. With the ultimate edition, you are supposed to get 4 day early access to the game, not just part of it and that is exactly what has happened. There are so many features that weren't enabled and after scouring the internet and finding answers in forums, Turn 10 (the company that makes Forza) said that all features will be available on October 3rd, the release of the standard edition. If I wanted to only play part of the game, I would have stuck with the demo and played that over and over. The extra money spent would have been better used elsewhere and not on an unfinished product. The next issue I have with the game is the VIP membership you get with buying the ultimate edition. Forza has nearly always made the VIP portion of the game advantageous for people who opted for it as opposed to those who didn't. Better XP for races, lifetime double credits, VIP exclusive cars, etc. This time around, they went back on their initial wording of their VIP program. So instead of what was said about the better xp and double credits, they changed it after the game was released and reworded it to 5 mods cards that give xp and double credits. There are other glitches in the game but that is to be expected as a first day release.
Im an avid forza fan however, forza 7 is not what I was expecting. Two thumbs down!

The game is still a great racing sim, however Microsoft, as done with Gears of War 4 and Halo 5, have chosen to cram disgusting micro transactions into a 60 dollar game. The version i bought was the 100 dollar game which is even worse. VIP launched gutted so people would have to buy crates, in an awful bait and switch move that has since been rectified, but single player career mode is slightly geared toward making players want to buy loot crates which is insulting. Its a good core game, if you can look past the other stuff.

Unfortunately the VIP Pass you pay for in the Ultimate Edition is almost worthless. In past Forza games buying the VIP would give you some exclusive cars, and unlimited credit, and XP bonuses. Now they limit the XP and credit bonuses to cards. They give you a whole 25 uses on them which goes by really fast. As for the game itself, its amazing. So far its turned into my favorite racing title. I just recommend buying the regular edition and the car pass separate instead of wasting money on buying it in this.

The game is great, the graphics are great. This game does suffer from loot box issues and needs help with its campaign directions. The game leads you into events you must finish to progress, but leaves you with not enough money to buy a car to compete in said event. The car count is amazing, but more attention should be paid to how people progress.
The ultimate edition is nice due to all the perks and cars you receive right as you start

where to even start... loot boxes cars are locked to make you collect cars in tiers before others are ALLOWED to be bought VIP isn't the same yet is was advertised it was there is no reason to buy this version of the game its just a really really nasty move by microsoft thank you microsoft for telling me to my face you don't want my business

I have owned all seven Motorsport releases and three Horizon games, and this was my favorite for about two months. With a few exceptions (tree lines on Maple Valley), this game looks and feels incredible in 4K with HDR. Cars look and sound great, and it has the largest collection in recent Forza memory. After 75+ hours invested in the game, everything disappeared. My hundred or more cars are gone, my millions in in-game currency is gone, and my career progress and collectors status erased. The game all of a sudden lost all data and there's no known fix despite it being a known problem. I reached out to the Forza team for help, received a generic response that they'll look into it, and I'm sitting here waiting two weeks later. $100 for a great game that I now have no interest in touching. Until this is fixed, I'd advise you to stay away.
Great game. I like it quite a bit, but do have to take breaks occasionally as raving games can become repetitive for me.
If you like games like gran turismo for PS4, than you will love Forza on Xbox one.

Great game as you would expect from Turn 10 team. I am concerned about the use of 'Prize Crates'. The reason I dropped the rating to 4. Forza Sport 7 is on the cusp of trying to go the 'Pay to Win' formula that has been popularized by FIFA and now Call of Duty. Pay money to obtain crates to increase your credits:(. Decreased credits for wins. Now changed to 2X payout for VIP's with last game update. If they continue to go this route, I am done with this franchise! Pay to win is the reason I stopped playing FIFA and Madden. Look it up the net and you get more info on this terrible change sweeping video games.

Forza 7 expands on some dynamics and tracks, it's still more of the same, but that it is not necessarily considered a bad thing, the same has been proven fun for quite some time. I like to play racing games with a steering wheel, with new dynamics comes new challenges. Out of the box, the game is not set for a good steering wheel feel, unless you want to feel like you're racing a heavy piece of farm machinery without power steering, but a few adjustments and it's good to go. The visuals are nice and add to the sense of realism, a better set up out of the box for steering wheel support would be nice. At least it has steering wheel support. I used to love the NFS games, but they only let you play with a thumb stick, not nearly as fun. I don't bother with NFS anymore.
This is a good game with nice graphics but the pay chests to get new rides is not cool.

Pros - Looks outstanding. Excellent presentation. Best graphics in a console driving/racing game I've seen. Night and weather effects are jaw-dropping. - Physics feel very good with a controller. - Sounds great. Cons - Almost a month after release, parts of the game are still unavailable, example: Auction house, Forzathon, etc. Unacceptable. - Custom, searchable online lobbies would be nice. Resigned to fact that they are probably never coming back. - Computer AI is moronic. And the rubber-band nature of how they behave it ensures that if you do turn the difficulty up, they're still stupid, but really fast. - In single player, still no qualifying to be found. Always start in the middle of the pack. Would not recommend until all of the features are available.
This is a great game but the loot boxes stink. I do not buy the loot boxes.
Great graphics, smooth gameplay, wish more cars were available though.
Forza Motorsports 7 finally has reached the pinnacle of the best simulation racing game on Xbox

I am a Forza fan since the first game was released, in 2004 on the original Xbox. I own and played over 1,000 combined hours on all 6 Forza Motorsport and all 3 Forza Horizon editions previously released,. Today I added the 10th edition to my Forza collection with an ultimate edition copy of Forza Motorsport 7. FM7 is the best installment of the series. Impressive visuals and sound, solid controls on controller and wheel (I own a Logitech G920), master FFB and sim enough to be challenging and captivating. Yes, there are other simracers with more accurate to real life physics. However, FM7 physics are very close to a real sim, and production levels, presentation, graphics, game design are eons ahead of ANY other racing game on Xbox One. FM is an incredible experience with a controller and an epic one with a good FFB wheel (Logitech, Thrustmaster, Fanatec). There are also enough assists and settings to make this game accessible even to those who never played a racing game before. Last but not least the tunning and livery editors combined deliver an extra dimension that no other racing title on Xbox One gets even close to offer. This game is really deep, fun, and customizeable to all tastes and racing games skill levels. It is a killer app and a must-buy to ALL Xbox One owners who enjoy playing racing games and/or is a true car lover.

The initial setting is interesting enough, but there never seems to be much purpose to your actions. On top of that, the game ends rather quickly and the ending falls flat. The entire final level is extremely anticlimactic. As long as you go into Rage accepting that the story is flawed, and the real fun lies in the shootouts and driving sequences you will enjoy your time spent playing.

I was highly disappointed in this game. It did not live up to the hype. The story was bland, it wasn't difficult at all, even on hardest setting, the ending was HORRIBLE. The vehicle parts, especially the racing, felt nothing more than an arcade offroad game and added no value to the game. There were audio problems. It seemed like the game was only 4.1 surround sound, not 5.1. The center channel didn't appear to be used at all, and dialog with characters came out of all speakers and was not directional. PC and console users alike reported this issue. It looked pretty good graphically although a bit cartoony for me. Note: I did not play any multiplayer.

The game is set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland created by an asteroid impact, based on the real life asteroid Apophis, which is on track to pass near Earth in 2036. In Rage's story, the asteroid strikes on August 23, 2038, and the few pockets of survivors are forced to begin a new civilization. The world is populated by human survivors of the impact, who have come together to form settlements around oases and other practical or habitable locations. These fragile homes are diligently defended by the inhabitants against bandits and mutants, which are divided into various gangs and organizations of their own. Bandits and mutants serve as the player's main enemies for much of the game, although id Software has hinted at some sort of significant change around the halfway point in the storyline. The player emerges into this setting after being preserved inside an underground cryogenic pod called an Ark. The Arks are the direct result of the Eden Project, a massive international undertaking in which hundreds of Arks were sealed under the surface of the Earth with twelve people inside each. Each passenger possessed a special ability or trait that, combined with those of the other members, would help them rebuild society. The Eden Project, however, was far less successful than hoped. The player's Ark in particular is in bad shape at the start of the game. All of the other residents of the player's Ark are dead (presumably because of the impact), and the equipment of the Ark is destroyed as well, so the player wakes up alone and uninformed. With no memory of his identity or objective, the player is forced to head for the surface to find sustenance and allies
Super stoked to play this game! Love ID doom 3 was a sick game for original Xbox. Can't wait to play the twisted metal style multiplayer. Its gonna be a nice change of pace from cod

The Caligula Effect surprised me. When the game started asking me at the very beginning what my personal real life shortcomings are, I knew immediately that this game was going to be something special. Its a game that goes into the mind of us as people and what drives us to run away from our problems and escape to a fantasy world. For some it's video games, movies, anime, television shows, books or in this case music. The story takes place in a world called Mobius created by a Japanese POP idol named U. Through hearing Us many songs people start being sucked into this world that they never want to leave and cant. Think of it as escapism that you cant escape from. You start the game in a cutscene where everything looks normal and it looks like just a regular high school ceremony. Things arent like they seem though as a sort of glitch in the matrix starts happening, weird digitized images start showing up on peoples faces and you realize something isnt right. You escape and meet up with this fairy looking girl named Aria and someone who also is aware of Mobius named Shogo. You get acquainted and this is where you meet up with the Go-Home Club, a group of people who also see through this fake world and start to devise a plan to escape. Turns out a group of villains called the Ostinato Musicians hold control over different parts of the city and the main goal is to end the different musicians reign, take them down, and get closer to confronting U about returning home. What I love about this game is the main theme of escapism. Every character, having been pulled into this world has their own reasons for being in Mobius in the first place. Solitude, not wanting to grow into an adult, getting away from responsibilities, taking revenge on a rival, changing your looks in radical ways, or wanting the world to stay the same forever. You get to see why they escaped and there are times when they get challenged on whether or not its better to just stay. Musicians themselves control each area through their songs, using them to brainwash people to stay in Mobius. Throughout the game youll come across many of these people. A percentage count will be next to them and once this gets to a certain point theyll be corrupted and turn into what is called a digihead. Then youll have to fight them to return them to normal. These people you can then interact with and start what is called a trauma quest. Talking with them and becoming their friend will open them up to their trauma and youll have the ability to cure them. This can be done through including them in the party and equipping them with a certain piece of equipment, bringing them to a specific person, letting them level up while in the party, or clearing another persons problem that is directly related to them through the causality link. This causality link is a huge network of people connected to each other. You can use this to keep track of quests and where to find certain people. Through completing quests and curing them of their trauma, you get equipment and minimal stat upgrades. Once you cure someone they will no longer be able to turn into a digihead enemy. It makes the world feel alive because you could see some character NPCs that youve seen hours ago in completely different locations. Gameplay is a dungeon crawler with many floors, rooms and encounters through the many environments that youll traverse. Encounters happen when you are caught in the vision of an enemy and youll activate a transformation called the catharsis effect. This is used to fight off digiheads who are lost souls that have been consumed by the world. Other characters will soon also get this ability after certain events take place where their determination breaks out and they awaken. The battle system has each character using moves depending on the situation. You can buff, debuff, break a shield, dash across the battle area and launch enemies as well to perform combos. The way this is accomplished is through a timeline system where you can adjust at what time each character does their move in what order. Each character has up to 3 moves they can make and Its important to note that once you confirm a characters orders you cant go back and change them, so it's really important to set up your team properly in the right order and watch for the percentage chance at the top left. Each time you put in a battle command you get to see what the outcome will be if all hits are successful, this is crucial to determine what the enemy will do as well because some attacks only do best or activate against certain moves. It also gives you time to dash away or block future attacks. Blocking in particular can stun the enemy and timing is everything where the smallest difference in timing a block can mean taking a lot of damage or sustaining next to none. There is also a bar that fills up called the Risk meter that builds up through stacking attacks. It goes up from 1 to 6 and once it reaches 6 a risk break will start and the enemy will be susceptible to nothing but critical hits for a while. Some enemies in a dungeon, upon defeat will open up a soul remnant which are random pieces of equipment. It incentivises exploration through this as well with the mysteries of the world, these are random messages that give you skill points scattered in each dungeon. These skill points can be used to strengthen and get new attacks and support skills. Most areas will have hallways making moving around feel somewhat clunky at times, normally this would make battles very enclosed but the game does this clever thing of expanding the dungeon area by cutting out all of the walls around you when you enter a battle. It can get pretty nuts when you have 3 or 4 different battles between enemies going on in the same room. Each character has their own specific weapon they use and different styles. Certain characters like Ayane focus on stunning an enemy, Kotaro is all about quick powerful damage, and Mifue builds up Risk quickly. You can have one character break a shield and then proceed to air juggle them and hit them when their down. You could build up risk and cause a risk break and proceed to launch them and build damage with long range attacks. There are even counter moves as well as special moves you can do when a characters yellow colored stress meter is filled that all look very flashy, cool and well animated. It all flows as this makes for a pretty addictive and dynamic combat system where experimentation of the characters different weapons and abilities is really fun and keeps the game fresh. The game took me 36 hours to beat and I played the game on normal up until the 8 to 9 hour mark. I bumped it up to hard and I thought it gave a better overall challenge. Id recommend starting the game on hard and then seeing whether or not it's still too easy or hard depending on your skill level. One of the absolute best parts about this game however is the music. Each dungeon has their own instrumental theme and the moment you enter battle the song actually transitions to the vocal version seamlessly. Bosses even have a remixed version of the vocal theme that really just brings it all together. You can tell that they really cared about the soundtrack as this ranks up with some of my favorites in recent memory. Dungeons are fun to explore listening to these tunes and are a clever way of invoking the music that the people in the locations are being brainwashed by. At the end of each dungeon you have a confrontation with the musician, each boss is very different from each other making these situations interesting. Theres even times one of your party members will have something to relate to them to make learning and to make more understanding of where theyre coming from. Theyre all pretty entertaining villains and their designs further accentuates their insanity. In between dungeons, you can head to your base and when you see green symbols above a character that means you can hang out and learn more about them. All of these storylines have some great moments like Shogos attempts to go on dates,Trying to get Ayane to overcome her hatred for men, and Izuru experiencing the domestic life. These eventually lead to you gaining the ability to dive deeper. Which allows you to help your friends overcome their trauma that relates to why they escaped to Mobius in the first place. Be wary though as saying or doing the wrong thing can lead to you locking out that persons character quest forever unless you go back. In this new Overdose version of the game there is a optional second story where you can experience being a musician and you even get your own theme, It has a different ending and looks to be worth the second playthrough having not done it yet myself. Voices are all in japanese and from what performances are given from the sounds of it most all of the voice actors gave it their all in giving these characters life. Concerning environments, they arent the best looking, considering that these are all just real world locations being a little warped. There are some great looking locals such as the spa hotel and aquarium among many others. Theyre all very different from one another so there are bound to be some favorites. Graphically as you can tell is not good, the game has some very flat character faces and the whole game itself looks muddy and unpolished. It is no surprise though after hearing about Furyu, the developers of the games philosophy on making the best possible quality games on limited budgets. There were two times when the game crashed on me, both times happening in docked mode and fairly early on in the game. There were also some weird glitches that happened that werent game breaking but just strange and kind of funny. The Caligula Effect: Overdose has several rough edges, but a lot of heart. - Slentay

One of the best games I've played in a long time. I like it on the switch but it's also available on xbox and ps4. Wherever you can play it if you like permadeath (with some progression through carry over items) with random generated levels then you will absolutely love this game.
This game is easy to pick up and play, but be warned you'll find yourself staying up late 'just one more playthrough'
Side Scroller eat your heart out. This is a great game. Super challenging. I don't recommend for kids (4-10) as it may pose to be to difficult for them.

Oh how pretty these pixel are. It feels visually more like Castlevania, but elevates the aesthetic with some really solid lighting effects, depth and animation. Instead of roguelike, its rogue-lite. Theres no turn based battle, but the levels are procedurally generated, meaning: nothing is in the same place when you die. And youll die often, starting over at the beginning, losing (almost) everything in your inventory. But as you go along, getting a little farther each time, youre also gaining some traits that are permanent, like health restoration potions you can use once, then twice and so on. Its a totally different approach to gaming for me. Im usually a point A to point B kinda player, but this encourages getting better at going with the flow, identifying patterns and honing tactics. Super enjoyable.

Honestly, I never heard of this game at all nor even knew it existed. My friend gave me this game as a suggestion and I said 'what the heck, let's try it'. 3 weeks later, and I cannot stop playing it. It is the perfect combination of anger, frustration and rage quiting and at the same time relief and accomplishment. You are going to die. Period. That's the point of the game. I quote Cleveland from Family Guy 'You don't win, you just do a little better every time' and it's so true. When you die, you start over from the very beginning, BUT anything you unlock (weapons, mutations, etc) carries over to the new game and you get this urge to see how you can go 'this time' around. It's such a great side scrolling platformer with an interesting story arc. I highly recommend this to anyone's Switch Library.

This game got rave reviews and even a Game of the Year nomination. In my opinion, it was over-hyped. Was it a bad game? No. I enjoyed it for the first 10 hours or so. But after that, it became a grind. Yes, its challenging. Yes, that pushed me to beat it. Yes, I did finish it. But I cant say I enjoyed beating it. This was my first venture into the Roguelike genre though, and I cant say that genres for me. The repitition felt like a constant grind. If you like those games... this may be the best of the bunch as the actual gameplay was immensely fun.

This is my first roguelike game, and I have a love/hate relationship with this style. I love the non-linear approach, but I hate the groundhog day scenario of starting over completely after dying. I think its extremely well done: graphics, sound, controls, the myriad weapons & abilities... its addictive! There is tons of effort in honing your skills, learning what works best, having success, BUT then you die again and start over with none of those effective weapons again. Grind through, maybe you get something else that works for a bit, maybe you struggle for 5 more playthroughs with no luck. At some point, it wears off and you just want to play something else. I couldnt wait to jump into a more traditional game after this diabolical torture experience! Maybe Ill come back to this down the road, but everytime I see the cartridge, I cringe at the brutality that awaits. But its a great game nonetheless, just not my favorite style. I still recommend trying it for awhile to catch the fever... misery loves company.

Dark Cells is a brutally difficult 2D platformer for the Nintendo Switch and Sony PS4. Graphics are pretty, game and bosses are challenging. This game is very well done and is perfect to take with you on the road with your Nintendo Switch.
Great art style and design but that's about it. This is one of the most boring games I've ever played. Been gaming since 1985.

My first thought upon dying was that Id rather play Symphony of the Night. So I turned it off and played a better game on my PS3. If your looking for something new or portable Im sure this is fun and worthwhile.
GREAT GAME TO ADD TO MY COLLECTION OF SEALED GAMES

I have never watched anything to do with Conan at all. Thankfully, this game has next to nothing to do with it, so I'm not out of the loop too much. However, I've been a fan of survival based games sense Ark: Survival Evolved, 7 Days to Die, and depending on your interpretation of 'Survival Based Games', since the dawn of Minecraft. I love the open world, the struggle to find/make shelter, the salvaging of the world's resources, and the great unknown of survival games. I compare Conan: Exiles to Ark for a few reasons, but it is unfair to say it is exactly like Ark. They are similar, but that may just be due to the nature of well-made survival games (which 7 Days to Die was not). While they are both pre-made worlds (not procedurally generated), Ark's denizens are randomly spawned, and generated throughout the map, and will always respawn at random. With Conan, things are where they are, ALWAYS. If I find a band of cannibals (which is around every corner), they will be there on every other server you play on, and will respawn there, exactly where they were when you found them, always. That's not necessarily a bad thing, however. Ark's experience is much different than Conan's. While it appears Ark is all about struggling to survive and sprawling out over the entire map searching for and taming dinosaurs, while constantly improving your technology to reach crazy limits within the world itselt (all the way up to space age, by the way), Conan is far different. It focuses more on the medieval aspect, with heavy emphasis on that era. It has tons of different types of weapons, tools, armors, etc. and it plays FAR more like Minecraft than that of Ark. It's building is way easier and relaxed than Ark's (I built a very nice, ocean-front resort in a matter of about a day or two, as opposed to it probably taking me around a week or longer on Ark, and without all of the senseless dinosaur related deaths attempting to collect materials). Conan Exiles provides a very predictable experience. It is scary to venture out sometimes, mainly due to carry-weight and not being able to take back your entire haul to your house, but once you've explored a location, you pretty much know how it will ALWAYS be. This can be bad if you feel like you're an avid explorer looking for different experiences each time you enter an area. But, for those looking to build and create, this is AWESOME, because those iron ore rocks in my front yard will always be there, and those Pirates will ALWAYS be far enough away from me to not pose a threat while I'm out of their area. I've spent HUNDREDS of hours in Ark; online, offline, private server, friend's server, etc. I loved it, and that passion for Ark is what drove me to purchase and look forward to Conan: Exiles. I've put in dozens of hours into Conan, but none of it was with a friend or on an online server. While I intend to put several dozen more hours into this game on my private server, I feel as though I could double or triple the lifespan of this game with extra people to play with, after all, it seems more geared towards the rich building mechanics behind the game. You can conquer and enslave the humans in Conan Exiles, and have them work for you and take away the loneliness of your solo, ocean-front getaway. They can defend your home on PVP servers as well. There are gods that you can praise your loyalty too, and eventually someone giant, titanic avatars to smite the map with. While there is divinity in this game, there are also terrible monstrosities that inhabit the regions of Conan Exiles. Their diversity ranges from Turtle-Gorillas, Crocodiles, Giant Lizards, and Terror Birds, to a city of ferocious Apes, a castle of undead soldiers, and a snowy wasteland of wights and draugr. The map is also split into 3 difficulties; the bottom left to lower central area is the easiest; the middle of the map stretching all the way to the eastern side of the map is the middle difficulty; and the top region is the hardest. The harder the land is to survive, the rarer the resources, and the greater the loot. The character customization is also fair at best. While the characters and armors look very nice, the actual options for customization seem lacking and limiting, which is okay since you're usually dressed in some form of body cloaking garb. For those who spotted the 'nudity' rating on the game, you'll only get the top half of women revealed. If you were expected full nudity, buy a PC because that's where it is allowed (ESRB's decision). This is fine to me, as nearly ALL enemy humans are next to naked - not all of them, but most of them. Also, if you are a server host, or a host of your own offline server, there are countless options to customize the setting of each session or server. It gives you near total control of how your experience or the experience of those on your server will go. If you happen to turn on the option, which I initially had ticked on, there is the Purge mechanic. I had no idea what this was at first, and after a little digging, I decided it wasn't for me, so I switched it off. It is basically a meter that builds up on your server, and when it gets to 75% all the way up to 100%, there will be a random, colossal hoard(s) of monsters that spawn randomly on the map. Their sole purpose is to target player made bases, ranging from broom closet homes from a one log-in player, to giant player made kingdoms (including my relaxing ocean condo). They can wipe away entire player homes and villages, so the goal is to prevent that and fortify your defenses with strong walls, armed guards, and extra players outfitted with higher end equipment. I feel like I may turn it back on some day when I grow far stronger, but while I'm lone-wolfing this unforgiving land, I think I'll sleep better at night knowing I won't be receiving a forced eviction from my home. Another thing that is important to point out is that I've yet to explore more than probably 10 - 15% of the map, so you can imagine that it is very big. So, all you explorers who were disappointed when I said this game can be predictable, you've still got quite a lot of gameplay before you, and loads of fun to boot. I bought this game at the 20% discount offered by Best Buy's (now restricted only to current members) Gamer's Unlocked membership, so I can't exactly say if I'd recommend this game at full price. If you have been eyeballing this game for a while, or already love survival-based games, then I can say you won't be disappointed with this game if purchasing at full price (especially with friends). But, if you have no idea what this game is about, or the genre in general, I'd wait until the game goes on sale, say $30?
