I purchased this game for a nephew and he didn't enjoy this game much at all. He didn't like the story line felt it was boring.

I would recommend this game to any child 6 and over - my son absolutely loves this game and feels very challenged most of the time. . . sometimes it is too challenging for him but he does eventually figure out what to do next!!!
Love the game and all the characters. It is challenging for the kids and keep them ocuppy for hours.

I hear people raving about the lego series, and I finally got a chance to play. I have to say I was extremely disappointed. The game was really long, and there isn't enough action to make this game engaging. I love playing puzzles and games, but this is even less action that doing a crossword puzzle.

We were really bummed about this game. Now that my son has played it I can see why it's $10 less than the average price for a newly released Wii game. There are only 15 main levels and it took less than 5 hours to complete the game. It's not challenging or complex. Really wish it had more levels and more challenges. We love everything Lego and have all the Lego video games - this one is the least challenging of all.
So far my appliances are working great. Best Buy was easy to work with and delivery went smoothly
granddaughter loves it ! She's into Lego right now.
I had lots of fun on the first State of Decay and this one improves on that. If you love games like this, definitely pick it up!

I played the original State of Decay and that was a fresh take on the zombie apocalypse. State of Decay 2 is more of that with a multiplayer addition. The same survival mechanics of searching buildings for the five basics (food, materials, medicines, fuel and ammo) and using them to build your base is present. Of course, not all base sites can accommodate the same structures, so you will have to decide what is important to you. The addition of the plague hearts along with infestations was a bit nerve wracking, as the plague hearts can take a lot of damage. The ability to carry over your survivors as a 'legacy' is also a nice touch. I have a couple of complaints that make the game frustrating. 1. Sometimes, a member of your community will have a 'personal' quest. If you are using that character when the quest pops, you cannot switch characters without cancelling the mission. This is extremely frustrating as you will not be able to load up your 'follower' with the correct inventory. (Think follower with a broken melee weapon. You won't be able to equip them with anything now.) 2. Sometimes your follower 'disappears' during a quest. For some reason they won't get back in your vehicle. You might even seen them on the mini-map, but they will not be around. If you return to base, I've had a hard time finding the 'lost' follower. Until you tell your first follower to 'leave' you can't pick up another one. If you're on one of those personal quests, you can't switch off the character to the missing one to see where they are. This is very frustrating, because you really don't want to be out in the land all alone. 3. Sometimes when you are face to face with your follower (who has been missing, and sometimes they've not been missing) and you try to switch characters, the characters warp to another part of your base. So, now you will have to try to find the character that you were just using within your base in order to realease them and pick up a new follower. Overall, I like the game. I was a fan of the first, and I'm a fan of the second even with with annoying bugs. It has RPG elements along with a simplistic combat system. You can waste a lot of time with this game.

As a fan of the first State of Decay I was excited to see the new features and graphics. Needless to say they did a great job improving on the first entry in multiple ways. It is a blast to play and provides many hours of enjoyment.
I enjoyed the first game, but this is the first zombie apocalypse survival game I've played in multiplayer and it was a lot of fun.
This game is highly addictive, especially if you like horror survival games. Endless possibilities. Very fun game!
This game is pretty sweet. While not a great leap beyond the first game, it does add some pretty cool features.

If you're looking for a zombie killfest, this is probably it. The game's mechanics are good, and the gunfights and melee combat are very good and the control are tight; however, the game has some problems with simpler things such as vehicle physics (like getting stuck on guardrails, getting stuck going off-roading in ditches and rocks, and in multiplayer if two players are driving separate cars near each other and collide the cars can catapult or destroy each other almost comically), being bogged down too many missions while you're doing other things (and thusly you can lose allies who feel neglected and leave because you've been stuck neck deep in zombies trying to navigate through the town), and slow patches because Microsoft has to go through a lengthy process of approving the patch even though the game developer's have had it ready for weeks or longer. TL;DR: I would recommend if you're looking for a zombie shoot-em-up with simpler base building aspects; with that in mind, know that some of the cars physics can be strange, the game is still a little buggy, and patches are going to be trickled in slowly.

So, in the beginning of the game you are prompt to a few character. Each character you choose has a storyline and have a partner to build your community with. Wish there were more character. But I have to say this game pulled me in immediately. I haven't turned off my xbox one. If you have friends who play this, do play it together. Challenges are more challenging and survival modes are fun to go through together.
This is not just a hack n slash game. It is a resource management and hack n slash. Very fun with depth in character choice. Very fun.
Very fun game! You will end up losing track of time when playing.

Buggy, can't get the multi player to work. Tedious repetitious game. There isn't much going on, and my stupid followers keep losing my resources while I'm out. They literally just lose fuel and materials. Once while I was in the base, it said we were being robbed and lost a ton of our food...but I was right next to the food supply. I guess I was robbed by an invisible ghost ninja. Not a fun game. I really wanted to like it.
not a great game but not a bad game. its just good Not for everyone but i recommend playing with friends for a better experience
This game is kind of boring to be honest and this game is a step down than the first game

Not my type of game. The kid seems to be enjoying it. He's a Walking Dead fan. To me, the graphics look sub-par and the mechanics are clunky. If you're into that and like to shoot at zombies, then you may enjoy this game. If you like Forza, Battlefield, CoD, then this will disappoint.

This game is an open-world, zombie apocalypse survival game. What it has to offer (that the first SOD game did not have) is the ability to join and play with friends. If you are someone who enjoyed playing the older Left for Dead games (especially in a team of friends), you will probably enjoy playing State of Decay 2 with your buddies as well. This game keeps you busy with objectives, looting, and fighting off zombies. I would have definitely given 5 stars; however, 1 star has to be deducted based on the mechanics alone. The game has its moments of being buggy, especially when driving in a vehicle during multi-player. The graphics could be way better, considering this game was released in 2018. Also, (not 100% sure but...) you can't search and join random online players. I believe you can only play with people you know and send invites to. These issues aside, as I said before, the gameplay is so much fun. I would recommend it, especially if you intend on playing it with friends.

I am having a blast with this game. If you liked the first game, they improve on everything. Mods for your base add a very interesting spin on things, and I just upgraded my truck with something I got off a trader, and it's a zombie slaughtering machine now with spikes and blades. I can't wait to play this with friends! My only complaint is that I wish infestations weren't so frequent. It seems difficult to keep up with them at times.
While I enjoy playing this game, the graphics are a major detraction. Its almost impossible to see whats going on at night. The base management stuff will probably keep me playing.
Graphics: 7.5 Controls: 7.5 Gameplay: 7.5 Sound: 8 Replay: 7.5
The game has some glitches, is shallow, and is only fun in co-op.
Honestly I think I dont have the patience for 3-5 seconds per box searches and weird controls

There's been a lot of good games this year but this one has me addicted. its like living out a zombie apocalypse, a mix of dead rising meets the sims. I have Farcry 5, Zelda and God of War still to finish but this has my full attention. Lots of Graphics problems that I hope get addressed in a patch. Also you can play with friends but because there isn't dedicated servers its too slow to work
I'm so hype to play this game come on Tuesday Open world let's go

I entered my code emailed to me by Best Buy and it shows up as the Pepper's pack instead of the Survivor's Pack on my Microsoft account. I ordered the Ultimate edition from Microsoft and ordered the best buy one for the bonus pack. Now it appears I have 2 Pepper's Packs. I follow the emailed intrusions 'Have a Microsoft Account or Xbox Live Profile? Simply log in to your account on linklink and enter the 25-digit code.' Also I am unable to verify this is an issue because the game is not released yet, But it is showing 2 Pepper's Packs on my Microsoft Account order history.

I really had high hopes for this game. I loved State of Decay as flawed at it was in terms of bugs. I told everyone who played xbox one to get this game. I bought on release day and was extremely disappointed. Doesn't have the same feel as the original and the storyline is very boring and slow. I feel like the original sucked you right into the action. This one almost feels like a chore to play. If I didn't buy online through Microsoft (couldn't do a review on there but wanted to do one regardless) I would have returned the game already. Sorry for those who like it. I am very underwhelmed by it.

Right up front I love this game. Even though it's glitchy and co-op can be hit or miss. The fun I have with this game is immeasurable! Organizing and strategically deciding what you're going to do is a blast that sets my mind at ease. This game does sometimes try and randomly throw a lot at you, but since it's going for a more 'realistic' zombie apocalypse, it fits. You're not going to be able to help everyone, you are going to have people die, you will have to scavenge for supplies. But the joy of being in this living world that has a back story that eventually brings everything together is just too much fun to miss out on in my opinion. At it's core mechanics it's a survival horror with base building in the zombie apocalypse. If that doesn't sound even kinda fun, just walk away. But with budget price and budget expectations you will find a gem here!

This sequel has a lot of great things going for it, but has some inherent flaws that consistently remove you from the otherwise amazing experience of thriving day by day in the zombie apocalypse. Starting out with the great things about this game: -Fun, fun, fun -Immersion -Challenging -Unpredictable AI This game is similar to its predecessor, but with improvements in terms of managing your base, your community's needs and wants, and the constant worry of contracting the deadly Blood Plague virus if you're consistently attacked by bloodied zombies, or infected zeds, who are far more aggressive in nature. The challenge gets bumped up as you collect more survivors, figure out how to keep all of them alive and happy, and hoping that you don't encounter some zed specialists on your next venture to retrieve daily necessities to keep it all going. You never know what is lurking around the corner in this game. Now for the cons, the negative aspects of the game that really break the immersion on many occasions, and inevitably causing you to reboot the game... -Buggy gameplay (getting stuck, interface disappearing, sidekick's whereabouts unknown -Unintuitive menu complexity and presentation -Graphics aren't any better than the original (enhanced) release -Music tends to cut out at random -Reboots needed to fix game-breaking errors While the game can be really fun and pull you into its amazing world of immersion, the quests do get repetitive after a long while, the music will sometimes just stop suddenly, the contextual menu system that has you managing your base is overwhelming at first, and the worst part of it all is after a good boss fight (a.k.a. the Juggernaut), your whole interface will just inexplicably disappear, preventing menu selection, base management, character progression, GPSeverything. The game will keep running, but you lose insight into what is happening around you. This happens mostly after a climactic scene after defeating a boss, for some strange reason, and the only solution is to restart the game to fix every bug that has been accumulating during your play time. That is very annoying! Hopefully these technical glitches get fixed because they almost ruin the whole game. Despite these shortcomings, when the game is running really well, it's impressively fun across the board. You play at your own pace, chart out your character growth, and grind through until you make your goals a reality. If you've enjoyed the original game, then this is a no-brainer. This is better in a lot of aspects even though the first game ran better consistently.

I just played about an hour of the open beta, and even after that short time, this game is incredible. I've played other snowboarding games, and I've played open world games. This is the first open world boarding game though. Super unique, graphics are phenomenal, gameplay is amazing.

I played the recent beta and it was nothing but pure fun and adrenaline fueled game. the physics, sounds and the fun terrain were are realistic! Telemark/ free-heel skiing would have been a nice touch which is my passion for traveling in the backcountry.
This game brings me back to the days of Shaun white snowboarding, but this map is insanely huge with a ton of insane lines to ride.

Ok...I gave this 5 stars for ME. I love snowboarding, and consider it one of my favorite hobbies. With that said... Not everyone will like this. If you aren't a winter sports/adrenaline fanatic you will be disappointed. If you are looking for ssx or snowboard kids...you will be disappointed. But I love this game, that's all that matters to me. Maybe you will too!

Infinite Air is much more realistic and the controls are very good and rewarding once you master them. STEEP is more of an arcade game and the controls are not that great. Infinite Air allows you to create your own mountains. STEEP allows you to fly around like a bird.

First things first, I am playing this on the Xbox one X connected to a Sony 4K TV with HDR. This game is tough to even know where to begin. Story, graphics, mechanics, everything is the the best I have ever seen. To begin with story, I was blown away the twists and turns this game took me down. Mind you, I am at the end of chapter 6 with every side mission completed thus far and also I've done a lot of hunting and fishing for legendary animals/fish. I probably am 55+ hours in and I still feel like there is so much I have left to do. While the game starts out very slow, it's for good reason. There is a lot to learn but once you understand how to play the game, there is nothing like it. The main story itself has wow'd me, the end of chapter 4 going to chapter 5 took me places I never thought the game would have and the entire chapter 5 was constant heart racing action. Going into chapter 6 it leaves you feeling lost, like things have really changed and while the first half of the game it seemed like they had it all figured out, that may not be the case anymore. I won't spoil too much but I'm telling you, chapter 6 really took things in another direction and it makes you sit on the edge of your seat wanting more. Even without the story, the games side missions feel like mini story mode quests. They're so detailed and there is real emotion grabbers built into them. You get invested in them just as much as the main story itself. Outside the story and side missions there is still a million things to do. The map is incredibly massive, it's alive with people, animals, and vegetation everywhere you go. You could be trotting along a random path and a stranger will ask you for help. You feel like hunting or fishing? Go for it, I don't know how many animals and fish are in the game but it feels like hundreds and you want to keep finding more so you can fill up your journal. There is so much to do in this game it's hard to explain it all. My only complaints for this game are the ways to get around the map, it's not easy to fast travel. If you're in the middle of nowhere hunting and kill a bear, skin it, and put it on the back of your horse, the trapper to sell the pelt to may be really far away and there is no train or stage coach near by. So those cases suck. Also, trying to hitch your horse was a little clunky but since the update it has really improved. Besides those little things, I can't think of anymore negatives. Overall this is the most incredible game I have every played and as the cherry on the cake, graphics are the best I have ever seen. If you're on the fence about this game don't be. I guarantee it will be game of the year and if it isn't, I will be very surprised (Yes I have played God of War and Spiderman and in my opinion, God of War may be close but Spiderman is out of Red Deads league). Best of all, online play for this comes out the end of the month which I'm super pumped for, I hope to have the game beaten by then. Let me know what you think of my review in the comments!

I was terribly disappointed by RDR2. While visually stunning and smooth running during gameplay, Rockstar Games has bogged this title down with endless management details that greatly impact gameplay. The original RDR had some of this but for the sequel they have amped it up to the Nth degree forcing you to constantly waste in game time eating, sleeping, bathing, brushing your horse, smoking and other tedious actions that can't be disabled. I have been told they want to keep the experience 'real' but when you only have a limited time to sit and play each week, spending 30 minutes doing these things just becomes ponderous. Now you have to monitor your body temperature if you can believe that. Wearing that heavy winter coat while in the desert will cause you harm. If you eat too much or too little, it also impacts your character's health, rarely if ever for the player benefit. The game is so bogged down in these tedious details that it kind of saps the fun out of just enjoying the pretty scenery. I have more than 20 hours of gameplay invested and I still don't really know what the ultimate story is about or what my version of Arthur Morgan is expected to do. Deadeye drains so rapidly that combat against groups of lawmen or bounty hunters is a constant repeat of live, shoot back, die and respawn that it is likewise not especially fun. Each time you die you lose money. The more times you get killed in a gameplay hour, the amount of your money you lose also increases. Committing robberies or other shenanigans to increase your holdings is also bogged down with ridiculously tiny amounts of currency or valuables making it difficult to actually get the stake together you need to really begin the main quest line. With no way to lower any difficulty settings or ways to adjust and reduce the more tedious elements of the game it has been thus far for me, not nearly as much fun as it is bland repetition. Some might argue that you just have to build up to being a better character and the gameplay improves but again, when you have a limited time for gaming and just want to enjoy, it gets frustrating after a while. I recognize that I am probably one of the few who finds this system more of a nuisance than a quality feature but I think they overdid it in the 'realism' department. Even the mini-game where you sit down to play poker with random folks has become more time consuming than the original as you are limited in when you can 'skip' the cut scenes. You have to sit there after each hand while a computer player collects the cards and passes them to the next dealer....every, single hand. Just a constant time waste that might be more realistic but it sucks the joy out of playing. In a nutshell, this is a visually stunning game with pretty good mechanics and a deep and I am told, well written story - but Rockstar Games has micro-managed a big chunk of the fun out of it. Cheat codes are readily available online but be WARNED - activating any cheat code will disable all achievements and make it IMPOSSIBLE to save your game and this effect is permanent as soon as you activate a cheat. Even if you disable the cheat, you are still locked out of saving your game. IF you do activate a cheat, be sure to have at least one SAVE GAME without the cheats prior to activating them or you will never be able to save the game period. This effect is apparently permanent.

The Red Dead Redemption 2: Special Edition delivers exclusive content for Story Mode including: Bank Robbery Mission and Gang Hideout in Story Mode: Get exclusive access to a Bank Robbery Mission, in which Arthur and a couple of his fellow gang members come up with a daring plan to break in and rob the bank in the southern town of Rhodes. Elsewhere, the Del Lobos Gang has taken over a hacienda - clear this gangs hideout and rob their stash for a lucrative take. Dappled Black Thoroughbred: This thoroughbred racehorse sporting a beautiful reverse-dappled black coat will keep you at the front of the pack with its exceptional speed and acceleration. You will also get the exclusive Nuevo Paraiso Saddle, handmade in dark chocolate leather with silver medallion detailing. This horse and saddle are available in Red Dead Redemption 2 Story Mode. Talisman and Medallion Gameplay Bonuses: These special Story Mode items will give Arthur a helping hand whenever they are equipped. Attaching the Eagle Talon Talisman to his boot, Arthurs environmental awareness skill will last longer. By carrying the Iguana Scale in his personal Satchel, Arthur will take less damage while riding on horseback. Gameplay Boosts, Cash Bonuses & Discounts: This collection of exclusive Story Mode boosts, bonuses and discounts will help Arthur to survive out in the harsh wilderness and better provide for his gang members and their camp. The Core Stat boost benefits Arthurs Stamina, Health and Dead Eye Cores. Earn more cash during robbery missions with the Van der Linde gang, and when hunting and selling animal carcasses. Receive discounts on all upgrades to the Van der Linde gangs camp. The Nuevo Paraiso Gunslinger Outfit: This exclusive Story Mode outfit for Arthur is inspired by the clothing worn by vaqueros and banditos south of the border. The outfit features a wide brimmed black cowboy hat, deep indigo coat, worn denim chaps, leather gloves and boots. Free Access to Additional Weapons: A good range of weapons is essential for survival in the Old West. Get free access to three weapons at the in-game Gunsmiths in Story Mode: the robust Volcanic Pistol, devastating Pump Action Shotgun and versatile Lancaster Varmint Rifle.

Ive lived out on AZ for 4 years, worked out of the Reservations, and Ive seen the vast deserts, Mesas, and the forest and mountains of Flagstaff area, and I can with absolute certainty (at least from my perspective) the game is more fun than the real thing. Hiking and horseback riding through the wilderness is great and all, but the heat, cold, bugs, poisonous snakes, unwanted tan (and still smelling like sunscreen), and all the other annoying stuff I can do without. The story is well written. The adventure is fun and fulfilling. If all games were this good, I wouldnt be able to keep a stable job.

This is my first experience with this series and I'm very impressed. The graphics are excellent, but I really like the story driven elements more and it's really fun to play. I like how they made the environment react to your actions more than most games, so going around killing people will have real consequences. Though I do think they overestimated how quickly law enforcement in this time period would have found out about things, the game acts like they have global hawk surveillance drones watching you 24-7, so even if there are no survivors the law still finds out.

When numerous early previews called this game one of the 'Best In The Past Ten Years,' I simply laughed! I am admittedly a fan of the GTA series, but this game blows away anything done previously by Rockstar. You will truly get your money's worth with this one. There is something for almost every type of gamer in this title. Anyone considering themselves a gamer will try this game and hang on beyond the first few hours, at least until the epilogue/training is done. That is where the game truly begins and the world opens up for exploration. No spoilers, but this title is not a true sandbox because you are somewhat guided by and contained within the story. I would wholeheartedly recommend this experience to every friend and anyone else willing to listen. If this recommendation has helped you in anyway, please check it as Helpful, so that it may help others.

This is an amazing achievement in gaming. Rockstar have once again outdone themselves to create a living and vibrant world with excellent characters and storytelling. Gameplay is married to the storytelling in all the best ways. The visuals are impeccable especially on the Xbox One X with its native 4K support. HDR unfortunately is abysmal thankfully the SDR is quite good already. While controls are quite good there is a heavy feeling due to lengthy animations which makes you feel like your walking through thick mud at all times. After getting used to this can be forgiven. Altogether this is an unmissable game and improves upon the rockstar formula in every possible way.

Read Dead Redemption 2 is a direct prequel to the first title released over seven years ago. This title shows a tale around Arthur Morgan, a member of Dutch van der Linde's gang. This title plays exactly like the first game, particularly with regards to the horse, movement and gunplay. A number of famous voice actors were brought back to reprise their roles in Red Dead 2 as well, van der Linde's character in particular. Rockstar crafted another another excellent story, and even though I haven't completed it yet, I am highly engrossed and want to keep playing further to see how everything unfolds. The story for this game is much, much longer than the first game. Expect a playthrough of over 50 hours to complete this title. If you're looking for a single player game with a great story, this game is a must purchase. If you played the first title and want to see how this prequel ties into the first game, you probably already made the purchase and are playing this right now.

-It's real purdy. -It's real big -It's real deliberate. This is a game that seems to have taken to heart how I played RDR and spun it out as far as you can go. You need to slow down and play at the pace it's built for rather than try to push it. But that works perfectly for me. I never run (unless I have to to get things done), I never push my horse (again, see above). The rhythms of a time long gone feel great. It has some control quirks but I've adapted to those pretty well. Highly recommended.

I've been a red dead fan since the release of red dead redemption 8 long years ago. The hype this has built is so deserving. Beautiful graphics, immersive world and characters and is the closest to life like a game has and I believe ever will get in this generation of gaming. If you have not yet pulled a trigger on the new consoles or a new 4k tv and intend on doing so. Now is the time. Goty

Make no mistake, if you bought this version of the game for the Xbox One X, you are playing the best version of the game. The art direction, the cinematography, the voice acting and animations are all top notch even for Rockstar standards. But what puts it over the top is this is probably the best looking game on the market, even better than PC games that are out now in terms of overall appearance. You're not going to get more than 30 FPS until it maybe comes to PC, so until then, this is as good as its going to get. Also kudos to BestBuy for getting this to me on release day, they missed it in the past with Destiny 2 and I wasn't happy about that at all.

Much of the gameplay is detrimental to the enjoyment of the game. The first few times I played, I killed my horse, had a bounty placed on my head for running someone over with my horse, then shot and killed by lawmen when I accidentally bumped into someone while on my way to pay off the bounty. The next few hours of gameplay were spent trying not to get killed by gangs, thrown off my horse, or getting attacked by wolves. Only to come back to another bounty on my head when I turned my console back on after not playing for a few days. How did I get a bounty when not playing? No idea, but that's not the first time it happened. After a week of gameplay, I threw this game in the garbage and deleted it from my Xbox One. It's sad because I was excited about this game.

It's an excellent Rock Star title. It's graphically impressive and the level of detail far exceeds the original; however, it should be stated that sometimes the game is not what a typical gamer would consider 'fun.' It is an adventure....in the sense that climbing a mountain is a fun endeavor; but, what if you had to play a game of checkers, then chess, then hopscotch every 100 yards. I look forward to experiencing the END.
Story, graphics, gameplay are all among best youll ever experience. Game of the year 2018!
Grand is great. Controls are a little weird but still great.
Been waiting a while for this game. Definitely not disappointed, its amazing.
It lives up to the first one and surpasses it in every way.
This game has great graphics and story and is fun!
This game is pretty groundbreaking there is something for everyone
Great game on every level. A game like this only comes around every 5-6 years. Must buy for any platform.

Awesome game, I went and picked it up early on the 25th. Very well worth the wait. It's very well done, Rockstar did an amazing job. The only thing that is a downside is the 87.86GB of harddrive space it takes up to install on your console.

On the Xbox One X this game looks absolutely amazing. One of the most immersive and beautiful worlds Ive ever seen in a game. I've played video games for over 20 years and this is by far one of the best games out there.
Very well made game. Like playing a movie with lots to do and see.
This game is amazing. Graphics are great and its a lot of fun!!!
I love this game by far the best game from Rockstar since gta 5 . great story graphics and gameplay
Im only about halfway. So far Im loving it. I did have a quest glitch on me. Closed out of the game and tried again and it worked fine.
The attention to detail that Rockstar took with this game is unbelievable. Its a fantastic experience. Take it slow. Savor it.
This is definitely a game that sucks you in! I'm really enjoying it. Looking forward to beating it, and multiplayer!
The anticipation for game was beyond crazy and has delivered

I can't remember how long I've waited for the sequel to the original Red Dead Redemption to come out, and when it finally did, I can't be happier. This game improves in every way over the original. Great story, great gameplay, great all around game!
It has been 8 years waiting for this game, if you love to play it mostly offline, Special Edition is the right choice!
Fantastic follow up to the first game. Great graphics!
This is a great follow up to Red Dead Redemption! Its like GTA set in the Wild West.
This is the most amazing looking game Ive ever played! stretches the mind how real it looks. Buy this game!!!

It's true what they say about the Xbox one X version of this game. You simply HAVE to experience it. The atmosphere, the story, the characters, the locals, the dialogue. EVERYTHING! Rockstar more than earns the right to be sitting shoulder to shoulder with other greats like Naughty Dog, and Fromsoftware to name a few. You actually can see the blood, sweat, and tears, that went into this game. Bravo!

RDR2 has everything; great story depth, smooth and addictive gameplay, great characters and equally impressive voice acting. You cannot go wrong with this game, the value is outrageous. Even after the main story, theres so much to do! Online hasnt been released yet but should be a ton of fun with friends.

Red Dead Redemption 2 is not an action game. It's slow and can feel like it drags on for those that just want to shoot things. But it's incredibly cinematic and is one of the best looking games ever made. If you're the type of person that loves to immerse yourself in a world or loves watching cutscenes after a mission, or even just likes to explore a huge map that feels alive to just discover things, you will almost certainly like this game. Highly recommend for anyone without a short attention span.
being a cowboy on tv is awesome neato. really awesome neato. bang! bang! giddy up!!

I loved the original red dead redemption because of the story and in spite of the bad gameplay. RDR2 doesn't have as strong a story and the gameplay especially is mostly chores and bad gunplay. HDR settings are fake and look terrible. Really the only improvement from the original is the production value. I would still recommend it for the experience but its not as fun as other games.

It's probably one of the most innovative gaming experiences I've ever seen. The game really plays like a western from it score to the slow paced story that manages to keep you invested the whole way through. if you are unsure about buying this game you need to go home and rethink their life. buy this game and hop on your horse for an adventure that so good you'll forget about the other pleasures of life. dedicate an unreasonable amount of time to sitting in front of your TV for an experience that you literally cant find in real life. RED DEAD REDEMPTION 2 the best game that has ever made us realize how hopelessly boring our mundane lives are. if you've read this far and haven't bought this game yet, then I am typing to a brick wall.

If you want a game that you will truly get your money's worth out of...this is the one! It rumored to take many months of non stop playing to even come close to finding out all the games challenges and secrets. Just make sure you have enough room on your exsisting hard drive before installing. It is a very nice change to play a game in the Old West setting of Red Dead Redemption and the details to the era are a sight to see!

The Highlights: The graphics - 10/10 (Every detail has been considered and brought to life from the clothes and weapons right down to rainbows that appear and disappear under the right weather conditions). The sounds - 10/10 (The sounds of the late 1800s are there and the weapons, surroundings, and equipment sound just as they should). The gameplay - 10/10 (There are plenty of missions and side quests to keep you busy. This is a true open world experience where life will continue on in the world regardless of what you decide to do in it, even if it's taking a few days for yourself to go hunting or exploring). The immersion - 10/10 (From horses that actually lift their tails to poop to the 1800s styled catalogs at vendors, this game keeps you immersed). The controls - 8/10 (The controls can be a little clunky, but nothing game breaking. I have had no real issues aside from when I was on my horse. Watch your speed and direction, if you hit a large rock/boulder or tree too hard you can hurt yourself and your horse. Note: Horses do not make tight turns while in motion and can have a mind of their own at times, especially when in danger). Final notes: The characters in the world notice you and will remember everything you have done from a wild night out to beating someone down to gunning someone down in the street. When you knock someone unconscious or beat them in a gun fight, do not loot them until you have moved the body to a secure location where nobody can see you. If you are seen, you can be sure the witness(es) will run to the law nearest them to turn you in.

,,, there's a lot of hours to be spent on here. As a return on investment, it's a no-brainer. It's fun and entertaining with so much to do. The graphics are amazing; the graphic details are the same between the PS4 (pro) and the Xbox (X) but the sound on the Xbox is better than the PS4. The character controls are a little clunkly for modern games and the story unfolds pretty slowly (that's intentional) but when the action begins (out of nowhere!) you can quickly die if you're not prepared, which can be frustrating. It's a good time.

What else can I say about this game that no one has? Probably nothing, BUT, I will double-down on what everyone else has said about it. This game is amazing. Probably the best game I have played this year (I am so sorry Spider-man). The only thing I will say is that its a little overwhelming with all of the controls and options. But eventually you will get the control of things and It'll be a lot easier to rule the West.

8 years after the original RDR we finally get a masterpiece of a follow-up. In the 8 year span since the original, the typical open-world game has evolved quite a bit. If you're expecting the Assassin's Creed or Far Cry 3/4 Style gameplay you may be a bit disappointed. RDR2's gameplay is much slower and more deliberate. Fast travel is very limited. But, the world feels much more detailed and immersive. Definitely requires a different mindset than you may be used to.

The long-awaited sequel to Red, Dead Redemption is the most visually stunning game I've ever played. You feel like you're watching a movie, not playing a game (until, you know, you have to shoot at some bad guys). And if violence or hunting animals (the 'skinning' scenes are quite graphic) doesn't appeal, you can play poker or dominoes or just go fishing (and, yes, you can throw the fish back). Rockstar Games has created a vibrant world with just about any kind of earthly terrain or weather conditions you can imagine. Even after playing the game for MANY hours thus far, I can still be surprised...like when an alligator took out a gunman that was trying to kill me in a swamp. Or when I was besieged in the dark (in the same swamp) by some weird voodoo men painted like skeletons. And so on. If you're a fan of westerns or shooter games or, um, hunting and mutilating animals, then Red, Dead Redemption 2 is for you.
Everyone already know how great Red Dead 2 is. This is one of the few games that comes around every so many years that EVERY gamer needs. Doesn't matter what your favorite kind of games are.

As I write this I have spent about a dozen or so hours in this game. The world feels alive and every moment feels like it's part of a movie. Everybody knows Rockstars reputation when it comes to the gaming world, they have made another amazing game and I can't wait to spend several dozen more hours with the game.
Rough controls. Slow movement. Beautiful but not great.

This game takes over an hour and a 1/2 to load and then has to be the most boring game I have ever played. After playing for about 2 hours I sold the game on let go because of course you can't take back a game once you've opened it

RDR@ is a beautiful game that has interesting charcaters and a story that is very close to realistic while still being a game. I believe most people will like this game. I loved Red Dead Redemption 1 as well as all the 3D GTA games, but RDR2 is the appearance of a sandbox game. To be clear, this is my opinion, I do not expect everyone or even anyone to share it. It's actually very linear from my 5 hours of experience. I spent at least 90% of my time talking to other characters and watching cut scenes. You are introduced to so many characters that when you see them in the open world they ask as if you have this history with them that you have no knowledge of. And when you do finally get to actually play the game, you're only allowed to run where they say you can, grab guns when they say you can, and don't walk too far away from a mission, you will fail with no warning. There are more bugs in the game than I've seen in some BETAs. The honor system rewards you for being 'good' and punishes you for being 'bad', but during almost every cut scene the main character is portrayed as a 'bad guy'. Kill a guy who saw you commit a crime that's story related, bad. Kill a guy who saw you kill some random dude punching your friend, no problem. They system is only active when they want it to be, but they don't tell you when that is. They have slowed item selection by making you hold the X button to collect anything or to hold the Y button to inspect. Why pressing these buttons when prompted is not good enough, I do not know? To summarize, it's like watching a movie that you occasionally get to interact with button presses. The only true open world part of it is when you're outside of a mission wandering around. But Rockstar used to be the fun game that let you approach missions any way you want, but not in RDR2. Things are set up in ways that make take me out of the game play and that stinks. Again, these are just my opinion and I know everyone else is loving it. I hope they keep loving it, but it just wasn't for me.

Game mechanics are clunky, and annoying. Most of the time you die is the character standing to close to an actionable object during a fight. You spend more of your time traveling between missions, than actually making progress. The rest of the time your trying to figure out where you got spawned or how your horse got where it ended up. Might be better by the time it comes out on PC, but all I can say is save often and plan on redoing things over and over to get it to work.
I cant give full starts just because multiplayer isnt out yet. but so far this game is fantastic. only other contender for game of the year is god of war on ps4. a must own for any serious gamer

Only one star because no society should allow this sort of game to come to market. It is fun, it is gorgeous, it is really bad for the psyche. I have already met others who play the game and have said, 'It is so life-like that I sometimes forget I'm playing a game.' That does not sound good. Rockstar worked hard on it, they did a great job on it, it is entertaining...nevertheless, this is an issue of society, philosophy, and wisdom. Do you want your children and future adults to revel in cruelty, criminality, and violence? This game is great after a day of retail work, but you should have to be...like...30 years old or above to play. The graphics and physics are astounding, I'm playing in 4k, and it's clearer than PC games!

Great game, however it is not for casual play. You can easily sink in multiple hours and feel like there is so much more to do in one sitting. Picking up items have its own action so it can get tiring to sit through it every time you pick something up. The environment is fantastic and the interaction is phenomenal. It is a great game but it is not a pick up and play. If you play for short chunks of time it may feel like you dont get anything done.

I bought this for my boyfriend. He really seems to enjoy it. I got the one with the bonus content. Which comes out to be somewhat of bargin when you compare buying the content separately (some isnt available to be purchased separately)
Slow to start slow to progress. Different than the first. Maybe not for the better either. Looks great on my xbox one x, but looks aren't everything.
slow game in the beginning it does get better best looking game on console

I didnt actually get to play this game, because my xbox hard drive wasnt big enough for the storage space required by the game. I thought this would be fine because I have an xbox 360 flash drive, but that didnt work because it has to be a hard drive. Bummer. Then Best Buy wouldnt even refund or exchange it at the price I bought it, so I had to trade it back in for basically nothing. Bigger bummer.

I'm a mature gamer chick and I love this RPG. It's so cool that characters from the first two games make appearances again here. The detail and the story line are interesting and exciting to play. I love making armor and weapons for my character and my followers as well. It takes over a hundred hours to just play the main story line. If you do all the side quests it can take twice as long. It's so much fun to play again as different races, different skill sets and different love interests to see how that changes the story.
No words can justify how awesome this game is. Even if you have played the 2 previous games, you will still be blown away by how real everything is
Another great RPG in the Dragon Age world. Lots of action.
It was a great and easy to get into and hooked on. It had an enjoyable storyline
This game has great graphics and is addicting. I enjoy all of the Dragon Age games.
It took a minute to get used to the game play, but I'm about 90 hours into it and it's worth the money. The tactics assignments are detailed, but worth the time.
Huge difference between this and the xbox one version if your able too. get it on pc or one of the newer consoles.

I have only started the game but I can already tell that it is better than the second game. It remains to be seen if it's better than the first but I can see the potential for it to be. Great graphics, great game play.

It would freeze on the loading screen when I would try to play the game. Played 4 hours the first night and when I loaded it to play the next night it would freeze and game wouldn't load the next 20 times I tried it.
A fun game for a good price, this isn't a game that's big on plot, but is a lot of mindless fun.

This game is most definitely a throwback! It harkens back to the days when F1 2010 was the new thing on the video game market in a good way! It brings post session interviews back into the equation and the way you answer each and every question affects your relationship with your team in a truly dynamic way. For example, if, in your post qualifying interview, you mention that the chassis handled well, then the chassis dept of your team will be happy and thus, chassis upgrades will cost fewer resource points to acquire. If you downplay the chassis, then the chassis department's morale will decline, and you will be forced to spend more resource points on chassis upgrades. This goes for every aspect and department of your car's R&D. Overall, this game is simply the most well thought out and developed game in almost a decade and i am very much looking forward to digging even deeper into it's various modes and challenges. If you are an F1 fan, then F1 2018 is a must to add to your collection!!!

First of all the product itself. The launch edition has a really cool metal slipcase probably the only one of it's kind. We have had metal steelbooks sure but not a metal slipcase. Really cool. There is also a free japanese voice pack in the E-Shop you can download. Story - Pretty generic honestly, like PS2 Era JRPG storytelling. Have an evil kingdom who is doing evil stuff against the good kingdom... Insert main character here.... He goes on an adventure to save the kingdom from evil kingdom and bam there is your story. The lore is pretty intresting but the story itself just holds it back. It never gets into that level of final fantasy or tales games story telling. Gameplay - Plays out like a tales game, you can turn into a dragon! Which is awsome. There is like a FF7 materia system going on there for your wepons. No fast travel unfourtuntly, but not that bad as the maps themselfs are easy to run across. There is a random dungeon you can do for grinding. There are side quests but all those are is the basic 'Kill this' or 'Collect this' and thats it, nothing more meaningful than that. I guess the best part of the game is that you can date all the girls and you won't get punished for it. For those who are confused by original mode and refrain mode... Basically original mode is just the original story while in refrian mode you get 2 playable characters that are like villian characters.... Thats about it. So I just went with refrian mode to date the evil chick. Sound - Pretty good since one of the focuses of the game is about music, since all your party members items are actually instruments. So at least for sound is 5 out of 5 Graphics - It's like in between PS2-PS3 era anime style graphics. Not that bad seeing as it was a PS3 port from japan only. Conclusion - It's worth getting if only go play once, it's only like 49.99 anyways not even full priced. For a PS3 port it's pretty decent, at least until we get octopath traveler soon and that tales remaster for the switch.

Its a fun game and its got your fan service(Bonus) However, I cant help but feel the developers skimped on optimizing it for tv since its a switch game. You do get a interesting story about dragons and a fun combat mechanic. Bosses are ridiculously brutal(I spent two hours and still haven't beaten the first main boss). The game definitely feels laggy especially in bigger fights, the fps completely tanks, in portable mode, not so much. its a shame because I enjoy playing on my tv more than handheld. still a great game though------ 3.5 stars for me.
If you like JRPGs, this is a must have game to add to your collection! Great character designs, well made world, and pretty good story.
definitely a hidden gem on the switch. i'm surprised it was never marketed very well. this has a lot of the dlc compared to the other platforms.
GREAT GAME TO ADD TO MY NINTENDO SWITCH COLLECTION
Super nice game,its graphics are very well made,uts a adventure game,and gameplay is easy,its alot of fun,love it so much, not borning at all.
Thea Tory is amazing and backed with an amazing story

The game is a visual novel. I had never played the genre previously. I will say the cutscenes looks amazing and the voice acting is good. I felt the story slow to get going and nonsensical. If you like visual novels you might like this. I however, did not care for it.

I was expecting more gameplay than reading. Branching dialogue options or something to maintain engagement. It's not bad for what it is as long as you don't expect anything more than a visual novel that apparently carries scenes over directly from the anime. So, visual novel fans and fans of the anime would probably appreciate this more. I would recommend it to a friend if they met that criteria.

The original steins;gate is an amazing visual novel. Elite adds anime scenes. I think it's a great way to meet in the middle for people who don't like standard CGs. However, the original CG is very iconic and sadly I don't think the art style of the anime is as good. If you haven't played Steins;Gate I would probably go for the original first. However, being as this is the only version on switch I would still heavily recommend it.
I am a few hours in so far. this is my first visual novel and I do not know how I feel about it. The animated cut scenes are beautiful but this game takes to long to start.

I was worried because I had not played the first game, which was fine because it had no campaign! And coming from the first game which didn't have one, it proved to be an amazing experience. Multiplayer is top notch high velocity action. The studio who made this, Respawn was made from the founders of Modern Warfafe.

I hardly, if ever, write reviews but I felt that Titanfall 2 is well deserving of recognition. As many reviews have pointed out across the internet, Titanfall 2 is a very well crafted shooter that excels in many areas. The campaign is absolutely fun and exciting to play through and the story keeps you engaged. The multiplayer is balanced with customization options. The guns are well designed and they are all fun to use and swap through depending on your class. The servers are very stable and matchmaking is fairly quick and simple. I haven't had any issues connecting to servers nor had any issues getting kicked off due to connectivity issues. Overall, I have and continue to highly recommend the game to anyone. Whether you're just looking to get into shooters, a shooter veteran, or looking for something different to play, Titanfall 2 is the game you should consider picking up!

This is one of the best, most well rounded games I've played since Witcher 3. The campaign is the first FPS campaign I've played in many years that was actually interesting and fun, and that I didn't just get bored with after a few hours and abandon it. On top of that, the multiplayer, while having some changes from the first game, feels more well rounded and complete than the first game. There is also no need to play the first game to understand what is going on in Titanfall 2. I actually was surprised how much I loved this game, to the point I bought it a second time for a friend (at full price) who had bought Battlefield 1 instead. Titanfall 2 has replaced Overwatch for me, and is easily one of the best games of the year. Don't overlook it just because it's not as established as Battlefield or CoD and was relased by EA at a terrible time (right between those two games).
This game has what the first game lacked: a solid campaign.
The campaign is short but satisfying and the multiplayer feels even faster than in the original game. Multiplayer loadouts have much more variety and the game feels much more fleshed out overall.

Game is classic tetris plus new features in gameplay, what's not to like there? However the music in the game is overrated and the use of a usb drive to replace the music of your own preference is highly suggested and mandatory. You can add Dark Knight Rises soundtrack to the fire background stage to great effect. Or Man of Steel soundtrack to the stage with the illuminated blue sea animals. It goes well together. There are plenty of other special effects added to the simple 2d graphics. However, just listening to some of the music in the game is pure torture. The reviewers rating the music so high are obviously high themselves. Lumines also had many examples of the same type of horrendous music. It seems like the only decent music in these Mizuguchi puzzle games were the Genki Rockets songs because they tended to be catchy rather than annoying. Let's talk about the stupid song that everyone raved about when this game came about. 'Weere all 2-gethah'.....that is such a lame song there should be a warning label on the package. Then after that comes a level with this rap song and monochrome background that sounds like it was ripped off from WWE superstar R-Truth, except it is so bad that R-Truth sounds 100 times better. 'What's Up - Golden Truth remix' would definitely be a better choice for the soundtrack then this trash. What's with the music in these games nowadays anyways? Most of the other music in the game have no lyrics. Some are decent but alot of them aren't.

I played Tetris here and there growing up but not to much. I played this over a free weekend and it is incredible! I had to get the full game. There are so many different modes and challenges and the visuals are awesome! You can play relaxing modes and just chill or really put your skills to the test with some crazy fast Tetris. The PSVR is NOT required and it is still amazing without it, the only difference is it is a bit more immersive in the headset, since it is more 3D. Either way, get it!

This game is came from the maker of games like rez, lumines, and child of eden. They had been making an off-brand tetris for years with lumines, now it's like they just to actually do tetris in that same style. The visuals are wild, but you kind of can't watch them cos' you're trying to play tetris. if you can get someone to watch you to play tetris, this will definitely entertain. there is also some great music on here. by default the controller vibrates to the beat, but i actually had to turn that off after awhile, because some songs were too intense and i thought it would break the controller and some made my hands tickle. I switched the vibration to gameplay only, so it would only vibrate when i cleared some lines. anyway, if you like tetris you will like this game, if you hate tetris, you probably won't like this game. there is no multiplayer btw. this is classic tetris, while also something new at the same time. in journey mode, what the game describes as its 'campaign', each of the levels evolve as you progress through them, trying to hit the goal of clearing 36 lines, while scoring as many extra points as possible. oftentimes in levels, you will reach a point that triggers lightning fast tetris. but, as you will find, the game kind of lets you play a different way when you encounter this... you can drag the piece around the floor and keep rotating it for quite some time. once you experience it, you'll know what i'm talking about, it's bizarre, and brilliant somehow. i'm not sure it was quite like that in any previous iteration of tetris, but i'm mostly familiar with the gameboy version. for fans of that version, there is a 'secret' 1989 mode, while the look of it is pretty great, the sound seems to be purposely a little off, the music and sounds are similar, but altered versions of the originals. when the level progresses to it's final form, i'm not really a fan of their new version of the classic song. anyway, if you like tetris, and are thinking of getting this, you should probably get it. i don't have VR, so i dunno if that's good, but it probably is.

High concept with immersive music and background integration. Truly an advancement in a 30+ year old property. It makes something that is classic and makes it feel brand new without sacrificing the top-notch gameplay.

I played the original Tetris on the first Nintendo, and this one is just as much fun, if not more. The visuals and music are mesmerizing. This game is relaxing, but can be challenging at the same time. You must buy this game!!!!

This is an amazing PSVR experience. It's super approachable and timeless like any Tetris game, but the addition of the spacey effects plus PSVR is mind blowing and all but guaranteed to put you in a transcendent flow state.
The game brings Tetris to another level with beautiful graphics and a wonderful soundtrack.

Tetris has been around for a while, but it never gets old. This version of Tetris is infused with new imagery and sound that might hypnotize you. The reason I bought it is that it can be played with PSVR. It's incredible being in VR and playing the game to everything that's going on around the play area.

Brings back the 80's and 90's feel of Tetris with very low to no latency on the VR Headset, which is the best mode of this game. The unfortunate thing about this game is there is no local co-op so the family has to take turns getting high scores which is kind of not the point of Tetris especially playing multi-player. 30 stages are way more than enough for a single player and getting to the insane levels are impossible on the controller but possible on the VR headset. Watch the #1 player of Tetris play this game and he can get to the master levels only with the VR headset. This game is made for VR - not for the controller.

Tetris is such a classic, and this version totally does it justice. The visuals and music combine for a feeling that I've rarely experienced before. The progression of the story mode does a great job of teaching you how to play, by the final level you are moving insanely fast and in the zone along with the music. I've yet to experience the VR but it is worth it on its own for the regular modes

one of the best games I played in 2018. Well worth the purchase. I've never really been good at Tetris, but my wife loves this game and she was a major Candy Crush player. Do note, you may need to turn down the music and animations as its quite distracting.

I'm in my mid 30s. I have been playing Tetris since I was a wee child and it was on the NES and Gameboy. There have been some good Tetris games since then, and some not so good Tetris games since then. This is probably the best since the ground-breaking original. It's like a rhythm game for people for people who are terrible at rhythm games but great at puzzle games. Not all of the levels are my taste in visuals and/or music, but there is enough variety that everyone should find something they really like.

The game is worth the price. It takes tetris to a new level. The game has multiple modes and unlockable stages. If you played the ds game you will mostly find all those modes plus some other in this game. The HDR isn't out of this world, you can only turn it on or off and there is no adjustment sliders. The default is off and buried in the option menu, which I found odd. You might find the tetris playing field is to small, but you can use the right stick to adjust the size or look around the level. The vr option is a cool add on to the game and it should be played with it, but it still works great without it. The music is perfect and your button presses and beats to the music. It works in perfect harmony. It really does take tetris to the next level. It's a must buy for people that want to play a classic game and great showcase game for people who don't play videogames or vr.

Tetris will always be a great game with a formula that never needs to be changed, but Tetris Effect adds it's own elements that make it stand out from the many versions released in the past few decades. The music combined with the sound effects produced by the tetrominoes and visuals from the 20+ stages further draws players into the immersive and addicting world of Tetris. Along with the classic endless Tetris mode, the game includes a Journey mode for those seeking a sense of completion. This mode takes you through all the stages requiring players to clear a set number of lines at varying speeds, and when you run into trouble or want to set a higher score, players can activate the Zone meter to clear up to 16+ lines simultaneously. Tetris will be around for a long time and is available on almost any electronic device with a screen, but Tetris Effect emphatically places itself as the best version available now.

Tetris Effect is one of the most incredible games I have ever played. The visual effects along with the incredible sound are euphoric and mesmerizing. The gameplay is what you know and love, but with some impressive twists in certain modes that are all positive.
Total re-imagination of what a Tetris game is. Beautiful music and imagery combine for an experience more akin to a concert or rave but yet still peaceful, paradoxically.
This was a much better game than I expected. The different levels and ability to hold blocks is great but it's the music that steals the show.

Tetris is a solid game and the stuff they've added to this verison of it are at least a pretty distraction and at most an experience when you reach that zone. Speaking of the zone the zone mechanic is interesting in itself it lets you take off some pressure and just clear lines. Whether it is worth the 40 dollars to you is a different matter. This will be a great cooldown game for me and you can just put it in the effects modes and most people will enjoy the light show. Have yet to give it a try in VR but I think that would be very cool in short bursts.
Tetris Effect is the definitive version of Tetris. The use of dynamic music is brilliant and truly awe-inspiring. A must play game on the PS4.

This is Tetris with an incredible soundtrack and visuals, and some extra modes thrown in. I personally LOVE Tetris so this was a no-brainer. Plus I have PSVR which this is compatible with. Play it in VR and use headphones - it makes it a great experience.

Tetris Effect is a visual and auditory treat that bombards your senses with exploding colors and punchy electronic songs, but its real accomplishment is combining this with the nature of Tetris. Retaining the precise gameplay while also marrying it effectively with the beat of a drum. Tretris Effect is meditative, exciting and incredibly difficult to put away.
If you want your Tetris with a side of beautiful distractions, have I got the Tetris for you!
The music and visuals to this game is hypnotic. This is def a kewl game only drawback is no multiplayer.

Tetris Effect really is a cool spin on the tetris formula and the VR support is what makes it the best. The addition of music and changes to the stages stand out as one of the most prominent features, giving a sense of 'zone' to your gameplay. It is really a cool game and I recommend anyone with a VR headset check it out!

I have never bought a tetris game, as it's always been, 'Just tetris'. Man, this games visuals and music will blow you away, specifically if you have VR. There's dozens of different modes to play, with online rankings for each too. Must-buy for any puzzle game or PSVR fan

If you've never played Tetris before, stop reading this and go buy the game. If you have, you should also buy the game, but I see how you might need to be convinced. This version of Tetris feels fresh. It looks beautiful and the music is so perfect for the action. You're gonna wanna buy the soundtrack. VR mode is nuts too. It's a challenge, but you will not feel cheated when you lose. All my fellow Tetris Effect owners, I wish you luck as you chase the elusive Decahexatris!

My mom didn't think Tetris could be this beautiful. Heck, I never thought a Tetris game could be this beautiful. Have not played a Tetris game for over 15 years and this is really the best way to revisit this classic. Can't wait to try it on PSVR because I heard it looks even more amazing. This thing even pulled me away from RDR2 for hours! Friends asked me why am i playing tetris instead of RDR2 and I was like 'dude i don't know this thing is dope!'

Bought this and I am completely satisfied with it. The game has a ton of modes and features amazing music and visuals. Those blend with the gameplay perfectly to create an experience that few other games can provide. You can play it without PlayStation VR but it is even more amazing when you do play it in VR.

Tetris is a game anyone can play and this version makes it easier and more exciting than ever. More than 20 stages with memorizing backgrounds and fantastic music. One of the best editions of Tetris ever.
Tetris makes you smarter. So buy today to become smarter tomorrow. Simple math. TWO THUMBS WAAAAAAAY UP!!!!!!!

Loved everything about this game! From the pulsating music you control to the particle effects that punishes your eyes for completing a tetris. No motion sickness at all after 2hrs but eye fatigue kicked in and I had to tap out. Hint: A Tetris will start the music, another will push the song forward.

Bought this on a whim cause tetris has always been one of my favorite games that you don't have to take seriously cause it's easy lol and tetris effect does not disappoint there are multiple modes to play the visuals are sick while the music makes it just perfect so if you're a old school gamer like me it's a must get!

I am 42 years old and I absolutely love this new TETRIS game! With the VR headsets this game is not only enjoyable but relaxing as well. The graphics are unbelievable you cant help but to wonder off and look at the scenery then play the game LOL. But for some reason when my nephew has his friend over some of them cannot play it. They find it difficult and hard I cannot match to make a line. I dont understand its not that hard. These are 14-year-old kids. Well this 42-year-old loves and would highly recommend this game back get ready for a head spin.

This might be my favorite version of Tetris, and I'm old enough that I bought the original Tetris on Nintendo and Game Boy. The visuals are spectacular, with bright colors, neon flourishes, and lush ambient patterns. The music is just as good, and reacts with the visuals to create an overall experience that makes this so much more than just Tetris. Add in the time-tested gameplay of Tetris itself, online leaderboards, multiple game modes, and you have a truly one of a kind experience. Can't recommend this game enough. Wish I could give it six stars.

I was never really into Tetris but after playing this great game I realized I was missing out in a way. This game makes Tetris very much enjoyable . The soundtrack is really good and the visuals are awesome. I would highly recommend this game to anyone.

I've only played this in VR but that version is trippy and amazing in the best way. Insane particle effects combined with unique visuals and great music add a new dimension--literally!--to classic Tetris gameplay. Love it.

Always loved Tetris and over the years many developers have put a new spin on the classic like Tetris Sphere for the N64. That game was great but this is better, the music and game play are fast and fun even without the VR headset. Definitely worth picking up!
Kinda strange but fascinating that Im enjoying this game especially on the PSVR. Great soundtrack also. Highly Recommended!
This game is great in VR or regular mode. Visuals are nice and music is good too. Great buildups to level completion
Its Tetris with a surprising twist on the old video game. You will love the music and visuals in the background as you play. Amazing experience
It's just such a great experience. Once you get a rhythm going and the music kicks in its just such a blast. Just wished it had multi-player
Cool game to play , love the graphics and music. Always love Tetris but love it even more that its now in VR. Highly recommend to all my friends and family.

I'm not very good at Tetris, but this is a great game with a great soundtrack. If you have a PSVR headset, you must try this game and then go buy REZ Infinite if you haven't already. Also go listen to the song from the reveal trailer.
The game is made by the same developer as Lumines. I love it this is the best version of Tetris available. I like the added music, background and effects. The game is challenging but still awesome.
If you like Tetris and you like visually stunning effects, as well as sounds, this game will NOT disappoint you. I wish I could express what it is really like, but it might get removed. Lol

Whether or not you play this update on a classic puzzle game in VR, you are guaranteed a good time. The music, the visuals, and the vast selection of game modes more than makes up for what some might seem as a steep cost of entry. Buy it, play it, and have no regrets!
Takes our old familiar game and pumps new energy into it! Great graphics and ambient/dance tracks (composed for game), plus other new features make it fun to play again.

What a journey and rush. Pure euphoria. If you like Tetris at any level a must own. Got misty eyed by time I completed the games journey mode while playing in vr. I have never felt this way while playing a game. dazzles the senses with great visuals and music.
Tetris Effect is an incredibly immersive experience (especially in VR). Wonderful puzzle gameplay synced perfectly to an outstanding soundtrack. Mesmerizing!

The old school Tetris in a far out environment and visuals that add to the game. Combined with the music track and being immersed in VR and this is one that will get you hooked for hours. Fun for everyone!
Tetris effect successfully mixes music/rhythm games with the classic Tetris puzzle game and the results are mind blowing.

The best version of Tetris I have ever played! All of the new game modes are a blast, the weekend event is great, I dont even have VR or it would be even better. Game is essentially a cross between Lumines and Tetris and is an absolute audial and visual delight!

I never thought a Tetris game could make me emotional, but the campaign on this got to me. Somehow the challenging gameplay, combined with the marathon finale, the magnificent music, and surrounding vr experience really got to me. Great game!
The inclusion of music and VR makes this version of Tetris stand out among the rest. It is very easy to get lost in the gameplay.

This is an awesome version of the classic Tetris puzzle game with beautiful graphics and wonderful background music. This game is playable on a traditional TV but is also playable on the Playstation VR. I play this in VR and it is 'mind-blowing'! An awesome way to experience Tetris. The scenery in VR is awesome and just transports you to wonderful locations as you play. There are plenty of modes including some 'easier' modes if you just want a lower stress level experience and the easy modes are a great way to relax (especially in VR). Highly recommended!
This game is really good! Its super trippy with amazing visuals and sounds, including some really standout music. Definitely would recommend!
Love this game my kids and I enjoy playing. Fun music and great graphics. Great new twist on a game classic!
So it seems like just Tetris at first but you MUST play this in VR once you have the helmet on and the music starts going it's easy to lose your self in a trance while playing Tetris haha
This isn't a game. It's a paradigm shifting quagmire of experience.

If you love Tetris and you have a PSVR, you NEED to pick up this game. There are a wide variety of modes to keep you busy, and the graphics of the backgrounds/skins are fantastic. The immersive backgrounds and music make it one of the most peaceful games I've ever played.
I do not have VR so I can't comment on that mode but the normal gameplay is fun. The story is short but the custom modes are a lot of fun. Very relaxing
We've all played Tetris but never like this. Amazing graphics but more amazing music and just mind blowing in VR.

If you love Gears of War, then this is a must buy. The gameplay, graphics, multiplayer and campaign are all the best yet of the series. That being said, the ultimate edition IS NOT worth the price of admission. I admit, I failed to do my homework on what the season pass (included with this edition, hence the price increase) included before purchasing, so that's on me. All of my past experiences with season passes meant that you were buying all the game DLC that will be coming out in the game, generally in the form on MP maps/etc. That IS NOT the case with this game. All of the MP maps will be free to all players, and will be released in a rotation (from what I understand). So, you must be wondering what the season pass includes? You get to have all of the DLC maps available at all times (even after they are out of rotation) for private matches and horde mode. Personally, this doesn't match my needs/expectations of what such a high priced (or any, for that matter) season pass should include. I don't play private MP matches, and could care less about Horde mode. Now, that's not the only difference in the ultimate edition...you also get a steel case instead of plastic one that the game comes in, as well as a couple in game packs for weapon skin/character/XP bonus card...that's a whole other mess in and of itself...it doesn't bother/affect the overall game for me, so it's not a negative as far as the core game is concerned. GoW4 get's a full five stars from me; however, the ultimate edition is a complete waste of money (IMO). I say pick up the standard edition and enjoy an amazing game.
Cant wait for the ult edition. Gonna be great. Beta was a lot of fun. HDR capable game as well

Another classic Gears game. Graphically top notch playing on the S. Game with the season pass, along with the copper mug & coaster was a great deal. Also instead of receiving 4 days early, Best Buy delivered 6 days early. Beat it once, now to move to a higher difficulty. What a blast.

Let me start by saying, in order to see this game's full potential you need a 4k TV. I played this on my 40 inch samsung 1080p TV and on my 65 inch samsung curved TV and there is a huge difference. It does look great on both display options but on a 4k TV you will this game shine.Graphics 10 out 10 with great framerates and smooth gun play. Gameplay 10 out of 10. It also comes with codes for gears of war 1-3 including judgement. Overall great deal for $79,99 with gamers unlocked here at bestbuy. Definitely worth picking up with high replay value.

But i would all of a sudden get no sound but my swords swinging, no boxes breaking, no talking, nothing... worked out fine when restared, has happened twice.... so might have a fix down the road if a know bug.... other wise great game, pick it up youll love it looking forward to whats next in the Amalur World...

The difficulty level of Normal seemed a little soft to me, but I have maxxed out smithing and sagecrafting so my armor and weps are much better that what the shops stock. Might try using all store-bought stuff next playthrough and see how that plays.

I WAS SKEPTICAL ABOUT THIS GAME BUT FOR 5$ I FIGURED WHY THE HEGS NOT! TO MY SUPRISE I LOVE IT! THE GRAPHICS WERE A LITTLE CHEESY/CARTOONISH FOR MY TASTE BUT THEN AGAIN IVE BEEN PLAYING SKYRIM FOR 5 MONTHS STRAIGHT. IT REALLY IS A GREAT GAME AND THE COMBAT IS CHALLENGING ON HARD MODE. LOVE THE WEAPONS AND LOOTING, AND ALSO LEVELING UP IS FUN. IF YOURE ON THE FENCE ABOUT THIS GAME, JUST BUY IT. IT HAS ELEMENTS OF SKYRIM, FABLE, AND ZELDA ALL MELDED INTO ONE GAME.

For the first game that 38 Studioes made, I have to say they did a great job at it. The action style combat + destiny system were excellent and key points that other RPG's can take a lesson from. With any games first run there will always be things to work on to improve such as being able to turn off the spacious sub-titles. Overall it is an Awesome game. Looking forward to the next one.

Combat is very diverse. Unbelievably GREAT! But the role playing choices are disappointing as they make no difference in the outcome of that choice. The story is pretty good but your character choices don't really affect the outcome. Be it whether you choose one more controversial answer over the other the outcomes are the same, so if they would have married the excellent combat with the story development of each quest outcome that would have improved the game to Excellent! There is no follow through of the quest characterization. It is almost the exact opposite of Skyrim, where the combat is fabulous and much more colorful, but the choices I make in Skyrim really matter in the overall plot development. So if Amalur would have made the quest plot choices matter more then the whole game would be 5 out of 5!
