I haven't gotten far in game due to just getting bored. Looks great, runs great, some cool lil features like being able to look through holes in wood walls. But all in all not much fun. But for a achievement hunter this game seems like you will get upset with some of the achievements but that's the whole point. This isnt much help. Sorry ha
Great game with lots of challenge.It gives you choices on how you play to fit your style of play. It is a unique challenge and with a great story.

Fun game with a lot of great graphics. The game almost seems like an open world type of game but it has a path to fallow every time when you are in missions. It is a lot of fun hiding in the shadows and stealing stuff. Must have game for the XBOX One console.
I love this game it keeps you entertain for a very long time.
Over all it's a good looking game with smooth control. I like it a lot.

If you are a fan of Assassin's Creed games you will like this game. You have an open world to do whatever it is your heart desires and to play the style of game you like to play. You can be stealthy throughout the whole game without killing any enemies or you can just slaughter them all. Very fun and has a lot of extras to find that can be very challenging.

This is a great adult game for those sick of just jumping into combat with 5,000 other people on line. The characters feel true to the past games in the series and it is easy to slip back into the character if you've played an earlier console version of the Thief series.
This game keeps you immersed and is full of stuff to do. great game.
This was by far one of my favorite games I've ever played!! I would buy it again in a heartbeat. I highly suggest getting this, it would be a best addition to your collection!

I traded this game in the very next day and got Plants vs Zombies. The dialogue in this game is so lame. Also, the game play is way too slow/boring, glitchy, and the storyline is super cheesy. You have limited control over your character and the schematics of the game are all unbalanced (shoot an arrow into a guards head and he just shakes it off). I usually don't leave feedback, but this game is exceptionally bad. Please don't buy it, lol.
This could have been a great game but was lacking story, being a thief was awesome but the layout of the map was limited and the fighting mechanic was basic. they could of done better.

Overall Thief is a fun game to play. The AI is tough, but not impossible on the hardest difficulty and the stealth system is fun to work with. The story-line and some of the game-play mechanics / glitches keep it from being a 5/5 but this game is still pretty fun to play.
Pretty good game very similar to the original game unique story and dark tones.great game
Buggy, no gamma selection (so it's really dark), looks like a Xbox 360 game. Small maps with load times in between. Generally a pain just to get from point A to Point B.
Love this game, both my son and I play & compete with each other.
The is great my kids are even addicted, so I guess I need to buy them an XBox One
Thief is a good adventure game. My only problem with it is it's a slow start in my opinion. It is a little bit of a mixup between Assassin's Creed Black Flag and Dishonored.
Doesn't break any new ground and is a bit linear, but looks good (first xBox One game), and is every bit as fun as the other Thief games.

So the trailers looked nice. That's where the good things stop. I tried this game out on impulse, and regret doing so. This is not a 60 dollar game. It's not a 30 dollar game. It should have come out 5 or 6 years ago on the xbox 360 and ps3. The graphics are terrible, the gameplay is monotonous and repetitive. I can't bring myself to play it anymore.

There is a plague about the world. It's a dark setting in a sparsly populated city. Curfew is in effect. You'll progress at a snails pace but this is a game about stealth! You aren't going to buy this title for instant gratification. Finding the hidden treasures is the name of the game. Hidden is the keyword here. Prepare for hours of study in the ancient shadow arts. Mr. Thief is a master of his art. He transverses the environment with smoothness and fluidity. You have skills that can be upgraded such as stealth, combat, and efficiency. There are benefits to the skills but loot is scarce. You'll have to manage your resources carefully. Buying arrows and tools may be more important. Careful planning will get you through your endeavors. Just keep focussed with focus. The controls are great. Everything works. You'll slide through the environment like biscuits through molasses. The world is detailed with several hidden areas. There is a story being told every time you complete a chapter. The world is dynamic with new areas opening as you complete events. The story transitions in real time. Events take place in the world and you experience them. There are tools and weapons. You have your bow and an assortment of arrows ranging from offensive to defensive and some unique environmental modifying catalysts. The blackjack is your other weapon for infighting. You'll be able to dodge most attacks but everything about the combat is upgradable. Replay value depends on your preferences. People still replay linear games. Look up speed runs. If you turn off all the assists and can still finish the game on the hardest difficulty finding all the loot in less than a few hours, then you've probably conquered this title. No game is perfect. Because a perfect game is boring. Technology-wise, I think everyone believes this game should be maintaining a solid 60 frames per second. Graphics and technology in general won't make a great game. BlueRay movies show at about 24 frames per second. Too fast and you get the live TV effect. Residents are robotic with 3 lines of scripted communication. It repeats redundantly. Nothing new here, developers don't spend time designing clones that carry on conversation. The attention to detail is notable but it leaves you wishing you could be able to interact with more of the environment. Throwing buckets and candles at guards instead of being limited to bottles. Thievery is the name of this game. You get instant money for larceny but it would have been better to have had to haggle with the Fence. Sale a couple of valued items and receive a better price. The system works irregardless (it's a word). Play the game but don't believe the reviews until you've experienced it for yourself. I don't personally care for popular reviewers on video sites because they never truly play a game. They'll tell you 7 to 10 hours but I've already sank approximately 30 hours into this game. So I leave you with a question for you yourself to answer. How can they know a game after only 7 hours?

Hi I am writing this review for the primarily reason of the bonus points I will get from it. But i must say after playing the game I was surprised how good the story was. But for the price I think its better played as a rental or buy it used.
Must buy. Great game, story, and graphics. Keeps you engaged.

The process to pre-order included finding the game on the internet, processing the order, waiting for the order on time, traveling to the proper store, picking up the game, and on with my business. The pre-order program seemed superb from my experience.
This game is no Assassin's Creed but it isn't bad. It is pretty fun (but just started it). We were running out of games to play for the Xbox One so it is nice to have a fresh new game.
Came in the mail yesterday and i was a bit skeptical of how good it wood be but the graphics were good the story line is decent and who doesnt like free running in a game.
i returned his game to get fifa 14 and that was for the best.
Awesome graphics and gameplay. Good story line and detail.
Graphics, art, dialogue, cut sceens, all garbage on xbox 360 or belows level. kept game one day. Sold!!! Save yourself money!

I took it back as soon as I received it. I wasn't able to see it had topless and strong content until after I received it.. games are being ruined by these types of images... too bad I would have liked to try it. Oh well now for titanfall

Minimal action controlled by the player. You control an excellent storyline based on your time sensitive choices. I love Telltale games. One downside is only episodes 1&2 were available at launch. Still waiting for episodes 3-5 to be released. Seems silly to launch a game and keep players waiting to play the entire game.
You must start at the beginning to appreciate & see for yourself how telltale changed the game of story telling. Get the tissues out, you will need them.

I've been playing this game series since the first season came out. I really recommend this game to anyone. It's not based on the TV series. It has different characters who face survival and personal problems throughout the whole game. There are emetional and sad decisions you have to make for the group so keep that in mind. This game is not a 1st person shooter or any of that stuff. It's just a story interaction game which basically you make the decisions of what to say or do of the main character. I had fun playing these game, so I strongly recommend this.

I was super excited about this game as I am a huge Walking Dead Fan. I cannot get episode 3to load. System error stating please connect to Playstatuon Network. I do a system check and I am connected...
Pretty fun game. Was kind of disappointed at how little actual game play there was.

Overall, the story is what you'd expect from tell tale games. Although it didn't have as many difficult choices as previous seasons, it was great to continue Clementines story. However, the game crashed three times during episode 5 alongside numerous glitches throughout the entire game.
This game really has solid story with Clementine as a crutch, rather than the main character which I love! I hope to see the next installment!

Captures the feel Iga's older Castlevania platforming adventures with a great retro soundtrack. One casual playthrough isn't too long, but additional difficulties up the challenge and replay value. Plus, there are many secrets in the walls! Four characters to play and switch between, each with their own ability, allow you to mix (and combine) powers. It's a premium price to pay for this physical release of a $10 download, but if you are a fan and backer of the new Bloodstained game (or Castlevania fan), it is a must have for the collection. Besides the Nintendo Switch cartridge, you get a case and little character manual with it. I wish the manual would have included control instructions, like game manuals back in the day, but it is really just a character introduction manual with artwork. Fairly light manual, at with only five spreads. This is created with the diehard fan in mind, so, being a diehard fan, my review is skewed to 5. But then, if you aren't a fan, why would you be reading all of this? I included images for clarity on what is included. A great intro to the new Bloodstained series!
Bought this for my sons birthday after getting the switch on the advice of a Best Buy employee. He has enjoyed playing the game.
great game...lots of fun but until they patch it, the load times are a pain and its glitchy
This game brings memories of old castlevania games. Its good but I think the price should be $20 rather than $30. Also I think they only did a limited run release on this.

This game is the prequel of Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night, and is guaranteed to hit that retro game play feeling you need in your life. This game is almost a remake of the Castlevania 3: Dracula's Curse from the old NES. The 8 bit look, the music and the story will give the nostalgia we just don't really get that much. Its a fun game, and if you are a Castlevania fan, its a must get!
Great game just like the old school games. Iga did a great job cant wait to place ritual of the night
This is a great game. It feels like the old NES Castlevania games.
very great 2D old school action game, game play is good, music is good.

What an amazing & nostalgic experience! Bloodstained: Curse of the Moon takes you back in time to the NES days, to the days of Castlevania 1 & 3. A platformer that plays very much like Castlevania, with a few new more modern twists. This game is basically a reimagining of Castlevania 3: Dracula's Curse... where you can play up to 4 characters. A Swordsman, an Alchemist/Mage, Long range & high jumping woman with a whip & a Vampire/Dark Magic user type of character with the ability to fly long stretches... all characters with different attack patterns, sub weapons, strengths & weaknesses. Game takes you through 8 levels, with diverting paths filled with peril or just plain shortcuts. Each playthru can feel like a fresh experience! Game features multiple endings, 3 modes & a Boss Rush mode that is unlockable. Game is all about experimenting and pattern recognition like the old NES days... and the game provides quite the challenge for those that decide to tackle the Veteran mode difficulty playstyle and for those that want to have an easier time, the game provides with a 'Casual' mode difficulty. Getting a physical copy of this game with as much replayability it had, was the definitely worth the extra $20 in its price tag, quite the collector's item from Limited Run Games' partnership with Best Buy. 5/5 game with countless of hours to sink in for all the different playthroughs and endings to acquire & see.
This is a great throwback game inspired by Castlevania III on the Nintendo NES. I highly recommend it to any and all Castlevania fans!
looking more forward to the ritual of the night game.
I loved the original Wolfenstein and was very happy with this game. If you liked the original you will enjoy this!
This game filled in the blanks that were left by the original game.
If you like the new order you will like this too. this game also has 1000 gamerscore at a $20 price point. Very fun game.
that game take while to finish it, that great.. also the picture is amazing ...
This game is a lot of fun if you like a good Puzzle Fighter! The characters are charming. You can customize the block colors and menus. There are also built in achievements.
I loved playing puzzle fighter on the original PlayStation back in the day and when I seen this game was an amazing clone of that game I just had to buy a copy

It looks, sounds, and plays nearly identically to Capcom's masterclass puzzler Super Puzzle Fighter 2 Turbo. But since this isn't Capcom, it has none of the Capcom characters charm or presentation. Some of the matches feel over difficult. But the fact that we can have something like on the Switch is a major cause for celebration. As with Puzzle Fighter, multiplayer is where the game shines the most.
This is a very fun puzzle fighting game, similar to the old Super Puzzle Fighter Turbo games. Better graphics and sound but similar gameplay. A nice change from my usual game genre choices.
If you like puzzle games, this one is for you, especially with all the different nicalis characters.
Great puzzler with lots of recognizable characters for Nicalis fans.
Its a fun game thats similar to Super Puzzle Fighter.
We like puzzle games now and again, so hoping he'll like this; reminds me of Puzzle Fighter.

On the same scale as Rachet and Clank comes Agents of Mayhem, filled with stereotypical cartoonish characters that carry a bevy of weapons and talents against a variety of enemies all within the local of a futuristic Seoul South Korea. The 3 D map of the city is full of detail and plenty of side games make this herculean effort worth of role-playing gamer. You can chose any level of difficult with more challenging roles paying the highest reward. A fun game but not for anyone younger than 16 as there is foul language used. Recommended for gamer who love this kind of play.

There are very few companies that get day one buys from me - Bethesda and Volition are two of them. So I picked this up day one at full price. It's a great concept and you'll get sucked in - hold out until you start opening up additional character slots because it can feel like a slog until then. There's still some bugs to be patched out, and the open world feels a little simplistic compared to the Saints Row games, but I've got around 40 hours into it and I'm still loving it. Not worth full price, but when it goes on sale at 20-30 dollars it's a game everyone should pick up.

It's like Crackdown and Saint's Row had a really funky baby. The gameplay can be repetitive. The lairs have a basic layout that you end up seeing over and over. the objectives just change. But it's not enough to disguise the same basic layout that you end up seeing. I hope they will fix this with some patches later on. The dialog is pretty funny at times, so that's nice. I bought this because I an waiting for Crackdown 3 to finally come out. If you like open world, zany gameplay, this might be for you, but I would wait until a price drop.

You like Grand Theft Auto? Well you'd most likely like this title. It is definitely more silly than GTA, but that's perfect. Sometimes you just need a fun game to relax with and turn your brain off, and with this you got it.
This game is cool it reminds me of crackdown and saints row combined.
Game isn't as fun as saints row. But it's a decent game. Switch characters on the fly in game. Not worth full price. Maybe once it goes down to 29.99

It's hard to summarize this game up in a few words but it is an interesting twist on the Saints Row universe, retconn-ing it to start fresh in a world of supervillains and action crazy heroes. It does feature a certain Saints Row character with a change in personality and story. You get to play as 3 out of 12 characters at any time in the open world Seoul, South Korea. Beautiful setting and great artistic style. The dialogue between characters is funny as expected and each character offers different words (for lack of a better word) but whoever they're talking to says the same thing back usually. It's a great buy for anyone who enjoys Saints Row.

Trying for something new this saints row spin off misses. Starts off with a good idea with the player getting to control many characters that you unlock. But sadly the game play is the same in every mission. Even the dungeons are all mirror images of themselves. No variety. Wait for a sale.
4 star bc u had to buy extras and no player 2 for the ome play.
Gameplay lags. And if they were going for an 'R' rating, then they should have stuck with the adult humor instead of just a curse word here and there.
Very fun game! Nice character selection. Easy to play. Fun for all ages.

For anyone who hasn't played these titles it is a FPS with puzzle elements that you can either blast your way through or sneak through. I always tend to play any game that gives options in a barbaric, kill them all, even the civilians manner. this game, unlike many others makes that extremely challenging. the AI is extremely smart and will go around different object, or shoot through things to hit you. running away is an option, except they tend to surround you and they will follow you across the map. Speaking of the map, it is a little quirky and the quest icons can be a little annoying at first, but you get used to it quickly. Good variety of weapons and the augmentations are always fun. There is a bit of a learning curve if new to this game, but all in all it is fantastic to play and gives you good replayability since you can go through all stealth (including talking your way out of boss fights), blast your way through, or a combination of both. Definitely a game worth investing in.
Game had tons of potential, but was not nearly as good as I expected. They should have spent more time, and not added micro transactions...

I loved the previous game and was told great things about this one. Picked up used copy for amazing sale and the game is teriffic. Only downside is preorder only dlc and microtransactions keep it from being perfect. Sure I got it used but I would be happy to pay for available DLC instead if these nickel and dime tacticts that remove availability from the player on an otherwise good game.
First time trying Deus Ex series....didn't like it. Got boring too fast. Cool idea for a game but didn't execute like I expected. Good for story. Gameplay, not so much

Games like this now a days aren't worth the $60 they charge this game does a fairly good job of keeping you entertained. For example there are multiple endings that are based on what you do or don't do. I played the entire game twice through and had 2 different results. So of those side missions are only activated by roaming around talking or doing particular things. The news reporter at the end of the game will makes remakes based on those choices. Cons are few. One is once you unlock enough parts of your tech the game doesn't challenge you. Even on the harder difficulty the catch is you have to be mindful about which ones you choose. But by 70% of the way through the game if you also completed enough side mission you will almost be unstoppable. My first time completed i was 90% through all the upgrades I could purchase. The game is only really hard if you make it hard if your a stealthy and patience you could beat the game on any difficulty without being killed There are minor unpolished things like when you drag enemies into a corner or throw them so they can't be detected they have no smoothness to it they don't drag or drop like a body should things like that but over all its good being that you choose the outcome and how people talk to you is based on what you already know or you could go into a conversation and not get any clues because you didn't do x,y or z makes it fun

Great game to spend lots of time, cool things things to do, great graphics, smooth play. Good story line the only thing I can say negative is if you die it takes a long time to come back so don't die. That can be frustrating especially if you are at a tough part of the game or just die a lot.

There's a lot to like about Deus Ex. It's slick, the gunplay is good, and there is a reasonably good protagonist. However, some of the objectives are unclear, sometimes you fail for reasons that are not clear, and the story is oddly paced. Good but not up to the lofty standards of the original

This is a new game system on a new tv, with a person who is challenged electronically. So my inability to figure out how to turn the game system on is probably not a good guide. I also did not understand why the game system needed to download. When I had my last system we just popped the cartridge in and loaded it up. I mean remember Pong? It was hours of fun. Then PacMan came along and we'd be busy for hours. Then they every sexy Ms. Pacman came next and ohlala... was that ever racy?!?!!!! Pitfall with the cream color face swinging over the green blobs in what was to be a lake... I loved that. So I miss my old game system and look forward to someone dusting off the new one when it's not in use by the kids stopping by.
its like Just Cause 3 day one launch, xbox one is 900p 30fps and the loading time is longer.

I watched the most recent trailer and the graphics review. Deus Ex have always had a great story line and a pretty fascinating stealth gameplay. I would recommend it to people who like games like Thief and Skyrim. It is a mix of both.
This game is okay but dont go in expecting a masterpiece.
This is great game for your entertainment. Trust me you will be entertained & it has a strong story behind it as well.

There are a lot of similarities between the evil within series and resident evil and that's a good thing. The Evil Within 2 steps it up a bit with a more coherent story compared to the first game. Gameplay is solid monster shooting and surviving. With around 20 hours of content it's a sizable experience that I really enjoyed. Would definitely recommend.

Im a fan of survival horror. While the genre had, for a while, made a shift from inventory management and survival to a surplus of ammo with a focus on action, things are starting to look up with games like Outlast and the latest entry in the Resident Evil franchise. Evil Within 2 manages to create a nice bridge between survival and action by giving players a solid arsenal with just enough ammo to get yourself into trouble. Frame this in a broken world of connected minds, and youve got a satisfying recipe for trippy and grotesque psychological survival horror. The Evil Within 2 is a perfect example of what survival horror should be. The weapons youre provided throughout the campaign help to keep you from feeling entirely powerless, while enticing you to be more courageous than you really should be. Ammo is extremely scarce and you may find yourself using more than you should on standard enemies instead of saving it up for boss fights. This can create a steep spike in the games difficulty, but that really comes down to bad planning. Inventory and resource management are a huge part of what makes this game successful as a survival horror game. You have the option to blast your enemies to oblivion and feel powerful, but that road tends to lead to an abrupt end in your power fantasy as the games challenging boss fights will leave you begging for mercy if unprepared. The Evil Within 2 knows exactly what it is and doesn't try so much to be an emulation of something successful as much as it is an evolution or refinement of what makes the genre so great. Despite the action and RPG elements, the game never makes you feel powerful. You're constantly going into a big fight with just enough in your inventory to make it by (provided you have the skill to survive - I did not. I died over 100 times over the course of my first playthrough on Nightmare). The marriage of concepts from Resident Evil and Silent Hill makes for a near perfect survival horror game that hearkens back to the past of the genre while driving it in new directions that haven't really been seen since Silent Hill 2 and RE4. There's a constant, looming dread of unpreparedness, incentive to avoid conflict instead of just killing everything in front of you. That paired with a story that's as absurd as it is intriguing and emotionally captivating makes for a truly remarkable gaming experience.
Much larger and less linear that the first. The difficulty has been toned down on the lower levels as well. Cheap instadeaths have also been reduced.
I am not sure due to know completing the main story.

I have not played this yet because I have other games ahead of it. I also don't play these types of games in front of my 2 year old. I did enjoy the first one a lot. I love the horror genre. I have been a fan of the upgrade system to weapons and abilities ever since RE4. I gave a 3* because I have not played it yet. As long it is more of the same from the 1st game, I know I will enjoy it. When I play it, I will change the rating.

The gameplay of this title is not like the first one. There are several open world sections and the game is not scary. While the keys and upgrading different characteristics can be fun, I feel that overall the experience is underwhelming. The game is not directed by the legend in gaming who directed the original the evil within and it definitely shows. This title is not scary at all. The tense battles of the original are replaced by very average boss fights. The director on this one spent too much times trying to develop a story that, quite frankly, seems to be 2 separate stories rolled into one game. Overall, I was quite disappointed in this title. While I played the original multiple times over the past 3 years, I beat this one within a week and will be returning it shortly. I would even say that the gaming mechanics take a step back in some areas. The game is still fun, but its nowhere near the caliber of the original.
Feels a lot like earlier Resident Evil games which would be great but something feels missing.

Death Mark is a dark literary exploration title with RPG elements thrown in. The game focuses around a mysterious 'mark' that has been going around Tokyo. The title also has elements of horror thrown about, though you could make the argument that it's more atmospheric if anything. Still if you're looking for a text-heavy narrative-driven story, give Death Mark a try.

Games like these remind me of the days of the Nintendo DS. I never really played visual novel type games until the arrival of the DS. This game is dark and suspenseful that has me wondering whats gonna happen next. Glad this made it over to the US. Worth checking out.
Good search and survival game, not as good as outlast
You might wonder how a VN can succeed as a horror game, but Death Mark hits the mark with its atmosphere, visual style, slow pace, and a story that is truly chilling at times.
I enjoyed this game, but I am not into visual novels. Good game for people who want interactive Horror Movies.
This game really doe's nothing for me. It Just tells you a story so far. Maybe not playing it right.

Haven't finished but it's been pretty good so far. Feels like Bioshock in space. Runs well on PC. Running 1440p at 60 fps with no problems. *Please note the retail copy does not install the game and directs you to Steam to download the game.

If you like games like System Shock, Bioshock, Dishonored, Deus Ex, etc. you will most likely like this game. Very surprised just how good it is. Only complaint is that you start out quite weak but by roughly 75% of the way through the story you've amassed so many healing items, upgrades, and perks, you're practically invincible. But it's a fantastic feeling of progression.

Picked this up on PC even though the lack of marketing and hype on the game made me wary. Within the first hour I was hooked. The reviews that say this feels like a hybrid of System Shock, Bioshock, Deadspace and Dishonored are right on. Some quick twitch action, but punctuated with periods of exploration, story building and lore recovery. Note that an incoming patch is supposed to fix some late game problems, but that isn't enough for me to reduce the rating on the game.
Dead space sort of horror is back. If you like survival horror, this is a game for you.

Never got a chance to see how it was. You can't get it through their digital library, so BB sets you up with Steam...which doesn't let the product download. BB cust service hangs up on you, re directs to another department,never really helps you. I only called them 16 times, mostly got hung up on. DO NOT BUY from this company

Last time I purchased a hockey game, I felt a little overwhelmed by the controls. At 40+ years of age, I don't have the time I used to to put into games so I wanted to go with old school controls I was semi-familiar with. So getting this and going with the '94 control scheme (one button for shoot / one for pass / one for deke), I hoped that would be cool. Well, not as cool as it used to be but I'm still winning. Having said that, I do feel WAY limited and am playing on semi-pro. About to up the difficulty to normal and see how I do. Again, you're limited compared to regular controls. Also, FYI, if you're into customizing your team -- like I did my expansion franchise Houston Aeros -- there are WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAYYY too many things to change. It's cool to be able to change so much but pretty tedious. Haven't delved into other modes.

After playing the last few versions of NHL I feel like NHL 19 is a lot more fluid playing and polished now. The online modes are also pretty well done and welcome. If you've skipped the last few NHL games... NHL 19 might be where you want to jump back in.

The gameplay is awesome. The player mechanics are so realistic. The graphics are almost identical to last years NHL but its really the gameplay that counts. One annoying problem that I encountered is creating a team in franchise mode. The game freezes out and restarts about 15 minutes in with creating a team.
I got this game with a price match from Macy's for $60, best deal ever

The NBA 2K series doesn't rest on its last game. It improves every year and this year is no exception. Everything is improved. The story mode is the best its ever been. The gameplay is better than ever. With 2k18, you needed to adjust the sliders to make the game play great. 2K19 plays perfectly out of the box. There are a few areas that can be tweaked but they are very minor. The MY Team does make you play some online games to unlock features that you will want to have. I HATE that. I hate being forced to play online, and win, to open features. I understand they want us to try out stuff, but adding the Must Win caveat really makes me hate the mode before i even try it. Bad move, 2K. There is so much to do in the game that it can be overwhelming a bit. The learning curve can be a little steep, but it is well worth a little effort. Finally, 2KTV is a great feature to watch and help you get tips on how to be a better 2K player. Its well worth the time.
Love the new additions in 2K19. Great graphics!!!! Gameplay is fun and more challenging My Career. Also, rebounding is much better.
I bought this for my boyfriend and haven't heard from him since so I guess he likes it.

Lot of features, gameplay is good offline but online needs some work like modes not working right, lag and latency issues and the unrealistic rate of steals in the game. Spammers online hit X for everything, they really should make it so you lose stamina for spamming the steal button too often. Good gameplay though and that's really what I care for.

I like how 2k has listened to the community and have fixed their game including the vc, cutscenes, the neighborhood, parks etc.. in order to please their fan base... I feel like this game will be the best one yet.
The game will great 2k will finally make up for all the past mistakes
The Neighborhood looks exactly the same. There is no park affiliation, same old Jordan Rec Center, same old wack animations. Same old 2K.

NBA 2K19 improves on some of the flaws of 2k18. Defense has improved and the games looks slightly better. The anniversary edition should only be purchased if you wanted the game early. If you didnt buy then, dont buy now.
Never purchasing a digital code from Best Buy again
This game is Great! NBA 2k never lets me down and Im sure 2K19 will not disappoint.
I haven't received my email to activate my game on line. 2k19

Are you ready to party like it's 2004? Then Kingdom Hearts III might be the game for you. I'll admit that I'm not a die-hard fan of the series but have always sort of admired it from afar, then never given it a whole lot of attention. I'm a huge JRPG fan, a huge Square fan, and even a huge Disney fan, but ultimately this game does nothing for me. It looks absolutely stunning on Xbox One X and presumably almost as good on stock Xbox One but the game feels way too much like a PS2 title to be enjoyable in this day and age. You could have told me it was a 4K remaster of a 15 year old game and I'd have believed you. That said, if you're a fan of the series anyway and want to see how it all comes together, go for it. Sometimes that nagging itch of wanting to know the end of a story makes the suffering worthwhile. That wasn't the case for me.
Okay game, good to see a continuation of the series, but would have liked to see more content, especially due to the long release time between games.

Fans of the series will probably have a good time and enjoy this game a lot. The Disney stuff is great, but fro someone new to the series... the gameplay just didn't really do it for me. It seemed like for a 2019 game it was lacking in a lot of areas.

Great game! I have been a fan of the KH series since I first played it when I was 7, this is just one more great addition. The combat has been upped (you can now swap between 3 different keyblades mid fight and each keyblade has a special second form/finisher), the worlds are huge, and the game play is fun/ addictive and easy to get the hang of. Nevertheless, unless you want to be confused, I wouldn't recommend this to newcomers without first beefing up on the old lore or playing the old games; because they reference a lot from the previous games with little context. They've lowered the difficulty since KH 2, (save the very final sections of the game) and unless you go on proud mode its downright easy, but it still is wildly entertaining either way. And to anyone who think the graphics are short of great (okay, I believe you), nah man; this thing is beautiful. Some of the animated sections looked on par if not better than their Disney counterparts and the pirates world was weirdly enjoyable (water combat no longer makes me want to kill myself). So I highly recommend this game if you've played all the others. Also, just a heads up, buy at least one potion/ingredient from every moogle you see. He'll give you a postcard after every first purchase and you need a butt-ton of postcards to get Orichalcum+ (needed for the strongest keyblade).
Well put together game definitely worth the wait really enjoyed it so far!!

I have followed both KH1 and KH2 and was so excited when they decided to make KH3 Xbox compatible. This game definitely follows the same game play as the first two with new worlds and the same fun loving characters. It might be a little confusing if you haven't played the series before, so hopefully they will come out with the first two on Xbox in the future. For those of us who have been able to play the first two, KH3 is a must have for your game collection.
This game is years in the making. Great game and bookend to the trilogy.
This game is amazing. The graphics are insane. It really brings me back to the old games but so much newer movies involved and graphics! Love love love it
The culmination of the series. the whole family is playing.
Great game if you like kingdom hearts. Really if you are a fan, then why are you looking at reviews? Just buy it.

If you've played all the handheld games, I'm sure you'll love this. After all, I assume you've become entranced by this series' convoluted mess of a story. I, on the other hand, have not played seriously since kh2. I don't care about the nonsensical story; I just want classic kh gameplay with some new mechanics thrown it. You get that, but so far there's more time devoted to cutscenes than actual gameplay. Long story short, it wasn't worth the wait.

$15 price tag from Black Friday. Made sure to pick it up since Kingdom Hearts the full story is finally releasing in 2020 on Xbox One. The first 2 games were superb so I can only imagine this game will be just as great. Looking forward to playing the entire series on Xbox One.
Awesome game love the graphics and characters along with the fighting scenes

After a 13 year wait, the finale is here. I found the story to be as confusing as ever, but the gameplay is an evolution of KH 2's system, and brings into the fold elements first introduced in other series games like BBS. Over all some of the magic is gone for me, however, and it just feels like I'm going through the motions at this point. I really wanted this game to be bigger than all it's predecessors in some way, but it falls well short of that and is just another, as-expected KH entry.

If you ever played Kingdom Hearts 1 or 2 on PS2, then you've probably been waiting 13 years for the final installment. Buy it now, even at full price, but if you're on the fence, wait for it to be on sale, then pick it up and get ready for some great Kingdom Hearts action!
The third Kingdom Hearts video game is great. Great characters. Great visuals. Great gift. Great graphics. Great game play (KH1, and KH2 equally). Great story progression. -J.T

Waited for this game for so long. Love the graphics and love the story line. The game gives a quick summary of what has happened in the story so far so if you're new to the game you wont be missing out on too much.
This is my first kingdom hearts game and I must say I dont feel as if I need to have played the prior games very colorful entertaining game
excellent deal. Got it on sale pretty sure it was 20 or 30 bucks. Never buy games at full price!

I have played most of the KH games. They were a lot of fun & action starts quickly in the game. it was a lot of fun seeing new Disney caracters & having old friends Donals & Goofy along for the Journey. Some good puzzles & side chanllanges too. the only down side is it has been so long since I played the games the story was hard to follwo becasue I did not remember who was who & what happenbed before a recap video would have been appreciatedl. it ewas a fun game even if I got lost withthe story sometimes.
After waiting for years for the KH main series trilogy to come to an end this game is a well polished compliment for the games up to this point.
The saga comes to a close. I played the original games on the ps2, but now I've actually been watching my nephews play this one and hey are enjoying it quite a bit.
One of the worst games ever. Overrated games by Disney, I should have known. Don't buy this game!!!

First off, I haven't played any of the kingdom hearts games up until this point, so consider that for my review. This game had the hype. My friends who were big kingdom heart fans had been talking fervently about this game for a year. Every month and week leading up to release I would get some breathless update on how this game is gonna be the best thing since sliced bread... So I bought the game on release. The reviews were good. And I had done my homework into the story line (there are many synopses online). But wow was I disappointed. The combat by itself is largely boring to actually do. You hit the same button repeatedly with the same combo, over and over and over and over again. Yes, the developers do spice up stuff by having these amusement ride combos cash-ins, and that's cool. But having just come from God of War, the combat mechanics in this game are a tier below. So I'm left with just a meh feeling. Writing and story. So everyone knows the writing is... Just weird. I'm not super invested in these characters, but I could see if you're a lifetime fan of the series, the character interactions might have some more weight for you. But as someone with no prior experience, the character interactions were awkward at best and dumbfounding at worst. I don't know if I should blame the translator, or the writer, so I'll blame both. Story is infamously convoluted, and I'll say it rings true here as well. All around, I would not say this game is worth full price of admission. $30 seems like a fair deal if you're just looking for a JRPG and don't have any experience with this game series.

I've been waiting a long time for this game and I am not disappointed so far! I am a big fan of the Kingdom Hearts games but wasn't too fond of playing on the mobile systems. I am only a few hours in but this is exactly what I wanted. It's an easy play with an entertaining story. Of course, if you're looking for more of a challenge it can entertain that as well with it's harder difficulties.

This game has tons of nostalgia for me, I grew up playing KH1 and 2 and this game does its predecessors justice. With great graphics, tons of new Keyblade abilities and call backs on the old games its great. However if you are new to the series and a big Disney fan the game will still captivate you, however I do recommend doing research on what has happened in past games so you dont feel out of the loop.

Ive been anticipating Kingdom Hearts 3s release since I finished Kingdom Hearts 2 in 2006. Actually, though, Kingdom Hearts 3 is the 13th game in the series - preceded by such titles as 358/2 Days (Three Five Eight Days Over Two) and Kingdom Hearts 0.2 Birth by Sleep -a fragmentary passage-. The storyline for the series is about as incomprehensible as the titles, with time travel and alternate realities and clones. To tell the truth, if you dont already have the game, you probably wont care about it at all. Which is a shame, because this is the most Kingdom Hearts-y game ever. Each previous game added or changed a game mechanic, and this game brings them all together. There is almost too much to do while in combat, with every flashy attack flowing into the next. One of the most striking aspects of the game is the graphics, especially on the Xbox One X and PS4 Pro. Specifically, when youre with Buzz and Woody from Toy Story, or Rapunzel and Flynn from Tangled, the characters and environments look as good - sometimes even better - than the movies they come from. Its remarkable, and really shows off how far weve come. The writing isnt the best, but the voice acting performances are solid, led by Haley Joel Osment playing the main character, Sora, as he has since the first game. It is funny, sometimes, having characters like Goofy talk about finding a heart in the datascape, or Mickey Mouse in a black cloak threatening monsters with a sword, but thats really what Kingdom Hearts is all about.

I know the popularity that surrounds Kingdom Hearts is vast. But I am just not sure I can recommend it to people who have not played the previous games or did not enjoy them Pros: - Interesting and fun combat - Slightly easy - Disney environments are super cool Cons: - Story is not very interesting - Voice acting is abysmal - Certain portions of the game do not look that great - Multiple gametypes that are not polished/refined (bullet hell sequences or platforming)

Fun from start to finish. Playing on XBOX One X also definitely worth it for the upgraded details. Looks amazing. You definitely have to play the previous games or watch a bunch of videos in order to understand the confusing story. The Disney world stories were 'meh'. You mainly get this game to see how the Xenahort saga is gonna end. Without doing any sidequests I was able to finish the game at exactly 30 hours.

This is a welcome addition to the series - for newcomers and old players alike. If you played the previous versions of the game, you'll feel right at home. It's a beautiful game with great graphics and music. The mechanics are fluid and fights enjoyable and somewhat varied. There's a lot of variety in the game. There are a lot of cut scenes but so far, they have all been interesting. My family will sit there and watch because it's so much like a movie. Overall, an enjoyable game.

Took me a while to complete this game's story mode, but it was definitely long and worthwhile just to see how the story played out. The gameplay was definitely fun the longer you stayed with the game and learned how its new mechanics work. Speed Cards is introduced as your new system for upgrading your ride beyond its natural limitations, which kind of keeps you coming back in hopes to being ready for the next big event. Sometimes you have to replay events to earn enough to get to the next big thing, but it's not a constant thing if you are frugal early on with base shipments and earned rewards. For a smooth gameplay style, I recommend you save all of your Speed Cards until you really need them. Don't sale the ones you don't want; store them to invest in rolling three unused ones for a chance to score a really powerful one later on as you progress through the game with your car of choice. Save up all of your money to get that dream car you always wanted (mine was the Jaguar F-Type R). The only downside to this game, when compared to the likes of Hot Pursuit, is that the cop chases are either very difficult to get past later on in the game and that they just end automatically after you get toward your final checkpoint. It's nowhere near as good as it was when you actually had to work hard and think creatively at dispatching them in previous games. The game is split up between Race, Drift, Drag, Off-Road, and Runner (Cop Chase) events. You'll most likely spend most of your time as a racer and doing off-road events because those two are the most challenging as you get deeper into the game. (Off-Road is particularly unfair on certain difficulty settings.) There are a million little distractions to do in the open-world of this desert city, so go out and explore, find derelicts, and save up for your dream car. Then go online and challenge the world with your unique ride.

Here are my impressions regarding this game: Pros: I liked the addition of over new 100 Digimon to the game (300+ in total). It was nice to see what the side characters were up to when you did not see them in the first game. The story was good overall. It was a pain to get the pre-order bonus but once I received it via email, it filled up my Field Guide and I got a couple costumes. Cons: You must have played the previous game in order to understand this game. The story felt disjointed at times because the main character from the previous game impacted your story. Not much was improved design wise so if you were not familiar with the layout, you are bound to go through a learning curve. You will have to do a ton of level grinding if you plan on completing your Field Guide. You do not get a choice of gender for your protagonist, but it is about one person after all. On a final note, you have to pay for the DLC in this game, versus the previous game which was free. Overall, it was a good game. I have considered going back and forth between this game and the previous game to see if I would get a fuller story. I highly recommend this game if you have played the previous one in the series.

I am a huge fan of the zombie genre, and thoroughly enjoy a good zombie game! I have played through the Left For Dead Series and loved it, so going in to Dead Island, I already had something to base the experience off of. I like the first person perspective quite a bit, and the controls and action is very satisfying! The story line and quests change up enough to keep me interested, and the open world concept is a big plus! The down side. First, the action is great except they forgot to make you and the other zombies solid objects. For instance, if a zombie rushes you and you miss with your attack, they don't stay in front of you, they run right through you, and now you have a zombie behind you. And you can run through them as well. This can be hugely irritating when fighting a horde of zombies because if you back yourself into a narrow alleyway to fight a bunch of them, the ones you miss end up behind you, and the bottleneck you intended to use as a defense is a detriment, not a help. Secondly, I don't mind blood and violence, but this trend that everything has to have cussing and cleavage to make it interesting or realistic is false. Every woman on the island is a scantly clad model in a bikini, and the language gets old... I'm a grown adult, and would enjoy playing action games even more without adult content. It seems like it would be an easy option to add to the Sound Menu. Toggle adult language on/off. Overall, it's a fun game. Just know what you're getting into!
