XCOM2 is true to the original storyline. It was great fun to play and certainly met my expectations. The XCOM series are my favorite turn-based games. A couple of things that diminished gameplay: 1) There were some stutters and technical glitches with cut scenes and actual gameplay. Mostly annoying, but it was noticeable and occasionally halted play. I suspect they'll patch and update soon. 2) Multiplayer for XB1 doesn't exist. No matter how I tried, I could not enter, join, or host an online match in any way, shape, or form. I love multiplayer, and was really disappointed. Again, an upcoming update will probably include a fix. 3) Actions/reactions and their results during actual mission play were mostly random and unpredictable. This is as it should be. But when looking at the Bridge screens and participating in that part of the game, the progress was TOO predictable. I had no trouble telling when an emergency mission would pop up and require my attention. I finally got annoyed and sometimes just skipped over an 'urgent mission' because it always got in the way of my soldiers' healing, research, construction, etc. Likewise, the timing of the game's progress on it's final countdown to disaster was also easily predicted. I still really loved this game, and am going through a second run-through at a more difficult level. While this game (like most) has a linear story, the best part is the missions which have much more random play. This gives me a number of 'what if' actions and reactions to try out from saved game files. If you're a fan of XCOM, you'll overlook the glitches and hiccups. It's a great game, with hours of fun play.
Great game! I really like the co-op aspects. Way to up the game!
I can't give a honest review of this game because I didn't play more than 15 mins once I realized what kind of gameplay it was. This is definitely not my kind of game so I did not enjoy or keep it.
Love the pc version. Hope it looks and plays exactly the same .

Come on now its soul calibur one of the most underrated fighting games ever and despite it not be big as tekken ,MK it doesnt matter with this game you can see what fighting is about and despite it missing the big chronicles mode we had in the 2nd one the character creation does make up for it

After a good half day of knocking on the fighting engine, it feels good. I felt the high point was SC2, 3 and 4 were good but, lacked something. While I 100% completed SC1 and SC2, I fell out of playing 3 and 4 after a few hours. This doesn't feel quite as difficult to recommend. The gameplay runs well, the controls are tight, and the match load times aren't bad. The basic additions to the game include the reverse edge mechanics and a gage mechanic. In my limited game play against the AI, I don't find it overpowering nor cheap. The game play looks good, provides a nice clash mechanic, and I like it. The visuals are quick to parse and provide the relative info about the attack type. Lightning effects or Fire effects indicate specific attack types. The bad includes a troubling tendency to slice a fighting game into pieces and reselling it a character at a time. Day 1 DLC has no real place in the market and should be abolished. Tira was a built in character in 3 on and they only cut her to make for a pre-order/season pass bonus. In short, a good fighting game marred by marketing and with some interesting additions to a solid fighting system.

Wow blown away by this game the character creator is so in depth that can basically recreate any pop culture icon you can think of Thanos seems to be everyones favorite to make the fighting is top notch and graphics look great running on the unreal engine glad i preordered it
Great game with better graphics. Fun to play with your friends. If you like the older Soulcalibur games you will like this one.

Format of the game it's like an older generation game. Story with a pretty background, then loading... Fight! Then loading... Story with a pretty background, then loading... Fight! Then loading... Story with a pretty background, then loading... Fight! Then loading... Story with a pretty background, then loading... Fight! Then loading... Story with a pretty background, then loading... Fight! Then loading... Story with a pretty background, then loading... Fight! Then loading... You could make your own character and adopt a fighting style from the main character! My wife is enjoying the story, she's a fan!

WHOOOP WHOOOP! The only game my wife actually wants to play with me. I'm screaming 'I NEED MORE MEAT BABE'!!! Meanwhile she's screaming at me for not washing the dishes. It's like our real life but now we get POINTS!

There are fewer and fewer games designed to gather people together and have them help each other in order to win. This isn't a if-I-win-then-you-lose game. This is a let'-all-help-each-other win and succeed game. In my view, it is a terrific family game (and is one of the very few video games my family will play together). I love how is fosters teamwork and delegation and support from one another. Now, compared fo Overcooked 1, this game has excellent additions and challenges. The additions (one of them being a way to throw food to others) is superb. Plus, online co-operative play is an new addition...but I would argue that while a nice option, the game is far more enjoyable to do with others in the same room. This is a video game that can be recommended without reservation!

If you've played Overcooked then you know what to expect. This one is great, I especially love the surf n turf expansion. I will say that, in general, Overcooked 2 is much easier than the first one, my wife & I didn't have to try nearly as hard to get all 3 stars in each level. At that point, a 4th star can be achieved in each level and THAT is challenging!!
My only complaint is that you can only be truly successful with 4 players. It's difficult to play with any less people. Otherwise, a true family game where kids of all ages can play with the adults.
Anthem is a great action adventure shooter with specialized mech suit like armor. If you are fan of Destiny then you will enjoy Anthem

It feels like a Diablo shooter with flying mechanics. It does make sense that a futuristic space suit should fly and not just double jump like so many games. The character dialogue is so KOTOR and ME. Kinda weird, but makes you learn about the world you are playing in. I'm not sure I'll have a real opinion until I get to end game where drops matter more. I think this game will be dependent on how that looks for longevity. You definitely feel more powerful as you level.

First of all stay away from the Legend of Dawn edition it's a ripoff. The unique weapon is no longer useful after a few hours of game play and you can buy better looking armor with the coins you earn through the in game merchant. This has to be one of the most stunning XBOX games I have ever played. But the amount of game play it takes to level up your character will become unbearable. Many of my friends that left Destiny 2 have returned due to the absolutely poor drops in Anthem. I played just a few days ago for 4 hours on Grand Master 1 and did not get anything I already had gotten a dozen times or more. Even on the higher Grand Master settings the rare drops are few and far between. Some posts say it may take 10-20 hours of game play to get an item you need. In short, if you love stunning graphics this is a must own. But if you hate grinding run away from this game!

Let me start by saying that I went into this game with an open mind despite what reviewers were saying. I really really wanted to like this game. I've been playing it for over a week straight. It was cool to fly around an open world, land, shoot enemies, complete various objectives, etc. The story is kinda forgettable. The main hub/fort is vibrant but also kinda lacking at the same time. Comparing what was released to what was shown a few times at E3 is really disturbing. It looks and plays nothing like that. That 'gameplay' trailer was a complete lie. The loading screen will be your new friend as its what you will see 60% of the time. This game has bugs.....LOTS OF THEM. Bugs ranging from the sound completely going out, to mission objectives that never appear causing an entire mission to have to be quit and redone, to constant crashes to the games title screen, crashes to Xbox home, and times when the game just completely freezes. This game in all honesty is a godforsaken mess. What the heck happened Bioware? Oh yeah, thats right, EA happened. Lets also talk about the loot system and drop rate. It is for the most part broken and just bad. Playing on Grandmaster 1 will still drop some common items laughably and 99% of what you get ranges from Uncommon to Epic. Very rarely and I mean VERY VERY rarely you may get a Masterwork item (Better than Epics). Which comes to the reason I am here reviewing this game and ceasing any more play time with this horrendous junk. Tonight, after pouring hours and hours playing and doing missions and strongholds......Finally, a LEGENDARY dropped. MY FIRST ONE IN ABOUT 60-70 hours. These things never ever drop, I mean never. The planets must have been aligned for me to actually get one. I finished up Freeplay, which is where I got it, quit the expedition. While its loading guess what happens, CRASH TO XBOX HOME. Everything I had just done and received.....GONE. The game doesn't save until the end of a mission. In a buggy disgusting mess like this, the developers put the save at the very end!? I was in complete shock and could not believe it. I also think the game is partly rigged to do that when you get good drops so you have to grind this garbage forever with no reward. Do yourselves a favor people, avoid this game and stay very far. Don't even accept it as a gift and don't even take it for free. We should be getting paid by Bioware and EA for play testing and putting up with this no-where-near-finished shell of a 'game'. Instead we paid top dollar for a buggy mess. I haven't bought EA games in a long time and gave this a chance. Done with EA and Bioware, never spending a dime on their half finished games again.
There is reasons this game is getting dumped on DONT buy it. look at the youtube videos and find out, yes it may be a great game in a year but right now its a dumpster fire cash grab.
Hours of fun love this game,cant get enough!!! A+++
Great game love it so far! Pre order bonus was awesome
Never was a fan of 3rd persons but this is awesome!
This game is unreal have not stopped playing it great game
I love this game, graphics are amazing, gameplay is great I can see this going far
Amazing game! Great graphics and a lot of fun to play!
So far this is my favorite game of 2019. Graphics and gameplay are top notch.
It has lots of action and is a pretty solid 3rd person shooter.
Great game looks good plays great but gets old fast

I know this game is getting some negative reviews but I am loving it! The gameplay is great and just feels fun to play. The story is a little lacking for a Bioware game but for some reason it doesn't really bother me. I could care less about making connections with NPCs and instead just want to get out and fly my javelin.

While it is a little rough around the edges, it's a beautiful game. There is a great story and I find it enjoyable. Depending on expectations, you might be slightly disappointed but overall it's a worthwhile game to play and they're updating it frequently to only make it better.
So far i like it graphics and story line are good i really recommend this game
This game is what some have been calling the destiny destroyer. Definitely one of the top games lunched this year so far

I have been waiting for awhile to pick this up and I have not been disappointed! I have not played for too long due to other commitments but this game is a blast! It's beautiful to watch, cool to fly around in Javelin and the controls are mapped out nicely. I don't get all of the negative reviews, but hey to each their own. I'm still riding with Bioware. To others on the fence, if you go in without influence or expectations you will be in for a treat.
If you are buying this for yourself then I hope that you enjoy. If you are buying as a gift then I would strongly suggest picking another game or maybe some digital currency.

This game got some tough reviews when it was first released. The developers must have fixed most of the bugs because it is a very enjoyable game. It is like a mix of Destiny, Titanfall and No Mans Sky. This is good and bad. All are good games and mixing elements of all can be a little confusing. It takes some time to learn what your focus should be in the game. The open world I feel will continue to grow and this very well could become a classic like Destiny. Destiny got some negative reviews when it released and now Destiny 2 is one of the top games. The graphics are some of the best Ive seen on my Xbox X. The worlds are so realistic is is a pleasure to just explore. Being able to jump and fly in your suits is way cool. I got the Legion of Dawn edition on sale for $32. If it goes on sale at this price, it is a bargain to add to your game library.

Severely disappointed with how the game was released. Too many bugs, too many mistakes for a game that has been in the works for so long. I got this game for free in a promotion with purchase of an Xbox. And I returned the game even tho it was free because it was that bad.

This game is a complete mess. It feels very unfinished. The graphics are fantastic but thats where the good stops. The gunplay is not sharp, the flying is limited, there is no endgame content, the story is uninteresting. It has potential but give it a year to fix all of its issues. Stay away from this game!
Gamers cannot continue to allow this to happend. Unfortunately Anthem speaks for itself.
Great game. Awesome customization. The graphics are mind blowing!
alot of reviewers are bashing this game it's about a 7 or 8 if you like destany I recommend trying it out
The combat system is pretty good but the game gets a bit repetitive after you beat the campaign. I'm still enjoying it. Your mileage may vary.
Love the controls and mobility in Anthem. Story is still not quite where I want for this type of game, but its a huge step in the direction I want to see.
Game has been decent, and definitely fun. Once it gets updates, it will be great. Little repetitive right now. Flying a javelin is fun though!!!
I played for about 20 hrs. now and it's a great game. There are things that need to be fixed, but Bioware is working on it. So, it'll get better.
Great game, wish there was a player versus player element.
This game is amazing!, graphics are 2 to none, the 4K is eye-popping! The only downfall is the load times, but with an open world concept, its understandable!
good game has some bugs but once they are worked out will be great game
This game is awesome would recommend to any one. Great product
Played demo loved it, pre order game got it. I have enjoyed every minute I have play. Decide for yourself people!
Enjoy the game, and case, I am really happy with it.
Game is amazing! Love the story and online setup. Must buy
Game got a lot of unfair reviews but I love playing this game online with my friends
This is a great game although there is a grind for gear and the story is a little repetitive.
The Game Has Its Highs & Lows But Over All a Good 3rd Person Shooter...
This game is awesome! Ive been waiting for about 6 months for this game and love it!
Not far enough into the game to really judge. Combat and flying are great. Playing with friends is the way to go.
I love the game, the world look amazing and the suit is fire but i don't understand why people hate it so much.
Five stars for graphics....but overall, its okay, not super.
My kiddo loves this games. Unlock lots of other games, He plays it a lot.
Beautiful game, plays great, huge open world... Only downside is the server instability. Plus it's a little too quick to level up the max
Graphics are great, and gameplay is great! Must buy!
Couldn't be more than pleased with game play and graphics. I have been waiting a long time for a game like this.
I honestly cant figure out why critiques hit this game so hard. The game is fun, and super beautiful. The writing is the best a video game could ask for. Get this game!
Halo/destiny/ mechassult hybrid!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Good game and dont understand the hate around it. Looks great on the Xbox One X.

Visually stunning game. The flight in the game is good as well. The only issue I have with it is that it is very repetitive and I don't see much else you could do once you have all masterwork/legendary gear. I own it, so I will continue to play it and see how it evolves
Anthem is a pretty awesome game. It allows you to fly around the environments and customize your armors
The Game is not record breaking but very fun to play. Especially with friends. Graphically beautiful!
This is one cool game, it's unlike anything I've played before. The controls are complex but stick with it and you'll be flying like iron man in no time.

If you love Destiny, this is Destiny + Iron Man combined. The best part is flying around and the graphics are awesome. The main story is short. They need more content which they will surely add. The current end game is a definite Grind. 4 Classes are cool and its nice you can use all your weapons/perks in between each Class. No need for extra grind of class specific stuff.
Open world, lots of loot and a wonderful co-op adventure. Good times for everyone.
The graphics is amazing it almost feel like u watching a movie . Money well spent
Very fun game , graphics are awesome , game play is good
The best game ever! The Legion edition give an excellent start!
Meets and exceeds expectations. Love the open world play.
This is a great game thats kind of a cross between Titanfall and Destiny!
This game is better than I thought... I love the play style especially.. I love flying around in a mech like suit
Been playing for a week now and jut love it. Great game to kill my time!!
Pre ordered after playing beta and it hasn't let me down yet. Mmorpg that continued to evolve as you play. Very cool
Graphics are the best Ive seen and one of the best games Ive played in a long time, thanks to Best Buy I got it for a great deal!
It's really fun right now, to me at least, and I believe that given time, this game can become better than the likes of Destiny.
Amazing graphics, smooth gameplay and a great storyline puts you in the driver's seat of alot of action with excellent weapons.

People are expecting this to be just as good as destiny is with its 4th year in development. Unfortunately, that is not the case. But that doesn't mean that this game isn't fun and most of still growing. The deva are active and responding to our feedback. So if you are on the fence I say give this game a chance!
This seems a lot like Destiny except there is too much talking to people to get missions, activities, etc. Seems overly thought out and a bit monotonous.
Now after hearing about the game coming out a year ago I was so excited but once you get a couple hours play under your belt the game didnt have much to it and begin to get boring and repetitive!

I've been hearing about this game for 2 years now and I jump for the pre-order right away. The game mechanics are phenomenal! The javelins are amazing!. The story is short, but in sure they are going to add more with DLCs and the Interceptor needs to be more balanced. There isn't enough opportunity for melee attacks in the game. Otherwise, a must buy for all!

Not the same Bioware I grew up with. From KOTOR to Mass Effect (Even Andromeda), I was always a Bioware fan, but since then, their games have become lax and wanting. Maybe in a few months, or years, this game will be awesome, but there are no excuse for how long it took them to develop it that it isn't perfect now. Especially with all the other Looter Shooters out there and they should know what works and what doesn't, and unfortunately, this doesn't.

I was really hoping that this game was going to be great, but unfortunately I was somewhat wrong. The graphics and flying are great, but the rest of the game is not very engaging. It seems like a game that came out about five or six years ago. I'd try this game first before fully purchasing it.

The beta had more glitches than the game of today. I can play for hours now and not experience game play issues. I've never played a game that didn't need patches. Cons first: It doesn't have 'Borderlands type' dialog (my #1 co-op shooter). A lot of people aren't mic'd up. I completed 100% of the missions without vocal communication from other team members, but the game feels less like a 'team effort'. Also, with more team coordination the game would be more 'tactical', and progression in the game would move at a faster pace. Pros: You have to play the game on 'hard mode' to give weight to flying around and battling foes. That's what make this game really really fun. The weapons in the game feel amazing, and I don't believe one gun does it all. I'm using all the weapons, and the special abilities are awesome to use. The micro-transactions are a joke, and don't impact my game- play since you can make your suit unique by using thousands of color combos. Selling dropped guns and completing missions can produce coins that give you the ability to purchase items in the micro-transaction market. If you read reviews, they talk about the fact that once the glitches get resolved the game will be much better. At that time the game would be able to get to 4 stars but never 5.
Levels look like theyre the same cant tell if you did the same mission over Its just repeated progress
This is not what I and many others expected from BioWare proper.

People really need to manage their expectations on live games these days, especially brand new franchises. Otherwise, it just turns into argumentative fanboy-style arguments over which game is better. This is a nice Bioware game with a good backstory, and I'm taking my time on it. Yes, I really enjoy Destiny 1 and 2. I also really enjoyed The Division and Diablo 3. I did not like Fallout 76, but that was a huge cluster which this doesn't compare to. The loading screens do suck, but Division has them. Destiny has them. Get an SSD to mitigate this. It did wonders for me in Division.
Was super hyped about this game, now I'm super bored. Lack of content makes it a very repetitive game. Also not being able to set a way point to locations or public events is extremely frustrating

This is the worse game I have ever tried to play. I say try because I haven't been able to play past the tutorial. Once you complete the tutorial, you have to access the forge with equip your freelancer. I cannot access the forge and many others say the same on forums. The fix, uninstall and reinstall the game 'might' work. Well, four installs later, I cannot even play the game due to 'connection errors'. I was warned BoiWare pushes out crap and buggy software. I should have listened. Before you buy, do yourself a favor and Google 'Anthem issues'...

Im just about to finish the main storyline which has been an absolute blast! The graphics and world are amazing and the moving/flying mechanics are really fun. There has been some criticism of the game after finishing the main storyline, but I am really excited to see where this game is at in the coming months-year.

Despite everything you may have heard about loot and content, the mechanical guts of Anthem are incredibly solid. The meaningful content does run out and into a grind a little quickly, but this is meant to be a living game. As long as it keeps growing this game is going to be fun for a long time to come.

I easily got burned out with Destiny and The Division, but Anthem brings the grinding type games to a whole new level...in a very good way. I dont get tired of exploring the massive environment. The enemies can be challenging. The recent update, better loot has dropped. Of course, the game needs some more updating, but in its current form, it's a fun game!

This game has great free-form gameplay and fighting through the use of four distinct mech suits. Also love how it makes you feel like Iron Man when you fly around in them. Only downside is that you must have a gold membership in order to play this game...but other than that its amazing!

This game definitely does not feel like a complete game. Nowadays- seems to be a growing trend. I will say most reviews are a little too harsh. Game play pretty solid. Story a little lacking compared to most bioware titles. I would wait for a cheaper price. Worth a rent or purchase at half the cost.

The whole Iron Man concept of this game is fun. I enjoy the game play of this game. The flying, the combat, the guns, the villains, etc. This game is catching a lot of flack, but I still think its worth it. My friends and I enjoy playing the strongholds or the missions together.

This much anticipated game is truly fun to play. The flight mechanics, gun play, enemies/bosses all feel good. There have been quite a few bugs, but BioWare is listening to the community, responding (being as transparent as possible), and squashing the bugs in a timely fashion. Good game IMO, and a rather large area to play with lots to do and find. Two thumbs up.

While other reviews may not shock and awe, I like this game. It has a Destiny feel but more freedom. I liked Destiny's overall premise but the gameplay and loot system weren't great, and the coordination required more, along with not being able to do certain things without a pre-formed group. I like that this still allows matchmaking in the dungeons and missions. The graphics are great and overall the gameplay is fun.
This game has a lot to offer. Good game play and graphics. Needs to work on server issues.

I was not going to get this game till I tried the beta. It is fast fun and enjoyable. There are some things people pick out to harp on and they are not as bad as most people say. Save your time and watch game play or sign up for EA origins to try for a month then decided to buy. Which you should

For my initial review, I have to say, it's not bad. Gameplay is a bit repetitive and the load time is ridiculous. It is a good change of pace from games I have been playing. Hoping that new contents will improve the game.

Its a fun game, if you dont mind dealing with constant bugs that supposedly get updated almost daily, has long loading screens (which are supposedly fixed almost daily), and repetitive everything. Theres fun to be had, just be prepared to wait for it.

Anthem is amazing...fantastic graphics, sound is really good, gunplay is tight...controls are smooth. Co-op game play works seamlessly and the classes compliment each other very well. It's a mix of a loot shooter and rpg lite and works great together. Loading screens are a tad long but will be addressed in future updates. An absolute must have in their shooter genre.
Anthem has a lot of highs and a lot of lows. Level design and structure could use a lot of work as it becomes extremely repetitive. The graphics and gameplay and story NPCs are great!
The game has what is needed for a good game, but it just seems like it was released to soon and could use some work. Give it 6 months of patching.
The game has promise, but EA hasn't shown it. Maybe wait to see what their plans are, because the game is pretty shallow. They could correct it, but that might take 1/2 a year or more.
Game has solid action and mechanics, even if the rest of the game is kind of unflushed out. Progression feels good and the storm is a blast to play.

Dont listen to reviews, it was reviewed before the day one patch! All issues have been fixed. Anthem is as if Mass Effect, Destiny, Avatar & Ironman had a baby. Having lots of fun with this game, a definite buy!

So far so good, I am enjoying more than Destiny 1 and 2. It is a bit of a grind having to talk to so many people in town. The story line is on the shorter side but there are plenty of other missions and contracts to keep you busy. Leveling up your player takes forever. But from what I read they are working on fixing some of that and it sounds like the DLC to come will be free, so that works. So far I'm enjoying.

This game has gotten a lot of uncalled for negative press. A lot of streamers are bashing this game due to its lack of end game content but as a new IP the expectation of having a plethora of content endgame was talked about beforehand. BioWare has a road map that will give many of the diehard shooter fans content, but that might not see the light of day due to such terrible sales. This game is worth your time and money, I promise.
Can be fun to play with friends, but I do not see this game lasting very long without quite a few DLC.
Graphically stunning, an immersive world with an intriguing story. Gameplay and character customization ensure a multitude of different experiences from mission to mission. Great game!!
I have been a fan of Bio Ware for a while now going all the way back to KTOR I was disappointed with Mass Effect 4 but so far Anthem has been fun and not a disappointment.

I like this game. It's not perfect but it is a good time. It's like being ironman with guns. The flying feels great! I'm sure they will update it in the future and make it even better. I would buy it again after spending time with it. Don't expect too much, just enjoy the game.
Bioware the great Devs of many Role-Playing Games redeem themselves with Anthem. Soar, Hover, Fly at the speed of Power. Play with friends & choose your Javelin to fight & save Anthem
I honestly cant figure out why critiques hit this game so hard. The game is fun, and super beautiful. The writing is the best a video game could ask for. Get this game!
Its a great game all around. Ive been playing it co op with a buddy of mine and we love it. The guns, sound, graphics..... its s pretty good. The flight mechanics are the best Ive seen.

Ok so there are a few things that could be tweaked or improved but they are constantly updating and exciting content on the way..I have played for about 32 hours. I could go on and on and on...but all I can say if you doubt it try it for 10 hrs with EA access you might be amazed...sure story is.not as deep as Bioware usually is but they already told you it would not be months ago.. lol..but at least there is a story.
At first I used to call this game an ironman simulation... boy was i right! but in all the right ways!! I dont care for everyones criticism, i personally loved this game!!!
If you ever wanted to play a game that makes you feel like iron man this is it. Gameplay is fun but the story isnt the best and it can be repetitive.

Great foundation for success. Gameplay is fun, but long loading time, bugs, and loot system makes the game feel like something is missing. EA and BioWare are working tirelessly to update the game, but until then, this game didnt meet the expectations of most people.

I'll be honest it's fun, but very short lived. I'd hope they would have put more in the game considering it was suppose to be the most epic release on the console per E3. The campaign is very quick, and the characters are not gripping like you get in other single player driven games.

Its another visual masterpiece and very reminiscent of mass effect andromeda combat. It would have been better if they applied a single player campaign and focused more on it like they did the Mass Effect series. There was so much potential for more.

This game is pretty cool but with any new game has its bugs/glitches. Too many to mention but the developers have been releasing patches to fix the game. I wish more developers would take this kind of initiative and listen to feedback from their communities.

i know this game has been getting a lot of hate lately but its really a gem that needs u to see it for what it is and how great it can become. each mech that u get plays totally different from each other and and air to ground combat is the best ive ever seen in a game like this the content is not there just yet but its comeing .... if u gave destiny and the division a chance why not give this one a shot at least the grind is not as bad as the other two

The combat and movement mechanics are excellent, but the story and interactions in the world suffer in this open-world always-online shooter. If you are a fan of BioWare's previous games, this one might be a bit of a disappointment. Read up before purchasing.

Not sure where all the hate is coming from I have had a great time playing. Sure it was little buggy at realse but all of that was taken care of with first update. Similar to Destniy but with better storyline and more rememeberal characters. Plus you to fly around blowing stuff up like iron man.

I dont understand all the hate and negativity this game is getting. It is rather disappointing that the graphics and some of the stuff was downgraded from the trailer but its not the only game to ever have that done to it. Overall I love it! Its a great game and plenty of fun to play!
Receive code as stated and was easy to add to my sons account
This is a SCAM! This is absolutely worthless and is waste of money because you cannot run it without buying the actual game.

havent played that much yet but so far cant complain There are literally a lot you can do in this game, its completely differentt than the first watch dogs. I felt like indeed I'm playing an open world game. I cant wait to get my friends to buy a copy so i can take on co op . If you hated the first dont worry youll love this one.
Great game. Colorful graphics. You can get lost in the game for hours. very fun.
Good game! Awesome graphics! Very entertaining! Get your copy today you will also love it!
This game is a lot better then the first. I highly recommend it. Can't wait for them to bring the seamless multiplayer.
2K18 is a slight graphical improvement from 2K17, but thats about it. Fun game, but not worth paying full price.

It's an okay game, at times it feels very clunky and repetitive and other times it's enjoyable offering a decent amount of wrestlers and game modes. If you're a fan of the sport, buy the game on sale, if not then don't buy it.

He wanted this game but when he got it he learn that all the characters are not available until you unlock the through play this might have been good but he is only 10 and he was looking forward to playing with his favorite wrestler for 59.00 you dont get much

I'm probably the biggest wrestling fan in the world but cannot in good faith support this game. I ended up selling it after a couple months of play because of the endless grind you have to do to improve your character, the obvious grabs from 2K to get you to buy DLC, the freezing, the glitches, and save file corruption. Save your money

My son loves the game, but aside from updates to the characters and scenery, he tells me hes not seeing many new features. Definitely worth the Black Friday price, but doubt we would have bought it at full price.

This game has just lacked good gameplay for awhile. yes there is a improvement to graphics and characters. Playing backstage is also an improvement, but the controls just plain suck. Just plain too hard to reverse moves. My kids get so annoyed.

It's simple: Create yourself or who you would be if you were in WWE. Max out your stats so your only flaws are determined by your fighter type and height/weight. Create your friends and add them to your group. Download some super heroes (the online community uploads some very convincing models) and put them in teams based on their series - I had Power Rangers, DC, and Marvel groups setup. After all of this is done, maybe download some insanely cool looking belts, and create your own storyline complete with beefs between Undertaker and batman (this happened in my game) and repeatedly jump anyone who fights your friends as you annoyingly go undefeated and become the greatest heels WWE has ever seen
good for mind training how to handle movement my son has difficulty to manuver both hands this games help him
Bought for my grandson who loves wrestling it's age appropriate as well.
2k does great job on video games. Accurate with player models, arenas, and signature moves. Gameplay is top of the line.
I love the graphics get better ever year and kids love it
If you watch the show, these games are a blast to play. Every year its tweaked but still fun to play. The graphics are great. Highly recommend
We love the WWE series. It is worth paying for the add on for the extra characters.
Awesome game. Fast updates on tracking from Best Buy.
Well I'm hoping it's a great game. My son has to delete other games off his Xbox in order to download this game

I love this game, I had grown fed up with NBA 2K and their constant in game micro transactions so I decided to go another route this year when purchasing an NBA game. I was not disappointed with my purchase, it is safe to say I am on the NBA Live bandwagon from now on, bye bye 2K!

The NBA Live series has come a long way. In a few years, the series has gone from an absolute joke, to an actual fleshed out and worthwhile game. I still would like to see Live give you more flexibility in the franchise mode like NBA 2k does. To be more specific, I would like to be able to play as any team I want to during franchise mode within the same season. This is not something Live allows you to do at this time. The other aspect that needs a little work is the post game. It feels a little generic. I do like the efforts Live has put into the animations. They definitely are closing in on 2k in this area. Where Live has won me over, is the continual evolution of this game. Since the game has been released, the Live development team has been hard at work with numerous gameplay improvement patches as well as visual enhancements. Most of which were pulled from NBA Live community feedback. Some people see this as a negative, stating that this game should have had these patches in place prior to it's initial release. However, I look at it as great customer service and a willing to listen to their community to give us what we want. There is not enough of this going on in the gaming industry and it is a very welcomed concept. Most games will have periodic improvements that occur over the course of several follow up releases, but Live's team has made the effort to continually improve a product that has been out for over 4 months now. We will have to see what that will mean for NBA Live '20, but in the meantime, I applaud EA and the Live development team for their efforts in trying to give their fans a quality product.

I am not a 'car person' by any stretch of the imagination, and yet, I'm incredibly addicted to this game. You are awarded experience points for repairing cars so you can increase your level and obtain new tools, abilities, and better garage facilities. It's like an RPG with cars. It's also a bit of a puzzle game. Customers will give you clues by describing issues they are having with their car, and it is up to you to locate the problem and repair it. I find the gameplay compelling and fun. I can't recommend this game enough!

To start, I wanted to give this a 4.5 star review. Here's why. Back in 2003, Blue Tongue entertainment developed a Jurassic Park game where you bred dinosaurs and created your own park. This was awesome. The game became a legend. Now, the fun is brought back with JWE (Jurassic World Evolution). Unlike its predecessor, you start JWE on isla Mataceros. This is the softball thrown to get you into the game. You're given a limited set of dinosaurs that you can breed and a few buildings. The game guides you through how to succeed. It's great to finally have a tutorial. The interface is much better than before. You have alerts that appear at the top of the screen to keep you abreast of incidents that will lower your park's rating. The shoulder buttons can be used to quickly access ACU and Rangers (which you need for emergencies). The D-Pad gives fast access to different buildings and object placement. There's even a dashboard menu (opened with Square) that tells you everything you need to know at a glance. It's never been this easy to run a Jurassic World/Jurassic Park. There are 50+ dinosaurs in this title. Most Dinosaurs are unlocked by excavating fossils. Dinosaurs range from classics like T-Rex and Triceratops to overlooked dinosaurs like Chunkingosaurus and Struthimimus. If you complete the right objectives, you can even unlock both Indominus Rex (Jurassic World) and Indoraptor (Fallen Kingdom). I have mixed feelings about the Deluxe Dinosaurs sold as DLC. For an additional $12, you can purchase 7 more dinosaurs that were included in the Deluxe downloadable version. The animation looks super realistic. Dinosaurs walk, socialize, fight, and even hunt in realistic fashions. The only animation complaint I would give is the kills start to follow quickly identifiable patterns. Dinosaurs of a specific build will use the same kill animations. An example is when a velociraptor hunts a goat, the animation is the same as a dilophosaurus (without the frills). Something unexpected is the story behind the game. There are missions that unlock other islands and content, but these missions also feature dialog between characters. As you listen to the dialog, you start to uncover some of the more insidious secrets to Jurassic World. Overall, I'd strongly recommend this game. It's a great experience and fun for the whole family.

The systems in place to balance the three branches of entertainment science and security. The creation system and management system are fantastic, the only con I can point out is the control system. One of my all-time favorite games is the old Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis, which I still replay up to this day. Jurassic World Evolution is the 'sequel' to that awesome game, with the new Jurassic World in play. It looks great, plays great, and is still lots of fun! You start off with one island, and you have to proceed enough in the game to unlock the other 5 islands and more dinosaurs to dig for and breed. And one of the islands is the original island from Jurassic Park (which is open and with no budget! A big thanks to Jurassic Park movie fans, I would say). THIS IS NOT AN ACTION GAME... it's a sim game, so know this and research the gameplay BEFORE you buy it, so you know what you're getting. I love this game and am glad I got it, despite initial apprehension (I didn't think it would be as good as the original).

This collection is a great buy. I put it in, and instantly jumped right back into games that I remember from my childhood. Also I just turned 23, so some of these games are before my time. It feels good to discover them. Streets of Rage 2 is a great beat em up game. Phantasy Star IV is one of the first RPG's of large scale, even on the Sega Genesis. Sonic 2 was alwys fun, and even had terrific level design. Comix Zone was tons of fun to play with its inavative leve design, and gameplay mechanics. That is only a handful of the games that you will experience with this collection. I gave the challenge rating a 5 because believe it or not, some of these games were quite difficult. This collection also features every entire game, and has a save feature which many of them did not support back then. Simply put, this is a great way for older gamers to remember the games they enjoyed and for younger gamers to discover a forgotten age of gaming. Buy this...

This is easily one of the best retro collections ever. I owned a Sega Genesis many years back and this collections has most of my favorites. It's gret having Sonic the Hedgehog, Columns, Streets of Rage, Shinobi and Vectorman all in one collection. The controls work very well, which I am thankful for. I have played some retro collections where current controllers were not taken into account, but Sega has worked these games so the PS3 Dualshock 3 works perfectly with all games. The graphics may be dated, but the fun is not. Many of these games still hold up alongside the current generation of games and are still a lot of fun to play. It's also interesting to see how the graphics of the Genesis games evolved over time as technology improved. Play an earlier game like Alex Kidd or E-SWAT and then play Vectorman 1 or 2 to see what I mean. There are a few minor bugs in terms of sound and graphics in a very small number of areas, but nothing that will have any real effect on your enjoyment of the games. These were probably in the original games and may be fixed with future operating system upgrades. Also, the original Genesis cartridge for Sonic & Knuckles had a feature that let you play as Knuckles the Echidna in Sonic 2 and 3, but that is not in this collection for some reason (maybe it will be a future download). Despite these two minor issues, I would recommend this to anyone who ever had a Sega Genesis or who has an interest in retor gaming.

This is a great compilation of what I consider to be some of the best games of all times. This might not appeal to more recent gamers, but for those of us who grew up with these specific titles can definitely appreciate this.

If you grew up in the 16-bit era, then you're going to love this classic compilation of games. The graphical emulation is solid although there are a few sound oddities. However, there's nothing to really detract from the nostalgia. The usual suspects are present in this collection such as all the Sonic games (no lock-on feature for Sonic 3 and Sonic & Knuckles), the Phantasy Star series, etc. However, there are a few gems in this collection that haven't been available in other Sega collections including the Streets of Rage series, Shining series, etc. Overall, you can't go wrong with this collection if you grew up on these games or are looking to experience a piece of gaming history.

This is a port of a mobile game, and based on the responsiveness of the controls it certainly feels like it at many points. You should know that the game is made to be replayed over and over again with many sections of your first play-thru guarded by monsters Lv. 60-99. Many other missions and stories won't be available until later play-thrus, some only unlocking on your 3rd play-thru. The achievements are simple enough to get on a single play-thru, but after that it just seems later play-thrus for a couple extra missions on top of more grinding to be able to complete them is a bit much. At that point, it's less of a challenge and more of just a grind. Not a bad game, but definitely not optimized for a console experience. It's good if you're the kind of person who likes repetitive grinding for incremental yet paltry rewards.

The game is an HD version of a PSP title, and it shows. Some areas look disastrous, and some look good. The real problem is the price - $60 is insane for a PSP game. Considering that other PSP ports were quite cheap (Peace Walker HD, for example), you can tell Square loves to nickel and dime its fanbase. Essentially, this is a $40 (tops) game packaged with a $20 demo. Also the demo runs at a garbage resolution on Xbone: 1408x792.

Final Fantasy Type-0 is a combination of what fans want from the series and what they wanted. A fantasy rich story filled with drama, intense action and unique characters drive the story forward at a remarkable pace. The combat complements this by giving players the chance to finally play an active role in fighting, allowing players to run around the field, attack at will, and switch between your fighters at will. Each fighter has a distinctive move set and style of fighting, utilizing each fighters strengths and weakness is paramount to ensure success and a top rating. If you're a fan of the series, or RPGs in general, than Type-0 is a must buy. If you however have a sour taste from RPGs or the Final Fantasy series this game won't win you over.

I first played Devil may cry 1 , 2 & 3 on the ps2 and then played Devil May Cry 4 on my Xbox 360, and what an awesome ride they all were. We then were given DMC ( Devil May Cry ) as what seemed like a reboot of the series, it received a mixed bag of reviews, as some of the changes were just a little to much for some of the die hard fans of the original Devil May Cry to accept. I think the biggest change was to Dante himself, apart from just not sounding like himself he also received a total new character model, the most shocking thing being the short dark hair style instead of the longer white hair . I know that something like hair length and color might seem kind of petty but MANY people really had a problem with it and I as well had to get used to the new look, voice and hair. Now after the initial shock as I began to play the game the issues I had began to fade from memory as the gameplay of DMC was just as fun, flashy and furious as it was in the original games. During the early cut scenes I would see our new Dante and still get a slight feeling of wrongness about him, but after a little more play I didn't even think about it again. The game is just to great to let the little things I mentioned above keep you from having a blast with this game. Now on to our new flashy Xbox One version ( Definitive Edition #.. This is still the DMC you remember except with upgraded polished graphics # it looked awesome on the 360 ) and running at 60 fps and 1080P. I can tell you that the new polish and increase in frame rate and resolution make this already beautiful game simply jaw dropping.. DMC is full of color and is amplified to the extreme in this new version , leaving you drooling at the beauty of this game, and the 60 frames per second give you some of the silkiest controls you have ever had.. This is the question , is a game you have played before worth the purchase price again ? That is what you have to ask yourself. To me at the low price point of 39.99 it is a steal . The new graphics , frame rate and resolution alone are enough for me because I truly enjoyed the game on my 360. If you have never played this game or any of the past entries you are in for a real treat at a relatively low price point. Great price and great value , this is one game that I can say is a must play.. Solid 5 out of 5 Side note : If you don't like Dante's new look you can change his appearance with the character model skins that come packed in this new version. I have been using the skin from the first Devil May Cry and he now looks like our old Dante. There are a selection of skins , I think you have a choice of a skin from DMC 1 - 4 . so if for some reason you don't want to play as the new redesigned Dante you can put one of the skins provided on him and just forget about the new look.. I personally think that was a nice touch for this edition.. Edit : 3-15-15 -I have completed the game on Demon Hunter difficulty and have completed the extra content Virgil's fall.. The main campaign took me about 91/2 hours to complete and I completed Virgil's fall in about an hour & 45 min. I know some could complete this game faster but I am one that looks in every nook and cranny for collectables and such. But even if I didn't you could only shave off maybe 45 min to an hour . But I put in about a total of about 11 hours and 10 minutes into my first play through , and that's not a bad game length at all .. Not to short and not to long , it just feels about right and never over stays it's welcome.. Now it's time to start again on the next hardest difficulty and get some more achievements and enjoy the game all over again.
Its a very fast paced game with multiple combo moves with different weapons its a blast using the two pistols to tie each combo together for the price its a great buy

I would say this is probably one of the most campiest, cheesiest, yet kinda beautiful and decent RPG's to hit the PS4. Now most people may not know about this game but actually this game has been around for 5 years. I first purchased it on 360 in 2010, then on PC on a Steam sale 2 years ago, and now I purchased the PS4 version hoping that I will actually play more than 60% of this game and finish it. Nevertheless, in comparison to the other versions, I can say the PS4 version is the definitive version of this game. The textures are re-done quite nicely, pop-in is non-existent which was a huge problem in the other versions, and the combat/enemy animations appear 10X more fluid than earlier. This version also contains the separate expansion: The Fall of Setariff which is an added bonus. However, with these said do not expect a great game. In fact, I would say Two Worlds is a better game than this if you know what I mean. But on the contrary to that, know this is not necessarily a bad game. It's a very simple RPG, hack and slash and can be repetitive, confusing, silly, frustrating, janky, and could put you to sleep (problem playing earlier versions). But if you can overlook these cons, it's a pretty decent experience! One of the things that has helped me to avoid losing interest in the PS4 version, is increasing the difficulty to the hardest level: 'Gothic.' This has turned the game into a more 'Dark Souls' experience but make no mistake this game is still just alright. I give it 4 stars because it's not that bad, there are a lot of good ideas present (sawing wood for no reason, taking a bath for no reason, sleeping for no reason, using smithing tools for no reason, etc) that you can tell that maybe there was not enough time to get developed into the full release. I think with this latter aspect, they were trying to go for a 'Skyrim' experience but IDK.(JoWood if you are out there correct me if I am wrong). There is some good humor in this game, good environment/enemy designs, and good combat concepts. The bow and arrow feel actually pretty satisfying. Anyway, if you can get it cheap, it's not bad.

I wasn't expecting much from a cheaper RPG, and I got a little bit more from Arcania:The Complete Tale. This game may be no Fallout or Witcher, but it is another good RPG to play on PS4. This is a tough one to recommend. It's a spiritual sequel to a 15 year old game that is unlike anything else on consoles. The gameplay is very unusual, it involves talking to very, very chatty characters, listening to their stories, then deciding whether or not to help them. There is almost no action to be found, just a lot of decision making. The story is very large and confusing, and seemingly made up of 100's of short stories all woven together. If that all sounds fun to you I recommend giving it a chance. Otherwise pass. An added bonus is that buying it on disc means you'll get a ton of extra. A soundtrack CD, a map, some bonus content, and even a thank you note from the devs.

This game is not for everyone, there is a lot of reading and your choices affect everything you do. Torment has an excellent story with incredible writing that makes you want to play more to find out what is going on. The combat is slow and can be confusing at first, but this game is more for the story and journey not the combat. Overall, if you enjoy reading and science fiction you will love this game.
I did not enjoy the game at all. You read more dialog and made choices of what to say then you did playing the game.
This game is pretty entertaining. It's adds the already great components of Monster Hunter, but made it cute and more appealing to kids with nods to Pokemon.

I have tried to play Ultimate Monster Hunter 4 and Generations but I just can't seem to get into it. This monster hunter is so much more fun to play. It looks better, has similar quests and you get to fight monsters but you also have monsters on your side and each monster has a different strategy and abilities. This is one of the best game on the 3DS in my opinion.

A spin off of the mainstream Monster Hunter. I liked how you can gather eggs to hatch monsters (the eggs have patterns to tell you what kind of monster you are hatching), and also have the ability to create stronger ones by messing with their genes. The fighting system is pretty simple and is basically a rock/paper/scissor game. I haven't messed with the online, but you can challenge other people to battles. The monster field abilities are similar to HM moves on Pokemon, but don't take up any slots on the monster. You can try the demo which is the beginning of the game, and transfers everything over to the full game. Careful though because I don't think there's a level cap in the demo, so you could be way over leveled when you transfer the game.

I bought this game for my 9 year old daughter. All of my kids love Yo-Kai Watch, and have each of the first two games. My son also got this game as a download from the Nintendo eshop to get the bonus character. Both have them have spent hours with this game and love it. They can't stop talking about it. There seems to be enough new content from the previous two versions of this game that I don't feel like I just paid full price for a small expansion pack. Also, you do NOT need either of the two other versions to be able to play this one.

I had no idea that I liked the Layton series as this is the first one I've ever played. I'm normally an action/adventure game guy and tend to shy away from puzzle games because I don't have the time for them. Having said that, I played this and nothing BUT this from beginning to end over the period of about 3 days. That's with a full-time job and a family, mind you. It's really very good and I'm anxious to go back and discover the older titles in the series. Highly recommended.
The game is not a Professor Layton game! The game is a spin off. It is a port of a mobile game. So don't expect much and you'll enjoy it.
This is a really cool game! A must have. Solving the mystery is a blast!!!!

Layton games typically interweave a masterful 3D environment (for 3DS), a good story, some exploration, puzzle solving, and video sequences. This Layton game fails across the board. There's no use of 3D in this edition and the story is mind numbingly boring. The scene design is Laytonesque but lacks the detail and features expected from previous work. The puzzles are few and far between compared with previous titles and finally include trick puzzles. While at first I welcomed the inclusion of trick puzzles, their overuse and lack of variation make them tremendously predictable. The video sequences are short, contribute nothing, and are of low quality. The quality of Layton games has improved over time since Curious Village all the way up to the crossover Layton vs Wright. That is until this. The product has all the hallmarks of being rushed and poorly planned. Let's hope this is a one off blunder. Wait for this game to hit the bargain bin before buying.

Im not great at reviews but I had to try for this game. The best part of this game is the storytelling. Any JRPG fan will appreciate it. Think back to the great ol days of JRPG storytelling, if you miss those days then buy this game. You'll love it. It takes place in a world split into different realms after a Human vs. Daemon war 1,000 years ago. You'll lead a group that eventually equals 9 on a journey to free the world from the control of 'Daemons.' The battle system is reminiscent of the romancing SaGa series. If you are a fan of the SaGa series from Square Enix then buy this game. This might be one of the last great 3DS games. Definitely one of the last great JRPG'S on 3DS. I collect this stuff so I got 2. I wanted to keep one sealed for my collection. I'd give this game a 9.5 out of 10 just because I'd love to see what it could be with a bigger budget. I definitely recommend this game.

Its a good addition to your library if youre a fan of Atlus games but doesnt do anything groundbreaking in terms of rpg games since theres many more out there that are just like it or better.Its still worth playing though if you havent already.I personally enjoyed this title but it isnt for everyone.It caters to a specific audience who seeks a turn-based combat rpg game that tells a story as you go.

When I saw this game get announced I was interested in getting my hands on it. So first off this was the first time I played this game, I guess it flew under my radar back in the day. Recently it caught my attention being a steal at $9,99. I looked a some reviews on YouTube and it immediately looked like something I wouldve played growing up. Theres something about these older action adventure games that hit home for me. If youre going into this one for the first time know that this isnt some passionate remaster like the recent Spyro. Its still very much the same game as it was in 2003, but dont let that detour you. Yes, the controls can be a little clunky at times and sure the puzzles can be a little frustrating but for me thats apart of its charm. It doesnt hold your hand either, so if youre used to games that keep you on training wheels this one probably isnt for you. Like I said, I snagged it for $10 at the time and for me that was without a doubt worth it.

This game is incredibly fun. It runs well on the Switch and is a great nostalgic trip back to the early 2000's. If you see this in the store, buy it! Fun story, fun gameplay, great graphics for a game that came out over a decade ago, and just fun all around!!

Sphinx and the Cursed Mummy came out in the days of the Playstation 2, Xbox, Gamecube, and Dreamcast -- though the Dreamcast was long gone by the time it released. This game was quickly forgotten because there were a lot of platformers back then, especially of the 'mid-tier' variety (Voodoo Vince, Vexx, Ty the Tasmanian Tiger, Kao the Kangaroo, and on and on). It was tough back in those days to compete with the likes of Mario, Jak & Daxter, Ratchet & Clank, Sly Cooper, etc. That didn't mean that Sphinx was a bad game -- quite the opposite! And since the genre isn't as alive as it once was, it's nice to see a forgotten gem like this brought back. While it shows its age, this is definitely the best looking version in existence. If you like the platforming genre & have never played Sphinx, I'd recommend giving it a go. It doesn't have voice acting, or even odd noises like a Banjo & Kazooie, but it doesn't need it. It's a fun game for all ages.
I remember owning this on Gamecube for awhile sealed in the package and now I can have it again (on the cheap) sealed in the package on Switch.

This game brings something new to he table for Gearbox. While the art style of Battleborn will have you reminiscing of your days playing Borderlands, the game pretty much leaves all its similaritie there. It has much more in common with League of Legends or DOTA 2 than your average multiplayer FPS. The game is about unique heroes that you must master, while choosing which of their stats to increase. It is part of a wave of new games called hero shooters. However, many compare this game to Overwatch. While both are onjective based arena shooters that put you in control of a hero with their own unique weapons, stats and abilities, these games have very little in common after that. Battleborn offers the ability to customize your hero as they level up in a match, choosing which of two traits to pick each level progression. Add this to the ability to deploy turrets, stat boosting structures and drones at designated spots on the map, and you have a game that will likely not play the same each time you play. The animations are beautiful, but can be a little over the top during intense moments, making it hard to play competitively, as you lose track of what's going on around you. The game also feels as though it isn't polished enough for it to be taken seriously as a competitive online game. However, the foundation and ideas that Gearbox has laid will make this game a definitive title in this new genre as they continue to update and add content to the game. Gearbox is actively working on this title, so look forward to all the little problems being smoothed over within the next year.

If you like or enjoy MOBA style games and enjoy first person shooters, then this game is for you. It's a nice spin on FPS games since majority of them have adopted the call of duty style--not saying it's a bad thing--it's just not an innovative thing. This game introduces characters upgrades while you play and it has a co-op campaign mode alongside it's PvP multiplayer modes. Most games nowadays are not even putting campaign stories in their FPS which is a shame. Also, if you like borderlands, these are from the same creators.

I have been buying NHL games for year after year this year's edition is so content rich it is insane. NHL 16 felt like a ripoff with hardly any content, they redeemed themselves this year bringing back EASHL, better options in HUT, sets to complete, legends, heroes, GM mode, create a player it is all there. Great game love the realistic fell of the game. You can even create your own character

I've been playing NHL video games since Blades of Steel on NES, trust me, you don't want to waste your money on NHL17. I've been reporting bugs to the game developers support on twitter with video evidence and they do not respond. You can control the puck much better in NHL 16. Passing is better as well. There are less features in NHL 16, but there's also less bugs. Save your money! I've been providing feedback to the developers directly as well as multiple surveys since NHL15 and they totally missed the bar on this one. They left out important features like coaches challenge which can be a big deal when you have a bad call that costs you the game. You can see here linklink issues with the gameplay and obvious glitches that cause issues with controlling the puck and these weren't even taken during online gameplay! Invest yourself in NHL16 and say goodbye to EA Canada ever getting this one right. They don't listen to fan feedback, they get more money every year if they release a mediocre game and promise the moon and stars the following year.

This game is a great leap forward for the series and probably the first time I can truly say I've enjoyed a sequel much more than an original. The story truly continues from where the first game left off, answers the questions from the first game up front and leads you into a new storylne very appropriately, while still leaving you wanting to know more about the story of the character you are playing. The controls are much improved from the first game, the combat is much better and more adaptive than the original, and the side challenges and achievements are actually worth something to your character and the storyline (not just miscellaneous fluff like the flags in the first game).

This is my first time into this series, I did not play AC1. I decided to get AC2 since the story sounded interesting and everyone said 2 was way better than 1. The graphics are stunning. The cities are enormous. There are enough side missions to keep you occupied for a very long time. Or if you just want to explore the cities causing mayhem along the way, you can do that too. The storyline missions aren't just a run and gun type mission. They take planning. You can't just bust up into the place to assassinate your target and expect to survive long. This is definitely a must have game and I look forward to Revelations coming out soon.

I have not purhcased this game yet but, Ih ave played it on my friend's PS3 and it was amazing. I mean the graphics were stunning as well as ezio doing moves such as jumping from building to building and killing guards. It is worth $30,00 and I think this game should be voted game of the year for 2009.

I just bought this game recently and I can't get away from it! I'm a huge fan of 'open world' or 'sandbox' style video games and this one, for me, stands close to the top!!! I love the story taking place in the late 1400's, it's a time period not usually depicted in video games and the graphic design and gameplay really give you a great and realistic feel of Italy in that time period. The storyline is excellent, great characters, beautifully written with emotional intensity. Of course combat variety really gives the game a powerful edge. And the abilty to free run and explore makes the game more accessable because you don't have to follow the story everytime you play, you can do side mission or explore the land... up to you!!! Overall, excellent game! 5 stars all the way!!! Can't wait for the next one coming soon!!! Highly recommended!
love it. still in the midst of it. which is a good thing bc usually i beat a game in 3-6 days.

The first one was good but this one takes the cake. The game play is unreal the graphics are amazing and the story line is real good. For everyone that like games that give you free roaming abilities this game is a must

Assassin's Creed 2 is a great game, and its better than anything i thought ubisoft could do. There maybe be some problems with the game in the challenge and length. I say the length because i know alot of people just try to follow the main storyline and don't try to do any of the extra events. I say the challenge because once you get every move down you basically just walk up to someone and their dead in less then a second, which i've played and seen this happen when you get surround by a group of gaurds and then like one swift move and almost everyone is taken out? It makes no sense. But overall this game is great! I would recommend this game to everyone who has an 360 or PS3.

This game is absolutely awesome. A terrific story, a MASSIVE free-roaming land, and great graphics. There's not much more you can ask for in a game. It's one of the few games I've picked up recently that I had to keep playing until I finished it. The puzzle aspects of the game are challenging but not frustrating. My only slight complaint is that the controls can sometimes be annoying (I found myself flying off a building a couple times by accident), but that doesn't deter me at all. Pick this game up!

Now when I say intense I mean the cut-scenes are. Any way this game is full of action packed adventure as you climb obstacles, jump from log to log to get to your target. Very exciting, and fun. Worth the money.

This is a great sequel to a good game. Assassins Creed I was a game with a great story and fun things to do..but it does get repetitive. Assassins Creed II is even better, with more to do, more to see, and more to learn about the Assassins Creed universe. There is Downloadable Content for this game also, which expands the games life (so to speak).
Great game! I am happy with my purchase!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I was not a huge fan of the first Assassin's Creed. They got a lot of things right, but after a while it just seemed like the missions repeated themselves and before long it became kind of a chore to continue playing. So I got rid of it without ever finishing. This game is what Assassin's Creed SHOULD have been. As an independent game designer, I am consistently blown away by the care and attention that every aspect of this game has received. That's not to say that it doesn't have its faults- the opening scene, for example, is boring and unnecessary- but what it gets wrong is NOTHING compared to what it gets right. I wish all games had the polish that this one does. It's a true work of art, and I'd recommend it to anyone- whether you're a fan of the 3rd person sneak-around genre or not, this game is an awesome experience.

This is an excellent game. I like it better then the first. The first was very repetitive and later in the game you could not walk 10 feet before getting attacked by the guards. This time it is so much better. First you can now bring your notoriety down so guards will not attack you all the time. You can rip down wanted posters, bribe heralds, or kill politicians. When you unlock the level in the game you can start to rebuild your family villa. The small town and home looks very dark and dingy when you get there. The more money you get from missions and treasure boxes you can take that money and put it to the up keep of your villa. This is fun to do but it is not going to affect the story if you skip it. The town will start to give you discounts on weapons, armor, etc. It will also start to generate more money for you that you will be able to collect and spend on those things. Finding assassins tombs is fun too. You will find them on the map but have to find the secret entrance and then have to go through the building or tomb to find the resting place of the assassin. Finding all of these will allow you to unlock Altair's armor from the first game. These are just a few of the great things about the game. I recommend picking it up. Just a great story game that I am still working on to finish.

I was a very big fan of the first one i enjoyed it alot. Once i heard about the second one i was already anticipating it. I watched a few trailers and i was amazed by the new and improved things you can do. I bought it yesterday the day it came out and was a little surprised. As soon as you start the game there is ACTION. What surprised me was you got to battle outside the animus with Desmond. That was awesome. I don't want to give anymore details you definately have to play it yourself. It's the best!!!!!

The game will be moving away from the crusader days and into a time around the Romeo & Juliet era. If you were a fan of the Fable games and any other RPG game this is a great game. If you have not yet played Assasins Creed 1 i recomend or else you will not understand the concept of the game and why it partaily takes place in the present/future. The first Assassins Creed had amazing gameplay and a very interesting storyline, however it was very repetitive and the gameplay never really developed throughout the story. AC2 corrected this problem by changing the gameplay throughout the game, introducing the ability to purchase new weapons and armor, and incorporating a variety of side challenges that truly added to the game. This is by far one of the best games I have ever played.

Excellent game! Much like the first except there is much more customization and a sense of engagement that surpasses the first. Assassin's Creed II is a huge step up from the first game. It gets rid of the required monotonous gameplay aspects and gives some more variation. I felt the animations and voice acting were a step above the last game and the beginning tutorial sequences and storyline helped to get you more intertwined with Ezio and his motivations. The fighting system is updated a bit to include various weapons that you can use - whether you bring them to the fight or steal your opponents weapons. However, the general rule of waiting and countering to kill your enemies still holds true in this game. It can get a little old, but it's still good time.

If you liked the first AC game don't even finish reading this review - go out and buy ACII right now! In all seriousness this game takes everything that Assassin's Creed did well and made it better, then took everything that the first game fell short on and went well above and beyond the improvements necessary. The result is a stunningly beautiful game that is easy to pick up and get completely and totally addicted to. The story is very compelling in ACII, and your character is a bit more robust. The voice acting is really quite good, and the cut scenes are even better than in the first. Apart from looks the game delivers on several other levels, though. The controls have been refined from the first game, the combat is a bit more challenging, and the environment seems to be more interactive and open. In addition you can finally get in the water without desynchronizing! Simply following the storyline provides many hours of gameplay, but all the extras are what makes this game well worth the purchase. Much like in the first game you have items to find, but there are also puzzles you can solve to unravel part of the mystery behind Abstergo, and even property management that increases your income. If you invest enough effort into the property at the offset money becomes no object and you'll always have the best weapons and armor available.
Its probly the best Assassin's creed game ever maid....

This is a decent game for those who like Renaissance historical fiction, parkour mechanics, and/or wholly-disproportionate revenge-taking. Other folks, especially those who have not played the original Assassin's Creed may want to steer clear or wait for it to go on a huge sale, because you'll be helpless to understand what the devil is going on here, plot-wise. The game's best moments are spent negotiating clever environmental puzzles and sneaking stealthily around corridors to deftly fell bad guys; unfortunately there's surprisingly little of that sort of thing for a game about an agile assassin. There's much, much more just running around town offing people in broad daylight, like some kind of a 15th century Grand Theft Auto.

The graphics on the xbox version aren't that good. The voice acting is horrible. Character movement with the controller will drive you crazy. For example, the slightest error while running and jumping on roofs and walls will cause you to fall off your intended path. I think the developers could have cut us some slack on this one. They get really ticky tack with you pressing the buttons just right. I noticed a lot less problems with similar situations in Uncharted 2 and Res evil 5.

Overall after playing about 100+ games so far, this is probably the best iteration of MLB The Show in many years. There still is the obvious and frequently frustrating/annoying/maddening thing with the CPU taking control of the gameplay in any game, where human input doesn't matter for variable periods of time (see any of my past yearly reviews for an expanded comment about this- ALL sports videogames suffer from this, too), but so far, it seems to be a bit less than last year- and I have found that it can be corrected by simply saving the game at the point when you see you are no longer in control, and then restart it again at that point- this seems to 'reset' the gameplay mechanism, and on restarting, you might get a fair shot at the gameplay results. The 9th inning CPU comeback mechanism is still alive and well, BTW. This is what I was referring to above, regarding outcomes for pitching, hitting, etc, by the human player. Also often referred to as gameplay 'scripting', and it remains the single main issue, IMO, that makes this game less than a 5-star game. Only noticeable for those who play a lot of games, though.

I buy the show every year, and every year the small tweaks make it better. Presentation is great, graphics are great, some of the new modes (Moments, Road to October) are really fun and keep it fresh and brisk. Not a full overhaul but a great addition to the series and I think fans of the series will like it.

The controls are tight, and the gameplay mechanics don't get old too quickly. There are quite a few quick time events which I've never been fond of, but they're easily overlooked considering how fun the rest of the game is. I love action/adventure games with puzzles and this is all of that. Definitely worth buying!

I'm eagerly waiting for the new TR game to come out later this year!
